name: Journey
description:
Journey has QUITE the story! From being a known stray for weeks to being trapped, she has had quite the adventure in her short life. Once she knew she was safe, she rolled over and wanted belly rubs. you would never know her past from her attitude today! She is SWEET, loves people, loves to play, loves other dogs, is a fast learner and is the perfect size! She walks great on a leash, she loves cuddles, she gives kisses and she is perfectly crate trained! She is AWESOME!!

name: Tinker *Introverted Athlete*
description:
Please contact ADOPTION (adopt@doggieharmony.org) for more information about this pet.Tinker is a highly intelligent and quite the athlete. She would be great on an agility course. She loves playing fetch and could chase tennis balls all day long if you let her. She even cleans all of them up when it's time to mow.

Tinker is a sweet little girl who is affectionate but also likes space and slow introductions to people and dogs. So she is seeking a forever home that is calm, quiet and routine. She was returned by her original adoptive family for being nippy when anxious, so she's working with her foster and trainers on social skills and reactivity to changes that might trigger her anxiety.
Tinker comes with FREE TRAINING from Frogs to Dogs, a leading metro Atlanta trainer. They will offer help in transitioning into her new home since change can be hard for introverted-types like her.
But patience will pay off for the adopter who puts their time in with Tinker, as she is easily managed and a super-fun companion.
Age: 4 years
Weight: 40lbs
Vetting: Spayed, up-to-date on vaccinations, heartworm negative
Training: House-trained, crate-trained, walks well on leash and knows tricks.
Temperament: Good with dogs, older respectful kids, can be cat-tested on request
Tinker videos:
*https://goo.gl/photos/Kw1zqMqWKLUw9yze8 *https://goo.gl/photos/mYu1BRt61du1DB49A *https://goo.gl/photos/Pth61YmyiFFvkYbU6

Contact adopt@doggieharmony.org with questions or complete/send an Adoption Application. We look forward to hearing from you.

This adoptable is not in the Doggie Harmony program; s/he is a courtesy listing on behalf of the kind person who is caring for this pet until a forever home is found. There will be a fee to reimburse for the cost of its vetting/care; it may vary by caregiver/animal. Additionally, you will be asked to complete an application and allow a home visit to ensure the pet is a good fit for your home/lifestyle. If you would like to proceed with the application, please click Adoption Application now.

name: Jazzy
description:
Meet Jazzy!! Jazzy's shelter name was Jazz, and the handlers liked the name, so they decided to keep it, but make it just a little â¦ well â¦ jazzier!! So Jazzy it is! Jazzy had been a shelter dog more than once - that's just so sad. She was owned by someone who developed health problems and couldn't care for her, so she was relinquished to the shelter. She was adopted again, and ... not long after that, came back in much worse condition than she left. She was tethered in the second owner's front yard, she had significant hair loss, and was underweight - the note was made that it appeared as though she had not eaten in several days. She was treated for her skin condition, and she gained some weight. She developed an upper respiratory infection and was treated, and she gained some weight. She was spayed and recovered, and gained some weight. All in all, this not-so-little girl gained 23 pounds at the shelter, and is more than slightly rubenesque!! We think she was eating her food, and as much of everyone else's food as she could - poor thing probably just couldn't get past feeling so very hungry!  

  We were drawn to her sunny disposition, so we temperament tested her, and we were thrilled when she passed!! After 185 days in the shelter, she was finally going to get to leave!! This chubby girl (we will work on her weight!!) is a sharpei / pit mix, with a golden brown coat, and smiling face. She does love so very much to give kisses - and we have the pictures to prove it!! She is extremely playful, and loves to engage in toy games with her people.

 Want to help us make sure that the rest of Jazzy's days are full of fun, without any chains or missed meals? Put your application in today - www.caninecellmates.org!

  Jazzy is located in Atlanta, GA and is available for adoption immediately. She will be able to go to her forever home after graduation from the Canine CellMates program. Jazzy is spayed, microchipped and up to date on all her shots. Canine CellMates dogs are trained in items similar to the Canine Good Citizen (CGC) test. They learn basic obedience and commands such as sit, down, stay, go to place, and leave it. They are also crate trained. If you are interested in adopting Jazzy, please fill out an adoption application at www.caninecellmates.org. or email adopt@caninecellmates.org for more information.

name: Gregor
description:
Gregor is an adorable gray/white pit mix who was rescued from Augusta Animal Services, a high kill shelter in Augusta, Georgia. He was a favorite of the staff and volunteers at the shelter but was due to be euthanized due to lack of space. A determined volunteer began reaching out to local rescue groups to save his life and my licensed rescue Hands to Paws in Augusta responded and gave him his freedom ride. Gregor is quite the character and has such a great, playful personality. Heâs currently being boarded at a local kennel an has been there for several months, getting wonderful care there but itâs time for this special boy to have a home of his own!

Heâs affectionate, friendly, loving, loves people and needs to be the only dog in the household. He's good with kids but due to his size and strength it would be best for the kids to be older - no small children. Wonât you consider giving this special boy his permanent soft place to fall? He will bring you so much love and joy. He's got such a great personalty and is a sweet soul. He's had a rough start in life and deserves a loving home. Could it be you? Until his forever home is found we are also looking for a foster home for Gregor - it's a great way to see if he would be a good match for your family and it gives him a chance to be in a home and out of boarding for a while, so please consider fostering sweet Gregor if adopting is not an option right now! There's no cost for fostering - it just requires love and TLC! Please contact me for details about either fostering or adopting this very special soul!
Rescue
Hands to Paws Rescue
Contact Info

name: Cogz
description:
Cogsworth or Cogz is a 2 yr old young male Rottie who never got quite the socialization and structure he shouldâve as a young pup. He is learning new things but will benefit from an adopter who is firm & has breed experience. He is good with most dogs but will need proper introduction. He needs to be in a home with no kids or kids older than 13 years old. No cats. He is neutered, microchipped, vaccinated & on preventatives. He is located in Avon, OH. If you have breed experience & are interested in Cogz please apply at www.realrottweilerrescue.com. 

Note: if you have a current dog or cat please make sure vetting is in good standing & animals are fixed & UTD on vaccinations, on preventatives as this is a requirement for potential adopters!

The prospective owner must agree to a screening process that includes an application and the signing of an adoption contract.

Our goal is to find the best match for our dogs and their new families, so that everyone lives happily ever after.

We prefer homes who want to go to an obedience class. Training strengthens the bond and trust that you have with your dog, and it's fun, for both of you! Dogs like to think and to be mentally challenged. The training you do together will be an investment in the future. 

We will try to respond within 24-48 hours, but please be patient as we are volunteer based. We all have full time jobs and are busy with other rescue matters.

Thank you!

name: Cali Girl
description:
CALI is an âElderbullâ approximately 16 years of age. She came to us two years ago from a high capacity shelter in Baltimore where she was found as a stray.  Cali has had a rough life, thatâs for sure. She most likely lived outdoors and Is appreciative of a soft bed. Cali is sometimes aloof and likes to sniff around and do her own thing - probably because she was shut out from her former family. She probably never had medical care. At the age of 14 we had her spayed and had a large mammary tumor removed (benign) and she has settled down to life at our adoption center. We would LOVE for Cali to find a retirement home so that she doesnât have to spend her last years in a kennel. 

Cali would do best as an only dog. She needs someone who will be patient with her as she has probably never lived in a house. She would love a big fenced yard where she can sniff around - her arthritis prevents her from taking walks of any distance more than a stroll to the mailbox. Are you the family that Cali has been waiting for? Please fill out an application at www.companimals.org. Adootion $100.

name: Kady Mae
description:
Hi I'm Kady Mae!

I'm two years old and super lovable ! I was a stray from the Baltimore County shelter and now have a really nice foster mom with AAHA!

To adopt me, I have few requirements:

*A busy social life- I love to meet people, go on adventures and play with other dogs! My foster mom says I am still working on my leash training skills, but she says I am so much better! It's just that I really do want to play when I see my four legged friends- it's very exciting!

*I am a couch cuddler and bed snuggler!

*I am a great housemate so don't have much I need there- I am crate trained, and now spend time during the day in my foster mom's kitchen on my doggie bed when she works.

*I am not a picky eater, so if you want to train me with yummy treats, I would love that!

To meet me, please email aaha_rescue@yahoo.com

9/19/19 11:52 AM

name: Maverick
description: Meet Mr. Maverick. The shelter had him listed as a retriever mix about 6 months old and 32 pounds. He is now fully vetted with 60 days free pet insurance. He will be located in Bayside Queens NY so get your applications in now. https://www.peytonssafehaven.org/adoption-application

name: Pixie
description:
OMG SO SMALL!!!
WILL NOT BE BIGGER THAN 15 POUNDS FULL GROWN. We think they are chihuahua Jack russell.

Who is looking for a small breed adorable puppy with beautiful green eyes! Pixie (12 pounds ) was rescued from a tiny crate with her sister, mom and a senior chihuahua after they were dumped on the side of a road in TX. She is now fully vetted with 60 days free pet insurance so get your applications in now. She is located in Bayside Queens NY. This adorable little girl is about 5 to 6 months old and is crate and house trained. She gets along great with other animals and children even though she acts tough to big dogs at first. https://www.peytonssafehaven.org/adoption-application

name: Thumbelina
description: More littles under 15 pounds. Momma and 2 pups we believe they are chihuahua jack russell mix. Pixie has green eyes. Trixie is all black and momma is Thumbelina black and white. They will be located in Bayside Queens NY. They are fully vetted with 60 days free pet insurance. https://www.peytonssafehaven.org/adoption-application

name: Trixie
description:
Small Breed Alert! 
OMG SO SMALL!!!
WILL NOT BE BIGGER THAN 15 POUNDS FULL GROWN.

She is now fully vetted with 60 days free pet insurance so get your applications in now. She is located in Bayside Queens NY. name: Georgie
description:
Meet Georgie!

Georgie is all Love!! He loves to be loved and he loves to give love!! 
He has his playful silly side but then he also has his cuddle love bug side.
He's truly amazing!
After everything he's endured in his life up to this point ... he still smiles and shines and loves everyone he meets!! 

He is a 2-year-old, 65 lb, neutered male. Georgie is up to date on all shots and microchipped. Good with kids and other dogs!

If you would like to meet me please contact pnwpack@gmail.com. Currently located in Bellingham, WA.

This is not a Hello Pitty Rescue dog; we urge prospective adopters to do their own evaluation.

name: Dale
description:
Name: Dale
Breed: Shepherd/Hound/Lab Mix
Age: 6 years old (As of August 2019)
Good With Dogs: Yes. Dale enjoys playing with and socializing with female dogs and happy, submissive dogs. He is a lady's man.
Good With Cats: Yes
Good With Children: Yes
Heartworm Status: Negative

Dale is a very sweet boy who came from an animal neglect case out of Bibb County. Even though he had a rough start at life, he has a lot of love to give and hasn't let his past define him. He does well with some dogs, and we would say he's selective, but we always require other companions to meet dogs prior to adoption to ensure it is a great match for everyone. He especially loves likes female dogs and submissive dogs that appreciate his status as being his own man.

 He does well with everyone, including small children. He's a very intelligent boy. He thinks he is macho when he is in an environment where he knows what to expect, but with new situations - like the first time he met nail clippers, he turned into a squeaky little mouse in about ten seconds. He gains confidence quickly in new places, and likes to go for walks in his harness. He's stubborn and good natured. Dale is a proud, dapper guy that likes to patrol his grounds, go for walks, and get his back scratched. He is soft like a teddy bear. He is the perfect model who doesn't mind being dressed at all!

----
Peach County Animal Rescue is a rescue located in Fort Valley, GA. Our adoption fees range from $175-350+. On average, our fees are $250.  All of our dogs are fully vetted: up-to-date on annual shots, spayed/neutered and microchipped with a lifetime registration. We look forward to hearing from you!

If you would like to send in an application for this dog, please use the link below! https://peachcountyanimalrescueandrehabilitation.org/apply-now-2/

name: GILBERT
description:
Gilbert is a love bug. He had to have surgery to repair his hip, but he has healed up and is doing great. He loves everyone and does well with dogs, cats, kids!! He is up to date on vaccinations, fixed, and is on heartworm preventative. 

Gilbert will need a fenced yard for playtime. 

If you would like to meet him, please let us know at sugarbellefoundation@gmail.com

He is located in the Birmingham area!!

name: Brew
description: Brew is in need of a medical foster, she is currently located in Bradenton, FL (Manatee County). Brew is an English Bulldog we saved from a high kill shelter in Tampa. She is 8 years old and in a neglected state. She has a medical history of arthritis spondylosis, she is heartworm positive and required a removal of a blueberry sized mammary node during spay. She is underweight at 35 pounds and will require 3 meals a day. She is quiet,sleeps a lot and the only issue we have seen is some guarding of her xpen area when other dogs nose around. She's fine with other dogs but offers no interactions and turns her head away. Once we have her tuned up she will be available for adoption or long term fostering through heartworm treatment. If you are interested in Brew and have experience with English Bulldogs please contact us. PUPDATE. Brew has been with us for almost a week. She has seen our vet. Her liver values were abnormal and we have had her on supplements and will retest the 2nd week of Sept. She has gotten more energetic,is eating well, and actually is playing with some of the other dogs. She loves people and absolutely loves being pet. She is actually chasing flies! She is becoming a dog again!! Once we do our vet re-check, she will be available for foster to adopt or medical foster. We are a foster-based rescue organization with foster homes throughout the state of Florida. We predominantly save dogs from municipal shelters throughout the Southeastern U.S. Our rescue dogs live in foster homes - there is no central facility. If interested in meeting one of our wonderful adoptable dogs, please fill out an application at ewenityfarmsbch.com. Information on adoption donation amounts and our process can also be found at this site.

name: Sox
description: This is a courtesy post. If you are interested in rescuing or adopting this dog, please contact Rand by email theellardplace@aol.com. This dog is located in Brent, AL.

name: Riley
description:
Riley is 14 years old, 12 lbs. and is currently located in Cocoa, Brevard County.

Riley was surrendered to rescue by a family member after their grandmother passed away.  Unfortunately we don't have much history on Riley as that was not available.  The family was unable to keep Riley due to an upcoming move and knew financially he needed serious dental care.

Riley did have a dental once he came into rescue and had a whopping 20 teeth pulled and he is a much happier dog now!  Before coming into rescue he ate canned food due to his painful mouth.  He now eats kibble but softened with hot water.  

Riley is a sweet gentleman who meshed well with the foster homes Dachshunds, Great Dane and cats.  He LOVES squeaky toys and snoozing in his bed.  Riley does like to take his toys with him when he goes outside to potty.   Riley does have a playful side and will play with the 1 year old Dachshund in his foster home.  

He can be a little protective over his squeaky toys.  

Riley would likely do okay with other dogs or by himself.  He seems to prefer people over the dogs and is a very low key guy.  He loves to sit on your lap and be petted.

Riley has had some accidents in the house, mostly just overnight - some nights he does not have accidents and some he does.  He is crate trained so crating is an option.

Riley is neutered, up to date on vaccines, heartworm tested negative, on a monthly preventative, microchipped and ready for his new forever family!

If you are interested in adopting Riley, please fill out an adoption application on our website at: http://fldr.org/adopt/adoption-application/. The adoption fee is $150

name: Dutch
description: 5 month old Dutch was saved from the Bronx when his owner could no longer care for him. He is a fun loving puppy. If Dutch is adopted before his scheduled neuter date, his adopter will be required to sign a neuter agreement.

name: Junior
description:
Junior is doing great and is the cutest little guy in town! Please consider giving him a loving home so he can forget the miserable basement he was living in. Apply at www.nybullycrew.org to submit an adopt or foster application today

EMERGENCY RESCUE RECAP: NYBC Pack Leader Craig and The  Crew got a call to the same building our boy Bronco was saved from in the Bronx. The young pup was living just blocks away from where the heinous crime that took the life of  Lesandro âJuniorâ Guzman-Feliz took place. In his honor, we have named this pup with a bright future JUNIOR. Please apply to foster or adopt this cutie today.

name: Tony
description:
Meet Tony our Boomerang- Boy. He was pulled from Cabarrus County AC back in April 2016 with his BFF Linda. He found what we thought would be his forever home in Novemember 2016.  Fast forward to April 2019, and he found himself homeless after his mom and dad could no longer care for him.  He spent some time with the nice people at the York Co PA SPCA before he hitched a ride south with a wonderful group of transporters.  

He is about 4 years old, 65 lbs, neutered, and current on vaccines.  His ideal home is a home where he is the only dog, or he has a female dog his size to live with.  He would not do well in a home with cats or small dogs. He loves to ride in a car, but is happy just hanging out at home too.

This is what one of his transporters had to say about him yesterday: \"Tony was just the most sweetest, loving soul!!! And so well trained. He saw a tortoise & a squirrel and was mesmerized and wanted to be \"off to the chasing\"! But the moment I said sit, he turned to face me, sat right down and quietly awaited his next command. Such a love bug!!!\

name: Onyx
description:
Onyx is a well behaved friendly dog good with smaller dogs. She is good with dogs her size if they are friendly and not pushy. 

Kellen Rescue is located in California and almost always requires fenced yards and do not adopt out of State with the exception of sometimes to neighboring States. Our dogs are in foster homes and available to meet by appointment.

name: CAMI
description:
Pick me only if you're ready for loads of fun. I'm CAMI, a mischievous, pint sized mouthy female BULLDOG LAB MIX puppy. My coat is as white as snow with tan and blue markings. I first said hello to the world on April 04, 2019 as I was born at MMFFR located in CAMERON, NC. My parents are both lovable and smart while they possess loyal and devoted personalities. Having inherited my parents good traits and personalities is the reason they say I am strong-willed right to the core. You can count on me for a friendly wag, a happy hello and lots of wet puppy kisses too. I'll already be fully vaccinated and have my health certificate from previously having my vet check. While I may be demanding and obnoxiously  energetic at times, remember that I am always ready to bring you heaps of joy. Living currently in CAMERON, NC with my rescue mom at our rescue home, I am patiently awaiting to meet my forever companion soon. If you have the time to devote all your love to me then what are you waiting for, contact my rescue mom via email. Otherwise to adopt CAMI or for more information complete our pre-adoption form to schedule an official meet & greet visit.

Personality: strong-willed
Date Available: Available Today!

What's Included:
Vet Checked
Up to Date Vaccinations
Child Friendly
Pet Friendly
Cat Friendly
Dog Friendly

name: MILO
description:
Meet MILO! A playful BULLDOG LAB MIX puppy in CAMERON, NC who is charismatic through and through. Weâve poured ourselves into raising this sweet little puppy that made his debut into the world on April 04, 2019, and are excited to secure MILO a safe and loving home! MILO loves to play, snuggle, and be a favorite pal. With proper training, MILO will make a great family pet or join alongside a caring single. Showing off a stunning white coat, MILO comes from parents of companionable and family-oriented personalities. When he is adopted MILO will arrive home already vaccinated, good natured, and energetic. The bags are packed and MILO is ready to venture into the new world of finding him a forever home! We strive to raise socialized, fun-loving rescue puppies that are a perfect match for puppy lovers located in CAMERON, NC or nearby areas. If your interested in learning more about MILO or want more information on how you can become his potential adoptive family, feel free contact us or complete the pre-adoption form to schedule your 1st meet & greet visit with MILO.

Personality: charismatic
Date Available: Available Today!

What's Included:
Vet Checked
Up to Date Vaccinations
Child Friendly
Pet Friendly
Cat Friendly
Dog Friendly

name: Kirie
description:
My name is Kirie. I am available for adoption through Colorado Canine Rescue (CCR), a nonprofit dog rescue located in the Denver area. I came to CCR from Canon City Colorado. There is very little history on me. CCR has been told I am a pit bull breed mix, but that is just a guess made by shelter staff, rescue volunteers, and our veterinarians.

It is said when life gives you lemons, make lemonade. Well Kirie has had quite a few lemons handed to her in her 4 year life span, but definitely making the best lemonade that she can. Kirie was adopted out from CCR as a young dog but two years later wound up in the Aurora Shelter, having been abandoned. They called us so we could take her back into our rescue. Kirie has had TPLO surgery since being returned to us, going through training with a behaviorist, and a foster has worked diligently to get her past her pulling on the leash, and help her master her needs to attack water spouts and sprinkler heads.
Kirie still has separation issues, but does well in the foster home left with other dogs and free reign within the home. She is on a generic Prozac to help her manage with anxiety. Kirie loves to snuggle with her people on the couch and in bed and absolutely loves to give kisses. She is looking for a family that will give her plenty of attention, be home more than not, play fetch, take her on walks in the neighborhood. She adores children and is very gentle with them. Kirie so looks forward to rides in the car. She would enjoy being an only dog, but would do fine with a furry companion that has a laissez-faire attitude. She does best if the door is open or a doggie door for her to go out as needed. She needs a more experienced dog owner because she has been through so much in life.

If you are interested in adopting Kirie, please submit an adoption application located on our website, www.coloradocaninerescue.org. We are asking for a $200 adoption donation for Kirie. Kirie being a bully breed, will only be placed in communities that do not have a ban on bullies. Please note, CCR cannot guarantee the breed composition or ages of our dogs as we usually have no history prior to them entering the shelter. 9/15/19 5:01 PM

name: Bubba
description:
Hi my name is Bubba!!! Iâm 9 yrs old and 12-1/2 lbs. Iâve been living with a foster family until my forever family comes and gets me!!! My foster mama says Iâm a great dog and Iâve been a good boy since Iâve been here. Iâm housetrained and use a doggie door with all my other foster siblings. I get along fine with the cats in the house as long as they get along with me!! Picture of us sleeping side by side shown in photos. I get along with my doggie friends, picture to prove it, shown in photos. Iâm just an all around good guy looking for my next and last home!! Iâve never been around kids ever so Iâd prefer not to start now. Iâd really love a home where my new parent or parents would be home all or most of the time because thatâs how I lived my previous life. Bubba is getting a dental on Aug 27th then heâll be ready to go shortly after. Heâll be all healed by the time you get your application filled out and we do your reference checks!! He can be adopted 2 hours, any direction from Canton Ohio. To speed up the process please fill out an adoption application on our website at 
sophiasgracefoundation.org
Thank you!!!
Bubba

name: Chico
description: This is Chico, he is a wonderful little Chihuahua mix that weighs about 10 pounds fully grown. He is about 3 years young, has a great disposition, does great with other dogs, does not do well with men or small children. He was rescued from the Canton dog pound. His adoption fee includes neuter, up to date vaccines, rabies vaccine, deworming, flea treatment, heartworm testing and preventative, microchip and is $100.00. He requires a fully fenced yard. If you are interested in meeting Chico please go to www.pawswithpride.org and complete our online adoption form and we will get back to you asap. Thank you.

name: Missy
description: Mystical Missy is here to say adopt me please. I came here from Cecil County with a sad past...I was living in a shed because my owner became homeless and couldn't care for me. I can be a bit shy or nervous at first but if you give me a toy, especially if it squeaks, you will have my heart. I enjoy the outdoors, maybe not the humidity but the nice weather is great for long walks. I would really appreciate someone coming in to visit me so that I am given another chance to have a happy life. Would you like to meet me and see if we make a love connection? I cannot go home just yet because I had some medical tests done and need to get results first.

name: Snoozer
description:
Snoozer is a 11-12 week old Mastiff/Jack Russell/Beagle mix who weighs 17 pounds. Snoozer got the nickname Chef because he is always the first in the kitchen around dinner time and follows every step of the preparation process. He is a super cute little guy that loves to explore the dangers of a backyard such as sniffing the butterflies and grass and enjoys ending his expeditions with cuddles, kisses and treats. Snoozer sometimes prefers to play and/or rest on the couch all by himself. He is crate trained and doing well with house training.

If you are interested in adopting Snoozer please submit an inquiry directly with Greater Charlotte SPCA by visiting charlottespca.org/adopt.

***Because our rescue is composed entirely of volunteers and we require a home check for each of our adoptable pets prior to them going to their new homes, local applications will take precedence. We will accept out of town applications, but any family further than 60 miles from Charlotte is responsible for finding a representative of a rescue local to them that is willing to perform the home check. All out of town applicants will also have to be willing to drive to Charlotte to meet/pick up the pet as soon as the application is approved.***

name: Malia
description:
Malia is a one year old female long-haired Chihuahua mix who weighs eight pounds. She does really well in the crate and is about 90% trustworthy with house training. She does well with other dogs, with an appropriate introduction (her foster brother is a 90 lb pit mix and they are doing well together) but does not like cats at all. So she needs a cat-free home.

In regards to her personality, it took a few days for her to come out of her shell, but now that she has, she wants a *lot* of attention and is fairly high energy. She is also very, very busy and on the go when not in her crate. That being said, she does not bark much for a toy breed. She loves being with people and is really good kids including the 9 and 11 year old in her foster home who are in love with her. She would do well in a home with a lot of stimulation and activity.

If you are interested in adopting Malia please submit an inquiry directly with Greater Charlotte SPCA by visiting charlottespca.org/adopt.

***Because our rescue is composed entirely of volunteers and we require a home check for each of our adoptable pets prior to them going to their new homes, local applications will take precedence. We will accept out of town applications, but any family further than 60 miles from Charlotte is responsible for finding a representative of a rescue local to them that is willing to perform the home check. All out of town applicants will also have to be willing to drive to Charlotte to meet/pick up the pet as soon as the application is approved.***

name: Caitlyn
description:
Caitlyn is a 8 month old Pit Bull / Plott Hound mix, who is fully vetted, spay and ready to find her forever home. Caitlyn is house trained, but working on crate training.

Caitlyn is very friendly with other dogs (cats unknown) and humans and would make a great dog to train to be a running or hiking buddy, or for taking to one of the local dog bars for play dates!

If you are interested in adopting Caitlyn please submit an inquiry directly with Greater Charlotte SPCA by visiting charlottespca.org/adopt.

***Because our rescue is composed entirely of volunteers and we require a home check for each of our adoptable pets prior to them going to their new homes, local applications will take precedence. We will accept out of town applications, but any family further than 60 miles from Charlotte is responsible for finding a representative of a rescue local to them that is willing to perform the home check. All out of town applicants will also have to be willing to drive to Charlotte to meet/pick up the pet as soon as the application is approved.***

name: Miska
description:
Miska is a beautiful one and a half year old, husky mix and is a petite 44 pounds. She is very loving and playful with people. She's a little nervous around new dogs, but with proper introductions she warms up quickly to them.

She is crate trained (but does not like other dogs near her crate) and house trained. Miska is up to date on vaccines.

If you are interested in adopting Miska please submit an inquiry directly with Greater Charlotte SPCA by visiting charlottespca.org/adopt.

***Because our rescue is composed entirely of volunteers and we require a home check for each of our adoptable pets prior to them going to their new homes, local applications will take precedence. We will accept out of town applications, but any family further than 60 miles from Charlotte is responsible for finding a representative of a rescue local to them that is willing to perform the home check. All out of town applicants will also have to be willing to drive to Charlotte to meet/pick up the pet as soon as the application is approved.***

name: Perrin
description:
Perrin is an absolutely adorable 5-6 month old puppy. The vet believes he is a Catahoula Leopard Dog/Pointer Mix. (The ears are definitely Catahoula!) We think there may be some Staffordshire Bull Terrier or other bully breed in the mix as well.

Perrin is VERY food motivated, which makes him easy to train. The appearance of treats make him laser focused and eager to learn. So far, he's learned \"sit\" and \"down\" and he's making great progress learning \"stay\" and \"base.\" And this puppy wants snuggles and attention as much as he wants food. He's your basic love sponge. He plays well with every dog he meets, regardless of their age or size. He assumes that all people are going to be utterly charmed by him and want to give him lots of love and attention. So far, he's been right about that.

He loves toys - the fluffier the better. And he's a little kleptomaniac who is obsessed with his foster mom's favorite fuzzy slippers and tries to steal them off her feet at least once a day. Fortunately, he is learning the meaning of the word no and usually responds well to a verbal correction.

Perrin loves to snuggle and cuddle on the couch - he's a great Netflix binge buddy. But he is a very active, energetic puppy who needs lots of exercise and activity to thrive. He would do best in a home that can commit to daily structured exercise - walking or (when he's grown) running, chasing a ball in the yard long enough to tire him out, etc. A tired puppy is a good puppy! His adopters also need to be prepared to continue obedience training (preferably with professional guidance) and provide structure and boundaries necessary to make him a well-adjusted and welcome member of the family. Perrin is going to be a large dog - we're guessing 80 plus pounds of muscle when full grown, so he needs to be well mannered.
Perrin is current on vaccines. He is crate trained and is working hard on house training. The few recent accidents have been due to his foster mom not cluing in fast enough when he tried to let her know he had to go.

This guy is about as perfect as puppies get, so if you're interested in adopting, act quickly. He's not going to be around long!

If you are interested in adopting Perrin please submit an inquiry directly with Greater Charlotte SPCA by visiting charlottespca.org/adopt.

***Because our rescue is composed entirely of volunteers and we require a home check for each of our adoptable pets prior to them going to their new homes, local applications will take precedence. We will accept out of town applications, but any family further than 60 miles from Charlotte is responsible for finding a representative of a rescue local to them that is willing to perform the home check. All out of town applicants will also have to be willing to drive to Charlotte to meet/pick up the pet as soon as the application is approved.***

name: Lapis
description:
Lapis is an 11-12 week old Mastiff/Jack Russell/Beagle mix who weighs 14 pounds. Lapis is a special, sweet and sensitive little girl. She loves to play with her toys (especially with her little furry squirrel) and sometimes with her brother Snoozer and her house mate Charlie. She will need a calm and gentle family as she easily gets scared of sudden movements and high sounds and will show her anxiety by making a puddle. She loves to cuddle with her foster mom and dad, and whoever adopts her has to look forward to a + 60 lbs. lapdog.

If you are interested in adopting Lapis please submit an inquiry directly with Greater Charlotte SPCA by visiting charlottespca.org/adopt.

***Because our rescue is composed entirely of volunteers and we require a home check for each of our adoptable pets prior to them going to their new homes, local applications will take precedence. All out of town applicants will also have to be willing to drive to Charlotte to meet/pick up the pet as soon as the application is approved.***

name: Sammy
description:
Meet Sammy! Sammy is a 2 year old Feist mix who weighs 23 pounds. Sammy has a low to medium level of energy and enjoys smuggling and being a couch potato. He is happy to sit by your side and watch television with you. Sammy really likes children and is okay with other dogs. He is house and crate trained as well as up to date on vaccines.

If you are interested in adopting Sammy please submit an inquiry directly with Greater Charlotte SPCA by visiting charlottespca.org/adopt.

***Because our rescue is composed entirely of volunteers and we require a home check for each of our adoptable pets prior to them going to their new homes, local applications will take precedence. All out of town applicants will also have to be willing to drive to Charlotte to meet/pick up the pet as soon as the application is approved.***

name: Ham Ham
description:
Ham Ham is an eleven week old Bullmastiff/Jack Russell/Beagle mix. Ham Ham loves the classics, hamburgers, Hamilton soundtrack, black forest Ham sandwiches, a drive in the Hamptons, all while taking selfies, because he's a huge ham. This pup will be a big boy with so much love to give. He is a regular couch potato, but loves a good game of chase in the yard (until he finds a shady spot to chill). He loves meal time whether it's his or yours. He is starting to enjoy walks on a leash in the yard. He is progressing with his house training and crate training. Going to bed at night is easy for him, but during the day he gets mad about it. He loves to cuddle and watch TV. He also loves to pounce at bigger dogs and pretend he's bigger than they are as he is practicing for the day he will be larger than them. He will make an amazing companion dog for any family. He plays with kids well, but watch those sharp puppy teeth!

If you are interested in adopting Ham Ham please submit an inquiry directly with Greater Charlotte SPCA by visiting charlottespca.org/adopt.

***Because our rescue is composed entirely of volunteers and we require a home check for each of our adoptable pets prior to them going to their new homes, local applications will take precedence. All out of town applicants will also have to be willing to drive to Charlotte to meet/pick up the pet as soon as the application is approved.***

name: Kato
description:
Kato is an eleven week old Boxer mix. He gets along well with other dogs and kids. Kato is seriously sweet. He enjoys playing with his stuffed toys and loves chewing on antlers. Kato is doing well with house and crate training. He is still learning boundaries with other dogs, but he is very smart and has a very reasonable energy level. Kato has met a cat and did not react to it. Expect that he will need more guidance on interacting with cats, if there is a cat in his adoptive home. Kato will do well with a family.

If you are interested in adopting Kato please submit an inquiry directly with Greater Charlotte SPCA by visiting charlottespca.org/adopt.

name: Darla
description:
Darla is a 8 month old, brindle, female Pit Bull Terrier, who is fully vetted and ready to find her forever home.

Darla is the sweetest pup and loves all humans, of all ages and just enjoys snuggling on the couch with you. Will you be her forever home and give her all the love she needs?

Darla is doing great on her crate and house training!

If you are interested in adopting Darla please submit an inquiry directly with Greater Charlotte SPCA by visiting charlottespca.org/adopt.

name: Jeff
description:
Jeff is a two year male, blue and white Terrier mix, who currently weights around 50 pounds and is fully vetted and ready for his for ever home!

Jeff is a very sweet boy who is doing great with humans and dogs (cats are unknown). He has a scruffy coat, like terrier, but he is tall and lean, so we are not fur sure what he is mixed with, but what ever it is, makes him one sweet boy!

Give him a lap or couch to watch Neftlix on, and he will be happy!

If you are interested in adopting Jeff please submit an inquiry directly with Greater Charlotte SPCA by visiting charlottespca.org/adopt.

name: Figaro
description:
Figaro is a five month shepherd mix who weighs about 25 pounds. He is super loving and playful with other dogs. Figaro is working on house training and does well in his crate. Figaro is also great with kids. He loves being outside playing with toys or inside cuddling. He would make a great addition to a family with another young pup.

If you are interested in adopting Figaro please submit an inquiry directly with Greater Charlotte SPCA by visiting charlottespca.org/adopt.

All out of town applicants will also have to be willing to drive to Charlotte to meet/pick up the pet as soon as the application is approved.***

name: Tasha
description:
Please meet Tasha. Tasha is an 18 month old female, Blue Pit Bull, who is current on her vaccines.

Tasha was found with a huge chain attached to her, extremely emaciated, weighing in at an initial 27 pounds, has had at least one litter of puppies and used as a bait dog. Despite having a very rough start to life, Tasha is very friendly towards all humans and other dogs. Tasha is learning very quickly to enjoy the indoor life, she has an occasional accident here and there, but doing well overall.

Tasha will always bare scars of her previous life, but if she is able to look past what has been done to her, can you look past the scars and give her a loving home?

Tasha is slowly gaining weight and once at a healthy weight will be spayed.

If you are interested in adopting Tasha please submit an inquiry directly with Greater Charlotte SPCA by visiting charlottespca.org/adopt.

***Because our rescue is composed entirely of volunteers and we require a home check for each of our adoptable pets prior to them going to their new homes, local applications will take precedence. We will accept out of town applications, but any family further than 60 miles from Charlotte is responsible for finding a representative of a rescue local to them that is willing to perform the home check. All out of town applicants will also have to be willing to drive to Charlotte to meet/pick up the pet as soon as the application is approved.***

name: Bruna
description:
Meet Bruna Marz! She is the sweetest 2-3 year old, 77 pound, Rottweiler mix who loves everything she meets! She has the brightest smile that won't stopcan't stop! She is house and crate trained. Bruna is a big fan of humans and dogs, but we don't know how she feels about cats. She is up to date on shots and is spayed. She loves to lie on the couch, go to Lucky Dog or go for a hike, as long you are with her.

If you are interested in adopting Bruna please submit an inquiry directly with Greater Charlotte SPCA by visiting charlottespca.org/adopt.

***Because our rescue is composed entirely of volunteers and we require a home check for each of our adoptable pets prior to them going to their new homes, local applications will take precedence. We will accept out of town applications, but any family further than 60 miles from Charlotte is responsible for finding a representative of a rescue local to them that is willing to perform the home check. All out of town applicants will also have to be willing to drive to Charlotte to meet/pick up the pet as soon as the application is approved.***

name: Georgia Pups
description:
This litter is 12 weeks old and we have 2 boys (Remy & Francis) and 2 girls (Lilou & Stella). They came from a hoarding case in GA and are now being fostered in Charlotte, NC. They have acclimated well into their foster homes and they do not seemed phased by loud noises , new dogs or new people. They are a very confident bunch that love to play and have lots of energy! We are working on house and crate training and they are coming along. They did come in with UTI's and have intestinal worms but are on meds for those. They love to rough house and play and are very social babies!

** If interested in these babies you can email us at info@greatdanefriends.com Only homes with giant breed experience will be considered for any of our dogs 1 year and younger. We also do not adopt siblings out together **

Please contact Great Dane Friends (info@greatdanefriends.com) for more information about this pet.

*****Great Dane Friends of Ruff Love covers NC and surrounding states for adoptions. We require a fenced yard (exceptions made on a case by case basis - NO exceptions for puppies or deaf/vision impaired dogs - no invisible fencing), that stairs in the home be covered with some sort of slip resistant material to prevent injury, that all other animals in the home be up to date on vaccinations as well as spayed/neutered and that all dogs live inside as a part of the family. Our approval process consists of an application, vet and reference checks, phone interview and house check. Please email us for an application or if you have any questions.*****

name: Shannah
description:
My name is Shannah and I am a 10 year old beagle. I love to lay on the couch with my foster parents. My manners are great. I am house trained and I walk nicely on a leash. I am getting along very well with the cats and dogs in my foster home. Currently, I am recovering from a skin infection that caused hair loss. My skin is getting better and my fur is slowly coming back. I am working on losing weight as I am quite pudgy. My past has been sad because I was abandoned when my owner moved, but my future is bright. Don't you want to give me a second chance at the good life?

If you are interested in adopting Shannah please submit an inquiry directly with Greater Charlotte SPCA by visiting charlottespca.org/adopt.

***Because our rescue is composed entirely of volunteers and we require a home check for each of our adoptable pets prior to them going to their new homes, local applications will take precedence. We will accept out of town applications, but any family further than 60 miles from Charlotte is responsible for finding a representative of a rescue local to them that is willing to perform the home check. All out of town applicants will also have to be willing to drive to Charlotte to meet/pick up the pet as soon as the application is approved.***

name: Eli
description:
Eli is a 6 year old Cairn Terrier mix who weighs 30 lbs. He is up to date on all his shots and neutered. He was brought to us because his owner, who is handicapped, could no longer give him the care he needs. He is crate trained and house trained. Eli is very gentle and friendly. He is looking for his forever home and will be a welcome addition to any family.

All out of town applicants will also have to be willing to drive to Charlotte to meet/pick up the pet as soon as the application is approved.***

name: Azam
description:
Meet the handsome Azam! Azam is a 10 month old, brindle, Pit Bull Terrier who weighs about 50 pounds. He is neutered and current on all his vetting.

Azam is a very sweet boy, who LOVES everyone he meets. However we don't know how he is with cats. He is a great boy who just wants to be around his person all of the time. He still has some growing to do, and is expecting to be between 60-70 lbs when full grown. He loves to have his big old block head held and kissed. Will you be his forever person who will give him nothing but kisses and love?

If you are interested in adopting Azam please submit an inquiry directly with Greater Charlotte SPCA by visiting charlottespca.org/adopt.

description:

I can be a bit vocal so I think living in an apartment is not the best home for me. I get along great with other dogs and I don't mind cats or kids. I like to play hard and nap harder. I am house and crate trained, neutered and up to date on my vaccines. I weigh about 35lbs. If you're looking for your own Black Bear put in an application for me!

description:
Princess is a big girl that would do best in a home with older children and medium to large dogs.  She a very sweet girl that is very strong. Unknown how she is with cats.


Our adoption area is limited to a distance of one hour from the Charlotte, NC  metro area due to rescue resources.

description:

This girl has some serious skills and can easily clear a 6' privacy fence. She needs some basic obedience but otherwise will be a great pet.

I get along great with other dogs, I am interested in cats, but I respect their space and I like kids. I am pretty vocal so an apartment is not a good home for me and I would prefer another dog in the home to keep me company. If you're looking for your own Little Bear put in an application for me!

She was brought to Richmond County shelter as a stray so we don't know much about her history. Jolie is good with other dogs, but needs to learn boundaries as she gets rambunctious. She is learning about cats and has not been aggressive with them. She is very sweet, loves people and loves to play.

description:
Frankie is an easy going six year old Rat Terrier/Dachshund mix who weighs 15 pounds. He enjoys exploring the outdoors on long walks, taking in sights on car rides, and snuggling when indoors. He is friendly, playful, and loving as well as crate and house trained. Frankie may be small in size, but he has a big bark which he uses to alert his human and a strong hunting instinct. He is not best suited for apartment life, small children or cats. If you're looking for a great little companion with a big personality and heart then please put in an application for Frankie.

Lana likes to play with other dogs and chew on dog toys. Lana is working on training in order to learn to stay on place/base and basic commands. She has been a quick learner and is easy to reinforce with treats. Lana is fully vetted.

description:
Handsome Poppie is the world's biggest love bug. He adores all people, and he wants nothing more than to snuggle and to play tug (although he cheats). Medium to low energy, Poppie enjoys short(ish) walks and long naps. A very smart boy, he's doing beautifully with his obedience training, and can sit/down/stay/come (and he's working on place). He's great in the car, at the groomer's, and at the vet's. Poppie would like to be the hero of his own house, and would rather not share his home with other dogs or cats. If you want a loyal best friend who will happily share your ice cream, Poppie is the boy for you.

If you are interested in adopting Poppie please submit an inquiry directly with Greater Charlotte SPCA by visiting charlottespca.org/adopt.

description:
Sweet Cassie is a 3 year old American Bulldog mix and weighs 60 pounds, she is fully vetted and ready for her forever home. She is house, leash, and crate trained. She is food-motivated for easy future training.

She is generous with love and a cuddle monster. Everyone that has meet Cassie can't believe her gentle nature and how affectionate she is with children, women and men. Her favorite thing to do is to be petted all day long! When she wants your attention she will lay her head right in your lap. Cassie has a medium level of energy and is calm inside the house all day. Are you ready to have a companion that will show you nothing but love and loyalty? If so, please put in your application for Cassie today!

If you are interested in adopting Cassie please submit an inquiry directly with Greater Charlotte SPCA by visiting charlottespca.org/adopt.

Arceus loves to show affection to his humans and wants nothing more than to cuddle and play with you and roll over for belly rubs. Will you be his next family and let him into your heart?

She is great with other dogs and cats. She just wants to play! Gretel is very shy around humans and takes awhile to trust humans. She will do best in a home with another dog and a family that will give her time to adjust and come out of her shell, because once she does, she will love you forever!

He is happiest spending all his time in a calm environment and being the center of his owners attention. Mac is slow to warm up, but once you earn his trust he is very sweet and loyal. While is house and crate trained, Mac seems to do best when he can look out a window or curl up in a quite spot in the house. Mac is best suited to be the only pet in the house and with older considerate children.

If you are interested in adopting Mac visit charlottespca.org/adopt/.

description:
Duke is a seven year old male Pit Bull Terrier mix who weighs around 65 pound, fully house and crate trained.

Duke has been through professional training and knows all his basic commands. He also walks very well on a leash! When you are done for the night and you just want to cuddle and watch some TV, Duke will be right there next to you watching too!!

Duke would do best in a home with older children over 12 and with dogs of similar size and females.

name: Coco
description: Meet Coco, the energetic, 30 pound American Pit Bull Terrier who looks and acts younger than she is! Coco is 12 years old, but aging with grace (Meryl Streep would be envious) and is more full of life and joy than much younger dogs she knows. She is a pocket sized, spunky gal who wants to lay in the sun, snooze next to you, and play with toys and other dogs. Coco is family friendly and loves kids; but would do best in a house that has easy going male dogs as she really likes the boys. She is still working on manners and commands, but is house and crate trained. She is just so exuberant about life she can't contain herself! Coco is wonderful and sweet and confident! Please come out to an adoption event and meet this sweet gal with a gigantic underbite (the most serious underbite ever)! 'Some call me a senior dog, but that just means that I have years of experience in the fine art of friendship' If you are interested in adopting Coco please submit an inquiry directly with Greater Charlotte SPCA by visiting http://www.charlottespca.org/adopt/. ***Because our rescue is composed entirely of volunteers and we require a home check for each of our adoptable pets prior to them going to their new homes, local applications will take precedence. name: Fergie
description:
Say hello to Fergie, a one and a half year old Pointer/Australian Shepard mix. Fergie is an absolute doll who wants nothing more than to love on her person and play with her dog friends. Shy at first, she quickly warms up and will lean in and ask for pets and give you kisses in return. She has been an excellent playmate with her foster brothers and sisters, takes the cue when they don't want her company, and will happily play with someone else or choose to go chew on a toy. She has been excellent in the house, no accidents, as well as in her crate. Fergie loves to run in the backyard, so a structural fenced in yard is required. She walks well on leash, but needs some time to get used to new surroundings. Once she is familiar, she is a great walking or hiking buddy. She has been introduced to cats and seems to do well with them. As you can see from her smile, she is a happy girl ready to be with that special someone or family to give them all of her love. Fergie's adoption fee includes current vaccines, microchip, and spay. To apply to adopt this very special girl, email adopt@carolinapaws.com. 

Adoption fee includes current vaccines, microchip and spay/neuter.  Adoption events are held on Saturdays from (11-2) inside the Blakeney Petsmart (9911 Rea Road Charlotte, NC) in the small animal section.* * * Please note: This a meet and greet only event.  Not all our animals may be at an adoption event. We do not accept applications at our adoption events.  Please review our adoption requirements on our website https://www.carolinapaws.com/adopt/adoption-process/ If interested in one of our rescued cats/dogs complete the online application.  Submitting an application does not obligate you to adopt nor guarantee an adoption.  It is in everyone's best interest to ensure the best possible match, and your cooperation is appreciated. 

We are only accepting applications from the greater Charlotte North Carolina area and certain surrounding counties.

description:
Meet Sierra, a stunningly gorgeous female Lab mix born around June 4th 2019. Sierra is playful lovable puppy!  She was recently rescued with her siblings from a local shelter.  She is adjusting well in her foster home.   She is a smart little girl and is treat motivated.  She is doing amazing with house and crate training.  She enjoys car rides and walks with her foster mom.  She loves nothing more than to be with other dogs!  Her favorite sport is playing fetch. 
 She is best suited in a home with a structural fenced in yard, someone that is home more often than not and children over the age of 8 years old.  She will weigh around 45-50lbs full grown. If you would like to meet Sierra, contact us at adopt@carolinapaws.com

description:

The only thing in the world she wants is a family to call her own.  She came to the rescue after being abandoned at a local shelter.  She is good with cats, dogs and children. name: Riley
description:
Meet Riley,  a Hound mix born around 6/22/19. She is a wonderful little girl; a silly, goofy bucket of love.  Riley loves everyone she meets, both people and dogs alike. She likes to be around her family, not needing constant attention, just to be a part of the family. She likes to play with both balls and ropes toys, and outside \"chase\" is the game of choice.  She is a charmer, and no one has been able to resist falling in love with this sweet girl. Riley is doing well with her crate and house training. Her foster mom is working on her basic commands. She knows \"sit\" and comes when called. Riley and her sisters came to the rescue as tiny little babies, eyes still closed so they have known nothing but love and affection. She will weigh around 60 pounds when full grown. Due to her age, she will need someone home more often than not. She will need a large (structural, not invisible) fenced in yard. She is not a candidate for apartments, condos or town homes.  Her adoption fee will include current vaccines, microchip and spay.  To inquire about adopting this awesome puppy, please email adopt@carolinapaws.com

description:
Meet Ricky, a 5 year old American Staffordshire Terrier mix.   Ricky is a super sweet fun loving, full of life boy!  He may be 5 but he is a puppy at heart and loves to play with tennis balls, people and doggy friends.  He gets along great with all dogs.  He rides great in the car and is house and crate trained.   He is eager to please and knows basic commands.  After a long day of play you will find him snuggled up by your feet with his dog bone.  He would love a yard to run and play in and will thrive in a structured home with lots of love to give!   Ricky is ready to find a family to call his own. description:
Meet Callie a gorgeous 1 year Lab mix.  Callie has the most stunning eyes!  This sweet fun loving girl was rescued from a local shelter and is adjusting well in her foster home.  Callie is eager to please and learn.  She is very treat motivated and already knows some basic commands like sit and stay.  She loves to play in her foster's yard on a sunny day.   She is great with everyone she meets and cannot get enough attention.  She is a big fan of any toy you put in front of her.  This playful, goofy girl will surely bring lots of love and laughter to any family.   After a long day of play you will find her curled up on her dog bed.  She is good in the car, loves to go for runs, and will make a wonderful companion.  She will weigh about 50lbs, is up to date on vaccines, spayed and microchipped. Callie is best suited in a home with children 12 years or older.   If you are interested in adding Callie to your family, contact us today at adopt@carolinapaws.com.

name: Cayde
description: If you are interested in adopting this dog, please fill out our dog adoption questionnaire and e-mail it to AdoptionCenter@homewardtrails.org PLEASE VISIT THIS WEBSITE TO FIND THE ADOPTION QUESTIONNAIRE: http://www.homewardtrails.org/adopt-a-pet/adoption-forms/ Cayde is a beautiful retriever/terrier mix originally from Chatham, VA. He has a beautiful deep red/tan coat and big ears full of personality! Cayde loves to play, but also snuggles up well next to his people. He's happiest when he can exercise and take long walks. He is crate-trained, and goes in happily to lay down or rest. He does great riding in the car and meeting new people. He will need someone to help him a bit while walking on leash as he gets excited and pulls, but with treats and commands he listens well and stops. He's just excited meeting people and dogs -- not aggressive -- so with a little more training, he will do great. He's a big love bug and full of personality. Come meet him this weekend! Adoption Coordinator: Adoption Center Location: Adoption Center The adoption fee for this dog is $375. This fee INCLUDES spay/neuter and microchip. Every adopted Homeward Trails animal comes with 30 days of free pet health insurance. We are proud to partner with the following veterinarians who offer a free first exam for your animal, exclusively for HT adopters: Caring Hands Animal Hospital, Palisades Veterinary Clinic, Sunshine Animal Hospital and Clarendon Animal Care and all VCA Animal Hospitals. Additionally, any VCA hospital will cover illnesses up to $250 at no cost to any Homeward Trails adopter. We also provide a 30-minute phone consult with a professional dog trainer at Fur-Get Me Not within the first 30 days of adopting - just for HT adopters in the Arlington/Alexandria area. Start your new dog out on the right foot with this valuable, expert advice and guidance FREE! You can save animals like this one by becoming a foster! Fosters are like way stations between high kill shelters and forever homes. We need fosters so that we can save dogs before they are euthanized at the shelters. If you are interested in becoming a foster, please check out our information about fostering by visiting http://www.homewardtrails.org/foster-a-pet/dog-and-cat-foster-program/

name: Yin
description: Yin is an older (born approx 6.20.10) spayed, female Akita. She is heartworm negative, on flea/heartworm prevention, microchipped, up to date on vaccines, house trained, crate trained, and leash trained. Yin came to us from the shelter in Chesapeake, VA, where she was surrendered because her family could no longer care for her. She had a bad skin infection on her back and was reported to have gotten into a tussle over food with the female Rottweiler she previously lived with. In true girl-fight fashion, all she did was hold the Rottie down and pull out her hair. ? Yin is a sweet, older girl looking for her retirement home

name: Gator
description: Gator is a 6 month old pug/hound mix from Chesterfield. He weighs 21 pounds, is up to date on shots, and good with all. He was brought into the animal control shelter with his sister Shine - they had both been shot full of bbs. I expect them to be coming up the weekend of July 9th.updated pic and more information for Gator, shines brother: Gator is house trained. He is easy going and loves other animals. He's about 20lbs. He loves going on walks and a good snuggler on the couch.

name: Angel - Only $75 adoption!
description:
ANGEL (Purebred Chihuahua) - AVAILABLE!!!!!
Only $75 adoption!!!
My adoption profiles tend to be long & very detailed. Please read the ENTIRE Adoption Profile (all the way to the FAQ) so you understand everything about this dog & if you are a good match for her.
Angel had a very very hard start in life. In June she was confiscated from a hoarder, along with multiple other dogs, for living in over crowded deplorable conditions and failure to give medical care.
She was rescued from the Chihuahua hoarder that had over 40 Chihuahuas that I'm sure you saw on the news. Here is one of the videos:
https://www.azfamily.com/news/nearly-chihuahuas-found-abandoned-by-evicted-tenant-in-east-phoenix/article_14325912-8e34-11e9-a4c2-0bdb8b6b9c4f.html?fbclid=IwAR1RI_2n4E6YeTeh7uha9N63VPPwgEiqVjG20HxOw8LElVEahfX5f7G6O24
While at the shelter she was fearful, and that landed her on their euthanasia list.
That is when Safe Haven stepped in. Then when getting her spayed, it was discovered that she had Pyometra (infection in the uterus). So had she not been confiscated, she would have died a slow, painful death...She is all better now, and was given antibiotics to make sure any lingering infection after the surgery is completely gone.
She was scared and shaking when she first got here, but now she is a happy little bundle of joy... She is very sweet and gives kisses and has a happy, peppy playful personality. She wants to be wherever you are & would make a great companion dog. Very loving!
VIDEOS OF ANGEL:
Angel in the backyard with Wendy and Glitzy: https://photos.app.goo.gl/hgp1k6MJdiZec6re8
Angels' guard dog qualities: https://photos.app.goo.gl/qDwVvkBm5ZcpVkLUA
Angel getting treats: https://photos.app.goo.gl/xySZQe2eWGkq1h8a7
Angel and Wendy being goofy: https://photos.app.goo.gl/4C92v1y2DGN6DE26A
Angel playing with Beans & Daryl: https://photos.app.goo.gl/D8ZcxVHLxM1r2fTJ9
PLEASE NOTE: All of the pets at Safe Haven receive basic training when they come here. All adopters will be given a list of words that your new pet knows at the time of adoption. What each pet learns depends on how much time I have had to work with them, & if that pet has any additional issues that need to be focused on first. The pets here are always improving.
Birthday: 6/9/18

Weight at last Vet visit: 8 lbs and she is at the ideal weight
Cats: Interested in them and will go up and gently sniff them.
Small Dogs: She has been great with all the other small dogs. She will go up and greet them and is very friendly and playful. She would be a great dog park dog!
Large Dogs: She is friendly with large dogs. Even if they get up in her face...
Kids: Unknown, but she is sweet and I imagine she would be great with kids as long as they were gentle with her. Older kids only please since she is so small.

Men: Loving and affectionate.

Women: Loving and affectionate
Strangers: Loving and affectionate. Especially if they have treats!
Food: I feed all the dogs on a rotational diet. Which means they get a different brand of high quality food each month. I do this because I do not think that one brand can provide all the nutrients that they need. Just like one food can't provide us with all that we need...Plus, who wants to eat the same thing every day? All dogs are fed breakfast (6 am) & dinner (5 pm), & are fed in their crate with their own bowl.   She gets 1/4 cup for breakfast and again for dinner for a total of 1/2 cup of dry food a day.  Plus for dinner, I add 1 tsp. organic coconut oil,  & some type of extra goody like canned food, cottage cheese, organic pureed pumpkin, or an organic veggie. She's a great eater & has eaten everything I have given her. She is so funny. It takes me awhile to get the meals together for all the dogs, and she will stand up on her hind legs while waiting in anticipation! To funny!
Crate Trained: Yes, She has not had an accident in a long time. She now goes in on her own (she will follow the food) She is let out multiple times throughout the day, and can hold it through the night.
She is in a small 24\" x 18\" wire crate.
House Trained: In training. She seems to understand that her business needs to be done outside.
I do have to make sure she goes outside though, because she doesn't want to leave me to go out on her own. She is more willing to go outside without me if another dog goes out with her...
She also had submissive urination whenever I would walk towards her when she first came here. That is what happens when dogs are really scared. Much like when a humane says \"I was so scared I peed my pants!\". I have found that if I talk to her in a baby voice when I am walking up to her, it calms her down and it doesn't happen. Only time she does it now is in the morning when she has a full bladder.
Leash Trained: The leash is new to her, and she is apprehensive about it. Treats help coax her to walk on leash...
Car: She rides in a carrier
Other issues: - Tips of ears are missing.
Adoption fee is only $75 & includes:
- Spay/Neuter surgery
- Up to date on Vaccinations
- Microchip
- Collar
- Harness *
- Leash
- Other surprise goodies from Safe Haven
- Free office visit to Vet
- 50% off any Optimum Wellness Plan
- 30 days of free Pet Insurance
- Other coupons from Partners
- Available Paperwork: Spay/Neuter records, Vaccination records, Vet records, Micro records, Recommendation list, etc...
- Continued Support: Safe Haven will be there for the lifetime of your new adopted pet. If you ever have questions or concerns, we will always be there to help. Our goal is for you & your pet to live happily ever after!
If you are interested in adopting this dog, please fill out an application:  http://www.adoptapet.com/Safe-Haven/adoption-application/ 

After we receive your application, we will contact you through e-mail. Please check your junk filter if it has been more than 2 days.
To get status & updates on this dog, follow us on Facebook! You will usually find more pictures & videos of the pets there too!   https://www.facebook.com/groups/1405138936478168/
ADOPTING A CAT OR DOG IS UP TO A 20 YEAR COMMITMENT! THEY ARE NOT OBJECTS THAT YOU CAN GET RID OF WHEN THEY BECOME INCONVENIENT. THEY ARE INNOCENT LIVING, BREATHING ANIMALS WITH FEELINGS THAT DEPEND ON YOU TO TAKE CARE OF THEM. IF YOU ARE NOT WILLING TO TAKE CARE OF, LOVE, & PAY FOR EVERYTHING THIS PET NEEDS FOR UP TO 20 YEARS, THEN PLEASE DO NOT ASK FOR AN APPLICATION.
* Safe Haven STRONGLY believes that collars should only be used as decoration or to hold the ID tag. If you are trying to restrain your dog, it can easily slip out of a collar. Also, attaching a leash to a collar puts pressure on the neck, which is one of the most sensitive areas of the body, & could hurt them. For these reasons, Safe Haven includes a harness with every dog adoption to ensure the safety of the dog. A harness distributes the weight on the chest & shoulders. It also has a handle on the back that you can grab if need be, without hurting your pet (EX: Dog falls off your boat, just grab the handle & pull your pet back in with no harm done. With a collar, you would have to strangle your dog when pulling your dog in). Also, it is very hard for a dog to slip out of a harness when properly fitted. So it is much easier to restrain them.
FAQ:
Q: Is this pet still available?
A: Status of each pet is  posted in the original post on the Facebook page for Safe Haven Animal Rescue of AZ at https://www.facebook.com/groups/1405138936478168/  . It will say the status in ALL CAPS at the very top of the pets post, and updates are posted in the comment section of each pets post.  
 Once on the Facebook page, type the pets name in the search box in the upper right corner to easily pull up all the posts on that pet.
Q: Why are your adoption fees so low?
A: Safe Haven does things very differently than other rescues do. If you look at our other pets up for adoption, and also our past adoptions, you'll see that ALL our prices are low. We do this because it generates a lot of interest, and gets the pets adopted quickly. The more that get adopted, the more we can rescue. We only deal with pets in danger of being euthanized. The whole point is to save as many lives as possible! We are all about the animals here. And if you want to add a donation to the adoption price to show appreciation for all the hard work we do, then please indicate that in your application!
Q: I don't see a phone #. Will someone please call me?
A: Everything needed is online. I have found that online is the most efficient way to get all the work done. In the past, when I posted my #, my phone rang off the hook all day. So I spent the whole day on the phone, with not much work to show for it at the end of the day. Again, everything needed is online.
Q: How do I adopt this pet?
A: Your first step is to fill out an application. http://www.adoptapet.com/Safe-Haven/adoption-application/
Q: Can I adopt if I live out of state?
A: Yes, Out of state adoptions are welcome. You have the choice of coming to Litchfield park AZ to meet and adopt, or having the pet transported to you. This also applies if you live farther than an hour away. An additional fee applies if you would like us to transport the pet to you. Fees are $195 for transport + the adoption fee. Fees might be slightly higher for medium and large dogs, depending on the cost of the crate. Fees are not due until transport has been confirmed. All transported pets are spayed/neutered, microchipped, and up to date on their vaccinations. They come with with a collar with ID attached, harness and leash, health certificate if required, bowls and food if it is more than a day trip, a voucher for a Free office visit to Vet, 50% off any Optimum Wellness Plan, 30 days of free Pet Insurance, Other coupons from Partners, and all available paperwork: Spay/Neuter records, Vaccination records, Vet records, Micro

name: Scarlet
description: Scarlet is about 10 months old. She's a pointer mix or lab/cattle dog mix- we don't know for sure. She was surrendered to a vet office by her family because she was in need of surgery for her eyes - she had entropian which means the eyelids/lashes turn in and irritate the eyes and cause infection. She also was covered in ticks - obviously not well cared for. She had the surgery before she came to us and her eyes got infected - we have treated her for that and will update pictures soon! Scarlet weighs 36 pounds and is super sweet and submissive. Scarlet is ready to find her new family!  If you are interested in adopting from Recycled Doggies, please complete an adoption application through our website:  www.recycleddoggies.org. THAT IS THE FIRST STEP IN OUR PROCESS. Please do not just show up at an adoption event and expect to adopt a dog that day - we need time to review your application ahead of time, which is why we ask that you submit your application ahead of time so you don't miss out on the dog you are hoping to adopt while you wait for your application to be reviewed. Our adoption fee is $195.  All of our dogs are spayed/neutered, up to date on age-appropriate vaccines, dewormed, heartworm tested (if over 9 months of age), and microchipped. We do not adopt outside our area, which we define as two hours drive time from downtown Cincinnati (zip code 45202 - use Google Maps to determine if you are within our area) NO EXCEPTIONS. This is for the safety of our dogs, so that in case an adoption does not work out, we can be sure that we can quickly get our dog back. We do not have a shelter or facility - all of our dogs live in volunteer foster homes. In order to not infringe on any more of the time of our foster families, we introduce our dogs to potential adopters at our weekend adoption events posted on our website - please do not request to meet the dog outside of an adoption event as we are unable to grant the request.  If you have additional questions, please email recycleddoggies@gmail.com.

name: Flo Jo
description: Flo Jo is a Chiweenie (chihuahua/dachshund) mix. Sheâs estimated to be 7-8 years old. She was found as a stray out in the country dragging her hind legs behind her due to some injury or impairment. She has some apparent muscle wasting in her hind end and sores on her legs from dragging herself around. We had it checked out and the xrays showed no significant findings as far as arthritis or fractures (but she does have a bullet in her lumbar area but not believed to be causing any issues at this point) but she had some pain in her back so she was started on gabapentin to try to help. But donât let Miss Flo Jo fool you â she can climb baby gates and get around just fine! We donât know her history but we know her future looks wonderful â full of love and comfy beds and healthy food and no more worries about being shot at. She sometimes seems to poop when she doesn't know she's doing it like when she's super excited. The vet said it's possible there was a little nerve damage back there that occurred when the other injuries occurred. She can be a little nervous sometimes so we think a home without small children is what she needs. name: Goldie
description: Goldie is such a cutie pie! And sheâs such a nice dog too! She weighs almost 20 pounds and is long and low to the ground - some kind of spaniel mix. Sheâs estimated to be 7 years old. We have no idea on her background - she came into the shelter as a stray with lots of mammary tumors. The shelter spayed her and took off the first set of tumors before we got her (and unfortunately did not send them out for testing) and then we had the remaining tumors removed - both benign- YAY! While we have no history on her, we can tell she had a family at some point â this girl is very well behaved, she knows the commands sit, down, and sit pretty! She often chooses to go in a crate even though she doesnât have to, and she loves going for rides in the car! She has had two potty accidents in the 3 weeks that we have had her and that was on a potty pad. She gets along fine with other dogs and has met the cats in her foster home and was fine with them as well. WE LEARNED THAT GOLDIE IS NOT GOOD WITH KIDS. We found that Petsmart was not really where she showed her best self- she barked at a lot of the dogs while on leash and barked in her crate and she did try to nip a child's hand - that's why we say NO KIDS. She's wonderful at her foster home with adults and has done well at the vet meeting new people - she gives a little side eye like she's unsure but warms up nicely. name: Gail
description: Gail is ready to start interviewing potential forever homes! Sheâs a senior poodle mix - very sweet. She loves to explore the yard and snuggle in bed. She's vision-impaired due to cataracts but does see some. She's also hard of hearing - it's rough being an old gal! She circles a lot in the house and yard as she wanders. She's not the most engaging doggy at first - it takes her a while to warm up and show happiness through tail wags and greetings. Sheâs estimated at 10-12+ years old and is about 15 pounds. She was extremely matted when she came into the shelter so she had to get shaved down. She had a dental with several extractions - she does not have a lot of teeth left but she still eats just fine! It takes some time for her to warm up and show personality but once she does, she's tail wags and happy girl for her people!
