name: Liberty \Libby\","Liberty came to us on the 3rd of July - she had been picked up as a stray by animal...
description: Liberty came to us on the 3rd of July - she had been picked up as a stray by animal control and no one ever came looking for her at the shelter. Probably because she had a very large hernia as well as a second hernia and needed medical care ASAP. We got her the care she needed - her intestines were in those hernias! Thankfully she did well in surgery and recovered well. Our vet thought her heart looked enlarged on X-ray but she saw a cardiologist and had an echocardiogram and they said her heart is shaped normally, not enlarged, and that other than having very mild valve disease (common for her breed) sheâs in great shape â no medicine, no restrictions! But she's fun, happy, playful and super excited about life! She loves to ride in the car- she explores everywhere and looks out the windows to flirt with other drivers! She is food protective - she will guard it from people and other dogs (she barks & growls at the other dogs to keep them away and blocks them) so she may need to be fed separately if her forever home has other dogs and a home without small children would be best for her. She is estimated to be about 8-9 years old (shelter originally guessed around 5 but our vet thinks she's older than that). She weighs 7 pounds. She is not completely housetrained. She has a potty pad in her area where she eats and sleeps and has used it occasionally (less as time goes by) and when she comes out of her area and runs to the door, if you're not quick enough or if she gets distracted and runs away from the door, she sometimes squats to potty before you can get her outside. But she's doing better than when she first arrived! She's spunky and loves to dance! name: JIMMY
description:
Hi! My name is Jimmy. I am a 5 year old male Chihuahua/Jack Russell Terrier and I weigh 12 pounds, although I could lose a pound or two. My story is a little long but it goes like this, my first known family left me in a house. The people that moved in decided to keep me since I was already there. Somehow I ended up at the shelter shortly after in 2016. I was adopted out, but returned 3 years later to the same shelter because my owners were getting a divorce. That's when LuvFurMutts got me out of the shelter. I am the sweetest boy and I love everybody, although I can be a bit scared at first. I love to be pet and I love treats! I do great with other dogs and I don't pay attention to cats. I would do best in a home with kids 8 and up. I would love to find a forever family that will really be my FOREVER family! Can you open your heart up to me?
*LuvFurMutts Rescue cannot guarantee age, breed(s) or adult size of the dog. We do our best on their bio based on our veterinarian's assessment. Thank you for understanding!
Thank you for considering adopting from LuvFurMutts Animal Rescue!
If you would like to meet a dog that you are considering adopting, we REQUIRE you to first fill out an adoption application. You can find our online application at www.LuvFurMutts.com

PRIOR TO ADOPTION:
Unless health or age reasons prevent us from doing so, every LuvFurMutts' Dog has:-Vaccinations up to Date (Including Rabies)-Is on Heartgard-Is on monthly flea protection-Had a Dental if needed-Been Spayed/Neutered-Been Microchipped with 24 Petwatch microchips and free lifetime registration is included-Been tested and is Heartworm Negative *All dogs over 5 receive pre-op blood work. This lets us know if the dogs have liver, heart, kidney, etc. problems*
Our adoption donation is $200 and is tax-deductible.
*LFM does not charge higher fees for purebred dogs, puppies, or dogs that have had extraordinary medical expenses that far exceed the $200 adoption fee - we depend on donations to help us cover those costs.
We do not adopt dogs to adopters that live further than three hours out of our area (also note, on some particular dogs, we do not adopt to adopters that live further than an hour out of our area, such as puppies that may need to come back for vetting and would be noted in the dog's bio.)We define our area as a 3 hour drive time from Cincinnati, OH using zip code 45231 according to Google Maps (not based on how fast you can drive the distance). This rule is for the safety of our dogs - we need to be sure we can get our dogs back quickly in the event an adoption doesn't work out.
Want to foster/adopt/transport with us? Please check out www.LuvFurMutts.com
Please give us a 'Like' at www.Facebook.com/LuvFurMuttsRescue

name: Baby
description:
Baby is a Female Jack Russell Terrier. Her owner passed away so she is looking for a new forever home. She is an older gal at approximately 13 years old. She has a super sweet personality and enjoys being around people. She is all up to date and ready for her forever home. She does great in the crate and has only had an accident one or twice. Baby has a very sweet temperament, but due to her older age, she would be best suited with older kids. We would not want kids to be rough with her or mishandle her. If you can open your heart to this sweet gal, she will give you unconditional love.

name: Foxy
description: Foxy is estimated to be about 12 years old. She is a sweet little frail but happy chihuahua. She weighs 10 pounds. She has a heart murmur and thinning hair on her back (likely from a prior flea allergy). Her initial bloodwork showed some kidney issues so we are re-running bloodwork before she can get adopted so we can provide the best information to anyone interested in this sweet gal (the vet wanted her to be on antibiotics and good food for a while before retesting).  She has some arthritis but still gets around well - she does steps very well! She gets along well with all the dogs in her foster home. She is not fully housetrained-  she cannot hold it on long days (mostly poop accidents). She generally pees outside unless she's too slow in making it to the door to go out so we tend to make sure she hurries on her way so she makes it! She might be slightly hard of hearing but she hears some. Her tail wags and she's happy to be alive. :)  If you are interested in adopting from Recycled Doggies, please complete an adoption application through our website:  www.recycleddoggies.org. THAT IS THE FIRST STEP IN OUR PROCESS. Please do not just show up at an adoption event and expect to adopt a dog that day - we need time to review your application ahead of time, which is why we ask that you submit your application ahead of time so you don't miss out on the dog you are hoping to adopt while you wait for your application to be reviewed. name: Lucy
description: Lucy is a senior pug - 12+ years old. She is a wobbly old gal who needs help getting around - her knees and hips just aren't what they used to be. She mostly cannot stand/walk, her back legs just cannot get under her to give her stability. She rolls over and will cry for help.  But she's a good sport even when she rolls over on the floor. We got her a cart that she is learning to use to help her stay upright and hopefully build some muscle mass. Her body may not be the best anymore, but her spirit and enjoyment of life is still there and we think she can bring some joy to someone's life. Lucy is super sweet. She's not housetrained. Because she isn't able to get up on her own, she often will poop under herself when in her dog bed. Thankfully she has nice solid poop so it's not a mess! You have to sprint to get her outside to potty or she will pee like a fountain while you are carrying her - a towel over her and a sprint is a good tip! But then you look at her sweet face and see her wonderful spirit and you know she's not giving up yet so neither are we! She will make you laugh and fall in love. name: Diane
description: Diane is a very scared girl who does not show well at adoption events - too scary and so many people! Diane needs a patient mom and/or dad (adult only home) who will give her the time and space she needs to feel comfortable and loved. She does best with a single person but can learn to love others with time, patience, and treats, but with visitors, she may need to be put in another room - she barks and may nip. Sheâs a 4-6 year old chihuahua mix who was found in a vacant apartment. Once sheâs settled in, sheâs very sweet and loving. It just takes time and it will take someone who can see beyond her scared exterior. If you think you might be a match for Diane and are interested in possibly adopting from Recycled Doggies, please complete an adoption application through our website:  www.recycleddoggies.org. name: Atlas
description:
Atlas is a 21 month old male American Bulldog/Pointer mix (our best guess) that is 86 pounds. He needs to be in a home with no other alpha male dogs. He does fine with small male dogs. He is very attached and loves to be with you. He is extremely found of kids. Kids seem to be his favorite thing. Just wants to be with them. He is fine with cats. He will jump a fence shorter than 8 ft. So will need a tie out, electric fence or leashed to go out. He is very well trained on the electric fence. He is completely potty-trained. He loves to sleep in bed with you on your head. He is a calm dog and loves to relax on a couch or chair. He does get spurts of energy where he wants to play as he is still puppy. For the most part he is a relaxed, calm dog. Can you open your home and heart to Atlas?

name: Bailey
description:
Bailey is a special guy and isnât the right match for most homes. Bailey is about 4-5 years old and he is a Yorkie mix â he is on the bigger side around 20 pounds or so. Heâs a healthy guy and he loves to play ball and be near his people but he does not need to be in your lap â just knowing youâre close by is good for him. 

Unfortunately Bailey has some quirks that make him need to be pretty selective in who his forever family will be. Bailey does not like kids â at all. Bailey does not like to meet other dogs when heâs on a leash so walks are not much fun.  Bailey does not particularly like to share special space (like his favorite personâs bed) but he does OK once you let him know the rules. He might snap if another dog steps on him or gets in his space but he usually can figure it out. He had an issue when the grown daughter in his foster family tried to get on the mom's bed where Bailey was and nipped at her so that's another thing to consider.  Bailey really needs a privacy fenced backyard (or no neighbors) so heâs not distracted by neighbors (big/little humans or dogs) who will get him all riled up. And heâs very sensitive to sights and sounds around him that make him nervous and he will bark, so no apartment or condo type situation for him. He had an incident where some noise or movement triggered him and he nipped the leg of a person who was doing nothing other than having a conversation with his foster mom - they couldn't figure out what might have triggered him and Bailey has worked with a trainer who also couldn't identify a trigger or replicate that kind of reaction,. but as a result we know that Bailey doesn't do well in many normal social situations. He takes Prozac for his anxiety but he still can be a little unpredictable as far as his reaction in certain situations. He's wonderful in his foster home  - loving, funny, smart, well-behaved, rarely has a potty accident. But he doesn't handle visitors well and needs to be restrained or put in another room and slow introductions done. He gets super excited when the leash comes out and loves car rides.  Bailey is complicated. We know that. We still think his person is out there!

That probably makes it sound like Bailey is just awful and heâs not at all! We just know that everyone gets sucked in by his good looks, and we want to make it very clear that unfortunately Bailey is not going to be a match for most people. But for the right person or family, Bailey will be a wonderful companion and friend! Heâs well behaved in the house, he gets along with the other dogs and cats in his foster home, he sits politely to wait for treats, and he loves to dance!  He does pull on the leash â heâs in a big hurry to get wherever heâs going! Petsmart is really not where he shines because the dogs are on leashes and heâs in a crate - at adoption events with dogs parading past and people staring at him, itâs not his scene. He gets overly stressed and acts out.

Bailey is looking for his perfect home â we know itâs a tall order but we also know itâs out there! We have learned a lot about Bailey in the last couple of months which helped us be able to narrow down the list of what works for him so that we can hopefully make a successful match. If you think you might be the right match for Bailey, please go to our website to submit an adoption application www.recycleddoggies.org THAT IS THE FIRST STEP IN OUR PROCESS. Please do not just show up at an adoption event and expect to adopt a dog that day - we need time to review your application ahead of time, which is why we ask that you submit your application ahead of time so you don't miss out on the dog you are hoping to adopt while you wait for your application to be reviewed. Our adoption fee is $195.  All of our dogs are spayed/neutered, up to date on age-appropriate vaccines, dewormed, heartworm tested (if over 9 months of age), and microchipped. We do not adopt outside our area, which we define as two hours drive time from downtown Cincinnati (zip code 45202 - use Google Maps to determine if you are within our area) NO EXCEPTIONS. This is for the safety of our dogs, so that in case an adoption does not work out, we can be sure that we can quickly get our dog back. We do not have a shelter or facility - all of our dogs live in volunteer foster homes. In order to not infringe on any more of the time of our foster families, we introduce our dogs to potential adopters at our weekend adoption events posted on our website - please do not request to meet the dog outside of an adoption event as we are unable to grant the request.  If you have additional questions, please email recycleddoggies@gmail.com.

name: Benson
description: Benson is an adorable senior maltese/poodle mix (best guess). We estimate him to be 10+ years old. He came into the shelter already neutered and missing an eye - we don't know his history so we don't know how he lost his eye or where his family went. He was a stray. He weighs 12 pounds. He has some compression in his spine and takes anti-inflammatories and glucosamine for that and it helps him walk more easily and comfortably. He's very sweet and just wants to be loved. He does have a cataract in his remaining eye but seems to see some.  He's an old guy with old guy issues but he still deserves to be loved!  He's very chill and low maintenance. He is not housetrained. If you are interested in adopting from Recycled Doggies, please complete an adoption application through our website:  www.recycleddoggies.org. name: Taco
description:
Taco is a 2-3 year old male Terrier mix that weighs fourteen pounds. He gets along with other dogs and cats. He is doing well with housebreaking as long as he is taken out regularly. He is very sweet, laid back and quiet unless another dog wants to play and then he will play. He can be a great playmate for others dogs or kids. Taco must have a physical fenced in back yard. Unfortunately, an electrical fence will not do. Can you open your heart to him?

name: Sugar
description: Sugar is a special girl. he has a strong personality but it's endearing. She will be the right match for the right person- we just know it! She can be \"clingy\" - she always wants to be right where her person is and she loves to snuggle on the couch and watch tv! She's a quirky gal - she has a high pitched bark when she wants attention so no apartment/condo for this gal. She can be dominant with other dogs so if she has a doggy friend it needs to be a submissive or apathetic doggy friend who doesn't react to her bossiness and maybe appreciates a strong leader like Sugar.  No cats or kids for Sugar. She appears to have been mistreated in the past and while she needs training and structure, that needs to be done in a gentle style. In her past home, Sugar was permitted to run loose in the street and she got hit by a car. She had surgery and is healed (it was a couple years ago). Sugar is about 4-5 years old and weighs 20ish pounds. If you are interested in adopting from Recycled Doggies, please complete an adoption application through our website:  www.recycleddoggies.org. THAT IS THE FIRST STEP IN OUR PROCESS. name: Pappy
description:
Hi, my name is Pappy! I am an adorable male Chihuahua/Miniature Pinscher that is 10 years old and weighs 12 pounds. I am working on losing a few pounds. I found myself urgent in a high kill shelter, so LFM stepped up to save me! I have tons of love to give! The vet discovered I have a stage 1 heart murmur, but it does not slow me down at all. I am on medication, but it is less than $10 a month to refill. Despite a heart murmur, I can still live a long, happy life as it is being take care of. I cough sometimes due to a slight bend in my trachea which will improve as I lose weight. I am house trained and crate trained! However, I am not destructive so there isn't truly a need to crate me. I would do best with someone who is home a lot. I like being with humans! I am a quiet guy that gets along with other dogs, as long as they are small. Big dogs are scary. I am fine with cats and I like kids too! My foster mom says I'm the sweetest, cutest little old man ever. I love going on walks! I just need a quiet home to settle down and be loved on forever. Can you open your heart to me?
Watch me in action! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mXWEP6s66O4

name: Sassy
description:
Sassy is a female Rat Terrier/Beagle that is 10 years old and weighs 17 pounds. Sassy found herself with LFM after her owner passed away. Her sister was adopted very quickly after coming to LFM, so Sassy doesn't understand why she hasn't been adopted yet. She was very well taken care of and had Dentals every two years. Sassy is extremely well potty trained. She will go to the door and let you know when she has to go out. Sassy does fine with other small dogs, as long as they are not in her face. Sassy would need a home without cats as she likes to chase them. She loves the yard and going outside including running. She needs a home without small kids since she is a little older herself. She would be okay around kids if grandchildren visit as long as they understand she doesn't like to play. Sassy has a pin in her neck, but we do not know why. She also sometimes favors a leg. The vet said it is no problem and her leg is in no pain. Sassy loves to snuggle and will sit in your lap as often as you let her and is also happy curled up on the couch in her blanket as well. She sleeps through the night. She is a very sweet and loving devoted little girl. Can you open your heart up to Sassy?
Check out Sassy in Action! https://youtu.be/kKPjrbRR_MA

name: Boss
description:
Hi, I'm Boss! I am a 7-8 year old male Chihuahua that weighs 11 pounds. I came to LFM after Animal Control was called to take me when a man was arrested and had me in his truck so I ended up at a shelter. I love neck scratches and snuggling/burrowing in blankets on the couch. I can be nervous at first so I need time to warm up. For that reason, I need a home with kids 12 and up. I do great in the car and on my leash, and I'm crate trained and potty trained. I am okay with other dogs my size, big dogs scare me. I ignore them as long as they leave me alone, but I would prefer to be the only dog. I need a home with no acts because I like to chase them. I just need a quiet home with someone who understands that I had a rough start to my life. I want someone to love me just the way I am. I am a really good boy and want to live my life with someone who is patient and kind. Can you open your heart up to me?

We do not adopt dogs to adopters that live further than three hours out of our area (also note, on some particular dogs, we do not adopt to adopters that live further than an hour out of our area, such as puppies that may need to come back for vetting and would be noted in the dog's bio.)We define our area as a 3 hour drive time from Cincinnati, OH using zip code 45231 according to Google Maps (not based on how fast you can drive the distance). This rule is for the safety of our dogs - we need to be sure we can get our dogs back quickly in the event an adoption doesn't work out.
Want to foster/adopt/transport with us? Please check out www.LuvFurMutts.com
Please give us a 'Like' on Facebook at www.Facebook.com/LuvFurMuttsRescueThank you for considering adoption from LuvFurMutts Animal Rescue! If you would like to meet a dog that you are considering adopting, we REQUIRE you to first fill out an application. Please find the application at www.LuvFurMutts.com

PRIOR TO ADOPTION:
Unless health or age reasons prevent us from doing so, every LuvFurMutts' Dog has:-Vaccinations up to Date (Including Rabies)-Is on Heart Guard-Is on monthly flea protection-Had a Dental if needed-Been Spayed/Neutered-Been Micro-chipped with 24 Petwatch microchips and free lifetime registration is included-Been tested and is Heart worm Negative *All dogs over 5 receive pre-op blood work. This lets us know if the dogs have liver, heart, kidney, etc. problems*

Our adoption donation is $200 and is tax-deductible.
LFM does not charge higher fees for purebred dogs, puppies, or dogs that have had extraordinary medical expenses that far exceed the $200 adoption fee - we depend on donations to help us cover those costs.

name: Callie
description:
Callie is a 14 year old Chihuahua whose owner died and whose family couldn't keep her permanently. So she made the trip from Cincinnati to Youngstown where she slid into foster home easily.

This girl weighs about 7 1/2 pounds and is fully vetted. She just had a dental so she's much more pleasant to be around. :)  We're really just learning about her.

She's learning to be her foster mom's \"chair Chi\" and is finding her place in the pack. She's a bit nervous and reserved at first, but once she's used to her situation she is a very friendly, sweet girl. She's good with other small dogs and so-so with cats. She would probably prefer a home without a cat, but once properly introduced to one, she should be OK. 

She is crate trained, but during feeding times is very vocal. During that time, she sounds like a wild animal or bird from a jungle. Right before and after feeding you wouldn't think she was a Chihuahua. Other than that, she's pretty good in a crate.

We're working on house training. She will potty outside, but her potty breaks need to be consistent. She loves her basket and blanket, and loves sleeping (like all seniors do!)

Callie would like a quieter household with her own personal human to love and bond with. She's a good little guard Chi who wants a home that she can protect when called upon. She wants regular feeding (and peanut butter snacks!!!) and chair time so she can feel close to her person.

**Callie is being fostered in Youngstown, OH**

Callie's adoption fee is $250. If she sounds like the dog of your dreams please contact Chihuahua Rescue & Transport and she will pack her toys and love and be there in a wag of her tail.

If you would like more information about adopting this dog, please go to our website(www.chihuahua-rescue.org). All dogs listed are adoptable in the 10 Midwestern states(OH/IN/KY/IL/MN/MI/WI/PA/IA/MO). We do transport! All of our dogs are spread out throughout the Midwest in foster homes.

Please fill out an adoption application at: www.tinyurl.com/CRTMidwestApp

name: Neff
description: Neff, 3-years-old, is a great family dog. He generally gets on well with the other with an occasional grumble. He is crate trained and not destructive in the house. If you would like to meet Neff then please go to our website www.GSRFL.org. Questions? Call his foster Mom at (352) 897-5357All animals accepted into our rescue receive the finest vet care and psychological services we can provide. Our rescue and sanctuary is now located in Citrus Springs, FL, with a foster homes in Lady Lake and N. Fort Myers. Please visit our website www.GSRFL.org to learn more about our organization.Our rescue consists of a group of dedicated volunteers that take German Shepherd Dogs into their homes and lives while the dogs and puppies are awaiting adoption. No salaries are paid to volunteers or anyone associated with the rescue. All funds collected go directly to the care of the dogs and puppies. We are in constant need of foster homes to allow us to save more dogs and puppies. Please consider being a foster home for a needy dog or puppy. You can request a foster application by Email us at WeLuvGSDs@gsrfl.com.We are always seeking financial donations to allow us to provide more services for our dogs. One hundred percent of all donations are used to benefit the dogs and puppies. We are a 501(c)3 non-profit Florida Corporation.

name: Missy
description: Missy is a two-year-old angel that was an owner surrender to this rescue. She came with seven puppies and now that the puppies are all adopted and she is spayed it's Missy's turn to find her forever home. This is the sweetest dog you will ever meet. If you would like to meet Missy, then please go to our website www.GSRFL.org and complete the Adoption Application you will find there. Questions? name: Molly
description: Molly is six-years-old and came back to rescue after her adoptive family's lifestyle changed. Molly is good with women and fearful of men. She is not a dog that can be taken on walks through neighborhoods. Molly would do well with a woman or two and be a total love. She is excellent with livestock, but barks horribly at the horses, which Jec taught her. We bring her in the house if she is outside when we feed the horses. She is all love and cuddle with women. Her people are important to her. Molly is crate trained and reliably house trained. Molly plays with the other dogs. If you would like to know more about Molly Email WeLuvGSDs@gsrfl.com or call (352) 897-5357All animals accepted into our rescue receive the finest vet care and psychological services we can provide. name: Maxey
description:
Maxey is a senior female Boston/Terrier mix and is coming soon from Clarksville. Up to date on all shots, just needs a forever home . Good with dogs and has lived with cats. She is 9 years old and weighs about 20 lbs.She would love for somebody to nurture her and give her a little TLC.
Look at herHow sweet!

http://www.russellrescuetn.com/application-for-adoption/

name: Charlie, sweet, mellow and so social puppy!!
description: Oh my gosh- you have to meet this most adorable, calm and mellow 3 month old puppy Charlie!!  Charlie is one of a litter of 8 chocolate lab and Staffordshire mixes.  His mom Mia gave birth after she was rescued from Clayton County shelter.  Momma Mia was down to her last hours when trainer and rescuer Jillian Pellegrino got her out of there and discovered she was due to deliver any day!  The puppies were all raised at Jillianâs home and received great care, love and awesome socialization.  Charlie is so easy-going, mellow and such a happy puppy.  Charlie is quiet, low energy and LOVES EVERYONE! Heâs currently in a foster home with smaller kids and many other animals.  Charlie weighs 25lbs now and we expect him to be about 50-60lbs when full grown.  He is fully vaccinated, micro-chipped but not yet old enough to be neutered.  His adoption fee does include his neuter when he is 6 months old. Charlie LOVES the water and he is working on fetching and basic commands.  His foster mom is a professional trainer and his adoption fee also includes puppy classes!  Charlie gets along great with all his foster siblings, loves to play (duh!) and is crate trained and super social. Heâs walking well on a leash and working on his basic commands.  Nearly house trained, Charlie is an amazingly fun and super smart puppy.  His personality is very much like his momâs- easy going and very good natured.  He will make a great exercise partner when heâs a wee bit older.  Charlie is great with other dogs, cats and kids.  He even has a bunny in his foster home.  To meet this incredible baby boy and make him your next and luckiest family member, please email Jillian at trainingtotherescue@gmail.com.  Charlies adoption fee is $400.  To complete an application right away, please go to raincityrescue.com/adopt to complete an online application.  You donât want one minute of fun to go by without coolest kid Charlie with you!

name: Cyndi
description: Please contact Jonnie (404) 518-9807 for more information about this pet.  Cyndi was saved from Clayton County AC along with her daughter, Mischief.  Cyndi is up-to-date on vaccines, spayed and heartworm negative. Cyndi knows 'shake'.

name: Binky
description:
Binky is very protective of his owner and his home.
Saved from Clayton County AC.
Binky has gotten older so he would prefer to be the only dog.
He is up-to-date on vaccines, neutered, microchipped, and heartworm negative.

name: TILLIE
description:
PLEASE DO NOT USE THE PETFINDER LINK TO CONTACT US AS THIS LINK IS NOT ALWAYS RELIABLE! 

Tillie is a tiny little (6 pound) Yorkie, Broken Coated Jack Russell, Maltese mix. She came to use from a hoarding situation where she was confined in a basement without much human contact. She has blossomed in rescue.

Tillie is house trained, crate trained, does well on a leash and enjoys riding in a car, sleeping in bed. Our little Ragamuffin is very sweet and attached to her foster providers but still timid with people she does not know.  She does warm up but will need a quiet, calm home full of TLC and an understanding of her past. She will continue to heal as she settles into her forever life and experiences more fun doggie things to do.

Tillie's adoption will require a securely fenced yard or fenced area that leads directly into the home.  She will need someone that is not working away from home a typical 8 hour work day; someone that works from home and can have their dog in their work space, someone who works VERY part time of is retired.  Tillie will need another very socialized dog, non alpha dog, in the home that she can emulate which will help her to adjust.  Tillie will blossom with an owner who is calm and kind, that will take her out and about and continue to offer her positive experiences. Adopters must live within a 1.5 hour drive from Wooster OH which includes The Cleveland and Columbus areas.

Star-Mar Rescue is a natural care provider and we place our dogs in homes that are already on a natural care program or are eager to learn. We use no chemicals on our dogs, no commercial flea products (oral or topical), do blood titers instead of randomly vaccinating. Our yards are without fertilizer and weed killer and our homes are toxin free. We feel that dogs can be protected without being harmed by harsh chemicals and unnecessary vaccinations and do best on a species appropriate, no grain, raw diet. Frozen raw diets, freeze dried or dehydrated no grain. Raw, no grain foods are easily gotten at many pet stores and on line and are no more expensive than a high quality dry food. This simple step will provide your dog the nutrition needed to keep them healthy and happy for many years unlike feeding a lifetime of processed foods. We are happy to help with this transition. For more information go to Star-Mar Rescue Natural Care facebook page and click on \"videos\" in the column to the left and watch the 7 part series called The Truth About Pet Cancer. It will give you an understanding of what we are doing and why. Please do some research on natural care and raw feeding and decide whether or not you can care for Tillie in this manner before requesting an application.

If you feel that your lifestyle and environment meet with Tillie's needs, please directly contact Martha at learymjri@aol.com or call 330-466-3667 or 330-262-0515 for an application or more information. PLEASE DO NOT USE THE LINK PROVIDED BY PETFINDER AS IT IS NOT ALWAYS RELIABLE.  Tillie's adoption will require an approved application and a home visit, with adoption completed at her foster home in Wooster, OH. Tillie's adoption fee is $300. We will work to place her within a 1.5 hour driving distance from her foster home in Wooster, OH. so that we can conduct a home visit bringing Tillie with us. This area includes the Columbus, Cleveland area of OH.

STAR-MAR RESCUE IS REGISTERED WITH THE OHIO DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE AS REQUIRED BY LAW

name: SLY
description:
This adorable little fella is Sly.  He is a 9 pound, 14 month old male Maltese, Yorkie, broken coated Jack Russell mix. He came to us from a hoarding situation. He had spent the first 12 months of life living in a basement in an 
x- pen with a number of other dogs. He was not socialized. He was afraid of everything and afraid to be handled but he knew he wanted out.  When I went to assess the situation Sly stood on his back feet at the x-pen.  He would run and hide when I got close but finally he let me pick him up and I took him home that night.  I came back several days later and took 14 more dogs.  

WELL.... Mr. Sly has come along way from the basement and he is one SUPER little guy!  He is a major love bug, is learning to play ball and loves going for walks.  He loves other dogs and really loves kitties.  He is playful with dogs his size.  Sly is with you every minute, comes when he called, VERY crate trained, is house trained and adores his people.

Sly might be shy when he first moves.  His foster home is all that he has ever know but he will quickly bond with his new family.  He wants to please and be loved.  He is a bit standoffish with men at first but warms up quickly.  He will need a quiet and calm home that ONLY uses positive reinforcement training.  He is house trained in his foster home but could possibly need some guidance when he transfers.  

Sly would not be a good candidate for children. Not because of any aggression but he does not know how to respond to them and would not be a fun dog for kids to have. He needs adults to continue to offer him good experiences that will build his confidence. 

Sly's adoption requirements are a fenced yard or fenced area large enough for him to run and play that leads directly into the home.  A person who does not work a typical 8 hour work day; someone who works from home and can have a dog in their work space, works very part time or is retired but active.  He will need another well socialized, calm, non alpha type dog in the home as he has never in his life been without other dogs and will emulate a well socialized, friendly, happy dog.  He will blossom with an owner who is calm and kind, that will take him out and about and continue to offer positive experiences to this sweet boy. Adopters must live within a 1.5 hour drive from Wooster OH which includes The Cleveland and Columbus areas.  

Star-Mar Rescue is a natural care provider and we place our dogs in homes that are already on a natural care program or are eager to learn. We use no chemicals on our dogs, no commercial flea products (oral or topical), do blood titers instead of randomly vaccinating. Our yards are without fertilizer and weed killer and our homes are toxin free. We feel that dogs can be protected without being harmed by harsh chemicals and unnecessary vaccinations and do best on a species appropriate, no grain, raw diet. Frozen raw diets, freeze dried or dehydrated no grain. Raw, no grain foods are easily gotten at many pet stores and on line and are no more expensive than a high quality dry food. This simple step will provide your dog the nutrition needed to keep them healthy and happy for many years unlike feeding a lifetime of processed foods. We are happy to help with this transition. For more information go to Star-Mar Rescue Natural Care facebook page and click on \"videos\" in the column to the left and watch the 7 part series called The Truth About Pet Cancer. It will give you an understanding of what we are doing and why. Please do some research on natural care and raw feeding and decide whether or not you are wanting to care for Sly in this manner before requesting an application.

If you feel that your lifestyle and environment meet with Sly's needs, please directly contact Martha at learymjri@aol.com or call 330-466-3667 or 330-262-0515 for an application or more information. PLEASE DO NOT USE THE LINK PROVIDED AS IT IS NOT ALWAYS RELIABLE. Sly's adoption will require an approved application and a home visit, with adoption completed at his foster home in Wooster, OH. Sly's adoption fee is $275. We will work to place him within a 1.5 hour driving distance from his foster home in Wooster, OH. so that we can conduct a home visit bringing Sly with us. This area includes the Columbus, Cleveland area of OH. 

STAR-MAR RESCUE IS REGISTERED WITH THE OHIO DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE AS REQUIRED BY LAW

name: Riley
description:
Riley is 14 years old, 12 lbs. and is currently located in Cocoa, Brevard County.

Riley was surrendered to rescue by a family member after their grandmother passed away.  Unfortunately we don't have much history on Riley as that was not available.  The family was unable to keep Riley due to an upcoming move and knew financially he needed serious dental care.

Riley did have a dental once he came into rescue and had a whopping 20 teeth pulled and he is a much happier dog now!  Before coming into rescue he ate canned food due to his painful mouth.  He now eats kibble but softened with hot water.  

Riley is a sweet gentleman who meshed well with the foster homes Dachshunds, Great Dane and cats.  He LOVES squeaky toys and snoozing in his bed.  Riley does like to take his toys with him when he goes outside to potty.   Riley does have a playful side and will play with the 1 year old Dachshund in his foster home.  

He can be a little protective over his squeaky toys.  

Riley would likely do okay with other dogs or by himself.  He seems to prefer people over the dogs and is a very low key guy.  He loves to sit on your lap and be petted.

Riley has had some accidents in the house, mostly just overnight - some nights he does not have accidents and some he does.  He is crate trained so crating is an option.

Riley is neutered, up to date on vaccines, heartworm tested negative, on a monthly preventative, microchipped and ready for his new forever family!

If you are interested in adopting Riley, please fill out an adoption application on our website at: http://fldr.org/adopt/adoption-application/. The adoption fee is $150

name: Tippi
description: Tipi is a terrier mix that came to us from the city of Coleman. He is a lovable pet that thrives on attention. He has had all his shots and is fixed and will make a great family pet.

name: Coco
description:
Coco Is a charming 10 year old liver colored Mini. She spent her first six years in a puppy mill. When the mill was closed down by the state, she went to an out of state shelter. They had so many Minis, that they asked for help from some breed rescue groups, and Coco came to Colorado. She was adopted to a wonderful couple, but after three years, and two babies, Coco was no longer comfortable and they asked us to take her back. She is still timid, but comfortable enough to sleep with her foster mom, and she is getting along well with the dogs in her foster home. She loves attention and she would make a great lap companion while you are reading or watching TV.  Coco would do best in an experienced \"mill dog\" home, and she would, of course, love a home with a retired owner or someone who works from home.

Coco is spayed, she is up to date on her vaccinations (rabies, distemper and kennel cough), vet checked, heartworm tested negative and on preventative while in rescue, and microchipped.  Coco had surgery to repair a luxating patella while she has been back with us.  She is nearly fully recovered from that but should not be doing a lot of up and down motion. If you would like to meet Coco, go to www.cominischnauzerrescue.com and complete the on-line adoption application.  We suggest that you print a copy of the application before you hit the \"submit\" button, just in case!  We will give you a call to set up a time to bring Coco for a visit.

name: Kirie
description:
My name is Kirie. I am available for adoption through Colorado Canine Rescue (CCR), a nonprofit dog rescue located in the Denver area. I came to CCR from Canon City Colorado. There is very little history on me. CCR has been told I am a pit bull breed mix, but that is just a guess made by shelter staff, rescue volunteers, and our veterinarians.

It is said when life gives you lemons, make lemonade. Well Kirie has had quite a few lemons handed to her in her 4 year life span, but definitely making the best lemonade that she can. Kirie was adopted out from CCR as a young dog but two years later wound up in the Aurora Shelter, having been abandoned. They called us so we could take her back into our rescue. Kirie has had TPLO surgery since being returned to us, going through training with a behaviorist, and a foster has worked diligently to get her past her pulling on the leash, and help her master her needs to attack water spouts and sprinkler heads.
Kirie still has separation issues, but does well in the foster home left with other dogs and free reign within the home. She is on a generic Prozac to help her manage with anxiety. Kirie loves to snuggle with her people on the couch and in bed and absolutely loves to give kisses. She is looking for a family that will give her plenty of attention, be home more than not, play fetch, take her on walks in the neighborhood. She adores children and is very gentle with them. Kirie so looks forward to rides in the car. She would enjoy being an only dog, but would do fine with a furry companion that has a laissez-faire attitude. She does best if the door is open or a doggie door for her to go out as needed. She needs a more experienced dog owner because she has been through so much in life.

If you are interested in adopting Kirie, please submit an adoption application located on our website, www.coloradocaninerescue.org. We are asking for a $200 adoption donation for Kirie. Kirie being a bully breed, will only be placed in communities that do not have a ban on bullies. Please note, CCR cannot guarantee the breed composition or ages of our dogs as we usually have no history prior to them entering the shelter. 9/15/19 5:01 PM

name: Jojo & Rowdy
description: Jojo and Rowdy are brothers and best friends and need to be together. They love to play and run around. They have spent many months on a farm and loved having the freedom to roam. They are medium size dogs and have traveled with us from Florida to Texas to Colorado and back. They have been around a lot of kids and never bitten or been dangerous. They are still a lot of energy so they  could use some training, but even without training they are super great and loving dogs

Star-Mar Rescue is a natural care provider and we place our dogs in homes that are already on a natural care program or are eager to learn. We use no chemicals on our dogs, no commercial flea products (oral or topical), do blood titers instead of randomly vaccinating. Our yards are without fertilizer and weed killer and our homes are toxin free. We feel that dogs can be protected without being harmed by harsh chemicals and unnecessary vaccinations and do best on a species appropriate, no grain, raw diet. Frozen raw diets, freeze dried or dehydrated no grain. Raw, no grain foods are easily gotten at many pet stores and on line and are no more expensive than a high quality dry food. This simple step will provide your dog the nutrition needed to keep them healthy and happy for many years unlike feeding a lifetime of processed foods. We are happy to help with this transition. For more information go to Star-Mar Rescue Natural Care facebook page and click on \"videos\" in the column to the left and watch the 7 part series called The Truth About Pet Cancer. It will give you an understanding of what we are doing and why. Please do some research on natural care and raw feeding and decide whether or not you are wanting to care for Sly in this manner before requesting an application.

If you feel that your lifestyle and environment meet with Sly's needs, please directly contact Martha at learymjri@aol.com or call 330-466-3667 or 330-262-0515 for an application or more information. PLEASE DO NOT USE THE LINK PROVIDED AS IT IS NOT ALWAYS RELIABLE. Sly's adoption will require an approved application and a home visit, with adoption completed at his foster home in Wooster, OH. Sly's adoption fee is $275. We will work to place him within a 1.5 hour driving distance from his foster home in Wooster, OH. so that we can conduct a home visit bringing Sly with us. This area includes the Columbus, Cleveland area of OH. 

STAR-MAR RESCUE IS REGISTERED WITH THE OHIO DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE AS REQUIRED BY LAW

name: Astro
description:
This boy is a black lab mix, approx 7 yrs young, male neutered, pulled from Columbus animal shelter in June.. still waiting for a forever home !!. Foster mom shared this:. Probably BEST as an ONLY DOG because he is protective of property; not immediately friendly with strangers in the house. He does not get along well with my dog but she instigates most of the arguments. He has a prey drive - wants to chase cats, but unsure if he would harm them. Growls slightly when you try to get him to do things he doesn't want to do (such as a bath). Trainer evaluation (Janet at SkyviewK9, TROY, OH) said that he would benefit immensely from training and would be a perfect dog. (If adopted, DREAM pet rescue - Dream4pets.org - will assist with the training expenses.)
? Loves attention (howls for it actually),
? Favorite toy: Kong, ball and leash
? Enjoys: car rides, walks, playing ball, chew toys
? Favorite activity: Cuddling or playing
? Demeanor: Calm but loves to play
? Interaction w/visitors: Whines more than barks
? Inside - has bedroom and sleeps in crate when in living room
? Outside: chain-link fence
? ASTRO will bring you the leash when he wants to go out or play. Very good watchdog, rarely barks. He is super smart and very loving. Loves peanut butter in his kong toy. Wants nothing more than to be loved on.
For more information about ASTRO, please contact CATE at 513-284-1140 or cate_wad@yahoo.com     MORE INFORMATION about ASTRO and adoption application can be found on the ADOPTME page at DREAM4pets.org     THIS is a COURTESY POST for the owner/caretaker ....we have not met this dog.

name: Connie
description: This is Connie! She is a super lovable little chihuahua who wants nothing more than to be with her people. She has some fear about being picked up, but once she's in a home she opens up and will follow you around the house. The perfect little companion! For Connie the perfect adopter is someone who has patience to gain her trust, a fenced in yard, and plenty of time to provide her with the love and attention she's always deserved. Connie has been in a foster home with a 4yo boy who she adores. Think Connie may be a fit for you and your family? Email us today! She is currently located in Connecticut but is available for meet n greets throughout New England.

name: Junior
description:
Five month old Junior is super sweet! He is quiet and calm and will make an adorable addition to any loving family!

******IMPORTANT - PLEASE READ ALL THE GREAT INFO BELOW******

PLEASE read our website's ADOPTION PROCESS PAGE prior to submitting an adoption application. www.apupspizzazzrescue.com/adoption-process 
ADOPTION APPLICATION: www.apupspizzazzrescue.com/adoption-application 

ABOUT OUR RESCUE DOGS: 
All of our sweet fur babies are being socialized daily with other dogs, adults, & most importantly, children. They are ALL in homes being cared for by people who LOVE them! All of our dogs are located in Connecticut, are spayed or neutered, up to date on vaccines, microchipped, dewormed, have had CT State health checks, & go home with a leash, collar, & packet of medical paperwork. 

BREED IDENTIFICATION:
Please understand that many rescue dogs are mixes of multiple breeds. Petfinder allows us to choose up to two breeds per dog. While the shelters and our rescue do our best in accurately identifying breeds, breed identification is not guaranteed. If there is a certain breed that you do not want, it is very important that you share this with our rescue when applying. When adopting a puppy, breed uncertainty plays a big part in the size/look of the dog as an adult. Please know that any puppy can be a wonderful dog, regardless of preconceived notions of certain breeds, but it is very important that the adopter has the dedication and patience to raise the puppy with boundaries, consistency, structure, & love. The more effort you give towards training & time you allow for exercise, your puppy will grow to be a HUGE source of UNCONDITIONAL LOVE, TOTAL LOYALTY, HAPPINESS, COMFORT & COMPANIONSHIP!

ABOUT OUR RESCUE:
We are a small rescue run by volunteers & focused on finding the right match for both our dogs & for you. If you are interested in adopting through our rescue, you first will need to complete an adoption application & be approved as a potential adopter before meeting any of our pups. No need to be intimidated by our application as it allows us to get to know you & your lifestyle. Of course, the more you can share the better! Please also note, while a fenced yard is fantastic, it is not required by our rescue, however, it may be required for a certain dog. Once adoption applicants are approved to become potential adopters, we offer private appointments where you can meet one or several dogs at the discretion of the rescue. We offer a unique & pleasant experience focused on finding the perfect match. It is extremely important to us that everyone is treated with respect & that NO ONE IS LEFT HANGING. WE WILL GET BACK TO YOU WITHIN 4 TO 5 DAYS of application submission. If there is a dog you are eager to meet, please email us before the 4-5 days! IF YOU DO NOT HEAR FROM US AT THAT POINT, PLEASE CALL US DIRECTLY at 203-241-2351 so that we can check the status of your application and move it forward immediately. We look forward to hearing from you and helping you find your new best friend!

HOME/RENTER INSURANCE:
SOME PROVIDERS HAVE VERY STRICT POLICIES REGARDING WHICH TYPE OF DOG BREEDS ARE ALLOWED UNDER THEIR COVERAGE. STATE FARM WAS SUGGESTED TO US AS THEY DO NOT PUNISH, DROP, NOR REFUSE YOU DUE TO DOG BREED SHOULD YOU RUN INTO ISSUES WITH YOUR CURRENT PROVIDER.

name: *Stormy* - AKA Big Guy
description:
Two year old, 100 lb. Stormy, is in need of a home! He is a great guy that will be a wonderful companion and friend! 

Stormy is WONDERFUL! He is generally peaceful and quiet. He is social, loves people, and is good with other dogs.

This guy is not only beautiful to look at, but he's funny too! Just watching him, will bring a smile to your face!

So good on the leash, his foster families' 11 year old daughter can walk him out in public, with no problem whatsoever!

Stormy ADORES hanging out outside, and watching the world go by. So, in order to safely have him relax outside for the amount of time that he would love, we are requiring his adopters to have a fully enclosed yard, with a physical fence, or at the very least, go to an adopter that like to spend A LOT of time outside!

***At this time, we are looking for an experienced handler for the Big Guy. Additionally, a home with no young children.

name: Milo
description: I was evcauated from Craven County in Hurricane Dorian. I am getting used to my new life at Lake Norman Humane and waiting for my forever family.

name: Molly
description:
Molly is a cute little Chihuahua looking for a new home. She is 8 years old in good health and weighs 9 lbs. She has been with her current owners since she was a puppy but because of health issues they are no longer able to care for her.  

Molly can be shy and fearful so an ideal home would be with a patient family.  She has lived with cats and dogs but would benefit from more experiences outside the home to build her confidence and help her enjoy our beautiful world.
When Molly does bond with her people she enjoys being with them and is definitely a lap dog!

Because Molly is low energy and doesnât need lots of exercise she would do well in a stand alone home, apartment or condo.
If you could give Molly a new lease on life she would love to meet you. Please call 860-242-9999 or e-mail annmarie@ourcompanions.org.



~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~All of the pets promoted by Our Companions Animal Rescue are located in CT.  As such we wish to adopt animals into homes in the greater CT area.  Pets are in various locations so we request that an appointment is made to meet with a specific pet we are advertising. Contact the person listed on the petâs profile to find out more about our adoption process for a specific pet or e-mail Helpline@ourcompanions.org for general inquiries.

name: Lucky
description:
Do you have a special place in your heart for senior dogs? Enjoy the happy feeling that comes with providing a dog security, comfort and love in his later years.  If you are that special person Lucky is waiting to meet you!

Lucky has lived with his family for many years but life happens and now they are no longer able to devote the time and attention he deserves. He is a 13 year old bichon/poodle mix. He has a little arthritis but mostly heâs in very good health!

Lucky is sweet, docile and smart. Heâs playful, loves the car, and rarely barks. He can be shy and nervous especially around new people but heâs social and wants to bond. He knows his basic commands and wants to be close to his people.  Heâs low energy and is happy with short walks.

If youâre interested in giving Lucky a forever home please call 860-242-9999 or e-mail annmarie@ourcompanions.org.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~All of the pets promoted by Our Companions Animal Rescue are located in CT.  As such we wish to adopt animals into homes in the greater CT area.  Pets are in various locations so we request that an appointment is made to meet with a specific pet we are advertising. Contact the person listed on the petâs profile to find out more about our adoption process for a specific pet or e-mail Helpline@ourcompanions.org for general inquiries.

name: Urgent Leo
description: URGENT â Laid back Leo is sending out word to all humans in need of a cuddle bug âI am seeking a forever loving home to live out my golden years and I WOULD LOVE TO BE YOUR CUDDLE BUG!â.  Would you like to meet Leo?  At no fault of his own, Leo has found himself with no where to go.  He has done nothing wrong, in fact he is amazing!  He is what we call an easy keeper and he needs a home, or foster home, fairly quickly.  If you are looking for a loving, gentle, sweet, senior boy to cuddle and tool around with, Leo is your boy.  In exchange, he will cherish everything you do, quietly watch over you, join you on your errands and chill out with you any chance he gets.  He is devoted and adores his humans and will follow their lead.  He loves to be pet as much as you are willing to pet him, he walks amazingly on a leash, has lived most of his life with other chill 4-legged friends, and he tested fine with cats during his travels.  Not much fazes Leo as he chooses to take most of the things around him in stride.  He is about 10 years old, weighs 60 lbs, current on all vaccinations, neutered and microchipped.  Do you want to meet this gentle soul and see for yourself how amazing he is?  He is located in CT.  Please send an email ASAP to RickyC68@aol.com for more information and please include your phone number so that we can contact you.

name: Sheba
description:
Sheba is a beautiful and gentle 70 lb. female flat coat retriever mix (6 yrs old) still looking for her ideal forever home. For the last 2 months Sheba has been living with a wonderful senior woman who has grown very attached to her but her size is just not the right fit to make this her permanent home. Sheba is a very shy and timid dog who will require an owner willing to accept that she likes to hang out under the coffee table or behind the couch and does things in her own time. Once you have gained her trust she will welcome affection and spend more time close to her person. She walks well on leash but does get anxious when she sees other people and dogs on her walks. Patience and training will be necessary as well as the strength and agility to hold on to her if she tries to pull away or reacts abruptly to something that may frighten her. We think Sheba was probably an outdoor dog. We are looking for a home that has a physical fence for her to be able to run and play and a quiet atmosphere. No toddlers or young kids but possibly older kids/teens who are not expecting a playmate. Sheba has not been overly interested in other dogs at her prior foster homes. She is a special soul who deserves a peaceful place to relax and provide companionship. Sheba is located in CT.





Please note: Little Black Dog Rescue is a FOSTER BASED rescue based in Fairfield County, Connecticut. We do NOT have a facility where you can come meet the dogs. We do adoption events every few months but primarily work one-on-one with each applicant to match the right dog to the right family. Once your application is received, all questions can be answered. We currently adopt to homes along the East Coast of the United States.  The adoption fee ranges from $250-$525 depending on age of the dog and transport distance/cost.

Please go to our website at www.littleblackdogrescue.org to see more information and to fill out our online application. Applications are required before conversations about potential matches can begin. Please check our website for up to date availability.

 We are a non profit organization and the adoption fee goes towards the transport, vetting, spay/neuter and boarding needs of the dogs we rescue. LBDR is a small rescue that receives a minor discount on vetting unlike larger rescues who self-administer or receive volume discounts. LBDR focuses on the rescue, care and placement of black dogs who are in danger of euthanasia due to their color, as well as other dogs who are in immediate need. LBDR is funded by donations which are used solely for the 
care of our dogs.

name: Roxi
description:
Smart, energetic, and friendly âthis is Roxi! This 2-year-old pitbull loves running in the play yards, playing fetch, and spending time with her people! She's currently attending our training classes with her favorite volunteer, and is learning so much! She would benefit greatly if her new owners continued her training. Sheâs looking for a home with experienced dog people who have time to give her lots of love, attention, and playtime, and one where she is the only pet. Roxi is crate-trained and about 50 lbs. To learn more, email Daryl@OurCompanions.org or call 860-242-9999 ext. 302.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
All of the pets promoted by Our Companions Animal Rescue are located in CT. As such we wish to adopt animals into homes in the greater CT area. Pets are in various locations so we request that an appointment is made to meet with a specific pet we are advertising. Contact the person listed on the petâs profile to find out more about our adoption process for a specific pet or e-mail Helpline@ourcompanions.org for general inquiries.

name: Nala
description:
Beautiful Nala originally came from Cuba, NM, as a stray.  This extremely sweet girl is very loving and affectionate.  She is a very friendly, very nice dog.  She is good with dogs.  She has gotten along very well with her fellow rescue dog buddy.  She likes to be active, go for walks/runs, but also enjoys mellow time.  She would like to be a lap dog and sometimes forgets her size!   She weighs around 55 lbs and is about 2-3 years old.  Nala is a very mindful, respectful girl.  She is housetrained. 

Contact Trish at 505-907-3791 or email pacatrish@yahoo.com

name: ONYA
description:
PLEASE call the shelter for more information (see number below) as the e-mail address at this site is not monitored closely by the shelter.

ONYA is a Great Pyrenees mix female dog.  She is also a large girl for a 9-month old dog, but that goes with her breed mix.  She weighed 87 lbs. at intake and is a lovely-to-look-at long-haired girl.  Her coloring is white/brown/black.  Maybe she likes Beethoven?!  You can see her now during normal business hours at the county animal shelter in their adoption facility.  Remember: that building is at the top left side once you go through the front gates of the shelter and reach the top of the driveway.

Adoption fees are $80 for dogs.  Cat adoption fees are $50.
The shelter routinely vaccinates all healthy appearing animals upon their arrival at the shelter and deworms them.  Any animals not already spayed/neutered must have the procedure done through the veterinary clinic that contracts with the county before that animal can be released from the clinic to the new family. By state law, animals old enough to be given a rabies vaccine, must have that vaccine done, as well.  The vaccine is given by the veterinary clinic staff at a separate cost to the adoptive family. 

Hold periods for every incoming animal vary for several reasons including, but not limited to, whether the animal came in from the Cumberland County area, or from the City of Crossville, which contracts with the county for its animal shelter services.  Check with the staff to verify the availability date of every animal for which you have an interest.

For more information on this pet, call the shelter at (931)484-8525. The shelter is open Monday, Tuesday, Thursday, Friday, and Saturday from 10am to 2pm. Closed Wednesday and Sunday and county observed holidays.

description:

Large and lovely is CANNOLI, a black female adult Lab mix dog.  She weighed 80 lbs, at intake and is a beautiful black color.  See this lady during the shelterâs normal business hours.  NOTE: like too many dogs that get adopted through the shelter, CANNOLI has been found to be heartworm positive.  That means her previous adoption could not go and she cannot be adopted to the public until she is treated - which has to take place before she can be spayed.  This will take time.  Talk with shelter staff about the length of time treatment will require before she can move forward in the adoption process.  She is located in their adoption facility at the top and left of the driveway after you pass through the gates. The boy in the photos with her is Charlie, an older male Lab with whom she is housed.

name: MORGAN FREEMAN (Neutered, ready to go!)
description:
PLEASE call the shelter for more information (see number below) as the e-mail address at this site is not monitored closely by the shelter.

MORGAN FREEMAN is a newly neutered, 2-3 year-old male Blue Heeler mix dog.  He is blue/white/black and weighed 40 lbs. at intake.  Staff says he is sweet himself, but a little bossy with other dogs. He might get along better with a female dog if you have one at home.  At the shelter he was initially housed with a submissive male dog and he picked on that one.  Thanks to H.A.R.T., a local rescue group, MORGAN FREEMAN was sponsored through his neuter surgery and rabies vaccine.  He is ready to go home immediately upon adoption.  The neuter surgery itself may result in a more relaxed dog when he is around other animals, as well!  Something to think about if you have other animals at home that still have not been spayed/neutered.

Adoption fees are $80 for dogs.  Cat adoption fees are $50.

PLEASE call the shelter for more information (see number below) as the e-mail address at this site is not monitored closely by the shelter.

MAMA FRATELLI is a 4-year-old Bulldog mix female dog.  This lady has the ability to pose beautifully while showing off her brown, fawn and white markings to advantage.  She was 38 lbs. slender at intake and looks fit to run and play as soon as she can find a person or family with whom she can enjoy the summer.  If you are bored and facing the summer alone, she would make a great companion for walks, playing in the water, curling up for a nap or just making faces at each other.  Think of the fun you could have with each other and then head out to see her at the shelter adoption facility during normal business hours.  She still needs to be spayed before she can go home with you, but she is worth the wait.

Adoption fees are $80 for dogs.  Cat adoption fees are $50.
The shelter routinely vaccinates all healthy appearing animals upon their arrival at the shelter and deworms them.  Any animals not already spayed/neutered must have the procedure done through the veterinary clinic that contracts with the county before that animal can be released from the clinic to the new family. By state law, animals old enough to be given a rabies vaccine, must have that vaccine done, as well.  The vaccine is given by the veterinary clinic staff at a separate cost to the adoptive family. 

Hold periods for every incoming animal vary for several reasons including, but not limited to, whether the animal came in from the Cumberland County area, or from the City of Crossville, which contracts with the county for its animal shelter services.  Check with the staff to verify the availability date of every animal for which you have an interest.

For more information on this pet, call the shelter at (931)484-8525. The shelter is open Monday, Tuesday, Thursday, Friday, and Saturday from 10am to 2pm. Closed Wednesday and Sunday and county observed holidays.

name: Bolt
description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Bolt is a street rescue from Custer County area. She is very playful and should make a great family pet.SPECIAL NEEDS: Very Secure tall fence. She can go over lower fences and she can lift handles on a gate.MicrochippedAdoption Fee: $150

name: Rosie (fka Jenny)
description:
Name: Rosie (fka Jenny)
Suspected Breed: Pit Bull Terrier Mix
Approximate Age: 3 years old
Approximate Weight: 43 lbs
Personality: calm, affectionate, very sweet	
Observations with Dogs: good
Observations with Cats: good
Observations with Kids: not yet tested
Currently Living at: DC area foster home

Meet Rosie! She's the most chill pup you will meet! She is calm, affectionate, and loves to snuggle. This girl is the sweetest and she is so grateful to be in a rescue searching for her forever home. 

Rosie is one of the few \"bully\" mixes in the Prince George's County Shelter to leave alive. This is due to a ban on bully breeds in the county that prevents adoption of these dogs to the general public. The only bully dogs that leave the shelter alive are released to approved rescues.

The shelter has a group of dedicated staff and volunteers who evaluate and work with these dogs to identify the most highly adoptable ones and pitch them to DC rescues, pleading for their help in saving them. This group lobbied hard for Rosie to be rescued, and DC PAWS is fortunate to have had a willing foster who allowed us to rescue this very deserving gal.

Upon meeting Rosie, it was very clear why she was a staff favorite. She is so gentle and lovely. She gets along well with other dogs and even cats! She is a total couch potato and would make a great fit for an adopter who loves to binge watch Netflix. She would love a calm home where she can be spoiled!

Like most shelter dogs, Rosie may need a refresher on housetraining and crate training. We ask all of DC PAWS fosters to work on both house and crate training with their foster dog.

The adoption fee for this dog is $350. If you are interested in adopting Rosie, please submit an adoption application at https://dcpawsrescue.org/adoption-info/adoption-application-dogs/DC PAWS Rescue does our best to provide accurate and complete information about our adoptable animals. Please note that we cannot make any guarantees about age or breed; we rely upon our rescue partners and their veterinarians to make those assessments. We also cannot make any guarantees about housebreaking and animal temperament, as animals can behave differently through transition and in different environments.

Our shelter partners provide a basic vet screening for each animal we rescue, which includes necessary vaccinations, deworming, microchipping, and spay/neuter (unless the animal is too young or otherwise deemed by the vet to not be a good candidate for surgery). Please note that this is not a comprehensive medical exam and as such, may not identify any and all medical issues, though our goal is to flag any obvious health issues through the basic vet screening. We share all medical records with adopters and flag any known issues prior to adoption finalization. 

About DC PAWS Rescue

Our rescue is an all-volunteer, foster-based dog and cat rescue in the DC area. We rescue from rural shelters in the south, as well as local DC area shelters, such as Prince Georges County, MD and BARCS in MD.
BE A FOSTER:

Fosters make it possible for DC PAWS to save and care for homeless, neglected and abandoned animals! To learn about fostering dogs or cats for DC PAWS Rescue, please visit: http://dcpawsrescue.org/volunteer/fostering/foster-application

BE A SPONSOR:

For any of our animals! Sponsors help us provide critical medical care, food, boarding and other support for animals facing euthanasia. Individuals who sponsor a dog or cat receive special recognition on the animal's profile. Sponsorships can also be made in honor or memory of a loved one, and you may designate to whom DC Paws Rescue should provide notice of your gift. 

To learn more about sponsorship, please visit: http://dcpawsrescue.org/donate/

name: Betty (fka Chili/Totoro)
description:
Name: Betty (fka Chili/Totoro)
Breed: Lab mix
Approximate Age: 1.5 years old
Approximate Weight: 20 lbs
Personality: People friendly, but sensitive around men
Observations with Dogs: slightly reactive - will need training 
Observations with Cats: unknown
Observations with Kids: cannot be placed in home with kids under 18
Currently Living at: DC area foster home

Meet Betty! Betty is a sweetheart in need of a loving home. Betty has a lot of great attributes - she loves to play, seeks out affection and attention, and is a quick learner. Betty is also very sensitive and has shown a hesitancy towards men. She is also slightly reactive towards dogs while on a leash. Betty will need a very patient, experienced dog owner to help her come out of her shell and become the best dog she can be. She will do best in a low traffic, calm home. She would also benefit from working with a behavioral consultant to help manage her fear of men and to feel more comfortable on a leash. Betty is the kind of dog that needs love and compassion and is the reason why rescues exist. If you feel you can give her a chance, please apply to adopt her!

The adoption fee for this dog is $350. If you are interested in adopting Betty, please submit an adoption application at http://dcpawsrescue.org/adoption-info/adoption-application-dogsDC PAWS Rescue does our best to provide accurate and complete information about our adoptable animals. name: Elise
description:
Name: Elise
Breed: Lab/Shepard mix
Approximate Age: 3 years 
Approximate Weight: 40-45 lbs (skinny)
Personality: energetic and playful
Observations with Dogs: good
Observations with Cats: too playful
Observations with Kids: good
Currently Living at: DC area foster home

This sweetie is a great family dog as she is good with younger children, as well as other dogs. She is energetic and very playful... so playful that she's a bit too much for cats so she shouldn't be in a home with one. She loves her humans, too.

She has A LOT of energy and would be great for an active foster who can take her on runs, trips to the dog park, or play in a yard. If you're a less than active person, she will settle for day care or even better, she will get you on track with a fitness regimen (it's amazing how much less it feels like exercise when you have a loving dog by your side).

Her foster mom raves about how well-mannered she is! She's good on walks, in the crate, and has yet to have a potty accident (2 days into fostering). Add in her good looks, and she is quite the catch!

The adoption fee for this dog is $350. If you are interested in adopting Elise, please submit an adoption application at https://dcpawsrescue.org/adoption-info/adoption-application-dogs/DC PAWS Rescue does our best to provide accurate and complete information about our adoptable animals. name: Bea
description:
Name: Bea
Breed: Hound mix
Approximate Age: 3-5 years old, but acts closer to 1-2 years old 
Approximate Weight: 50 lbs
Personality: very affectionate and sweet		
Observations with Dogs: good
Observations with Cats: good
Observations with Kids: not yet tested
Currently Living at: DC area foster home

Bea's photos don't do her justice! She's a majestic and gentle hound mix, with the most adorable freckling. She can be a little timid and tentative at first, but once she sees your a friend, she opens right up and craves some attention. She is becoming more and more outgoing and social every day. 

Bea is good with both cats and dogs, and is just eager to please, making her a great candidate for training! She has a lot of energy and would do well with an active adopter who can run with her or take her to the dog park or day care. She does play by herself very well and keeps herself entertained if you have a securely fenced in yard. 

She is a new arrival, so we're still getting to know her. We will update her bio as we learn more about her.

Like most shelter dogs, Bea may need a refresher on housetraining and crate training. We ask all of DC PAWS fosters to work on both house and crate training with their foster dog.

If you are interested in adopting Bea please submit an adoption application at http://dcpawsrescue.org/adoption-application/. dDC PAWS Rescue does our best to provide accurate and complete information about our adoptable animals. name: Muppet Max
description:
Name: Muppet Max
Breed: Chug - Chi and Pug mix
Approximate Age: 8-10 years young
Approximate Weight: 20 lbs and losing weight
Personality: very friendly and sweet
Observations with Dogs: good
Observations with Cats: Good
Observations with Kids: Good with Gentle children
Currently Living at: Local foster

Muppet Max makes Oprah a verb. Now that he is living in a foster home he is living his best life everyday. You have never met a dog who loves life more than this little man. This crazy looking guy is about 8-10 years old and 20 lbs. He is very friendly and good with other pups. He goes to the dog park every day and with his weight loss gets more engaged with the other pups all the time. He loves to pay ref when his big foster sister wrestles. Max would be a great first dog for someone in an apartment. He is quiet, clean and loves to snuggle. He is easy going with dogs and cats and has approached kids with enthusiasm. Max is great on a leash and is very gentle when walking. He would be an excellent choice for a Senior who wants a companion or a someone younger who would prefer walks instead of runs.

Like most shelter dogs, Max may need a refresher on housetraining and crate training. We ask all of DC PAWS fosters to work on both house and crate training with their foster dog.

The adoption fee for this dog is $200. If you are interested in adopting Max, please submit an adoption application at https://dcpawsrescue.org/adoption-info/adoption-application-dogs/DC PAWS Rescue does our best to provide accurate and complete information about our adoptable animals. name: Roscoe
description:
Name: Roscoe
Breed: Domestic Basset Hound/ Beagle mix
Approximate Age:4 years 
Approximate Weight: 46 lbs
Personality: very friendly
Observations with Dogs:good
Observations with Cats: doesn't try to harm them, but he is too curious to coexist peacefully with them
Observations with Kids: good
Currently Living at: DC area foster home

This adorable little guy is quite the character! He is playful and seems to get along with most pups. He has also been tested with children and did very well. His cat test was less successful; while we don't think he intended to harm the test kitty, he was a little too interested and excited by her, so we think he needs a home without cats.

Aside from his good looks, Roscoe seems to be a happy and social boy who adores affection. He was sadly surrendered to the shelter because his family could no longer afford to have a dog, and they really wanted what was best for the little guy. They said he was a purebred Basset from a breeder, but did not have papers. To us, he looks more like a Basset/Beagle mix. Whatever he is, he is so darn cute.

The adoption fee for this dog is $350. If you are interested in adopting Roscoe, please submit an adoption application at https://dcpawsrescue.org/adoption-info/adoption-application-dogs/DC PAWS Rescue does our best to provide accurate and complete information about our adoptable animals. name: Dusty Springfield
description:
Name: Dusty Springfield
Breed: Lab/Shep
Approximate Age: 1.5
Approximate Weight: 45lbs
Personality: very friendly and happy
Observations with Dogs: good
Observations with Cats: unknown
Observations with Kids: Good with children
Currently Living at: Local foster

Dusty is a year and a half old lab/shep mix who loves walks, runs and WATER. We can confirm that Dusty enjoys water! She hopped around in the shallows like Tigger - it is hilarious! If you are looking for a great companion for adventures or just fetch, she is your girl. Walks have been good so far too, although she leaps at birds when she sees them, but she is working on this and with a little bit of patience, she will be awesome on leash. Dusty is busy learning commands and she's had great playdates with her fosters family's dogs too! This sweet summer girl is looking forward to having her own family and cant wait to be your beach baby. If you are looking for a fun time, Dusty is the dog for you.

Like most shelter dogs, Dusty may need a refresher on housetraining and crate training. We ask all of DC PAWS fosters to work on both house and crate training with their foster dog.

The adoption fee for this dog is $350.
