name: Carmen
description:
Name: Carmen
Suspected Breed: Carolina Dog/Chihuahua Mix
Approximate Age: 2 years old
Approximate Weight: 25 lbs 
Personality: timid, but affectionate once you earn her trust	
Observations with Dogs: good
Observations with Cats: good
Observations with Kids: not yet tested with young children
Currently Living at: DC area foster home
NEW ARRIVAL!!! NEW ARRIVAL!!! NEW ARRIVAL!!! NEW ARRIVAL!!! NEW ARRIVAL!!! NEW ARRIVAL!!!
 
This little lady is mom to a litter of beautiful blue eyed pups who will soon be available for adoption. Her babies are newly weaned and she has been a great mom, but now she needs to focus on finding a forever home! She is sweet as can be and perfectly sized.

Her life clearly hasn't been easy. In addition to being pregnant and landing in a high-kill shelter, she was heartworm positive and had to undergo painful heartworm treatment after her pups were completely weaned. Heartworm is a completely preventable disease, but she lacked the care and preventative medication needed. She was treated in early August and is on the road to recovery. She does have an activity restriction for another few weeks, but she is a calm girl and has been the best patient.

She is shy at first, but warms to her humans with some time, especially if you show her affection. She would do best with a patient adopter in a calm home, where she can have the space to come out of her shell. She is worth it, trust us! Because she is so shy with humans, she would be happiest in a home with another dog to help build her confidence. She needs a bit of stable living to learn that not all humans mean to bring her harm or neglect. She is good with other dogs and cats. 

Like most shelter dogs, Carmen may need a refresher on housetraining and crate training. We ask all of DC PAWS fosters to work on both house and crate training with their foster dog.

The adoption fee for this dog is $350. If you are interested in adopting Carmen, please submit an adoption application at https://dcpawsrescue.org/adoption-info/adoption-application-dogs/DC PAWS Rescue does our best to provide accurate and complete information about our adoptable animals. name: Bella
description:
Name: Bella
Suspected Breed: Lab/Pointer Mix
Approximate Age: 1 year old 
Approximate Weight: 61 lbs
Observations with Dogs: Good with proper introduction
Observations with Cats: she should not live in a home with cats
Observations with Kids: Good with older children 
Currently Living at: DC area Foster home

This beautiful gal is affectionate, loyal, and loving. Bella is basically an oversized lap dog at home, and loves being close to her humans. She has come a long way since we rescued her. Initially fearful and dog-reactive, this girl attended training classes with her amazing foster and has learned how to be polite and confident, all with just some positive reinforcement and consistency. She's smart and eager to please, which makes her highly trainable.


From her foster: Meet Bella! She is a beautiful, loyal girl that loves to run and is just a bundle of energy. She wants to please her \"people\" and has done really well with training as she is extremely food motivated. Although she has energy, she can be gentle when need be with the proper commands, but overall would make a great companion for an equally energetic family! She tends to get overwhelmed in large social gatherings (such as adoption events) and it is recommended for potential adopters to meet her in her foster environment, where she is comfortable and happy and can best show her true colors.

Bella will need an adopter who is committed to giving her lots of exercise, as well as continuing with her training. We recommend another training class for her with her adopter since it is about training the human as much as it is about training the dog! A class also has the benefit of building a closer bond between dog and human. We want to ensure her forever family continues to reinforce the positive behaviors so she can remain a confident and well-adjusted pup.

This gal has been overlooked for so long because of her reactivity towards other dogs, and she wonders if anyone will give the \"new Bella\" a real chance at a loving forever home. She has worked hard for it, and she deserves nothing less.

Her foster reports that she is crate trained and has not had any accidents in the home. 

Like most shelter dogs, Bella may need a refresher on house training and crate training. We ask all of DC PAWS fosters to work on both house and crate training with their foster dog. 

The adoption fee for this dog is $350. If you are interested in adopting Bella, please submit an adoption application at http://dcpawsrescue.org/adoption-info/.DC PAWS Rescue does our best to provide accurate and complete information about our adoptable animals. Please note that we cannot make any guarantees about age or breed; we rely upon our rescue partners and their veterinarians to make those assessments. We also cannot make any guarantees about housebreaking and animal temperament, as animals can behave differently through transition and in different environments.

Our shelter partners provide a basic vet screening for each animal we rescue, which includes necessary vaccinations, deworming, microchipping, and spay/neuter (unless the animal is too young or otherwise deemed by the vet to not be a good candidate for surgery). Please note that this is not a comprehensive medical exam and as such, may not identify any and all medical issues, though our goal is to flag any obvious health issues through the basic vet screening. We share all medical records with adopters and flag any known issues prior to adoption finalization. 

About DC PAWS Rescue

Our rescue is an all-volunteer, foster-based dog and cat rescue in the DC area. We rescue from rural shelters in the south, as well as local DC area shelters, such as Prince Georges County, MD and BARCS in MD.
BE A FOSTER:

Fosters make it possible for DC PAWS to save and care for homeless, neglected and abandoned animals! To learn about fostering dogs or cats for DC PAWS Rescue, please visit: http://dcpawsrescue.org/volunteer/fostering/foster-application

BE A SPONSOR:

For any of our animals! Sponsors help us provide critical medical care, food, boarding and other support for animals facing euthanasia. Individuals who sponsor a dog or cat receive special recognition on the animal's profile. Sponsorships can also be made in honor or memory of a loved one, and you may designate to whom DC Paws Rescue should provide notice of your gift. 

To learn more about sponsorship, please visit: http://dcpawsrescue.org/donate/

name: Del
description:
Name: Del
Suspected Breed: Lab mix
Approximate Age: 9-10 years old and fabulous
Approximate Weight: 36 lbs
Personality: calm, sweet, and loves everyone	
Observations with Dogs: has done well with other dogs
Observations with Cats: has done well with cats
Observations with Kids: not yet tested with young children, but loves people
Currently Living at: DC area foster home

Foster reports Del is very friendly and great with other dogs and people, and also very affectionate! Just watch some clips of her and her!

When the shelter asked us to save this sweet senior, how could we say no? Just look at her adorable frosted face? How does a dog like this end up in the shelter, we wonder? How can the family she has been loyal to discard her because she is no longer young and playful? We see this all too often and it is heartbreaking. This dog deserves better and we will make sure she gets it.

Del clearly wasn't afforded many comforts in her previous life. She didn't know what the TV was in her new foster home, and stairs are also new to her. Good thing she is a fast learner and she is acclimating. She still prefers the safety of her crate, but is opening up more and more each day. As we learn more about her, we will update her biography.

Will you be her hero in her twilight years and show her the life of comfort and love she has always deserved? While she is calm and lower energy, this girl still has spunk and lots of life left in her. If you are also low key and don't mind slow walks around the block, Del is your gal!

Like most shelter dogs, Del may need a refresher on housetraining and crate training. We ask all of DC PAWS fosters to work on both house and crate training with their foster dog.

The adoption fee for this dog is $200 since she is a senior. If you are interested in adopting Del, please submit an adoption application at https://dcpawsrescue.org/adoption-info/adoption-application-dogs/DC PAWS Rescue does our best to provide accurate and complete information about our adoptable animals. name: Truman
description:
My name is Truman. I am available for adoption through Colorado Canine Rescue (CCR), a nonprofit dog rescue located in the Denver area. I came to CCR from a owner relinquishment in Denver. CCR believes that I might be a Boxer/German Wirehair breed mix (just a guess by shelter and vet personnel) and I am approximately 7-8 years old. My foster parents tell me I have a kooky personality, maybe it has something to do with my mohawk and big underbite. I am a sweet boy with people, although I have not been around a lot of kids. Since I am starting to enjoy my senior years, I prefer not to share my humans and would need to be the only dog in the house. I do well with cats, I don't even notice they're around until there rubbing against me. I am crate trained and walk well on a leash. I am also trained to use the dog door in my foster's house and will need to go to a home with a yard. I love to go for car rides and hang out with my people. I like to go into the hardware stores because the workers give me treats! I do like to chase the squirrels on the fence (but I think that they are there for my enjoyment because they tease me). In the house I love to stare out the door or windows at the wildlife (squirrels, birds, bunnies, deer), but I don't like those pesky raccoons, don't worry I will keep the yard safe from them. I have been known to be a barker and know what a bark collar is. I sleep on a big comfy dog bed next to yours at night and will only get on the bed if you tell me it is ok. I take treats extra gentle and love fruits and vegetables. I love to chew on dog bones, and play with some toys. I like to go for walks and hikes, I like to play in the water and have been fishing in the mountains. I have been on a boat and love to have the wind just blow through my hair.
Truman will do best with an experienced dog owner/handler. If you are interested in adopting Truman, please submit an adoption application located on our website, coloradocaninerescue.org. We are asking for a $200 adoption donation. He is neutered, housebroken, up to date on vaccinations, and microchipped. Please note, CCR cannot guarantee the breed composition or ages of our dogs as we usually have no history prior to them entering the shelter. In addition, most dogs listed as potty trained will experience an adjustment period as they learn the routines in their new home.

name: Kirie
description:
My name is Kirie. I am available for adoption through Colorado Canine Rescue (CCR), a nonprofit dog rescue located in the Denver area. I came to CCR from Canon City Colorado. There is very little history on me. CCR has been told I am a pit bull breed mix, but that is just a guess made by shelter staff, rescue volunteers, and our veterinarians.

It is said when life gives you lemons, make lemonade. Well Kirie has had quite a few lemons handed to her in her 4 year life span, but definitely making the best lemonade that she can. Kirie was adopted out from CCR as a young dog but two years later wound up in the Aurora Shelter, having been abandoned. They called us so we could take her back into our rescue. Kirie has had TPLO surgery since being returned to us, going through training with a behaviorist, and a foster has worked diligently to get her past her pulling on the leash, and help her master her needs to attack water spouts and sprinkler heads.
Kirie still has separation issues, but does well in the foster home left with other dogs and free reign within the home. She is on a generic Prozac to help her manage with anxiety. Kirie loves to snuggle with her people on the couch and in bed and absolutely loves to give kisses. She is looking for a family that will give her plenty of attention, be home more than not, play fetch, take her on walks in the neighborhood. She adores children and is very gentle with them. Kirie so looks forward to rides in the car. She would enjoy being an only dog, but would do fine with a furry companion that has a laissez-faire attitude. She does best if the door is open or a doggie door for her to go out as needed. She needs a more experienced dog owner because she has been through so much in life.

If you are interested in adopting Kirie, please submit an adoption application located on our website, www.coloradocaninerescue.org. We are asking for a $200 adoption donation for Kirie. Kirie being a bully breed, will only be placed in communities that do not have a ban on bullies. Please note, CCR cannot guarantee the breed composition or ages of our dogs as we usually have no history prior to them entering the shelter. 9/15/19 5:01 PM

name: Oatmeal
description:
Meet Oatmeal! Oatmeal is believed to be a shih tzu mix, possibly with griffon, and around 5 years old.

Oatmeal has come to us from Detroit, where she went unclaimed as a stray. She does have a cherry eye that will be repaired along with her spay. We do not know her history, but she came to us with an old injury that took much of one of her ears.

Oatmeal is very sweet with people, but doesn't always care for other dogs and would likely be happiest being a spoiled only. She enjoys spending time outside and going for walks, and would appreciate a moderately active adopter. 

Oatmeal's adoption fee is $150. This includes all vetting including spay, vaccinations, deworming, and microchip. 

Our adoption application can be found at http://humanesocietybaycounty.org/adopt/ or email us for more information! If you send us an inquiry through Petfinder, PLEASE include your email address or a phone number, or we will not be able to respond to your message

name: Munchkin
description:
PLEASE READ ENTIRE DESCRIPTION

Age: 7 yrs old approx

Size (full grown): 8lbs

Breed: Chihuahua mix

Sex: Male

Good with kids: Older children only

Good with Cats: Yes

Good with dogs: Yes

Information: Munchkin was trapped from running the streets in Detroit. He is scared at first but warms up with treats and good food. He will not jump up on things you will need to pick him up to get him on the bed or furniture. He loves attention but is scared when you move too quickly.

Adoption Fee: $250

We are a foster based rescue based out of Muskegon, MI. We have an application process for adopting our pets. We have an application on our website www.caninesrescue.com. PLEASE DO NOT EMAIL US WITH YOUR APPLICATION INFORMATION. WE REQUIRE YOU FILL OUT THE FORM.

We check vet references, backgrounds for abuse or neglect and home ownership or speak to the landlord to verify you are allowed to have a pet. Once the application is received and approved then we will set up a time for you to come and meet our pups that are available. All our dogs are up to date on shots, microchipped, been dewormed at least once, and sterilized. All meet and greets are APPOINTMENT ONLY. We do not have a facility that the public can come and view our pets at.

name: Peyton
description:
Meet Peyton! Peyton is a female boxer, and is believed to be around 8 years old.

Peyton has come to us from Detroit animal control, where she had been turned in as a stray. She is underweight, and has a few masses that we will be removing once she puts on a few pounds. She came to us very shy and depressed, but is warming up nicely in her foster home. She is housebroken, and cohabitating with other dogs in foster, but takes VERY slow introductions - she would likely be happiest as a spoiled only.girl for her senior years. She does have some arthritic issues in her back end, but still does stairs well and is on some joint supplements. We believe she would do best in a home with older (teenaged) or no kids, and either as an only dog or with another older, respectful dog. 

Peyton's adoption fee is $100. This includes all vetting including spay, vaccinations, deworming, and microchip.

Our adoption application can be found at http://humanesocietybaycounty.org/adopt/ or email us for more information! If you send us an inquiry through Petfinder, PLEASE include your email address or a phone number, or we will not be able to respond to your message

name: Lucas
description: I was rescued from Dixon. I am sweet. Primary Color: Black Secondary Color: White Weight: 49.8lbs Age: 1yrs 3mths 3wks Animal has been Neutered

name: Bumpkin
description:
Bumpkin is one of the newer black doggies available for adoption! Bumpkin was pulled from Dorchester County. He was with them for well over one year before arriving to Eunoia. 

We don't know too much about his history before the shelter life, but we do know that Bumpkin has been staying with our friends at K9 Good Manners for a while now. Even though he loves them, he is really hoping for a forever family. 
He's been doing a great job learning how to be a good boy at K9 Good Manners and we want to give him the reward of a lifetime! Bumpkin would be best in an environment where he is the only animal. He loves humans and just wants to have the opportunity to be a dog. If you think you'd be interested in adopting Bumpkin, please let us know. Remember, his adoption fee is only $100! Bumpkin is heartworm negative, up to date on vaccines, microchipped, neutered AND COMPLETELY TRAINED! 
Bumpkin's adopter will also receive a complimentary informational training session with K9 Dog Manners and Bumpkin. What are you waiting for?! Let's find this guy a home!

name: XP Mace - Dover, NJ
description:
Mace is NOT with Eleventh Hour Rescue but we are posting the dog on our web site to help his caretaker find a new home for him. If you are interested in meeting Mace, please call or text 973-223-0625.

Mace is an 8-year-old Mastiff whose owner can no longer care for him. He is up to date on his vaccines & he's currently located in Dover, NJ.

name: Gus
description:
Gus is a sweet hound looking for his forever home! We were told he is 10years old however, he acts younger! Gus loves going on hikes with his foster family, has gone to the beach and played in the water and loves to play with other dogs.

The foster family does not have children. However, we believe Gus would do just fine around children, he has a great personality. He would also love a fenced yard to lounge in and also play ball! 

Gus is located in Dunkirk, MD. If interested in meeting Gus please complete an application at thehumanewayanimalrescue.org

name: Ginger
description: Ginger  is all dressed up, waiting and hoping for a family to come visit her, fall in love and make her their new family member. Ginger is approximately 10 years old, good with other dogs, older kids, no cats, spayed, up to date on her shots, located in Dunnellon, Florida. For more info contact  call/text 863-272-4666

name: Molly
description:
Molly 
Sex: Female
Age: 4 years old
Coat: Red and white
Weight: 55 lbs and dropping
Activity Level: Active Pet

Molly is a beautiful red and white medium coated purebred border collie. She is incredibly sweet and really attaches herself to her person. She is biddable, thoughtful, and intelligent. She loves to play frisbee and fetch! She walks nicely on a leash, has excellent greeting manners, great recall, knows a bunch of tricks, housebroken, and crate trained, although doesnât need to be crated during the day as she is very well trained. She would be an awesome dog for the âweekend warriorâ because she can be calm during the week when you work and only have time for a walk and short fetch session but also be ready to hike and play all weekend long. 

Molly would prefer to be in a home with no other dogs and no small children. She is good with cats. 

Molly is located in Durham.  For more information, reach out to her foster mom, Mia, at mia.gulan241@gmail.com.  She will not be available until the end of October.

name: Drake
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Online Adoption Application 
Fluff and CuddlesDrake is a stunning, super-sweet boy from an animal cruelty case in Eastern North Carolina. His rehabilitation has shown the true miracle of rescue. For months, Drake wouldn't leave the bathroom. He would be scared and shy -- and yet wanted affection.. would give you little licks on the hand. Given lots of time and love, Drake has done a total 180 and while still skittish, he runs around the house with his foster siblings, pounces on beds and couches, and plays joyously with toys. He has even started to vocalize when left alone-- he likes to have friends.

Potty training / leash training is still an issue. As of now, Drake is used to going on pee pads and while his aim is great, he does need to learn the yard.

Might you have the right home for this stunning, sensitive boy?

name: Benji
description: BOW WOW! My name is Benji and I would like to be your friend! I am a lovebug from Edison, NJ who is ready to make my way into your heart. Overall, I am a silly, happy boy who would do well in a home with adults only. They call me a ladies man as I do very well with female dogs. COME MEET ME AT ST.HUBERT'S ANIMAL WELFARE CENTER AT 575 WOODLAND AVE IN MADISON, NJ. CALL (973) 377-2295 FOR MORE INFORMATION. Primary Color: Grey Secondary Color: White Weight: 70lbs Age: 5yrs 1mths 2wks Animal has been Neutered

name: Glory
description:
Glory came to us from the Edmond, OK animal shelter in horrible condition (as you can see from one of the photos). She had very little coat and her skin was deeply infected. She did not have mange, just horrible flea dermatitis and a yeast infection. So after taking many rounds of mediation and having many medicated baths (that she did not enjoy, but was such a good girl!), we are happy to report that Glory has recovered and has grown a thick, healthy coat now.  

This sweet girl has likely never know a comfy life, but she is thriving in her foster home. She is house trained, will crate just fine (though we think she could be trusted loose in the house), gets along well with other dogs, loves to snuggle, and is so sweet and grateful.

We want to find Glory the loving home she's never had before. She is calm and would be great for retirees or for anyone who just wants a chill dog. Leisurely walks would be great...a back patio where she could relax with you would be fine and dandy too. She is low-maintenance and content. 

Glory does not require any further medication. Her skin is recovering well and she's now happy and healthy. It's a bit hard to tell how old she is because she was neglected so severely for so long, but we guess she's in the middle somewhere--maybe 7ish? A lovely age with a lot of great years ahead.

Will you be Glory's person? Will you give her life the happily-ever-after she deserves? Please complete the online application in the \"more about us\" section. Placements considered within 300 miles of Tulsa, OK.

name: Leroy
description:
LEROY, above all the other animals in our care, embodies the spirit of CompAnimals Pet Rescue and the level of commitment we give to our animals for their entire lives. Here is his story:

About 10 years ago I got a call from a senior citizen who was trying to catch a stray pit bull in her neighborhood in Elkton. The dog would follow children around but eluded adults. She was worried the SPCA would pick him up and euthanize him. The Cecil Co SPCA had a \"no pit bulls\" policy at the time. So for 3 weeks I tried to catch him, make friends with him, bribe him and for 3 weeks the SPCA was bent on catching him as well. Luckily, with the help of a butcher (who lived in the same neighborhood and had been giving him fresh beef) I was able to capture him. He was super friendly and hopped right in my car. We had him vetted and aside from a hairless patch on the top of his head he recovered from his ordeal pretty quickly.

I fostered him myself. He had a distinct hate of cats and for that reason I wasn't able to keep him permanently. He did get along with other dogs and was a well mannered guest. It was probably a year or so before he found his \"forever\" home. Leroy seemed to have lucked out - he had a boy of his own and a big grassy yard. We didn't hear much from him after the initial settling in. There were other dogs to rescue and Leroy was starting his new life.

Fast forward about 4 years - tragedy struck and Leroy's family fell apart. His mom was sick, the house was in foreclosure, Leroy was living in an empty house. We got a call that the family could no longer care for him. Leroy came back.

Due to the family's lack of finances and the stress of it all, Leroy was in horrible shape. His skin condition which, looking back through vet records, had never been fully addressed. He was bald, scabby, bloody and thin. His head was sunken in. His hair loss was so great that you couldn't even distinguish what color he was. He wagged his tail.

Antibiotics and prednisone kicked back the skin a notch but again it never fully recovered. He developed demodex, a type of mange, due to the pred suppressing his immune system. We sent him to a foster home hoping to boost his spirits and give him more 1-on-1 care. Another vet was added to his repertoire. More antibiotics, supplements, shampoos but still his skin was slow to recover. Some prickly hair poked through but not as much as we had hoped for. He developed a sore on his ear and one on his toe which was so painful he didn't want to walk. A culture was done and revealed not one, but 3, drug resistant bacteria. One was resistant to ALL antibiotics. The drugs that we had been giving him were slowly killing him.

Fast forward to a year ago, stopped all Western medicine and enlisted the help of Always Helpful Veterinary Services & Dr Judith Shoemaker. The first visit was hours long as she worked up a plan and refining of supplements, powders and remedies. I noticed her lack of concern at the \"flesh eating bacteria\" - a condition so bad that one vet wanted to amputate part of his ear and toe and another felt it was hopeless and he should be euthanized. She was most concerned with his painful eyes. He has a condition called entropean where the eyelids roll in and the lashes rub against the eye.

Leroy responded quickly under the watchful eye of Dr. Shoemaker. His coat came in glossy and now covers about 2/3 of his body. His skin still has flare ups but not more drug resistant bacteria. He was tested for food allergies and put on an appropriate diet. To someone meeting Leroy today, for the first time, he looks like a wreck - like he was just rescued. But to those of us who have seen him in the road to recovery, he looks beautiful.

Leroy has a pan pal who has him out every week for his medicated bath and some R&R. This same wonderful pen pal is covering most of his medical expenses (thankfully Always Helpful has a monthly payment plan!). She has offered to continue with his support even after he is adopted.

Leroy is now pushing 10 years of age. We would love for him to find his special home but if not, he is welcome to live his life out with us. Somewhere along the line he decided he didn't want to get along with other dogs - his Dr thinks it is because he felt so crappy. He has never lost his love of people - especially children. Leroy adores kids! He is currently getting a break from shelter life and is in a \"vacation\" foster home for a few weeks. Check out the video his foster mom made for him.

If you can be Leroy's guardian angel please fill out an application at www.companimals.org

name: Sparky
description:
Sparky is looking for a foster home (would be perfect if that foster home might be looking for a dog to adopt as well). Sparky is one year old hound mix, possibly with some cattle dog mixed in, 50 pounds, an active boy (a fenced yard would be most ideal), loves playing with his 50 pound active foster brother (but no small dogs, so probably no cats either). Also a big snuggler, Looking for a dog savvy foster home who can help work on some manners (pulling on leash, jumping etc) so no kids under 12 either. We are located in Ellicott City, Md, trying to set up this lovebug for success. We supply everything you might need to foster. If you think you can help us with Sparky, we would love to speak to you. 443-750-2833 or go to almosthomedogs.org and click on foster for application. PLEASE HELP US.

Please note-an application is required prior to any meet and greets.  There is no fee or obligation. Go to Almosthomedogs.org, click on \"Adopt\" tab at top

Because our dogs are in foster homes, applications are required prior to setting up any appointments.  Calling or emailing may delay your consideration.  Find our application on our website, almosthomedogs.org or click link below to find our application. https://docs.google.com/forms/d/12OTN3QBcNJEXlyQM0GzTMrb5ErkjpgWV3MiSlUP0L64/edit?ts=5a7f738f

Adoption Fee is $350. All dogs older than six months will be spayed/neutered prior to adoption. Dogs also have vaccines that are age appropriate, fecal check, treatment if needed, a vet physical, flea/tick treatment,  All of our dogs will be microchipped.

We are a non profit no kill 501 (c)3 rescue. Please understand that we do our best to describe our dogs but often we rescue them with virtually no information about them and often our best educated guess can be challenging. Currently check or cash is preferred payment.

name: Ellis #2
description:
Ellis #2 is about 1 year old and 41 lbs. He has had a prolapsed anus so he had surgery to tack his colon to his body internally. It has worked well and he is doing fine. Ellis is a sweet and goofy boy. He cannot climb a fence, but has climbed the gate when he sees a dog on the other side he wants to play with or he sees me. He normally does not try to get out, but would need to be supervised. He has a great personality and gets along really well with other dogs. He loves humans too. If you are interested in Ellis please fill out an application at labs4rescue.com.

September 15, 2019 Update from Ellis's Foster Mom in Connecticut: As soon as the Vet in Norwalk does his final exam, I think we will be taking Ellis to play with a neighbor chocolate lab. He wants to play so much when he meets other dogs. We have started dog obedience classes yesterday through our Park & Rec Dept. After all the initial craziness (6 dogs in class), he ended up doing pretty good. He is so friendly with people and children. Loves to be petted and loves to give kisses too. Rides well in the car. Is relatively calm and quiet in the house - until the doorbell rings. There is not an aggressive bone in his body. Likes to keep tabs on his people. Likes to lie at or under your feet.

Ellis's day is up at 6:30, Todd takes him out to potty. Back in for breakfast. Then a long walk around the property. Todd and I take him on walks around the yard. He seems to like laying outdoors. Does not bark at cars or bike riders. Late afternoon is a walk at the beach or the state park for an hour. Loves his dinner! And loves to chew his rawhide chew bone while in the living room with us. We go down to the barn to put the horses in and he loves gobbling up any grain they miss. Also he likes carrots. Around 9:30 he is tired and goes to sleep on his dog bed but will go into his crate at night when we go to bed. Boy oh boy, can that boy snore!

For additional information about Ellis #2 please email Marla Cox at mclabs4rescue@gmail.com. 

Ellis #2 is being fostered in Connecticut.

IMPORTANT INFORMATION: We receive many questions about our adoption process from potential adopters, most of which can be answered by viewing our \"Adopt a Lab\" page on our full service website, https://labs4rescue.dog/.   To expedite the process, please follow the step-by-step instructions outlined and submit an adoption application listing 3-5 dogs of interest. Please hurry as your new best friend is waiting for you!

name: Jax
description: Jax is a CAUTIOUS boy around men. He was pulled from Hillsborough County in HORRIBLE condition, and Saved from Euthanasia. Unsocialized or Feral, they were not sure. He is Selective with his people but with slow and proper introduction, we feel he will be a wonderful (but protective) Companion dog. He is a Handsome, Sleek, High energy baby, looking for the PERFECT Furever home and family.

name: Foster Homes Needed
description:
Every minute matters when it comes to rescuing a Shih Tzu. We may get a short notice that someone needs to surrender their dog or a puppy mill dog needs a temporary home. We can't help if we don't have families willing to foster, and we are always in need of more foster homes!

If you live in the Minneapolis/Saint Paul, Rockford or Chicago, IL areas and want to help save lives, please complete either our online Foster Sign-Up or download a word version here:

http://www.northstarshihtzurescue.org/foster/

(please note: neither dog pictured are available to foster or adopt, both are in their forever homes)

NorthStar Shih Tzu Rescue exists to benefit both Shih Tzu and Shih Tzu blend dogs and the people of our community. We operate as a no-kill rescue that provides rescue and adoption services, and meaningful outreach programs in order to advance the welfare of these companion animals, to serve and educate our community, and to make a positive, loving impact on the lives of both.

NorthStar, located in Excelsior, MN, actively works to rescue Shih Tzu and Shih Tzu blend dogs from dangerous environments and shelters with the ultimate goal of placing them in loving, permanent, adoptive homes. We rescue unwanted, abandoned, and abused dogs. We have them vaccinated, micro-chipped, spayed or neutered, provide other medical care, and rehabilitate them in carefully selected foster homes.

We also serve as a resource to our community and all pet owners by providing education and information on the benefits of adopting an animal in need as well as responsible pet ownership, including the importance of spay/neuter, good nutrition, and positive behavior training. We strive to increase public awareness about companion animal overpopulation, commercial breeders, and to offer solutions to end the killing of adoptable animals.

We work in alliance with local animal shelters, pounds, other rescue groups, and humane society organizations to ensure these animals are not forgotten.

9/7/19 7:24 PM

name: Amelia
description:
Please contact Pet (information@pethelpersinc.org) for more information about this pet.

This gorgeous girl is Amelia!! She is so so loving and her tail is always wagging. She does great with all the dogs in her foster home. But cats are a no no. She is rather obsessed and drives them nuts. She is happy just having her head on your lap. She is also crate trained and has done amazing with house breaking. She is looking for a family to call her own. She is approx 3 years old. Amelia is spayed, utd on shots, microchipped, wormed and flea treated. Amelia is being fostered in Clarksburg WV and her adoption fee is 150.00. If you want to give this awesome girl a wonderful loving home...fill out an application at

https://www.pethelpersinc.org/adoption-application/
For more information on this animal email adoptionisforever@pethelpersinc.org.

Pet Helpers is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit foster based volunteer rescue located in Fairmont, WV. We do adopt out of state to approved applicants, if you are willing to drive to WV to pick up your pet. We do not fly or use transport companies. Our adoption fee is $150.00 for mixed breed puppies and adult dogs, $225.00 for full blooded puppies and adult dogs and $50.00 for cats and kittens. Regardless if the animal is a mixed breed or full blooded they are spayed/neutered prior to adoption IF they are old enough. If they are too young at the time of adoption, then it is your financial responsibility to spay/neuter the pet by the age of 6 months and you must provide proof for our files that it has been done. All of our pets are checked by a vet, given the shots appropriate for their age and any other treatment deemed necessary by the vet. All of our pets are adopted as indoor pets and are not be outdoors tied to a box 24/7. The pet you are adopting has been living in a home with a foster family. You are expected to take possession of the pet you are applying for within a few days of application approval. This will enable us to accept another pet into that home. Because we are a rescue, and believe that spaying and neutering is crucial in stopping the reproduction of unwanted puppies/kittens and massive amounts of animals dying daily in shelters across the country, we expect any animal already in your home to be spayed/neutered. If for any reason you are unable to keep the pet you have adopted you are required to return them to Pet Helpers, Inc. They are not to be sold or given away.

Check us out on Facebook!!!!!! We hope you will give us two paws up, like our page and share with your friends. Pet Helpers, Inc.

description:
Please contact Pet (information@pethelpersinc.org) for more information about this pet.

Chester is looking for his furever home where someone will throw a ball for him to fetch. He absolutely loves it! He is so goofy and lovable you can't help but fall in love! ! He is approximately 3 years old, weighs around 25 lbs and is such a great guy. He just wants to be near his person and show you how much he loves you. Chester would love a home with no other dogs but does get along with the dogs his size and smaller. He was actually found with another beagle a female who i
s older. They get along fantastic. Chester is neutered, up to date on shots, flea treated and wormed. Chester is also micro chipped. A fenced yard would be wonderful but not a deal breaker. He is crate trained and working hard on housebreaking. If you want to make this awesome guy part of your family, fill out an application at

name: Elvira (Ellie)
description:
Please contact Pet (information@pethelpersinc.org) for more information about this pet.

This gorgeous girl is Elvira aka Ellie. Ellie is a redbone who is approx 3 years old and weighs around 50 lbs. This amazing girl is the most loyal dog you will ever meet. She is truly one of the most lovable dogs. Her only problem is...she is so loyal that she is very protective of her family. She needs a home with no kids because she is especially very protective of kids. A quiet home where there is not a lot of people in and out. Once she knows you, she is fine. She loves to just chill with her family but will also play with toys. She is great with other dogs with proper introduction. But no cats! Ellie is spayed, utd on shots, flea treated, micro chipped and wormed If you think you are the one...please fill out an application at:

https://www.pethelpersinc.org/adoption-info/

description:
Please contact Pet (information@pethelpersinc.org) for more information about this pet.

This super gorgeous but shy red tick is Macey! Miss Macey is approx 10 months old and fearful of people until you gain her trust. She is so super sweet and playful but did not have any socialization as a pup. Macey really need someone who understands a dog that is timid. She absolutely loves playing with the other dogs in her foster home. She likes dogs approx her size or a little smaller. Macey does not do with with cats. She weighs close to 60lbs So another larger dog as a playmate would be best. She is crate tr
ained and doing great with the housebreaking but a fenced yard is a requirement. Macey is spayed, utd on shots, flea treated and wormed. She is also microchipped. Macey is a happy go lucky girl . She just needs someone with patience and understanding. If you are ready to commit and give Macey the loving home she deserves, please fill out an application at

description:
Please contact Pet (information@pethelpersinc.org) for more information about this pet.

This super cute guy is Trapper!! Poor Trapper came to us in pretty bad shape. He has scars and part of his lower lip is missing. But that doesn't keep this boy d
own. We are guessing Trapper to be approx 5 and weighs about 25lbs. He is such a sweet loving boy! He is all about cuddling with his human. Trapper is so happy go lucky! He gets along ok with other dogs, but he can be a bit growly if they get in his space. He is crate trained and now that he is neutered doing much better with the housebreaking. A fenced in yard and being let out frequently is helping him get it! Trapper wants nothing but a comfy couch to hang out on. With a loving family. name: Opal
description:
Please contact Pet (information@pethelpersinc.org) for more information about this pet.

Meet pretty Opal! This adorable girl is a probably a hound mix. She is approx 1 year old weighs around 32 lbs and has been spayed, microchipped, flea treated and wormed . Opal was super skinny when she was found but has put on weight and is looking great. She is doing good with the dogs in her foster home. But she does seem to take a while to warm up to any new ones she meets. Slow introductions are best. She is playful but also loves to be near her person. Opal is house broke and crate trained. A fenced yard is required

name: Maggie and Enzo
description:
Please contact Pet (information@pethelpersinc.org) for more information about this pet.

Hi!! My name is Maggie, I am a spayed dachshund and I am 8 years old and 12lbs, my foster mom says \"every girl needs her very own chihuahua\" and guess what I have my very own attached to me at all times!! His name is Enzo, he is 11, neutered and I am his best friend, he follows me every where. I could probably do my own thing and live my life without him but I am not sure what he would do without me. I do love him and if he cries I am right there to make sure he is ok and lick his face, he isnt really as much of a social butterfly as I am but if I am around he does ok, so we must be adopted together! We both really like to snuggle under the covers with our person at night and I Maggie am happy to say I am house trained, we do well in a crate as long as we are together. We have been vaccinated, wormed, flea treated and micro chipped and we are just looking for that special someone willing to take on both of us, Enzo is going to need a little convincing, he just got used to our foster mom, but with some time an patience I think we would make perfect family members! If you would like to make us part of your family you can fill out an application at https://www.pethelpersinc.org/adoption-application our adoption fee is 300.00 we are being fostered in Morgantown WV
For more information on this animal email adoptionisforever@pethelpersinc.org.

name: Ethel Jane Starr
description:
Please contact Pet (information@pethelpersinc.org) for more information about this pet.

My name is Ethel Jane Starr. Apparently the other ladies at the senior home are talking and accusing me of having fake hair. Ladies, the only thing fake about me is my first home. These Pearl's cost me 5 dog bones and two poops outside. I am currently available to the right person. My needs don't come cheap. Think about vet care, my hair, my nails, jewels, and most importantly food! I like my fine dining. My age is in the double digits. I cant see or hear very well, but once I get used to your layout I am golden. I like to keep my bathroom habits private, but I know you are going to ask. Sometimes I take it outdoors or sometimes I take a poop on the pad. No depends for me yet. My foster mom says I am very loveable. I'm not very clingy or cuddly though. Unless you bride me with the lucky charm marshmallows. I like to take lots of naps on the local beds. I get along ok with the other seniors at the center and ignore the cats. If you fancy me and would like to give me the fancy life fill out an application to meet me at

https://www.pethelpersinc.org/adoption-application/ ,

or if you want more info email adoptionisforever@pethelpersinc.org

For more information on this animal email adoptionisforever@pethelpersinc.org.

name: Petula Bark Starr
description:
Please contact Pet (information@pethelpersinc.org) for more information about this pet.

When you're alone, and life is making you lonely

You can always go

Starrtown

When you've got worries, all the noise and the furry

Seems to help, I bark

Starrtown Just listen to the music of the furries in the pound

Linger on the sidewalk where the stars in the sky are pretty

How can you lose?

The lights are much brighter there

You can forget all your troubles, forget all your cares

So go starrtown, things'll be great when you're

Starrtown, no finer place for sure

Starrtown everyone's waiting for you!

Miss Petula Bark Starr is waiting for you at Starrtown! Petula would like a quiet home with no kids.

She does ok with other dogs, but would love to be the only child or with another laid back dog.

She does have a little food aggression, but who would want someone else touching their food.

Petula is a sweet girl. She is a little timid at first, but she knows you have to be cautious of people these days.

Petula takes Zonisamide twice day for seizures. Her seizures activity is low.

Little Miss Petula prefers to use pee pads, but loves the great outdoors if it is nice out.

Just a little picky about her bathroom choices, but peeing in the cold or rain is not a likely choice for any girl.

We believe Petula is 6 to 8 years old. This middle-aged looker still has lots of likes and licks left.

For more information about Petula email information@pethelpersinc.org, or to make her your new best friend, go to https://www.pethelpersinc.org/adoption-application/ to fill out an application.

For more information on this animal email adoptionisforever@pethelpersinc.org.

name: Daenerys
description:
Please contact Pet (information@pethelpersinc.org) for more information about this pet.

My name is Daenerys (Daeny for short) and I am a Beagle/Pit mix about 5 years old weighing 45 pounds. I came to Pet Helpers with my 6 surviving pups and 2 other adult dogs that were my pack. I am an alpha female and it was my responsibility to bring them back food if I could find it and protect them. Some really nice folks followed me home one night and made it possible for ALL of us to be rescued. My puppies have all been adopted into wonderful homes and now it's my turn to find my Forever Family. I've been spayed, microchipped, updated on vaccines and tested negative for heartworm and Lyme. I'm house trained and crate trained, but I really don't need a crate...I'm a pretty laid back kind of gal. When I meet a new dog I have to be introduced properly and spend some time with them to feel comfortable. Because of this I do not do well in a dog park or out walking with other dogs I do not know. I don't like cats, I'll be perfectly honest with you. I love kids and adults though and love to give kisses. I'm easy to leash walk and I really like car rides. If you could please open your heart and home to me, I promise to be loyal and loving. I am fostered in Fairmont, WV, and my adoption fee is $150.00.

If you would like more information please email adoptionisforever@pethelpersinc.org.

If you think you might like to adopt and give this animal a forever home please fill out an adoption application to arrange a meet and great by clicking on the following link: https://www.pethelpersinc.org/adoption-application/ Once you meet the animal you can make your final decision on adoption!
For more information on this animal email adoptionisforever@pethelpersinc.org.

name: Ruby
description:
This happy dog is Ruby, and she is so photogenic. I love taking pictures of her because she has such an aura about her. She was rescued from an abandoned house in Far Rockaway with another dog during Hurricane Sandy by fellow rescuer Christine D. Ruby is a sweetie who has a playful side to her. She is about 8 years old now, and weighing in about 40lbs. She is always happy to see you and will shower you with affection, giving kisses all over your face. Ruby has a lot of energy and could probably win an Olympic sprint! So she would make a great running or exercise partner. She is a pocket pittie and not too big so she would be perfect for any home situation. Ruby needs some training as she can be a little mouthy during play or getting too excited. Currently in a foster home where she is doing well.  Let's find Ruby a home!

Email harescue1@aol.com or haar13@aol.com/harescue1@aol.com 

The application can be found at http://fs30.formsite.com/HAAâ¦/AdoptionApplication/index.html

name: Lady Bunny
description:
Lady Bunny is a female double merle Australian Shepherd located in Fayetteville, NC.
She is around 6 months of age and is expected to be somewhere between 30-40 lbs when full grown.
As a result of being a double merle Lady Bunny is completely deaf, blind in the left eye but does have some vision on the right.
It's very important to remember that she was born this way so she doesn't realize she's any different and it certainly doesn't slow her down at all.
She is a rather strong willed girl, very smart and high energy!
She is very treat motivated which has made training a lot easier!
So far she is doing fantastic with the hand signals for sit, down, stand, come, stay and spin.
She walks well on leash too.
She is fully crate trained and is doing great with house training.
Lady Bunny would do best with someone that is willing/able to continue her training. 
Aussies are a very smart breed and love to learn.
Lacking some vision from one eye and hearing doesn't change that.
Training is also a great bonding tool!
She absolutely loves playing with other dog's and would do great with another doggie companion.
It would be best for any potential doggie friends to have a more playful/high energy personality because we feel Lady Bunny would be rather overwhelming for an older more laid back dog.
She loves her people and is very attentive, meaning she checks in frequently without being reminded.
She stays too busy to be a cuddler though.
We are recommending she go to a home without small children due to the fact that when she gets overly excited, she can bite down a little too hard.
Not aggressively at all but it does pinch.
Being an energetic young puppy at times she still finds it difficult to keep all 4 paws on the floor when greeting people.
Lady Bunny isn't a fan of sharing her food or high value treats with doggie friends.
We have been working on this and she has made great progress so it very manageable.
Foster mom can fill you in on what we have been doing to work on the issue.
Lady Bunny is spayed, up to date on all vaccinations, current on heart worm/flea tick prevention and she is also microchipped.
We are requiring a meet and greet prior to adoption.
This is just to help ensure we get the best match possible for Lady Bunny as well as the potential adopter.
With her high energy level and love for playing with other dog's, we feel any existing dog's will need to meet her as well to make sure they don't feel overwhelmed by her high energy playful self.
If you think you would be interested in meeting this adorable girl please follow this link to submit an application-

https://www.australianshepherdsfurever.org/adoption-applicaâ¦

name: Genie
description:
Meet the Adorable Genie!!!

This little brindle Pekingnese girl is just a puppy and such a sweet, silly precious girl! She joined us as an \"owner surrender\" and we immediately recognized some trauma in her behaviors. She clearly wasn't treated very well in her precious life- which broke our hearts. We had a shy, scared little puppy that didn't understand how to really be a puppy. 2 months in foster care and tons of love later, and we have a confident, happy, silly playful girl and what could be better! Genie has been with children, cats, and other dogs. She does great with other dogs, is great with cats and also good with older children. Because of her uncertain past we recommend homes with children over 8 years old. (Ie- no tail pullers lol) 
Genie is under 20 pounds and around a year old.

Genie is now spayed, microchipped with lifetime registration, received all of her annual shots (rabies, distemper/parvo and bordetella) she has been dewormed, is current on flea treatment and heartworm prevention. She is HW negative. We also had her groomed.

She is mostly potty trained and we say mostly because she still is very young and will adjust to a new schedule fairly well. She is an \"excited pee-er\" when greeted! She was once terrified of a leash and walks and now looks forward to them, we do recommend a harness. She is snuggly and goofy and loves her toys and wants attention and love. She is a joy and a wonderful pup. Since Genie doesn't require kids we welcome all applications on her as she would also be a wonderful companion pet!!!! 

Genie can be an only pet!
Fenced yard preferred not required.

If you'd like to meet this gorgeous girl and open your heart and home to her, send our adoption coordinator a message for an application. FishHawkTNR4@gmail.com
Our process includes application, playdate and home check and delivery. Adoption fee is $350

Help us continue to save lives, by choosing to adopt a rescued pet!!

****APPLICATION DOES NOT GUARANTEE ADOPTION WE HAVE THE RIGHT TO DECLINE AN APPLICATION FOR ANY REASON, INCLUDING DISTANCE!!!!***

Application notes:

*We are NEVER first come first served.

*Must live within 45 minutes from FishHawk/Apollo Beach, FL. We deliver.  (non- negotiable!!!!!)

*Please read our application and information in full- we will not send updates on application status and we will not consider apps that are not completely filled out with every question we have asked addressed and completely answered where applicable. 

*Application does not guarantee adoption. It is 100% at our discretion, as we see fit, for whatever reason. We know these animals best.

*Lastly, we will not respond to adoption inquiries via Facebook. Please do not leave us a comment stating you are âinterestedâ we simply do not have the time to chase down adopters via comments. If you will not follow the simple, specific and stated procedure, please do not expect us to adopt to you.

Genie has been fully vetted- this includes spayed, microchipped, 1st set of shots (rabies, distemper/parvo and bordetella) dewormed, flea treated, tested Negative for Heatworms and is current on HW prevention . She will come with her full vet portfolio, an adoption process and an adoption fee of $350 collected at the time of adoption via cash, check or paypal.

To Apply:

Please email Ali at FishHawkTNR4@gmail.com for an application and more specific information. Please include her name in the subject line. Please allow 7-10 days for a reply to the initial email requesting the application. Processing applications can take anywhere from 10-14 days. *Please do not email for updates and please note that we do not have a line, or list, adoptions are never 1st come 1st served rather we match each applicant and animal to the best fit homes we can! This ensures success for both the adopted and the adopter! We appreciate your patience and understanding in our tried and true process and are thrilled you have chosen to apply for a rescued pet! They are our most favorite breed!!!

PETFINDER APPLICANTS- YOU MUST EMAIL US DIRECTLY FOR A RESPONSE- FishHawkTNR4@gmail.com

Thanks!
#AdoptDontShop #FishHawkTNR

name: Tutsi
description:
Love, sweetness and affection! That's what Tutsi is all about! Once unwanted by her previous owner because she would not guard his goats, she is now looking for a family to love her and spoil her without giving her any job assignments. All she's interested in are belly rubs, hugs and kisses. Known for bonding to her people quickly, Tutsi will be a wonderful addition to a family who has experience with large dogs and time and patience to teach her basic obedience. She is pending arrival to our rescue and will be located in Jacksonville, FL.

Please, visit www.dbgsdrescue.org to proceed to HOW TO AQDOPT section. Thank you.

name: Neff
description: Neff, 3-years-old, is a great family dog. He generally gets on well with the other with an occasional grumble. He is crate trained and not destructive in the house. If you would like to meet Neff then please go to our website www.GSRFL.org. Questions? Call his foster Mom at (352) 897-5357All animals accepted into our rescue receive the finest vet care and psychological services we can provide. Our rescue and sanctuary is now located in Citrus Springs, FL, with a foster homes in Lady Lake and N. Fort Myers. Please visit our website www.GSRFL.org to learn more about our organization.Our rescue consists of a group of dedicated volunteers that take German Shepherd Dogs into their homes and lives while the dogs and puppies are awaiting adoption. No salaries are paid to volunteers or anyone associated with the rescue. All funds collected go directly to the care of the dogs and puppies. We are in constant need of foster homes to allow us to save more dogs and puppies. Please consider being a foster home for a needy dog or puppy. You can request a foster application by Email us at WeLuvGSDs@gsrfl.com.We are always seeking financial donations to allow us to provide more services for our dogs. One hundred percent of all donations are used to benefit the dogs and puppies. We are a 501(c)3 non-profit Florida Corporation.

name: Missy
description: Missy is a two-year-old angel that was an owner surrender to this rescue. She came with seven puppies and now that the puppies are all adopted and she is spayed it's Missy's turn to find her forever home. This is the sweetest dog you will ever meet. If you would like to meet Missy, then please go to our website www.GSRFL.org and complete the Adoption Application you will find there. Questions? Then contact her foster Mom at (352) 897-5357.All animals accepted into our rescue receive the finest vet care and psychological services we can provide. Our rescue and sanctuary is now located in Citrus Springs, FL, with a foster homes in Lady Lake and N. Fort Myers. Please visit our website www.GSRFL.org to learn more about our organization.Our rescue consists of a group of dedicated volunteers that take German Shepherd Dogs into their homes and lives while the dogs and puppies are awaiting adoption. No salaries are paid to volunteers or anyone associated with the rescue. All funds collected go directly to the care of the dogs and puppies. We are in constant need of foster homes to allow us to save more dogs and puppies. Please consider being a foster home for a needy dog or puppy. You can request a foster application by Email us at WeLuvGSDs@gsrfl.com.We are always seeking financial donations to allow us to provide more services for our dogs. One hundred percent of all donations are used to benefit the dogs and puppies. We are a 501(c)3 non-profit Florida Corporation.

name: Buddy
description:
Buddy is available for foster or adoption. We are a foster-based rescue and always looking for foster families. Buddy is currently located in Palm City, FL (Martin County). Buddy is a laid-back boy of 3 years and 45 lbs looking for a forever home.
Buddy - a low-rider hunk boy is the best way to describe him. Buddy could also stand to lose a few lbs. He's pretty chill and loves to carry around his toys in his mouth. His favorite things are humans and toys (in no particular order). He is fine with other dogs too but humans and toys are TOP OF HIS LIST. He walks well on leash and rides well in the car.
Buddy is housebroken, crate trained, neutered, up-to-date on vaccines and preventives, and microchipped. He was recently cleared by the vet after heartworm treatment.
We are a foster-based rescue organization with foster homes throughout the state of Florida. We predominantly save dogs from municipal shelters throughout the Southeastern U.S. Our rescue dogs live in foster homes - there is no central facility. If interested in meeting one of our wonderful adoptable dogs, please fill out an application at
ewenityfarmsbch.com
. Information on adoption donation amounts and our process can also be found at this site.

name: Sheba
description:
***COURTESY LISTING*** Not a Ewenity Farm dog, but shared with love! Sheba is located in Myakka City, FL (Manatee County).

Sheba is about 60 lbs and 5-6 years. She was found dumped on a farm and taken in by a loving family, but due to her incompatibility with farm animals needs to find a suitable forever home. She loves humans of all ages including children, and is very friendly and loving right off the bat. She would do well in a home with a companion dog, but it is not a requirement. She loves to play outside but not as much as napping at your feet and getting attention. She knows basic commands and is fine on leash but could use a refresher.

Sheba is housebroken, spayed and up-to-date on vaccines and preventives. If interested, please submit an inquiry and we will forward it to Sheba's current foster.

name: Molly
description: Molly is six-years-old and came back to rescue after her adoptive family's lifestyle changed. Molly is good with women and fearful of men. She is not a dog that can be taken on walks through neighborhoods. Molly would do well with a woman or two and be a total love. She is excellent with livestock, but barks horribly at the horses, which Jec taught her. We bring her in the house if she is outside when we feed the horses. She is all love and cuddle with women. Her people are important to her. Molly is crate trained and reliably house trained. Molly plays with the other dogs. If you would like to know more about Molly Email WeLuvGSDs@gsrfl.com or call (352) 897-5357All animals accepted into our rescue receive the finest vet care and psychological services we can provide. Our rescue and sanctuary is now located in Citrus Springs, FL, with a foster homes in Lady Lake and N. Fort Myers. name: XP Scooby - Flanders, NJ
description:
This is our dog Scooby. He is a Beagle and he is 9 years old. He is a sweet and loving couch potato. He's very quiet, you might even forget that he's home with you. He loves to be rubbed especially around his butt area, that's his favorite spot. He's very playful especially with our other dog and friends at the park.

Scooby likes to be comfortable and warm so he loves the bed, the couch and/or he will find a pile of clothes or blanket and lay on it. He is a great dog, you will love him as much as I do. Please help us to try and find a loving home for him.

Scooby is NOT with 11th Hour Rescue but we are helping with the rehoming process. If you are interested in making this boy a part of your family, please contact Abigail directly at either abigailbennett15@icloud.com or 202-468-1244. Scooby is currently located in Flanders, NJ.

name: Pablo -- Courtesy Post
description:
This handsome gentledog impresses everyone he meets: affectionate, polite, playful, and so clearly grateful to have even a minute of your attention. How was this guy an unclaimed stray at an animal shelter?? 

Pablo especially loves being rubbed on his head and behind his ears. So far he seems friendly with the other dogs here, but he draws the line at cats so should go to a home without kitties. 

Outside, he has a good bit of energy -- you'd never guess he is about 10 years old. Pablo can be a bit mouthy when excited, so, though he loves people of all ages, he is not recommended for a home with small children. 

Pablo is a courtesey post. For more information please call his rescue, Safe Shelter, at 814-485-1579 or 301-478-3206, or email them: safeshelterinc@yahoo.com. Safe Shelter is located in Flintstone, MD, but his fans in Frederick will help arrange a meeting in or near Frederick if that's more convenient. :-)

name: BYRON
description:
Greetings, Ladies and Gents! Byron here, a mellow, friendly bloke with a shiny black coat. I'm 2 years of age and weigh 72 pounds. I need to gain more weight and I'm a good eater, so no problem-o.  I love to snuggle with people and I'm very friendly with other dogs. I leave the kitties alone. I'm a gentleman inside the house and I walk nicely on my leash. I have heartworms, but they will soon be gone. LRROF will provide my treatment at a vet near my adopter's area. My namesake, Lord Byron, wrote \"Always laugh when you can. It is cheap medicine.\" That's my philosophy, so come to New Port Richey to laugh and snuggle with me. 
Thanks so much for your interest in our rescue!
To apply to adopt from Labrador Retriever Rescue of Florida, please visit our website at http://www.lrrof.org. Your support, both through adoption and donation is always essential to us and our Labs. Donate today.
We're about matching the right dog with the right family! All applicants will be assigned an Adoption Counselor who will act as their liaison. In addition, a phone interview, home inspection and vet reference (if applicable) are required for eligibility to adopt from Labrador Retriever Rescue of Florida.

description:

name: LUCY
description:
Hi everyone! My name is Lucy and I will be 10 months old this week! I came to my foster parents a few weeks ago, and boy have I learned a lot. I am already completely potty trained and can âsitâ, âstayâ and lay âdownâ too. I am very smart and learn quickly. I love my tennis ball and and my rope toy and running and playing in the yard. I have been left alone inside a few times and have not chewed up anything. (I might have licked a thing or two!). I am also not afraid of thunder or the vacuum cleaner now that I know what those things are! The hardest things for me are walking on leash and greeting new people because I just get so EXCITED!  I know that with continued training I will be a good girl in those area too. I canât wait to meet you and find my forever home, so give my folks a call and letâs get together in Clearwater!

Thanks so much for your interest in our rescue!

name: Morty *FH*
description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Morty came to us from a rural shelter in north Florida. He is a goofy and sweet dog who loves to run! He has been with a foster family for the past couple of weeks and they have really helped him come out of his shell. He is a dog that definitely needs a fenced-in yard to run with and another dog to play with as well. Please fill out an application to meet him!

name: REGAN MAE
description:
Hi everyone! Puppy Regan coming your way! I'm 6 months of age and enjoy playing with people and other large dogs.I'm a good girl with small children. I like all types of dog toys. I was rescued by some nice people who found me on a lonely country road. I had a wound on my head and some wounds on my body. It's thought that I was thrown out of a moving car. The nice rescuers took good care of me and now my wounds are all healed. Everyone says that I'm very beautiful, so come to New Port RIchey to see for yourself. I love to be cuddled. You can see a video of me, plus more photos, if you click to the left or right of the picture above.  
Thanks so much for your interest in our rescue!

description:

name: Bucky
description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Bucky came to us from a rural shelter in north Florida. He is a ball full of energy and would love a yard to run around in! He is a cute dog with an adorable face. We are not sure yet if he is good with other dogs, but we will be testing him with others this week. He is currently heartworm positive, but please do not let that shy you away from this wonderful dog!Pet Rescue By Judy practices the slow kill method for treating heartworm, and we have had great success with it. The slow kill method means we give the infected dog a medication for 30 days (if you adopt within his first 30 days we will provide you with the medication) and then after that all he needs is his monthly topical of Advantage Multi!

name: Jasper
description:
Adopt Me!

Online Adoption Application

I was rescued from a family who chained me to a tree and am now being fostered in Largo, Florida. I am looking for a fun family to love on me and give me lots of attention. I am an American Staffordshire terrier mix, 3 years young and oh so playful and loving! Weighing in at only 61 lbs., I would make a great family addition to a home with older and considerate children, as I have very playful spirit. I love to roughhouse with other dogs and would play best with others my size and age. I am ready to give kisses and cuddle with you. Could I be the boy of your dreams?

I dream of a big back yard where I can run and chase sticks all day! Do you have a heart and home for a guy like me? Please send a message to meet me...I am waiting for you to call!

Please go to www.fluffanimalrescue.org/adoption-application to fill out an online app to meet me!

(Jasper's $200 adoption fee includes his neuter , UTD on all vaccinations , microchip and current flea and heartworm preventative.)

name: Kisses
description:
Meet Kisses!  Kisses is a chocolate 10 year old former breeder girl that was found as a stray in Polk County. Kisses takes some time to learn but she does get it eventually. She is food motivated and has learned sit and wait under certain circumstances (such as meals) but isnât doing it universally yet. She has been found guilty of counter surfing in the past, especially for the counter surferâs most coveted prize: bread!

She has experience with other dogs, people and older kids.  Sheâs not a big fan of small-yippy dogs, but she can be corrected to ignore them.  She loves attention and wants to be touching you or at a minimum wants you in her line of sight. While she is high energy, she will settle if you're watching TV or on the computer. She is crate trained but will bark/whine initially. 

Kisses can be mouthy but is getting better at that. She is still working on taking treats nicely and can jump, but more next to you than on you. She loves to fetch and will retrieve random things around the house for you even if you donât need them!  She occasionally chews on stuffed toys but hasnât destroyed any. 

Kisses is the chocolate dog in the photos with two dogs.  She is being fostered in Tampa and still needs to be spayed but can visit with potential adopters.


If you are interested in adopting please go to www.lrrof.org NOW and fill out and application.
Â

name: Kaya
description:
Meet Kaya!  Kaya is a black 10 year old former breeder girl that was found as a stray in Polk County.  Kaya learns quickly and is learning to swim. She has a strong prey drive for everything in the backyard.  She has caught a few lizards (killed and spit them out) and eaten a small frog. Kaya is happy to meet new people but calms down quickly. She rarely barks but makes funny old lady grumbly noises. She is crate trained and has no issue being in her crate. If the crate door is open she will occasionally go in and lay down voluntarily. Kaya is social with people.  She tolerates other dogs but would do best as only dog because she is looking for a quiet lifestyle.  She is not interested in toys unless they include food.  Kaya is the black dog in the photos with two dogs.  

Kaya is fostered in Tampa and still needs to be spayed but can visit with potential adopters.

If you are interested in adopting please go to www.lrrof.org NOW and fill out and application.
Â

name: Merlin
description:
****IF YOU ARE INTERESTED**** Visit our website to complete an adoption application: www.nakedkissesdogrescue.org/adoption.


Intake 7/5; Available for adoption on 8/2. 


- 17lbs

- Good with dogs and cats

- Good with men, women, children over 12

- Sweet but takes time to open up

Merlin came to us from a shelter in Florida. They estimated him to be 8 years old, and our vet thinks maybe 10-11 years old. He looks to have not been well cared for during at least part of his life, but he will never know what that is like again. The tops of his ears are missing, possibly from either trauma or frostbite. He wasn't neutered. His ears were horribly infected with pseudomonas, maybe even MRSA. Our vet thinks he had some past trauma to part of his cervical spine, and either that or the ear infection causes a head tilt - which looks pretty cute. It doesn't seem to bother him.

We began working on the ear infection with antibiotics and drops, and his ears are doing much better. There is irreversible damage inside that was done, and he has some hearing loss. Since treating the ear infection, he seems to have recouped some hearing and is responding to us when we call him loudly or if he hears a loud noise. Bonus: thunderstorms don't bother him!

Merlin is a sweet dog but took a few days to start showing personality. Now he is goofy, even playful sometimes! He is a Velcro dog with his foster mom and follows her everywhere she goes. He LOVES car rides. He sleeps with his foster parents at night and doesn't move all night. He has learned to walk on a leash and does so very nicely. He loves getting petted on his face, and he lovvvesss getting his back rubbed above his tail. He dances his rear so hard that sometimes both legs come off the ground at the same time.

Merlin is definitely a Crested because he despises grass. He has gotten really good about using the potty outside, but he has to be set outside most of the time. He won't go out far in that treacherous grass, so sometimes we carry him to the far corner once or twice to make sure he has finished up his business. Housetraining is coming along nicely.

Also a classic Crested trait, is separation anxiety! Merlin says he wants a home where someone is almost always home. He is not a candidate for anyone who works away from home or who is routinely gone for more than a few hours. He will howl and howl and howl if he is separated from his people! Because of that, he also cannot live in attached living because the neighbors may not appreciate his singing.

Perhaps not a Crested trait, but maybe just a trait for anyone who really loves their sleep... Merlin doesn't like being woken up when it's time to leave the couch and go to bed at night. There is no picking him up and waltzing off to the bedroom. Merlin will not just growl, he will warning snap and be annoyed that his beauty sleep was interrupted. We think this is partly because he doesn't want to be bothered, but we also think a big part of it was his ear infection hurting him. He has gotten so much better with every night. We have found it's easiest to just tug on his blanket until he gets up, and that is working well. He's also very food motivated, so if a treat is dangled in his face, he gets right up. We believe in time, this reaction would go away. His ears are feeling better, and he has started to feel settled and at home.

He has allowed people to pet him when on walks, but he has demonstrated body posture that says he does not want them to pet him, so we ask people not to pet him. We feel that will get better with more practice and socialization too, but we like to err on the side of caution and keeping him feeling comfortable.

Merlin loves car rides! He would be great company for anyone who takes long road trips. His foster family takes him along on errands all the time because he really loves it.

Overall, Merlin is a really great dog and is going to make someone the best companion. He is super sweet, adores his foster mom (even our vet commented on that), and the rest of his family are pretty cool too when she's busy. He cannot be placed in a home with children under 12 years old. 

Merlin is up to date on vaccines, heartworm negative, and is microchipped. His senior blood panel was great. He had a dental on 7/10.  He will be ready for adoption on August 2.

name: CHARLIE BEAR
description:
Hi folks! Charlie Bear here, a happy, friendly fella, 3 years of age, who wants to play ball with you. I weigh 65 pounds, just right for snuggling. I have a shiny black coat and everyone says I'm very handsome. Â I was in a rural shelter, picked up as a stray. The shelter was filling up, so they said I was out of time. A nice rescuer picked me up and now I'm in my comfy foster home in New Port Richey waiting to meet you. Pilots and Paws volunteer, Captain Roger, gave me a first class flight to my foster home area and I was a good boy, looking out the window from the back seat. I also ride well in the car. You can see a video of me, plus more photos, if you click to the left or right of the picture above.  I know commands and would like to have some more training to help me to stop jumping up (I'm an enthusiastic guy) and to help me walk like a champ on my leash. I'm an athletic guy would like to have an active adopter, teenagers and older kids are fine. 
Thanks so much for your interest in our rescue!

name: Nigel
description: Nigel is a friendly, fun guy. He is a male black lab. Nigel is a young adult, and we estimate his age to be about one year old. He still has a lot of puppy in him and is lovable and energetic. He weighs 64 lbs and tested negative for heartworms. He will be scheduled to be neutered soon. He came from the Panhandle area of Florida and was a stray before coming to Houndhaven. Nigel is waiting for someone to open their heart and give him the chance to become a loyal, faithful companion for life. To adopt Nigel, please review our policies and submit an application.

description:
