name: Bobby
description:
Bobby is available for foster or foster-to-adopt. He's currently being fostered in Bradenton, FL (Manatee County). Bobby is a sweet sweet Jack Russell mix who would love to have a forever home! Other dogs?? That's okay!! By himself?? That's okay too. What Bobby does is roll with the punches. He came to us from a very high-kill shelter in Florida. He has had surgery twice for removal of benign growths. We have not had to do anymore surgeries. He came through with flying colors, considering he is heartworm positive. He will be treated in August, and we are looking for a foster, that can carry him through heartworm treatment, ideally fall in love with him and adopt him. Best. Jack. Ever. He is not noisy, but barks when you come home, not a crazy busy Jack. Loves to go out and explore. He even swims. He loves to be loved on. Follows you around. Expert lizard and fly chaser. Loves toys, balls and squeakies.. Walks great on lead, and loves to ride in the car. He is the perfect companion. He will sleep when you do, be active when you are. He would like someone that is home a lot, or another dog to keep him company. Fenced yard is preferred, but not sure he needs one. He seems to want to stay with you. Crates easily, housebroken, just an all around good guy. Heartworm treatment will be done in St. Petersburg, so the ability to take him to treatment is a must. Bobby is the perfect companion dog.
We are a foster-based rescue organization with foster homes throughout the state of Florida. We predominantly save dogs from municipal shelters throughout the Southeastern U.S. Our rescue dogs live in foster homes - there is no central facility. If interested in meeting one of our wonderful adoptable dogs, please fill out an application at
ewenityfarmsbch.com.
Information on adoption donation amounts and our process can also be found at this site.

name: Abby
description:
Hi everyone! My name is Abby, a loving gal with a shiny black coat, 9 years of age. My house manners are great and my favorite pastime is to snuggle with people and watch TV. I also like to take walks and explore the outdoors. I'm very good walking on my leash. I get along well with other dogs and kitties, too. I would do well in any type of home: apartment, condo, home where folks are away all day, or with someone who wants to have a constant companion.  Come to Odessa to take a walk with me and then snuggle together. My guardian passed away and wants me to have a loving home. I get insulin twice daily; it's very easy to take care of me. 
Thanks so much for your interest in our rescue!

name: Ty
description:
Ty is a 13-year-old Owner Surrender as his Dad was in his 90âs and required an Assisted Living Facility.  Ty is a 100 pound Yellow Boy that is a gentle boy.  He walks well on a leash or beside you off leash, he is super gentle taking food from your hands, he doesnât bark and simply is a joy.  He needs someone to retire with! Ty has arthritis issues and is on meds to keep his pain level down.  However, he loves a short walk a few times a day.  He gets along with other dogs as there isnât an aggressive bone in his body. Ty gets a lot of attention due to how handsome he is and loves the attention.  He isnât a kissy guy but loves to be petted.  Â Ask about Ty in District 9.

name: Jojo & Rowdy
description: Jojo and Rowdy are brothers and best friends and need to be together. They love to play and run around. They have spent many months on a farm and loved having the freedom to roam. They are medium size dogs and have traveled with us from Florida to Texas to Colorado and back. They have been around a lot of kids and never bitten or been dangerous. They are still a lot of energy so they  could use some training, but even without training they are super great and loving dogs

name: ASPEN
description:
Greetings, Ladies and Gents! Aspen here, an easy going guy with a yellow coat, 12 years of age. My home was foreclosed and my guardian was ill, so he wants me to have a loving forever home. I love people and enjoy snuggling. Other dogs like me because I play well with other dogs of all sizes. I'm slow moving, but I love my walks. I enjoy chasing the slow lizards and exploring the outdoors. My foster mom says that I have the sweetest personality. Come snuggle with me in Seminole. Â 
Thanks so much for your interest in our rescue!

description:

name: Bella (chocolate)
description:
Hello my name is Bella. I am about 2 years old. I have beautiful Golden Eyes, a petite girly figure      (57 Lbs.) and a short soft coat.  I recently had puppies that were taken from me by someone as they werenât with me when I was found roaming around in the wild to fend for myself.  I was Picked up by a very small rural shelter and sadly my days were limited if not adopted. I was very scared, almost crippled with fear in the shelter.  The good people at Lab Rescue found out about me and have given me a chance to find a  forever home.
 
Bob my foster dad believes I must have lived in a home for most of my life because I know all of my house manors and commands.  I am potty trained.  I like to ride in the car and enjoy going on walks. I am good on a leash but could use some obedience training when I see some different things.  Since I have been with Bob, I have not let him out of my sight. I am always in the same room with him. I guess I am fearful about being abandoned again.  I very much like to snuggle.  I will lay on your shoulder or next to you on the couch when ever you let me. I enjoy playing with a tennis ball. Playing fetch in the yard is nice or I will roll the ball around the house and play by myself.  I also enjoy chewing on a stuffed bone and recently started playing with stuffed animals.  
Bob says I am very smart and eager to learn more.  I did not have ID when I was found so no one knew my name. I was give a new name Bella (Beautiful!) and started responding to my name in less that 2 weeks.  I might do best as an only dog but they say we will see once I get my paws under me and settled a bit more.  I am just catching my breath and going through Hormonal changes. It would nice to have backyard to run in, play fetch or to just hang out looking at the squirrels.  I do not like to go in the water.
 
Right now I am just a little girl looking to be loved and give my unconditional love to a nice family.
Please call Bob and come visit me in Sarasota.
 
Thank you for taking the time to read about me. Have a nice day
 
Bella & Bob  
 
 If you are interested in adopting please go to www.lrrof.org NOW and fill out and application.
Â 
Thanks so much for your interest in our rescue!
To apply to adopt from Labrador Retriever Rescue of Florida, please visit our website at http://www.lrrof.org. Your support, both through adoption and donation is always essential to us and our Labs. Donate today.

name: Larry and Moe
description:
Hi there we are Larry and Moe at least that's what our Foster Mom has named us.  We are very thankful to be with her as our person left us in a neighborhood that wasn't ours.  We don't understand why as we are great boys.  We are housetrained and love love love to play with toys.  We love to be with people too and although this guy they call a \"Vet\" guesstimated our age at 10 we have heard people say we sure don't act like 10 year olds.  We'd love to meet you if you'd love to give us a forever home.  We are currently undergoing Heartworm Treatment but it isn't slowing us down.  We are being fostered in the Florida Panhandle. description:
Hi there we are Larry and Moe at least that's what our Foster Mom has named us.  We are very thankful to be with her as our person left us in a neighborhood that wasn't ours.  We don't understand why as we are great boys.  We are housetrained and love love love to play with toys.  We love to be with people too and although this guy they call a \"Vet\" guesstimated our age at 10 we have heard people say we sure don't act like 10 year olds.  We'd love to meet you if you'd love to give us a forever home.  We are currently undergoing Heartworm Treatment but it isn't slowing us down.  We are being fostered in the Florida Panhandle.  To apply to adopt from Labrador Retriever Rescue of Florida, please visit our website at http://www.lrrof.org. Your support, both through adoption and donation is always essential to us and our Labs. Donate today.

We're about matching the right dog with the right family! All applicants will be assigned an Adoption Counselor who will act as their liaison. In addition, a phone interview, home inspection and vet reference (if applicable) are required for eligibility to adopt from Labrador Retriever Rescue of Florida.

name: MALACHI
description:
Greetings, ladies and gents! My name is Malachi, a friendly boy with a shiny black coat, 5 years of age. When I was rescued, I had no coat at all and now everyone says I'm the most handsome guy around. I like to play with other dogs and I'm a good boy in the house. I live with cats and other dogs and do well when I'm out on walks. I like to live the active FLorida life. I love to snuggle and be with people. Come see me in Seminole, just  north of St Pete. 
Â 
Thanks so much for your interest in our rescue!

name: Poet
description: Meet Poet! Poet is a sweet young girl rescued from a Florida high kill shelter on her last day before euthanasia. She is definitely a people dog and absolutely adores her human companions. When she's around humans, she wiggles her tail so much, the back half of her body wiggles with it! On the other hand, she is not a fan of small dogs or cats - her prey drive is strong. Poet is good around dogs of her own size and larger, but as most dogs prefer, she would love to be the star of her family. Poet is spayed, current on all vaccines and micro chipped. Do yourself a favor and make this girl the happiest dog on the planet by making her your furever companion today!

name: Ginger
description: Ginger  is all dressed up, waiting and hoping for a family to come visit her, fall in love and make her their new family member. Ginger is approximately 10 years old, good with other dogs, older kids, no cats, spayed, up to date on her shots, located in Dunnellon, Florida. For more info contact  call/text 863-272-4666

name: Liberty
description:
Liberty is a 3 yrs old american bulldog weighing in at 55 pounds. Not only does she love people, and she is great with kids!!  Liberty is spayed, up to date on her shots, microchipped and house trained. 
Liberty is located in Deltona Florida.

name: Sweet Pea
description: Sweet Pea is a 12 year old senior who got her name because she's is the sweetest! She'd love a home where she could get lots of snuggles and have a comfy spot on the couch to sleep. Sweet Pea would really like to have a home where she could be showered with all of the attention and not have to share with other pets. Just like so many human seniors, Sweet Pea is suffering from some arthritis but she's responding well to treatment. We would consider a foster to adopt home so we could cover the cost of her treatment until the holistic vet says she no longer needs them (should be fairly soon!). Her holistic vet is located in Fort Mitchell. Sweet Pea has been spayed, is up to date on vaccines, is heartworm tested and micro chipped. Our adoption application can be found on our website, www.pawprintsnky.com.

name: Toby
description:
Toby is an adorable 18 pound, red and white Basenji mix with very distinctive ears. His estimated date of birth is October 2016. He came to ARF from a shelter in Fort Smith after being rescued as an unclaimed stray. This sweet guy had a tough time coping with anxiety, and spent time in the medical unit because he was so scared. He is doing extremely well in a foster home after being given a chance to adjust at his own pace. He is housetrained, with a few accidents here and there. He is crate trained at night, and rests quietly when his crate is covered. 

Toby loves being around other dogs. He is energetic and playful, but also submissive. The two dogs in his foster home have helped his adjustment immensely. He does okay with older kids, but may not be a good fit around younger ones. He chases the cat living in his foster home, but hasn't tried to hurt her. As he has been adjusting to his foster home, he has growled and barked at the members of his foster family. However, he responds well to verbal correction, and this behavior is declining in frequency as he becomes more comfortable.

Toby is very companionable and likes being around people. He follows his foster mom around the house keeping her company in various rooms. His only really bad habit is that he likes to chew, with a particular affinity for shoes and cords. This can be easily managed by providing bones and toys, and keeping human things picked up. Toby shows his Basenji heritage with unusual vocalizations in addition to little barks and growls.

Toby's ideal forever home would be with a family who is patient enough to allow him to acclimate at his own pace. The perfect home for Toby will have at least one other dog, and no young kids. They will also have the ability to tolerate toileting accidents, and to remember to pick up things he's likely to chew. Toby is a smart, resilient little guy, who will be a wonderful addition to his forever family.Toby has a $150.00 adoption fee plus the cost of 6 months of heartworm prevention. 

Note: ARF reserves the right to deny any application that is deemed unsuitable for the animal. Please be aware that our animal adoptions are NOT on a first come- first serve basis. Our sole purpose is to find the best possible home for the animals that fall under our care. We do not ship our animals. All adopters are expected to come to Tulsa if approved.

For details on how to adopt please visit http://www.arftulsa.org/adopt

name: Hallee
description: Hallee is a female, 32.1 lb, white and tan Terrier mix. Hallee's estimated date of birth is August, 2016. She was rescued from the Fort Smith shelter. Hallee, is a very smart, cute and almost fully house-trained one- to two-year-old. She has moved to foster care  and shows lots of potential for adoption in a one-dog home. She can follow orders like \"sit\

name: Dale
description:
Name: Dale
Breed: Shepherd/Hound/Lab Mix
Age: 6 years old (As of August 2019)
Good With Dogs: Yes. Dale enjoys playing with and socializing with female dogs and happy, submissive dogs. He is a lady's man.
Good With Cats: Yes
Good With Children: Yes
Heartworm Status: Negative

Dale is a very sweet boy who came from an animal neglect case out of Bibb County. Even though he had a rough start at life, he has a lot of love to give and hasn't let his past define him. He does well with some dogs, and we would say he's selective, but we always require other companions to meet dogs prior to adoption to ensure it is a great match for everyone. He especially loves likes female dogs and submissive dogs that appreciate his status as being his own man.

 He does well with everyone, including small children. He's a very intelligent boy. He thinks he is macho when he is in an environment where he knows what to expect, but with new situations - like the first time he met nail clippers, he turned into a squeaky little mouse in about ten seconds. He gains confidence quickly in new places, and likes to go for walks in his harness. He's stubborn and good natured. Dale is a proud, dapper guy that likes to patrol his grounds, go for walks, and get his back scratched. He is soft like a teddy bear. He is the perfect model who doesn't mind being dressed at all!

----

name: Raiden
description:
Name: Raiden 
Breed: German Shepherd/Husky
Age: Approx. 2 Years as of August 2019
Sex: Male
Weight: 50 lbs
Good with Dogs: Yes
Good with Cats: Yes
Good with Kids: Yes
Heartworm Status: Negative

Raiden is a beautiful Shepherd/Husky mix that is intelligent, goofy, energetic, and excited about life. If youâre looking for a buddy thatâs always ready to party, Raiden is your boy. Raiden would love to live a fairly active lifestyle that might possibly include hiking, exploring, and playing with other dog friends. 

Raiden was pulled by us from a local animal control after his stray hold was up, and his owners, if any, did not come forward. For the life of us, we donât know why they didnât bother- Raiden is wonderful! He lights up a room when heâs around. 

Raiden has many of the personality traits of both a husky and a shepherd. He is intelligent, fairly energetic, playful, and obedient- and to top it all off, heâs a stunner with those eyes that everyone notices at first glance. He learns by watching and example. Raiden walks well on a leash and does well in a crate. We believe he is house trained based on behavior at the rescue. Raiden is a joy to have around and is ready for his forever family! 

Please note due to Raidenâs breeds he does shed a lot.

name: Peggy
description:
Name: Peggy
Breed: Standard Dachshund, possibly mixed
Age: 3-4 Years as of July 2019
Sex: Female
Weight: Approx. 22 pounds
Good with Dogs: Yes
Good with Cats: Yes
Good with Kids: No
Heartworm Status:  Negative

Peggy is a spitfire, inquisitive, adventurous pinup of a girl that loves  to explore, catch frogs, and eat. Peggy walks well on a leash and rides well in a car.  She prefers to ride shotgun, in a car, and in the ride of life. She does well at the vetâs office and is fearless and independent in every situation.  Peggy has all of the stubborn and intelligent traits of a dachshund. She is very smart and knows how to sit and wait on command. Training her to do more commands would do well both for her mental aspect and to bond with her. 

Peggy has spent time with cats and shown no interest in them in the past. She enjoys romping and adventuring outside, at her own pace and in her own time. She is the kind of girl that would love nothing more than to take an African safari if given the opportunity in order to hunt new adventure. Peggyâs ideal home would include a family that understood the personality traits of a dachshund and could allow her the independence of a teenage human and opportunities to explore that she so greatly craves. She is not interested in being coddled and dressed up, but she is interested in being a companion. If you think Peggy is your girl, please see our contact info below!

name: Tank
description:
**Required Rottweiler breed experience** 

Name: Tank
Breed: Rottweiler 
Age: Approx. 2 Years as of July 2019
Sex: Male
Weight: Approx. 85+
Good with Dogs: Selective, would prefer laidback friends or ideally be an only dog
Good with Cats: No
Good with Kids: Older teenagers if any
Heartworm Status:  Negative

Tank is a handsome hunk, who came to us after being discovered as an unclaimed stray by a local farmer. Tank has been treated for heartworms and has worked hard spending time learning how to be a dog. He tries very hard and is eager to please his human. Tank knows how to sit and wait on command. He walks well on a leash and rides well in a car. He does well in a fenced in area, and loves to socialize with people. He is big and sloppy, and a very good boy.

 Tank is the kind of boy that needs a confident owner. Because of his shady, we assume horrible, past and the things he has had to learn with us, we think that he spent a lot of time without food, water, love, and guidance. As such, he is not a fan of sharing his food or toys, as he is scared someone will take them away from him. He doesnât mean to be rude, but he will try and push boundaries if he isnât given proper restrictions, thus the need for breed experience in his adoption. Tank has been working hard to gain weight since his bout with heartworms and being dumped. He is still in need of gaining more weight and is continuing to work on this while he waits for his forever family to find him. If Tank finds a compatible dog friend, he must be fed separately from the other dog in the home. Tank is a good boy, he just needs guidance to be the best boy he can be in your particularly lifestyle. Interested in Tank? Check out our application below!

----

name: Branna
description:
Name: Branna
Dog friendly: No
Cat friendly: No
Kid Friendly: Yes! 
Breed: Blue Pitbull Terrier/German Shepherd/Rottie Mix
Age: 5 years old (as of 2019)
Heartworm Status: Negative

She is a Blue Pitbull Terrier/German Shepherd/Rottweiler Mix. She is very friendly, adventurous and LOVES any sort of affection. Would make a great family dog. Branna has been with us most of her life as the last of her litter to come through our doors because she is a princess and wants to find just the right family that appreciates her and sees her as the center of their universe. 


She's a big fan of chasing tennis balls and toys, and she's all about sitting on your foot when things are slow. Branna-Banana is very eager to please. She loves people very much is as careful to watch facial expressions in order to anticipate the next move or adventure, and listens attentively so she knows best how to please. She's a very intelligent girl. 

She is obedient and is downright cuddly when a lap presents itself - she has no idea she's more than 20 lbs! She is a good companion dog to the right person and situation and such a goofball. Branna is a total cuddle bug for folks and so eager to please she sin danger of turning herself inside out at times. She gives the best kisses around and thinks she is a lapdog, especially when she gets scared. She's is playful and goofy and gentle and fun loving with folks.

description:
Name: Benny
Breed: Labrador Retriever/American Pit Bull Terrier mix, possibly some great dane.Â

Good with Dogs: Yes
Good with Cats: Unknown, can test for an approved applicant upon request

Benny is a goofy, good-natured, initially shy boy that likes to sneak up in your heart when youâre not paying attention and just steal it away. Benny came to us when a lot of new changes happened in home and he and his owners, though all doing their best, couldnât quite make the transition. 

Benny loves to play. He is gentle and silly. He has the biggest smile in the entire world, and it lights up the room when he gets his behind scratched. Benny loves treats and is gentle in taking them. He walks wonderfully on a leash and is doing well with crate training. He is housebroken and has no known allergies at this time. He is lean in build and due to his Labrador heritage tries very hard to come up on point, but those ears just wonât quite cooperate, much to our amusement.

Benny is a wonderful boy that would make a solid family dog. Benny weighs approximately 55 lbs. He is currently available for adoption and is just waiting for your application to come through!Â

Austin is a stunning German Shepard Mix. He is house trained and fully vetted. He is good with kids, other dogs, and cats. He was rescued from an abandoned house along with his siblings. He is feral and is about 70% rehabbed. He would do best in a home with other dogs. His perfect adopter would be one that not only understands his situation but is willing to put the time in to teach him his job, which is to be a good family dog. He is very responsive to teaching but needs personal attention on his journey to being at peace with being a family dog. He has been with a professional trainer and knows commands and does very well on the leash for a young age. He needs to be with a family who understands and embraces his shyness and can continue to work with him.Â

Amos came to us from a horrible abuse/neglect case, but that has not broken his spirit in the slightest. He is very friendly and loving and would love to have a family to call his own! His favorite things include belly rubs at any time of day, for hours at a time if possible, chicken, hugs, and kids. He is a large, lightly toasted marshmallow that can be squished at will and will distribute big sloppy kisses upon request. He would LOVE to steal your couch! He is a good boy, who is gentle and sweet. He has no known allergies and loves to get treats at every golden opportunity. Appreciative of butt scratchies at any time of the day, he likes to chill in the backseat for car rides. He is easy going and doesn't mind a jaunt around the yard. He does fine on a leash. He is afraid of thunderstorms and turns into a bowl of jello at the first rumble of thunder.Â

name: Alice
description:
Name: Alice
Breed: American bulldog/Lab mix
Age: Approximately 2 Years as of April 2019
Sex: Female
Good with Dogs: Yes
Good with Cats: Unknown, can test for approved applicant upon request.
Good with Kids: Yes
Heartworm Status: Negative. Alice had heartworms and has recently had her injections. We expect her to be negative at the end of her rest period portion of heartworm treatment. 

Alice and her sister Libby came to us from a truly horrible neglect situation in late 2018. You see, Alice and her sister were found chained in the back of an abandoned rental property in Fort Valley. They had clearly been used to make puppies, probably for sale. Their owners, to use the term as loosely as possible, had abandoned them when he left the rental property. Alice and Libby were both terrified when they came to us. They had clearly had zero medical care and bare minimum human contact. 

Now, however, after many months of love and patience, Alice and Libby both are noticeably coming into their own personalities and relaxing. They have received medical care and are up-to-date on their needs, and have filled out nicely with good food. Alice is 40 pounds. Both Alice and Libby are on the hunt for their forever homes, either together or separately. 

She took to having a soft bed and a full food bowl like a duck to water. It has truly been gratifying to watch her progress over the last few months. Alice enjoys her food with gusto and gets excited when she is inside the rescueâs buildings with other dogs around her. She picks up on the energy of those around her and excels when there is love and happiness proffered to her.

Alice is ready for the next steps in her life. She has come around beautifully! She is a maternal in nature, friendly, initially bashful, goofy, silly girl that can rock pearls and bathe in a pool of water all in the same half hour. She loves to play with her canine friends at the rescue, of which she has many, large and small. She is not averse to meeting new people, although she is very bashful about it initially. She is a gentle girl that is shy about learning new experiences, but does so anyway, sometimes when youâre not looking. Alice walks perfectly on a leash and seems to appreciate the idea that an adventure awaits her at the leashâs destination. While she does not enjoy riding in a car, she simply turns into a puddle of sadness in the backseat or her crate while on the ride.

Aliceâs ideal home would include a family that understands her past trauma and knows that there is going to be teaching and patience involved in helping her heal from the wrong done to her. We look forward to seeing her continue to blossom into the beautiful flower she is.

----

name: Libby
description:
Name: Libby
Breed: Boxer mix
Age: 2 Years as of May 2019 
Sex: Female
Good with Dogs: Yes! Libby loves other dogs.
Good with Cats: Unknown, can test for approved applicant. However, based on her mannerisms and temperament, we donât think sheâd have a problem with kitties!
Good with Kids: Yes, although older kids preferred.
Heartworm Status:  Negative

Libby is a beautiful chocolate swirled brindle girl that is shy and wants to be so friendly, but is still learning how to trust. Libby came to us after a call came in from the local police department asking for assistance in evaluating whether two dogs they had been put in charge of were aggressive or not. Imagining the worst, instead our staff manager and assistant found two miserable, broken hearted little dogs huddled behind a recently deserted rental property, chained up and terrified. Libby and what we suspect to be her biological sister Alice, were left to fend for themselves for an unknown period of time. They were both a horribly strong heartworm positive, crawling in insects, and had lost some hair and most of their self confidence. They have truly seen the very worst that this life, and humans, have to offer. 

After many months of gentle and consistent care by our loving staff, Alice and Libbyâs personalities are both blossoming. While Alice has bloomed a bit faster than Libby, Libby is starting to get the hang of it. She is still learning to trust. Libby is afraid of new situations and only wants to be feel safe, warm, and well fed. She takes great confidence from her sisterâs and other dogsâ presences and does best when she is around other dogs. She enjoys romping with them when she thinks no one is watching. She is still learning. She doesnât really understand what toys are, she doesnât understand what it is to be in a stable home life. But she does understand when kindness is shown to her. She does understand a soft dog bed and the companionship of other dogs. She does understand when her food bowl being consistently full, and she is so grateful! 

Libby is 37 pounds. She has been fully vetted, her heartworms treated and her skin cleared up. She does walk well on a leash. She understands and appreciates having a safe place to hide, her crate. Libbyâs ideal home environment would include a safe, loving, and perceptive family that understand her past trauma and is willing to work with her to teach her that she doesnât have to be afraid of this life. She would probably come to her full potential in having another dog friend that she can learn from and follow after as part of her pack. Libby is not broken, but she does need guidance to continue to grow- but donât we all need something like that?

----

name: Molly
description:
Name: Molly
Breed: German Shepherd/Wirehaired terrier mix Â 
Age: 1-2 Years as of April 2019
Sex: Female
Good with Dogs: Yes
Good with Cats: Unknown, would be willing to test for approved applicant
Good with Kids: Yes, older kids only.
Heartworm Status: Negative

Molly is sweet, small girl that weighs approximately 30 pounds. Molly and her best friend in the world, Callie, were trapped by another local rescue and brought to us for help. From the way that they act, it is clear that they have had very little socialization prior to their coming to live with us. Callie has since found her forever home and is thriving in a stable, happy, calm home environment. We have continued working with Molly, and she is now able to walk on a leash quite comfortably and accept pets from the staff. She is able to be touched and handled; she freezes on contact.Â 

Molly needs a family or individual that will devote significant time to her and show her that the world is nothing to fear. She needs someone to teach her that life is a happy place, where there is love and nothing to be afraid of. Molly socializes well with other dogs and is all about playing with them and romping in the yards on a regular basis. She enjoys rough housing with multiple large canine friends and appreciates hanging out with our other resident small dogs. While she has not met a cat at the time of this writing, based on her temperament and reaction to small dogs, we donât think cats would be an issue, although we would of course test prior to any placement with them. She is sweet, good-natured, and happy, just unsure of what is acceptable and what is not, so her ideal home would be willing to show her all of that.

Because of Mollyâs current fears, she will require multiple meet and greets to ensure both she and her potential adopters are comfortable with each other.Â

name: Norah
description:
Name: Norah
Breed: Labrador retriever
Age: Approx. 3 Years as of April 2019
Sex: Female
Good with Dogs: Yes
Good with Cats: Unknown, but can test for approved applicant upon request. Based on her temperament, we suspect she would be fine with kitties!
Good with Kids:  Yes
Heartworm Status:  Negative

Norah came to us with what we are guessing is her biological family member, Margo in mid-2018 from what was initially described to us as a hoarding case in Twiggs County. As we learned more about their origination, our hearts broke for these poor mama dogs. Because when they came to us, they did indeed have three puppies between them, all three of which were approximately 6 weeks old. Norah and Margo have been through a personal purgatory that if a person had gone through, they would be hailed as superheroes. They and 36 other dogs of similar breed and ages were on a property under what from all reports has been described as a den of horrors. None of them had any sort of medical care, all were living in pens outside with little to no shelter. Many had teeth rotten from a steady diet of white bread. Little to no human contact was given to any of them.

Despite all of this, they were the best moms to their puppies. The puppies grew up and have since found forever homes of their own where they are loved and cared for. Norah and Margo both have spent extra time with us learning about people, socializing with other dogs, and getting plenty of medical care and a steady diet of good food. They have both been so appreciative. Itâs truly been a wonder to see their personalities blossom! 

Norah is a flirt. She likes to give you a big puppy smile and dance away from you just out of reach when you go to tickle that little pointy face of hers. Her zoomies are the best; sheâs like a blonde tornado of glee. She likes treats and to dance with Margo. Sheâs a rough and tumble tomboy that likes laid-back personalities in her canine companions. She gets along great with our small dogs and plays in the yard with them every day. She does fine with other big dogs as long as they arenât overly dominant. Despite her horrific past, she has no problems with things like food or resource guarding. Sheâs a soft, gentle, big bottomed girl that is still learning about how nice it is to be part of a pack that includes people. She is not a fan of the camera shutter sound and pretends to be a walrus with big eyes when itâs around.

Norah is still learning the ropes of walking on a leash completely comfortably, and she is making good progress. Her ideal family would include someone that appreciates her courage and is willing to give her the patience and love she needs to bridge that last gap of going from rescue dog to full fledged, comfortable member of a family. It may take her a couple of meetings with her potential family to really get a good sense of her goofy personality; this will be determined by our manager on a case-by-case basis. Norah tips the scales at approximately 60 pounds.

name: Zennith
description:
****Available for adoption to experienced dog owners of working/âdifficultâ dog breeds (I.e German Shepherd Husky, Akita, Heeler, etc) ****

Name: Zennith
Breed: German Shepherd
Age: Approx. 5 Years as of April 2019
Sex: Female
Good with Dogs: Yes, however no small dogs. Also because of her past she is picky until she gets to know the dog.
Good with Cats: No
Good with Kids: Yes, although older teenagers if any are preferred. 
Heartworm Status:  Negative. Zennith had heartworms and has recently had her injections. We expect her to be negative at the end of her rest period portion of heartworm treatment. 

Zennith came from a tough family situation by way of Macon-Bibb Animal Welfare (animal control). Zennith spent the first portion of her life living with her then mate, Apollo, and two of their puppies, all of whom are currently with us. While their owner truly did love them, none of them received adequate medical care and were in a half-starved, terrified state when they came to us in late 2018. From what we know, they had spent their lives living outside exclusively and had rarely met other dogs. They were scared, defensive, and worried about their survival. After many months of gentle and persistent socialization and getting her up-to-date on medical care, Zennith is ready to find her forever home!

Zennith is a maternal, solid girl that tips the scale at 75 pounds. Her thick fur and sweet personality remind us of a teddy bear. She has learned to walk on a leash with us, and appeciates having a âsafe zoneâ in the form of her crate. She is working hard to learn about potty training and is doing better by the day. Zennith is a highly intelligent girl that learns well and pays close attention to her handler. When she first meets people, she is a little stand off-ish until she realizes that they are her friend. Because of this, Zennith may need multiple meeting with her new family before she is ready to hop in the car with them and go home. This will be determined on a case-by-case basis with our manager. When Zennith is comfortable with her people and surroundings, she opens up like the delicate blossom that is her personality. She is loyal to her handler and focused on learning. While she isnât overly playful and is quite serious, she is a good girl that appreciates all that she is given. She is gentle and an example of what it means to be a strong survivor of tough situations. Zennith is ready for her forever family that can continue to show her the ropes of being part of a family!

----

name: Darcy
description:
Name: Darcy
Breed: Shar Pei/Boxer mix
Age: 1-2 Years as of April 2019
Sex: Female
Good with Dogs: Yes
Good with Cats: Unknown, Can test for approved applicant upon request 
Good with Kids: Yes
Heartworm Status: Negative. Darcy is on her crate rest phase of her heart worm treatment, and we expect her to be negative at the end of her treatment cycle! 


Darcy is a sweet tempered, gentle, loving little warrior. She came to us as an unclaimed stray who had clearly been severely neglected to the point that every bone in her body was visible to the naked eye. Her large, pleading eyes tore us up right down to the soul. Thankfully, she found her way to us where she has blossomed on the outside into the beautiful girl that we have always seen that she is on the inside. 

 Despite her hard beginning, Darcy is a sunbeam of happiness. She loves people very much and worships the ground they walk on. She is gentle and well-mannered and loves to romp with her dog friends here at the rescue. Because of her hard beginning, Darcy has a touch of separation anxiety and wails like a broken soul when she is initially left alone in a crate. She does overcome this given a bit of time, but her crate just isnât her favorite place to be, although she is grateful for a soft bed to sleep on inside of it. While she is physically finishing up the healing process of her past, her emotional resistance to being separated from her folks is likely to linger a while longer. 

Darcy is still learning how to walk well on a leash, her future adopter should be aware she may do better with a harness and a little more thorough training. When she is excited, which is always especially evident when there is food around, her stumpy little tail hits warp speed. She is a very endearing little girl that only wants someone to love her and appreciate her. She is a doll and ready for her forever family to find her! She weighs in at 35lbs of pure love!

----

name: Patches
description:
Name: Patches
Breed: Terrier/bulldog mix
Age: 1 year old As of March 2019
Sex: Male
Good with Dogs: Yes
Good with Cats: Unknown, would be willing to test for approved applicant
Good with Kids: Yes, older kids preferred
Heartworm status: negative

Patches is a sweet, small little boy who has a minor cleft palate which will never require surgery and doesn't bother him at all. He weighs in at approximately 30 pounds and is not expected to grow any larger. He is a forever puppy! Patches and his brother Murphy were picked up as strays by a caring couple; they found them on the side of the road in a ditch with their deceased father. We have been working with them, and Patches is now able to walk on a leash and accept pets from the staff. Where he once was so afraid of anyone trying to handle him, now Patches has come alive and is ready to play, play, play! Patches is a HUGE fan of doggie-daycare-playtime! 

Patches needs a family and best friend of his very own! He needs to continue to experience new things, like sleeping on a couch or how to fetch and return a toy. Patches socializes well with other dogs and is all about playing! He enjoys rough housing with Murphy and the other small and large dogs at the rescue. He appreciates romping with our other residents, and is easy going and non-discriminating about his friends. He is sweet, good-natured, and happy, just unsure in new social situations, but willing to learn with patience from his handler.

name: Shane
description:
Name: Shane
Breed: Labrador Retriever mix
Age: 8 months as of February 2019
Sex: Male
Good with Dogs: Yes
Good with Cats:  unknown, but can test for approved applicant. Based on temperament, we think he'd be fine!
Good with Kids: Yes
Heartworm Status: Negative

Shane is a strong, handsome, genial, excited-about-life, sunny, joyful kind of boy. Shane is also a fighter. Shane came to us when the county sheriff's department found him on the side of the road after having been hit by a car and apparently laying in a ditch for at least a few days. Shane's back legs were shattered, and he has been through extensive surgery and is beginning his physical therapy that includes strengthening, short walks. He is named after his rescuer and friend in the police department, whom we are so grateful to for saving this lover. Shane never stopped smiling through the entire ordeal of surgery, healing, and growing. The surgeon that performed surgery on him got a real kick out of his excited, happy personality while he was recovering. If you couldn't see his funny haircut, you'd never know anything horrible had ever happened to him. Watching him heal has been a true miracle and example of cheerful determination to us all at the rescue.

 Shane is an active, perky, silly clown of a little boy that loves life and lives it to its fullest. He is a youngester that loves to play until he drops, and can get impatient with the movement restrictions he has had placed upon him until recently so that he can heal properly. Shane is a lover. He would do well in any family structure. Shane is approximately 30 pounds and we do not believe he will grow to be a very large dog and will stay in the medium sized dog range. Shane walks well on a leash and has done well riding in the car. He is crate trained and housebroken.


----

name: Lucy (4)
description:
****This dog requires an adopter that is experienced handling working breed dogs and knows the demands these dogs require. Working breeds include but are not limited to German Shepherds, Akita, Australian Cattle Dogs, etc ****

Name: Lucy (4)
Breed: Belgian Malinoise
Age: 3 years old (as of 2019)
Sex: Female
Good with Dogs: Yes
Good with Cats: No
Good with Kids: Yes, ages 12 and up. 
Heartworm Status: Negative

Lucy is a gentle, observant, spunky, athletic, intelligent girl that was surrendered to us when her owner's changing living situation moved her near a herd of goats. Rather than see her and her brother meet untimely ends due to not being able to turn down the chance to snack on goats, Lucy and her brother Buck are now looking for homes! At the time of this writing, we request that they be adopted together, although we may be willing to consider attempting to separate them if the right home comes along. 

Lucy is a sweet, classy girl that absolutely loves chasing a laser pointer. She is all about playing with toys of any variety, and has deep concentration on her tasks at hand. She knows the following commands: Sit, stay, roll over, shake (from both paws!) and likes to chase frisbees. Lucy tends to pick one person and really stick with them and become her best friend, although she is amenable to people of all walks of life. 

When Lucy was a puppy, she managed to get into some pesticide, and suffered a small reaction to it. This has had no long term affects that must be maintained, although she does \"space out\" a bit when a loud noise occurs near her, like a gunshot or fireworks. She is quick to snap out of it and it has no lasting affects on her behavior. Lucy is a bit of a Houdini that requires a supervising eye on her. 

Lucy rides great in a car and is approximately 60 pounds and enjoys being fattened up!

Lucy is a quick learner and very gentle with people she has just met. She walks wonderfully on a leash and listens to her commanding person with attention. One of her favorite games is to be told to sit, and then see how long she can hold it while her person goes on about their business. She likes having a \"job\" but she does not depend on it for her life's purpose. She loves her brother Buck very much, and we would simply love to see them find their forever - and goat free- home together! 

----

name: Genesis
description:
This butterball of love is all ready for her forever and ever home! 

Name: Genesis
Sex: Female
Breed: American Boxer
Age: Approximately 10 years as of February 2019
Good with Dogs: Yes, though no small dogs.
Good with Cats: Yes
Kids: Yes. Genesis LOVES children of all ages!
Heartworm Status: Positive. Due to her age and somewhat compromised immune system, we feel it is risky to put Genesis through heartworm treatment and are opting for the \"slow kill\" method.

Genesis is nothing but solid love in a goofy, awkward footed, happy-go-lucky 65 pound butterball of happiness. She is every bit as wonderful to hug as she looks, and is nothing but a huge sponge of love and kisses! Genesis lost her family the week before Christmas in December of 2018 when her family went through a divorce. She has been heartbroken, and doesn't understand why the kids that she loves so much haven't come back for her. She is the epitome of compassionate, eager-to-please love. She would be perfect as a kind of therapy dog for older, younger, and every age in between people, and a best friend to anyone that extends the hand of friendship to her. Genesis is wonderful! She loves hugs, but most of all she really love bellyrubs. She immediately falls to the floor when you offer and starts to roll around, asking for you to continue, much to our amusement.

Genesis is crate trained and loves everyone that she meets, whether they are canine or human. We believe she has lived with cats before, but we would be willing to test this again if needed. However, we do think she would be fine with them. She walks great on a leash and listens well to her humans. She wants nothing more than to love, please, and be loved in returned.

As mentioned, Genesis has a somewhat compromised immune system because she has skin cancer on her belly. It has been removed to give her some comfort. The cancer also accounts for the spots on her face. They do not seem to bother her on a day-to-day basis. Please consider opening your heart and home to this perfect girl! Somewhat older does not mean that there is no love left to give. 

-----
Peach County Animal Rescue is a rescue located in Fort Valley, GA. Our adoption fees range from $175-350+. On average, our fees are $250. 
Although our rescue dogs share a common bond with one another, no rescue story is the same (even when similar). Vetting costs vary depending on their health conditions. Our calculations show, that if you included the 1st year of vetting, training, the cost of a purchased dog; your costs would exceed $500+ dollars for initial investment. For us, it is NEVER about the money. We are a NON-PROFIT. It is all about the well-being of the dog. If you can't make the initial investment and appreciate the value of one of our dogs...then we can't ensure that you are committed to the pet for it's LIFETIME and will give them to best quality of life. At the end of the day, we hope everyone can appreciate that our efforts, time and commitment is solely in the best interest of our beloved dogs to ensure they are NEVER FAILED again. Thank you for your love and support! All of our dogs are fully vetted: up-to-date on annual shots, spayed/neutered and microchipped with a lifetime registration. We look forward to hearing from you!

name: Harper
description:
***Available for adoption to experienced dog owners of working/difficult dog breeds (I.e German Shepherd Husky, Akita, Heeler, etc) ***
Name: Harper
Age: Approx. 3-4 Years as of April 2019
Breed: German Shepherd Dog possible Belgian Malinois mix
Good with Kids: Children aged 12 and up
Good with Dogs: No
Good with Cats: No
Heartworm Status: Negative

Harper is a beautiful German Shepherd that is a credit to her lineage in terms of looks and personality. She has a drive to do a good job. Harper listens attentively, and works to follow commands the best she knows how. We really think that she would do well under any sort of training her new family would care to put her through. Harper is the kind of girl that would excel as a working dog with a job. Harper's ideal family would involve no kids, but instead a couple or a single person looking for companionship and looking to have a lifelong friend that they could devote their attention and patience towards.Harper is does well in her crate and great on a leash. She likes to have a job to do, and takes her job of patrolling the grounds seriously. She has taken it upon herself to be the guardian of our staff, and she loves her people very much. Harper isn't much for toys, but instead prefers to be on guard and working. She loves chicken! She is great at catching treats and rarely misses. She is very careful with her food not to alarm the person offering it to her. She is quite gentle with people that she knows are the alpha. Harper is currently 75 pounds. Harper is very intelligent and quite serious.Harper may require multiple meet and greets to get an accurate gauge of her personality.

---

description:
Name: Lilly
Breed: American Staffordshire Terrier with possible Boxer mix
Age: Approx 3 years old (as of 2019)
Sex: Female
Good with Kids: Yes
Good with Dogs: No
Good with Cats:  No
Heartworm Status: Negative

Lilly and what we presume to be her sibling Mack, came to reside with us after they were dumped at a local elderly couple's home. Lilly manifests her anxiety at the stress of having to fend for herself for an undetermined period of time prior to coming to us by not wanting to deal with other dogs at the present time. She would prefer to be an only girl in the center of her adopter's universe! Lilly is a sweetheart that likes treats and bum scratchies. She excels at the sad hippo expression that melts you into a puddle of goo. She is a velvet hippo that is wonderful and amenable to being hugged, kissed on, and dressed up. She would make a wonderful best friend to a single person or a great family dog with no other pets.

Lilly is approximately 60 pounds and walks fairly well on a leash. She is crate trained and house trained.

name: Noel
description:
Name: Noel
Breed: American Pitbull Terrier
Age: Approx. 2 years old (as of 2019)
Sex: Female
Good with Dogs: Not at this time. 
Good with Cats: No
Good with Kids: Yes
Heartworm Status: Positive. Noel's potential adopter must be willing to work with us to continue his prescribed treatment plan.

Noel is a wonderful petite lady that loves to romp and play as the days are long. She's an active little gal that beams happiness from her head to her tail! She absolutely loves treats like no ones business and who can blame her! Noel is a true delight to be around. She lives for smooches and bellyrubs in particular. And ohhh the joy of butt-scratchies! Noel is playful, gentle, and would make the greatest best friend!

Noel came to us after having been discarded like so much trash after what we can only assume was a failed backyard breeding experiment. Noel was \"used\" and dumped off, where a good Samaritan asked for our assistance in getting her well and finding her a loving home. If you were not able to see her physical signs of having been bred - which will reduce in time- you would never know from her temperament of the trauma of her past. She walks well on a leash, rides equally well in a car, and loves to cuddle and smooch. She accepts treats gently and gratefully. Noel would make a perfect best friend, and it is therapeutic to be in her presence. You can't leave her without a big smile, which is an inverse relationship to her size- Noel is tiny! She is approximately 32 pounds soaking wet. Noel is a treasure of a velvet hippo that you just come away wanting more!

----

name: Diesel
description:
Name: Diesel
Breed: American Staffordshire Terrier
Age: Approx. 3 Years (As of April 2019)
Good with Dogs: Yes
Good with Kids: Yes, older children preferred
Good with Cats: Unknown, would be willing to test for approved applicant. 
Heartworm Status: Negative

Diesel is a handsome boy with a heart of solid gold. Diesel came to us very unexpectedly when we found him chained to our front gate. We feel so bad for his previous family; how hard of a situation it must have been to abandon their family member with us. Diesel was very obviously loved; he had a rough time understanding that he was going to be our guest for the first week, and understandably was terribly heartbroken when the reality set in.

Diesel hasn't let his past define him though. Diesel is a lovely velvet hippo that has gotten along with every dog he has met in his time with us. He LOVES car rides more than anything else, and he has the best happy face with the breeze blowing in his face! He needs a little work when it comes to walking on a leash, simply because he is so exuberantly excited about his new adventures waiting just around the bend that he will give you a work out!  Diesel is crate trained, house trained is very even tempered and a well behaved boy. And yes, he is exactly as satisfying to hug on as he looks! He is 60 pounds of pure squishy.  

Are you Diesel's new family? Please read on about how to apply today!

------

name: Phillip
description:
****Please read his bio before applying for adoption!****
Note Phillip requires multiple meet and greets.

Name: Phillip
Age: 2 (2017)
Breed: Pomeranian/Dachshund mix 
Temperament: Feral, very shy, is a bit more friendly once he gets to know you.
Good with Dogs: Good with other small dogs, doesnât like big dogs. 
Good with Cats: Unknown, can test for an approved applicant, but based on temperament, we believe he would be fine.
Good with Kids: No

Phillip is extremely unsocialized, he came from a hoarding situation where he was never properly cared for and was in bad shape. He is what we classify as feral, with 20% rehab. He's definitely come out of his shell since we first rescued him. If you are looking for a dog that will be all over you and shower you with immediate love, then Phillip is not for you. He'd be a great companion dog to another small dog! He is very much a pack animal and loves the company of another pup. He runs away from you when heâs in the yard. Heâs really a quiet boy and he will have accidents when heâs scared. You can pick him up and you can pet him if heâs cornered or in a crate, but he still tends to be very jumpy. He likes to play outside and doesnât tear anything up such as toys or blankets. He will not walk on a leash therefore he cannot live in an apartment or without a fence. Your patience will pay off with this sweet boy. Remember, Phillip was failed by the human who had him. It is our goal to show him we are not here to hurt him, but to love him. He needs some TLC, time & patience. He is a project dog, who just needs to learn to trust again.

name: Gus
description:
****Please read his bio before applying for adoption!****
Note Gus requires multiple meet and greets.

Name: Gus
Age: 2 (2017)
Breed: Pomeranian/Dachshund mix
Temperament: Feral, shy, a little more friendly once he gets to know you.
Good with Dogs: Good with other small dogs, does not like big dogs. 
Good with Cats: Unknown, can test for an approved applicant, but based on temperament, we believe he would be fine.
Good with Kids: No

Gus is extremely unsocialized, he came from a hoarding situation where he was never properly cared for and was in horrible condition. He is what we classify as feral being about 20% rehabbed. Gus has come out of his shell somewhat since we originally rescued him. When he is out in the yard he runs away from you and barks. If you are looking for a dog that will be all over you and shower you with immediate love, then Gus is not for you. He would be a great companion dog to another small dog. He is very much a pack animal and follows wherever the herd goes, he is very playful with other small dogs. He is feral and 20% rehabbed. He will require TLC, time and patience. He does not like to be picked up, he doesnât like loud noises, he will snap and bite if he is scared. As of now he does shred toys, beds and blankets. He is jumpy when you touch him, when he allows you to touch him. Your patience is key with this boy. Remember, he was failed by the human who had him. It is our goal to show him we are not here to hurt him, but to love him. His favorite thing is treats! Please note that Gus is still having a hard time learning to use a leash therefore he would not be fit to live in an apartment. He does need a home with a fenced yard because of his current fears and tendency to bolt.

name: Morticia
description:
Name: Morticia
Breed: Boxer/Plott hound mix
Age: Approx. 4 years old (as of 2019)
Sex: Female
Good with Kids: Yes
Good with Cats: No
Good with Dogs: Yes, though no small dogs
Heartworm Status: Negative. Morticia has been treated for heartworms.

Morticia is an absolute blessing to have in your company. She weighs approximately 45lbs and is a solid wall of love and kisses. Morticia loves to cuddle, and loves to mooch chicken treats out of your pockets at every opportunity. Morticia came to us via Macon Bibb Animal Welfare after she was discovered behind a an apartment complex with her older, but still nursing puppies. Her puppies were pulled away from her at the shelter and she was left to her own devices where she found herself on the euthanasia list, where we discovered her. Morticia forgives those that left her to die, however, and would probably kiss them given the opportunity. She rides great in a car and loves to go for walks and good naturedly loves to play with toys for a few minutes before she parks herself upon your foot and asks for butt scratchies. She is very sweet and gentle and would love to give you kisses for the rest of her days!

name: Coco
description:
Name: Coco
Breed: Rhodesian Ridgeback
Age: 4 years old (as of 2019)
Sex: Female
Good with Dogs: Yes, though does not like small dogs. 
Good with Cats: No
Good with Kids: Older kids preferred, 10 and up. Our only concern with smaller kids is that in her exuberance she might send a small kid flying by accident!
Heartworm Status: Negative

Coco is a funny, fun-loving girl that is easy going and gentle. She's an active girl that loves to play with her tennis ball more than anything in the whole world! She is very obedient about her ball and has good manners. She knows how to sit and wait on command. She isn't a fan of small critters. She likes to go for trots around the yard and loves to play. She likes to get a serious nap after a jaunt around the yard and tussle with toys with her friends. She is a big fan of people, naps, and back scratchies, as well as chicken and milk bone cookie treats. 

Coco is a sweetheart that we think would make a wonderful family dog. Coco is kennel trained, rides great in the car, and is sweet to our vet. She has no allergies that we are aware of at this time. When she has decided you are her person, which honestly doesn't take too long, she loves you to the moon and back. She is very loyal to her people and is very sad when she is left alone for long periods of time. She loves her tennis ball very much and is a playful girl that would make a wonderful best friend that enjoys adventures, walks, hiking, and being active.

----

name: Snoopy
description:
Name: Snoopy
Age: Approx 10 years old (Oct 2019)
Breed: Terrier/chihuahua
Sex: Male
Good with Kids: Yes, older kids only
Good with Cats: Unknown, can test for approved applicant
Good with Dogs: Yes
Heartworm Status: Negative

Snoopy is a goofy older gentleman. Our vet thinks Snoopy is about 10 years of age, but you would never, ever guess it when you meet him! Snoopy has lots of energy and LOVES to play and chase toys and have fun for as long as the day has hours. You may laugh at how his pictures seem to be all be at about the same angle - that's because he's quite difficult to get pictures of him where's NOT a blur of happy pinballing around the frame! He thinks he's Superman. He gets along fine with other dogs that don't mind exuberant outbursts of the zoomies and likes ear scratchies - though he literally never stops moving, so he would need a patient kind of companion. He is not aggressive towards them; just exuberant. He rides fine in the car and thinks his crate is a home away from home. Snoopy weighs in at about 20 lbs - he's quite a small dude!

Snoopy was kept on a runner outside of a trailer for his entire life that we know of. Because of his past background, he is food and treat possessive and is learning how to share. His ideal home would be one where his people understood his need to be fed separately and enjoyed his happy, exuberant energy. Because of his size and no prior health issues, we think Snoopy's approximate lifespan could go anywhere from 15-18 years - he still has a lot of time to love his folks in him!

----

name: Noble
description:
Name: Noble
Breed: American Pit Bull Terrier 
Age: Approx. 3 years as of Aug 2019
Sex: Male
Good with Cats: No
Good with Kids: Older teenagers only. Noble gets nervous with younger kids or kids that are excitable and becomes fearful. 
Good with other Dogs: Yes
Heartworm Status: Negative

Noble is a good boy. He is shy at first, and needs someone that is patient and has a gentle demeanor. He warms up quickly after meeting you, and fast becomes very, very playful! He love toys of all varieties, but really goes for the squeaky ones and the ropes that he can haul on. He is good with being in his crate for periods of time; he thinks of it as his safe spot and refuge. He is a playful boy whose ears flap in the breeze when he gets very excited. He bounces like a big puppy - which isn't far off. He's a youngin'! He is protective of his food, which is something we are working on with him while he is under our care. His favorite thing in the world is to play tennis ball, endlessly if possible. Noble was taunted and teased mercilessly by children in his past life, so he is not a fan of them now. He travels well in the front seats of cars. He is confident, a clown, and very intelligent.

name: Yoshi
description:
Name: Yoshi
Breed: American Bulldog Mix
Age: 4.5 Years Old (As of March, 2019)
Sex: Male
Temperament: Very Friendly
Good W/ Kids: YES
Good W/ Dogs: YES
Good W/ Cats: No
Heartworm Status: Positive. Potential adopter will need to be willing to work with the rescue to continue his heartworm treatment.

Yoshi would be great addition for any family! Yoshi is a big marshmallow that loves to play and give hugs. He likes to cuddle and he loves to chase toys, especially tennis balls! He is a big fan of playing with other dogs. He is eager to please his human. Yoshi is a very happy boy that loves to run and play, and is a DIE HARD tennis ball fan. He is an easy going, quick to learn boy that just wants to party and gives kisses for the rest of his days. He has learned how to open the cupboard where we keep his food - we weren't kidding when we said he was a very smart boy! 

His favorite thing in the whole world though, next to tennis balls, is food. He takes to learning commands with patient teaching very well. Yoshi is crate trained, house trained, and walks great on a leash. He is eager to look out the window when he gets to ride in a car. Yoshi is just a big lovebug that would be a wonderful best friend and adventure buddy. He would really love to be a hiking buddy or walking/jogging training partner. Please come meet Yoshi today! This boy is a chunky love and all ready to be your best friend!

----

name: Tonka
description:
Name: Tonka
Breed: Bulldog mix
Age: 12+ years old (as of 2019)
Good with Dogs: Submissive females
Good with Cats: Unknown (can test for approved applicant) We'd be surprised if Tonka had any issues with cats though. He's easy going!
Good with Kids: Yes
Heartworm Status: Negative. Tonka has undergone heartworm treatment.

Tonka's story is a sad one. Tonka was left abandoned in a house. Luckily, he was found just in time otherwise his story may have ended differently. He was left for roughly 2-3 weeks with food spread all over the floor and nothing but a 5 gallon bucket of water that was empty lying nearby. Who would abandon this boy? Luckily, movement was heard from this abandoned property, which led us to him. He is an older boy, but he is sweet, gentle and calm. He would be a great companion to anyone. He is a warrior, a survivor, a lover. We would love for him to live out the rest of his years with someone who can give him a lot of love to make up for lost time. It's hard to imagine how many years of his life he may have had filled with pain, suffering and lack of attention. Tonka can best be described as easy going, slower moving, gentle, and patient with people, even with tasks that aren't very pleasant, like cleaning one's ears or trimming his nails. Please consider adopting Tonka and changing his life! He may be an older boy, but he is not slowed down at all. He is engaged in his environment. His Clint Squint is to die for! He is a quiet, gentle old chap that loves to have his back scratches. He is as good natured as they come. 

----

name: Scarlett
description:
Name: Scarlett
Breed: Staffordshire Bull Terrier
Age: 5 Years old (as of 2019)
Temperament: Friendly
Good with Kids: We don't see why she wouldn't be, but at this time (due to new intake), we haven't tested. She does really well with our staff.
Good With Dogs: No
Good With Cats: No
Heartworm Status: Negative 

Scarlett is a small girl in stature, but she has a big heart. She has a stumpy tail that just about hits warp speed when she gets attention all of her own- and did you know it's completely possible to fit all 40 lbs of her into your lap? We've tested extensively, and it is completely possible. She LOVES to be hugged! 

Scarlett is a zesty girl, and likes to play, whether it's with her dog friends at the rescue or with her human friends. She is best at giving kisses. She likes to be doted upon and enjoys playing with her friends at the rescue. She is one that likes to watch - sometimes we wonder if she doesn't have a herding dog in her lineage because she is so intelligent and likes to supervise proceedings at the rescue to ensure things are attended to correctly. She gives approval by doling out kisses generously, and we just love her so much! If you can't adopt at the current time, please share Miss Scarlett to the best of your abilities. We would love very much to see this special girl in a home of her very own where she's treated like the wiggle-butt princess that she is! 

Scarlett walks great on a leash and rides well in a car. She gets excited to watch out the back window as much as possible. She is used to a crate.

----

name: Rocko
description:
Name: Rocko
Breed: American Bully
Good with Kids: YES!
Good with Cats: No
Good with Dogs: Yes, although he is not a big fan of dominant male personalities or small dogs. Rocko likes to be macho! 
Age: 6 years old, as of March 2019
Sex: Male
Heartworm Status: Negative

Rocko is a sweet Staffie. He is a fun-loving, happy cannonball of sunshine that loves life and his friends. He loves kids, and most other dogs. He does not do well with cats and small animals. He does great in a home environment and really loves having a family to love on. He is a big fan of kids especially. Rocko does a happy dance on his tippy-toes like an Irish Jig at every opportunity! He loves to shower you with slobbery kisses at any time of the day or night. He is VERY friendly and loves all sorts of people! He's always ready to party. In fact, the only time weâve ever seen him pout is when the toenail clippers come out.

He is a big fan of chicken and treats of any variety. He does not have any allergies that we have found. He's a great boy and would love to snore on your couch for the remainder of his days. Rocko is crate trained, house trained, and likes to go for a ride in the car.

Rocko came to us after his former owner committed suicide and Rocko had nowhere to go. We feel terrible about his past owner and so wish we could place Rocko in a loving home where he would have stability the rest of his days!  Rocko had luxating patellas when he came to us, which basically meant that his back legsâ knees moved in and out of joint.  This meant he had a hard time getting up and down stairs prior to surgery. He had an operation on both legs to correct this, and has healed from the surgery. He has no restrictions now.

description:
Name: Repo
Sex: Male
Breed:Purebred Pitbull Terrier (\"red nose\")
Age: 4 years old (As of 2019)
Good with Kids: Yes
Good with other dogs: Yes, tested and grew up with females
Cats: No
Temperament: Gentle, shy
Heartworm Status: Negative, Repo has been treated for heartworms successfully.

Repo is an active boy that gets on well with most dogs. He loves to play, especially with squeaky toys. He's quite friendly and thinks his best vantage point to laugh up at your face is by putting his paws on your waist and giving you kisses, once he gets to know you. He is one sweetie that think he is a macho male type, but is really a little mouse on the inside! Don't tell him that though, because he honestly thinks he's so sure of his place in the universe as the leader of the pack... until the nail trimmer comes out! Then he is instantly a chihuahua on the outside. Repo also thinks he is a Labrador Retriever - he loves to spend time playing in the water and kiddy pools at the rescue! He's not one much for tennis balls but squeaky toys definitely get his attention. He is very gentle and loves chicken treats!

Name: Paris
Breed: German Shepherd Mix 
Age: 5 years old (d.o.b. Jan 2014) 
Sex: Female 
Good with Kids: Yes
Good with Cats: Yes
Good with Dogs: Yes
Heartworm Status: Negative

Paris is the sister of Austin, also at our rescue. Austin and Paris both came from a litter of ferrel puppies. They both need an adopter that has experience with fearful feral dogs. Paris is not feral, but she is very, VERY timid about her surroundings and thrives on routine and baby talk.  Paris and Austin both respond well to training, but just need the time and investment of love that a true family environment can provide. They are both very intelligent dogs that need a serious injection of TLC. They respond well to routines and training.

name: Kermit
description:
Name: Kermit
Breed: Terrier Mix
DOB: 1/28/14
Temperament: Friendly
Good with other dogs: Does not like small dogs.
Good with Cats: unknown, but can test for approved applicant 
Good with kids: Yes
Heartworm Status: Negative

Kermit sadly was neglected and confined to a small cage, which prevented his legs from developing correctly. In turn, he does not walk like other dogs. He is the sweetest boy and deserves a great family. He loves bellyrubs above all else. He also really appreciates being put on a leash and walked for as long as his legs will let him...and then more bellyrubs. This is actually his preferred position, hence his crazy happy photos! He would make a great couch potato kind of dog, perfect family dog. He is very good natured and a jovial kind of dog that has no idea he is any kind of different. He loves to go for short jaunts and explore new places. He is overall a very happy boy and very eager to please. He walks well on a leash and rides great in the car.

----
Peach County Animal Rescue is a rescue located in Fort Valley, GA. Our adoption fees range from $175-350+. On average, our fees are $250.  All of our dogs are fully vetted: up-to-date on annual shots, spayed/neutered and microchipped with a lifetime registration. We look forward to hearing from you!

If you would like to send in an application for this dog, please use the link below! https://peachcountyanimalrescueandrehabilitation.org/apply-now-2/

name: Jordyn
description:
Name: Jordyn
Sex: Female
Breed: Boxer Mix
Age: 4 years old (As of Oct. 2019)
Temperament: Very Friendly
Good with Dogs: Yes, though she does not like dogs who are overly energetic, but instead prefers to be the energetic one in the equation. She can be selective when it comes to female dogs. 
Good with Cats: Unknown, can test for an approved applicant. 
Good with Kids: Yes, though she might be too exuberant for small children.
Heartworm Status: Negative 

Jordyn came to us as an unclaimed stray via Macon-Bibb Animal Welfare, the county animal control. We can't understand why no one ever came looking for her, because Jordyn is a lover! Jordyn has the most adorable underbite known to man. She loves to play and has plenty of puppy energy to spare! She is a ray of sunshine, and it's impossible to meet Jordyn, interact with her, and not walk away with a similar goofy smile. Jordyn is a doll, and a tiny one at that. She is approximately 35 pounds in weight. 

Jordyn walks well on a leash and enjoys a healthy jaunt around the premises.  She is a very active girl that is always on the go and has places to be! You will never be bored with Jordyn around. She enjoys her afternoon naps and her afternoon playtime, which usually includes a well loved tennis ball. Jordyn loves toys and has dog friends at the rescue that she gets along well with that tolerate her puppy energy and antics stoically. Her canine companions would need to also be willing to put up with her energy levels. Jordyn is a great girl that is eager to please and show you how cool the world is! She would make a great best friend.

----

name: Jimmy
description:
Name: Jimmy
Sex: Male
Age: 4 years old (As of 2019)
Breed: Lab Mix, possibly with shepherd or herding breeds
Temperament: Very Friendly, High Energy
Good with Dogs: No
Good with Cats: Unknown, but can test for approved applicant
Good with Kids: Yes
Heartworm Status: Negative

Jimmy is a very smart dog and would do well with a family that loves to adventure and spend time with him. He knows basic commands like sit, stay, back up, etc. He has thrived on being taught manners, and we think he would do well in any training that an owner would wish to put him through. He listens very well and is a very intelligent, thoughtful boy. Jimmy is dominant and to date has not liked other dogs at our rescue. At this time, we recommend him being the only dog. His ideal owner would be one that shows Jimmy how to act through example and is a leader in his or her own home. 

Jimmy enjoys having his back scratched, going for walks, and cuddling up on the comfiest blankets we have. He is a sweetheart that needs someone that can appreciate his brainpower as well as his handsome good looks. He is so squishy and sweet, and gives the best hugs. He is a big fan of chicken and does great on a leash. He is crate trained and rides well in a car. He is a great boy that enjoys being taught new things. Jimmy has lots of love to give!
