name: Chief
description:
MEET CHIEF!
Chief is a 3 year old, neutered-male Boxer mix.  
This sweet boy is still young, so he will benefit from some obedience training.  A fenced yard would be a nice place for Chief to have some freedom outdoors.  Chief would do best in a home with older children. 
We are just getting to know him, so check back for more updates on this handsome guy.  
Chiefâs adoption fee is $100.00.  That includes neuter, vaccinations, heartworm test (negative), flea and heartworm prevention, deworming, microchip (plus registration) and a 30 day pet insurance policy offer. 
** You can meet CHIEF on Adoption nights, which are held every Friday from 4-6pm at our office located at 169 E Jefferson Street, Franklin, Indiana 46131.
**If you are interested in giving CHIEF a loving forever home, please submit an adoption application from our website www.petelves.com.   Email petelvesrescue@gmail.com with any questions.

name: Oreo
description:
Oreois a very sweet puppy. She loves her siblings and her foster mama. She is part of the Candy Liter. The only thing we know for sure is mama is a GSD. Dad, well your guess is as good as ours.

She is about 11 weeks old. She spends her days eating, sleeping and playing just as all puppies do. She is pretty much house trained but does have access to the outside when the foster is home. She is up to date on all age appropriate vaccines, de-wormed, and micro-chipped. She will be a joy to add to any household.

If interested in adopting a pup from the Candy liter, please apply. Puppies are located in Franklin.

Note: A$150 refundable check, separate from adoption fee, will be neededto guarentee that she is spayed. When she is at the appropriate age, you contact us and we will pay for the spay. Your check can either be torn up or sent back to you.

name: Krackel
description:
Krackel is one of the Candy Liter. She is very playful and crashes hard after playing. She is a typical puppy in every sense of the phrase. We know momma Reeses is a GSD. Dad, well your guess is as good as ours. However, they do make beautifully unique puppies.

She is an active little pup who loves outside time, playing with her sisters and brother. She is up to date on all age appropriate vaccienes, de-wormed and micro-chipped. She is house trained but she does have access to outside when her foster is home through a doggie door.

If interested in adopting one of the Candy Liter, please apply. They are located in Franklin.

Note: a $150 refundable check will be needed at the adoption to guarentee she is spayed. Once she is at the age to be spayed, you contact us and we pay for the spay. We can tear up your check or send it back to you.

name: Percy
description:
Hello! I'm new to ODHS! I am a sweet, small 7 year old guy.  I found myself at a local shelter as a stray and no one came for me, so here I am!  While at the shelter they treated me for ear infections and found I don't hear very well (not sure if this is permanent or not), but I am a guy afterall (#selectivehearing).

Adoption donations are $250 for an adult, $350 for puppies (a dog under one year of age), and $125 for a senior dog (based on the age of the dog). All dogs are spay/neutered, have rabies, distemper vaccine, microchip, heartworm test if age appropriate, and are current on heartworm preventative. Adoption donations are accepted via cash or debit/credit card. There is a $5 fee to run a card.

Please remember to bring a collar and leash with you the day of the adoption. 

Fill out an application online prior to arriving to our adoption event. This greatly speeds up the adoption process and will ensure that the animal you are interested in will be at the event. Not all adoptable dogs can make it to all events, because they are cared for in foster homes. Our adoption events are most Wednesdayâs from 5-7pm and each Saturday from Noon until 4 PM on Saturdayâs at 3602 Lafayette Blvd, Suite 102, Fredericksburg, VA 22408. There are circumstances that we will not have an adoption event, so please email or check our Facebook prior to coming to ensure we will be open. 

We do receive HUNDREDS of emails daily. The fastest way to get a response is to fill out an application on our website, NOT by submitting an inquiry. Online applications get priority over applications filled out in person.

Visit our website for an application to adopt.  
https://www.olddominionhumanesociety.org/adoption-application

Please be patient. Old Dominion Humane Society is a volunteer based organization. We are run completely by volunteers, who also have full time jobs and families.

Like us on Facebook
www.facebook.com/OldDominionHumaneSociety and follow this dog's journey in finding a forever family.

Old Dominion Humane Society adopts to Virginia and the immediate surrounding states. There is a $50, out of state fee.

name: Sky
description:
Hello! I'm new to ODHS! I was surrendered by my owner because I was too much of a \"nervous Nelly\" and I paced a lot.  Maybe I need more exercise and mental stimulation, we will see.  I will need some time to relax and feel safe in your home.  Because of my super bionic ears, I do hear quite well and will definitely alert you when someone knocks on the door.  Men are quite tall and big, so they make me more nervous than women do.  I would do best in a home that doesn't have small children, but I seem to like calm dogs to play with.  I am about 30 lbs and between 1-2 years old.

name: Abbigale and Hoss
description:
Hi there! We are Hoss and Abbigale and we come as a pair of cuties! Together we weigh about 15 pounds, and around 6 years old. We do everything together like sit on your lap and sleep in our kennel. We do fine with other dogs, but we are not really interested in playing with them. We sleep quietly in our kennel and have had no accidents in there. The shelter environment and our foster home is new to us so we are a little timid. It took us a few hours before we warmed up to our foster family. For the most part we do a good job of using puppy pads. I Hoss (white and brown) do a good job on going outside on a leash, Abbigale (brown) prefers not to go outside. We would be best with older children (10+) as we are small and timid. It is also good to know that I (Hoss) have a pin in one of my front legs. It does not prevent me from running/jumping or having fun. We are both sweet and cuddly, we just need a family to call our own. We hope you will come and meet us on Saturday!

name: Reagan
description:
Hi! Iâm Reagan. I used to live my life on a chain and could never go in the house. I've had a lot of litters of puppies in my day. I was recently seized from a house by these nice animal control officers. They found out that I was heartworm positive and I also need a dental cleaning. But now I love the air conditioning and don't want to stay outside longer than I have to go to the bathroom. Which I normally do outside! I'm sweet as can be and I love cats and children. I walked a little bow-legged and would really benefit from joint supplements. Belly rubs are my favorite!

Note: I am heartworm positive because I never got the preventative in my prior home.  Iâll be treated and then Iâll just need 30 days of low activity to heal.

name: Baxter
description:
Dear future parents, Hi my name is Baxter and I am such a sweet boy. Iâm loving my life in my foster home right now! I get free range of the house because I seem to be fully house trained and I crate well when told to! I know basic commands like sit, down, and shake with both my paws. My favorite activity is laying in bed with my foster mom cause I love to snuggle so much! I also double as her body guard. I might be 9 y/o but that doesnât slow my long legs down when my foster family goes out to do activities. When you come to meet me ignore how shy I might seem because when you get me home I will be the most bestest doggo ever! 

Note:  In my prior home I didn't like it when people would \"play fight\" because that upset me and made me bite.  If I felt like someone was being hurt, I was going to protect that person.  So if you can work with me on this, I will be pretty easy to get along with otherwise.

name: Nellie
description:
Hey, Nellie here! Let me tell you a bit about me... I'm living in a foster home now with three other dogs and no kids or cats. I get along fairly well with the other canines, but they have been correcting me a bit lately (something about etiquette and personal space). I am a young and playful small dog with not too many cares in the world. I'm working on the potty training currently, but  the puppy pads are working great for me. I haven't done a lot of leash walking yet, I'm not super fond of it. I can get a bit persistent and riled up at times, I slept in the crate last night and although it's not my favorite place to be, I settle down after a bit. I have only been here for about a week and I am learning new dog skills every day. Its not that I don't like it here, but am looking for my forever family, a place to call home permanently! Ask about me or fill out the application! I am about a year old and 8lbs.

name: Erykah
description:
Hi there, Erykah here! Iâm a spunky little snuggle bug looking for my forever people. I love playing with other dogs but if you donât have another dog for me to play with, thatâs fine too because I just want to be your very best friend! I love being around my people and will follow you wherever you go! Whether thatâs on a walk or just hanging out on the couch, I just want to keep you company! 
I appear house and crate trained and have had ZERO accidents in my foster home! I also sleep quietly in my crate at night. Sometimes I bark for a minute or two when I first go into my crate but I settle down quickly if you just leave me be. 
Iâm very food motivated which means I can learn new things pretty quickly as long as youâre offering a treat! So far Iâve mastered âsitâ and âdownâ! My foster parents say Iâm pretty smart!
If you have room in your life for a fun little adventure buddy, Iâd love to meet you!

Note:  I am heartworm positive, so that means I need to have low activity until my treatment and 30 days of low activity after my treatment.  I can still be adopted though!

name: Trixie
description:
I'm a fun girl. I Iike to run zoomies in the house and jump up and cuddle with you! I like kisses, belly rubs and all the pets! I'm very food motivated. Can you believe I was a stray and no one came looking for me! 

Note: I do have a condition called âcherry eyeâ. Cherry eye is a disorder of the nictitating membrane (NM), also called the third eyelid. Cherry eye is most often seen in young dogs under the age of two. In many species, the third eyelid plays an essential role in vision by supplying oxygen and nutrients to the eye via tear production. If left untreated, tear production may stop. This can be treated with a simple surgery.  She's getting that surgery on 9/17 along with her spay as well.

name: Cardi
description:
Hello, my name is Cardi, although my foster mom usually calls me \"Sweet Girl\" or \"Pretty girl.\" I came to ODHS from a hoarding situation, and when I got to my foster house, I wouldn't even come out of the back of my crate for the first 2 days. Since they had me come out of my crate, they've been working with me a little more every day and they tell me how proud of me they are for making progress every day. I've been with my foster family for about a month now and I've gotten much more comfortable with them. I love to follow my foster mom around the house everywhere she goes. I wag my tail and do my happy dance when I see my foster family now. I went from being scared of them, to loving getting pets and treats from them. I love treats! I hardly ever run into my crate when they are home now, because I enjoy being out in the house with my foster fam. I do great with going potty outside in my little puppy pen. I stay in a crate when my humans leave the house and at bedtime. I have 3 human siblings (ages 7-11) in my foster family and 2 canine siblings that are both close to my size. I have done well with my human siblings because they are very calm and patient with me. I don't think I would like to be with young kids that don't know how to be patient and calm with me and give me my space to build up trust with them. I now love playing with dog toys and chasing balls. I love running around and playing with my 2 year old canine brother.  I'm not a big fan of my older canine foster brother though. I have come a long way during my time in my foster home, so although I'll have a transition period to go through in my new home, I know I would blossom with having a fur-ever family. I would love a family that understands that I will need time and patience to build up trust and know that they are good and love me and help me to understand that the world isn't so scary. Will you be that family?

My first adoption event will be 9/25, which is also my \"go home\" eligible date.

name: Alma
description:
Hi! Im Miss Alma. I'm a tiny lady looking for a place to chill to call my furever home. I came from a hoarding home in SC and so I'm learning to cuddle with my foster mama and explore the home. I get along with other dogs but I get grumpy about my space and prefer to sleep solo. My hobbies include eating and napping on very plush bedding. I am maybe 5lb but I sure do enjoy my canned dinners and my foster mama even warms them up for me because my precious eyes convince her I require that. These hoomans that cater to me make me get up and walk around. I'll do best with a home with older kids that understand to give me space. I haven't been cat tested but by my chill level I don't see it even phasing me. 
And I think Iâm about 7 years old, but Iâm not sure. I will need a dental and to be on canned food only.

name: Zeus
description:
Hi there! My name is Zeus and Iâm a special boy, according to my foster mom. I have come a long way in my foster home in learning how to \"dog\".  I started life in a home that hoarded dogs, so I didn't get the best care and the love and attention I needed.  Because of this situation, I was defensive and a bite risk to start.  I like it when you get down on my level and don't tower over me.  You are big and I am very small, so you look like a giant coming at me.  

I have found that I like pillows and they give me security, in that I can hide in them if I want to.  I also am treat motivated (fish based treats are my favorite), so that will be a good way to continue my training. Once Iâm comfortable with you, I love to snuggle close and get belly rubs. I do love to give kisses but I can get a little overboard!

I am working on leash skills and not being so scared with quick movements, loud sounds, and going through doorways.  I like to walk with a harness on and I am learning that I should do my potty business outside. While I am learning, I do understand about potty pads inside. 

I like having a K9 companion, but I would not do well with cats in my forever home.  If you are willing to work with me, I know I could be a great dog for you.

name: Toro
description:
Hi Iâm Toro! Iâm a small thing at just 10lbs! 

I was just rescued about a month ago from a hoarding situation so a majority of the world makes me quite nervous but Iâm slowly settling into my foster home. 

I love being outside and just laying out on the porch. Think quick about taking me for a walk cause leashes are scary for now. 

Iâm curious about my foster humans. Iâll go up and sniff and lick them when they arenât noticing but if they try to touch me I scurry off cause Iâm not ready for that much attention just yet. So no small humans for me because if they donât understand the space I need right now I will bite them. 

There are 5 other dogs living with me. The first couple of days I growled when they came near my personal space but we are growing on each other though I would probably do best either as the only dog or just co-habitating with a dog that doesnât want to play.  

Iâm also heartworm positive. Right now Iâm taking my meds before my treatment gets scheduled so Iâll need the low activity life I already prefer until my treatment date and 30 days after. 

Adoption donations are $250 for an adult, $350 for puppies (a dog under one year of age), and $125 for a senior dog (based on the age of the dog). name: Ollie
description:
Hi, I'm Ollie! I'm about 9 years old & weigh approximately 80 lbs. & in good health. I love going on walks with my human. I am potty trained but on occasion will have an accident inside if left alone for too long. I get along fine with other dogs as long as they aren't annoying me by constantly getting in my personal space, so another older guy or gal like me would be ideal. I'd also prefer older kids as I don't care to be climbed on or have my fluffy tail pulled. I like to be in the presence of my humans & sleeping in their room. I like to roam the house during the day & to snooze on the couch. If you're not looking, I'll be sure to steal any food that I'm able to reach (trash included). I'm a great alert dog, making sure my humans know when unauthorized people or animals come near the house. I'm a good boy. I also love being groomed (brushed, bathed, hairdryer, etc.) although I may need to be muzzled when trimming my nails. If you scratch my butt, I'll never leave you alone.

name: Roco
description:
Hello! I'm Roco. I traveled all the way from Puerto Rico to find my furever family! I'm what you call a street dog, the product of little to no spay/neuter in my area. I was born in March and I am doing so well with crate training.  I sleep in my crate overnight and don't have any accidents (a whole 8 hours).  As far as potty training in my foster home, that is a work in progress, but I am doing very well. I'm a little slow to trust, but I warm up pretty quick.  I prefer females and am afraid of tall men (they are so big).  I am a super jumper if you want to teach me agility.  I'd also love to be trained so I can get those yummy treats (which are the key to my heart).

name: Mika
description:
Mika is starting to get more comfortable in her foster home, but is still hesitant of people, so no cuddling for this girl. She does great with the other dogs (especially loves bigger dogs) and loves to play with them. Because she is so hesitant of people, taking her out on a leash is an event, but she has no problem using a doggie door or just going outside to a fenced in yard.  She crates well, has had no potty accidents in her foster home, gets along with cats, She has made a lot of progress in her foster home so stay tuned for further updates.

This is a link to a good article about working with shy dogs like Mika. 
https://petcentral.chewy.com/pet-parenting-pet-lovers-7-ways-to-bond-with-a-shy-dog/

name: Frank
description:
Hello! I'm Frank! I'm sweet, very energetic 3 year old boy and I love hikes and swimming! I'm working hard to lose this extra weight so I can be healthy, don't let it fool you, I can easily hike three miles. I also have a pretty good recall when you whistle! 

I would do best in a home with older children, because when I sleep, I'm OUT and I can be snippy if startled. Please feed me alone, because I want all the foods for my self and can get aggressive, but if fed in my crate, I'm good.

description:

description:

name: Wes
description:
Hi guys, I am Wes. I am pretty old and tired, my eyes and ears are not working so well these days. My brother and I ended up with the fine people at the Old Dominion Humane Society after our elderly owner passed way. My brother was a little younger and lucky enough to get adopted, I miss him but I am happy for him. Like most older gentlemen I have some hair loss but with grooming I am looking much better. I spend most of my day sleeping and resting, I sleep quietly in my kennel at night and I have been doing really well about doing my business outside. I do fine with other dogs as long as they do not keep me from napping. I walk on a leash well outside but really struggle with stairs. I think this is because of my poor eyesight. Good news is I only weigh about 10 pounds so I am not heavy to carry. I get along with everyone and enjoy getting pets, oh and kids are great too! I know I might be as cute as some of the young pups and yes I am in the later chapters of my life but I am willing to give you every ounce of love I have left. If you are looking for a sweet quiet older gentlemen to warm your lap in the coming months then I am your guy. Please stop by to see me even if it is just for a short visit.  
 
Thanks,

Wes

name: Rae
description:
Hey everyone, I'm Rae. Well, that's my real name, but my friends call me Ray Ray or little bit around here. I'm new to this household and I've only been here a few days, but I settled right in! They say I'm very well tempered and loveable (what?? people think they can talk about me while I'm in the room and I'm not gonna hear them?). I'm kind of a snuggle bug if I was bigger I'd be a great spooning partner. Especially burried in a fuzzy blanket! The other dogs here are just fine with me too, sometimes they get a bit aggressive with playtime, but I can hold my own. I'm being treated for flea bites currently and I'm hoping my hair fills in as time goes on. Those little bugs really bother me. I'm small, but don't let that fool you, I LOVE to eat! Dinner time is my favorite and I try to show it with excitement and love! I pretty much do my business outside, but I don't like the rain so I have had a couple of accidents in the hallway (hey but at least they're small). Car rides are cool, it's a big world out there to see! I'm ok with the leash, but I'd rather just cruise around freely. The other dogs go a hootin' and hollering about the crate, but I don't mind it, seems like a safe place for me! This place has a few dogs, I haven't seen a kid or a cat yet, but I think from what I've heard I'll do fine with them. I like it here ok, but sure would love a place to call my own and be part of a forever family! Ask about me, I'm hoping to get an application soon!I am about 3 years old and about 15lbs.

Note: My leg has been bothering me and my x-rays have been done.  We are awaiting the results,  I am hoping itâs just arthritis and nothing worse.

name: Ajax
description:
Ajax is a silly, funny guy that likes to do zoomies around the house. He loves to play, but he has a hard time picking up social cues from other dogs. He can be too rough with small dogs, so those are a no for him. If you have a very playful dog, Ajax would be a good playmate, but he doesn't know when to stop. Ajax rides well in the car and is crate trained. He is looking for a dog savy family that can help teach him not to be mouthy. No small kids for this guy! Sometimes he can even leave marks! Ouch! He is such a ham, though! Ajax LOVES going hiking and playing in the water. Do you have what it takes to train him?

name: Dutchess
description:
Dutchess is a sweet, small, laid back kinda gal. Sheâs around 10 lbs and 7 years old. Although she only has a few teeth left, it does not stop her from enjoying her meals.  She will gently remind you if you forget.   She rides well in the car and is such a cuddle bug with lots of love to give.  She walks well on leash and enjoys the outdoors, even a fun trip to the park.  Did you say you also need a watchdog? -  then Dutchess has you covered.  She was fostered with a puppy for a time and is working to regain her potty manners.  She is just one cool chic, so if you are looking for a small lap dog, put in an application for Dutchess.

name: Moe
description:
Moe is around 1 year old, 35lb and is eager to please.  He loves nothing more than to cuddle up with you.  Heâs so excited to see his people that his tail goes a mile a minute and he jumps up and down.  He has had no accidents, in human terms, heâs ready for Kindergarten! And he is well on his way to passing the Good Canine Citizen test!  He comes when called, drops whatever he has when you say ânoâ or âleave itâ, and heels well during night time walks.  He does well with dogs small and large.  Heâs laid back and picks up commands really fast.  Moe is an awesome little guy!

name: Todrick
description:
Well hello - Iâm Todrick! 

Iâm a small fellow at just 18lb but Iâm a year old so no growing for me! 

What do I want the most? A big spoon. I want some humans that I can snuggle with all night kinda like I am a teddy bear. Hey if you want to nickname me Teddy I wouldnât even mind! 

Iâd also like some toys. Fluffier the better. Oh and some siblings to play with... 2-legged or 4... doesnât matter! 

And I want breakfast for breakfast lunch and dinner. Yeah eggs... theyâre yummy. I mean bacon is too... but eggs I like. 

Itâs ok if you come with a crate. Iâm good in the crate! Now.... Iâm still working on mastering my potty skills but if I had to guess you were in diapers at 1 too! 

Iâm working on resource guarding, not jumping 6 foot fences, and getting along with dogs smaller than me (little man syndrome).  Iâd be great for an only dog house if thatâs your situation.

So what do you say... we snuggling tonight?

name: Coco
description:
Iâm a spunky, little 11 year old lady!  I don't mind sharing a house with other dogs (as long as they aren't super hyper and in my face), cats, or humans.  Because of my age, I would do best in a home with no kids or older kids who understand to give me my space.  I like for you to call me to where you want me to go vs. picking me up.  

I do have a mammary tumor, so cancer . . .  Due to my age - ODHS is not going to make me go through the surgery to treat. I don't know how much time I have left but . . . Can I spend that time left, with you?

name: Duke
description:
Buster came to us from Fresno where he and many others were left at an abandoned house. A mom and puppies and several females went to other rescues...we got the 3 boy on the property. He's a little shy at first but super sweet once he warms up to you. Great with other dogs, 

  

 ****PLEASE DO NOT CALL TO CHECK STATUS OF A DOG...PHONE CALLS ARE FOR EMERGENCIES ONLY. EMAIL US WITH ANY QUESTIONS ON ADOPTION AS WE DO NOT GET BACK TO PHONE CALLS ABOUT ADOPTION.

 Shots up to date (DHPP) and rabies, micro chipped, altered (spayed/neutered). We also now give one free vet visit with our local vet within first 3 days of adoption!!

  Adoption cost for this dog is $150 

 We are a rescue, and although we have a facility in Modesto most of our dogs/pups are currently being fostered in or around our area. So please be willing to make the trip to see them if you are from out of the area. Our adoption process REQUIRES that an application must first be submitted and approved prior to meeting any of our pets. Just note that we may get several responses on one pet at a time so just because you have an approved application does not mean said pet is on hold for you. One must FIRST confirm an appointment to meet the pet after an approved application has been sent. To inquire about this specific pet, please write to info@pupznpalz.org for an application. Please remember to put the pets name in the subject line when emailing, and on the top on the application. It helps us to help you that must faster. We are a group of volunteers, and ask that you please bare with us. We will get to each person just as quickly as we can. If you do not hear back from us within 24 hours, please send another request as we have been having problems with e-mail.

 email: info@pupznpalz.org and ask for an application for which dog you are interested in

 phone: 209-480-8662 (9-6 pm only please, cell phone, emergencies only please...do not call to ask status of dog, email please)

 **ADOPTION EVENTS: typically every Sat at Modesto Petco 2021 Evergreen Ave from 12-3

 **OUR FACILITY: Located at 1430 Carpenter Lane Suite B (by appointment only as we do not have set hours)

name: Buster
description:
Buster came to us from Fresno where he and many others were left at an abandoned house. A mom and puppies and several females went to other rescues...we got the 3 boy on the property. He's a little shy at first but super sweet once he warms up to you. Great with other dogs, loves belly rubs.

  

 ****PLEASE DO NOT CALL TO CHECK STATUS OF A DOG...PHONE CALLS ARE FOR EMERGENCIES ONLY. EMAIL US WITH ANY QUESTIONS ON ADOPTION AS WE DO NOT GET BACK TO PHONE CALLS ABOUT ADOPTION.

 Shots up to date (DHPP) and rabies, micro chipped, altered (spayed/neutered). We also now give one free vet visit with our local vet within first 3 days of adoption!!

  Adoption cost for this dog is $150 

 We are a rescue, and although we have a facility in Modesto most of our dogs/pups are currently being fostered in or around our area. So please be willing to make the trip to see them if you are from out of the area. Our adoption process REQUIRES that an application must first be submitted and approved prior to meeting any of our pets. Just note that we may get several responses on one pet at a time so just because you have an approved application does not mean said pet is on hold for you. One must FIRST confirm an appointment to meet the pet after an approved application has been sent. To inquire about this specific pet, please write to info@pupznpalz.org for an application. Please remember to put the pets name in the subject line when emailing, and on the top on the application. It helps us to help you that must faster. We are a group of volunteers, and ask that you please bare with us. We will get to each person just as quickly as we can. If you do not hear back from us within 24 hours, please send another request as we have been having problems with e-mail.

 email: info@pupznpalz.org and ask for an application for which dog you are interested in

 phone: 209-480-8662 (9-6 pm only please, cell phone, emergencies only please...do not call to ask status of dog, email please)

name: Camo
description: Camo is a beautiful and friendly doggie that looks like he is a Pit mixed with Great Dane and/or Catahoula. Camo loves people and gets along with most other dogs (especially females). Contact foster mom Pat at 559 683-3660 for more information. Kellen has foster homes located in the Sierra Foothills outside of Fresno CA. We typically require fenced yards and usually do not adopt out of State.

name: Digby
description:
âThe scientists want to collar himâ¦ The crooks want to steal him. Digby -- the biggest howl in the worldâ -- Digby, The Biggest Dog in the World (1973)

Making his way into the ring, from Athens, Ga, weighing 30lbs, two years old, champion of doggie wrestling, cat-friendly, and all around great pup -- Digby! Currently, Digby loves playing with his canine brothers and sisters as well as getting attention from Foster Mom. Stay tuned as we learn more about Digby!




To ensure our dogs are placed in a safe environment, we require a home visit for all adoptions. Because of this, we typically only adopt to homes within 30 minutes of Athens, GA. If you are further away than that and are interested in one of our pups, please still fill out an application and we can discuss your options. Please understand that you would be responsible for all transportation - meeting the dog, picking the dog up to start a trial, returning the dog should he/she not be a good fit, etc.  Please visit our website for more info. (www.athenscaninerescue.com)

name: Roo
description:
Roo is very sweet! He is very affectionate and eager to be a part of what his humans are doing!

As a POPB adoptable, Roo is eligible for 5 free obedience classes with his new family! We have adoption events every Saturday from 10 am to 1 pm at Petco in Gainesville, at 6869 W. Newberry Rd. (near the mall) and at the Millhopper Petsmart, 4119 NW 16th Ave. We also have special events regularly. name: Luna Mae
description:
This sweet pup LOVES water. She is happy to play with some toys but would ultimately love another pup she can play with. She is still a puppy, but is a quick learner who is easy to train! She likes cats but doesn't understand the way they won't play with her! Luna is a great, loving dog and do well in any home!

As a POPB adoptable, Luna is eligible for 5 free obedience classes with her new family! We have adoption events every Saturday from 10 am to 1 pm at Petco in Gainesville, at 6869 W. Newberry Rd. description:
Banksy is new to Plenty of Pit Bulls and is doing great! He is such a loving, gentle dog who loves to snuggle and be pet! He enjoys playing with toys, both on his own and playing fetch! He loves food and is very food motivated, which is great for training! He also makes adorable soft pig like snoring noises when he sleeps!

As a POPB adoptable, Banksy is eligible for 5 free obedience classes with his new family! We have adoption events every Saturday from 10 am to 1 pm at Petco in Gainesville, at 6869 W. Newberry Rd. (near the mall) and at the Millhopper Petsmart, 4119 NW 16th Ave. We also have special events regularly. name: Cookie
description:
Mama Dog - has puppies birthed in rescue with POPB

Cookie is as sweet as her name! She loves to cuddle/snuggle with you! She is GREAT in the crate and is potty trained. Her other interests include patrolling for squirrels on walks and eating yummy food, and she would be happiest with a chill/submissive doggie friend.

She is a smart girl who is picking up quickly on commands, and is starting to show her playful side as she recovers from heartworm treatment.

As a POPB adoptable, Cookie is eligible for 5 free obedience classes with her new family! We have adoption events every Saturday from 10 am to 1 pm at Petco in Gainesville, at 6869 W. Newberry Rd. (near the mall) and at the Millhopper Petsmart, 4119 NW 16th Ave. We also have special events regularly. Please visit our Facebook page (facebook.com/plentyofpitbulls) for information about upcoming events. For more information about our adoption process and a link to our application, please see popb.org/adopt

name: Butterscotch
description:
Butterscotch is a fantastic puppy who will fit into any home. She's about 7 months old and weighs around 45-50 lbs. She's a gorgeous red brindle with flashy white markings and beautiful amber eyes, as well as an adorable smile and expressive whiskers. Most importantly, Butterscotch has a fantastic temperament. She's a happy, easy-going, and curious pup who gets along with everyone. She's met small dogs and big ones and been friendly and appropriate with them all. She plays constantly with her foster brother and would love a home with another dog to play with. However, she's pretty independent and confident, so she'd probably be fine as an only dog too! She is still a puppy, obviously, and gets zoomies sometimes, so a fenced yard would also be great, but she'd be fine with lots of walks, runs, and play time!

Butterscotch has spent time with a toddler and really enjoyed him! She gve him kisses and enjoyed playing fetch. She also loves to play in water -- puddles, the hose, or the beach! She has been kayaking and loved it.

While she's a very curious, active, and playful dog, Butterscotch also likes to cuddle and is very affectionate. She's been great with all the strangers she's met, on walks and in the house.

All in all, Butterscotch is a great pup who will be a wonderful companion and family member for almost anyone!

As a POPB adoptable, Butterscotch is eligible for 5 free obedience classes with her new family! We have adoption events every Saturday from 10 am to 1 pm at Petco in Gainesville, at 6869 W. Newberry Rd. (near the mall) and at the Millhopper Petsmart, 4119 NW 16th Ave. We also have special events regularly. Please visit our Facebook page (facebook.com/plentyofpitbulls) for information about upcoming events. For more information about our adoption process and a link to our application, please see popb.org/adopt

name: Supernova
description:
Supernova is loyal and loving to those she loves! She takes a while to warm up to new people but once she does she has unlimited love to give.She is obedient and is eager to please and always wanting to learn new tricks and skills. She is a cuddle bug and always wants to be close to her person. She is strong, agile and energetic and loves to play with other dogs but also enjoys relaxing and finds comfort in her crate so she is content staying crated all day while you're working. She gets along great with indoor cats but may chase outdoor cats and other small critters. Please contact us to meet this wonderful girl!

As a POPB adoptable, Supernova is eligible for 5 free obedience classes with her new family! We have adoption events every Saturday from 10 am to 1 pm at Petco in Gainesville, at 6869 W. Newberry Rd. name: Boo Radley
description:
Boo has so much love to give! She just wants to be by her humans
, snuggling and spending quality
time together. She definitely prefers the creature comforts of air conditioning and a soft bed. Consider sharing kisses and your time with this beautiful and gentle girl!

As a POPB adoptable, Boo is eligible for 5 free obedience classes with her new family! We have adoption events every Saturday from 10 am to 1 pm at Petco in Gainesville, at 6869 W. Newberry Rd. name: Bogey
description:
Bogey, like his namesake that he looks exactly like, is one of a kind and has a magnetic, captivating star quality. He is seriously handsome and he KNOWS it! He is funny, smart and delightfully affectionate. His sense of humor is almost human-like and he can melt your heart with it in about one second flat. He is a young, strong, curious, funny, happy, very active dog that wants to be in on anything you are doing and play, play, play. He is also just as happy in the kitchen supervising while you cook, out back undoing the pile of branches you just made or burying a toy or a bone. Yes, he buries things to dig up later. His tongue is as big as your hand and you can't help but love it when he gives you those kisses. He will melt your heart and light up your world.

As a POPB adoptable, Bogey is eligible for 5 free obedience classes with his new family! We have adoption events every Saturday from 10 am to 1 pm at Petco in Gainesville, at 6869 W. Newberry Rd. (near the mall) and at the Millhopper Petsmart, 4119 NW 16th Ave. We also have special events regularly. description:
Need someone to spice up your life? Sharkie's spunky and high energy personality will never leave you bored. Sharkie loves to play and loves to snuggle. She does great with dogs, kids and humans alike.

As a POPB adoptable, Sharkie is eligible for 5 free obedience classes with her new family! We have adoption events every Saturday from 10 am to 1 pm at Petco in Gainesville, at 6869 W. Newberry Rd. name: Paxton
description:
Paxton is a tiny, smart, cuddly, affectionate little lover boy. He will be your shadow and wants to follow you around all the time! He plays well with other dogs. He's doing great with crate training and has not had a single accident in the house. He gets SO excited to go outside and does a little dance when he sees his foster mom grab the leash! You need this boy in your life!

As a POPB adoptable, Paxton is eligible for 5 free obedience classes with his new family! We have adoption events every Saturday from 10-1pm at Petco in Gainesville, at 6869 W. Newberry Rd. description:
Meet Miss Piggy! This sweet girl has had it \"ruff\" but we are here to finally find her the home she not only deserves but one that deserves her as well. She is a wonderful bundle of energy and oh so smart! .

She loves to be outside and to go places....she would be cool with hiking, running or biking

. She is very sweet and snuggly with her foster and is great with children.

As a POPB adoptable, Miss Piggy is eligible for 5 free obedience classes with her new family! We have adoption events every Saturday from 10 am to 1 pm at Petco in Gainesville, at 6869 W. 9/20/19 10:56 AM

name: Harvey
description: Harvey is 3 year old, 12 pound, supper cuddly and loving chihuahua mix. He came from a shelter in Gallia and is sweet and spunky and loves to play with other pups. He is almost housebroken! And we expect that to be finished up once he is neutered. He has a great deal of energy and loves to play with his small foster sibling pups, run around the yard, and go for walks. He can be shy at first but quickly warms up. He is crate trained, not yet cat-tested, and very happy when people wake up in the morning! Right now Harvey is being treated for Lyme, Ehrlichia and hair loss. He is on his way to a happy healthy life and is looking for that perfect someone for his life! His foster says this... \" he is the cutest, goofiest, baldy bean and we adore him!\

name: Mercury
description:
Mercury is such a sweet boy!! He was pulled from a south Georgia animal shelter. He had been shot and was having trouble walking. We took him to a specialist that decided it was unsafe to remove the bullets because they were too close to his spinal cord. He is a happy, goofy boy that needs a home to call his own. His back legs are weak and he needs some Physical Therapy to build some strength in his back legs. He has shown that he loves other dogs and LOVES to play. When first introduced, he will lunge because of his back leg issues. He is not aggressive at all.We do not have a shelter facility and our pets are housed in foster homes, vet clinics and local boarding facilities.

Many of our adoptable pets attend adoption events each Saturday at Mall of Georgia Petsmart in Buford, Georgia from 11:30-3:00 pm

Please check with us to find out if a particular pet will be available. Dogs going to adoption event are typically posted on our Facebook page the day prior.

Details about our adoption procedures can be seen at www.pupandcatco.com.

name: Coal
description: Coalcame from a shelter in south Georgia. He's a big boy and a lot to handle and we're looking for an owner who is confident and has great leadership skills. He's house trained and good in the house and is a great companion dog. If you are interested in fostering or adopting Coal, please go to www.atlantalabrescue.com to fill out an application.

name: Gregor
description:
Gregor is an adorable gray/white pit mix who was rescued from Augusta Animal Services, a high kill shelter in Augusta, Georgia. He was a favorite of the staff and volunteers at the shelter but was due to be euthanized due to lack of space. A determined volunteer began reaching out to local rescue groups to save his life and my licensed rescue Hands to Paws in Augusta responded and gave him his freedom ride. Gregor is quite the character and has such a great, playful personality. Heâs currently being boarded at a local kennel an has been there for several months, getting wonderful care there but itâs time for this special boy to have a home of his own!

Heâs affectionate, friendly, loving, loves people and needs to be the only dog in the household. He's good with kids but due to his size and strength it would be best for the kids to be older - no small children. Wonât you consider giving this special boy his permanent soft place to fall? He will bring you so much love and joy. He's got such a great personalty and is a sweet soul. He's had a rough start in life and deserves a loving home. Could it be you? Until his forever home is found we are also looking for a foster home for Gregor - it's a great way to see if he would be a good match for your family and it gives him a chance to be in a home and out of boarding for a while, so please consider fostering sweet Gregor if adopting is not an option right now! There's no cost for fostering - it just requires love and TLC! Please contact me for details about either fostering or adopting this very special soul!
Rescue
Hands to Paws Rescue
Contact Info

name: Winston
description:
Winston, a happy 50# young adult about 2 1/2 years, is looking for his forever home.  His owner moved from Illinois to Georgia and couldn't keep him.  Rescued and doing well, has more manners and more training from his foster home..it's a great thing!

He is neutered, uptodate on his shots, on Heartworm and flea preventative.

He should not go with cats - way too interested in them on leash outside and shouldn't live inside with them either.  He should be fine with kids older than 6 yrs. and doing great in his crate.  He's a ball player, stick, football, throw anything and he'll go get it...now bringing it back is another story!

For more information:  Julie cell 770-329-4742 or email for application:  jachambers4806@yahoo.com

Pet Adoptions Sat- 2-6 pm - call ahead for location and attendance.

name: Waylon
description:
ASF Waylon is a gorgeous DM who is blind and deaf. That doesnât stop this handsome hunk from enjoying life! He loves to go for rides. Is learning to walk on a leash but still pulls so a harness is a must. His nose knows who and where everyone and everything (especially food) is. Lol. He does counter surf and gets in garbage if you leave him for long periods of time. He is very smart and has figured out how to open the kitchen cabinets. 

Waylon never meets a stranger, loves everyone he meets. He would love a quiet home where his humans are home a lot or retired and can spend time teaching him obedience and some touch signals for commands. 

Waylon is about 8 yrs old, neutered and up to date on vaccines. He is currently on a diet. Still needs to lose about 20 lbs or more but is doing well with it so far!! Waylon is housebroken, good with dogs and cats. Children over 12 yrs old please. He is located in Georgia.

If you would like to make this hunk of love part of your home, please fill out the application:

https://www.australianshepherdsfurever.org/adoption-application

name: Mason
description:
Forever Love Starts with a Wet Nose and Ends with a Tail...
Mason is a quirky guy. He is a 50 pound husky with a lapdog mentality. He will love you unconditionally and be your best friend. He loves to give kisses and is starting to do pretty well at the sit command. He plays hard and naps even harder. He does great at night, He has slept in both his bed, at the base of the bed, and up in bed with people. It just depends on his mood that night. He loves bones and jerky treats are his favorite. He likes his dinner wet, so we put some wet food on top of his dry food. He is also doing pretty good on a leash. We have been working with him and are seeing improvement. He does get excited when he sees other dogs. He will continue to be trained to be focused while walking, but overall does pretty well on a leash. He will need someone who has time to spend with him during the day or another dog to help keep him company when nobody is home since he does get very anxious being home alone. Fireworks and loud noises don't scare him however. We will send him with his crate, treats, a few toys, his harness, and his leash. His breed is known for high energy and needing a lot of exercise. He is doing great in his foster home. He loves kids and has even met and done well with cats.

All of the dogs/cats listed are located in or near Gettysburg, Pennsylvania. Adoption fees are $195 for dogs ($95 for Seniors 7 years+) and $60 for adult cats, $75 for kittens (under 6 months) and $25 for senior cats (7 years+) to help cover vet bills for spay/neuter of all adoptable pets as well as getting them up-to-date on their basic vaccinations, and for starting heartworm and flea/tick preventatives. No pet will be officially adopted without being spayed/neutered and vaccinated (unless there are health risks in doing so).

We will require an approved on-line application which is available on our website at ForeverLoveRescue.com. If you are looking for a dog, be prepared for a Meet-and-Greet and a basic home check to be done on or before adoption day, to ensure that the dog can be safe in the new home and that everyone involved is comfortable with each other. Please feel free to call 717-900-5525 with any questions, or reach us by email at foreverloverescue@gmail.com. Be sure to check us out on Facebook at Forever Love Rescue and \"LIKE\" our page. SAVING ONE DOG OR CAT MAY NOT CHANGE THE WORLD...BUT FOR THAT ONE DOG OR CAT, THE WORLD CHANGES FOREVER! Please, Don't Shop, ADOPT A BEST FRIEND! <3

name: Diego
description:
Forever Love Starts with a Wet Nose and Ends with a Tail...
HI, I'M DIEGO! DO YOU LOVE TO SNUGGLE AND PLAY? ME TOO!

It seems this sweet boy spent the beginning of his life living outdoors at the end of a chain. Oh, how Diego has blossomed in foster care! He adores people of all ages, including children, and and absolutely craves attention. He may be a little too enthusiastic for small children, so care will need to be taken in that regard. Diego hasn't gotten the memo that he's larger than your average lap dog, as he loves to get as close as possible to snuggle and offer pittie kisses.

This very smart pup will sit, shake, down and rollover on command; we're still working on 'stay' and 'come.' His leash manners could use some polishing, although a proper harness and additional training will be beneficial. Diego has excellent car manners and will often nod off in the passenger seat. Toys rock his world and this silly guy is always ready to romp and play. He'll chase a ball all day long but hasn't gotten the hang of returning it to you just yet. While Diego shares nicely with humans, he's not inclined to share toys, treats or food with other dogs and may act out in an aggressive manner. He's housebroken and crate trained in foster care and may just need a refresher course in his new home, as he gets the hang of a new routine.

Diego does not do well with dogs who make him feel challenged or threatened. He needs to be your one and only. He's also not a fan of kitties and there can be no cats in his home. If you can offer Diego the exercise, playtime and loving care he craves, he's ready to make your acquaintance. A fenced yard is would be ideal. He's had some hard knocks in life, but Diego has shaken off the dust and is ready for his happily-ever-after to begin.

All of the dogs/cats listed are located in or near Gettysburg, Pennsylvania. No pet will be officially adopted without being spayed/neutered and vaccinated (unless there are health risks in doing so).

name: Sally
description: Sally is looking for a new forever home. She is currently located in Goshen, NY, due to a change in the family and the addition of a small dog.  Sally is totally great with kids and very loving to her family.  But dog selective.  Likes some males her own size but no females, regardless of size.  Meet and greet a must . No cats.  Sally will require a secure, fenced in yard.  Leash walking only.  If interested RER will connect you with her owner.

name: Reiko
description: NEW - 1 NOVEMBER 2018: Reiko is a 6-year-old neutered male beagle mix who is super sweet, reserved and good with other dogs. He weighs about 32 pounds. He is very loyal and attuned to his person. He thinks heâs a lap dog and loves to give kisses! He was a stray from Green County in Virginia, so his history is unknown.

name: Clover
description:
Clover is a 14 yr old cutie pie.  She was recently owner surrendered along with David, a 5 yr old Chihuahua.  

Clover has recently had a dental and is fully vaccinated and negative for heart worms.  She is a sweet girl that bonds easily.   Could you be her retirement home?

The adoption fee is $250.00.  A fenced yard is sometimes required, for certain dogs, for their safety and for exercise.  ARFP home delivers 300 miles roundtrip from Greensboro, NC.

name: Baxter
description:
Baxter, a 3-year-old Shih Tzu mix and about 14 lbs, had a very rough start in life. Even though his previous owners threw him out of a car window, he has improved by leaps & bounds! He loves people, toys, and everything about his new life.

Baxter is thriving in his foster home and is the perfect little companion. He is very loyal to his people and super affectionate. He loves to sit in your lap and adores belly rubs. He has fun playing fetch with his favorite toy and going on daily walks. Baxter would do well as an only pet or with a friend â he loves everyone!  He is housebroken.

Unfortunately, Baxter was heartworm positive, but he started his treatment and is on his way to a healthy new life. Baxter will be available for adoption after completing his heartworm treatment (early Oct). We are currently taking applications so he can go straight to his new home when ready. Baxter is a foster-to-adopt candidate if you are located in the Greensboro, NC area.

If you are interested in adopting this dog, contact h2hadoptions@gmail.com. An all adult home with a fenced yard (fence must be attached to the home) is required to adopt from Hart-2-Heart Rescue.

There is an application process and adoption fee. We are an all-volunteer organization, and in addition to saving dogs, we have other responsibilities, so we appreciate your patience and understanding during this process. Response time can take up to 5 business days.

Please inquire only if you are willing to come to Greensboro, North Carolina to meet the dog after we schedule your home visit. We do not ship dogs or put them on transports. Adoption fee is $350.

Veterinary Care: All Hart-2-Heart Rescue foster dogs are spayed/neutered, current on heartworm prevention, parvo/distemper, bordetella, and rabies vaccines and are professionally groomed. As needed, our foster dogs have teeth cleanings, extractions, bloodwork and other diagnostic testing.

name: Simba
description:
Meet Simba from the Guilford County Animal Shelter.  Sweet Simba was brought to the shelter and was part of a hoarding situation. He sat there for a week and became  very ill with kennel cough. He was urgent and had to get out. 

He is a 2 to 3 year old lab mix and weighs around 46 lbs. He needs to put on weight so will be around 50lbs. 

In swoops his foster mom Samantha to save the day!
He has had some time to decompress and this is what we know about him: 
**Loves his tennis ball
**Loves to play around the pool, not sure about swimming yet
**Loves to sleep on the bed, but also doesnt mind his crate 
**Already knows that the outdoors is for pees and poops
**Likes taking walks but still not sure about the neighborhood dogs. Once he is neutered he will let you know. He is scheduled for Neuter this Thursday. 
**Heartworm status: Negative!

He is located in Greensboro, NC. Adoption applications are online at www.tailsoftheunwanted.org

name: Jasmine
description:
Jasmine is about 5 or 6 years old and very sweet with humans - she has unfortunately gotten aggressive with the other 3 dogs in her home recently, and needs to be an only dog. She has a high prey drive and would not do well with cats either. Sheâs a working dog, so space to run and tasks to do would be great for her. She would be best as an only dog and is a huge lover with people, once she starts to trust them. 

She was rescued from Halo a few years back. The vet advised her to put her down if she can't find a way to make it work in the home, but sheâs a healthy dog around 5 years old that just needs to be in a home with someone who can love her and show her thatâs the world isnât so bad, and with someone who can help her overcome her trust issues. We definitely do not believe she deserves to lose her life over her lack of trust. 

Jasmine has been nothing but a total sweetheart with humans; we know that with the right home and a good amount of patience, she can be the best dog and make someone really happy!

name: Brady
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Brady is approximately 6-7 years old Pomeranian/Pekingese who is looking for his furever home. He weighs about 9 pounds and has a grade III-IV heart murmur. Brady came into our care after his owner passed away and he was surrendered to a shelter.

He is a super sweet little man, very loyal, and will follow you everywhere. Brady is great with other dogs and cats. He can become a little hyper as you are preparing meals or treats, and he will bark if you are in an area that he cannot get to. But both are very easily managed. Brady has also come a long way with his house training since his neuter. He may need to wear a belly band to ensure he doesn't mark any walls in his new home for a short time.

Brady is current on all vaccines, is microchipped, and has recently been neutered and provided a dental cleaning (with two baby teeth extractions). His adoption fee is $250, which is reduced to $150 for senior citizens 65+. You can submit an adoption application at PomPaws.org. Brady is located in Harrisburg, PA, and approved adopters must be willing to travel to Harrisburg to take Brady home.

name: Charlie
description: Hello, My name is Charlie and I am a sweet young man, looking for a place to call my own! I adore soft things, like blankets, toys and fuzzy socks! I am not a puppy anymore, but if it wasn't for my gray hairs, you would not even know! I am a Corgi-mix and am ready to find a best friend to spend all my days with! I am located in Harrisonburg, VA. My adoption fee is $250 which includes neuter, vaccines and microchip. If you are interested, please fill out an application. Our adoption team will be in touch!

name: Bailey
description: Hello, My name is Bailey and I am a dashing young man, who is in search of my forever home. I love to be where the action is, and am always down for a play session! I am a 5 month German Shepherd mix. I am located in Harrisonburg, VA. My adoption fee is $300 which includes neuter, vaccines and microchip. If you are interested, please fill out an application. Our adoption team will be in touch!

name: Maggie
description: Hello, my name is Maggie, and I am an affectionate snuggle monster who would love to find my new best friend! I love to meet new people and am ready for whatever the day may hold! I am an adorable Cheweenie mix with one cute floppy ear! I am located in Harrisonburg, VA. My adoption fee is $250 which includes spay, vaccines and microchip. If you are interested, please fill out an application. Our adoption team will be in touch!

name: Pamela
description: Hello, my name is Pamela and I would love to be your new best friend! My foster says I enjoy being where the action is, and finding a good sunbeam for a nap! I am a beagle mix, so I do not take up too much room, but be warned, you will not have much since I love to snuggle! I am located in Harrisonburg, VA. My adoption fee is $250 which includes spay, vaccines and microchip. If you are interested, please fill out an application. Our adoption team will be in touch!

name: Nina
description: Nina's foster has informed us that her favorite things to do throw her toys against the wall, meet new dogs and try and kiss her guinea pigs through their cage! She is described as polite, and has already been taught how to sit! This sweet girl is ready to find a home as great as her! Nina is located in Harrisonburg, VA. Her adoption fee is $250 which includes spay, vaccines and micro chip. If you are interested, please fill out an application. Our adoption team will be in touch!

name: Daisy
description: Hello, my name is Daisy and I am a sweet young girl that would love to be a part of your family! I am an easy going kind of gal, that would be perfectly content to hang out with you on the couch, or go for a run in the park! I am located in Harrisonburg, VA. My adoption fee is $250 which includes spay, microchip and vaccines. If you are interested, please fill out an application. Our adoption team will be in touch!

name: Didi
description: Hello my name is Didi and I would love to meet you! I am a young hound/boxer mix who loves to meet new people and enjoys a nice bone! I am located in Harrisonburg, VA. I will be at the Petsmart adoption event this weekend. My adoption fee is $400 which includes spay, vaccines and microchip. If you are interested, please fill out an application. Our adoption team will be in touch!

name: Chucky
description: Hello, my name is Chucky and I am a happy-go-lucky kind of pup that just loves to have fun! I love to go on adventures and be around others! I am a hound/boxer mix with a beautiful blue Merle coat. I am located in Harrisonburg, VA. I will be at the Petsmart Adoption Event this weekend. My adoption fee is $400 which includes neuter, vaccines and microchip. If you are interested, fill out an application. Our adoption team will be in touch!

name: Tommy
description: Hello, my name is Tommy and I am a sweet young man who is looking for a family that I can give all my love to! I am your typical puppy that loves to run, play and just have a great time. I am located in Harrisonburg, VA. I will be at the Petsmart Adoption Event this Saturday. My adoption fee is $400 which includes neuter, vaccines and microchip. If you are interested, fill out an application today!

name: Lil
description: Hello, My name is Lil and I am ready to find my forever home! I am a bouncy, precious puppy who lives each day to its fullest! I am a hound/boxer mix with a beautiful brown brindle coat. I am located in Harrisonburg, VA. I will be at the Petsmart Adoption event this weekend. My adoption fee is $400 which includes spay, vaccines and microchip. If you are interested, fill out an application. Our adoption team will be in touch!

name: Valkyrie
description: Hello my name is Valkyrie, and I am a precious young girl looking for a place to call my own. I have adorable floppy ears, a sleek coat and piercing amber eyes like my sister Roo. I get along with other dogs and love to play and run! I am located in Harrisonburg, VA. My adoption fee is $250 which includes, spay, vaccines and microchip. If you are interested, please fill out an application. Our adoption team will be in touch!

name: Otis
description: Hello, My name is Otis and I am a sweet young fella who is longing for a life-long couch buddy! I am a generally calm dog, but have short zoomies when the moment strikes me! I enjoy a good scratch behind the ears and a nice walk around the park. I am a young hound/beagle mix. I am located in Harrisonburg, VA. My adoption fee is $250 which includes neuter, vaccines and microchip. If you are interested, please fill out an application. Our adoption team will be in touch!

name: Mandy
description: Hello, my name is Mandy and I am a gentle, young lady looking for a family of my own. One of my perks is that I am housebroken! I give gentle kisses and love to be around people. I would prefer to be the only dog in your life, as I need all your attention and love. I have a beautiful brindle coat and chocolate brown eyes. I am located in Harrisonburg, VA. My adoption fee is $250 which includes spay, vaccines and microchip. If you are interested, please fill out an application. Our adoption team will be in touch!

name: Roo
description: Hi, my name is Roo! I'm a sweet girl looking for that perfect person to teach me that life is not so scary! It takes a little patience to win me over, but once you do, I will adore you and become your best friend for life! I love to relax and snuggle on the couch, but I need my playtime too! I love to run around and play with other dogs and giving hugs to humans! I am located in Harrisonburg, VA. My adoption fee is $250 which includes a spay/neuter procedure, microchip, and vaccines. Please complete an application for an animal you are interested in adopting. After completing the application, one of our adoption team members will be in contact with you!

name: Shiloh
description:
Shiloh is a handsome young boy who is estimated around 3 years of age. Shiloh was completely feral when he arrived with Tier Haven from Hazard, Kentucky. He clearly had never been handled prior to this time and we are unaware of the circumstances surrounding his first few months.

Shiloh still has a very long way to go in trusting people. He has zero confidence in himself or the world around him resulting in a very timid and shy dog. Shiloh has no fear aggression and has never lashed out but is going to require a home with the patience to work with him to overcome his past. Shiloh does really well with people from a distance of about 5-7 feet and will linger on the outskirts of interactions but doesn't know what to do when the attention is turned to him. Shiloh will come up and nudge from behind seeking attention but does best when there isn't a big fuss made about it. He has a desire to be around people but is still so unsure of him.

Shiloh does great with other dogs and really relies on them for social cues. He was running with another dog - Bentley - who we suspect is his brother. Shiloh was definitely the follower and has stayed true to that role. He does great with other dogs and has learned how to navigate play groups really well. He would really benefit from having another dog or group of dogs in a home to show him the ropes and help him overcome his fears.

A volunteer reached out to us about Shiloh within minutes of when he was scheduled to be euthanized - there was certainly a large hand guiding him to safety and we hope to see him fulfill his potential with a loving home. 

If you have a place in your heart and home for this sweet young boy please email tierhavenrescue@gmail.com for an adoption application.

name: Honey
description:
Honey is as sweet as they come. One of her favorite things to do is curl up on the couch beside you. She is great with other dogs! She is learning to fetch a ball and how to sit. Honey is shy at first but she is slowly learning how to trust humans again and just be a dog. With a good routine and lots of love and patience she will be an amazing companion for someone. 

Please call Nina - her foster mom and she can tell you more about this sweet girl with the most soulful eyes.

828 435 1954
Ninar62@att.net

Honey is around 2.5 years old and weighs about 45lbs with room to grow. She has had a rough start in life and is ready to begin the happily ever after she so deserves.

Honey is actually located in Hendersonville NC (not Olin NC) but as with any dog we are willing to travel for the right home.

name: ZEUS
description: Oh joy! They call me Zeus! You look like you could be the perfect companion for a sweet dog like me. We could start our days off with a walk around the block! I sure do love having you by my side when I'm exploring new territory. When we make our way back home, let's play! Grab a couple different options so that every play session can be fresh and exciting! I may not be a puppy anymore but I still love to get a good work out! After we've tuckered ourselves out, let's break a mental sweat with some training! I may not know too many tricks yet but, with patience and persistence, I'm sure that I'll catch on quick! Are you ready to get outta here? I am full grown at ~44 lbs. *I am currently living at the Admission Center - Please speak with an adoption specialist about meeting me.* ~My adoption fee is $95.00.~ Cats/Dogs/Children? Unknown. Housetrained? Unknown. Training needs? Let's start from scratch! Energy level? Unknown. How did I get here? Transferred from PAWS of Hertford County.

name: DAPHNE
description: It's a great day to be adopted! My name is Daphne! I would love to have a great friend like you to spend my days with! We could go for lots of walks around the park! It's some great exercise and I love to explore! Maybe when we come back to the house, we can play with some toys. I love to have fun and it's a great way to bond with me! At the end of the day, let's break a mental sweat with some training. We can start with the easy stuff like sit, down, and stay and work our way towards the more challenging tricks. I can't wait to get going! I am full grown at ~50 lbs. *I am currently living at the Admission Center - Please speak with an adoption specialist about meeting me.* ~My adoption fee is $95.00.~ Cats/Dogs? Unknown. Children? Unknown. Housetrained? Unknown. Training needs? Let's start from scratch! Energy level? Unknown. How did I get here? Transferred from PAWS of Hertford County where I was surrendered.

name: Millie
description: Meet Millie!   Sheâs been with me the past few days and is beautifully behaved and is housebroken. Sheâs around 11 years old and possesses somewhat of an old lady demeanor, so adopter needs to have a quiet home - no small children, please, unless you have trained them to respect space- a single older person or couple would be perfect! Sheâs done terrifically with all my pack....has been in a home with cats and is fine with them!  Millie is our sweetheart I pulled from Higginsville pound and immediately took to have a very infected, painful eye removed! Lexington Mo. $125

name: Liutenant Dan
description:
Hey everyone! My name is Lt. Dan and I am a year old mixed breed dog. We think I might be an Australian Cattle Dog mix or something, but one thing is for sure: I'm 100% handsome! I'm even more handsome with three legs! Your eyes do not deceive you: I am tripawed and a lucky boy. I am awesome with other dogs but my foster mom says I'm not that great with cats because oh boy do I like to chase them. I'm pretty food motivated and will take all of the snacks you'll give me... but I need a new family to help me watch my figure because of my disability.

Truth be told, I did not have the best start in life. I was dumped on the side of a road where I searched for my family and had to fend for myself. While looking for my family I was hit by a car. I was scared and lonely and was hurt really bad. I was so scared of people and it took three big scary men to catch me. They brought me to a hospital where I met my foster mom. She gave me pain medication and advocated for me. This is where the amazing Mel said foster mom could bring me into the rescue and make me better. They amputated my leg and my foster mom slowly gained my trust as I healed. As you can imagine I am still very scared around new people and strangers. I need my new family to come meet me a few times before I can go home with them. It would also be great if my new family has worked with a fearful dog before. I am getting better with trusting my foster mom about strangers and ignoring them. I love playing with my foster brothers and sisters and can play all day. I have foster kitties in the house that I will chase if they run. I am going to go play with my foster siblings now and my foster mom will tell you more.

Lt. Dan is up to date on vaccines, heartworm negative, and on flea, tick and heartworm prevention monthly. He LOVES playing with other dogs and gets along with dogs of all sizes. He can live with dog savvy cats. Lt. Dan is fearful of new people and his adopter with be required to come to New Jersey a few times to meet him and spend some time with him before he can go to his new home. His adopters will also need to have experience with fearful dogs and will need to work with a positive reinforcement trainer. Once he learns to trust you, Lt. Dan will cuddle with you all day if you let him. He is a medium energy dog who just wants to be with his person. He will gladly occupy you on a long walk or cuddle on the couch all day with you. Because he had his leg amputated his adopters will need to be vigilant about his diet, weight and keep him exercised. Lt. Dan has had a rough beginning but with love and dedication he can overcome his past and be a loving member of a family. Could that be you?

SOHO is a 501c3 public charity focusing on rescuing herding dogs in crisis on the East Coast. Your pets will need to be up to date on vaccinations and heartworm preventative in order to be considered for adoption. Lt. Dan does have some additional adoption requirements: his foster mom would like a potential adopter to come and visit Lt. Dan a few times before taking him home in order to help him bond to his new family. Please note that Lt. Dan is located in HIGHLAND LAKES, NEW JERSEY.

name: Jax
description: Jax is a CAUTIOUS boy around men. He was pulled from Hillsborough County in HORRIBLE condition, and Saved from Euthanasia. Unsocialized or Feral, they were not sure. He is Selective with his people but with slow and proper introduction, we feel he will be a wonderful (but protective) Companion dog. He is a Handsome, Sleek, High energy baby, looking for the PERFECT Furever home and family.

name: Summer
description:
I am small, tan girl with a curly tail. I came over from Hobbs to look for a new home. I need a safe place with good people, and nice kids. I am small and enjoy being held, but I also like to play.

I weigh about 4 pounds

Adoption Fee - $225.00

name: Aspen
description:
I came over from the Hobbs area. I am sweet and friendly. I love to cuddle too. My tan-colored fur is really soft. I am looking for someone to pet, love me, and take good care full-time.

I weigh about 6 pounds

Adoption Fee - $225.00

name: Hunk
description:
Hunk -- previously known as Hulk from Hoke County animcal shelter.


	He is good with other dogs,
	wants to snuggle,
	loves car rides
	Good with cats -- although a bit friendly!


He is doing AMAZING in his foster home and he LOOOOVES truck rides in the day time and cuddling up.

Up to date on all vetting, HW negative, dog, cat and kid friendly.

name: Bianca
description:
Bianca is a beautiful Shepherd mix who is about 14 months old. She is good shape but needs some basic training.  Bianca lacks the human touch that she will get here at Pet Friends before she gets adopted. 

If you are interested in BIANCA or any of our other canines, call our office at (831) 634-1191.  We are located in Hollister, CA, about 100 miles south of San Francisco.  Sorry, we do not ship our animals.  

See all our animals on our website http://www.petfriends.org.

name: Jax
description: Jax is a CAUTIOUS boy around men. He was pulled from Hillsborough County in HORRIBLE condition, and Saved from Euthanasia. Unsocialized or Feral, they were not sure. He is Selective with his people but with slow and proper introduction, we feel he will be a wonderful (but protective) Companion dog. He is a Handsome, Sleek, High energy baby, looking for the PERFECT Furever home and family.

name: Nigel
description: Nigel is a friendly, fun guy. He is a male black lab. Nigel is a young adult, and we estimate his age to be about one year old. He still has a lot of puppy in him and is lovable and energetic. He weighs 64 lbs and tested negative for heartworms. He will be scheduled to be neutered soon. He came from the Panhandle area of Florida and was a stray before coming to Houndhaven. Nigel is waiting for someone to open their heart and give him the chance to become a loyal, faithful companion for life. To adopt Nigel, please review our policies and submit an application.

name: Gary
description:
In June, a hoarding case was discovered in Hunterdon County. Close to 200 dogs were pulled. We have 5 of 'the 188' here at Jersey Shore Animal Center. Dogs like this will need extra special homes. Lack of socialization will require homes with lots of patience. They are very nervous with new people and situations. Potential adopters may have to come multiple times to visit before these dogs can go home. We will be very particular where these little ones go. All newly adopted dogs are flight risks, but these even more so. A watchful eye is necessary. They are all between 4-8 years old. We have had them all spayed and neutered and brought them up to date on vaccines. They have also had badly needed dentals.

Gary (approx 5 years old and 13 lbs) is one of 'the 188' rescued from Hunterdon County and he's ready to find a home! He would do best with a quiet family who will give him time to settle in and get used to his new surroundings. He'd also thrive in a home with another mellow dog to show him the ropes and provide canine companionship. Gary likes the baby pool!

When dogs come from situations like this rescue in Hunterdon County, they've often never experienced the simple joys in life. Walking on the grass, sunshine on their faces, playing with toys and indulging on treats are all new to them. Our staff and volunteers have slowly started introducing the dogs to a variety of tastes and scents including ham, turkey, and carrots. Each day they make progress and we are so happy to see their personalities shining through.

Please click on the article below to read about the case:
https://www.nj.com/news/2019/07/dogs-rescued-from-hoarding-house-horror-need-you-to-adopt-them.html

*Per JSAC policy, puppies and kittens under 6 months will not be adopted to families with children under the age of 6 years.
