name: Argamo
description:
Argamo is a very sweet dog of 4 years old who we saved as all the others from the same kill shelter .

Messenger went open and 40 German Shepherds were on the kill list . We could only take 8 . Argamo was one of the lucky ones and came alive out of the shelter .

His nightmare is over ...

As usual we promise our dogs a family and HOME and we are here to keep that promise to our dogs .

We are looking for a sweet family who will give Argamo and the love he deserves, a bed to snuggle , a few toys to play and lots of quality time .

Argamo is located in Huntington NY . He is a little bit unsure about other dogs , a meet and greet is required . He is not a fan of cats .

To become his new family please apply today by filling in the  adoption link to find on our website www.a-teameliterescuedogs.com or email us and we send you one

name: Assana
description:
Our sweet little baby Assana .

Yes she looks adorable ...but fear is in her eyes .

Her owner passed away and clearly he did not care for his dogs . No vetting, no decent food and they don't know what love is .

9 dogs were on the property . We took 5 in and ALL of them are shaking over their body .

Assana bites the first leash over so we put stronger ones and to keep her safe we put 2 on .

She is cornered and surrenders . She lays on her back and I give her slowly some belly rubs... she is confused ...because she likes this .

This poor baby needs a good person who understands what abuse and neglect can do to a dog . She needs somebody with patience and time to give .

We have seen so many blooming open and it's wonderful how adopters and their dogs come together .

It would be nice if somebody can give her her golden basket where she feels safe and loved .

Assana is 3 years old , is ok with other dogs but also a little bit afraid sometimes and is not a fan of cats .

This little beauty is located in Huntington NY .

To become her new family please apply today by filling in the adoption application to find on our website www.a-teameliterescuedogs.com or email us and we send you one

name: Aster
description:
Meet Aster! Aster is a mixed breed pup who we believe will most likely be a medium sized pup around 50lbs. Whatever he is mixed with I can tell you itâs cute!! This sweet boy loves his people. He also loves playing with the other dogs in his foster home. He is working on potty and crate training and will need a family to continue to work with him. If you would be interested in adding Aster to your family please fill out an application out at 
forrescue.net
His adoption fee is $250 and he will have age appropriate vaccines, neutered, on flea/hw prevention and microchipped. He is located in Huntsville AL.

name: Mary
description:
Mary is a sweet-natured senior girl seeking a retirement home.  Eight-year-old Mary is a former stray from Huron County.  We don't know of her history, but we do know that she's a relaxed, affectionate lady. Mary still has plenty of smiles and love to give.  Consider opening your home to her today!

If you have kids and/or another dog in your family and are interested in adopting a Friendship dog please bring them with you for a meet and greet.  No appointment is necessary.  Stop by anytime during regular business hours. 

All dogs receive one or more vaccinations, a basic veterinary examination, are wormed, heartworm tested, and spayed or neutered.  Dogs 3 months and older are micro-chipped.

name: Dede aka Diamond
description: Hi I'm DEDE aka Diamond. I am a true survivor!!  I survived a very bad Hurricane named Superstorm Sandy that destroyed the shelter I was at! I was so very scared, especially when I first came to New York Bully Crew. It was a horrible storm. Today I am a lot better but I do need a strong experienced pack leader owner to help guide me and make me feel secure. I still tend to get nervous around some people-the stress and trauma I went through from that Hurricane and all the scary things afterwards that went along with it made me a bit insecure. Can you help me by being my leader?? Help me regain my confidence again? I am 8 years old and do ok with  other calm balanced dogs. They make me not so scared when they are near me. I would love a family to help me and my rescue family says I deserve to be treated like a Princess after all I've been through. Please go to www.nybullycrew.org and fill out the application for me. I'm waiting all this time for you!! I do hope you come for me soon!! Thank you!

name: Chief
description:
MEET CHIEF!
Chief is a 3 year old, neutered-male Boxer mix.  
This sweet boy is still young, so he will benefit from some obedience training.  A fenced yard would be a nice place for Chief to have some freedom outdoors.  Chief would do best in a home with older children. 
We are just getting to know him, so check back for more updates on this handsome guy.  
Chiefâs adoption fee is $100.00.  That includes neuter, vaccinations, heartworm test (negative), flea and heartworm prevention, deworming, microchip (plus registration) and a 30 day pet insurance policy offer. 
** You can meet CHIEF on Adoption nights, which are held every Friday from 4-6pm at our office located at 169 E Jefferson Street, Franklin, Indiana 46131.
**If you are interested in giving CHIEF a loving forever home, please submit an adoption application from our website www.petelves.com.   Email petelvesrescue@gmail.com with any questions.

name: Bear
description:
Bear was surrendered by his owner to an animal control officer because his owner would not bring him inside because the temperatures were over 90 degrees outside. Thankfully there is a local ordinance that requires owners to bring them inside when the temperature is extremely cold or hot here. He is between 5 and 6 years old and has lived his entire life on a chain. Since the shelter was full, we had to agree to pull him right away, as they have no choice but to euthanize for space when they get owner surrenders. He is in need of a foster or forever home in the Indianapolis area, where we can provide the needed medical care for him. ear is very easy going, and gentle, and gets along well with other dogs. He is untested with cats.  He is very easy going, and seems to like all people.  He rides fine in a vehicle too. He does not pull on a leash.  He is very sweet and a little timid. He has been groomed, had a biopsy done on some bumps on his back that were the result of flea dermatitis we found out, and is undergoing heartworm treatment.  His fly strikes have healed nicely. If you would like to help Bear, please complete a foster or adoption application on our website, www.igpr.org. Bear is located in Indianapolis, Indiana.

We recommend obedience training for all newly adopted pyrs, to help you create a special bond with you and your new friend, and so you have a well behaved canine. Great Pyrenees are willing to learn, but are not as eager to comply with commands as much as other breeds. They are bred to be independent thinkers. Applicants must be over 25, own their own home and all children in household must be over 6 years old. Your resident pets must be up to date on vaccines, sterilized, you must have a good history of vet care for them, and you must have used heartworm preventative year round for your dogs. 


Bear will be placed as an inside pet with outside privileges. You MUST have a securely fenced yard accessible from your home. Invisible fencing does not work with this breed and they will take the shock for the freedom.  Great Pyrenees are bred to roam and will create their own territory if not secured, which can led to them being lost, hit by vehicles or shot by people who see them as a threat. The breed is not a good off leash dog, and cannot be trusted to not run away.  A Great Pyrenees off leash is a \" DisAPyr.\" 

If you are interested in adopting or fostering, please complete the appropriate application on our website, www.igpr.org under the Adopt tab. 

All of our dogs marked as needing foster homes are also available for adoption.  If a dog is listed on this site, it is available.  No need to contact us to see if it is,  We do require you  complete the adoption application prior to meeting a dog.

We also offer a foster to adopt program. You foster the dog, and have first right of refusal on them if an approved application is submitted for them. 

In fostering a dog, the dog comes to you fully vetted. and groomed. You provide good quality food, grooming, and we provide the heartworm preventative and medical care, if needed* .(*Based on approval from IGPR.)

Adoption fee is $350

name: Joplin
description: Joplin is a very special case here at our shelter. She was rescued from a hoarder near the Nebraska/Iowa border when flood waters began to take over the property she was living in. She has never had a collar on or ever known what a leash is. She is very curious about things but hesitant of all people and will need someone who is willing to work with her quirks and trust issues. She gave us quiet a surprise after she was transferred her by delivering a litter of 3 puppies!! If you're interested in Joplin schedule a time to come out and meet this special girl!!

name: Ace
description: Ace is a very special case here at our shelter. He was rescued from a hoarder near the Nebraska/Iowa border when flood waters began to take over the property he was living in. Ace has never had a collar on or ever known what a leash is. He is very curious about things but hesitant of all people and will need someone who is willing to work with his quirks and trust issues. Once he warms up to someone he is happy to lay at your feet or just bask in the sun. If you're interested in Ace schedule a time to come out and meet this special boy!!

name: Blondie
description: Blondie is a very special case here at our shelter. She was rescued from a hoarder near the Nebraska/Iowa border when flood waters began to take over the property she was living in. Blondie has never had a collar on or ever known what a leash is. She is very curious about things but hesitant of all people and will need someone who is willing to work with her quirks and trust issues. Onces he warms up to someone she is happy to lay at your feet or just bask in the sun. If you're interested in Blondie schedule a time to come out and meet this special sweet girl!!

name: Ringo
description: Ringo is a very special case here at our shelter. He was rescued from a hoarder near the Nebraska/Iowa border when flood waters began to take over the property he was living in. Ringo has never had a collar on or ever known what a leash is. He is very curious about things but hesitant of all people and will need someone who is willing to work with his quirks and trust issues. Once he warms up to someone he is happy to lay at your feet or just bask in the sun. If you're interested in Ringo schedule a time to come out and meet this special boy!!

name: Noodle
description:
For fastest response please email Mary Lou at maryloumaria@yahoo.com

Hi my name is Noodle, a silly name for a silly boy! I'm A  70 lb 3 to 4 year old boxer  mix and I'm located in Ipswich MA. I'm very shy at first meeting but once I warm up I'm your bestest friend ever! I'm potty trained and crate trained but I don't like being locked away from my people. I love to go on long walks and could probably become a running buddy but I also like to snuggle in on the couch or on your bed but only if you promise to share your blankets!  I do like to play ball but generally only have a few minute attention span for that. I don't like to be left home alone so a person who is home a lot would be my perfect match unless you can take me everywhere with you! I'd LOVE that! I'm a super good boy in the car. I love other dogs, but I need a slow intro because I like to jump on them and for some reason they don't think that's a very good greeting weird huh? I don't get it. 
I was found as a stray and very skinny so now that I have food I don't like to share it and I need to eat in peace, for that reason my foster mom says no kiddos Under 12 for me. Also no cats or other small animals, she says that they don't make good snacks but I don't believe her. I'm a very smart and super food motivated so I will learn quickly. I would benefit from some training but all in all I'm a great catch! If it sounds like you'd be a good fit for me contact my buddy Mary Lou at Maryloumaria@yahoo.com 
A note from my foster mom,
 Noodle needs a very committed person who is willing to give him the time he needs to fully come out of his shell. It took about six weeks in foster care to see the completely silly and awesome dog he truly is!  He went from not touching a toy to now carrying his favorite one with him wherever he goes!!

name: XP Ace & Buddha - Iselin, NJ
description:
Ace and Buddha are looking for new places to live - they do not have to go to the same home. Ace is brindle & white while Buddha is the blue nose Pit Bull Both dogs are under a year old & are neutered. They have basic training and are crate trained, too. They are currently located in Iselin, NJ.

Ace and Buddha are NOT with 11th Hour Rescue but we are helping with the rehoming process. If you would like to meet these dogs, please contact Diane by email at diana.doyle2116@icloud.com

name: Demi
description: This beautiful, outgoing sweet little lady is Demi.  Demi was rescued by one of our team members from the streets of Jackson one freezing cold night in November.  She was with her chihuahua buddy, Rumor, who was adopted months ago.  Demi is about 3 years old.  She is a very outgoing, loving, loyal dog.  She is the perfect size, weighing only 35-40 lbs.  Demi wants nothing more than to get out of a kennel and into a home, whether it be a temporary foster home or forever family. This girl loves the water and to be outside in the grass.  She rolls around on her back in the grass and wants belly rubs.  Demi also loves toys and to play with other dogs her size, preferably males.  She can be somewhat of a diva around larger female dogs.  Demi is not doing well at our kennel facility.  She is very stressed and paces back and forth.  She just wants a person.  Her own person to love on her and dote on her.  She deserves attention and love.  We've done alot of research as to what Demi's breed might be, and we've believe she is Jack Russell Terrier/Basenji mix.  She is spayed, up to date with all vet care, and has even completed heartworm treatment.  She is so ready to find her forever family.  If you would like to meet Demi to see if she is a good match for your family,  please fill out the online adoption application at www.rrofms.org/adoption-application.  Secure fenced yard and solid vet history are required to adopt.  Her adoption fee is $125.

name: Sparky
description:
It's been over 10 years since the water rose up in Waveland, MS. Over 3,500 days since the hurricane cracked the skies open and drove the sea right into town. If you have to ask which hurricane, well, then you probably aren't from around here. Katrina made landfall at Waveland, MS, a small town of 7,000 just an hour east of New Orleans, on August 29, 2005, and you'd be hard-pressed to find any of God's good creatures in Waveland that don't remember. Destin and Sparky remember.



Chaos is too simple of a word to convey what that time was like, but it's the closest thing we've got. Fortunately, there were a few clear minds that day, including Doll Stanley and In Defense of Animals. The organization recognized the doom bearing down on animals in the region, petitioning courts to release captured animals in the pound. Destin was one such animal, languishing in the pound as the storm bore down on the Gulf Coast. At the 11th hour, a judge granted the request, forcing animal control to release the animals to safety. When they reached Destin, the water was already up to her neck. Destin and 34 other animals were rescued that night, but, sadly, thousands more souls lost their lives all along the coast. Destin and Sparky, who was discovered after the storm, were some of the lucky ones.



A number of animal rescue facilities went to work in the aftermath of Katrina, and ARF was one of the organizations born from the rubble. The 35 dogs from Waveland made the trip north to Jackson, and a few more groups soon followed. Destin and Sparky were placed together in their new home, and quickly became inseparable, sharing a bond that few of us can scarcely imagine. Yet over 3,500 days after the storm arrived, these two remain with ARF. Every one of the other 35 dogs has moved on, either adopted to a wonderful home or crossing the rainbow bridge. We've twice attempted to adopt Sparky individually, but both dogs immediately grew depressed and stopped eating. Their bond is unique and irreplaceable, and so even though we know how challenging it is to adopt two older dogs, we know that they need to be together. They are sweet and spunky, despite their advanced age. But the wisdom in their eyes is surely enough reward for providing a forever home.



Katrina had an impact that still reverberates throughout the region. As we think of it, we still mourn for those that have been lost. Yet we also recognize the events that catalyzed the creation of ARF, and are reminded of our mission. If you can't adopt Destin and Sparky today, then please continue joining us in this mission. Stop by sometime to walk these wonderful dogs. The lifeblood of this organization is our supporters, and we're grateful every day that you've helped us make it this far.

Sparky, Hound Mix has been shared from Shelter Exchange - http://www.shelterexchange.org.

name: Tutsi
description:
Love, sweetness and affection! That's what Tutsi is all about! Once unwanted by her previous owner because she would not guard his goats, she is now looking for a family to love her and spoil her without giving her any job assignments. All she's interested in are belly rubs, hugs and kisses. Known for bonding to her people quickly, Tutsi will be a wonderful addition to a family who has experience with large dogs and time and patience to teach her basic obedience. She is pending arrival to our rescue and will be located in Jacksonville, FL.

Please, visit www.dbgsdrescue.org to proceed to HOW TO AQDOPT section. Thank you.

name: Sprocket
description:
Sprocket is my name and I am the best boy in the world. I have been patiently waiting for a chance to prove it to my forever family. I have had some pretty rough experiences. These are the parts of my life that I have chosen to forget, but people see them all over my body. Good fortune came my way when Eleventh Hour Rescue saved me from the streets of Jersey City. They cleaned me up and made sure I was fully recovered.

  

 I am easy to take care of with a very short coat that needs occasional brushing mostly because I love it. I don't like to walk very far, but exercise is as important for my mind as it is for my body. I like to walk for about 15 minutes. I am built for comfort not for speed. I like to play with a jolly ball and to spend time outside sniffing around. I love to sit on a bench with a kissable human. I am a little shy with new people and I don't like loud noises. I will let you know I am unhappy about it by heading back indoors.

  

 A greeting from me means hoisting my \"low to the ground\" little body up as close as I can get and giving lots of kisses. When it is time for you to go I will head for my comfy bed and settle in with a toy and a Nylabone to chew. I learned to sleep in my crate, too. I may need a little time to get used to sleeping in a crate again after having a kennel run for a while, but I am a smart boy!

  

 Here are some obedience things I know: sit, down, stay, walking nicely on a leash with very little pulling.

  

 If you think we could be friends, even if you want to foster rather than adopt me, please fill out an application at www.ehrdogs.org & ask for me by name - SPROCKET!

name: Spot
description:
Foster or Adopter needed
Spot
You don't get any cuter than thisOMGOODNESS He was rescued from Johnson City TnHe is anxiously waiting for his fur ever home.Apply today!
https://www.russellrescuetn.com/donate/foster/
https://www.russellrescuetn.com/application-for-adoption/

name: Duke
description:
Duke is a beautiful black and tan German Shepherd with a classic coloring and confirmation that speaks to american bloodlines. Duke is estimated around 15 months of age. Duke came to us from a rural area of Kentucky where he had been living on a farm but was surrendered to the shelter for chasing livestock. Duke doesn't have much herding sense and is certainly not the best farm dog but he has lots of love to give. 

Duke is the definition of a big baby - he enjoys cuddles, butt scratches, and always being nearby for lovings. Duke is an enthusiastic boy who doesn't have a good concept of personal space therefore he is thrilled to be the over-sized lap dog you didn't know you needed. Duke does well when introduced to new people in public and introduced properly to visitors. He has been around children 7 and up without any issues but given his size and energy level we would not recommend him for a home with children under 6 or children that are not accustomed to large dogs.  

Duke does well with the other dogs in his foster home and navigates play groups well. He is a sensitive soul and gets his feelings hurt pretty easily which is in contrast of his lack of manners when meeting new dogs. He can be a typical pushy young dog when meeting new dogs and gets his feelings hurt when the other dog tells him to knock it off. He is learning with every interaction though and getting a good handle on social behavior. Duke has not been around any dogs under 40 lbs nor has he been tested with cats. 

Duke is searching for an active and loving home that will feed his sense of adventure while also providing guidance and training to ensure he keeps his best paw forward. If you're the home for Duke please email Tierhavenrescue@gmail.com for an adoption application or visit adoptapet.com/tierhaven for FAQs

name: Macy
description:
Macy is an adorable young girl around 9 months of age who is believed to be a Shepherd Cattle dog mix. Macy came from a rural part of Kentucky where she was live-trapped after being born to a pack of Shepherds that were free-roaming on a farm. Macy had zero human contact prior to being trapped and has been very slow to warm up. She is considered semi-feral at this point and is still overcoming her fears. 

Macy prefers to avoid all human contact but has begrudgingly learned how to walk on a leash and tolerate being handled for daily living. Macy is a fear biter and if cornered - such as when she is in her crate and needs to come out - she will lash out in fear. If you move slowly with Macy she settles down and will allow you to handle her but she gets overwhelmed easily when rushed. Macy is going to require extensive ongoing handling, training, and socialization coupled with lots of patience as she continues to grow and bond. 

Macy connects with other dogs much better than she does people as a result of her early life in a pack. She does well meeting new dogs and is quick to follow their lead. She isn't at a place of comfort that she plays often but every now and then she will forget the people are around and start to play with one of the other young dogs. Macy has not been around cats or small dogs although she is relatively small herself. We do not know how she would do as there is not true way to test her given her discomfort on leash. 

Macy has a sweet soul and is trying her best to overcome her fears and bond with the people around her. Macy is searching for a home that can provide her a stable environment and ongoing work as she continues to grow beyond her past. 

If you have a place in your heart and home for Macy please email Tierhavenrescue@gmail.com for an adoption application or visit adoptapet.com/tierhaven for FAQ

name: Crissy & Molly
description: Crissy is an 8 year old Cattledog/Hound mix while Molly is a 10 year old lab mix. These girls have been through a lot together and we would like them to live their lives out together in the perfect home. Crissy and Molly lived with one owner most of their adult lives. He passed away roughly 8 months ago and a family friend agreed to take the two girls to avoid them being sent to the shelter. Their previous owner lived in Florida so the girls were transported from Florida to Kentucky to settle in with the family friend. Unfortunately, just as these girls were settling and really starting to get comfortable again the new owner accepted a new position  with her job and was transferred to Texas and did not plan to take the two senior girls with her so they were surrendered to our facility. These girls are very easy going, Molly is very sweet and happy to see everyone, Crissy can be a bit shy at first but will quickly approach for attention, Crissy just isn't as excitable as Molly. Both are very mild mannered and are fine with other animals. As far as we know they are housebroke, Molly had a lipoma (fatty growth) removed from her leg when she was spayed but there is no need for any additional treatment. Crissy had a large wart taken off her ear when she was spayed but again, there is no need for additional treatment. These girls have been given a clean bill of health and are just looking for the perfect family to love them and give them the stability they are desperate for.

name: Shiloh
description:
Shiloh is a handsome young boy who is estimated around 3 years of age. Shiloh was completely feral when he arrived with Tier Haven from Hazard, Kentucky. He clearly had never been handled prior to this time and we are unaware of the circumstances surrounding his first few months.

Shiloh still has a very long way to go in trusting people. He has zero confidence in himself or the world around him resulting in a very timid and shy dog. Shiloh has no fear aggression and has never lashed out but is going to require a home with the patience to work with him to overcome his past. Shiloh does really well with people from a distance of about 5-7 feet and will linger on the outskirts of interactions but doesn't know what to do when the attention is turned to him. Shiloh will come up and nudge from behind seeking attention but does best when there isn't a big fuss made about it. He has a desire to be around people but is still so unsure of him.

Shiloh does great with other dogs and really relies on them for social cues. He was running with another dog - Bentley - who we suspect is his brother. Shiloh was definitely the follower and has stayed true to that role. He does great with other dogs and has learned how to navigate play groups really well. He would really benefit from having another dog or group of dogs in a home to show him the ropes and help him overcome his fears.

A volunteer reached out to us about Shiloh within minutes of when he was scheduled to be euthanized - there was certainly a large hand guiding him to safety and we hope to see him fulfill his potential with a loving home. 

If you have a place in your heart and home for this sweet young boy please email tierhavenrescue@gmail.com for an adoption application.

name: XP Monster (located in Keyport)
description:
This is Monster! She is not part of our rescue but she is listed as a courtesy for her owners who are looking for a new home for her.

Monster is a super loving, sweet girl who loves cuddling - she'd be the perfect companion for those cold winter nights which are surely on their way! Her favorite thing to do is run laps around the backyard and play with tennis balls. She especially loves to do that in the winter time in the snow.

Monster is a 7-year-old Shepherd mix who weighs 55 pounds. She is spayed & is up to date on her shots. She has been in her current home for the past 3 years but recently she has started scuffling with the other female in the home. She loves people but should go to a home where the kids are older plus she is not a fan of cats.

If you're interested in adopting her, please contact her owner directly. Kaitlin at 973 567 1586 or by emailing metalkatart@gmail.com - Monster is currently located in Keyport, NJ.

name: Snickers and Spot
description: Snickers and Spot are a bonded pair of puppies who were saved from a puppy mill. They are shy in new situations but once comfortable, like to play and be very silly. They are very high energy and need training. A secure, solid fence is REQUIRED. Applications accepted from potential adopters within 30 miles of King of Prussia, PA. To submit an application, please go to www.findingshelter.org

name: GiGi
description:
GiGi was rescued in December 2011 from a horrible puppy mill in Pikeville, Ky. As she was being rescued, she went into labor and delivered 5 beautiful, healthy babies. GiGi was a great Mom to her precious babies and were adopted. GiGi was scared to death of everything and has now finally begun to trust humans again. She deserves her own home where she can live the life of the happy girl she is now. She will need a special home that has the time to give her that she will need to settle in and feel safe. She is still scared of loud noises and any fast movement. It takes her a few days to feel safe around new people. There can not be any young children in her home as they would terrify her. GiGi wants to find her forever home and hopes you are looking for her, too. She loves to be around her person and will lay by you as long as you pet her. Please consider this very deserving little girl.  You must be in or very near the Louisville, Ky. area to adopt Gigi. Her perfect home would be with an older woman that is home a lot of the time. You must have puppy mill experience to be considered for this dog.

This dog requires an above ground structural fence for adoption. If you do not have one, do not apply for this dog. Please read her bio, if you do not live in or near Louisville, have no prior puppy mill experience or do not have a fenced yard, do not email me asking if any or all of the requirements are negotiable, they are not.  I will delete your request.

name: Martha
description: Martha is a five year old Bulldog. She weighs about 60 lbs. Martha came from a Lancaster County puppy mill where she was bred mercilessly beginning at 7 months. Did you know the leadership of 1 Love appeared on Oprah's puppy mill show? Our undercover investigation with Lisa Ling was seen by over 49M people around the world. This makes us extremely qualified to say without reservation, Martha is one of the sweetest mill dogs we've ever rescued. Bulldogs can have special health needs such as properly cleaning the folds in the skin on their faces, and treating their eyes with ointment if they get yucky. Martha is also a former breeding dog so her tummy does and will continue to hang down (if this bothers you pls do not apply, it is who she is and nothing can be done to pop everything back in place). Excellent vet references a must. Martha is great with children (Amish children fed and cared for her so she loves and is familiar with kids).

name: Nick & Patrick - BONDED PAIR
description: Nick and Patrick are very bonded buddies, saved from Lancaster County, PA puppy mills. They require a very secure, physical fence and are bonded so must go to a home together. The first step is to submit an application for adoption. Finding Shelter does not have a shelter. All of our dogs live in foster homes. For more information and to submit and application, please go to www.findingshelter.org.

name: Contessa
description:
I came from the Las Cruces area as a stray. At 18 months, I had an upper respiratory infection but I am all better now. I have a smooth, tan coat and I am pretty laid back. I hope I will find the perfect home where I can make someone happy!

I weight approximately 5 pounds

Adoption Fee - $225.00

name: Peanut2
description:
I live in Valencia County, New Mexico.

I was rescued from a hoarder in Las Cruces, New Mexico.

I have not been around people much, so they scare me. I need someone who has the patience to show me that people are not bad.

I have been micro-chipped.

At the time of this posting I am 5 years old.

name: Forever
description: Meet Forever . This adorable girl is a 1 1/2 year old Maltipoo. Sheâs about 14.1 lbs. Wee wee pad trained. Rescued from a private home in Las Vegas.

name: Pria Lavesque
description:
Pria is still available! Meet and greets are only scheduled with approved adopters, so please apply on our website.

Pria is a 5 month old terrier mix who came to us from Laurel County.  She is working on her cuddling skills and can be slightly mischievous! Pria takes a while to warm up to new people and needs some patience, but is the most delightful and devoted little girl once she does. She currently weighs 16lbs and her adult weight will likely not exceed 25lbs.

She enjoys being around other dogs and would absolutely LOVE a home with another dog to follow around and play with. Pria is very playful and has all the cute puppy mannerisms, without all that crazy puppy energy! She loves plush toys and can play happily with them all on her own. She has a very cute little howl-bark that she does when she's happy or wants attention and makes her foster family laugh with it all the time.

Pria is crate-trained and house-trained. She is fearful around small kids, so she'd do best in a home with older kids. She would also do best having another dog in the home.

She gets to sleep in her foster parents' bed and sleeps in a little ball on the end of the bed mostly, but sometimes her foster mom wakes up with a little Pria cuddled up in her neck. Some of Pria's favorite things include tennis balls, tiny dinosaur toys, long naps, chewing on bones in comfy beds, whipped cream, and being outside.

-----------------------------------------

If you are interested in meeting Pria, please fill out an application on our website: www.chibisfuriends.org. Click \"APPLY TO ADOPT.\" That menu also includes a link to our adoption process.

Her adoption fee is $225 which includes her spay, microchip, all age appropriate shots, dewormings, and Pria is heart worm negative. You will also receive the results from her Wisdom Panel breed/ancestry testing.

name: Kenzie
description: Kenzie came to Eunoia Rescue from Lee County more than a year and a half ago! This poor girl lived a rough life prior to coming to us, and had babies by the time she was a year old. Unfortunately some of the trauma Kenzie experienced early in life has stuck with her, and because of that Kenzie needs to be an only animal. She does great with all humans, and has even had extensive training with K-9 Good Manners! She is very well behaved, but has a lot of energy so will do best with someone who lives an active lifestyle. If youâre interested in giving Kenzie the home sheâs always dreamed of, send us a message!

name: Lei Lei
description:
Hi my name is Lei Lei. I am a male Chihuahua who is approximately 3-4 yrs old. I am looking for my forever home. I get along with kids, dogs and cats. When you rub or scratch my sweet spot I like to talk, but it comes out sounding like I'm growling. I love attention but sometimes I don't like to share my food and will give you a warning growl. I love car rides, taking long walks in the sunset, playing with toys and love to play fight sometimes. My favorite thing is the world though is playing ball in the yard - I love to run after it and bring it back over and over! I would love to meet you! So please consider me for adoption and contact SHR.
Please read below for some of our adoption policies:
To meet any of our animals outside of a scheduled event, an approved application is required. 
The adoption donation is $250.00 unless stated otherwise.
There is an additional, non-refundable $50 charge on any approved adoption when the adoptive home is located between 60-100 miles from Leonardtown, MD. If we agree to an adoption further than that there will be an additional charge.
Any adoption further than 60 miles is at the discretion of the Board due to availability of volunteers.

name: Ty
description:
My name is Ty and my foster mom thinks I have the cutest ears... (pretty obvious from the picture you think?).   Anyway, I'm about 5 years old and I am working on my house manners (but could really use more personal attention), I'm crate trained and I have figured out that when the crate gets open, I go OUTSIDE the door to do my business.  I have heard whispers that once you get into rescue that eventually (hopefully sooner rather than later), you get to go to another house, one where the people that live there are actual YOUR people!  I hope that's true as it sounds like just what I need!  If you have an empty spot in your heart and would love to have an active companion, then please contact Second Hope Rescue TODAY for an application!  (I can't wait to meet you!)

  Please read below for some of our adoption policies:  To meet any of our animals outside of a scheduled event, an approved application is required. The adoption donation is $250.00 unless stated otherwise.  There is an additional, non-refundable $50 charge on any approved adoption when the adoptive home is located between 60-100 miles from Leonardtown, MD.  If we agree to an adoption further than that there will be an additional charge.  Any adoption further than 60 miles is at the discretion of the Board due to availability of volunteers.

name: Connor
description:
Connor is one of those small compact dogs, that's pure love and enjoyment!  Connor is about 8 months old and won't get any bigger.  He is crate trained and doing good on his house training but needs a little more practice on his leash walking.  Connor hasn't met another dog yet that he hasn't liked and loves to play with them all, both large and small!  Connor would love his own home where he can watch TV with you and join the family during summer lazy day bar-b-ques!  Please contact Second Hope Rescue as soon as possible to meet this awesome dog and make your family complete!

 Please read below for some of our adoption policies:  To meet any of our animals outside of a scheduled event, an approved application is required. The adoption donation is $200.00 unless stated otherwise.  There is an additional, non-refundable $50 charge on any approved adoption when the adoptive home is located between 60-100 miles from Leonardtown, MD.  If we agree to an adoption further than that there will be an additional charge.  Any adoption further than 60 miles is at the discretion of the Board due to availability of volunteers.

name: Maiya
description:
Meet Maiya ... she is a female bull terrier/ pit mix. She is approximately 2 yrs old. She is small and compact, she is built like a bull terrier. Maiya loves to play with other dogs but does do better with male dogs.Â  She's crate trained and working on house training. Maiya also gets along with children, she is working on her manners.Â Â  Maiya lovesÂ attention and loves being petted.Â  Â

name: King
description:
Hi, my name is King and it's the perfect name for me because I'm a spectacular 2 1/2 year old male pure bred Pit Bull Terrier.  I love people and I've lived with children and a 12 year old 10 lb Chihuahua.  Now, I'm looking for the perfect person who can give me a loving home and help me be the amazing dog I know I can be.  I'm up to date on vaccinations, neutered, house trained, crate trained and identification micro chipped.  For more information, please call 240-925-0628 or email katmc@secondhoperescue.org.

Second Hope Rescue is located in Leonardtown, MD 20650 Please read below for some of our adoption policies: To meet any of our animals outside of a scheduled event, an approved application is required. name: Zak
description:
Zak is another formerly chained dog, having spent Â 3 years of his life living like that he was able to get into rescue, where it's now our mission to give him the home life he deserves. Zak is his new name to start his new life.  Zak is very loving and affectionate with the four people that are his caretakers. He barks at people he doesn't know but warms ups quickly once he knows you. Zak is house trained, and walks well on his leash.

Zak has been neutered, and is current on his shots.  Unfortunately after being chained, he is heartworm positive.  He will be undergoing treatment soon.  He can still be adopted before treatment, and his new home can follow through with this.
If you think Zak is who you have been looking for to add to your family - please contact us for an application.  Zak has lots and lots of love to give to the right home! If we agree to an adoption further than that there will be an additional charge.  Any adoption further than 60 miles is at the discretion of the Board due to availability of volunteers.

name: ROXIE - COURTESY LISTING
description:
MEET ROXIE ~ Courtesy Listing

ROXIE is a BEAUTIFUL and SWEET Brindle and White American Pitbull Terrier/Labrador Retriever Mix.  She is approximately four (4) years old and weighs 70 lbs.  ROXIE is spayed and is up to date on all vaccinations including rabies. She is currently on HW prevention.   She is house trained.   ROXIE loves people. Adults and older children will be great for her.   

She is very smart and knows some commands such as: sit, lie down, and taking food gently. With additional training, she could learn much, much more! 

ROXIE loves other dogs and adores people. In fact, she would love to spend all her time hanging out with her people and have a dog sibling to hang out with.   She chases cats, so a home without kitties would be best. The fastest way to her heart is through a belly rub.   

ROXIE is still young and gets anxious when left all alone, so she would need to be crated when you leave home.  ROXIE will need positive crate training.  She has met with a great trainer (Total Pet Care LLC.) and everyone thinks that with someone who can give her the training, time and patience that she needs, ROXIE will be able to overcome her separation anxiety!  She will win over any pet sitter or dog walker that may help throughout the day. Total Pet Care LLC will also donate an e-session for foster/adopter transition counseling.  She is a loyal, loving and affectionate girl just waiting to find her forever home. Is it you?' 

ROXIE is currently located in Lillington, NC. 

If you are interested in adopting ROXIE, please contact Rebecca Gridley via e-mail to: totalpetnc@gmail.com

name: Lucy
description:
Lucy is about a year old and 30 pounds. She will be in the large side once she fills out. Lucy came in as a very shy aloof dog. She is doing great with all dogs here at the home and responding well living with people. She is very kind. Still very much a puppy. Loves to play with the other dogs. She does try to eat chickens. So supervised visits only. She does ok with the horses. Wants to herd them and they drive is strong with her. Easily called off with a stern voice. Lucy would make a nice family dog. She is super sweet and has a ton of potential. 

Lucy is located in Littlestown, PA. For questions, please contact kimberlylind13@gmail.com.

COMPLETE AN APPLICATION
http://www.acdra.org/adoption-application

name: Hank
description:
Hank is about a year old and 45#. He is still a big puppy. Meaning he will eat dog beds and chew on shoes but he is sweet and has a ton of potential. He currently lives on a working horse farm with free range chickens. He does fine with the chickens supervised and same with the horses. Hank lived his whole like outside and didnât know anything about living in a house. He does well. Crates fine and loves to hang with his people. 

Not recommended for a home with young kids. Hank has a lot of play and he is too much for small children. 

Hank is located in Littlestown, PA. For questions, please contact kimberlylind13@gmail.com.

COMPLETE AN APPLICATION
http://www.acdra.org/adoption-application

name: Scout
description:
Scout is about a year and a half old and 45 lbs.. He is a confident dog that is loyal to a fault. Meaning he will resource guard his people. So an experienced adult home only. Scout is very loving, well trained, house broke and all business when it comes to his people. Experienced ACD owners preferred. No children. 
 		
Scout is chicken, horse and cat safe. He is fine with other dogs but can be a bully. He bosses some around here and gets bullied by others. So middle of the pack is a good way to define his personality. Excellent recall and good manners with his people. 

Scout is located in Littlestown, PA.

For questions, please contact kimberlylind13@gmail.com.

COMPLETE AN APPLICATION
http://www.acdra.org/adoption-application

name: Red Rock
description:
RedRock is about a year old and 40 pounds. He is an absolute sweetheart. Excellent with cats, dogs, chickens and horses. Rocky is a favorite here. He had a pretty rough start to life. His original family didnât understand ACDs at all and disciplined him for things like heeling kids and nipping heels. To the point of being kicked so hard his hip was shattered. ACDRA had FHO surgery performed and this boy is good as new. Because of this he does have fear aggression towards young children. Older kind kids he is great with. 

Rocky was also diagnosed with diabetes insipidis. Not to be confused with diabetes. This condition does require eye drops twice a day for life. No exceptions. This condition is managed 100% as long as you administer his meds which he is a perfect gentleman for. Rocky is a solid citizen with an amazing disposition. 

Red Rock is located in Littlestown, PA. For questions, please contact kimberlylind13@gmail.com.

COMPLETE AN APPLICATION
http://www.acdra.org/adoption-application

name: Gracie Lee
description:
Gracie Lee came to us from a shelter in Long Island, she was very scared in there and would not let anyone go near her except one volunteer named Linda. Linda contacted us by email and begged for Gracie's life. We took a trip to meet her and said this girl does not deserve to die, so yes we took her and Linda drove her out to us. When Gracie got here she was scared, we let her decompress for a day then started working with her, what a lovely girl indeed. Gracie takes some time to warm up but she eventually does and has a heart of gold. She is good with other dogs, we have not tested with cats yet but that can be done if required. We also would suggest older children since they would understand on how to go slow with Gracie Lee. She so deserves a family of her own and she is patiently waiting.
Gracie is being fostered in Orange County NY 
If interested please email us at rottnrescues@aol.com

name: Bruno adoption pending!
description:
Meet Bruno! he is a handsome chow/golden mix who is very sweet and friendly..
(After two years of being boarded (His owner was in a nursing home) ) He is now safe with Heart Rescue.  He is a good boy, affectionate, wanting for attention. He walks great  on a leash, is great in the car and good with other dogs. However he should be the only dog in the household.  Bruno is waiting patiently for a new family to love.   He is currently located in Long Island.   If interested in adopting Bruno or would like to help by fostering Please email troman0218@hotmail.com for applications
We need a foster home for Bruno, if interested in helping this sweet boy please email Toni at troman0218@hotmail.com

name: Roxy
description: Roxy is a 10 month old hound mix she is crate trained and completely vetted. She is located in Lorain, OH. Fosters are willing to meet. She will need time to get adjusted to her new home so we recommend going slow with her. She is a great dog she just needs time to prove it. She loves laying on the couch next to you. She will go in her crate if she feels uncomfortable so we always leave the door open for her. She loves treats and takes them gently. We are unsure about how she is with cats but will soon cat test her. She can play a little rough with other dogs. Her adoption fee is $200

name: Minnie
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Adoption Application
Minnie was surrendered to us from a family with older Basset Hounds and Minnie had too much energy for them so they chose to rehome her. She has done very well in the foster home. She is very protective of her food and toys with other dogs. She has done well with other dogs but recently has been too rough with them. We're recommending that Minnie go to a home without other pets. We will be at the Potomac Mills PetSmart located at 13337 Worth Avenue, Woodbridge VA 22192 every Sunday from 1230 - 300 and at the Lorton PetValu located at 9427 Lorton Market Street Lorton VA on the 2nd Saturday of each month from 12 - 2. We look forward to meeting you.

name: Kinzey
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Adoption Application
Hi! My name is Kinzey, and I am a 6 year old American Foxhound mix. I was adopted 4 years ago, and my new mommy and I were absolutely crazy about each other. Sadly, my new mommy passed away suddenly and unexpectedly. Now, I am back in a foster home, and while I really like it here, I would love to find my fur-ever home again. I am a silly, smart, loveable, playful cuddlebug. I like to play, but I am perfectly content to amuse myself while you do your thing, and I love to snuggle up next to you while you relax. I give the best hugs!!! I'm a little shy around new people, but with a little time and patience, I always come around. I am house-trained and love to go for car rides and WALKS - walks are the BEST!!! My foster says that I am close to being the PERFECT DOG. I attach to my family very quickly and have some anxiety when they leave me alone. I can bust out of crates and would do best in a home with a stay at home parent, not a necessity; however, I have destroyed some things I shouldn't have, such as carpeting because I was trying to get to my family. I am spayed, microchipped, and up to date on all my vaccinations. If you would like to meet me (and I sure HOPE you do!), please fill out a no-obligation, online application at animalfriendsva.org/animals, and scroll down to Kinzey, (the pretty one waiting for a home!). On that page is my application.

I will also be at all of our adoption events and you can bring me treats to help fatten me up. I'll be at the Potomac Mills PetSmart located at 13337 Worth Ave Woodbridge VA every Sunday from 1230 - 3 and the Lorton Petvalu located at 9427 Lorton Market St, Lorton VA on the 2nd Saturday of each month from 12 - 2. I look forward to meeting you. 9/19/19 3:55 PM

name: LA - Magnus
description:
Will you allow me to be your shadow? I just graduated from a professional training program where I have learned the most gentlemanly manners including house training, crate training, and basic obedience.  I prefer to be the only canine in your life, but dog-savvy felines are ok.  After all, a human only really needs one Bullmastiff shadow. Otherwise it just gets too crowded when I follow you into the bathroom or snuggle with you on the couch.
I am about 3 years old, located in Louisiana, up-to-date on vaccinations, neutered, microchipped, and currently undergoing HW treatment via a slow kill method. The medications for this slow kill treatment can easily be continued in my new home and are provided by the rescue until I test negative for heart worms.
For more information please email us.  
PLEASE NOTE: Adopters are only considered with a completed adoption application, including references and a home visit.  Please visit our website http://bullmastiff.us/rescue to apply or to make a donation toward the care of our homeless Bullmastiffs.

name: Misha
description:
Misha is a beagle mix - possibly with some Shih Tzu in her - that was born approximately 2011.  She came to us from a shelter in Louisville and although we don't know her history, we know that Misha is ready to make a fresh start!  When Misha first came to us, she was scared and very unsure of all the changes going on in her life.  She is becoming more comfortable and is blossoming into a sweet, affectionate girl with people that take the time to get to know her.  She has the cutest wiggle in her hind end when she sees people she knows!  Misha still has a lot of love left to give and would make a wonderful companion for someone.  She weighs 43 lbs (but needs to lose a few pounds to get down to a healthier weight).

If you would like to visit Misha, our shelter is open MWF from 1-4 pm and Saturdays from 9-noon. We are located at 14 Fido Ct., Frankfort KY 40601. We can be reached at (502)875-3436.

If you have questions about this animal, please contact the adoption counselor directly at amyc0405@yahoo.com. Applications to adopt Misha can be downloaded from our website (www.lifehouse4animals.org) under the 'Adopt' section and emailed directly to the adoption counselor at amyc0405@yahoo.com, or can be filled out in person at the shelter. We are completely staffed by volunteers and are typically unable to complete the adoption process on the same day that applications are submitted. Please understand that it can sometimes take 2-4 days to process an application.

name: Bebe--COME MEET ME
description:
Bebe will be at our Open  House on Monday, Sept 23 from 3-5pm at 106 Adams St, Medfield, MA.  

Bebe is a 5 yr old 3 legged chihuahua who is in need of a forever home. She was picked up stray in Boston.  Bebe tolerates other dogs but can be quite bossy towards them.  She loves to play with squeaky toys and is used to sleeping in bed with her person.  She hates to be disturbed while sleeping though so that saying, \"Let Sleeping Dogs Lie\

name: Ruby - Come Meet Me
description:
Come Meet Me!  Ruby will be traveling to Massachusetts this week and will be at our Open House on Monday, September 23 from 3-5 at 106 Adams Street, Medfield, MA, unless spoken for prior to that time.  Ruby is a 30 pound, 15 week Hound mix puppy.  She and littermates, Rogan, Trey, and Copper were born to a stray who became pregnant.  They have a typical puppy energy level and enjoy  playing, treats, the outdoors, and water to play in.  Ruby is doing well with her crate and house training.  If you can give this adorable puppy her forever home, please apply today.  Puppies do best with children 5 and up.  Ruby's adoption fee is $475.

Adoption coordinator:  Pam

Please complete an online APPLICATION if you wish to adopt.  Forever Home Rescue New England is a 501(c)3  non-profit organization. We are a network of foster homes in the South and the New England area. THERE IS NO SPECIFIC SHELTER LOCATION. If you wish to meet our dogs, you must first be approved by going through our application and screening process. Forever Home Rescue suggests obedience training for all puppies and dogs. All dogs are up to date on their shots, dewormed and spayed or neutered. Vet fees, transport fee and New England quarantine fees ARE INCLUDED in each dog's adoption fee. Also, any dogs older than pups--even if they are not marked housetrained in their posting---usually housetrain within a day or two, because most are used to living outside in the south and will prefer to do their business outdoors. Our dogs and pups are best suited for families with children 5 yrs old and up. If you are approved to adopt, please submit the $100 deposit by clicking on our rescue's name in this posting (Forever Home Rescue New England--in purple) which will bring you to a new page with the deposit link at the bottom.  STOP! If you have not been notified of your approval status do not make a deposit.

name: Copper - Come Meet Me
description:
Come Meet Me! Copper will be traveling to Massachusetts this week.  He will be at our Open House on Monday 9/23 from 3-5 at 106 Adams Street, Medfield, MA, unless spoken for prior to that time.  Copper is a 27 pound, 15 week Lab mix puppy.  He and littermates, Rogan, Trey, and Ruby were born to a stray who became pregnant.  They have a typical puppy energy level and enjoy  playing, treats, the outdoors, and water to play in.  Copper is doing well with his crate and house training.  If you can give this sweet puppy his forever home, please apply today.  Puppies do best with children 5 and up.  Copper's adoption fee is $475.

Adoption coordinator:  Pam

name: Spice-COME MEET!
description:
Spice will be at our open house on Monday, Sept 23 from 3-5pm at 106 Adams St, Medfield, MA. 

Spice was surrendered by her family of 8 years because they have small children, including a 10 month old crawling baby.  Spice has become blind from glaucoma, and a bit anxious as a result.  The family was worried about keeping Spice around a crawling baby.  She has been overall a wonderful pet for this family. We are now looking for a quiet home for her for her later years.  She is 9 years old and weighs 40 pounds. We feel she would do best in a home with a gentle, older dog or with a person who is home most of the time.  She would just need to be fed separately from another dog, as she does protect her food from other dogs. We don't know how she would be with a cat, so a cat free home is probably best for her. In her 8 years, she has nipped one time, and that was after she became blind, and a new (not the usual) dogwalker came in and tried to take her out of the bathroom, where she was hiding.  She is fine with people in general. There is no adoption fee for this sweet girl, as we just want to find the right home for her.

name: Annie - Come Meet Me!
description:
Come Meet Me!
Annie is being fostered locally and  she will be at our open house on Monday, September 23 from 3-5 at 106 Adams Street, Medfield, MA, unless spoken for prior to that time.


Annie/Daisy is an Australian Cattle Dog(Blue Heeler)/Hound mix puppy who is just under under 2 years old and about 45 pounds.
Annie/Daisy is a sweet dog.. She is very content to lay around the house, but also loves to play outside and can show unending energy when chasing a ball or hiking. Her favorite words are âgo for a walk,â âball,\" âoutside,â and \"go for a ride.\" She loves to chew, but destroys toys quickly, so she needs sturdy objects such as elk antlers to gnaw on. She has been pretty good about not destroying household items. She is housebroken and is trained to nose bells hung on the door to ask to go out. She is crate trained and likes her crate, but hasnât been put in it for months. She sleeps on a dog bed on the floor of a bedroom. She is smart and knows several commands, including âsit,â âlie down,â âstay,â âcome,â âdrop it,â and âleave it.â  She takes a little while to warm up to some dogs, but others she loves to run and play with. She is a herder by nature..   She would do best in a home where she will be played with and go on hikes. Annie/Daisy would do best with older children. If you can give Annie/Daisy her forever home, please apply today. Her adoption fee is $400.

Adoption coordinator:  Pam

Please complete an online APPLICATION if you wish to adopt.  Forever Home Rescue New England is a 501(c)3  non-profit organization. We are a network of foster homes in the South and the New England area. THERE IS NO SPECIFIC SHELTER LOCATION. STOP! If you have not been notified of your approval status do not make a deposit.

name: Sasha
description:
Hi! My name is Sasha. I am a beautiful beautiful 85 lb, 4 year old Great Pyrenees Mix. I am located in MA and looking for a home! I am your classic Pyr... I like to run around a fenced yard, patrol and chase critters but I also love to lounge and just hang out with you. I get attached to my people and want to take on the world. So, I really need a person that understands my breed and can work with me on some of my confidence issues. I am naturally protective of my people and my home (its just the way my breed is sometimes!) so I need a person who can help me with that task so I don't think I have to do it all myself! I know lots of commands, I am housebroken, good when left alone and really just looking for a person or couple to chill out with. I am good at walking on leash and in the car! I need a leader to show me support and lots of love and positive reinforcement but also to accept me as me!  If you have kids, I would really appreciate if they are 10 and up so they understand that I like to eat alone and just sometimes act like the princess I am. 
 Other dogs - that's okay but if they could be medium or large, I would appreciate it too.  Also, my new owner, if I am joining another dog needs to be confident in setting boundaries and slow introductions.  I live as an only now so that will take some adjustment!  Please email erin@asecondchanceforziva.com for more info!

*********************************************************************************
A Second Chance for Ziva, Inc. (ASCZ) is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization dedicated to saving the lives of dogs regardless of breed, size or age. ASCZ rescues, cares for and adopts out homeless dogs into loving and responsible homes.  ASCZ will respond to all inquiries within 72 hours. For more information and questions, please contact info@asecondchanceforziva.com.

name: Zane AB
description:
âOh give me a homeâ¦., where the buffalo roamâ¦..donât cha just love westerns? I do!

But I donât have to go out west to be happy! I live in Massachusetts and I love it here! 

I am a 4 year old, male Anatolian Shepherd mix with a long luxurious coat that has finally filled back in. My first owner had me locked up a lot and let my coat get all funky due to my allergies, but with medicine and good food I am feeling so much better! In the winter I felt my best, but these pesky allergies seem to creep up on me in the spring and summer and make me itch! So annoying!

If  you want to adopt me, I do have a few requirements. First, no kids! They can be overwhelming and I like to be able to relax and snooze in peace! Second, Iâd like to be the only boy dog in the home (or only dog). Right now I live with two sisters and a brother - and boy do my brother and I get on each others nerves! I also have horse and cat friends at home and am a great farm dog!

I am a gentle ball of fluff at 125 pounds and take up a whole big dog bed. I love to sleep on the floor by your bed incase you need me at night, so no worries about trying to fit me in your bed! 

I have excellent house manners and would never go on any furniture or jump around in the house! I am a gentleman so I donât need a crate and get to pick any room I want to relax in. I will even let you know if someone comes over, but I always greet them with affection.

I enjoy car rides, walks at the park and always stick right by my moms side. I attract a LOT of attention everywhere I go and strangers always love to pat me! I am very handsome if you canât tell from my pictures!! 

Do you think weâd be a good fit? If so, let my mom know! She knows me really well and can tell you how fantastic I am! â

GOD'S DOGS Rescue does not have a shelter -  Each dog comes spayed or neutered, up-to-date with age appropriate vaccinations, microchipped, heartworm tested and are current with monthly flea/tick and heartworm preventatives. 

ALL OF THIS IS INCLUDED IN THE Local ADOPTION FEE OF $300.  Medical records will come with each dog at the time of adoption.

I am located in MA, with my previous adopters. I am a great boy but need a home without young kids and another male dog PLEASE!!!!

 Please contact us at info@godsdogsrescue.org for more information about adopting one of our dogs and puppies or fill out an application at https://www.shelterluv.com/matchme/adopt/GDR/Dog

Please visit our website http://godsdogsrescue.org/ for helpful information re: transport, our adoption process and application, volunteering and fostering, and photos of our dogs/pups looking for homes!!

Thank you for wanting to adopt a rescued dog, their LIVES depend on it!

name: Rick
description:
It's hard to miss Rick when you walk our grounds. He's the handsome St. Bernard/Siberian husky mix sitting expectantly in his kennel for the fun to begin. Rick is originally from Macon County in North Georgia. He has lived in a house, done well in foster care, and would like to settle in a home of his own. At 52 pounds, three-year-old Rick is a fairly big boy. He likes other dogs, knows his commands, and rides in the car so exceedingly well that you almost forget he's there. In fact, as an occasional treat, we drive him around the block. 

Rick needs an adults-only home with dog-experienced people who can take him for walks and continue his training. He'll repay you with loyalty and love and then some. Come meet him.

name: BOOMER
description:
Please contact Jenny Cope (giveadogahome@live.com) for more information about this pet.
BOOMER was an owner surrender on 1st September 2019 due to the fact that he and his sibling were starting to not get along and due to a fight between the brothers, Boomer was going to be euthanized. Neither siblings were neutered and so most likely hormones and common sibling rivalry.

BOOMER is a handsome Foxhound who is neutered, just had his 3 year booster rabies vaccine, core vaccines, heartworm/tick disease tested negative, de-wormed, monthly heartworm and flea/tick prevention and micro-chipped He has an estimated date of birth of 25 August 2018 and weighs 65 pounds.

Following his neuter on 9th September 2019, Boomer went home to stay with a foster family who live in the Litchfield, Maine area, just south from Augusta and is acclimating well and the foster family adore him.

Notes from his foster family:

BOOMER is a GREAT boy he is very affectionate, knows a few basic commands and loves to play. He definitely has that \"hound\" personality

and likes the company of other dogs, children, and adults and is heartbroken when left alone. Boomer has not been acclimated to cats but I think he would do fine. Hounds need a lot exercise and the foster family is currently working on leash and obedience training. Boomer is house trained and will let you know by whining or scratching at the door.

At 65 pounds, Boomer is a strapping young hound and basically mild mannered in the home. Hounds can be independent and stubborn in nature, particularly if their nose is in pursuit of an outdoor smell. Boomer is lovable in nature and will definitely win you over with his charm, love and loyalty.

On intake from the rescue.

I was informed by the family giving him up that Boomer has lived with his sibling, another dog, two small children and his mum and dad and was a wonderful part of the family. He has never shown any aggression, was well behaved, house-trained, he would go on long walks, play frisbee, chew on bones and a Kong and LOVED people.

When Boomer arrived at the rescue he was clearly stressed, upset and unsure what was going on. He has never been away from his brother and of course being left by his dad whom he has lived with since he was a small puppy caused some anxiety. He did settle down after a while and met some of the dogs. Not being fixed when he arrived he was a bit \"frisky\" with some of the dogs and so it was best to keep him separate until he has been neutered. He is in the house with the dogs, just living at the other end, but he does lie and sit next to the gate dividing them and is doing great making friends this way. He is definitely a social boy and I am sure when neutered there will be no issues, his family said he was never a problem around dogs, animals or humans and had two very small human siblings whom he adored.

BOOMER needs a family that lives in the country or are very outdoorsy and active, where he has a lot of places to explore, however, working on training and recall would be extremely important before he is allowed to run loose because being a hound, he will most likely be very easily distracted and would most definitely chase after squirrels and wildlife. A family that can take him on daily runs in rural areas, would be a great for him and with no distractions of people or other dogs an enjoyable activity. He is used to living with a family and so when alone, he does have that loud hound bark/howl, so plenty of interaction and mental stimulation. BOOMER loves toys, if they have a squeak in all the better, he will play for hours happily and I am sure the puzzle toys for dogs would help keep him entertained.

BOOMER is available for adoption from Give a Dog a Home, German Shepherd Dog Rescue for an adoption fee of $400.

This fee is not negotiable and is used to cover the rescue costs of pulling, vetting, health certificate, transport from Texas to Maine, monthly preventatives, supplements, food and anything else that is needed. If you feel that you have the heart and home to give this precious soul a wonderful life, please go to our website, under the APPLICATION tab, complete, then submit the APPLICATION. Our process takes around 2-4 days, and ensuring your references are aware that we will be calling, could speed up the process. Once you have been approved, we discuss any questions in regards to the dog you are wanting to adopt, then you complete and submit the contract, make payment and then we can work out the pick up / transport arrangements.

Please do NOT submit an application if you are not looking to take home a new best friend within the next few weeks. http://www.giveadogahome-sanantonio.org

BOOMER is located with a foster family in Litchfield, Maine (just south of Augusta). We post in various states along the east coast and Canada where we have had lots of successful adoptions to enable more exposure for these beautiful saved souls. Families will need to be prepared to travel to the rescue to meet and take home their new best friend. Sebec is located just outside the towns of Dover-Foxcroft and Milo (approx 8 miles) and approx 45 miles from Bangor. There are also lots of hotels, motels, pet friendly accommodations and wonderful camp-sites for the more adventurous families and what a great way to get to know your new best friend. If there are options to arrange transport, we will work with you to make it happen.Give a Dog a Home, German Shepherd Dog Rescue

187 Downs Road, Sebec, Maine, 04481

giveadogahome@live.com

All pets adopted will be spay/neutered, micro-chipped, de-wormed,heartworm tested, rabies and relevant vaccinations.

NO DOG WILL BE ADOPTED TO BE AN OUTSIDE DOG!

If you would like to start the adoption our process is below:

Submit Application with two personal references and a vet reference.

If you have never had pets and do not have a vet, we will need THREE personal references.

Ensure references are people who know you and your lifestyle well.

Applicant MUST inform vet and references that someone from GaDaH will be calling.

As long as we are able to contact your vet and references, it takes just 1-3 days to process and hopefully approve applications.

If you rent we will need an approval letter for the breed of dog you are wanting to adopt from your landlord on official letterhead paper or email.

Rescue processes and hopefully approves applications.

Once approved, rescue invites applicant to come to the rescue to meet your chosen dog/s, spend time with him/her

and then hopefully take him/her home.

We do NOT hold dogs so if you are unable to come within a week or so of submitting your application the dog will still be available for adoption to other families.

For Canadian adopters, all that is needed to get them across the border into Canada is a current rabies certificate and proof of adoption, which is the adoption contract. Both of which are included in the medical file you will get when you adopt. (https://www.aphis.usda.gov/aphis/pet-travel/by-country/pettravel-canada)

Ensure ALL Fields are filled in, if something is relevant, then put n/a or something in so it recognizes an entry.

We do not recommend using a phone or ipad since these applications for some reason don't tend to come through and you will have spent a lot of time on the application for nothing as it will need to be re-done.

Once we have you approved we can schedule an appointment for you to come to meet

him/her at the rescue in Sebec, Mane and then hopefully take them home to start your new life.

I just have to work on an appointment basis as I run a boarding/day care business and the rescue and so am really busy, but by planning ahead of time I can be pretty flexible.

http://www.giveadogahome-sanantonio.org/adoption-application.html

name: BUSTER - $300
description:
Please contact Jenny Cope (giveadogahome@live.com) for more information about this pet.
BUSTER is neutered, core vaccines, rabies, de-wormed and micro-chipped. He has an estimated date of birth of 16 November 2018 and weighS around 15.00 pounds. He is listed as a Lab/Boxer mix. We have no way of knowing the exact breed, it is up to individuals to decide what breed they think is most likely.

Since being at the rescue BUSTER has lived amongst a lot of dogs of all ages and sizes ranging from small chi's, middle sized dogs up to adult German Shepherds and so he is very dog socialized and very confident. He is friendly with people and has enjoyed cuddles from a friends 7 year old granddaughter.

We do not have cats or livestock at the rescue so cannot comment on how he would be around them.

BUSTER is young and used to being around lots of dogs so we are hoping for a family who either adopts another rescue or who has other pets at home. He is a young pup and so chewing is very much to be expected. He does use pee pads but also at times does use the dog door to go outside. He will need house training along with all basic training, manners and general behaviour. His personality is still developing and so it will be up to the family to ensure he stays a loving, gentle, playful, affectionate pup whilst growing into an adult dog.

Since being at the rescue he is totally loving life, he loves to play with toys, chew on hooves and horns, wrestle and chase with the other dogs and get lots of love and cuddles as much as he can. He is high energy and he feeds of the excitement of the other dogs, but does calm down and settle after a while. He is a great boy who has never shown any kind of aggression in any way.

As with all rescue's he needs guidance and training and we recommend families go through at least the basics of training with him themselves so that boundaries, personalities and body language can be learned from each other. BUSTER is very responsive and training would be fun and easy as long as proper training techniques are followed and are consistent.

We do not recommend dog parks for several weeks, if not months, it is so very important for families and dogs to form a strong bond and get to know each other before exposing them to the potential dangers of dog parks. Although all GaDaH dogs are very well socialized with other dogs, lots of other dogs have not had the benefit of this socialization and do not always know how to play and act with other dogs. You also do not know the control the other families have over their dogs and you should always have a good recall for your adopted dog before going to dog parks.

He is going to be a medium / large dog and so we are looking for an active family who goes out and about and intends to take their new family member as many places with them as possible.

BUSTER would benefit from a family that goes on walks and adventures and road trips together. We do not recommend dog parks it is so very important for families and dogs to form a strong bond and get to know each other before exposing them to the potential dangers of dog parks. Although all GaDaH dogs are very well socialized with other dogs, lots of other dogs have not had the benefit of this socialization and do not always know how to play and act with other dogs. You also do not know the control the other families have over their dogs and you should always have a good recall for your adopted dog before going to dog parks.

We do NOT adopt puppies out to be either emotional support or service dogs, but we welcome applications for out adult dogs.

All dogs (except dogs saved from China) are available for adoption for an adoption fee of $550.

Canadian adopters need to know that customs charge 15% taxes when entering into Canada. This fee is not negotiable and is used to cover the rescue costs of pulling, vetting, health certificate, transport from Texas to Maine, monthly preventatives, supplements, food and anything else that is needed.

If you feel that you have the heart and home to give this precious soul a wonderful life, please go to our website, under the APPLICATION tab, complete, then submit the APPLICATION. Our process takes around 2-4 days, and ensuring your references are aware that we will be calling, could speed up the process. Once you have been approved, we discuss any questions in regards to the dog you are wanting to adopt, then you complete and submit the contract, make payment and then we can work out the pick up / transport arrangements.

Please do NOT submit an application if you are not looking to take home a new best friend within the next few weeks.

http://www.giveadogahome-sanantonio.org

ALL Dogs are LOCATED AT THE RESCUE IN SEBEC, MAINE.
We post in various states along the east coast and Canada where we have had lots of successful adoptions to enable more exposure for these beautiful saved souls. Families will need to be prepared to travel to the rescue to meet and take home their new best friend. Sebec is located just outside the towns of Dover-Foxcroft and Milo (approx 8 miles) and approx 45 miles from Bangor. There are also lots of hotels, motels, pet friendly accommodations and wonderful camp-sites for the more adventurous families and what a great way to get to know your new best friend. If there are options to arrange transport, we will work with you to make it happen.
Give a Dog a Home, German Shepherd Dog Rescue

187 Downs Road, Sebec, Maine, 04481

giveadogahome@live.com

All pets adopted will be spay/neutered, micro-chipped, de-wormed,heartworm tested, rabies and relevant vaccinations.
