If you would like to start the adoption our process is below:

Submit Application with two personal references and a vet reference.

If you have never had pets and do not have a vet, we will need THREE personal references.

Ensure references are people who know you and your lifestyle well.

Applicant MUST inform vet and references that someone from GaDaH will be calling.

As long as we are able to contact your vet and references, it takes just 1-3 days to process and hopefully approve applications.

If you rent we will need an approval letter for the breed of dog you are wanting to adopt from your landlord on official letterhead paper or email.

Rescue processes and hopefully approves applications.

Once approved, rescue invites applicant to come to the rescue to meet your chosen dog/s, spend time with him/her

and then hopefully take him/her home.

We do NOT hold dogs so if you are unable to come within a week or so of submitting your application the dog will still be available for adoption to other families.

For Canadian adopters, all that is needed to get them across the border into Canada is a current rabies certificate and proof of adoption, which is the adoption contract. Both of which are included in the medical file you will get when you adopt. (https://www.aphis.usda.gov/aphis/pet-travel/by-country/pettravel-canada)

Ensure ALL Fields are filled in, if something is relevant, then put n/a or something in so it recognizes an entry.

We do not recommend using a phone or ipad since these applications for some reason don't tend to come through and you will have spent a lot of time on the application for nothing as it will need to be re-done.

Once we have you approved we can schedule an appointment for you to come to meet

him/her at the rescue in Sebec, Mane and then hopefully take them home to start your new life.

I just have to work on an appointment basis as I run a boarding/day care business and the rescue and so am really busy, but by planning ahead of time I can be pretty flexible.

name: Bandit
description:
ALL OF OUR DOGS ARE IN PRIVATE FOSTER HOMES IN LOUISIANA AND/OR MAINE (or partnering humane society in Louisiana). BECAUSE WE DON'T WORK OUT OF A FACILITY, WE ARE NOT OPEN TO THE PUBLIC. THE FIRST STEP IN ADOPTING A DOG IS COMPLETION AND APPROVAL OF AN APPLICATION.  

 

PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE AT www.puppyloveme.org TO COMPLETE AN APPLICATION AND FOR MORE INFORMATION ABOUT OUR RESCUE  WE APPRECIATE YOUR TAX DEDUCTIBLE DONATION TO ASSIST IN OUR RESCUE MISSION.

Our all inclusive adoption fee is $395.  Our dogs are fully vetted, including age appropriate vaccines and spay/neutering. The dogs are transported via a licensed carrier from Louisiana to Maine monthly.  Sorry, we do not adopt to families with children under the age of 6, or, in some instances, older depending on the breed, characteristics and/or behavior of the dog.



COURTESY POSTING/REHOMING NEEDED

Seeking a loving, active person/family to adopt a sweet border collie/Australian Shepherd mix. Bandit is 7 years old. He has been with the same family his whole life. As our family grew, with a toddler and another baby on the way, Bandit is starting to need a different family life. He truly is a sweet, loving and smart dog. He needs lots of exercise. He loves to cuddle, and is good with children over the age of 10. He does have anxiety, for example he is very sensitive to clicking noises, fans, blowing noises (such as blowing out a candle). Before we had children, my now husband and I were able to train Bandit quite easily to be more tolerant of these things, but as our attention gets drawn away from his behavioral training, he does still struggle with these, and some other, daily household routine noises. He is housebroken, and gets along with other dogs (has lived with a Sheltie for most of his life without issues). He is up to date on all shots, is fixed, and has had consistent veterinary appointments. Serious inquiries only. This is a very difficult decision for us, and would love to have an âopenâ adoption, where we could still see Bandit on occasion, at your convenience of course.

name: Brew
description: Brew is in need of a medical foster, she is currently located in Bradenton, FL (Manatee County). Brew is an English Bulldog we saved from a high kill shelter in Tampa. She is 8 years old and in a neglected state. She has a medical history of arthritis spondylosis, she is heartworm positive and required a removal of a blueberry sized mammary node during spay. She is underweight at 35 pounds and will require 3 meals a day. She is quiet,sleeps a lot and the only issue we have seen is some guarding of her xpen area when other dogs nose around. She's fine with other dogs but offers no interactions and turns her head away. Once we have her tuned up she will be available for adoption or long term fostering through heartworm treatment. If you are interested in Brew and have experience with English Bulldogs please contact us. PUPDATE. Brew has been with us for almost a week. She has seen our vet. Her liver values were abnormal and we have had her on supplements and will retest the 2nd week of Sept. She has gotten more energetic,is eating well, and actually is playing with some of the other dogs. She loves people and absolutely loves being pet. She is actually chasing flies! She is becoming a dog again!! Once we do our vet re-check, she will be available for foster to adopt or medical foster. We are a foster-based rescue organization with foster homes throughout the state of Florida. We predominantly save dogs from municipal shelters throughout the Southeastern U.S. Our rescue dogs live in foster homes - there is no central facility. If interested in meeting one of our wonderful adoptable dogs, please fill out an application at ewenityfarmsbch.com. Information on adoption donation amounts and our process can also be found at this site.

name: Sheba
description:
***COURTESY LISTING*** Not a Ewenity Farm dog, but shared with love! Sheba is located in Myakka City, FL (Manatee County).

Sheba is about 60 lbs and 5-6 years. She was found dumped on a farm and taken in by a loving family, but due to her incompatibility with farm animals needs to find a suitable forever home. She loves humans of all ages including children, and is very friendly and loving right off the bat. She would do well in a home with a companion dog, but it is not a requirement. She loves to play outside but not as much as napping at your feet and getting attention. She knows basic commands and is fine on leash but could use a refresher.

Sheba is housebroken, spayed and up-to-date on vaccines and preventives. If interested, please submit an inquiry and we will forward it to Sheba's current foster.

name: Sadie & Jada
description:
A SPECIAL NEEDS BONDED PAIR NEEDS OUR HELP!

Update: Sadie and Jada will soon be seeing a veterinary ophthalmologist for a complete exam.

Five year old Jada and her best buddy, six year old Sadie, are a truly bonded pair - and they're both blind.

Although Sadie, a neutered male, is blind he always knows where Jada is - and she relies on him. When they go for leash walks with their mom, Sadie is the leader and he walks ahead of his mom and Jada follows behind her - it's quite the parade.

Sadie was especially attached to his dad who died a few months ago. He was his loyal companion and stayed right with him throughout his illness. He was also with him when he died.

Jada and Sadie's owner now can't afford to care for them and she's anxious to get them both to a veterinary ophthalmologist for a thorough eye exam and treatment.

Our wonderful volunteer took them both to be groomed and vetted the week of August 7th.

The groomers adored both dogs. \"Jada is a real sweetheart\" and Sadie was fine once he was lifted onto the grooming table (because he is blind he was a bit panicked by being lifted by strangers but he settled down quickly.) Now both dogs are clean and beautiful!

Our vet diagnosed Jada with juvenile cataracts and we hope they're operable and she can regain some sight. Sadie has cataracts and glaucoma, he's now on two eye medications to help reduce the pressure in his eyes.

The immediate need is to find a loving, caring adult only home for these two special cockers. CSRNE will pay for all ophthalmological care and medications. Our vet said both dogs are otherwise in good health.

Both Jada And Sadie were purchased from a Manchester, NH pet store at 12 weeks of age. They started going blind when they were about 4 years old. Their condition, juvenile cataracts, is genetic so the purchased them from an irresponsible puppy  mill that is breeding cocker puppies with the gene  for juvenile cataracts. But quite frankly the puppy mill doesn't care - they've already gotten their money and now it's Jada and Sadie who will pay the real price for the irresponsible breeding practices of mercenary puppy mills and the pet stores who so carelessly purchase their puppies.

We can only help dogs like Jada and Sadie if you, our friends, become their advocates. Do you know a special person who might be willing to give these two dogs the care and attention they so deserve?

We know we're looking for a rare individual who has the time to care for Jada and Sadie but we're hoping their cocker angel is out there somewhere willing and able to help these two devoted cockers.

We ask everyone interested in adopting to please fill out and send in our adoption application and restraint agreement before we invite you to meet any dogs.   Once your application is approved, we can proceed!

Here is a link to our application and more information: http://csrne.org/adoption/apply-to-adopt/

name: Nate Archibald
description: Hello handsome! Meet adoptable Nate Archibald, a 2 year old brindle boy and native New Yorker from the Manhattan ACC! Nate immediately won us over when we met him in the shelter and has been a total delight for his foster mom. She tells us he's the \"biggest sweetheart, \"radiates positivity and is a \"12/10 park baby and nap buddy\". Nate is also a complete gentleman and is super well-behaved - he's wonderful on the leash, is housebroken and knows sit and paw! He also literally gets in the tub on his own for bath time - so essentially he is a next level goodboy. Nate is about 2 years old, weighs 60 lbs and loves making new friends, human and dog alike. Apply to make this cuddly mush mush yours today at heartsandbonesrescue.com.

name: Ora
description: Lovely Senior girl Ora is so sweet and can really use a nice calm environment to relax and enjoy for the rest of her years. She is stable since her mass removal surgery after being saved from Manhattan ACC, but she really needs and deserves an attentive companion to spend her days with. If you think you are the one for Ora, please apply today at www.nybullycrew.org

name: Shelly
description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Shelly, a beautiful pittie, was rescued from Manhattan ACC where she had been brought in as a stray. She had broken teeth and was emaciated at only 24 pounds!! Shelly is good with people of all ages and with other dogs. She was born in early 2015, is spayed and up to date on vaccines. Her foster mom has been taking such good care of her and she has put on some much needed weight and is back to healthy and happy! Despite her obvious neglect, Shelly remains a very sweet and loving girl, and we can't wait until she has a home to call her very own. Please put your application in here if you are interested in adopting Shelly: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

name: Clipper
description: Our newest Mighty Mutt, Clipper, is around a year and a half old and looking for her forever home! Recently rescued from the south, Clipper has been enjoying life in Manhattan--all she needs to make her life perfect is YOU!

name: Chance
description:
**COURTESY POST**

Chance is a 2 year old American pit bull mix (looks like some bulldog might be in that mix!) 

He was originally adopted from the Maricopa County shelter, but family feels he would be better suited to a home where the family has more time for him - they just don't. He is neutered, microchipped and vaccinated until August. Heâs a super sweet boy, and is very active. He loves sleeping in bed like a human. Good with small dogs and children. He has never been around big dogs but family feels sure that with slow introduction and comfort he will adjust perfectly. 

Please fill out an adoption form and we will forward it on to Chance's current family for review. 

https://2ndchance.rescuegroups.org/animals/detail?AnimalID=14333885

name: Red
description:
He is in need of rescue or adoption from the Pocahontas County Animal Shelter in Marlinton, WV. 

For adoption or rescue info email Advocates for Shelter Animals of Pocahontas Co. at asapwva@gmail.com.

name: Woodrow
description: Meet Woodrow! Woodrow is a sweet mostly chocolate Lab boy, 65-75 pounds, approx 5-6 years old. Woodrow has come to us from our local animal control in Marshall County and with us 2 weeks so far. He is going to make someone a great companion dog! Woodrow gets along great with all dogs. He is doesnât pay attention to horses, chickens and tested fine around a cat. In fact, the cat swatted him and he walked away. He loves to be around his person and loves to just follow you around. A stay-at-home or work-from-home individual would be ideal that can shower him with love. Woodrow even when dogs are playing around him, he prefers to be right by your side. He sits on cue and he is house trained. He would be a fantastic companion dog for a single lady since he does show a little bit of fear towards men, but nothing he cannot overcome with patience. He will be apprehensive at first and may growl at a man but its harmless. Thereâs absolutely no aggression in Woodrow at all he is definitely a lover. He would do best around older kids or teens versus young babies since he is a bigger dog and doesnât give you much personal space, but itâs only because he craves to be acknowledged. Poor fellow must have not gotten very much attention in the past and his medical vetting speaks volumes, so he longs for someone to just love him and in return, you will wonder âwho rescued whoâ. Woodrow unfortunately did test positive for heart worms, but we are treating him at no cost to an adoptive family. Woodrow has been recently medically vetted; neutered, up-to-date on all vaccines plus microchipped. If you are interested in this handsome boy please go to our website to complete the online pre-adoption application http://www.southernskiesrescue.org

name: Buddy
description:
Buddy is available for foster or adoption. We are a foster-based rescue and always looking for foster families. Buddy is currently located in Palm City, FL (Martin County). Buddy is a laid-back boy of 3 years and 45 lbs looking for a forever home.
Buddy - a low-rider hunk boy is the best way to describe him. Buddy could also stand to lose a few lbs. He's pretty chill and loves to carry around his toys in his mouth. His favorite things are humans and toys (in no particular order). He is fine with other dogs too but humans and toys are TOP OF HIS LIST. He walks well on leash and rides well in the car.
Buddy is housebroken, crate trained, neutered, up-to-date on vaccines and preventives, and microchipped. He was recently cleared by the vet after heartworm treatment.
We are a foster-based rescue organization with foster homes throughout the state of Florida. We predominantly save dogs from municipal shelters throughout the Southeastern U.S. Our rescue dogs live in foster homes - there is no central facility. If interested in meeting one of our wonderful adoptable dogs, please fill out an application at
ewenityfarmsbch.com
. Information on adoption donation amounts and our process can also be found at this site.

name: Twix #2
description:
Twix #2 is a 1-year-old neutered male fox red lab. Twix weighs 49 pounds and is up to date on shots. He is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Twix #2 is a knock-your-socks-off super cute, snuggly puppy with a gorgeous blondy-brown coat, beautiful brown eyes and a belly thatâs always begging to be rubbed! This high energy heartthrob loves to run and play with toys and other dogs. Like most puppies, he is busy and curious about everything, but always content to cuddle with his humans especially if belly rubs are included! Twix is looking for a family who will continue to train him as he learns his manners and give him plenty of playtime and walks. 

Twix #2 is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. To avoid this, for now we are limiting placement to stand alone single-family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. As we learn more from the dog's time spent in foster, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment and send out an update. 

This dog is available for adoption from Lab Rescue LRCP.   Lab Rescue LRCP rescues and places dogs in Maryland,  Virginia, Washington DC, West Virginia, Pennsylvania, Delaware and North Carolina.  Adopters must travel to Maryland, or Virginia with their family - human and canine - to meet the dog they want to adopt.

Lab Rescue LRCP has between 40 - 80 dogs available for adoption from foster homes across Maryland and Virginia, and at monthly adoption events.  The adoption event dates and locations are listed at www.lab-rescue.org. 

If you are interested in adopting, please visit www.lab-rescue.org and complete an adoption application. After you submit an application, you will hear from an Adoption Coordinator who will guide you through the adoption process. 

An adoption fee is charged to cover the cost of veterinary care and a home visit is required.

Princess is a sweet, sweet dog with gentle eyes. She pulls on the leash but only weighs 32 pounds so she is completely manageable.  She was great in the car.  More to follow on this sweet girl.

description:

She is crate trained, housetrained and knows some basic commands. Willow will find ways to amuse herself if left unattended like trash diving and counter surfing â nothing some training wonât fix. This girl is full of energy. Teddy has never had any formal training. He would love an active family who will invest some time in him and give him some much deserved love. Barked at the cats that lived in the farm. He is approved for kids 10 and up.

description:

Jamie & Fergus are a bonded pair and must be adopted together. Both are up to date on shots. These dogs are approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Jamie & Fergus are in pretty rough shape but we can fix that. What we don't need to fix is their wonderful spirit and love they have to give. They like to be with you and get like attention.  Jamie will put his head in your lap while Fergus prefers to put a paw in your lap. They are happy to meet everyone with their tails wagging and like getting their bellies and head rubbed. They are inside dogs that like to go outside. They are bonded and will be adopted together. Jamie & Fergus would like a home with a family that will give them lots of love and has a yard where they can play. Kids 10 and up as we have no history Good with other dogs, have been out with other dogs. No cats history. Knows sit, down come. Pulls some on lead settled down after a couple of minutes. Good with an Easy Walk Harness. Crate trained probably house trained, they are keeping their room clean at the kennel. Jamie & Fergus are from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. description:
Honey #3 is a 18-month-old spayed yellow female lab. She weighs 44 pounds 
and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Honey is a real sweetheart and a happy dog although a little confused right now. Honey has had a rough start in life and has bounced from place to place. Honey is looking for a family that can work with her to teach her the greatest way to be a dog and be loved. She does not have a mean bone in her body and loves everyone, except cats. Honey lived in a home with kids 4 and 6 and therefore, approved for kids 4 and up. The owner reports that Honey is very gentle with children. She is good with other dogs, but not cats. She has not had any training and will come with a training addendum. Honey is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. description:
Denim is a 9-month-old intact yellow female lab. He weighs 34 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Denim is a very sweet and friendly pup, she likes everyone she meets. She is a young active dog that is looking for a family that will provide training and exercise. Note: Denim is a petite pup who is in heat. Therefore, she will not be spayed until her heat cycle is over. Kids 10 years and up as we have no history. Good with other dogs, but no cat history. More on Denim soon!

description:

Mason is a sweet dog who ended up at the local shelter when his owner died and there was no other family to take him. Mason is very afraid. He must be walked with a harness and double leash to make sure he doesn't bolt if he gets startled while outside. We have no history of Mason having lived with kids, so he is approved for kids 10 and up. He is good with other dogs. Unknown with cats. Mason is from a rural area and have not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. To avoid this, for now we are limiting placement to stand alone single-family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. description:
Lachlan is a 2-year-old neutered male black lab. He weighs 58 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children 10 and up.

Lachlan is very friendly and likes to be with you getting petted and attention. He hasn't retrieved yet but goes over and examines toys that you toss then looks at you as if to say what am I supposed to do with this. Not sure he has had any before but we can teach him what they are for. He is a very easy dog and wants to please you. He takes treats very gently. He will be a wonderful addition to a home that has a yard and will give him the attention and exercise he needs. Kids 10 and up as we don't have any history. Good with other dogs, likes playing with the other LR pups at the kennel. No cat history. Knows sit and come, working on down. Lachlan will have a training addendum as he can use some additional training. Pulls on lead as he hasn't been on one much, good with an Easy Walk Harness. Seems to be house and crate trained, keeping his room clean at the kennel. This dog is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. To avoid this, for now we are limiting placement to stand alone single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. name: Dodge
description:
Dodge is a 10-month-old neutered male chocolate lab. Dodge weighs 70 pounds (still growing!) and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 8 and up.

Dodge's Doggerings:
Hi everyone, my name is Dodge. I made it into my foster home after a 2-hour ride. I traveled well even with all my pent-up energy from being at the vet! I'm good with dogs and have met the gang here. I can be a little exuberant in my greeting but I am being given correction; especially by Belle (the lemon beagle). It seems I hadn't had a lot of exposure to other animals so I'm unknown with cats. I'm healthy and up-to-date on everything. I love playing with toys and FM played toss with me today. I would bring it back to her, but I preferred to keep the toy. I know how to \"sit\" when asked, but my butt doesn't always stay there. FM says that I still need to adjust to being here and she knows I will shine!
Love,
Dodge

description:
Frazier is a 9-month-old neutered black male lab. He weighs 50 pounds 
and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children 10 and up.

Frazier came to us from a rural shelter as a very scared. almost feral pup. He is still leery of new people and situations but is doing much better with his foster/trainer. He is still not ready for full on cuddle fests but he is able to be pet, will even do \"drive by\" lovings and has started to play, giving cute little play bows. His favorite thing of all is playing with all his doggie friends! He will require an adopter who understands his fears and can continue to help him be brave and blossom. He is house and crate trained. He must go with another dog, is unknown but probably OK with cats and approved for kids 10 and up.

name: Dagwood
description:
Dagwood is a 1-year-old neutered yellow male lab. He weighs 70 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Dagwood is a super sweet boy! When he first came to us he was very scared and timid. He has really come out of his shell and he loves people! He is still leery of other dogs, mostly those that are \"in your face\" type dogs. He does well with dogs that just coexist with him and do not try to initiate too much. He gets a little intimated if shown too much attention by another dog. Dagwood has lots of good points. He is good on leash and loves to go on group walks. He is affectionate and well behaved. He is housebroken. He also presents his challenges. He is terrified of a crate and will try to break out. He is an escape artist with containment, possibly from his formative years of having to live in a pen with MANY other dogs. He would be best placed with someone who is home most of the time or where he could go with them a lot. We do not have any cat history on him and he is approved for kids 10 and up.

Murphy is a gorgeous, very sweet boy with an alert gaze. His foster has been working on hand feeding to gain trust. He is a good boy who will sit and let you handle him all over. He is great in his crate and is house trained. He is good with dogs. Murphy would do best in an adult only, quieter household. He is good with dogs, unknown how he feels about cats. Murphy is looking for a family that is able to provide some training, regular exercise, and lots of love.  Murphy is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. name: Honey #2
description:
Honey #2 is a 4-year-old spayed yellow female lab. She weighs 59 pounds 
and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Honey is a smart dog who likes to be with you to keep you company. She likes to be petted and thinks getting her coat brushed is great. She explores everything around and likes to retrieve her Nylabone. She takes treats gently and gives kisses as a reward. She likes to go out and play but thinks she should be an inside dog. Honey would love family that will give her attention and has a yard for her to play in. They will be getting a super dog. Kids 10 and up as we have no history. Good with other dogs, has been out with other Lab Rescue dogs. No cat history Knows sit, down and come. Pulls some on lead, better with an Easy Walk Harness. Reported as Crate & house trained by the shelter and the vet. Honey came into the shelter as a stray, she looks like she has had a couple of litters in the past. Honey is a friendly and active dog, she has manners and likes to play. He will make some family a great addition to their family.

Milton is an adorable and mellow boy who was found as a stray walking around a neighborhood. He has big brown eyes, and we can't wait to see him smile. Milton is looking for a family to make him feel special and loved. He rode quietly in the car and waited to go outside to do his business. He is good with dogs, unknown with cats, and approved for kids 10 and up. Milton is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. To avoid this, for now we are limiting placement to stand alone single-family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. name: Gracie #3
description:
Gracie #3 is an almost 2-year-old spayed black female lab. She weighs 44 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Gracie is a happy but shy girl, who loves adorably once she trusts you, but will take a bit of time and some caution to earn that trust. She absolutely loves other dogs, and has never met one she doesn't like. For this girl, the more dogs in her world, the better. If you are giving affection to another dog, her curiosity will get the better of her and she'll almost immediately come up to investigate. She can be a bit hand shy, even once she trusts you, so just needs humans that will go slow and understand to give her time. When she's in her element, she is silly, rolling on the grass, spinning around and zooming as fast as she can to play \"tag\" with the other dogs. And she's REALLY fast. She enjoys napping on the couch, and will allow herself to be a pillow for the other dogs. She also likes to sleep in bed with her humans and is incredibly silly in the mornings as she considers the bed a safe zone - she'll roll on her back and beg for belly rubs and play bitey-face. She especially loves when the other dogs join in the fun. She's excellent in the crate, and foster mom has spied her sleeping in the crate belly up while she's at work. Gracie prefers to eat alone, and will quickly eat her meals in her crate, or in a separate room, but is nervous eating in front of humans, unless it's people food that you are sharing with her (which she loves!). Her leash skills are pretty good, but she would prefer walking on quiet streets and not on a busy road. Gracie is a shy dog, and is always going to be a bit shy. She warms up to new people, but prefers them in small groups and not making a lot of noise, please. She's not the dog for you if you have rambunctious teenagers (or adults), throw parties often, or if you're looking for a dog to take everywhere with you. She started her life sheltered in a pen, and didn't get the socialization with humans she should have at an early age, so they make her a bit nervous. She's incredibly sweet and loving, and will reward you with her sweet, happy, silly self if you give her love, patience and understanding.

name: Steel
description:
Steel is a 1.5-year-old neutered male black lab. Steel weighs 40 pounds and is up to date on shots. He is approved for homes and townhomes with children 10 and up.

Hi! Iâm Steel. I am a sweet âpocket-size labby boyâ at 40lbs. I can be a bit shy initially but once I get comfortable, I will shower you with kisses and follow you everywhere. I am having fun playing with my foster sister and brother in the yard and going for walks by the river. I also enjoy playing fetch with foster Mom and she tells me what a good boy I am for bringing the ball back to her and dropping it at her feet. I am house and crate trained and learning the art of walking on leash. Give me a chance and I will be your best friend!

name: Shadow #2
description:
Shadow #2 is a 5-year-old neutered male black lab. Shadow weighs 50 pounds and is up to date on shots. He is approved for homes with children ages 8 and up.

My name is Shadow. I am 5 years old. I am the best boy according to my foster mom. I love to walk on the leash and I am very receptive to your pace (I slow down when you slow down and speed up if you do!) I am great in the backyard and love to run and play. Toys are my favorite. FM calls me silly boy because I like to get the zoomies when I stumble upon a toy I wasn't expecting. I am not a big fan of getting on the furniture. I love treats and snuggles. I do amazing in my crate. I don't make a sound in my crate and kennel up when told to! I am only a jumper when I get excited but not on people, just jump like a kangroao. I am townhouse approved and approved for children ages 8 and up.

name: Kayla
description:
Kayla is an 8-year-old spayed chocolate female lab. She weighs 81 pounds but needs to lose about 5 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Kayla is a happy chocolate girl who likes belly rubs and running in the yard. She has been a loving and attentive mommy to multiple litters of puppies and now she is ready to take her turn in the spotlight. Sheâs a friendly girl with lots of energy who would do best with a family that will give her plenty of playtime outside, long walks, and lots of love. Kayla is good with dogs, but not cats and approved for kids 10 and up. Kayla is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. To avoid this, for now we are limiting placement to stand alone single-family homes or townhomes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. As we learn more from the dog's time spent in foster, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment and send out an update. 

Foster family reports: Kayla has a vivacious, energetic personality. After spending much of her life outdoors, she is excited to be in her foster home. Her tail has not stopped wagging! She thinks she's a lap dog and would crawl in your lap with the slightest encouragement. She introduced herself to the resident lab with play bows and ran zoomies with him. She is friendly without being either dominant or submissive. Kayla had no problem navigating the hardwood floors. She can zoom up and down stairs. She likes watching TV, especially animal shows and Litter Robot advertisements, which bring her to her feet everytime. (Must be the cat!) She also enjoys watching squirrels outside. This former breeder girl had a litter quite recently and still has enlarged mammaries. She weighs 80 lbs but should weigh ~75. She shows interest in meeting children (approved age 10+). Kayla rode well in the car and walks nicely in an Easy Walk harness. She loved her first walk in the park. Although she came from a rural area, she does not seem bothered by traffic or loud noises. Kayla is food motivated, which should help with refreshing commands. Kayla is settling nicely into her foster home. She was a little over-amped when she first arrived but now she is able to settle in the house. She enjoys playing with the resident lab, and in fact, she is usually the initiator of play! She likes taking walks around the neighborhood, and we discovered that she is a retriever. Kayla did not appear to know her name or any commands, so we are working to teach her basic commands and leash skills. She walks pretty well with an EZ-Walk harness, doesn't pull, but will sniff a lot if you let her. She needs to be tethered in the car until she knows her commands or she will be in the driver's lap. She is not crated when we leave the house and she does not disturb anything. Kayla is super loving and affectionate. She has all the most desirable lab traits! She is a velcro dog to foster mom, but seems to do most of her lab leans on the men she meets. She has met the neighbors and their dogs and impressed them with her friendliness and beauty. Other dogs really like her, so she appears to share good vibes! We don't know yet whether she likes water. Her background continues to mystify us. She was photographed at intake living on a chain, but she also knows her way around a house, is interested in human food and would like to get up on the furniture (although not allowed by her current foster). Kayla is quite energetic for her age and will need regular walks and/or active time in the yard. Since she doesn't bark, navigates stairs easily and can be exercised on leash, Kayla is now approved for townhouses on a case-by-case basis.

description:

Durkes is a very handsome chocolate lab whose family is moving and cannot take him. He was a family dog but has been spending most of his day in his crate and would love a family who will give him regular exercise to burn his typical young lab energy. He has not had any training so he will have a training addendum. He is very affectionate and loves to play. Durkes is good with kids but has not lived with any, so he is approved for kids 10 and up. Heâs good with other dogs. Durkes is unknown with cats. Durkes is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. name: Bella #12
description:
Bella #12 is a 7-year-old spayed female chocolate lab. Bella #12 weighs 103 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Bella #12 is a chunky, curly coated chocolate girl who used to live on a farm with 2 other labs and an indoor cat. Even though leash walking is new, she is starting to grasp the idea. She is a pretty strong gal, so an EasyWalk harness makes all the difference in the world. Bella isnât all that much into toys, but she does love to play and swim in the water. She isnât used to spending long hours alone, but hasnât shown any anxiety when left alone at her foster home. She is quiet and submissive but will bark once or twice at new people or dogs. Bella is not destructive at all and is housebroken. She has not been crated for the last 6 years or so. She does enjoy sleeping on the couch during the day and in the bedroom at night. Bella enjoys her car rides and never has to be asked twice to get in the car. 

UPDATE from Bellaâs foster family:  Bella is adorable. So sweet, completely housebroken, sleeps all night. She LOVES to go on walks. She gets so excited jumping up & down on her front feet! She's very smart & knows commands.. sit, shake, down, stay & wait. She's very good at stay! She will play with a toy for a while and she always meet me at the door with a toy in her mouth when I come home. I do not crate her and she's fine. She has not gotten into anything or torn anything up. She's pretty good on a leash but could use some more leash training because she is strong and used to being off leash on the farm. We are working on her diet and exercise regime! 

This dog is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people.  For now we are limiting placement to standalone, single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area.  As we learn more about the dogâs time spent in foster care, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment.

Nina is a sweet girl. Nina has limited vision due to one of her eyes being sunken in. The shelter's vet thought it was either an old injury or a birth defect. Nina is good with dogs smaller than her but isn't quite sure about larger dogs due to her limited vision. So the shelter thinks Nina may be better with larger dogs with slow introductions. Nina is not a good fit for cats.

Nina is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. name: Tanner
description:
Tanner is an 8.5-year-old neutered male yellow lab. Tanner weighs 81 pounds and is up to date on shots. He is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Tanner is a super sweet, charming guy who likes to chase tennis balls and hang out in the yard. He has a friendly smile, big brown eyes, and ears that are longer than your list of things to do! This boy is ready to find a family that will shower him with affection, take him for walks, and toss him tennis balls until their arms are tired. 

Tanner met the resident cats, got over being excited about them and moved on to being curious and a bit mesmerized by them. He does not chase them, or pounce on them to get them to run. He just likes to stand there and sniff them. Tanner knows \"sit\" and loves to give you his paw.  He also loves to sleep on the bed - making it obvious that he's been an inside dog at some point. Tanner listens well, and does as he's asked. He is house-trained and is a terrific boy! 

Tanner is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. To avoid this, for now we are limiting placement to stand alone single-family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. description:

Loki is a very friendly boy but is very scared and can be a flight risk. He needs to he walked with a harness and double leashed, so he cannot back out of his collar if he gets scared. Loki was tested on lead with other dogs at the shelter and did great. We don't know how Loki is with cats. There's no kid history for Loki, so he's approved for kids ages 10 and up. Loki is beautiful and a sweet boy. He rides well and takes treats gently. Loki is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. name: Louise
description:
Louise is a 5-year-old spayed black female. She weighs 34 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Louise is an adorable, petite, and quiet girl who came from a hoarding situation. She is looking for a family to make her feel special and loved. She rode quietly in a crate in the car. She spent many months in a temporary foster home in WV and she is used to living with other dogs, so she will need to go to a home with another dog. She is good with dogs, unknown with cats, and approved for kids 10 and up. Louise is sweet, docile, and affectionate. She barks very little and she hasnât had any accidents inside the house. She always goes outside to do her business and is very good on a leash. Louise is still a little shy around new people; just a few pets from the right person will capture her heart and she will capture theirs.

 Louise (âLuluâ) is slowing coming out of her shell. Watching and helping her learn about the sweetness of life has been amazing. Lulu has been pretty clear about her likes and dislikes. She dislikes noise and unpredictability. She loves food (especially chicken!), chilling in a quiet space, walks on quiet paths, dog toys, and calm human and canine company. She plays with her foster brother and approaches dogs on walks with confidence. Sweet Lulu is house- and crate-trained, very quiet, and as gentle as they come. She asks for nothing but a patient family with a dog that will continue to pamper her and appreciate the joy of seeing this girl blossom.

description:

Millie is good with other dogs. She was dog tested at the shelter and was fine. No cats for Millie because she will chase cats if they run. There's no kid history for Millie, so she's approved for kids ages 10 and up. Millie is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. For now, to avoid this, we are limiting placement to standalone, single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. After Millie has been in a foster home for at least a week or two, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment and will send out an update. More on Millie soon! 

Foster family reports: Millie was feeling a bit under the weather but is doing much better and is ready to look for her new home! Millie is a wonderful pup. She is very loving and sweet and paid no attention to the caged bunnies in her previous foster. She did well in the crate, and seems to be house trained! She enjoyed playing with other pups but can be a bit bossy. She will likely do well with dogs who don't mind a more assertive lady.

name: Candi
description:
Candi is a 7-month-old spayed female black lab. Candi weighs 31 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Candi is a very sweet and friendly pup. She got pregnant when she was about 7 months old, probably just after her first heat, and was an excellent mother to her puppies Claire & Brianna. Now that the pups have been adopted it is time for Candi to find her forever home. She has nice house manners and has free run of the house. At night she sleeps on a dog bed in the bedroom. Like all young, active dogs, she will need some additional training. Candi gets along fine with the resident dog and visiting dogs too. She enjoys plundering the toy chest. If you are sitting on the couch, she will join you to be close. She likes everyone she meets. 

This dog is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people.  For now we are limiting placement to standalone, single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. name: Rose
description:
Rose is a 10-year-old spayed female yellow lab. Rose weighs 60 pounds and is up to date on shots. She is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Rose is a very sweet and loving girl. She had a rough life and is very happy that lab rescue brought her in and especially to her fosters. She plays very well with the resident lab, sleeps on the couch with foster dad and cuddles on the couch with resident lab when play time is over. She has the best soulful eyes that are just screaming. THANK YOU! 

Rose is great with dogs and people but cats and kids are unknown. Therefore, approved for kids 10 and older. During Rose's exam, the vet noticed a lump in her throat. They asperated the lump and sadly she was diagnosed with thyroid cancer. She is not in any pain and unfortunately it is inoperable. She is not showing symptoms of being sick and continues to go about her day, playing with the other dogs, following foster mom around, snuggling on the couch, and constantly being spoiled. Sadly, Rose is considered to be in hospice right now. 

Rose is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. To avoid this, for now we are limiting placement to stand alone single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. As we learn more from the dog's time spent in foster, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment and send out an update.

name: Scrappy
description:
Scrappy is a 4-year-old neutered male black lab. Scrappy weighs 70 pounds and is up to date on shots. He is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Come Meet Scrappy! This young guy is a sweet, playful, young guy who would fit into almost any home. He loves his toys, his 9 year old human foster brother and playing with the other resident furry friends. Scrappy is house broken, crate trained, walks good on a leash and knows several commands. If you are looking for a younger fella to be your best friend who has average energy and loves to eat, Scrappy is your guy! Scrappy is a good rider. He is good with other dogs but can be a little too rambunctious for very small dogs. Unknown with cats but we don't think cats would be a good idea. Approved for kids 10 and up.

name: Baby
description:
Baby is a 6 month-old spayed female black lab. Baby weighs 30 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Baby is the most charming, sweetest little pup. She is fearless and loves everyone and everything. She especially adores water! When foster mom was cleaning and refilling the pup pools in the yard, Baby had so much fun chasing the water and carrying the hose. She loves to cuddle and will fall asleep on the couch snuggled up with the other dogs, or next to foster mom. She loves playing with the big dogs and does her very best to keep up with them. She's curious about everything and loves to explore. Baby was born with a neurological condition that affects her movement. She sometimes weaves or stumbles when walking, and needs to be watched near stairs. She is on a low dose of Prednisone and 5mg of Omeprazole once/day to prevent an upset stomach. But this delightful girl still approaches everything full of excitement and joy. She is looking for someone who has a huge heart and maybe a friendly resident dog that will be her buddy. If you have a place in your heart for this sweet, sweet girl, her love will reward you ten-fold.

UPDATE from Babyâs foster family:  Baby's favorite thing to do is play with other dogs and snuggle with them or her humans. She often is found sleeping belly up, as close as she can get to the other dogs or foster mom, and snoring... She loves the new dog bed that she can nuzzle up in as well. Baby is learning to use the ramp to go down the short grouping of stairs outside to the yard, and is getting better at it! She is also learning to go up the big staircase in the house and doing great! She has found her voice and foster mom affectionately refers to her as \"bossy\" when she barks because she wants to do something and hasn't quite figured out how yet. She also likes to bark at the big dogs to get them to play bitey-face with her on the couch. She's a sweet, silly, special girl, who is looking for forever humans that understand her limitations and help her break down the walls when she can. 

This dog is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people.  For now we are limiting placement to standalone, single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area.  As we learn more about the dogâs time spent in foster care, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment.

name: Marley #2
description:
Marley #2 is an 8-year-old spayed yellow female lab. She weighs 95 pounds but needs to lose about 20 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Marley is a very sweet girl. She would love to meet you so she can give you love and attention. She loves to be with you to play and get petted which I don't think she had a lot of until she came to us. She enjoys being outside playing with other dogs but thinks being inside with people is better. She is not interested in running around outside retrieving but will go get treats which she takes very nicely. She likes to go on walks which is good as she has to lose some extra weight. We see a vegetable and fruit diet in her future! Marley would like to meet a family that will give her love and attention. Kids 10 and up as we don't have history. Good with other dogs has been out with other LR pups at the kennel with no problems. No cat history. Knows sit, come and sometimes down. Not bad on lead, better when walking with an Easy Walk Harness. Crate trained, probably house trained as she is keeping her room clean at the kennel. If you are looking for a laid back, gentle soul, consider Marley. This dog is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. To avoid this, for now we are limiting placement to stand alone single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. As we learn more from the dog's time spent in foster, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded. 

Foster family reports: Update We know that Marley is not her real name so we're trying different names. Right now we're calling her Penny, so we'll see. A couple more facts about Marley/Penny. We're not sure how she got to be so large but she's the most food-unmotivated lab! She may or may not eat her breakfast and she's really not into fruits or veggies. Her thyroid has been tested and is fine. We've never had a pup take treats so gently. We're used to the \"you may lose your fingers\" type of lab. Marley/Penny will go to the door if she needs to do her business. She would like a family who's willing to take the time with her to help her feel comfortable and loved. She'd also like a couple walks a day to help her build up her stamina and lose some of those pesky pounds. She recently visited with a friend for a weekend sleepover and met two very dog-savvy cats. She initially appeared to want to play with them but that was more effort than she wanted to expend and she laid back down. Marley/Penny found the toy basket, and although she is not a huge player or retriever, she periodically picks up a tennis ball and brings it to you or gnaws on one of the many bones all over the house. She LOVES her walks she doesn't go far and not too fast but she loves all the smells and all the people and dogs met so far. Marley/Penny is a very easy dog that requires little more than a place to sleep, a few pats on her head, some belly scratches and some food. Do you have room in your heart and home for Penny?

name: Rudy #2
description:
RUDY is a 9-year-old neutered male yellow lab. Rudy weighs 57 pounds and is up to date on shots. He is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

This sweet boy loves everyone. He thinks humans are great despite the fact that his past human did not take great care of him. He was allowed to wander around and when he wanrered into the wrong yard he was attacked by the dog that lived there. Once at the shelter his owner was called who never showed up to take him home.  Rudy would love a home that will allow him to give his love and have a soft bed and some ear scratches in return. Maybe a few treats as well. 

Foster update: Rudy is doing great in his foster home! He really warmed up to his fosters and is a sweet, affectionate boy. He has done well in his crate when alone during the day and sleeps in bed with the teenage daughter at night without problem. He gets along well with other dogs he encounters on walks. He does pull a little at squirrels, but he is not bad at all. He is learning to know the difference between his toys and general household items:) He is trying to work on sit, and heâs starting to learn no. Rudy loves to chase and fetch a ball, and his face shows the pure joy he has at sharing the fun!

Rudy is from a rural area and have not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. To avoid this, for now we are limiting placement to stand alone single-family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. name: Sammy #3
description:
Sammy #3 is an 8-year-old neutered male yellow lab. Sammy weighs 100 pounds and is up to date on shots. He is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Sammy is having a blast at doggie day care. He is described as a huge party animal. He is great with people and good with dogs. He would make a great running/hiking partner. He is huge dog so, he is doing to need someone who can handle his 100lbs. He does have some fence fighting tendency's so a sold fence and/or one where no other dog is on the other side would be more ideal. He is a leash puller so his new home will need to work with him on that. Sammy is a 100lb lap dog with no personal space. He likes to be in the room with you but he is not the type to get up on the couch for a snuggle. He enjoys his humans company but on the floor is his own space.

name: Sully
description:
Sully is a 2-year-old neutered male black lab. Sully weighs 46 pounds and is up to date on shots. He is approved for homes with children 10 and up.

Sully is a sweet shy little guy who takes a bit to warm up. He is doing well in doggie day care and learning the ropes with his k-9 friends. He is looking for a family that will help him work on his training and show him the fun side of life. Sully loves to run so if you are an avid runner and or enjoy long hikes, Sully is your man! Also, Sully can be nervous and shy when he is exposed to new situations. His new family needs to go slow with anything that is new for him (situations, environments, people and dog intros) and help him to understand that the world is an okay place. Sully has excellent house manners and enjoys affection from his people. 

Sully is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. For now, to avoid this, we are limiting placement to standalone, single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. After he has been in a foster home for at least a week or two, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment and will send out an update.

name: Regina
description:
Regina s a 1-year-old spayed female fox red lab. Regina weighs 26 pounds and is up to date on shots. She is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Regina is a very sweet and slightly shy girl. She is a bit slow to warm up to people but once she does she will show you just how sweet she is. She play bows and wiggles her entire body when she sees foster mom. Once she is comfortable with you she will surprise you by stealing kisses when she can. She would benefit most in a somewhat quieter household and a patient one so she can blossom at a more relaxed pace.  Regina gave birth to a rainbow of girls 8 weeks ago. Now that the girls are weaned she is looking for her fur-ever home. All of Regina's puppies have been adopted, and Regina has adjusted very well to life without little ones. She sleeps in a dog bed in the master bedroom. She loves to chase toys and will toss them up into the air with joy. She now tries to engage the resident dogs in play with lots of play bows and quick dashes away. She still LOVES to be outside as much as possible. Currently, she refuses all treats and loses all interest in other activities when strangers are around (this is a change from just a few weeks ago when she settled down nicely with female guests). She continues to change and make progress each week, so it may be a phase that she works through quickly. Her adoptive family will need to be patient while she adjusts to the changes in her life. She still needs to gain a few pounds - she is a picky eater, but will happily munch a dose of Philadelphia cream cheese:). 

Regina is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. For now, to avoid this, we are limiting placement to standalone, single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. After she has been in a foster home for at least a week or two, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment and will send out an update.

name: Carla
description:
Carla is a 12-year-old spayed female chocolate lab. Carla weighs 46 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 8 and up.

Carla is a lovely, mature chocolate lady whose family is moving and cannot take her. She loves people and being around them getting cuddled and petted. She knows basic commands and has full run of the house. She is good with other dogs and used to live with a Yorkie, but we were told she doesn't like cats. Carla is looking for a loving family that will spoil her in her golden years. 

This dog is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people.  For now we are limiting placement to standalone, single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area.  As we learn more about the dogâs time spent in foster care, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment.

name: Blake
description:
Blake is a 5-year-old neutered yellow male lab. He weighs 62 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Blake is a sweet, happy boy. He is good with other dogs and used to live with two others in his previous home. We don't know how Blake is with cats. He is very curious and is quite interested in all the daily activity of the suburbs. He loves to look out the window at home and in the car. He has been fascinated by joggers and was completely mesmerized by a sprinkler. He has been very interested in everything the family is doing. He likes to lay in the kitchen while we are cooking and eating dinner, but never begs or gets into the garbage. Blake does not bark and does not jump on strangers. He has not had the opportunity to learn basic commands but has demonstrated he can learn quickly and responds when you correct him. He went from crazy dog on a leash to a calmer and responsive walker on the harness. Blake will make a great addition to a family and will quickly bond. He has loads of personality and has perfect house manners.

UPDATE from Blakeâs foster family:  Blake is a sweet, sweet boy and is doing great in his foster townhome. He is housebroken and has free reign over the house when his foster needs to be gone. He has not been crated; he did scratch at the door when left alone initially, but calmed after a couple of days. His foster works-from-home, so he does get a potty break every four hours. Blake is great with the fosterâs teenager. He knows sit, and he quickly learned paw! He is a great eater, is not protective of his food, and sleeps through the night. He gets excited when you first get home and tends to jump, but that is something that can be trained. Blake is a love bug and loves snuggling in your bed or the sofa - he would a family that will let him on the furniture:) 

Blake is a playful guy and walks ~4 miles each day to expend his energy. He is very strong, and his handler needs to be prepared for him to pull hard if he senses something he wants to investigate. He is learning to walk on a leash and doing MUCH better, but ongoing training is needed. He wants to meet people and dogs on his walks and does well; he has not spent time alone with other pups while with his fosters. Blake is a cuddly, fun-loving boy and is the perfect match for a family willing to give him the exercise and ongoing training he needs. 

Blake is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. For now, to avoid this, we are limiting placement to standalone, single family homes or townhomes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. After Blake has been in a foster home for at least a week or two, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment and will send out an update.

name: Monkey
description:
Monkey is a 5-year-old spayed black female lab. She weighs 56 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Monkey is a happy and friendly dog. She enjoys being in the yard, but think she would be just as happy to be a couch potato and hang with you. Hasn't shown any interest in playing with toys yet. She sits nicely for treats and takes them gently. She does fine when she goes out to play in the yard with our other pups. Think she would be happy to be a couch potato and just hang with you. She would like a family that has a yard for her to play in to give her the exercise she needs. Misty is now at a fosters and is living with 3 other dogs without problems. Kids 10 and up as we have no history. Good with other dogs has been out in the yard with other Lab Rescue dogs with no problems. No cat history. Knows sit, down and come. Good on lead. Is house and crate trained as she is keeping her room clean at the kennel and at her fosters. Monkey is a very affectionate and loving pup. She enjoys walking and is calm and easy on leash. She gets a bit excited when she sees a squirrel. She enjoyed her bath. She is food-motivated and will come running anytime she hears a bag being opened. Monkey is from a rural area and have not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. To avoid this, for now we are limiting placement to stand alone single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. As we learn more from the dog's time spent in foster, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment and send out an update. 

Foster family reports: Monkey is sad because summer is almost over and she will not be able to wear her hat and shades anymore - she will have to shop for a scarf! She is a very good sport and is willing to sport attire to entertain her foster family. Her foster dad took her to Petco and she did great. She enjoyed the yummy smells and seeing all the other dogs. Monkey says hello and wants to share that she is a very calm and well behaved pup! She loves to lay around with her foster parents and the resident dogs. She likes to relax and loves rolling on her back and wriggling around so her tummy can be scratched. Monkey is very obedient and knows basic commands, such as sit and stay. She likes taking walks with her foster family and sitting outside on the deck, watching the world go by. She definitely watches for the rabbits to zoom past! Monkey's foster mom took her to Starbucks for a Puppercino and she loved it!

name: Chops
description:
Chops is a 10-month-old neutered male yellow lab. Chops weighs 55 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Chops came to us as a very scared pup, but his foster has been working very hard to socialize him and let him know that people and the world are not so bad. He has been building his confidence a little at a time. He is good with dogs but is still a puppy at heart, so can be a little annoying to the older, less playful dogs. He has become much more attentive to people and has started to show more affection and enjoy human contact more. His foster has been working with the collar and leash, but he still sometimes \"gator rolls\" when the leash goes on so a fenced yard is a must for him. 

Chopâs perfect adopter would be: 
1) A home with less chaos and a family that is willing to show patience and continue to help him grow and learn. 
2) A home with another dog to help him with confidence. 
3) Someone willing to possibly \"visit\" with him a few times before taking him home

This dog is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people.  For now we are limiting placement to standalone, single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area.  As we learn more about the dogâs time spent in foster care, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment.

name: Buddy #4
description:
Buddy #4 is a 10-month-old neutered male yellow lab. Buddy #4 weighs 45 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Buddy #4 is a very happy boy who loves everyone, two-legged and four-legged. He enjoys his walks and is well mannered when he sees other dogs, both large and small. He does have a few quirks which training should easily correct:  placing his paws on your shoulders while seated on the couch, thinking you want to continue playing after he \"releases\" a toy or bone, barking at strangers at the door until he gets to meet them (he remembers them on subsequent visits so that is pretty handy). He does not have an aggressive bone in his body. Buddy is trustworthy alone at home and is not crated at night. Buddy is a great little guy!

This dog is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people.  For now we are limiting placement to standalone, single family homes or townhomes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area.  As we learn more about the dogâs time spent in foster care, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment.

name: Mojo
description:
Mojo is a 2-year-old neutered black male lab. He weighs 57 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children 10 and up.

Mojo is a happy dog whose tail never stops wagging. He likes to retrieve both balls and toys, will bring them back except if he really likes a particular toy. He has a good nose and found the treats in no time and took them gently. Training will probably come easy as he is motivated to please and loves treats. Mojo enjoys being brushed and petted, and as a reward he will lean into you to show how much he likes it. He would like a family that will give him play time, training and exercise. Kids 10 and up as we have no history. Good with other dogs, has been out with other LR pups at the kennel with no problems. Unknown with cats. Mojo knows sit, come, and down but will have a training addendum. He pulls on lead a little when walking and is better with an Easy Walk Harness. He is crate trained, may be house trained as he is keeping his room clean at the kennel. Mojo is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. To avoid this, for now we are limiting placement to stand alone single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. As we learn more from the dog's time spent in foster, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment and send out an update. 

Foster family reports: Mojo is a super sweet love bug that enjoys the company of his people. He has completed his heartworm rest period and is looking for a family that will help him burn off his puppy energy. He knows sit down and wait (for his meal), but he needs some help with some other basic manners.

name: Red
description:
Red is a 1-year-old neutered male yellow lab. Red weighs 65 pounds and is up to date on shots. He is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Foster update:  Red continues to thrive in his foster home! He gets lots of exercise and practices his commands regularly. He can be a bit vocal when he is not occupied in order to get attention, so playtime with the resident pup and his humans is important! He does very well with his foster sister; however, he does take a little bit of time to become comfortable with other dogs. He can be tense when first meeting dogs, so slow introductions are the key to success. This sweet, goofy boy would love an active household with a best canine buddy. 

Red is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. To avoid this, for now we are limiting placement to stand alone single-family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. name: Jax
description:
Jax is a 1-year-old neutered male yellow lab. Jax weighs 55 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up. Jax is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people, so Jax is approved for placement to stand alone single-family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area for now. 

Jax's teacher was grateful that he was such a good student. Because he grew up in a pen with his siblings and wasn't exposed to a lot of things, he can be a bit timid when you first meet, but he has a lovely disposition and warms up quickly. He enjoys the outdoors and taking hikes. He loves to run around the yard and will need to go to a family with a physical fence. Jax needs a family who will not leave him alone for a long work day. He is used to being with other dogs and loves their company. After he gets the right amount of exercise, he settles down for a nap. He doesn't like to be crated much, so that is a work in progress and he can stay for short periods with a frozen kong, or a favorite durable toy. This young boy has already proven that with the right amount of exercise and continued obedience training, he will be an amazing companion for someone who puts in the time. He comes with a complimentary 7-week Good Manners class at Peaceable Paws in Fairplay, MD. He is excited to find a forever home with a doggy buddy:) 

UPDATE FROM THE FOSTER: This sweet boy is very gentle and loving. He wants to be with companions, both canine and human. Jax has excellent leash manners, loves walks and is learning to go for runs with his foster brother. Jax loves being with other pups (the more the merrier!) and people. Nothing beats a good cuddle session after a full day of play - check out his snuggle with the resident black lab in the photos. If you like exciting outdoor adventures followed by late afternoon naps in the sunny spot, Jax is a perfect match. Jax had fun where he got to run on the trail, wrestle with the other dogs, and play with the humans. He squeezed in a nap in the sunny spot, beating the other pups to it. He loves to meet new people and dogs and play, play, play. This pup is full of joy and energy, and would love a family to share it with him!

This dog is available for adoption from Lab Rescue LRCP.   Lab Rescue LRCP rescues and places dogs in Maryland,  Virginia, Washington DC, West Virginia, Pennsylvania, Delaware and North Carolina. name: Drake #4
description:
Drake is a 3-year-old neutered male black lab. Drake weighs 63 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children 10 and up.

Drake is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people, so Drake is approved for placement to stand alone single-family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area for now. 

Drake is a stunning black adorable male. He is doing great and loves his people! Drake thinks that he is the top dog and no one can come close to his looks therefore he is not a fan of other dogs so, he will need a home with no other dogs in the home so he can be the lone supermodel. He is affectionate and sweet but, will need someone to stand firm on the rules of the house. He is house and crate trained and knows all of his basic commands.Â Drake is a sweet and awesomely happy boy! Heâs a big, beautiful, block-headed dog that just wants to be in your lap. Drake knows sit and shake and appears to be crate trained. He slept quietly all night in his crate. Drake likes to retrieve. 

UPDATE FROM THE FOSTER: Drake is play time all day, and he has a full-on body wag! Handsome blockhead black lab, who is toy-obsessed and just wants to have fun. He loves attention and is doing well in training and with doggie day care. He is great with his people. Has a killer lab-lean and is very affectionate once he gets to know you. Drake is fine walking past other dogs on leash, but has no interest in engaging them to play. He is great with people but, not a fan of other dogs so, he needs to be the only dog in the household. Drake is learning his commands and loves human attention. Drake is full of life, and a huge fan of toys and tennis balls - he will even entertain himself. He needs to loose a few pounds, but playing fetch daily in the yard should definitely help him along with his weight-watchers program. He is a big fan of people and lots of fun. You won't regret giving this boy his forever home!  Drake is such an happy camper and so excited about life he rarely stands still - even when trying to get a picture to show the world how gorgeous he is. He's got the classic big blocky head and thick otter tail. He is not the most cuddly until you take him on an 8 mile hike - maybe after that he will snuggle of the couch. Drake thinks there is a lot to life and he is ready to see it all!!
