name: Apollo the White Knight
description:
Apollo is a 2.5-year-old neutered loving boy. He weighs 75 lbs and is naturally slender. Unfortunately, due to male-male aggression, Apollo needs to be rehomed to a loving family. He would do well in a home where someone could spend most of the day with him. He is looking for someone experienced with large dogs or northern breeds. Typical male malamute characteristics. He has moments of zoomies and then would lay next to you and watch TV. Apollo is an expert digger and occasionally tries to dig inside and outside. Apollo doesnât realize his size and loves laying in your lap and taking up the entire bed. 

Apollo would prefer to be the only pet in the household but has been getting along with a similarly sized female. He could never live with another male due to male-male aggression nor be around another male dog unsupervised. Apollo does mark in the house, but most likely this is due to the presence of another large male sharing the house. He will wear a belly band but that does not deter his marking. During walks, Apollo avoids other dogs except for his two husky friends. He responds well to the dog walker and loves to give kisses. 

Apollo loves all toys. He always has a toy in his mouth and wants to play fetch or get pets while he chews them. He is a good sitter and will do almost anything for a treat. Himalayan dog treats and fresh beef bones are some of his favorite chew treats. 

While not too fond of many dogs, Apollo loves people and is always eager to say hi to everyone on walks. He has not lived with children but enjoys meeting them on walks. Not recommended for homes with small children due to his size and stature. 

If you are interested in adopting Apollo, please contact CHAAMP at CHAAMPapplication@gmail.com for an application. You may also complete an application online thru our web site, www.CHAAMP.org

CHAAMP accepts applications ONLY from Maryland, New Jersey, New York, Pennsylvania, Virginia, West Virginia, and Washington DC. The information on your application will help CHAAMP determine which of our dogs is a good match for you and your family, based upon your lifestyle, other pets, etc. A home visit is required prior to all adoptions. Many of our dogs are fostered in private homes and cannot be visited until you have been approved for adoption. 

ADOPTION FEES
~Adult dogs, the fee is $275.00  
~Older dogs (eight years old or over) the adoption fee is $100.00 
~Puppies between 6 months and 1 year are $350.00 
~Puppies under 6 months old are $375.00 

All dogs are micro chipped, spayed and neutered and up to date on vaccines. These fees help us cover these costs.  The rates are higher for puppies because they require more visits to the vet and shots. 

CHAAMP IS NOT A SHELTER. We are volunteers over a 7-state area dedicated to helping Malamutes in our rescue area. You can read more about Malamutes and about CHAAMP by visiting www.CHAAMP.org

name: Rulcho
description:
Rulcho is a 2-year-old neutered male black lab. Rulcho weighs 55 pounds and is up to date on shots. He is approved for homes with children 10 and up.

Foster update: Rulcho is wondering why no one is calling about him! He has become so much more confident . He LOVES other dogs and they make him so happy and give him added confidence. He loves toys and food puzzles especially. He is doing great with meeting new friends. He is house trained and crated trained and does well on leash. Rulcho would love a quieter home with a doggie buddy!!

Rulcho is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. For now, to avoid this, we are limiting placement to standalone, single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. After Rulcho has been in a foster home for at least a week or two, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment and will send out an update.

name: Princess Anne & Smokey Joe
description:
Princess Anne is a 13-year-old spayed female black lab. Smokey Joe is a 13-year old neutered male black lab.  Princess Anne weighs 84 pounds and is up to date on shots. Smokey Joe weighs 105 pounds and is up to date on shots.  These dogs are a bonded pair who must be adopted together.  They are approved for homes and townhomes with children ages 10 and up.

Foster update:  Smokey and Princess are a bonded brother and sister pair, ready to face whatever life sends their way! Life sent this precious pair a curve ball when their owner could no longer care for them. Now theyâre hoping Lab Rescue will send them a family who can appreciate the bounty of benefits that come with adding a senior (or 2) to your family: loving, laid back, house trained, donât need tons of exercise, gentle with kids, off the charts adorable frosted faces! These sweet seniors would be an easy addition to any family. 

Princess and Smokey here! Foster mom went on vacation so we did too! Now we're back and time to unpack our tennis balls. We had a great time at our vacation foster home. We got to go to some neighborhood parties and we even helped supervise a litter of foster puppies that came for a short visit. Our favorite part of the vacation was the teenagers! They would rub our ears and scratch our bellies and throw tennis balls for us in the yard! Sometimes we had to wait until lunchtime for them to wake up, but they were really fun to play with. We're happy to be back with foster mom, but we're still hoping that someone out there has a permanent place in their heart and their home for us. We are an easy pair that just continues to demonstrate how adaptable and easy going we are. From 10 days living in a hotel to 3 weeks with a vacation foster, we make ourselves at home and adapt to new people and places easily. All we need is a yard with some tennis balls and some people to love and snuggle! 

These dogs are available for adoption from Lab Rescue LRCP.   Lab Rescue LRCP rescues and places dogs in Maryland,  Virginia, Washington DC, West Virginia, Pennsylvania, Delaware and North Carolina. name: Toby
description:
Toby is a 10-year-old neutered male black lab. Toby weighs 76 pounds and is up to date on shots. He is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Toby needs to spend his senior years with a family that will love and care for him every day. They will get a truly grateful, loving dog, perfect for taking along on adventures because his loyalty and loving personality will put smiles on any family that calls him theirs. 

Foster update:  Toby is a total sweetheart! He loves hanging out with his humans and is quite willing to be loved on:) He does well with the senior resident lab and enjoys their walks, trotting along side-by-side. He is more energetic than expected for his age and would enjoy long walks or a light run. Toby is not a fan of the crate, but that is okay because he can be trusted to have the run of the house. He does not care to be separated from his people when they are home (what lab does?!). 

Toby is approved for kids 7 and up, he previously lived with a boy and a girl and he loved to be with them. He is good with other dogs but no cats as he will chase them. Toby knows sit, shake, fetch and laydown. He pulls some on lead and would benefit from an Easy Walk harness. He is crate trained and has been keeping his room clean at the kennel.  He is also trained to an invisible fence. 

Toby is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. To avoid this, for now we are limiting placement to stand alone single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. As we learn more from the dog's time spent in foster, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment and send out an update. 

Toby is Heartworm Positive. Heartworm is highly treatable and treatment will be provided, at no cost to the adopter, at one of Lab Rescue's designated vets. Completing Heartworm treatment at the veterinarian designated by the Rescue is a requirement of adoption. Adopters can learn more about Heartworm at www.lab-rescue.org/heartworm.

name: Scout #2
description:
Scout #2 is a 3-year-old neutered male yellow lab. Scout weighs 50 pounds and is up to date on shots. He is approved for homes with children ages 15 and up.

Foster update:  Scout is a shy sweetheart who is getting used to life in the city. He rode like a dream for the long drive from the vet to his foster. He is doing fine in a townhouse and learned to negotiate the stairs. He isnât crazy about being put in his crate, but he will quiet down quickly and is content to sleep there. Scout doesnât pull on his leash unless he spies a squirrel or rabbit and he seems okay with traffic noises. He ignores the cat. 

Scout loves to be near to his people and wants to have his foster in sight at all times, or better yet, snooze beside her on the couch. He needs a calm home and adopters that will be patient as he learns more about the world! Scout needs to gain confidence but he is so eager to please and is a real love bug! Scout takes a few minutes to warm up but, if you get down on the ground and let him come to you - he will warm up and snuggle. He loves treats. He will need an experienced owner who will continue with his training to teach him that life can be fun!

name: Duke #3
description:
Duke is a 4-year-old neutered male fox red lab. Duke weighs 73 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 16 and up. Duke is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people, so Duke is approved for placement to stand alone single-family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area for now. 

Duke is an adorable boy with a dark honey colored coat, a sweet sugar dipped muzzle, and gorgeous golden eyes. This lovable guy enjoys snuggling with his stuffies, riding in the car, and relaxing with his humans. He does well in his crate and doesn't mind sleeping in there at night. He is very friendly, but can take some time to warm up to new situations. Once he does, he's a happy boy with a tail that won't stop wagging. Duke knows basic commands and is crate/house trained. He does pull on leash so an easy walk harness is recommended. Duke is loving life at doggie day care. He is very loving and is having fun meeting new people and pups. He enjoys getting petted and has a great lab lean. :) He will actively seek attention from his people with a nose nudge. If you are sitting down, he will place his chin on your lap or put his nose under your hand to get affection. 

UPDATE FROM THE FOSTER: Duke is not shy at all. He is an in your face, happy-go-lucky, and go along all the time. He is a jumping bean (except he is BIG). He's full of energy, but happy to do anything for a treat or a toy! Duke loves all stuffiesâ¦ however, he loves to destroy them more. Do you have a lot of stuffies that need destroying? Duke is your guy.

name: Ginger #2
description:
Ginger is a 13-year-old spayed female yellow lab. Ginger weighs 72 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 8 and up.

Ginger is a sweet, smart, gentle lady who enjoys snuggling, swimming, and going for walks. This pretty brown-eyed girl has good manners in the house, sleeps all night in a cozy dog bed, knows multiple commands, and walks well on a leash. Sheâs pretty close to perfect! Ginger is a fun, active girl who doesnât need much and is ready to find a family that has room for a laid-back love bug in their lives. Sheâs generally fine to be left alone for about 6 hours, but she needs a home where she won't be alone for a long work day. There are just a few things Ginger canât do in her golden years - like stairs. Sheâs okay on a few, but a whole flight is too much for her. She also needs help getting into a car. Ginger LOVES to sleep in the bedroom. She gets along with all of the resident dogs, and even the resident cat. Sometimes she doesn't like to share her toys, so as long as there are plenty of toys to be had, she will be a happy camper! She has been learning to take treats gently and responds to \"easy.\" She'll be a great addition to someone's home. She's such a nice dog with a great spirit and energy!Â 

UPDATE FROM FOSTER: Beautiful Ginger is checking in with a smile! Her foster family adores her and states that you cannot help but but smile and love her!! Ginger has great house manners, loves to go for walks, enjoys car-rides, is thrilled with lots of attention and will sleep quietly at your feet. All of these good things are wrapped up into a 13-year-old girl who is truly young in heart and spirit! gem of a gal who is always wagging her tail and is always excited to start her day, giving no thought or worry as to what will come her way -- A lesson to learn!! Ginger has so many good qualities and is good with other dogs who will respect her space - AND when she gets to know the kitty's in her life, she respects their space and won't chase or bother them. Ginger is not good on steps, but she has great house manners and knows all the basics. Added to this, she also has great eye-mouth coordination to catch treats, loves car-rides and lots of attention and of course mealtimes! All these good things wrapped up into a beautiful 13-year-old girl who is young in heart and spirit and has so much love to give!!


This dog is available for adoption from Lab Rescue LRCP.   Lab Rescue LRCP rescues and places dogs in Maryland,  Virginia, Washington DC, West Virginia, Pennsylvania, Delaware and North Carolina.  Adopters must travel to Maryland, or Virginia with their family - human and canine - to meet the dog they want to adopt.

Lab Rescue LRCP has between 40 - 80 dogs available for adoption from foster homes across Maryland and Virginia, and at monthly adoption events.  The adoption event dates and locations are listed at www.lab-rescue.org. 

If you are interested in adopting, please visit www.lab-rescue.org and complete an adoption application. After you submit an application, you will hear from an Adoption Coordinator who will guide you through the adoption process. 

An adoption fee is charged to cover the cost of veterinary care and a home visit is required.

name: Finn MacCool
description:
Born in 2017, Finn is a small pup who weighs around 55 lbs. Just a petite bundle of stunning WHITE fur with little slivers of chestnut on the top of his ears. He stays clean too. He can be shy & even fearful of some humans or just lean into you as he melts to the floor with his belly up for affection. Because he can be fearful of \"some\" people it's important to give him \"space\" and go slow with introductions. He has met older children and enjoyed their calm attention but to help him with his excitability he prefers a home with older children. He has blossomed with positive dog training (no force, no fear, no pain) and build his confidence while strengthening your bond. Finn is seeking his human soulmate. He is an amazing young boy & is waiting patiently for the right home.

OTHER DOGS: Currently, if we can't avoid a dog during our walk, then we keep a safe distance like on the other side of the street, in a calm voice tell him he is a good boy, watch, & we toss a treat in the air for him to catch. We allow Finn to watch the dog, but break his stare with something positive to change the experience. This also helps him refocus his energies to something delicious. With \"some\" dogs, this has worked well. There are still some dogs that he reacts to due to fear.  Finn tends to be intimidated by large dogs & can't help but want to chase small dogs, which is completely natural for Northern Breeds. He has met playful females and has done well with a slow introduction. He has also met some that made him fearful.  

INSIDE THE HOUSE:  Finn is calm inside the house as long as he gets a nice walk. We also give him a frozen toy filled with chicken broth & a couple of treats, which he loves to lick. Licking is very soothing to dogs & helps them stay busy. He enjoys chewing & licking toys. We always leave his crate open and he is kept in a gated area during the day, which is the kitchen as well as Finn's den. He is a very good boy & tries not to counter surf. He enjoys jumping on furniture & can learn which sofa is his spot.

BACKYARD FUN:  Finn enjoys your company while he runs around in the backyard. He enjoys keeping the garden free of critters, bugs, & eating fresh tomatoes off the vine. Thanks to Finn, the garden have survived! Finn hopes to have a fenced yard, so he can sniff and show you his zoomies, be your gardening assistant. He loves going outside & sprinting in happiness, especially in the winter!  He also loves to lay on his Kuranda dog bed under the shade after sipping water in between his own party in the backyard. He likes to play hide & go seek too. He also enjoys nuzzling his head in between your legs for affection in between his fun time. Just an amazing companion.   

Finn typically walks a mile 3 times a day. He sits nicely (with his paw up as if to say please hurry) for treats too. He has great potential & learns quickly too. The husky side of Finn is excitable. So it's important to help him practice calming down by asking for a sit, then a down, and then zen with long strokes on his back or a belly rub. He loves this & often melts into your side, then your feet with his belly up for love. In a new environment, it is important to remind him how to relax. He is a complete angel with his foster family, but they follow these guidelines earned his trust. He enjoys being with his foster family and is very affectionate. He loves to sleep on the bed & will initiate affection for a while, then goes to his side of the bed to sleep.  

TRAVEL COMPANION: Finn also travels well. He prefers to be seated close to his foster family. He is a family dog and loves with all his heart. 

TOYS & PLAY:  Finn likes squeaky tough toys (he destroys stuffed animals in seconds) and will trade his toy for a treat with no problem. He is quite playful & loves to smell & find things. He would do well-performing nose work. Finn enjoys being a \"good boy\" & loves working for a reward. It's important to provide with Finn a calm demeanor and go slow to help him blossom. Finn likes to play the \"find it\" game and he also likes to sit, wait, and catch a treat as you toss it in the air. He loves rotisserie chicken sandwiches, which he considers a high-value treat. We use it when counter conditioning scary things like dogs. 

SPACE: When introducing Finn to new things, we practice letting him go at his own pace and treating, repeat, etc. This has built his confidence. Trust is important for Finn. It is important to give him space and allow him to enter into your space when meeting him. Finn like most dogs does not like having his head pat by, especially strangers. 

We believe Finn is part Husky/Malamute, his Malamute side likes to keep his distance from other male dogs. His foster mom simply calls him and lets him sniff rotisserie chicken sandwich as she lures him to walk in a different direction (\"this way\"), he is rewarded with small bites. He responds nicely! He has so much potential. 

BACKGROUND:  Finn came to CHAAMP after living with a family on a farm with fur siblings. He was too interested in the chickens and the cats. He also wasn't getting along with the male dogs in the household. He was said to have high predatory behavior, which is normal for Northern Breeds. Finn can go from 0 to 70 in a blink of an eye due to excitement or if you go too fast and scare him. 

Finn's foster family has gone slow, provided structure, and practice positive dog training to help him make good choices. He is an amazing & affectionate young furry companion who loves his foster family & is seeking to fall in love with a special human.   

If you are interested in adopting Finn, please contact CHAAMP at CHAAMPapplication@gmail.com for an application. You may also complete an application online thru our web site, www.CHAAMP.org

CHAAMP accepts applications ONLY from Maryland, New Jersey, New York, Pennsylvania, Virginia, West Virginia, and Washington DC. The information on your application will help CHAAMP determine which of our dogs is a good match for you and your family, based upon your lifestyle, other pets, etc. A home visit is required prior to all adoptions. Many of our dogs are fostered in private homes and cannot be visited until you have been approved for adoption. 

ADOPTION FEES
~Adult dogs, the fee is $275.00  
~Older dogs (eight years old or over) the adoption fee is $100.00 
~Puppies between 6 months and 1 year are $350.00 
~Puppies under 6 months old are $375.00 

All dogs are micro chipped, spayed and neutered and up to date on vaccines. These fees help us cover these costs.  The rates are higher for puppies because they require more visits to the vet and shots. 

CHAAMP IS NOT A SHELTER. We are volunteers over a 7-state area dedicated to helping Malamutes in our rescue area. You can read more about Malamutes and about CHAAMP by visiting www.CHAAMP.org

name: Pepe
description:
Pepe is a 3-year-old neutered male black lab. Pepe weighs 35 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for adult-only homes.

Pepe is a fantastic lap dog with a soft shiny coat! He gives the sweetest kisses and loves to snuggle. This little guy is super smart and has learned some new tricks including up, spin, and paw. He loves to show off his skills in exchange for treats and praise, and he is always eager to learn more. 

Foster update:  Pepe has only been with us for the last 3 days, but he is a wonderful guest. His favorite thing to do is just cuddle with you on the couch. Second favorite is working on a bone, but he will put it down in a moment if someone comes into the room. Pepe doesnât touch a thing that doesnât belong to him and is housebroken to the max. He is crated for a couple hours a couple times a week to stay in practice, but there is really no reason to keep him crated- he would be a great buddy for someone who does work a full day since he can easily entertain himself. The most he barks is a single âWoofâ to tell the crazy dogs to go play elsewhere. He is a couch potato who insists on sleeping with his babies, which he sometimes carries around. Pepe is gentle with treats and stretches out a meal until the next one. He is great in the car, just occasionally panting. Pepe is also well behaved on leash and is doing fine behind a 4â fence. 

This dog is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people.  For now we are limiting placement to standalone, single family homes or townhomes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area.  As we learn more about the dogâs time spent in foster care, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment.

This dog is available for adoption from Lab Rescue LRCP.   Lab Rescue LRCP rescues and places dogs in Maryland,  Virginia, Washington DC, West Virginia, Pennsylvania, Delaware and northeast North Carolina (30 miles east of I-95 and north of the Pamlico Sound.)  Adopters must travel to Maryland, or Virginia with their family - human and canine - to meet the dog they want to adopt.

Lab Rescue LRCP has between 40 - 80 dogs available for adoption from foster homes across Maryland and Virginia, and at monthly adoption events.  The adoption event dates and locations are listed at www.lab-rescue.org.

If you are interested in adopting, please visit www.lab-rescue.org and complete an adoption application. After you submit an application, you will hear from an Adoption Coordinator who will guide you through the adoption process.

An adoption fee is charged to cover the cost of veterinary care and a home visit is required.

name: Pokie
description:
Pokie is a 9-year-old neutered male chocolate lab. Pokie weighs 61 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Pokie is an exceptionally loving, sweet boy that adores all people and his toys. This silly boy has a toy on him at all times - so much so that we've had to teach him to check his toy at the door before he goes outside. Pokie has exceptional house manners. He is fully house trained and has full run of the house while we're out. He also loves going for rides in the car. Pokie is quiet and only lets out an occasional bark when there's someone at the door. Pokie is partially blind due to complications from diabetes, but he does see shadows and gets around just fine. He loves running around the yard and playing ball (he listens for the bounce and is quite good at locating it). His diabetes is well controlled with two injections a day that are quite easy to do. Pokie's other passion is food and he equates getting his insulin with a biscuit, so he eagerly sits in anticipation of getting his injection and treat. He would do well as an only dog or have a laid back doggy companion. No kitties. Pokie has so much love to give his forever family. He is such a sweet gentleman, LOVES people, toys and catching some rays. Pokie is mostly blind due to diabetes, but runs full speed around the house. He has excellent house manners and is a complete sweetheart. Pokie would do great as an only dog or with another super laid back companion. 

Foster family reports: Pokie is a wonderful companion. He loves to play with people and is getting along with the pack. Pokie adores everyone he meets and is very affectionate. Pokie loves to play ball (he tracks very well with his hearing). He is perfect in the house - he has never had an accident or gotten into anything he shouldnât. His thyroid and diabetes management have remained very stable. He would probably do best with a quiet doggy sibling or on his own. 

This dog is available for adoption from Lab Rescue LRCP.   Lab Rescue LRCP rescues and places dogs in Maryland, Virginia, Washington DC, West Virginia, Pennsylvania, Delaware and North Carolina. Adopters must travel to Maryland, or Virginia with their family - human and canine - to meet the dog they want to adopt.

Lab Rescue LRCP has between 40 - 80 dogs available for adoption from foster homes across Maryland and Virginia, and at monthly adoption events.  The adoption event dates and locations are listed at www.lab-rescue.org.

If you are interested in adopting, please visit www.lab-rescue.org and complete an adoption application. After you submit an application, you will hear from an Adoption Coordinator who will guide you through the adoption process.

An adoption fee is charged to cover the cost of veterinary care and a home visit is required.

name: Marcus
description: Marcus is an adorable three year old. He's crate trained and good with other dogs. He is located in Maryland.

name: Kai
description: Hi My name is Kai. After a very long journey from down south I finally made it to Massachusetts.I was so scared of everything and everyone. I couldn't stop shaking. My foster mom is helping me to become more confident everyday. I am getting used to people petting me and I love a good brushing! I am learning my leash manners and rides in the car. I think someday I would like a friend to play with but having you with me is good enough. Did I tell you that I love to snuggle and give kisses? Sometimes I even think I'm a lap dog. Although I'm very young and have alot to learn one thing you will have to teach me is how to love you Kai

name: Sonja - Foster (101) / 2016
description:
Sonja
Sonja is a 45 pound cattle dog / lab mix and she is about 3 years old. We have had her since March of 2016 because we were trying to keep her together with her mom, Momma Madre. After speaking with a behaviorist, we have decided to separate the two after having them for two years with no interest. Sonja is very shy in new environments and around new people. She tends to be somewhat insecure. However, within her own foster home, she is very extrovert and playful. Sonja would be a good pet for a quiet and calm family or person who has a regular routine. She would not make for a good road trip type of companion. Sonja enjoys her fosters backyard and she is very good at leaving presents at the door. Sonja is current on shots, flea / tick / HW preventative, fixed, and she is microchipped. Sonja does have Diabetes Insipidus which will require twice daily eye drops to be given. This is a lifelong condition but is easily manageable with twice daily eye drops. Date of Intake: 3/17/16, updated 6/23/18
Sonja is located in foster care in Maumelle. Meet and Greet appointments available! For more information, please email us at Dogs@Maumellefoa.org. Online adoption applications located at www.maumellefoa.org. Our adoption fee is $80. Included in the fee is shots, sterilization, microchip, dogs are given a dewormer at time of intake, placed on monthly flea/tick preventative, if heartworm negative then they are placed on heartworm preventative, if heartworm positive then they are treated once an adoption finalized.
We are always at the NLR PetSmart with our available pets on every Saturday of the month. From 10:30 - 3:00 ish.
Find Maumelle Friends of the Animals on Facebook!

name: Doodle Dandy
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8551

2-3 year old Male beagle about 15lbs. Was found in a southern Virginia shelter by a volunteer. 

This dog tested positive for Ehrlichia before arriving to the rescue. Ehrlichia is a very common type of bacteria that infects dogs and other species and is spread by ticks. Ehrlichia is not contagious to humans or other pets. The only way to get this disease is to be bitten by a tick that carries it. The treatment is typically 21-30 days of antibiotics. This dog started treatment upon arriving to the rescue. 

**I will be at the Richmond Dog Festival Event in Richmond, VA on 9/21/19 from 11am to 4pm at Chimborazo Park 3215 E. Broad St. Richmond, VA 23223 . I would love to meet my furever family so come by and meet me this weekend ! 
To adopt this dog, or any OPH dog, fill out the simple online application at https://ophrescue.org 
Operation Paws for Homes, Inc. (OPH) rescues dogs of all breeds and ages from high-kill shelters in NC, VA, MD, and SC, reducing the numbers being euthanized. With limited resources, the shelters are forced to put down 50-90% of the animals that come in the front door. OPH provides pet adoption services to families located in VA, DC, MD, PA and neighboring states. OPH is a 501(c)(3) organization and is 100% donor funded. OPH does not operate a shelter or have a physical location. We rely on foster families who open their homes to give love and attention to each dog before finding a forever home.

name: Chubbers
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8373

Looking for a best four legged friend and faithful companion? Then meet Chubbers, the Corgi/Chihuahua mix! Hes about 6 years old and only 15 pounds so he is very portable and can go most anywhere with you. This shy guy came to OPH on 7/3/19 after some time at an overcrowded shelter in VA, where he was scared, but willing to be handled and enjoyed the attention he received from his OPH rescuer. Chubbers is doing really well in his foster home. He has peacefully coexisted with the dogs he has met so far in his foster home. He likes walks and sure enjoys just hanging with his people. He needs slow introductions to new people to allow him to properly get to know visitors and greet them nicely. His foster says he has nice house manners. Does he sound like the perfect pup for you? If so, please apply to adopt this sweet boy today!
To adopt this dog, or any OPH dog, fill out the simple online application at https://ophrescue.org

name: Belle (& Taco)
description:
This sweet bonded pair, Taco & Belle, have had unfortunate luck in their very short lives. They lost their original owner suddenly to a stroke and were passed around to different family members for a few months. They ended up with the 80-year-old grandmother who was legally blind and taking care of her disabled son, so she didn't have the time or bandwidth to take on two young dogs. A family member reached out to Worthy Dog for help, and we gladly took them in.

The duo came to N. VA and were adopted in February by a very sweet couple, and we thought they had found their forever home. Sadly, their current mom, Lynn, who is only in her 30's, is going through a significant and unexpected health challenge, and suffering from kidney failure. She had a kidney transplant 18 years ago and was in great health when she adopted the pups. The couple was so very excited to have these dogs, and even started an Instagram account for Taco & Bell to share updates

About two months ago, Lynn's kidney started failing, and she ended up in the hospital for weeks. She is now on the transplant list waiting for a donor and has to do dialysis 3 to 4 days a week. She travels from VA to MD to a military facility for treatment, and the dialysis wipes out her energy when she gets home. Lynn has been the primary caregiver for the pups and had the flexibility to work from home. Her husband is active duty, and travels frequently, so he's not home during the day to help. Her mom and friends have been helping out, and kept Taco & Bell when she was hospitalized, but it's not a long-term solution.

In the interest of the dogs, Lynn has made the difficult decision to rehome them. She feels they aren't getting the time and attention they deserve, and with another transplant surgery in her future, she may be out of commission for an extended period. She wants to find a home for them before transplant surgery, and have peace of mind that they will be well taken care of. She is fostering them until a great family can be found.

TACO & BELLE

Taco & Belle have been together their whole lives and are a bonded pair. Taco is more timid, but loves his buddy Belle, and looks to her for reassurance. Taco needs a little more time to settle in and trust, but once he connects, he's very trusting and affectionate. Both dogs fancy themselves lap dogs once they get to know you.

This adorable duo loves to play and will keep each other entertained during the day. They are crate trained, enjoy their daily walks, and are potty trained, but do need regular potty breaks. Belle lets you know she needs to go out, and Taco will follow her lead once he settles in. Initially, Taco was prone to marking or excited peeing when he was unexpectedly picked up, but that was more about nerves. They used a belly band to settle him in, and both dogs have been trained on pee pads. Lynn will leave them gated in the kitchen when she goes in for treatment, and has a dog walker or her mom come in when she's out of the home for more than 5 or 6 hours.

These two pups are very connected, so we will only adopt them out as a pair. They are buddies who love to play and nap together and keep each other entertained. They are both afraid of loud noises and strangers and need time to acclimate to visitors, but once they know the person, like grandma, they are all excitement and kisses.

We feel a quiet, calm home is the best fit for them - an adult or senior couple, or empty nesters would be ideal. If you are looking for two little pups who will add joy and much entertainment to your life, please apply today. They are long overdue for their forever home.

Breed: Chihuahua
Weight: 12 lbs (needs to lose a pound or two)
Age: ~ 2 to 2.5 years
Gender: Female
Adoption fee: $500 (pair)
Vetting: updated on vaccines, dewormed, spayed microchipped.
Location: Gainesville, VA

FOR MORE INFO OR TO ADOPT: Please go to http://adopt.worthydog.org and complete the application.

You can also help save dogs like this one by becoming a foster, providing a rescue dog with a temporary home and giving them the love and care they need until they are permanently adopted. Every person who fosters is directly responsible for saving the life of a dog, because we can only save as many dogs as we have foster families available to welcome them into their homes. If you think you might be interested in becoming a foster and want to learn more, please go to http://foster.worthydog.org and fill out an application.

Worthy Dog Rescue is an all-volunteer, foster-based rescue that primarily adopts to families in the DC Metro area.

Breed: Chihuahua mix
Weight: 13-14 lbs (needs to lose a few pounds)
Age: ~ 1.5 to 2 years old
Gender: Male (Taco)
Adoption fee: $500 (pair)
Vetting: updated on vaccines, dewormed, neutered, microchipped.
Location: Gainesville, VA

FOR MORE INFO OR TO ADOPT: Please go to http://adopt.worthydog.org and complete the application.

You can also help save dogs like this one by becoming a foster, providing a rescue dog with a temporary home and giving them the love and care they need until they are permanently adopted. name: Lei Lei
description:
Hi my name is Lei Lei. I am a male Chihuahua who is approximately 3-4 yrs old. I am looking for my forever home. I get along with kids, dogs and cats. When you rub or scratch my sweet spot I like to talk, but it comes out sounding like I'm growling. I love attention but sometimes I don't like to share my food and will give you a warning growl. I love car rides, taking long walks in the sunset, playing with toys and love to play fight sometimes. My favorite thing is the world though is playing ball in the yard - I love to run after it and bring it back over and over! I would love to meet you! So please consider me for adoption and contact SHR.
Please read below for some of our adoption policies:
To meet any of our animals outside of a scheduled event, an approved application is required. 
The adoption donation is $250.00 unless stated otherwise.
There is an additional, non-refundable $50 charge on any approved adoption when the adoptive home is located between 60-100 miles from Leonardtown, MD. If we agree to an adoption further than that there will be an additional charge.
Any adoption further than 60 miles is at the discretion of the Board due to availability of volunteers.

name: Ty
description:
My name is Ty and my foster mom thinks I have the cutest ears... (pretty obvious from the picture you think?).   Anyway, I'm about 5 years old and I am working on my house manners (but could really use more personal attention), I'm crate trained and I have figured out that when the crate gets open, I go OUTSIDE the door to do my business.  I have heard whispers that once you get into rescue that eventually (hopefully sooner rather than later), you get to go to another house, one where the people that live there are actual YOUR people!  I hope that's true as it sounds like just what I need!  If you have an empty spot in your heart and would love to have an active companion, then please contact Second Hope Rescue TODAY for an application!  (I can't wait to meet you!)

  Please read below for some of our adoption policies:  To meet any of our animals outside of a scheduled event, an approved application is required. The adoption donation is $250.00 unless stated otherwise.  There is an additional, non-refundable $50 charge on any approved adoption when the adoptive home is located between 60-100 miles from Leonardtown, MD.  If we agree to an adoption further than that there will be an additional charge.  Any adoption further than 60 miles is at the discretion of the Board due to availability of volunteers.

name: Connor
description:
Connor is one of those small compact dogs, that's pure love and enjoyment!  Connor is about 8 months old and won't get any bigger.  He is crate trained and doing good on his house training but needs a little more practice on his leash walking.  Connor hasn't met another dog yet that he hasn't liked and loves to play with them all, both large and small!  Connor would love his own home where he can watch TV with you and join the family during summer lazy day bar-b-ques!  Please contact Second Hope Rescue as soon as possible to meet this awesome dog and make your family complete!

 Please read below for some of our adoption policies:  To meet any of our animals outside of a scheduled event, an approved application is required. The adoption donation is $200.00 unless stated otherwise.  There is an additional, non-refundable $50 charge on any approved adoption when the adoptive home is located between 60-100 miles from Leonardtown, MD.  If we agree to an adoption further than that there will be an additional charge.  Any adoption further than 60 miles is at the discretion of the Board due to availability of volunteers.

name: Maiya
description:
Meet Maiya ... she is a female bull terrier/ pit mix. She is approximately 2 yrs old. She is small and compact, she is built like a bull terrier. Maiya loves to play with other dogs but does do better with male dogs.Â  She's crate trained and working on house training. Maiya also gets along with children, she is working on her manners.Â Â  Maiya lovesÂ attention and loves being petted.Â  Â 
Please read below for some of our adoption policies:
To meet any of our animals outside of a scheduled event, an approved application is required.
The adoption donation is $200.00 unless stated otherwise.
There is an additional, non-refundable $50 charge on any approved adoption when the adoptive home is located between 60-100 miles from Leonardtown, MD. If we agree to an adoption further than that there will be an additional charge.
Any adoption further than 60 miles is at the discretion of the Board due to availability of volunteers.

name: King
description:
Hi, my name is King and it's the perfect name for me because I'm a spectacular 2 1/2 year old male pure bred Pit Bull Terrier.  I love people and I've lived with children and a 12 year old 10 lb Chihuahua.  Now, I'm looking for the perfect person who can give me a loving home and help me be the amazing dog I know I can be.  I'm up to date on vaccinations, neutered, house trained, crate trained and identification micro chipped.  For more information, please call 240-925-0628 or email katmc@secondhoperescue.org.

Second Hope Rescue is located in Leonardtown, MD 20650 Please read below for some of our adoption policies: To meet any of our animals outside of a scheduled event, an approved application is required. name: Zak
description:
Zak is another formerly chained dog, having spent Â 3 years of his life living like that he was able to get into rescue, where it's now our mission to give him the home life he deserves. Zak is his new name to start his new life.  Zak is very loving and affectionate with the four people that are his caretakers. He barks at people he doesn't know but warms ups quickly once he knows you. Zak is house trained, and walks well on his leash.

Zak has been neutered, and is current on his shots.  Unfortunately after being chained, he is heartworm positive.  He will be undergoing treatment soon.  He can still be adopted before treatment, and his new home can follow through with this.
If you think Zak is who you have been looking for to add to your family - please contact us for an application.  Zak has lots and lots of love to give to the right home!   Please read below for some of our adoption policies:  To meet any of our animals outside of a scheduled event, an approved application is required.   The adoption donation is $150.00 unless stated otherwise.  There is an additional, non-refundable $50 charge on any approved adoption when the adoptive home is located between 60-100 miles from Leonardtown, MD. If we agree to an adoption further than that there will be an additional charge.  Any adoption further than 60 miles is at the discretion of the Board due to availability of volunteers.

name: Sparky
description:
Sparky is looking for a foster home (would be perfect if that foster home might be looking for a dog to adopt as well). Sparky is one year old hound mix, possibly with some cattle dog mixed in, 50 pounds, an active boy (a fenced yard would be most ideal), loves playing with his 50 pound active foster brother (but no small dogs, so probably no cats either). Also a big snuggler, Looking for a dog savvy foster home who can help work on some manners (pulling on leash, jumping etc) so no kids under 12 either. We are located in Ellicott City, Md, trying to set up this lovebug for success. We supply everything you might need to foster. If you think you can help us with Sparky, we would love to speak to you. 443-750-2833 or go to almosthomedogs.org and click on foster for application. PLEASE HELP US.

Please note-an application is required prior to any meet and greets.  There is no fee or obligation. Go to Almosthomedogs.org, click on \"Adopt\" tab at top

Because our dogs are in foster homes, applications are required prior to setting up any appointments.  Calling or emailing may delay your consideration.  Find our application on our website, almosthomedogs.org or click link below to find our application. https://docs.google.com/forms/d/12OTN3QBcNJEXlyQM0GzTMrb5ErkjpgWV3MiSlUP0L64/edit?ts=5a7f738f

Adoption Fee is $350. All dogs older than six months will be spayed/neutered prior to adoption. Dogs also have vaccines that are age appropriate, fecal check, treatment if needed, a vet physical, flea/tick treatment,  All of our dogs will be microchipped.

We are a non profit no kill 501 (c)3 rescue. Please understand that we do our best to describe our dogs but often we rescue them with virtually no information about them and often our best educated guess can be challenging. Currently check or cash is preferred payment.

name: Gus
description:
Gus is a sweet hound looking for his forever home! We were told he is 10years old however, he acts younger! Gus loves going on hikes with his foster family, has gone to the beach and played in the water and loves to play with other dogs.

The foster family does not have children. However, we believe Gus would do just fine around children, he has a great personality. He would also love a fenced yard to lounge in and also play ball! 

Gus is located in Dunkirk, MD. If interested in meeting Gus please complete an application at thehumanewayanimalrescue.org

name: Oscar
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.All of the animals posted on our site have been temperament tested. While not all are in the immediate area, once we have processed and approved your application, we will move the dog to our adoptive area for you to meet, greet and hopefully adopt. Sometimes we will have more than one application on a dog. That does not mean it automatically goes to another family but you should be aware of the fact that until you are approved and set up for the meet/greet.. the dog could get adopted by another applicant.NOTE- OSCAR IS LISTED AS A COURTESY FOR ANOTHER RESCUE ORGANIZATION. PLEASE SEE CONTACT INFO BELOW. Oscar is very good with people. He has only met other dogs through a fence so he will be slowly introduced to other dogs soon to get a better idea of how he does with them. He barks at them initially and then calms down but further dog testing will be needed after he is neutered. Oscar is a sweet boy that loves car rides and wants a family to call his own. He is unusually beautiful and appears to have been well taken care of. Oscar is located in Allegheny County, MD.
If you are interested in adopting Oscar, please contact:Missy MorganPhone: 240-979-7381

name: Scotch
description: Scotch came to us from Mecklenburg animal control weight in 51 pounds and 7 years old.  heartworm positive almost done with treatment.

name: Baron
description: Baron came to us from Mecklenburg animal control weight in 52 pounds and 4 years old. Very friendly

name: Xander
description:
Well, let me just say \"I am the greatest little dog you'll ever meet.\"  Della and I were in the Wayne County Dog Shelter.  It seems where we lived  was very filthy.  As a  matter of fact, the place was condemned and has since been demolished.   So we learned to walk on top of the furniture so we wouldn't get dirty.  I can actually fly from one piece to another. Well, my foster mom broke me of that.  But, get this:  I can talk!  When anything exciting comes along, I run and tell my mom.  She thinks it is cute, but little does she know I am actually talking to her and telling her what I saw. I get along with cats and other dogs and am mostly housebroken.
I'm a 4 year old boy who weighs only 19 pounds and my adoption fee is $150 fully vetted.
Save Ohio Strays does not have a shelter. Our animals are cared for in foster homes and the first step in our adoption process is to fill out an adoption application at the link on our website at:  www.saveohiostrays.org.  
Save Ohio Strays does NOT claim or guarantee any breeds given in this description.  These strays come from shelters so there is usually no further knowledge.  These are best guess descriptions for breed. SOS NEVER ships pets and will not adopt out to a driving radius greater than 3 hours from Medina, Ohio.

name: Honey
description:
My name is Honey and I'm just as sweet as my name.....and I have beautiful amber-colored eyes to match!  Iâm a boxer/pittie mix with a brindle pattern and I barely shed at all. I'm just over 1 year old and weigh about 60 lbs.  I have always looked at the bright side of life, even when I was just 10 months old, pregnant and homeless. I was still a very happy pup. I was blessed to be taken in by SOS where I was safely able to give birth to 8 beautiful and healthy puppies.  Now that theyâve all been adopted, I am hoping to find a wonderful forever home of my own.  I am great with kids (Iâve got natural mama instincts) but because of my size I'd do best with older, bigger kids. I'm young and still have a lot of puppy enthusiasm so I play too rough for little ones. I think other dogs are amazing to play with and  I'm a champion at Tug-O-War and fetch.  Iâll even bring my toys to share so that we can all have fun.  I am always up for a good snuggle.  Belly rubs and back scratches are appreciated as well.  I think cats are curious creatures. I love to chase and sniff them, but they never seem to understand I just want to play! Iâll leave them alone if you tell me to though.  I absolutely love, love, love to run (zoomies are the best!), but I could still use some work on leash training.  Iâve got places to go and trees to sniff!  But do you want to know whatâs even better than running?  Eating!  I havenât met a snack I didnât like... fruits, veggies, you name it!  And Iâll tell you a secret... Iâm willing to learn pretty much any trick in the book if youâre willing to share your burger with me!  I can be a bit skittish around loud noises like fireworks, thunder, big trucks, etc--- they can kind of freak me out.  But, during the last storm, my foster mom gave me a treat every time there was thunder and it didnât bother me so much after that.  Basically, if it involves food, Iâm up for anything!  Oh, and I almost forgot to mention I am completely house-trained as well.  I know I could be a perfect dog for your family; I bring a bit of extra sunshine wherever I go and Iâll love you unconditionally if you just give me the chance.  What do you say?  Is there room in your life for me?
My adoption fee is $150  fully vetted. 
Save Ohio Strays does not have a shelter. Our animals are cared for in foster homes and the first step in our adoption process is to fill out an adoption application at the link on our website at:  www.saveohiostrays.org.  
Save Ohio Strays does NOT claim or guarantee any breeds given in this description.  These strays come from shelters so there is usually no further knowledge.  These are best guess descriptions for breed. SOS NEVER ships pets and will not adopt out to a driving radius greater than 3 hours from Medina, Ohio.

name: Sammy
description:
Meet Sammie! He is a sweet, young boy that is full of energy. He loves going to the park, running, hiking and being outside. Sammie would spend all day playing fetch if he could. His favorite toys are volleyballs and soccer balls. Sammie has done well meeting and playing with other dogs and cats. He is crate trained and housebroken. Sammie is a smart boy and has done well learning simple commands and training. He will benefit from having a new owner that will continue to work with him and keep him active. After a walk, Sammie loves snuggling up on your lap, laying in the sun, or crawling under the covers for a nap. He is about a year old and the perfect size weighing between 35-40 lbs. With his energy level, he  can get rough when he plays and would not be a good match for young children. Sammie is a lovable boy and would be a great addition to an active family!
His adoption fee is $150  fully vetted. 
Save Ohio Strays does not have a shelter. Our animals are cared for in foster homes and the first step in our adoption process is to fill out an adoption application at the link on our website at:  www.saveohiostrays.org.

These are best guess descriptions for breed. SOS NEVER ships pets and will not adopt out to a driving radius greater than 3 hours from Medina, Ohio.

name: Manny
description: This is manny he is the one on the right in picture. He was saved from a high kill shelter in Memphis. Gets a long with dogs and kids

name: Banjo
description: This sweet boy is named Banjo! Banjo is around 2 years old. Very friendly and enjoys being in the car. Heâs leash trained and heâs good with other dogs. Weâre not sure about cats. He was rescued from Memphis, he was 12 hours from being put down. Heâs looking for his forever home! If your interested in adopting Banjo or have any questions please let us know!

name: Buffy
description: Buffy came to us from Van Buren county, Michigan. She is not yet available for adoption, awaiting a Rabies vaccination and spaying. She is a high energy and very playful girl. She would be best in a home without small children, but probably a great companion for teens and pre-teens. She is super loving and craves a good belly rub. Ask us about her timeline regarding adoption availabilty

name: Pending Copper-Cooper
description:
Please contact Monica R Larner (cowdogrescue@gmail.com), (989) 330-5147 for more information about this pet.8-16-19 Copper-Cooper comes into rescue as an owner surrender due to apartment management taking over the lease which does not allow dogs, is what I was told. His DOB is 9-6-18. He is a nice young man, who likes people and likes other dogs. Please Note: First, we ask that you fill out the adoption application if you are interested in one of our dogs. We can only answer questions about the adoption process, before the application. Then during the phone interview (step two of the application process) we can answer more questions based on what your application has on it. If you email questions without doing an application, we will not be able to give you a good answer. There are too many variables which we look at when matching up dogs. Thank you for helping us to help you, and ultimately help the dogs looking for the right home. Our adoption fee ($250) covers the age appropriate spay / neutering, heart worm testing, rabies, distemper combo, microchipping and any other necessary medical that a dog may need. Please consider a rescue that comes to you with all of the routine medical (and then some) already done.
Need to find the application? Please visit our new website at www.cowdogrescue.comhttp://australian-cattle.dog/?page_id=241

Contact Monica at (989) 330-5147, Director of AuCaDo Rescue, for questions about adoption process. If you are looking for a certain rescue, let me know, as we always have rescues waiting to come here.

description:

name: Pending ACD Annie GG
description:
Please contact Monica R Larner (cowdogrescue@gmail.com), (989) 330-5147 for more information about this pet.8-28-19 Annie has a pending adoption.6-25-19 Annie Green Gables comes into rescue as an owner surrender, due to long work hours after getting her from a farm. We are told that Annie is around 2 years old. She is really sweet and craves attention. She is a bit rude by jumping up and using her nails to get the attention, but we are working on some manners. She gets along with other dogs well. She does have a docked tail. Please Note: First, we ask that you fill out the adoption application if you are interested in one of our dogs. We can only answer questions about the adoption process, before the application. Then during the phone interview (step two of the application process) we can answer more questions based on what your application has on it. If you email questions without doing an application, we will not be able to give you a good answer. There are too many variables which we look at when matching up dogs. Our adoption fee ($250) covers the age appropriate spay / neutering, heart worm testing, rabies, distemper combo, microchipping and any other necessary medical that a dog may need. name: ACD Sr Rebel King HW+
description:
Please contact Monica R Larner (cowdogrescue@gmail.com), (989) 330-5147 for more information about this pet.Rebel will be coming back to rescue (we hope temporarily) to be HW treated. The Canadian adopter had until Christmas to get him back here for HW treatment, and has not returned him, and has had the adoption fee returned, since he is coming back. So the rescue has a breached adoption contract, no adoption fee, no proof / paperwork from the other vet, or Mr Rebel. Who does this, refuses to get his HW treatment done? (IF Rebel is HW positive, he came here that way.)Since he has not been returned to rescue, he is a stolen dog. 12-2-17 Rebel has a meet and greet scheduled. 8-8-17 Rebel King comes into rescue as Senior owner surrender. (Both are seniors) The reason given was that the vet would not put him down, and it was suggested that he give me a call. The only complaint was that the dog would sometimes circle-growl-nip at the owner when he poured his coffee in the morning, until the owner went to his office. We were told that he never did this with anyone else, and they had him since a puppy. No paperwork was given with him. name: ACD Flex
description:
Please contact Monica R Larner (cowdogrescue@gmail.com), (989) 330-5147 for more information about this pet.12-4-16 We received in Flex from someone who considered his release an emergency. Little did they remember that I had been contacted back in August of 2015 about him and did ask for him. However, they decided against it, even though they had already sent him intact to Canada to be a stud dog thru social media. (Poor Flex, he is very scared of his own shadow, so he must have been so very sad.)Fast forward to December 4, 2016 and it was explained that they had tried numerous times to rehome him and Flex would not take to anyone. Well, here we are....Flex is now between 2 and 3 and has been through some pretty horrible stuff. I can't even call it ignorance, since they did have an alternative over a year ago. I so wish I had him then. Flex will require a fenced in yard and quiet household where he can learn to trust again, at his own pace. He is NOT a bad dog, and with time and patience will be a faithful companion. Our adoption fee ($250) covers the age appropriate spay / neutering, heart worm testing, rabies, distemper combo, microchipping and any other necessary medical that a dog may need. Please consider a rescue that comes to you with all of the routine medical (and then some) already done.

name: ACD Mya is Deaf
description:
Please contact Monica R Larner (cowdogrescue@gmail.com), (989) 330-5147 for more information about this pet.
4-1-17 Returned to Rescue11-12-16 Pending Adoption10-29-16 Mya has a pending adoption. (Out of State)8-25-16 Mya is returned to rescue. 6-12-16 Mya has a pending adoption.
7-9-15 Mya comes into rescue as an owner surrender, due to her being deaf and finding out after the fact that she is three legged due to an injury at 3 months old which the breeder did not treat. The owner did not know she was deaf when she got her, supposedly. So then, the rescue only gets part of the story as well. Then the paperwork and x-rays are withheld. It seems that FHO surgery was done at 8 months old. Yet, it did not heal correctly and no rehab was done. So, at 14 months old, the rescue had the FHO Repair surgery done for her. Finding out the morning of the surgery, that she also has a luxating patella, grade 4, which (according to that particular vet) will also need repair after the hip is healed. The rescue had two more opinions, after her FHO surgery, and both of those vets (who we have previously worked with and trust more than the one(s) who did the surgery) agreed that taking off the knee cap and reattaching (because of the previous neglect) could make her unable to use her leg at all and make it worse. Therefore, we are opting to let her be the dog as she is very happy now. Our adoption fee ($250) covers the age appropriate spay / neutering, heart worm testing, rabies, distemper combo, microchipping and any other necessary medical that a dog may need. Please consider a rescue that comes to you with all of the routine medical (and then some) already done.

name: FOSTER Parents URGENTLY NEEDED!
description:
Somerset Cottage Poodle Rescue is URGENTLY seeking FOSTER parents  for the ever increasng number of dogs coming into our rescue.  We pay all expenses  including vetting and grooming.
We also offer a foister to adopt program on occasion if all our foster homes are full.  PLEASE NOTE:  We do NOT offer this option on dogs already in our foster homes,  no exceptions

We are located in Middleburg , Virginia  and do require our Foster's to be within a reasonable radius. If you are able to help please contact  Lesley 703-599-6018 for more information. Thank you

name: Mishka - Courtesy
description:
This is a courtesy post for a private owner, please contact them directly for more information.  
Male neutered 6 year old doberman.  Microchipped.  Rescued from Midland County November 2016 at age 3.  He is great with people of all ages (he sleeps with our 15 year old daughter or 13 year old son) BUT must be the only dog in the home.  He does do well with cats though.  If he has to go to the Vet's office he must be put on a short leash with a muzzle.  We have leashes, muzzle, harness, carrier that he sleeps in.  He is housebroken and if you are looking for a dog that you don't mind sharing a bed with, he's your dog.  He loves to be outside so a backyard with a fence would also be a must.  We will supply the new owner with his bowls for food as well.  

Our Contact information is:
Anne Bailey 989-529-2557
Dale Bailey 989-529-2556
abailey405@gmail.com

name: Roxie
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Roxie came in stray from Mifflin County. She had face full of porcupine quills. The owner was found and the she was surrendered. Roxie was adopted and went missing... only to be found 3 days later in the woods, porcupined again and very ill. She came back to ODAAT and has been in foster since. We were unsure what her future would hold. She had a bad leg injury that thankfully healed.
Roxie tolerates kids very well. She is extremely chill. A very relaxed, laid back girl
, she would probably do best in a home where she was able to be the Queen. She will attach herself to you immediately. She lays her head against your leg when standing and wants petted. She is most happy just to lay beside you. She loves to ride in the car and honestly... just be with you. We would not suggest cats for Roxie, but she LOVES stuffed animals. She acts like they are her babies.
The Perfect home we are looking for:
Family who wants a companion. A dog that will be dedicated thru and thru.
Family who has possibly one other dog that is laid back and does not care if they play.
Family who will give her all the affection and attention she so deserves.
Family that wants Roxie to be a part of their family. Her favorite place to be is on the sofa beside you... so if sofas are off limits... this girl is not for you.
If your home sounds like the perfect place for our girl, applications are available on our website www.onedogatatime.us.

name: Bowser
description:
Bowser is an active, friendly guy who has been bounced around far too much. He was origionally adopted from the Jefferson City facility, but ended up homeless in Millersburg. We took him in and found what we thought was a good forever home. Sadly, his new owner returned him to us for an act of very insignificant behavior, she didn't like.

One thing that has made it a little difficult to find Bowser another home is that he definitely does want to be the Alpha male, so there's a good possibility he wouldn't do well in a multi-dog household. He might, however, get along well, with one female, depending on her temperament.

Bowser's adoption fee includes his neuter, regular deworming, heart-worm testing, all vaccinations (Rabies is administered by a licensed veterinarian) and a microchip. For the specific amount of adoption fees or more detailed information, you will need to contact the Shelter directly please at 573 896-4049. Thanks for looking at Bowser.

name: Bella
description:
This is a courtesy post, please contact Mary Lou for more info/application: maryloumaria@yahoo.com

 My name is Bella, I'm located in Millis MA  and I am looking for someone to love and care for me furever! I am super sweet, affectionate, energetic, playful and I love toys. Snuggling and rubs from my human are my favorites. I smile constantly and bounce when I run. Itâs pretty cute! I know my basic commands by both voice and hand signal, but I still need some practice when outside of the house. I am VERY food motivated!

Fun Facts

â¢	About 5 yrs old

â¢	A sturdy 65 lbs

â¢	Super soft fur and ears

â¢	Great smile

â¢	Healthy, Vaccinated

â¢	Spayed

â¢	Microchipped

â¢	House trained

â¢	Crate Trained

I am hoping to meet my soul mate soon! I love to be outside so a home with a yard, preferably fenced in, would be perfect for me. Something else you should know - I like a small circle of dog friends and am selective about them.  I do currently live with 2 older bigger brothers and we are great pals.  I love other dogs, but my preference is dogs bigger than myself, and slow introductions are best!  I love people-not selective at all about them.  So what do you say??  Go ahead, fill out an app and hope to meet you soon.

For an application, please email Mary Lou at maryloumaria@yahoo.com

name: Rusty
description:
Courtesy Post. Please contact Mary Lou for an application at maryloumaria@yahoo.com 
 
Rusty is 3-4yrs old, weighs 50lbs and is located in Milton MA. He has  lived with kids as young as two and cats. He enjoys an active life with pack walks and doggie day care fun. And he is also happy hanging out and relaxing too!!. He has never met a person he didn't like. He enjoys good dog friendships but can be reactive on leash and takes his job of protecting the house from other dogs seriously,  So he needs a fenced-in yard.  An electric fence will not do .  He would enjoy a home with another dog to take the pressure off of having to protect it from all of those other dogs.  A  home that does not have many other dogs walking by would be good too..
So if you are looking for a great dog, good with kids, good with cats, good with other dogs  and enjoys life and you have a fenced-in yard and would expose Rusty to other dogs in the way he needs, 

Please email Mary Lou at maryloumaria@yahoo.com for an application.

name: Nubia (Foster Home Needed)
description:
* FOSTER HOME NEEDED - NO OTHER DOG IS A MUST * Nubia came from a free roaming hoarding situation near Mina, Nevada 2013. She is around 8 years old. Nubia is very shy around people but is learning to trust. Nubia had little early socialization and not a dog you can take out and about but more of a home body girl. She just needs someone who will just be soft and kind with her, patient owner is needed to help her learn to trust humans. Nubia walks well on leash and loves to run off lead with her current mentor, Phoenix.  Nubia needs time and patience in a home environment as she has never had a home.

** PROJECT DOG** 
For more information on Nubia, or to request an adoption application, call 775-463-1842 or email barkdogsinfo@gmail.com. Nubia is spayed, micro-chipped and current on her vaccinations.

name: Junebug
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Name: Junebug

DOB: 11/7/2010

Weight: 75 lbs

Adoption Fee: $125

June Bug is a sweet senior and around 9 years old. She is an English Setter mix, weigh about 75 lbs. Do not let her age fool you, she is full of energy and would love for her forever home to have a big yard and humans with lots of time for walks and playtime. She will hop around like a rabbit when she thinks it is time to play, going for a car ride, waiting for her food, or when you are getting ready for a walk. If you tell her to sit, she will patiently wait for you. I have not heard her bark yet, even when somebody has pulled into the driveway or is knocking at the door. June loves to play fetch, play with toys, getting a good belly scratch, and just hanging out. June's perfect day would be taking a walk or playing in the yard, coming in for a treat and scratches, taking a nap, and doing it all over again. She does currently live peacefully alongside cats, kids and other dogs but would also be fine being the only dog.

She has a heart of gold and there is no doubt in my mind that she will make a wonderful companion to her new owner. She is highly intelligent, and has completed dog training (sit, wait, down, shake, and many more commands), crate trained, respectful during car rides, fully potty trained and will do just about anything for a good treat. She will not jump up on furniture without being told \"ok\". Who can help me find my forever home?

An adoption application is the best way to show your interest in an animal. Once we receive your application, a placement coordinator will be in contact with you as soon as possible. Please check out our website, www.ruffstartrescue.org for more details and additional pictures on any of our animals! Ruff Start Rescue is a foster based rescue. Animals are located in homes throughout Minnesota. We do not have a facility where animals are kept. Hi There! My name is Tanner and I am looking for my forever family. I am just a little guy who has had a \"ruff start\" but I am excited about life! I came to my foster home with my sister when our mom could no longer care for us at 4 weeks old. I have been learning all about how to be a good boy. Since i'm still a baby I am working hard on this potty training business and sleeping quietly in my kennel. My foster mom says that I have a super sweet personality. I am pretty chill for a puppy and enjoy being a couch potato sometimes. I live with two little girls and LOVE to play outside with them and go on adventures. We also have a BIG furry foster brother who we are obsessed with a love to climb all over him and play tug of war with him. He's teaching us how to be good dogs. I am doing really well walking on a leash too. I would love to meet you and see if I'd be a good fit for your family, just submit an application and my mom with contact you! description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.

Hi there! My name is Ivy. I was found as an unclaimed stray right here in Minnesota. I am looking for someone to follow around and keep company. Im calm, sweet and lazy. My foster mom also says I might be a little overweight too and put me on a diet. I do well with dogs but not cats. I don't need to be kenneled, I promise I won't wreck anything when you are gone, but I do prefer you to not be away too long. I go potty outside, and bark at the door when I am done. I dont care to go on crazy adventures, I prefer to lay around all day and keep my eye on you. Ill keep an eye on the kids too, I'm very gentle with them. Oh, and if you have a home without lots of stairs I would like that best, im an older gal and a little chunky so that might be difficult for me.

name: Starlord
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Name: Starlord
DOB: 8/14/18
Weight: 55
Adoption Fee: $375

Theo is a handsome young lab/husky/shepard mix. He is very protective of his family and therefore can be cautious around new people. He is a big boy, 55 pounds of long lean muscle. He is very strong and will jump up to greet you, so probably no small children. Theo is still very much a puppy and loves chewing (don't trust him with your shoes), running, playing tug, and having a good snuggle. He loves to play and roughhouse with dogs his size and larger. He's probably too much for smaller or older playmates. He has lived with dog savvy cats but will give chase if motivated. Theo requires a fenced in yard to get out all of his energy. He can jump over a 4-foot baby gate and is somewhat of an escape artist so you'll want to keep an eye on him. He doesn't mind sleeping in a crate but can break out if he's bored. He loves going on walks but pulls at the leash, so he could use some training in that department. He does better with a harness and would make an excellent running partner. He is completely housebroken and never has any accidents. He knows the commands sit, down, stay, and off.

name: Rocko
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Name: Rocko
DOB: 3/15/2018
Weight: 10
Adoption Fee: $400

Hi, my name is Rocko and I just joined my foster family (I am sitting in my foster mom's lap as she writes this!) I am a super sweet, constant shadow of a lap dog. I love giving kisses! I start off a little shy at first, but it takes me just a few minutes to warm up to my person; treats help! I pick a person but if they aren't home, I pick my second person, and so on. I would love to find a family of my own soon!

My foster home has dogs and cats, and I get along with everyone. I am very persistent to be on my person's lap so I should be the only lap dog in your home. I really like the bigger dog best. The dog my size is bossy and I don't like drama.

I love all people but the very young little people make me nervous if they go too quickly at me. I am very gentle with children but I will need adult supervision around the little people to make sure they go slow and are gentle with me. I am just a little guy so I scare somewhat easy and when I am scared, I growl and bark, which scares kids and I don't want the little kids to be afraid of me.

POTTY TRAINED: Schedule trained. I do my business right away outside. I am also wearing a bellyband because the other dogs in the home need to know I am here too! My foster mom says when I am consistently dry, I can take it off.

CRATE: I am learning to like my crate! It's my safe place and I get a lot of treats when I go in there! I will whine and bark for a few minutes until I can't hear you anymore and then I sit quietly or go to sleep. I am quiet when I hear you walk in the door, silently anticipating being reunited with you again! I am sleeping in my crate at night but I would much prefer sleeping with my person in a comfy bed.

CUTE QUIRKS: I love to burrow in blankets when I want to sleep :)

IDEAL HOME: Single family home as Rocko is pretty vocal in his crate at first. He gets loud for such a small dog so shared walls wouldn't work for this little guy. Someone who is home most of the time would be best for him. He gets very sad without his person. A family with older kids or a person/couple with grandchildren 5+ would be a great fit for him. He is very gentle with all children but should be supervised with children 5 and under if grandchildren are visiting.

In the meantime if you have questions or are interested in me, please fill out an adoption application at www.ruffstartrescue.org.

name: Owen
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Name: Owen DOB: 2014 Weight: 10lbs Adoption Fee: $375

Psssst! It's me, Owen! I'm the cutest little dog who is looking for my match!

Could it be you? Let's see... Are you a little cautious when meeting new people? Me too!! I don't know about you, but when I'm given some time to warm up & trust you, I will jump into your arms, hang on tight, and snuggle right in. Then we can go for adventurous walks, lovely Sunday drives, or hang out for a night of net-flixing together! I will give you kisses, wait patiently when you're busy, and be there for YOU at the end of a long day.

Ideally, I'd fit in perfect in a quieter home with less commotion. More submissive type dogs are A-OK as long as I can have a little space when I need it. I'd probably do fine with cats, too. I enjoy older, respectful kids who want to read to me or cuddle up & watch a show. I'd prefer to sleep in my human's bed but I can adjust to a crate, too. Do you think you could take a chance to get to know me? Then apply to meet me today! I can't wait!! YOU could be my match!!
