name: Khan
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Name: Khan
DOB: 01/01/2019
Weight: 45 lbs
Adoption Fee: $400

I'm Khan , a good boy who loves to be active!

My fosters say I'm super soft and love-able. I absolutely love my people! In fact, I sometimes feel magnetized to them and will follow them around the house because I really love their cuddles, pets, treats and reassurance. I am the best combination of couch potato and play buddy!

I love to play fetch and am quite fast!

I don't like being kept in a kennel - I love my freedom! But can be in my kennel from time to time when needed. I am pretty antsy to get out as soon as I hear any commotion in the house prompting me to let me know that my crew is home.

When it comes to new dogs, I could use a bit of a slow introduction to them so that we can get acclimated to each other. I do love to go to the dog park and hanging out with new friends in a neutral territory. However, being an only dog in my previous home, I'm still trying to figure out how to have friends in the same house and may not know how to play and/or initiate play without coming off the wrong way. This awkwardness is getting better as I learn more about my foster fur sibings!

I've been in a family my whole life and looking to continue that family life with a family who will love me a ton! I lived with kiddos in my past life and was recommended to stick to older kiddos as I can get a bit jumpy and also love to do zoomies which can get a little intimidating for a little one. I did spend most of my time with kiddos though and I absolutely love them!

I'm house trained, can sit on command (with treats available!) and am learning to lay down on command. My fosters say I'm smart and want someone who can continue helping me out with this whole training thing. I am very food motivated and eager to please so with enough structure, I will become the best I can be!

My biggest weakness; however, is the darn car. (I don't get how some dogs get excited about this.) I can get motion sickness easily so will often drool more than normal during the car rides to ease my anxiety with these darn tin mobiles. This subsides as soon as we stop and am able to see our destination. My foster parents have learned to just bring a familiar blanket for the car to lay on and an extra towel so I can dry off quicker.

I look forward meeting you and giving you all the kisses. Adopt me? :)

In the meantime if you have questions or are interested in me, please fill out an adoption application at www.ruffstartrescue.org.

name: Angell
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.

Hello,

Hey, it's me- Angell! I'm a 7 year old female rat terrier and I'm sweet as cherry pie! I am adjusting well in my new foster home. Though I didn't think I'd find myself in this situation, I'm doing A-OK! You see, I had a home, but I couldn't go with when my family moved.

I've been told by my foster family that I'm making quick adjustments. I love all of my foster fur siblings and my human kid siblings, too! I do best with smaller dogs if I have an option. And, since I can be a little afraid of loud noises and quick movements, I'd do best with kids 8 and up! I love to play twister with my human foster sister, & family game night is my absolute favorite! I enjoy hanging with my humans whenever I can. Don't get me wrong though, I have been doing just fine at home when it's only me & my fur siblings. Foster mom lets me stay out of the crate when she leaves, and I'm told I've been very well behaved. I do use a crate at night and hardly make a peep. If I had it my way though, I'd choose to sleep with a human while snuggled up & covered in warm toasty blankets.

I'm learning how to \"get down\" and \"sit\" quickly! Shhh, don't tell my foster mom. I already knew those commands before I came. I'm developing more and more self confidence every day, which is helping me so I don't get so excited and urinate a little at your feet. Oops, I hate when I do that!! I do know how to go outside to potty, and a schedule without long periods helps me stay on track. I know I can get there. I just need someone to trust in me and help me develop my strong side!

I've been told I'm an absolute sweetheart. I love meeting new people and exploring the land on leashed walks. Car rides are a plus especially if we stop for a yummy treat! I'm not a picky eater but I might have some food allergies so my foster mom might recommend a special food. It's no biggie though!

I hope you'll take a chance on me. In no time, I will give you a big kiss and you'll see from my soulful eyes, how grateful I am you chose me!

If you have questions or are interested in me, please fill out an adoption application at www.ruffstartrescue.org. An adoption application is the best way to show your interest in an animal. Please check out our website, www.ruffstartrescue.org for more details and additional pictures on any of our animals! name: Jack Black
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Name: Jack Black DOB: September 2018 Weight: 50lbs Adoption Fee: $375

Hi! My name is Jack, but my foster mom renamed me to Kai and I'm still learning my name either way. I'm happy to be at my new foster home and am excited to find a forever home. I love to play with stuffed squeaky toys, and will bring them out and toss them around. My foster mom gave up picking them up because I just get them right back out again. There's another dog here too, she's cool. We play together and sometimes wrestle. I wish she would play with the toys with me but she doesn't much, but that's okay. There's two small people here too, they are about my height. I'm gentle and patient around them, but I get a little nervous when I'm sleeping.

I LOVE squirrels, they say I'm obsessed. They just look like lots of fun to chase. There is a cat here too, he keeps his distance from me, but I get really excited when I see him. I cry, bark, and whine; it makes my foster mom nervous I think. I would probably do best in a house that doesn't have cats, or with a very patient one and a family that would take LOTS of time with a slow introduction. There was also a small dog here for a few days when I first got here, I did okay with him. I'm just big and don't really know my size. I didn't hurt him or try to hurt him. We got along well enough. I'm not much for snuggles, but when I get tired I do sometimes lay next to my foster mom on the couch.

When I especially want attention I will go rest my head on my foster mom's lap and she will give me pets, when she stops I just flip her hand back on my head for more... it seems to work well.

I like to go for walks, but I tend to pull really hard. My foster mom put on an Easy Walk harness on me, and that slows me down some. She says I walk better with it on. I could use some training for manners, like sit, heel, come, stay, etc. My foster mom is trying and she started using a clicker with me with treats and when I'm in the house I love treats and like to practice with the clicker. When we are walking though, I don't care for treats, I just want to run or walk fast.

My family is at work all day so I'm in a kennel which is okay. I think I like the resident dogs kennel better as she has pillows, a super soft pad, and is covered with a blanket...it's kind of like a den.

I can't wait to find my forever family. Will you be my family? I'm good with kids, all dogs, and I might be able to learn to ignore cats. I like to be outside, and I think I'm going to like this cooler weather come a lot!

In the meantime if you have questions or are interested in me, please fill out an adoption application at www.ruffstartrescue.org.

name: Maggie
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Name: Maggie
DOB: 01/20/2015
Weight: 52lbs
Adoption Fee: $350

Hi everyone, my name is Maggie and I am a 4.5 year old pitbull. I'm a little girl that loves going for car rides and being with my humans. I love to give kisses to my humans. Something else I love? TOYS! I love toys, especially tennis balls. I do like to chew on them and sometimes they break, but I am learning how to be more gentle with them. I am crate and potty trained. I don't mind sleeping in my kennel and I even know the word. I like to go on walks, but because I'm so excited and a strong little girl, a harness works the best for me. Sometimes I need to take a break on the walk and flip down and scratch my back on the grass. My foster parents think it's pretty cute. I have a really big smile. When I'm happy you will know it because I tend to snort. I also love car rides and snuggling on the couch. You might have to help me up since I'm so short. I get along with dogs with slow introductions. I get excited seeing other dogs and my foster parents are working with me on this. I like to try and chase the squirrels so a home without little animals would be best for me. I am food motivated and already know tricks such as sit, stay, drop, and paw. I'm learning come and lay down and am doing a good job. If you love kisses, a cute smile, and an already trained doggy, then I'm your girl!

name: Doorknob
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Name:Doorknob
DOB:06/03/2015
Weight: 15
Adoption Fee: $125

Hi there! My name is Doorknob but my foster family actually calls me Doorbell, silly huh? I can be a little distant with new people at first, but if you just give me some time I will be your partner in crime in no time at all! I am potty trained on a schedule, and crate trained if lead by a leash, score! I do really well with other doggy friends but sometimes prefer to just lounge around and coexist with them.I also live with a couple of these things called \"cats\" in my foster home and do very well with them. When I was first rescued down in Louisiana,I lived with lots of other chi's in a home that had a fire. However, I came in well fed (maybe a little too well;)). I currently am fed in the morning and at supper time with the correct amount of food per the instructions on the bag. I am happy to say that I've been living a much healthier lifestyle these days and have shed most of my extra pounds after a lot of dieting and hard work! I am fed next to two of my fosters dogs and have been known to try and take their meals when they are not looking. My foster mom makes sure we all eat out of our own bowls so I go and pout until she says potty outside. Those words are my favorite because we all run for the door. I do better off leash and going to the potty so if you have a fence that is a bonus for both of us. I will go potty while on a leash too. I just prefer to run to the door and go straight out side. My foster will be trying a lead in her back yard, come spring time (if I am still here) and she thinks I will do well on that because I will get to choose where I go potty. I have quirks due to my past but am able to live with my foster mom and three human foster siblings ages 15 to 7 without issues. I taught them everything they know on how to take care of me so I feel safe. The fosters know my cues and are working with me everyday to get better and better at being a dog. I do love my blankets and do not like people taking them from me but will share with you once I get to know you and you have the right moves :) I do love to snuggle on my terms (when I want it). I am not fond of being picked up like a baby but my foster mom can show you how to pick me up the way I like it. I have been known to bug my fosters for pets and give them some kisses. My big human foster sister loves to sweep and I cannot stand the broom so I go to my kennel for cleaning time. I can be very playful when I'm in the mood to be and am also known to tell a good story or two (bark) while doing it or of course if that doorbell rings. If I am not in the mood I am usually on my blanket or yours. If you are good at reading dog cues and willing to give me some love and patience I would really like you to fill out an application for me. I really hope to have a family of my own, could that be you?

In the meantime if you have questions or are interested in me, please fill out an adoption application at www.ruffstartrescue.org.

name: Buddee
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Name: Buddee
DOB: 7/11/2019
Weight: 10 pounds
Adoption Fee: $450

Hello,

My name is Buddee because I am my foster moms side kick. I am a little shy yet, so I really don't leave her side unless her daughters take me and cuddle with me. I just love to sit on their laps and get all the love I can and take my naps there every chance I can. I came to Minnesota with a bee sting and so I didn't feel good the first few days but my foster family took good care of me and now I am all better and playing like a puppy again. Tennis balls and crinkly toys are my favorite. I am still learning how to stand up to my sister who just takes everything from me. My foster mom says I need to stand up for myself, especially when it comes to breakfast, she try's to take my food. . I didn't know what love was until last week when I got to Minnesota and wow, is life good. My dog bed is so soft and comfy. My foster mom say I will have a family that will love me and spoil me, cause I deserve so much. I can't wait to meet them, she says I will win them over as I have the biggest sad puppy eyes and I can do no wrong. Well until I found the snack bin in her pantry and boy did those beef sticks smell amazing!
I can't wait to meet my fur ever family

XOXOX

Buddee

description:

Hello there, I'm Gemma. I am so easy going and gentle. I just had puppies so I'm a little exhausted but I still love going to short walks! name: Eggroll
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Name: Eggroll
DOB: 7/24/2015
Weight: 12 lbs
Adoption Fee: $375

Eggroll (aka eggie) is an active little boy. He loves to play and loves his toys. He is good around other small dogs who like to play as well as big dogs who like to play . No children would be the best fit for him or older respectful kids. He likes to cuddle on his own terms. He can be protective of food so when feeding him he should be seperated from other pets and people. He has a spunky personality and deserves to have a good home where he can be spoiled and loved by a patient owner.

Eggroll is heartworm positive. He will need to be treated at one of the fabulous clinics Ruff Start works with in St Cloud or Duluth. Heartworm treatment consists of 3 injections in the pups back. Eggroll's first injection will be in roughly 30 days and the 2nd and 3rd injections happen 30 days after that. When a dog is going through heartworm treatment, they should be on \"restrictions\" meaning a lot of lap time, crate time and always on a leash. Heartworm disease is NOT contagious, it is transported via mosquitos.

If you have questions or are interested in me, please fill out an adoption application at www.ruffstartrescue.org.

description:

Weight: 25lbs
Adoption Fee: $450

Hey! I'm Bridger. I've been told by my foster mama that I'm a sweetheart. I'm kennel trained and potty trained and love playing with toys (especially my peanut butter-filled Kong!) I really like running around in the yard with my two foster brothers (70lb American Foxhound and 40lb Sheltie), which is good since I'm a working breed dog and need to keep my feet (and mind) busy (in addition to being good with other dogs, I'm also friendly with cats). I am still a puppy and have tons of energy and like to do zoomies in the yard or sometimes in the house. My favorite thing in the world is food. I love it all and sometimes try to steal my human's food from their platesI'm working on improving my manners. I'm also working on not jumping up on people when I first meet them - my mom says I'm getting much better at this. I get along pretty well with the toddler in the house, but sometimes I don't know how big I am and knock her down. While I know I have things to learn, my mom says I'm smart and food-motivated, so I should pick things up quickly. My nickname around the house is Shadow since I follow my mom around everywhere - I just love being with my people and getting pets! If you have questions or are interested in me, please fill out an adoption application at www.ruffstartrescue.org.

name: Shilo
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Name: Shilo
DOB: 5/2/2009
Weight: 50lbs
Adoption Fee: $125

Hello, I am Shilo. I am a sweet older gal with LOTS of spring in my step. I really enjoy the outdoors and going for regular walks with my humans. I also love pets. In fact, I love them so much I will nudge your hand with my snout and toss your arm over my head so you get the idea that petting needs to happen. Sometimes even when you are napping I will wander over and lick your face to let you know it's time for pets. I do also like daily hugs from my people. I am a little bit of a space invader at times. I can't help it, I just think people are really great.

Along with my love for human companionship, I also appear to be cat and dog friendly. Although I must admit I am not always willing to share my things with other four-leggeds in the house. I am pretty quiet, but occasionally I will bark to let you know someone is at the door. I will also bark for a minute if you leave me home instead of letting me come along for a car ride. I am potty-trained and can be left alone to roam the house. I am also good in the car and walk nicely on a leash. I do know the commands of sit, down, come, and shake.

Even though I am a little older, I appear to be in great health. I have a little muscle loss in my lower back but this does not seem to bother me and it does not slow me down one bit. The vet just recommended some joint supplements to keep me feeling my best. My foster family says that I am super sweet, and have the prettiest teeth and fur around. Seriously, no doggy breath! Overall, I think I would get along well in just about any home, but may do best with older kids only because some of that young kiddo energy may be a little overwhelming. I am pretty furrbulous and am searching for the perfect family to call my own.

Please fill out an application today so we can get more acquainted.

name: Linden
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Name: Linden
DOB: 04/10/2017
Weight: 30bs
Adoption Fee: $350

Hi! Hi there! HI!

My name is Linden (but mostly I go by Louie) and I'm the bestest good boy (or so I'm told). I'm looking for my furever home so here's a little bit about me:

-I've been treated for heart-worm already (I'm glad that's all done)

-I DO NOT like being in a crate. It's a no from me. I do well just being loose in the house with my puzzle ball or a toy to play with while you're gone.

-Everyone tells me I have the most beautiful blue and brown eyes (especially the girls at PetSmart)

-I LOVE to run around and frequently get the \"zoomies\" which makes my foster mom laugh because my little legs go really really fast!

-I love to nap with my fellow dog roommate and show off my frog legs

-I'm slowly but surely getting used to adult men (sometimes I get nervous and bark so I just need you to tell me it's ok and introduce me slowly then I'll trust them and we'll be best friends)

-I have mini humans that I adore and that are my bestest friends who call me \"Lou\" (I know how to be VERY patient with them because they're little)

-I'm very smart and need someone that is willing to continue to work with me because I'm still learning these things called \"manners\" (who knew not everyone likes to be jumped on?)

-I'm still working on not \"marking\" in the house and need little reminders every now and then because I still seem to think one corner of the wall needs to be watered occasionally..

-I need a fenced in yard to run in not only for my zoomies but because although I'm a good boy, I sometimes get loose and want to go on adventures by myself and my foster mom really doesn't like that....

-And above all, I need someone who will continue to love me for the goofy, meatball, love-bug that I am!

*Linden was recently treated for heartworm*

In the meantime if you have questions or are interested in me, please fill out an adoption application at www.ruffstartrescue.org.

name: Penelope
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Name: Penelope
DOB: 7/24/2017
Weight: 31 lbs
Adoption Fee: $375

Hi! I'm Penelope! My foster mom calls me Pretty Penelope because I prance when I walk and I love it when she brushes me. I am a bit scared of the big city. I get anxious when cars drive by, especially buses, and sometimes the people on bikes startle me and I bark at them. I think I would like it better in a quieter neighborhood with less distractions. I do walk well on a leash, except when I see a squirrel or a rabbit. I just get so excited and I might pull hard, but I am working on that! My foster mom says I'm doing great and she even gives me treats when I pass by a squirrel without trying to chase it. I will chase a cat too, so probably best if I am in a home without those. I would love it in a fenced yard where I could run some more and stay outside for longer and just be my goofy self! Overall, I am just not understanding the apartment life and I don't think it is for me.

I am very shy and meeting new people is tough for me, so with that being said, I will need a family that is willing to be patient with me and help me build up my confidence! I might bark when people come into the house but I calm down when they make themselves small and sit on the floor with me. I like to follow my foster mom around, and I always need to know where she is and what she is doing. I like to lay in my crate, but I don't like it when the door is closed for too long, I might bark a lot and try to get out. My foster mom leaves me out now when she goes to work and I do just fine! I do a happy dance and wag my tail in half when she gets home. I can be alone as long as I have things to stimulate me - I love to have the music on and I love to find toys and treats that my foster mom hides for me. I do well with smaller dogs but can get scared of big dogs and I will need slow introductions to them. Sometimes I play a little too rambunctiously (working on that too!), so I will also need practice being around any small children.

Whenever I am scared, or just too overwhelmed, my foster mom pets me for a while and tells me it is ok and I feel better. I think this is why they say all you need is love! I know I will be such a happy girl when I am settled and I want nothing more than to learn to trust again and to be your companion for life.

If you have questions or are interested in me, please fill out an adoption application at www.ruffstartrescue.org.

name: Sawyer
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Name: Sawyer
DOB: March 2018
Weight: 50lbs
Adoption Fee: $350

Sawyer is a typical happy, curious Pitbull tween. Just over a year old, he has all muscles and a puppy brain. He is silly and playful, he loves shaking and squeaking toys. He is strong with a short attention span. He tries to obey; He has been through basic obedience, he knows Sit, Down, Stay and Kennel but he is very easily distracted. If you are working with him and giving him directions he tries to please you. If you blink, he is looking for the next adventure.

He likes people and after a good outing, walk, or game of chase, he would like lay on the couch with you. Sawyer likes other dogs. He lives with three different dogs; he is respectful of the older, crabby dog. He tries to get the shy dog to play. And he plays and wrestles hard with the other large pup in the house.

He is curious about the cat but not obsessed. He sleeps in his crate and likes going for walks. He likes to swim and fetch in the water but he sinks like a rock and would benefit from a lifejacket.

Though he is still learning (he is impulsive), he is good natured and not aggressive. Sawyer is a joyful, powerful, goofball who would excel with continued obedience training and positive directions from the humans.

In the meantime if you have questions or are interested in me, please fill out an adoption application at www.ruffstartrescue.org.

Hi my name is Zoe and I am a former Ruff Start Rescue dog who was returned due to no fault of my own. I am a older dog, eyes alittle cloudy, hearing not so hot, move kinda slow, but I do like to go for walks, just like to take my time. Sniffing is very important. I would be a perfect candidate for a senior to adopt me. I am very sweet, like people and other dogs, there is a cat at my foster's house, which I have never bothered. My foster mom and dad have taken me to the park, and I am a great car rider, just need to be helped in and out of the car. I am a quiet dog(soft barker), have a low key personality, house broken, will sleep with you on your bed or in a dog bed on the floor, if on the floor, I like a bed that is really cushy. Mealtime is one of my favorites, treats a must, chewies are good, but toys are not too interesting. Oh, and I like a good scratching and plenty of hugs and kisses. A fenced yard would be great, since my vision and hearing are not the best and sometimes I don't pay attention to where I am going. Oh, and another good thing, Ruff Start Rescue is getting my teeth cleaned. How great is that!

description:

DOB: 09/01/2018 (best estimate)
Weight: 30 lbs
Adoption Fee: $450

Meet Bessie! When she originally came in, we thought she was about 6 months old but after a recent check up with the vet, they mentioned that she is likely closer to 1 year. She is 90% potty trained. Shy around new people but will warm up to you with patience. She is Not a fan of the busy city life, definitely does better in a more quiet environment. Gets along great with all dogs, and she finds other dogs help her build her confidence as well. Loves being outside amd going on adventures in the country. She has a prey drive and could be a good hunting buddy with some training. Still in the chewing stage but she is your typical lab puppy I find her smart and a quick learner just needs some training. She will cuddle on the couch with you and lay around the house when not a lot going on. She is kenneled trained. This little girl is in need of someone who can show her what love and patience is for she has had a rough start but such a sweetheart.

name: Donnie
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Name: Donnie
DOB: 2/05/17
Weight: 50#
Adoption Fee: $350

Donnie was found on the side of the road on the Pine Ridge Reservation this past winter. He had been trying to make it on his own for far too long in the extreme cold temperatures and was picked up as a popsicle! He was treated for hypothermia and is now safe and warm in his foster home. He is about 50 pounds, our guess is that he is about 2 years old, as he has pearly white teeth. He is the sweetest boy ever. Despite his big head and large size, he fully commits to being a lap dog! He LOVES to cuddle with you on the couch. He is gentle to kids of all ages and gets along with dogs of all shapes and sizes. He really is just a total lover and does not have a mean bone in his body. He took a bath without making a fuss and gets right into his kennel when asked to. He just wants to please you and hear you tell him, \"he is such a good boy\". He is learning about life inside a home and also working his potty training. He loves treats and will be easy to train as he is food motivated. He has already learned that when he hears the fridge door open, he may get cheese if he sits really nice and waits. Donnie really is an all-around awesome dog, with so much love to share.

After lots and lots of tests... Donnie has a diagnosis. He has Reflex Dysnergia. meaning his urethra does not relax at the same time that his bladder contracts, making urination and emptying his bladder impossible at times. Having had this condition for so long his bladder has become distended and 4X larger than it should be. He will require catheterization likely a few times a month to drain his bladder. I did it last night (I'm totally not a vet)... he lays so still and knows relief is coming.

There has to be a home for him? Someone who can manage his condition? He's such a sweet boy!

In the meantime if you have questions or are interested in me, please fill out an adoption application at www.ruffstartrescue.org.

description:

DOB: 7/24/2011

name: Winston* Bonded with Ellie*
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Name: Winston
DOB:6/24/2009
Weight: 14
Adoption Fee: $125.00

Sir Winston, as his foster refers to him as, is the cutest little guy with a cute little under bite. Winston is a happy little guy that loves to be kissed on his head, to be held and told he's a good boy. Winston loves to watch out the window, he will bark when he see's something that interests him outside but mostly he just loves to sit quietly looking out. Winston loves to have his own place to lay, loves adventures and loves to cuddle. You can't help but smile when looking at his little face filled with character. Winston is interested in the cats here, he is respectful, but he does like to play with them. He's super smart and is so fun to have around.

Ellie and Winston are bonded, where one goes, the other follows, they are in love and watch out for each other, and will only be adopted together. Neither dogs would be good in an apartment setting, they do bark when they hear a noise outside and when they get excited, which we're working on, outside of that, they're pretty quiet. Both dogs do really well being groomed and actually enjoy it. They are both sweet hearts and they're a joy to be around. They're looking for a quiet retirement home, with a person/people that enjoy walks and just hanging out. They ride great in the car, so they'd be good little travel buddies. Both dogs are good with all animals and people and both are potty trained. Winston may initially try to \"mark\" as he did when I first got him, but he quickly learned not to, using the word \"NO\" when caught in the act consistently, that, that is not ok and has stopped in the house. These 2 are little treasures and are a joy to have a round

name: Bindi
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.

biName: Bindi
DOB: 04/12/18
Weight: 45 lbs
Adoption Fee: $350

Bindi is an adventurous spirit who would love to find someone to explore the world with!

A good-natured, playful, friendly young adult dog, she likes going for walks and is athletic despite some injuries to her hindquarters early in her life. Bindi has been seen by a neurologist, who informs us that she may have had injuries near her tail. She can feel her legs and has good muscle tone but will need to wear diapers for life. Her foster home is working with simple exercises and stretches, and Bindi is also taking proin to help her build strong bladder muscles. Her perfect family will be home most of the time, will be prepared to continue working with her, and won't be overwhelmed by her diapers. Bindi lives in a foster home with two other dogs. She wrestles with her foster brother all day and is very bonded to him although doesn't always like to share her toys. She would love to have a dog companion in her new home. A home without cats would be best, and because she is a herding dog, a home without small children would be best, too. Bindi travels well kenneled in the car and is learning all sorts of new things, like sit and down and jumping onto things (to help build strong muscles). If you have an active family who likes outdoor activities, Bindi may be the perfect dog to share your life with.

name: Jera
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Name: Jera
DOB: December 2018
Weight: 35lbs
Adoption Fee: $400

My name is Jera and I just joined my foster family about a month ago so they are still learning a few things about me. I'm definitely on the shy side of the spectrum. You might say I'm a wallflower. I had a best friend in the shelter and she was a very brave dog who I could trust to lead me to nice people. Now in my foster home it's clear that I'm absolutely amazing with dogs, from the boss lady to the 60 pound dopey male, to the fun-police chihuahua. Im still shy with people, especially new people, but if my canine friends race up to greet new people I'm sure to follow. Sometimes I even give new people kisses. My perfect forever family would include at least one other confident social dog that I can learn from, a quiet home with adults or older teens only, walks with my family, and lots of time lounging outside in the sun or shade. My new family will just need to be careful to never let me escape through a door or gate off leash because once alone they may not convince me to come back right away just because new situations are scary. With time, experience meeting nice people, and patience, I know I can learn to be brave. Sometimes I get brave enough to sleep on my foster mom's lap already. I'm very quiet in my kennel, share things with dogs and people nicely, give gentle kisses, and am currently working on understanding this word \"sit\". My favorite things are walks and playtime with other dogs. I'm a quiet shy girl, so I might not be for everyone, but my foster mom says that for the right family I will be the perfect love of their life because I'm the sweetest little girl who never does anything bad. As they learn new things about me they will fill out more information. In the meantime if you have questions or are interested in me, please fill out an adoption application at www.ruffstartrescue.org.

name: MickeyMouse
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Name: Mickey Mouse
DOB: 4/20/13
Weight: 35lbs
Adoption Fee: $325

Hello, I'm Mickey! My age is just a number, I can run with the young dogs! In fact, I LOVE running! I think I'd also love to join you on long walks or hikes! Since I'm a working breed, I love having a job (already working on my fetching skills) so an environment that stimulates me is ideal. Since I'm food-motivated I could learn all sorts of new tricks! I'm very eager to please so positive-reinforcement training is great. I like other dogs as long as I have a chance to get to know them properly first but at the end of the day, I love people! I'm a A+ snuggler and I'm not afraid to get really comfy with you on the couch. You'll know when I'm really relaxed because I go belly-up and start snoring with a smile on my face!

My ideal family would be one that has a yard I can run around in, will shower me with affection, take me on adventures and snuggle me at the end of the day. I need slow intros to other dogs and men. If my future family has kids, it would be best if they were older kids who have good dog manners. Unfortunately, I can't live with cats due to my drive to chase them. Thanks for checking my aPAWrable face out!

description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Name: Laika

Weight: 20 lbs
Adoption Fee: $400

Are you checkin' me out? My name is Laika.

My foster mama thinks I'm beautiful and just the right size. I'm a 20# tricolor Jack Russell terrier/terrier mix. I'm about 3 years old. I am extremely shy when meeting new people or new situations. I like to have a hiding spot or 2 to run to for safety but come out again if it's safe. If you are willing to be patient and let me learn to trust you, you will find that I will follow you from room to room and might snuggle up on your lap. I love to curl up right next to my foster mama at bedtime too! I get along well with other dogs. I love mealtime and treats are always welcome. I have no info on cats for me, but I am good with kids as long as they don't poke my eyes or anything crazy!

I might do better in a home with a fenced yard because I really don't like my leash. I will be brave enough to meet you if you would like to meet me!

Please note my forever home must have another pup friend living there.

Laika arrived heartworm positive and has completed treatment.

name: Tate
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Name: Tate
DOB: January 2017
Weight: 70 lbs
Adoption Fee: $350

STOP!! Help me! I need a family of my own. My name is Tate and I am sooo excited to be looking for my forever home. My ideal home would be an active family, I have a lot of energy to burn so a running or biking partner would be amazing, I mean really cool. Fetch can be so over-rated, I would much rather be next to my human than chasing a ball yards away from them.

I am crate trained (I actually love having my own space) and I am potty trained. I walk really nice with my fancy no pull harness too! My foster mom says that I am very eager to please so training is going ok! She also said I am a lap dog and I love to give kisses...Gee Whiz! What can I say? I'm a lover not a fighter!

I am working on my manners, my foster mom has been working very hard with me and is making sure I am on my very best behavior when I meet my new family. I have mostly been working on my jumping and mouthiness, sometimes I just get really excited to meet new people and I totally get all crazy.

I really like other dogs, but would do best with ones who are my size and love to play a lot. My foster siblings are not super thrilled with my young pup energy. I would do best with older kids as I have not quite figured out my body yet and may knock them over unintentionally.

Well? Are you ready for some fun? Do you need someone to keep you motivated to exercise? Fill out an application and my foster mom will get in touch :)

In the meantime if you have questions or are interested in me, please fill out an adoption application at www.ruffstartrescue.org.

name: Martha
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Name: Martha
DOB: 6/1/2015
Weight: 56 Pounds
Adoption Fee: $350

- Dog friendly

- People Friendly

- Likes Toys

- Kennel trained

- Potty trained

- Cannot have children under 16 in home

- Needs basic training

- Can co exist with cats if properly introduced

Hiya! I'm Martha! I'm an adult Rottie mix looking for a family who is willing to help me learn, grow, and be the best girl I can be!

I love playing with toys, going for walks, and getting pets. Playing tug is by far one of my favorite things to do and playing with my foster siblings, it fills my whole day! I love going outside and am learning pottying outside is where I'm supposed to be! It's going very well and treats really help me learn. I take them so gently I lloovvee treats.

When my Foster Mom asks me to sit, I sit right then and there. I listen very well and I am extremely attentive to her! I come to my name, I stay close when we are outside, and if I need to be on a leash I walk fine on that too. I still need some help in other departments but I am a very quick learner!

I can get a little nervous if people I don't know reach for me. I growl and ask for my space. My Mama says Rottie's tend to be trust based and folks I don't know reaching to grab me makes me anxious. I warm up quick, but my future family should be aware of this.

With training and proper exposure, this isn't really even noticeable in my foster home. I love my Mama, my Dad, and her human siblings! They're 16 and take care of my some days. We play, wrestle, and cuddle.

What do you think? Can I come home with you?

In the meantime if you have questions or are interested in me, please fill out an adoption application at www.ruffstartrescue.org.

name: Vinnie
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Name: Vinnie
DOB: 2/20/2018
Weight: 60lbs
Adoption Fee: $350

Hellooooo! My name is Vinnie and boy am I ready to find my forever home! I am a young buck who enjoys going for walks and hiking with my foster family. They tell me I have quite a bit of puppy energy still and need a daily outlet for it. I am working hard on not jumping up when I get excited to see someone, I am told I would do best with older kids so I do not accidentally knock the little ones over. I am really happy to meet everyone though: men, women, kids, and I greet dogs nicely with an invitation to start play. I have not been exposed to things called \"cats\" yet, I am not sure if I like those or not and should have slow introductions to any that I meet. I am crate trained and sleep through the night in my kennel, I am not always thrilled about going in but will reluctantly go in if there is a treat in their first. I will bark at people outside who are walking past the house, but who wants a hound dog that doesn't bay like a hound? I am told that apartments may not be the best place for me though. I love riding in the car, I actually just took a road trip to Denver with my foster mom and I did amazing!

I also love, love, love to play! Toys, bones, the occasional non-dog toy if I get too excited so I still need to be supervised to make sure I am chewing on dog friendly items. I am getting much better with my potty training, I will need to be kept on a schedule as I will have an accident if I am not let out in time. I do try to ask though so I am sure we can work out some sort of agreement on that one.

If you are ready to add a spunky, energetic and playful young man to your household, I am definitely the one for you!! Please consider putting in an application so we can meet and be best friends forever :)

In the meantime if you have questions or are interested in me, please fill out an adoption application at www.ruffstartrescue.org.

name: Toby Jacob
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.

Name: Toby Jacob
DOB: 03/29/2006
Weight:17lb
Adoption Fee: $125

Toby Jacob AKA Toby joined Ruff Start Rescue after his forever owner passed away unexpectedly and the family was unable to afford his medical needs. He is affectionately known in his foster home as Toby Shark as well. He received that nick-name because when he first joined their home, he would walked around the house and make funny gremlin noises and would look up at them and bark with his teeth hanging out from his under bite. Toby is a super laid back gentleman and enjoys being with his humans and foster brothers all the time. Toby LOVES to eat, but does have skin allergies and requires a grain free dog food. He prefers a Raw Diet or wet dog food over dry kibble. He will play with stuffed animal toys from time to time, and loves playing tug-a-war with his foster mom when he gets in the playing mood. Most of his day though is spent resting (snoring) and following his foster mom and companion foster brother (Shih-Tzu) around the house or at the grooming salon that his foster mom works at. Toby does have separation anxiety and will need a home where he will either have someone home with him most of the time or will be able to join his family to work every day. Toby suffered from severe dry eye and extreme ear infections in both ears for an extended amount of time before joining Ruff Start. He ended up having his ear canal removed in his right ear and also gets multiple eye medication in both eyes twice a day now to help with his dry eye. Due to the severity of his ear infection, his facial nerve on that side of his face was damaged in surgery and he can no longer blink his right eye and his jowls are droopy in that side of his face. He does receive eye medications to help keep his eye healthy. Toby is mostly blind and deaf. He will need a one level home so that he will not fall down any stairs. Toby is house trained and enjoys strolling around the yard in the warm weather. He does need frequent potty breaks just because he has a harder time holding his potty because of his age. Toby grew up with multiple other large and small dogs and has interacted with cats in the past. In his foster home, Toby actually has a little shih-tzu that he uses a lot as his seeing-eye companion. He follows him around to make sure he is not going to bump into anything as well as his friend keeps in away from wondering off in the yard. He may do best in a new home that has another small laid back dog that he can bond with. Toby is good with children, but will need kids that understand not to be in dogs faces and not to be over bearing. Toby is all up to date on all his main vaccines, is neutered and heartworm negative. However, Toby has tested positive and has been treated for Lyme's disease. Lyme's disease can cause joint stiffness and minor lameness from time to time, his foster home gives him a daily joint supplement to help prevent this as well as to help with any arthritis he may have. Toby also has what is commonly called \"Old Dog Lung\" which is calcium build up in his lungs. It causes him to have difficultly breathing from time to time and may require further medical intervention in the future.

Toby's Needs

- Eye ointment in the AM and PM

- Eye Lubricant in right eye 4-6 times a day (as needed)

- Companion Animal

- Owner who is home most of the time or can bring him to work for frequent potty break and separation anxiety

- Frequent medicated baths for skin allergies

- No Stairs

- Grain free dog food

An adoption application is the best way to show your interest in an animal. Once we receive your application, a placement coordinator will be in contact with you as soon as possible.

Please check out our website, www.ruffstartrescue.org for more details and additional pictures on any of our animals!

Toby Jacob qualifies for the Seniors for Seniors program. With this program if a senior adopts Toby then the price will be lowered to $65

name: Rosie Ray
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Name:Rosie
DOB: 8/11/2007
Weight: 80 lbs
Adoption Fee: $125.00

Meet Rosie, a year nine old Lab with lots of love to give! She's a bit on the chubby side at 80 lbs, but we are working steadily to get her weight down.

She's potty trained and has never been kenneled inside the house. She likes to hang around with her people and would do okay without having a fenced yard after getting used to her new home! She loves absolutely everybody she meets and still likes to play with her two younger housemates. Due to being a little overweight, Rosie moves a little slower and breathes heavy after exercise but she does quite well with a halter and leash. As she ages, her eyes are sadly getting cloudy and she can't see as well, but that does not take away from her loyal and loving personality. She is a total sweetheart, stays close by your side, and would be a real asset to any family with a more sedate lifestyle! She loves her kongs, marrow bones, belly rubs, squeaky toys, and don't forget her beauty sleep!

Due to Rosie's age, she will likely need to be on daily medications for the rest of her life. Her new home should be prepared to cover that cost. Rosie also struggles with stairs, especially after her old hips wake up in the morning! She would do best in a home where she does not have to do more than 2-3 stairs at a time.

name: Dacotah
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Name: Dacotah
DOB: 12/05/2013
Weight: 51 lbs
Adoption Fee: $125

A good day to you! My name is Dacotah and I am an adult Husky mix looking for a human companion. I would consider myself a refined gentleman, I love long walks, hanging out with folks, and cuddling when the day comes to a close. Once in a while I will play with my younger foster siblings, but they can be so jumpy! I do prefer dogs whose taste more a lines with my own. Trying to talk to them doesn't get me anywhere so I find myself a good spot on the couch, curl in a ball, and plop right down to watch some tele.

I get along with pretty much everyone, I am very easy going. I like dogs, I get along with the resident cat, and children don't bother me either. I would prefer more respectful children if I am going to live with them for as I get older, I am more easily startled. I also like talking about my day, current affairs, all the like, so it can be off putting to younger ones if they aren't ready to chat with me. Another reason I prefer more mature small humans. They love talking to me!

I also like to play with toys! I love ball and tug ropes, so if you like playing I'd love if we could toss the ol' pig skin around. When I was a younger man, I moved a lot faster so you'll have to take it slow to start but once I get on a roll I'll play with you for hours!

This last part I am going to let my current human talk to you about; I don't fully understand why I get nervous about certain things so maybe she can help explain what I'll need. She does a great job of watching me so I bet she knows what will be best!

Hi there! My name is Taylor and I am Dacotah's current foster Mom. He has done an awesome job telling you about himself and covering the things he is so good at! Now I want to talk about something any new family considering Dacotah will need to know moving forward. I'm going to tell you where he came from, why he is the way he is, and what you can expect applying for him.

Dacotah's previous owner came on hard times but did what he could to continue to care for his pup even after they became homeless. Dacotah and him lived out of their car and they shared everything, from food, to water, to a living space. For this reason Dacotah is not used to confinement and is not accustomed to being alone. Being an adult dog, around 5-6 years old, these traits are something I find to be a part of him, not something I need to train away. I am looking for folks who are home more often than not and will have to leave him home for maybe a max of 2-3 hours a day. He does need a special type of kennel and this is something that his potential home will want to research prior to applying. It is called an Alcatraz kennel and it is made to be unescapable as the name may imply. Left out he can hurt himself and possibly your home if he becomes nervous or scared. This is not something that I as his foster parent take lightly. Watching him shake and cower away from me if I need to kennel him is crushing. Which is why I am looking to find a home that won't require that of him. He doesn't require a lot of exercise or grooming, just a lot of love! If you have the ability to bring a dog to your place of work or work from home, he would be an amazing match. He listens to commands extremely well and is a very people oriented dog that really looks to you for support. Any applicant's will need this information and I promise you, should you be able to meet these requirements, you'll come to meet one of the sweetest, gentlest, nicest dogs I have had the ability to foster.

Thank you for your consideration, Dacotah says he is excited to spend his life with you. Ready to go?

name: Reynolds
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Name:Reynolds
DOB:1/17/15
Weight: 62 lbs
Adoption Fee: $300

- Walks good on a harness

- Likes playing with toys

- Plays fetch

- Kennel trained

- Potty trained

- Requires a home with bully experience

- Needs to be only pet in the home

- No children in the home

Woah! Like, hey man! I'm Reynold! My foster Mom calls me Renny, it's nice to meet you.

I am a big baby, literally, as I'm about 75lbs. I love playing with toys, I get the zoomies, I jump over couches and stairs, I tuck my butt and I RRUUNN all over my yard! I am learning to drop balls and toys, I also love going for walks! I have a back pack I wear and know when it's time for work!

My past isn't really known, I came to a vet clinic and was in pretty rough shape. I know it says at the top I can't be with other dogs, but I might be! My foster Mom is being very careful with my introductions to make sure I don't hurt myself, so only time will tell.

In that same breathe, she does know I'm a very smart boy! After I'm all played out, I like laying in my dog bed and I chew on my bones. Training will be super important for me, since I am a big boy I could very easily hurt someone if I don't respect and listen to my family. My Mama knows that too. She'll be very picky about the family I go to and they'll need to have had bully's in the passed to have me.

I don't want to surprise you, but I can be kind of pig headed! I won't be a good first dog. I will be a challenge, but a challenge that will reward you many times over. I love being with people and I am so happy to be alive and just.. AM SO HAPPY! MY SMILE IS HUGE AND I WANNA PLAY WITH YOU!

What do ya say? Up for it? I'll get my back pack, let's go!

In the meantime if you have questions or are interested in me, please fill out an adoption application at www.ruffstartrescue.org.

name: Scooter
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.

Name: Scooter
DOB: 08/10/2014 estimated
Weight: 54 lbs
Adoption Fee: $325

Life is hard on the streets, especially when you look like I do. I'm an adult bully mix who is muscly, likes to growl, and likes to show my teeth. You'd have to stay with me a little while to see that's just my smile. To see my white muzzle. To see what I've been through. I've decided to call myself something approachable, I want to appeal to a wide amount of people. Call me.. Scooter!

I was found as a stray and brought into MACC, where folks at first weren't sure how I would do. As previously mentioned, I can come off as kind of hard. Then they let me out to play with some others dogs and.. well, I got to be me. I like playing with other dogs a lot but I like to meet my new friends slowly to make sure they're cool. I need to feel acclimated before I'm willing to offer friendship. The streets taught me that. I'm also kind of pushy, but I've been told most bully's are like that! (You may notice a reoccurring theme as I am pushy in some other departments too) I tend to play with my whole body so little children most likely will not be a good fit for me. Think, bowling ball. (See, pushy)

I met a kitty at my permanent foster home. She is a small creature, who stands her ground. I find her frightening and attempt to sneak up and sniff her when she isn't looking. This task is more difficult than it appears as she is very fast and harms my nose if I get too close. I bark at her. Then I hide. When she rests, I am respectful of her space. I do like her, although I have yet to confirm how she feels about me.. given the scratches on my nose, I would say she needs, possibly, more space? Will make a note for the future. (Too pushy?)

I would like to talk to you about how my true life's obsession. The thing that gets me up and out of the kennel in the morning, outside even when it's raining (I hate rain. I. Hate. It. It's too pushy), what even motivates me to listen to the humans I live with! It is the soft sphere they call, a tennis ball. This object is an amazing thing, I put it in my mouth and squeeze, it makes a sound that makes me JUMP with joy! I bring it to one of my humans, they are so silly they have no idea its value! They THROW IT! I bring the precious gem to them, only for them to do THE SAME THING AGAIN! These fools, eventually I stop bringing it back and just enjoy my ball alone.

I mentioned in the beginning of my tale, that I can be a tab quirky. That is a very true statement and my possible new humans will need to know these things about me, I find honesty is always the best policy. The streets taught me that.

I am a bed hog.

When I get on the bed, I roll around all over it first.

I snore really loudly.

I don't always listen when you tell me to drop the ball. (You're just going to throw it! You don't even know its worth!)

Sometimes I get really excited and pee a little. Just a little, I swear.

I drool when we play ball. That isn't a little. It's a lot.

I play in the water bowl. Only sometimes.

When you push me, I will push back against you with all my might. Even if I can see what you're trying to make me do, is definitely the right choice. (It's a bully thing, or so I've heard.)

I am scared of new people. I need you to take things slowly with me. When I was out there, alone.. it was terrifying. I did my best to stay strong, I knew someone would help me. They did! I'm learning that people aren't scary or out to hurt me, but sometimes I'll growl and tell new folks that I need space. My current humans have people meet me with my most favorite of the balls. Once I see they have that, I know my humans trust them which means they must be legit. Also, if they're willing to play ball with me they pass the test to be my friend.

Being on a leash is something that also stresses me out. I've never had to be tethered before, I think I can be taught, but that's something we'll have to learn together.. is that okay? Because if you're with me through this, I think we can do anything together.

In the meantime if you have questions or are interested in me, please fill out an adoption application at www.ruffstartrescue.org.

name: Shadow - Diabetic
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Name: Shadow
DOB: 5/24/2010
Weight: 27.5 Pounds
Adoption Fee: $125

Hello! My name is Shadow and I am looking for my forever home. I have been in foster care for a few months because I have diabetes and we have been getting that regulated! We now know how much insulin I need twice daily to maintain my blood sugar so I am ready to find my happily ever after. My diabetes will require an extra special family but it's nothing too scary! If you haven't dealt with a diabetic pet before, my foster mom will make sure to give you lots of details and information! Every morning and every evening, at the same time, I will need my insulin which I am PERFECT for. No, seriously. I know I need it and will walk right up to you so you can give it to me. My foster mom has been so impressed! Also, I will need to be brought to the vet every 3-6 months to verify that my glucose levels are still maintaining. I require this extra care for my diabetes but other than that, I am a normal, happy guy! I love to play with the other dogs in my foster home and run around in the yard. I am perfect in my kennel and completely potty trained. After playing in the yard, I'm content just snuggling up on the couch and relaxing. I'm incredibly sweet and a good listener! My foster mom has a feeling that I may not be good with kitties but we don't know for sure so we can certainly verify if you are interested and have kitties in your home! My foster mom may be wrong. If you are looking for a sweet, happy go lucky guy that just needs some extra care, I'm your guy and I'm very worth it! I'm happy playing, sleeping next to you and getting love. I may require more but I am a very low maintenance boy otherwise!

If you are interested in me, please fill out an adoption application at www.ruffstartrescue.org. An adoption application is the best way to show your interest in an animal. Once we receive your application, a placement coordinator will be in contact with you as soon as possible.

name: Lucy
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.

Name: Lucy
Age: 5 years (estimated)
Weight: 85 lbs
Adoption Fee: PAID BY GENEROUS DONOR

Lucy's Interview

Tell me a bit about yourself? My name is Lucy and I am a fabulous Mature Bloodhound with the perfect dose of sass and silly antics.

Whats your favorite pass time? Where to start.. I love to spy on all my neighbors from the window. I also like to find a good chew bone, cozy spot on the couch and relax with my chew toy. I also enjoy walks and a dip in the kiddie pool my foster family got for me. I love to dunk my face in the water and take big drinks.

What would your ideal adoptive home be? My Adopters should have a home with a fenced in yard at least 5 ft plus. I like to run and chase small critters so it would keep me safe. It should be a home without kitties or other female dogs that are big.. I do great with small dogs and male dogs with proper slow introductions. My foster mom's Chihuahuas are my BFFs. I would also like a home all to myself as the only pup too. I do well with all humans and little humans as well. I would not do well in apartment or shared wall living.

What skills do you have? I am potty trained. Crate trained I even go in when asked. I know how to sit and even shake! I will sometimes throw up two paws! I also have a fabulous hound singing voice.
I am good with baths, nail trims, ear cleaning, and vet visits!

What skills could you work on more? I love to go for walks but need to walk in a more remote place as I get pretty worked up when I see other dogs out walking with their pup parents. I also love to steal rags and food off the counters! I think its super fun but my foster mom doesn't seem to think its as fun as I do.

What other things should we know about you? I am a super healthy gal but take medication daily to help me with urinary incontinence. That means I sometimes leak urine when hanging out or sleeping, but with my medicine I do not leak at all! Yay me! I am super a sweet girl and have been looking for my furever home for a long time now!

Whats your history? I joined my foster family back in Feb of 2017. I joined them after a local MN shelter I was staying at requested to transfer me from the shelter to a foster based rescue to help me find a home in an environment more suitable for myself. I was at that shelter because I was found running around as a stray.

If you are interested in me, please fill out an adoption application at www.ruffstartrescue.org. An adoption application is the best way to show your interest in an animal. Once we receive your application, a placement coordinator will be in contact with you as soon as possible.

name: Zeena *Waiting 990 Days*
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.

Name: Zeena

DOB: 05/04/12 estimated
Weight: 35 lbs
Adoption Fee: PAID BY A GENEROUS DONOR

Zeena

is a gorgeous girl who is eager to please and has tons of love to give! She was found by her foster mom wandering the streets in pretty rough shape. Since she is so much happier and healthier now, she's so excited about life!

Zeena

is very playful and energetic and would make a good walking/jogging buddy, but needs to continue to work on leash training. She does well with SOME other dogs (she tends to be selective) and really loves to play with them when she finds a dog she can get along well with. A slow introduction will be needed and she tends to do better with male dogs. She has a prey drive so does not do well with smaller dogs and no cats or critters in the house for her. She would do the best with a fenced yard because she likes to chase squirrels and birds (hey who doesn't?) and should be supervised when outside as she has been know to scale a privacy fence to try to get a squirrel! Get out of my yard squirrel!

She loves to play and will always be up for a few rounds of tug-o-war. And when play time is over she likes to snuggle. She does great with the kids in her foster home (age 6 and 11) and loves to give kisses. I just remind them to be careful when playing with toys with her so that she doesn't get possessive of them.

Zeena

is crate trained, and knows a few basic commands (sit, recall-her name, wait and stay). Since she's so eager to make her humans happy, given time/patience and some dedicated training, I'm confident that she can learn more! This sweet girl developed some allergies and we have been feeding her Nutro (a limited ingredient diet) which seems to have helped. A 22lb. bag of Nutro is around $50 (should last about a month and a half). She also has some incontinence issues. She does go potty outside, but tends to have accidents inside as well. We've tried several medications for this and she has seen a specialist, but we can't quite pin point the problem. For now, she gets frequent outdoor potty breaks and wears a diaper indoors. Simple solutions diapers are about $11 per 12 pack of diapers (we use roughly a pack per 2-3 weeks, but this may vary depending on how long she's kenneled, how many potty breaks she gets, etc.)

Zeena is a great girl who has so much love to give. We know there is a family out there for her - we just have to find them! She looks bigger in her pictures but she is only about 35 pounds of sass, wiggle and unconditional love. She loves it at her foster mom's house but would love more than anything to find a forever home of her own!

If you are interested in me, please fill out an adoption application at www.ruffstartrescue.org. An adoption application is the best way to show your interest in an animal. Once we receive your application, a placement coordinator will be in contact with you as soon as possible.

Please check out our website, www.ruffstartrescue.org for more details and additional pictures on any of our animals!

All Ruff Start dogs and cats are spayed/neutered, up to date on age appropriate vaccines, microchipped, dewormed, and on monthly flea/tick and heartworm prevention (dogs) as well as heartworm tested (dogs).

Ruff Start Rescue is a foster based rescue. Animals are located in homes throughout Minnesota. We do not have a facility where animals are kept.

Ruff Start Rescue Adoption Policies: http://www.ruffstartrescue.org/info/display?PageID=11744

name: Edward
description:
Intake Date: 9.7.17
Appx. DOB: 11.16.16
Weight: 52 lbs

Hi, I'm Edward and I promise I'm more fun that winning the lottery, and cuter than six baby pandas! All you have to do is adopt me from Shaw PBR in Mississippi, and it will be like everything you touch turns to gold!

I've already been neutered; am up-to-date on all vaccinations, including rabies and bordetella; am micro chipped; heartworm negative (and on monthly preventive); come with my own collar and leash; and 30 days free complimentary pet insurance!! Call 662.386.7429 to see about adopting me, today!!

http://www.shawpitbullrescue.com/interested-in-adopting/pre-adoption-questionnaire/

name: Elvis
description:
On the heels of losing our sweet Gladys just weeks ago, we promised to follow up with some more information about her heartbroken son, Elvis.



Some of you may recognize Elvis from previous postings, but read on to learn a little more about what this soulful fellow has been dealing with recently. For those of you from other parts, Mississippi is the birthplace of American music, and Elvis Presley is one of her most favored sons. Presley had a hardscrabble upbringing in rural Mississippi - not so different from this fine dog - but he remained connected to his roots by his doting mother, Gladys. In the late 50s, as Presley began his meteoric rise to fame, Gladys fell ill and passed at the untimely age of 46. Here again, the parallels to our Elvis's story are heartbreakingly similar.



Elvis was rescued in 2009 - yes, nearly SIX years ago - along with a female dog that we believe was his mother. We named them Gladys and Elvis to signify their special bond; Gladys had tended to Elvis even after he'd lost sight in his left eye at a young age. The two were inseparable, and Elvis was distraught when complications from an infection took Gladys's leg. But even down one leg and one eye, this tough little family soldiered on, happy to have the company of one another and a roof over their head at ARF.



Knowing the strength of this bond, we were even more concerned than usual when we found a growth on Gladys's neck in late 2014. The growth was promptly removed, but years of hard living seemed to catch up to this sweet, 10-year-old girl. She had trouble healing in the months following the surgery, a fact that made more sense when we realized that the cancer had returned. Her good-natured demeanor remained, but it was clear that she was nearing the end of her road. Gladys enjoyed a beautiful final day in early February, laying in the warm Mississippi sun and leisurely watching the birds in a nearby park.



Much like his namesake, our sweet Elvis was devastated. We've made certain to give him lots of interaction with new friends in an effort to keep his spirits high, but we can't provide him with the one thing he truly needs: a family. He is a medium-sized dog that is full of cuddles and playfulness -- at roughly 7 years old, he definitely does not act his age smile emoticon Elvis is a sweet, friendly dog that needs a freshstart, and we know that the right forever home is out there. If you're looking to provide a new lease on life for one of our most deserving seniors, we'd be happy to provide more information about Elvis. And even if you're not ready to adopt, please consider coming to visit this handsome hound dog today -- he needs all the loving he can get.

Elvis, Labrador Retriever has been shared from Shelter Exchange - http://www.shelterexchange.org.

name: XP Sassy - Montclair, NJ
description:
Sassy is a beautiful 35 pound Pit Bull mix who is around 2 years old. She loves to play fetch with a tennis ball and is extremely loyal to her owners/family. She has nipped strangers though but has not hurt anyone.

We are heartbroken that we cannot keep her in a very busy household with many guests in and out each day. She would do best in a home where she has much room to run and frolic. She is a very loving & loyal dog to those who love her. As you can see in her photos, Sassy gets along with cats but can be picky about her doggy friends.

Sassy is NOT with Eleventh Hour Rescue but we are helping her owners with the rehoming process. If you are interested in meeting Sassy, please contact Jennifer directly at jmburke112@gmail.com - she is currently located in Montclair, NJ.

name: Tex
description: I was a stray brought in from Montreal. Primary Color: White Secondary Color: Brown Weight: 60.6lbs Age: 1yrs 3mths 1wks Animal has been Neutered

name: Shane aka Vinnie
description:
OVERLOOKED AND MISUNDERSTOOD SEEKS SOUL MATE TO SET THE WORLD ON FIRE (or a good cuddle on the couch)...Please meet Vinnie!

Vinnie is an amazing three (3) year old, lab/terrier mix that wears his heart on his sleeve. Vinnie is a life-loving dog that would be the perfect compliment for an active owner or family (children over the age of 10 preferred). Vinnie LOVESto play (tennis balls are his favorite) and would thrive in an environment where he could be intricately involved with the daily activities of his new home! Vinnie will be an amazingly loving and loyal companion to the home that is open to his very special gifts!

We are determined to find the right home to make Vinnie's success story complete! Originally adopted out as a cute and happy puppy, Vinnie was (gratefully) returned to us after a concerned citizen stepped in; Vinnie's initial home was characterized as \"abusive\" and he was subsequently handed off to two separate acquaintances that were unfortunately ill-equipped to provide the structure Vinnie needed to regain his trust in people. Thus, poor Vinnie arrived back to us fearful and with a broken spirit; humans had let him down. For close to a year, we worked with Vinnie to regain his trust and rebuild his confidence in people. And, after a number of smaller \"baby\" steps, Vinnie was ready for some professional training and guidance. He made the journey to Golden Heart Canine in Montrose, Colorado, whereby he spent a full six weeks of intensive training to get back on track to being his best self! The transformation was amazing! Simply put, Vinnie was almost an entirely new dog from the moment we picked him up! Vinnie's former fear and mistrust had been replaced by love, comfort, and most importantly, faith in people. Vinnie has resided in the loving environment of a caring and supportive foster home since his return from Montrose, where he has continued to work on socialization and confidence building by visiting new places and meeting new people. Vinnie is now ready for a permanent family to callhis very own!

Vinnie loves to be the center of attention and doesn't at all mind acting \"goofy\" to get you to smile! Vinnie can occasionally geta little insecure on walks with unfamiliar canine companions, but has made great strides in making introductions at adoption events, whereby he has been in the company of many unfamiliar dogs at one time. Because he still exhibits moments of insecurity, we would recommend structured introductions with new canine friends in a controlled environment. Vinnie will, In fact, sit at the door to actively greet new people and dogs as they walk in!

Vinnie is house-trained, crate trained, sleeps through the night and just a ton of fun during waking hours! Vinnie also loves his crate, which can also serve as a great place for 'down time' as needed.

Sweet eyes, a big heart, and in great shape...Vinnie will be your trusted friend for life, if simply given a chance...all Vinnie asks for is love and a firm but gentle hand to reinforce the skills he has recently acquired.

If you are interested in meeting Vinnie and giving him the life he deserves, please fill out an application through our website!

*BSL Restrictions may apply.

If you would like to see video's of Vinnie's board & train, please see below.


	Vinnie Video 1https://photos.app.goo.gl/iqdMbycBykrQwNkP7
	Vinnie Video 2https://photos.app.goo.gl/7SN8kgKStqvG2Qkb8


Adoption fee includes the following:


	Spay/Neuter
	Rabies Vaccination
	Distemper / Parvo Vaccines (includes series of 3 for puppies)
	Bordetella
	Microchip with prepaid lifetime registration
	Deworming
