name: XP Louie - Morris County, NJ
description:
At 13 years of age, Louie finds himself looking for a new place to live. He is a purebred Beagle who likes company & is a friendly companion. His owners tell us that he is in good health overall but at his age he is slightly incontinent. If you like sweet senior dogs, please consider giving Louie a place to live out his days, feeling secure and loved.

Louie is not with Eleventh Hour Rescue but we are helping his owner with the rehoming process. If you would like to meet Louie, please contact Laura at 201-694-2797. Louie is currently located in the Morris County area of NJ.

name: Lollipop
description:
Exact age unknown.

Exact age unknown. Lollipop is a really sweet girl; you just have to have patience to let her warm up and come out of her shell as she is initially quite shy. Once she knows you she loves you and will follow and play. She likes to be with other dogs, particularly ones that want to play as much as she does. She likes to go for walks (loves to go jogging!). Will require a yard with a tall fence. She is currently available at Old Friends Senior Dog Sanctuary located in Mt Juliet TN. All forever fosters have any medical expenses paid for by the sanctuary for the duration of their lives, so Foster Families must live within 100 miles of our Mount Juliet Sanctuary.

To fill out a Forever Foster application, visit our website at ofsds.org

All potential Forever Fosters must reside within 100 miles of Mt Juliet, TN. All Forever Fosters dogs will have any medical expenses paid for by the sanctuary for the duration of their lives.

To fill out a Forever Foster application, please visit our website at ofsds.org

name: Sheba
description:
***COURTESY LISTING*** Not a Ewenity Farm dog, but shared with love! Sheba is located in Myakka City, FL (Manatee County).

Sheba is about 60 lbs and 5-6 years. She was found dumped on a farm and taken in by a loving family, but due to her incompatibility with farm animals needs to find a suitable forever home. She loves humans of all ages including children, and is very friendly and loving right off the bat. She would do well in a home with a companion dog, but it is not a requirement. She loves to play outside but not as much as napping at your feet and getting attention. She knows basic commands and is fine on leash but could use a refresher.

Sheba is housebroken, spayed and up-to-date on vaccines and preventives. If interested, please submit an inquiry and we will forward it to Sheba's current foster.

name: Ozzy
description: What an absolute doll, he is a gentle as can be  he kisses the cats when they play with him he kisses the kids ever so gentle and yet he loves to run around outside and play with the other dogs he doesn't realize the power he has behind his little butt when he gets going omg this is the best dog ever he is about 53 pounds crate trained , housebroken, vaccinated , microchipped, he  never knew love from his previous owners they were anything but kind they left him outside and his back was all sunburned and they were cheap and evil they tried to dock his tail themselves and wrapped a rubber band around it and dumped him in the police box and after all of that he is the kindest most loving boy  around  and he keeps getting passed by he is in a foster home in N.J.please submit application on our website www.crazyrescueladiesinc.com

name: Aura
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Online Adoption Application 
Aura is a sweet, shy girl in need of a loving, patient furever family....Aura came to us from Nash County. She was confiscated by Animal Control as an abuse/neglect case. She weighed a mere 21 pounds when she was brought in. She had 7 babies that were starved as well. At 8 weeks old they only weighed 3 pounds. Thankfully everyone survived - the pups grew and thrived and were all adopted. Aura gained weight and has done great in foster care. She was heartworm positive at the time of rescue but received treatment and is heartworm-free now. Aura's a really great girl and deserves a wonderful home of her own.

name: PUPPY TANZIE
description:
Tanzie is a sweet and vivacious black Lab female puppy that is looking for a home with dog experience and training skills. This girl is a diamond in the rough that adores people, other dogs, would love a cat to be best friends with a cat too! She is 24 pounds at just 5 months old and will be a 45-50 girl when fully grown. She is loving and smart and almost housebroken with crate training down pat! She needs a fenced yard to run to her heart's content and would welcome a second dog in the family. She is NOT a Diva dog that needs to be the only dog. Older kids would be great for her to hang out with too! She is ready to transport up from Nashville, TN on 7/12. Contact us at ccrnewenengland@gmail.com
ADOPTION FEE REQUIRED. Contact ccrtennessee@gmail.com.

name: INDIE
description:
This precious 6 year old Yellow Lab girl is a victim twice now in her life. Her name six year ago when she came in to the Critter Cavalry Rescue program was Indie. A young yellow lab girl that needed a fresh and loving forever home. We thought we found one for herwe \"thought\". This is until we got a phone call from a local Nashville, TN shelter informing us that she was dropped off by the family saying they couldn't keep her any longer. They never in the whole six years of owning her, took her to the vet. Now, they were discarding her and not even trying to find the rescue who originally pledged their faith and support to this young girl. She was at the shelter for 4 more days as we scrambled to find a foster home for her at one of the most challenging times..holiday weekend of Labor Day. One of our faithful and trusted foster moms went to the shelter to bring her home. In the shelter she was shaking and shivering with fear and confusion as to why she was in this noisy, chaotic environment called a shelter. She didn't belong there and shame on that horrible family who didn't even try to find an alternative for rehoming her or calling our rescue. She is not trash folks. She is a loving and beautiful soul that needs a better person or family the next time around. We will dedicate all we have to finding that right place AGAIN. She is housebroken, good with other dogs, seems OK with the resident cat at the foster home and is good with children. She is not leash trained and she is strong. She would benefit from a fenced yard as that is what she had in the former home. She is 55 pounds and around 6-7 years old. Most like 6 than 7. But who is counting? She has lots of love and lots of years to give to a new beginning. Please email us at ccrtennessee@gmail.com Please help Indie find her forever place in life.

ADOPTION FEE REQUIRED. Contact ccrtennessee@gmail.com.

name: Kaiser
description:
Kaiser ~ Available...Kaiser is a handsome, male Rottweiler. He is approximately 3 years old and weighs around 80 pounds. He has a low-moderate energy level and is crate-trained and housebroken. He is good with kids, other dogs and cats!

For more information or to request an adoption application, please email us at adoption.mtgsr@gmail.com

ADOPTION: 
Training (for both the dog AND the family) increases the probability of a successful adoption. We feel strongly that training is an essential part of responsible dog ownership and we now require training for every dog placed through the MTGSR program. The cost of adoption is $500 which includes the $250 adoption fee and a training fee (payable to the trainer) of $250 is due at the time of adoption.

For the adoption fee, the dog will be spayed/neutered, current on all vaccinations, current on heartworm/flea-tick preventatives and microchipped.

The training fee will include a plan tailored to that specific dog and that dog's needs (obedience training, behavior modification, etc.) and typically includes three private training sessions.

PLEASE NOTE: Our philosophy is \"Rescue locally, place locally\" which means we primarily pull dogs from shelters in the Nashville area AND we place dogs within a one-hour drive of Nashville. If you are outside of the Nashville area, please consider adopting a homeless dog in your local community.

For more information or to request an adoption application, please email us at adoption.mtgsr@gmail.com

ADOPTION: 
Training (for both the dog AND the family) increases the probability of a successful adoption. We feel strongly that training is an essential part of responsible dog ownership and we now require training for every dog placed through the MTGSR program. The cost of adoption is $500 which includes the $250 adoption fee and a training fee (payable to the trainer) of $250 is due at the time of adoption.

For the adoption fee, the dog will be spayed/neutered, current on all vaccinations, current on heartworm/flea-tick preventatives and microchipped.

The training fee will include a plan tailored to that specific dog and that dog's needs (obedience training, behavior modification, etc.) and typically includes three private training sessions.

PLEASE NOTE: Our philosophy is \"Rescue locally, place locally\" which means we primarily pull dogs from shelters in the Nashville area AND we place dogs within a one-hour drive of Nashville. If you are outside of the Nashville area, please consider adopting a homeless dog in your local community.

name: Kiki/MH
description:
sweet, funny, and loving female terrier
Kiki is a sweet, funny, and loving female terrier. Since she loves to play, jump, skip and run, she'd be great in the dog agility training. She's approximately 3 years old, 18 pounds, fully vetted and microchipped. She loves going on walks and loves everyone - adults, kids, other dogs (hasn't been around cats but probably would be fine due to her sweet personality). She loves to roll in the grass and skips as she goes on walks. She'll make a wonderful addition to a family, couple or single individual. She was saved from a Texas animal control facility by 501(c)3 Russell Rescue Tennessee and is enjoying her foster home in Nashville. But she is looking forward to being adopted into a loving forever home. For more info and to schedule a time to meet Kiki in Nashville, please email melissarescuesdogs@gmail.com.
Please complete our application at:
http://www.russellrescuetn.com/application-for-adoption/

name: Doodle Dandy
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8551

2-3 year old Male beagle about 15lbs. Was found in a southern Virginia shelter by a volunteer. 

This dog tested positive for Ehrlichia before arriving to the rescue. Ehrlichia is a very common type of bacteria that infects dogs and other species and is spread by ticks. Ehrlichia is not contagious to humans or other pets. The only way to get this disease is to be bitten by a tick that carries it. The treatment is typically 21-30 days of antibiotics. This dog started treatment upon arriving to the rescue. 

**I will be at the Richmond Dog Festival Event in Richmond, VA on 9/21/19 from 11am to 4pm at Chimborazo Park 3215 E. Broad St. Richmond, VA 23223 . I would love to meet my furever family so come by and meet me this weekend ! 
To adopt this dog, or any OPH dog, fill out the simple online application at https://ophrescue.org 
Operation Paws for Homes, Inc. (OPH) rescues dogs of all breeds and ages from high-kill shelters in NC, VA, MD, and SC, reducing the numbers being euthanized. With limited resources, the shelters are forced to put down 50-90% of the animals that come in the front door. OPH provides pet adoption services to families located in VA, DC, MD, PA and neighboring states. OPH is a 501(c)(3) organization and is 100% donor funded. OPH does not operate a shelter or have a physical location. We rely on foster families who open their homes to give love and attention to each dog before finding a forever home.

name: Fergie
description:
Say hello to Fergie, a one and a half year old Pointer/Australian Shepard mix. Fergie is an absolute doll who wants nothing more than to love on her person and play with her dog friends. Shy at first, she quickly warms up and will lean in and ask for pets and give you kisses in return. She has been an excellent playmate with her foster brothers and sisters, takes the cue when they don't want her company, and will happily play with someone else or choose to go chew on a toy. She has been excellent in the house, no accidents, as well as in her crate. Fergie loves to run in the backyard, so a structural fenced in yard is required. She walks well on leash, but needs some time to get used to new surroundings. Once she is familiar, she is a great walking or hiking buddy. She has been introduced to cats and seems to do well with them. As you can see from her smile, she is a happy girl ready to be with that special someone or family to give them all of her love. Fergie's adoption fee includes current vaccines, microchip, and spay. To apply to adopt this very special girl, email adopt@carolinapaws.com. 

Adoption fee includes current vaccines, microchip and spay/neuter.  Adoption events are held on Saturdays from (11-2) inside the Blakeney Petsmart (9911 Rea Road Charlotte, NC) in the small animal section.* * * Please note: This a meet and greet only event.  Not all our animals may be at an adoption event. We do not accept applications at our adoption events.  Please review our adoption requirements on our website https://www.carolinapaws.com/adopt/adoption-process/ If interested in one of our rescued cats/dogs complete the online application.  Submitting an application does not obligate you to adopt nor guarantee an adoption.  It is in everyone's best interest to ensure the best possible match, and your cooperation is appreciated. 

We are only accepting applications from the greater Charlotte North Carolina area and certain surrounding counties.

name: Marley
description:
Marley and her two sisters were surrendered to us from rural NC. These puppies are as sweet as they are adorable. They will need continued socialization and of course, training.  They are just 4 months old and will be large dogs. They currently weigh 25 pounds.

If you are interested in meeting and/or adopting one of our dogs, we ask that you please go to our website and fill out an application. www.northmeckanimalrescue.org

Our adoption fee is $250 and includes spay/neuter, parvo/distemper series of shots, rabies (if dog is old enough), bordatella, heartworm preventative while here, worming, and microchipping.

We appreciate your patience as our volunteer-only team reviews your application and updates our website.

name: Sierra
description:
Meet Sierra, a stunningly gorgeous female Lab mix born around June 4th 2019. Sierra is playful lovable puppy!  She was recently rescued with her siblings from a local shelter.  She is adjusting well in her foster home.   She is a smart little girl and is treat motivated.  She is doing amazing with house and crate training.  She enjoys car rides and walks with her foster mom.  She loves nothing more than to be with other dogs!  Her favorite sport is playing fetch. 
 She is best suited in a home with a structural fenced in yard, someone that is home more often than not and children over the age of 8 years old.  She will weigh around 45-50lbs full grown. If you would like to meet Sierra, contact us at adopt@carolinapaws.com

name: Oakley
description:
Meet Oakley, a fun spirited handsome Lab mix born around June 4th 2019.   Oakley is a sweet little boy that loves to play with anyone he meets.  He is affectionate and loves attention.  Oakley has never met a dog he does not like.  He absolute adores his fosters children and dogs.  After a long day of play you will find him snuggled up next to you.  Oakley is a super happy boy that just wants to please.  He is very smart and a quick learner.  He is doing great with house and crate training.  He loves to go to walks to the bus stop in the morning to see his fosterâs children off to school.  This precious puppy would make a wonderful addition to any family.  He will weigh around 45-50lbs full grown. Oakley is current on vaccines and his adoption fee includes current vaccines, microchip and neuter.  If you would like to meet Oakley, contact us at adopt@carolinapaws.com 

Adoption events are held on Saturdays from (11-2) inside the Blakeney Petsmart (9911 Rea Road Charlotte, NC) in the small animal section.* * * Please note: Not all our animals are at an adoption event. We are only accepting applications from the greater Charlotte North Carolina area and certain surrounding counties.

name: Trinity
description:
Meet Trinity a gentle and lovable Collie/Boxer mix around 1-2 years old. Trinity is one of the sweetest girls you will ever meet.  She is lovable and affectionate with everyone she meets!  The only thing in the world she wants is a family to call her own.  She came to the rescue after being abandoned at a local shelter.  She is good with cats, dogs and children.  She is house and crate trained and super smart!  She will make a loyal and devoted companion.  She walks great on leash and loves to go for car rides.  She is around 52lbs and full grown.  She is current on vaccines and microchipped.  If you are looking for the next addition to your family, Trinity is the girl for you!  Contact us at adopt@carolinapaws.com to meet Trinity.  

Adoption events are held on Saturdays from (11-2) inside the Blakeney Petsmart (9911 Rea Road Charlotte, NC) in the small animal section.* * * Please note: We do not accept applications at our adoption events. We are only accepting applications from the greater Charlotte North Carolina area and certain surrounding counties.

name: Skye
description:
Skye is an experienced traveler, who was originally adopted from the San Diego Humane Society, and moved with her previous adopter to NC.  Her prior owner had a life changing event and it was determined that the best life for Skye is with an active family that wants a partner to share their life with her.

Skye is a velvet hippo, approx. 50lbs, and 1 1/2 years old.  She loves car rides, would love to have a running or hiking partner, and gets along very well with all types of canines.  She is confident but submissive.  She loves her nylabones, antlers and rope toys and will need a fenced yard and a consistent schedule.  She does not need to be crated because at her current foster home, she has 8+ other fur siblings to play with, from a tiny chihuahua to an 80lb dog.  Skye truly loves all canine friends!

She loves the dog park and she likes to sleep in the bed with her human.  She is one of the happiest velvet hippos her foster has ever met.  She needs at minimum a 30 minute walk twice a day.  She is crate trained but it isn't her favorite place.  

She is a beautiful soul!

name: Buster
description:
Buster is a good boy who just needs a home and family of his own.

\"Hi, I am Buster. I am an adult male bulldog that ended up in the county kill shelter when an animal control picked me up as a stray. Sadly, my owners never came for me. I didn't mean to run away, I was just looking for love since my owners didn't have me neutered. I have not shown any aggression in the shelter but I know how it works in these shelters. Humans over look me for little dogs and tiny cute puppies. But the workers tell me I am cute and they don't understand why I am still here. They say that they would take me if they could, but I wonder why they cant?

Please don't leave him in the shelter. He needs a home.
Call Silvia and Debbie now,,,,,Silvia is 910-876-0539 and Debbie is 339-832-0806. If Silvia's mailbox is full you can Text her. Transportation is generally available up and down the East Coast from NC, VA, MD, NJ, PA, NY and the North East.

name: Riley
description:
Meet Riley,  a Hound mix born around 6/22/19. She is a wonderful little girl; a silly, goofy bucket of love.  Riley loves everyone she meets, both people and dogs alike. She likes to be around her family, not needing constant attention, just to be a part of the family. She likes to play with both balls and ropes toys, and outside \"chase\" is the game of choice.  She is a charmer, and no one has been able to resist falling in love with this sweet girl. Riley is doing well with her crate and house training. Her foster mom is working on her basic commands. She knows \"sit\" and comes when called. Riley and her sisters came to the rescue as tiny little babies, eyes still closed so they have known nothing but love and affection. She will weigh around 60 pounds when full grown. Due to her age, she will need someone home more often than not. She will need a large (structural, not invisible) fenced in yard. She is not a candidate for apartments, condos or town homes.  Her adoption fee will include current vaccines, microchip and spay.  To inquire about adopting this awesome puppy, please email adopt@carolinapaws.com

Adoption events are held on Saturdays from (11-2) inside the Blakeney Petsmart (9911 Rea Road Charlotte, NC) in the small animal section.* * * Please note: We do not accept applications at our adoption events.  Please review our adoption requirements on our website and if interested in one of our rescued cats/dogs complete the online application.  Submitting an application does not obligate you to adopt nor guarantee an adoption.  It is in everyone's best interest to ensure the best possible match, and your cooperation is appreciated. 

We are only accepting applications from the greater Charlotte North Carolina area and certain surrounding counties.

name: Ricky
description:
Meet Ricky, a 5 year old American Staffordshire Terrier mix.   Ricky is a super sweet fun loving, full of life boy!  He may be 5 but he is a puppy at heart and loves to play with tennis balls, people and doggy friends.  He gets along great with all dogs.  He rides great in the car and is house and crate trained.   He is eager to please and knows basic commands.  After a long day of play you will find him snuggled up by your feet with his dog bone.  He would love a yard to run and play in and will thrive in a structured home with lots of love to give!   Ricky is ready to find a family to call his own.  He is neutered, microchipped and current on vaccines.  If you are looking for an amazing addition to your family contact us today at adopt@carolinapaw.com to meet Ricky.   

Adoption events are held on Saturdays from (11-2) inside the Blakeney Petsmart (9911 Rea Road Charlotte, NC) in the small animal section.* * * Please note: We do not accept applications at our adoption events. Please review our adoption requirements on our website and if interested in one of our rescued cats/dogs complete the online application. Submitting an application does not obligate you to adopt nor guarantee an adoption. It is in everyone's best interest to ensure the best possible match, and your cooperation is appreciated. 

We are only accepting applications from the greater Charlotte North Carolina area and certain surrounding counties.

name: Callie
description:
Meet Callie a gorgeous 1 year Lab mix.  Callie has the most stunning eyes!  This sweet fun loving girl was rescued from a local shelter and is adjusting well in her foster home.  Callie is eager to please and learn.  She is very treat motivated and already knows some basic commands like sit and stay.  She loves to play in her foster's yard on a sunny day.   She is great with everyone she meets and cannot get enough attention.  She is a big fan of any toy you put in front of her.  This playful, goofy girl will surely bring lots of love and laughter to any family.   After a long day of play you will find her curled up on her dog bed.  She is good in the car, loves to go for runs, and will make a wonderful companion.  She will weigh about 50lbs, is up to date on vaccines, spayed and microchipped. Callie is best suited in a home with children 12 years or older.   If you are interested in adding Callie to your family, contact us today at adopt@carolinapaws.com.

Adoption events are held on Saturdays from (11-2) inside the Blakeney Petsmart (9911 Rea Road Charlotte, NC) in the small animal section.* * * Please note: We do not accept applications at our adoption events.  Please review our adoption requirements on our website and if interested in one of our rescued cats/dogs complete the online application.  Submitting an application does not obligate you to adopt nor guarantee an adoption.  It is in everyone's best interest to ensure the best possible match, and your cooperation is appreciated. 

We are only accepting applications from the greater Charlotte North Carolina area and certain surrounding counties.

name: Droopy
description: This young man (1-2 years old) was pulled from a very high-kill shelter in rural NC.  He had an issue with a foster's cat, so was returned.  He is now with a behaviorist who has worked through the problem and raves about his wonderful personality.  He does well with dogs his own size or larger, but should not be around smaller dogs or cats.  He does listen very well when on a leash..  A sweet boy who was under nourished when he came to us, he's filling out nicely.  He was diagnosed HW positive, but is undergoing treatment (oral) and will be ready to meet his new family very soon.  Currently in LaGrange (near Goldsboro), NC

name: Aroon
description:
Looking for the elusive leisurely hound dog? Meet Aroon! Aroon was rescued from a small shelter in NC. 

Aroon like any good red-blooded hound is a connoisseur of food and will SNIFF out only the best treats. Aroon is between 60lbs. He is a Redbone Coonhound mix that is about 5-6 years old. He spends his day inside asleep on the softest bed; outside he let's his nose show him the way! He absolutely loves playing with toys including killing the squeakers. He also loves playing in the toy box and pulling out all the toys. Aroon is dog friendly but would be happy being the center of attention in his family. 

Aroon is house and crate trained. 

Apply: www.blackjackrescue.org 
Questions: Rachel@blackjackrescue.org

name: Clover
description:
Clover is a 14 yr old cutie pie.  She was recently owner surrendered along with David, a 5 yr old Chihuahua.  

Clover has recently had a dental and is fully vaccinated and negative for heart worms.  She is a sweet girl that bonds easily.   Could you be her retirement home?

The adoption fee is $250.00.  A fenced yard is sometimes required, for certain dogs, for their safety and for exercise.  ARFP home delivers 300 miles roundtrip from Greensboro, NC.

name: Willow
description:
Hi, my name is Willow, and I can be sweet as pie, or I can be a bit of a jerk! But please adopt me anyway :) 

Willow is a beautiful girl, who is a bit of a diva. She is particular about her choice of canine friends, and can be a little particular about her people friends as well. She will require several introductions before she gets to know you, and can be a bit \"standoffish\" at first. However, we have no doubt that once Willow finds her people, she will be a great companion! Willow came to us from a NC county shelter, and for that reason, she needs a little help building trust with her people friends. Hotdogs are her favorite, and have helped her gain trust with volunteers. Willow can also be possessive of her things, so we do not recommend her in a home with small children or other pets.

name: Lady Bunny
description:
Lady Bunny is a female double merle Australian Shepherd located in Fayetteville, NC.
She is around 6 months of age and is expected to be somewhere between 30-40 lbs when full grown.
As a result of being a double merle Lady Bunny is completely deaf, blind in the left eye but does have some vision on the right.
It's very important to remember that she was born this way so she doesn't realize she's any different and it certainly doesn't slow her down at all.
She is a rather strong willed girl, very smart and high energy!
She is very treat motivated which has made training a lot easier!
So far she is doing fantastic with the hand signals for sit, down, stand, come, stay and spin.
She walks well on leash too.
She is fully crate trained and is doing great with house training.
Lady Bunny would do best with someone that is willing/able to continue her training. 
Aussies are a very smart breed and love to learn.
Lacking some vision from one eye and hearing doesn't change that.
Training is also a great bonding tool!
She absolutely loves playing with other dog's and would do great with another doggie companion.
It would be best for any potential doggie friends to have a more playful/high energy personality because we feel Lady Bunny would be rather overwhelming for an older more laid back dog.
She loves her people and is very attentive, meaning she checks in frequently without being reminded.
She stays too busy to be a cuddler though.
We are recommending she go to a home without small children due to the fact that when she gets overly excited, she can bite down a little too hard.
Not aggressively at all but it does pinch.
Being an energetic young puppy at times she still finds it difficult to keep all 4 paws on the floor when greeting people.
Lady Bunny isn't a fan of sharing her food or high value treats with doggie friends.
We have been working on this and she has made great progress so it very manageable.
Foster mom can fill you in on what we have been doing to work on the issue.
Lady Bunny is spayed, up to date on all vaccinations, current on heart worm/flea tick prevention and she is also microchipped.
We are requiring a meet and greet prior to adoption.
This is just to help ensure we get the best match possible for Lady Bunny as well as the potential adopter.
With her high energy level and love for playing with other dog's, we feel any existing dog's will need to meet her as well to make sure they don't feel overwhelmed by her high energy playful self.
If you think you would be interested in meeting this adorable girl please follow this link to submit an application-

https://www.australianshepherdsfurever.org/adoption-applicaâ¦

name: Baxter
description:
Baxter, a 3-year-old Shih Tzu mix and about 14 lbs, had a very rough start in life. Even though his previous owners threw him out of a car window, he has improved by leaps & bounds! He loves people, toys, and everything about his new life.

Baxter is thriving in his foster home and is the perfect little companion. He is very loyal to his people and super affectionate. He loves to sit in your lap and adores belly rubs. He has fun playing fetch with his favorite toy and going on daily walks. Baxter would do well as an only pet or with a friend â he loves everyone!  He is housebroken.

Unfortunately, Baxter was heartworm positive, but he started his treatment and is on his way to a healthy new life. Baxter will be available for adoption after completing his heartworm treatment (early Oct). We are currently taking applications so he can go straight to his new home when ready. Baxter is a foster-to-adopt candidate if you are located in the Greensboro, NC area.

If you are interested in adopting this dog, contact h2hadoptions@gmail.com. An all adult home with a fenced yard (fence must be attached to the home) is required to adopt from Hart-2-Heart Rescue.

There is an application process and adoption fee. We are an all-volunteer organization, and in addition to saving dogs, we have other responsibilities, so we appreciate your patience and understanding during this process. Response time can take up to 5 business days.

Please inquire only if you are willing to come to Greensboro, North Carolina to meet the dog after we schedule your home visit. We do not ship dogs or put them on transports. Adoption fee is $350.

Veterinary Care: All Hart-2-Heart Rescue foster dogs are spayed/neutered, current on heartworm prevention, parvo/distemper, bordetella, and rabies vaccines and are professionally groomed. As needed, our foster dogs have teeth cleanings, extractions, bloodwork and other diagnostic testing.

name: Simba
description:
Meet Simba from the Guilford County Animal Shelter.  Sweet Simba was brought to the shelter and was part of a hoarding situation. He sat there for a week and became  very ill with kennel cough. He was urgent and had to get out. 

He is a 2 to 3 year old lab mix and weighs around 46 lbs. He needs to put on weight so will be around 50lbs. 

In swoops his foster mom Samantha to save the day!
He has had some time to decompress and this is what we know about him: 
**Loves his tennis ball
**Loves to play around the pool, not sure about swimming yet
**Loves to sleep on the bed, but also doesnt mind his crate 
**Already knows that the outdoors is for pees and poops
**Likes taking walks but still not sure about the neighborhood dogs. Once he is neutered he will let you know. He is scheduled for Neuter this Thursday. 
**Heartworm status: Negative!

He is located in Greensboro, NC. Adoption applications are online at www.tailsoftheunwanted.org

name: CAMI
description:
Pick me only if you're ready for loads of fun. I'm CAMI, a mischievous, pint sized mouthy female BULLDOG LAB MIX puppy. My coat is as white as snow with tan and blue markings. I first said hello to the world on April 04, 2019 as I was born at MMFFR located in CAMERON, NC. My parents are both lovable and smart while they possess loyal and devoted personalities. Having inherited my parents good traits and personalities is the reason they say I am strong-willed right to the core. You can count on me for a friendly wag, a happy hello and lots of wet puppy kisses too. I'll already be fully vaccinated and have my health certificate from previously having my vet check. While I may be demanding and obnoxiously  energetic at times, remember that I am always ready to bring you heaps of joy. Living currently in CAMERON, NC with my rescue mom at our rescue home, I am patiently awaiting to meet my forever companion soon. If you have the time to devote all your love to me then what are you waiting for, contact my rescue mom via email. Otherwise to adopt CAMI or for more information complete our pre-adoption form to schedule an official meet & greet visit.

Personality: strong-willed
Date Available: Available Today!

What's Included:
Vet Checked
Up to Date Vaccinations
Child Friendly
Pet Friendly
Cat Friendly
Dog Friendly

name: BUBBLES
description:
Meet BUBBLES, a rambunctious BULLDOG LAB MIX puppy whoâs ready to take on the world. Debuting her arrival into this world on April 04, 2019 BUBBLES and siblings are now 14 weeks old. BUBBLES sports a bouncy personality and carries a beautiful golden colored coat. In addition, BUBBLES upon being adopted  will arrive at her new home already socialized, fully vaccinated, and come with a clean bill of health. We've poured ourselves into raising this little gem and promise you a loyal and devoted puppy with inherited traits from both parents with quiet and reserve personalities. If youâre browsing for adoptable puppies and are located in or around CAMERON, NC, be sure to check out this charming little gal. We are experienced in adoptions and have procedures to ensure that all companion animals get safely to their new homes even for those adoptions that are slightly farther away. We take pride and joy in raising healthy, socialized rescue pups. If you want more information on BUBBLES or are interested in possibly adopting her feel free to contact us via email or by completing our pre-adoption form to initiate your official meet & greet visit with BUBBLES.

Personality: bouncy

name: MILO
description:
Meet MILO! A playful BULLDOG LAB MIX puppy in CAMERON, NC who is charismatic through and through. Weâve poured ourselves into raising this sweet little puppy that made his debut into the world on April 04, 2019, and are excited to secure MILO a safe and loving home! MILO loves to play, snuggle, and be a favorite pal. With proper training, MILO will make a great family pet or join alongside a caring single. Showing off a stunning white coat, MILO comes from parents of companionable and family-oriented personalities. When he is adopted MILO will arrive home already vaccinated, good natured, and energetic. The bags are packed and MILO is ready to venture into the new world of finding him a forever home! We strive to raise socialized, fun-loving rescue puppies that are a perfect match for puppy lovers located in CAMERON, NC or nearby areas. If your interested in learning more about MILO or want more information on how you can become his potential adoptive family, feel free contact us or complete the pre-adoption form to schedule your 1st meet & greet visit with MILO.

Personality: charismatic

name: ROXIE - COURTESY LISTING
description:
MEET ROXIE ~ Courtesy Listing

ROXIE is a BEAUTIFUL and SWEET Brindle and White American Pitbull Terrier/Labrador Retriever Mix.  She is approximately four (4) years old and weighs 70 lbs.  ROXIE is spayed and is up to date on all vaccinations including rabies. She is currently on HW prevention.   She is house trained.   ROXIE loves people. Adults and older children will be great for her.   

She is very smart and knows some commands such as: sit, lie down, and taking food gently. With additional training, she could learn much, much more! 

ROXIE loves other dogs and adores people. In fact, she would love to spend all her time hanging out with her people and have a dog sibling to hang out with.   She chases cats, so a home without kitties would be best. The fastest way to her heart is through a belly rub.   

ROXIE is still young and gets anxious when left all alone, so she would need to be crated when you leave home.  ROXIE will need positive crate training.  She has met with a great trainer (Total Pet Care LLC.) and everyone thinks that with someone who can give her the training, time and patience that she needs, ROXIE will be able to overcome her separation anxiety!  She will win over any pet sitter or dog walker that may help throughout the day. Total Pet Care LLC will also donate an e-session for foster/adopter transition counseling.  She is a loyal, loving and affectionate girl just waiting to find her forever home. Is it you?' 

ROXIE is currently located in Lillington, NC. 

If you are interested in adopting ROXIE, please contact Rebecca Gridley via e-mail to: totalpetnc@gmail.com

name: Chloe1 (CL)
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.

COURTESY LISTING
- Please contact person below with inquiries.

~3.8 years old. Good with kids, Not good with dogs and cats.

Leigh Moore

Trinity, NC

lamoore121@hotmail.com

Date Posted: 08/14/2019

Chloe is a very sweet and loving dog. She loves to go for rides and rides very well. She loves to go for walks and walks well on a leash. Chloe loves her toys and is very playful. We do take her outside without her leash. She stays in the yard as long as you stay with her. She doesn't like other animals. She stays inside our home all of the time. She does well when left for a period of time. She does like to get on the couch, but only when we leave the house. I put a sheet over part of the couch and that's the only place that she lays. She has not had an accident in our house since she's been here. We've had Chloe in our home since October. My husband rescued her from New Bern. Her family was displaced and couldn't take proper care of her. Her former owners expressed a desire for my husband to bring her home and take good care of her. He brought her back and we had her checked out at our vet the next morning. Chloe tested positive for heartworms. She has completed treatment and is now heartworm negative. She gets Heart Guard monthly, as well as NexGuard. She is current on all vaccines. She has not been spayed. We couldn't have that done while she was being treated for heartworms. Chloe loves to be petted on and brushed. She is an awesome dog! We would keep her, but she doesn't get along with our boxers. She would be a great fit for someone only wanting one pet.

PLEASE NOTE: THIS IS NOT A GSRA DOG. ONLY CONTACT THIS INDIVIDUAL ABOUT THIS DOG. THE CONTACT HAS NO AFFILIATION WITH GSRA AND GSRA CANNOT ANSWER QUESTIONS ABOUT THIS DOG.

name: Callie
description:
Howlo! My name is Callie and Iâm an adorable dog searching for a loving family. I hear about them all the time from my friends that have arrived in New Hampshire and they tell me thereâs nothing like having a family of your very own!	

A good day for me is when I get to enjoy snuggling with my human friends, maybe playing a game of chase with my furry friends, and then enjoying a delicious treat. I love days like those! I just know thereâs a family out there that loves those things too! 

A few basic details about me. Iâm around 3.5 months old and 20 lbs. 

If youâre ready to welcome home a great dog, contact Maryâs Dogs and ask for Callie! I canât wait to meet you! 

Would you like more information on this adorable pup? Email us at:  marysdogsadoptions@gmail.com or submit an online questionnaire at: https://www.marysdogs.com/adoption-questionnaire which OFFICIALLY gets you on the path to bringing home your new furry family member!

name: Baby
description:
Baby is 12 to 14 years old and weighs about 15 pounds. To maintain control of bladder stones, he does well with both canned and dry Royal Canin SO, including treats. Baby is very fond of his human mom who is unable to keep him any longer, and he will want to have that same loving attachment with his new adopter.

Baby is usually nice to people and other dogs, but may be inconsistent. An alpha personality, he barks at cats, birds, and squirrels--who doesn't!  Baby is well-behaved at the vet and is good friends with his local postman. His retired groomer loves him and even returns regularly to groom Baby as necessary.  

Please contact Animal Allies if you are able to ADOPT or FOSTER Baby at 609-737-2380.

We do local adoptions less than one hour from our central New Jersey location. Email us for our ADOPTION APPLICATION or with questions, or call us at 609-737-2380. 

Our dogs are spayed or neutered before adoption. They receive age-appropriate shots and worming, flea/tick preventative, and any other medical treatments that they require to be healthy.  Dogs over the age of eight months are tested for heartworm and Lyme disease.  Negative dogs receive heartworm preventative; positive dogs are medically treated prior to adoption.

name: Tessa
description:
Tessa, a pit bull terrier/lab mix weighing 60 pounds, is a enthusiasic dog who currently lives in a foster home.  She is playful, ougoing, and a little goofy sometimes but also likes to follow her person around and is content to lay at their side. What a snuggler!

Tessa is great with people but NOT great with other dogs or cats.  She is house trained, crate trained, knows basic commands such as 'sit', 'lay down' and 'spin' and is having a lot of fun learning others. She also walks well on a leash and requires a fully fenced yard.

We do local adoptions less than one hour from our central New Jersey location. See our ADOPTION APPLICATION on the main page of our website. We an also EMAIL our application to you. For questions, email AnimalAlly@gmail.com or call us at 609-737-2380.

Our dogs are spayed or neutered before adoption. They receive age-appropriate shots and worming, flea/tick preventative, and any other medical treatments that they require.  Dogs over the age of eight months are tested for heartworm and Lyme disease.  Negative dogs receive heartworm preventative; positive dogs are medically treated prior to adoption.  To read about how ANIMAL ALLIES conducts adoptions, please visit our home page at aa.petfinder.com.

name: Marley
description:
Marley, three years old and a cross between a Rottweiler and a German Shepherd, is very handsome.  He is happy-go-lucky and playful, and is charming and very lovable with his people.  However, Marley has been diagnosed as partially blind and therefore he can become confused and upset when there is too much action going on. A large dog, Marley weighs over one hundred pounds, so we want him to have a home and environment that will feel very safe to him. He must have a home with adults and older children only, with a physical fenced yard. Please contact us for more information. All medical is complete. Marley does not attend our adoption days.

We do local adoptions less than one hour from our central New Jersey location. See our ADOPTION APPLICATION on the main page of our website. We can also EMAIL our application to you. For questions, email AnimalAlly@gmail.com or call us at 609-737-2380.

Our dogs are spayed or neutered before adoption.  They receive age-appropriate shots and worming, flea/tick preventative, and any other medical treatments that they require.  Dogs over the age of eight months are tested for heartworm and Lyme disease, are treated if necessary, and are given preventative.  To read about how ANIMAL ALLIES conducts adoptions, please visit our home page at aa.petfinder.com.

name: Lula
description:
Lula came to us from a local New Jersey shelter where she was loved by many of the volunteers.  Lula is super sweet and loving but is in need of a confidence booster.  We believe she would do best in a home with another confident dog who can help her.  Lula has a bit of separation anxiety but with the help of another dog and a family who spends more time at home than away, she will overcome it in time.  Lula is young and eager to please everyone she meets.  She is so excited to find her forever home where she can curl up on the couch and get endless belly rubs.

If you think Lula sounds perfect for your family, then go to bfdaaa.com to complete an application.

name: Freddie
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.FREDDIE

BOXER MIX MALE.

ADULT/ CHILD-FRIENDLY/ DOG-FRIENDLY

HOUSEBROKEN

NEWEST VIDEO LINK: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BaF1bLXC4WI&feature=youtu.be

VIDEO LINK: https://youtu.be/ExVtVYJeaXM

POOR FREDDIE WAS RETURNED TO RESCUE RIDGE. Poor, sweet, handsome, Freddie was returned to Rescue Ridge through no fault of his own. His owner is ill and cannot care for him. We need your help in finding Freddie a new, loving, forever home.
Will you help us to help him? Freddie is a loving, affectionate, playful, now almost 5 yr. old, Staffordshire Terrier or Hound/ Boxer mix guy who was saved by Rescue Ridge from a local, New Jersey, overcrowded shelter last year (2/16). His family could not keep him and Rescue Ridge stepped up to save him. . Freddie is adult friendly, housebroken, too! He was then adopted through Rescue Ridge last year and was living the good life. Now, he needs our help again. He loves to run, snuggle, play ball, and go for walks. He knows \"Sit\" and takes toys, treats and food gently. Freddie is fabulous in the car and promises to be your best co- pilot ever! Please apply to foster or adopt Freddie in central N. J. at RescueRidge.com and email: rescueridgeshelter@gmail.com or text us at 732-546-8805 Here is his previous Youtube video link: https://youtu.be/ExVtVYJeaXM Stay tuned for a new one. Please share widely.

name: Patch
description:
This handsome smiley boy is Patch.  He was rescued from a crowded New Jersey shelter, where he lived for 18 months.  We can't even imagine this sweet soul living on concrete for so long.  He is now currently in a foster home and looking for his forever home.  Patch is about 3 years old, is loving, loyal and eager to please.  He enjoys car rides, especially if it means a trip to the pet store for some treats or a toy.  Patch craves attention and loves walking around the neighborhood looking for kids to give him belly rubs.  He told us children give the BEST belly rubs because their small hands make him ticklish.  He would do great in a home with children over the age of 10.  Since he is bigger and energetic we feel older children would be better!  His smile is infectious and all you want to do when you meet him is smoosh his big face.

If you are interested in adopting Patch, please go to bfdaaa.com to complete an application.

name: Liutenant Dan
description:
Hey everyone! My name is Lt. Dan and I am a year old mixed breed dog. We think I might be an Australian Cattle Dog mix or something, but one thing is for sure: I'm 100% handsome! I'm even more handsome with three legs! Your eyes do not deceive you: I am tripawed and a lucky boy. I am awesome with other dogs but my foster mom says I'm not that great with cats because oh boy do I like to chase them. I'm pretty food motivated and will take all of the snacks you'll give me... but I need a new family to help me watch my figure because of my disability.

Truth be told, I did not have the best start in life. I was dumped on the side of a road where I searched for my family and had to fend for myself. While looking for my family I was hit by a car. I was scared and lonely and was hurt really bad. I was so scared of people and it took three big scary men to catch me. They brought me to a hospital where I met my foster mom. She gave me pain medication and advocated for me. This is where the amazing Mel said foster mom could bring me into the rescue and make me better. They amputated my leg and my foster mom slowly gained my trust as I healed. As you can imagine I am still very scared around new people and strangers. I need my new family to come meet me a few times before I can go home with them. It would also be great if my new family has worked with a fearful dog before. I am getting better with trusting my foster mom about strangers and ignoring them. I love playing with my foster brothers and sisters and can play all day. I have foster kitties in the house that I will chase if they run. I am going to go play with my foster siblings now and my foster mom will tell you more.

Lt. Dan is up to date on vaccines, heartworm negative, and on flea, tick and heartworm prevention monthly. He LOVES playing with other dogs and gets along with dogs of all sizes. He can live with dog savvy cats. Lt. Dan is fearful of new people and his adopter with be required to come to New Jersey a few times to meet him and spend some time with him before he can go to his new home. His adopters will also need to have experience with fearful dogs and will need to work with a positive reinforcement trainer. Once he learns to trust you, Lt. Dan will cuddle with you all day if you let him. He is a medium energy dog who just wants to be with his person. He will gladly occupy you on a long walk or cuddle on the couch all day with you. Because he had his leg amputated his adopters will need to be vigilant about his diet, weight and keep him exercised. Lt. Dan has had a rough beginning but with love and dedication he can overcome his past and be a loving member of a family. Could that be you?

SOHO is a 501c3 public charity focusing on rescuing herding dogs in crisis on the East Coast. Your pets will need to be up to date on vaccinations and heartworm preventative in order to be considered for adoption. Lt. Dan does have some additional adoption requirements: his foster mom would like a potential adopter to come and visit Lt. Dan a few times before taking him home in order to help him bond to his new family. Please note that Lt. Dan is located in HIGHLAND LAKES, NEW JERSEY.

name: Spot
description:
Spot is a six-year-old blue Doberman and came to us from a shelter in northern New Mexico. This gentle giant is such a loverâhe just always wants to snuggle and be right next to you, he will nudge his nose on your leg to get attention. He is very unaware of his size and is always trying to climb into his foster momâs lap. If you are laying on the couch or bed Spot will be right next to you and will make sure he can get as close as he can, so he gets lots of love.

He is crate trained and stays in the crate while his foster family is at work. He also sleeps the night in his crate just like the other pups in the house. Just say the word kennel and he will rush into his crate for that snack. He is very food motivated and is super gentle in taking treats. He knows basic commands like sit and down. He works well with snaps or a clicker when it comes to listening.

He gets along great with other dogs and can play all day with his toys and is always willing to give up his toy to the pesky puppies in the house. He lets these little girls crawl all over him and loves to play and chase them all over the backyard. You can tell he has been around lots of puppies in his life because he is as calm as it gets when these girl nibble and lick him to death. It did take him a while to open up to the other male dog in the house, but now they are buddies and you can see them lounging together on the bed or couch as well as running around to catch the puppies in the backyard. He is learning the leash but does get distracted easily and sometimes likes to pull when he sees something. But with work this can be broken. He weighs almost 80 pounds and has bald spots that unfortunately have not started to re grow even with proper food and care. But this is common with Blue Dobies and Spot doesn't know he is bald :)

name: Peanut2
description:
I live in Valencia County, New Mexico.

I was rescued from a hoarder in Las Cruces, New Mexico.

I have not been around people much, so they scare me. I need someone who has the patience to show me that people are not bad.

I have been micro-chipped.

At the time of this posting I am 5 years old.

name: SANDY
description:
Sandy is a beautiful senior girl who would love to sit on the couch and enjoy TV with you. Sandy is a senior so she does go out to the bathroom often. She loves to be outside in the yard and soak up the sun, she enjoys her walks too. Sandy is looking for someone she can enjoy her golden years with, someone who can just love her, cuddle her, and make her feel like a princess.

Sandy would do best in a home where there are no other dogs or a very submissive dog that is about her size. She would be an ideal match for a couple, maybe even an older couple who understand what it's like to be aging.Sandy is located in New Windsor, NY (not too far from Poughkeepsie). Why not visit her and see if there's a love match? If you have another dog, you will need to bring him/her along.

Sandy is spayed, up-to-date on all vaccinations, and is microchipped. 

Please note: While some of our dogs have lived in a home environment, we cannot guarantee that they are housetrained.

Interested in fostering or adopting? Need more info on this dog? Want to set up a meet and greet? The first step in the process is filling out an application on our website.


	Adoption application: www.nycsecondchancerescue.org/general-application/
	Foster application:https://www.nycsecondchancerescue.org/dog-foster-application/
	Adoption process & fees:www.nycsecondchancerescue.org/process/
	Upcoming events:www.facebook.com/pg/SecondChanceRescueNycDogs/events
	States we adopt to:NY, NJ, CT, DE, PA, MD, NH, ME, VT, RI, MA

name: GINGER
description: Ginger is a beautiful one-year-old husky mix waiting to meet you! Ginger arrived here from an overcrowded shelter in the south; and after a long trip to New York, she's ready to find her forever family. She gets along well with all dogs and kids of all ages. However, she is a bit afraid of cats. Ginger is a moderate energy dog with a sweet, gentle personality. She is already crate trained and house trained, and knows her sit and down commands. Come meet this sweet girl today!

name: Apple
description:
Apple is a 2 year old female Jindo mix weighing 16lbs who was rescued from the Korean Meat Trade and brought to New York to find her forever home. She gets along well with other dogs, and loves running around in the yard with them. She is shy when first meeting new people, but with time and patience she gets comfortable and cuddly. She is currently working on her leash training and housebreaking. She will definitely need another four legged creature in the home and a quieter household without a lot of coming and going. A securely fenced yard is also a plus for this gal.

If you are interested in this dog, please submit an application directly to our website at www.ny-petrescue.org Only applications submitted directly to Pet Rescue will be considered.

name: Winnie: medical hold (NY)
description:
Winnie is diabetic and is currently on medical hold while she gets her insulin stabilized. She is being fostered in NY state. 

What we know about Winnie:
*sweet
*loves to be with people
*prefers her space with other dogs
*housebroken
*sleeps through the night

What Winnie's foster mom has to say about Winnie:
Who's that girl with the golden waves? It's Winnie! Winnie is a beautiful terrier mix. She's about 7 years old, and she's already quite the traveler! Winnie came to BDRA from a shelter in New Mexico, and she charmed hearts all the way from New Mexico to New York!

Winnie loves her people with all that she has. Her perfect day is a day spent with her person, giving cuddles and kisses and getting belly rubs. She tries very hard to be a good girl.

Winnie wants to be with her people at all times. She'll follow you from room to room, and will lay happily at your feet or in your lap as you work or watch TV. Sometimes she follows me so closely she actually steps on my feet. She can also be timid and submissive, and if she thinks she's in your way, she will do her best to avoid you.

Winnie has late immature cataracts, but has functional vision at this time. As her vision declines, she may be a candidate for cataract surgery. She receives eye drops every 12 hours and is an angel! She also has Anisocoria, which means her pupils are two different sizes. This does not affect her now, but will need to be regularly monitored. She is housebroken and sleeps quietly through the night.

Winnie can be tolerant of the other dogs (all males) and cats (one male, one female) in her foster home and may even sleep next to one, but more often, she does not like when another dog or cat gets too close to her. She'll give a warning growl, and if the dog doesn't move away, she will lunge. It does not escalate further than that. Out of the four male dogs here, there is one dog she likes very much (a blind poodle mix).

Winnie is diabetic and came into rescue underweight. She has since gained several pounds and is even a bit overweight! As she was an untreated diabetic, her diabetes is still being regulated, and so she will remain on medical hold. 
Blind Dog Rescue Alliance has voted against the use of electric fencing effective immediately.

name: Vinny
description: Before you ask about Vinny please read the full description.  Vinny is NOT your typical easy  going sweet beagle.  I know the photo is misleading however he can be quite the charmer with MEN.  Vinny is a self-conscious type of dog and is very suspicious of human motives when approached.  We attribute this to unpleasant early life experiences.  Vinny will do well in a home with just one man or a couple with dog experience.  Although good a on leash we just don't trust his behavior if a child were to run up to him or a person wanting to prove all dogs love them bends over his head.  He'd be OK in a  fenced yard and walks taken where there is limited exposure to encountering others.  Nose to the ground in the country he's probably a great candidate as a hunting dog.  He's more of that type of beagle than a docile house pet.    His guesstimated age is about FIVE years of age and he was rescued from a Newark, NJ shelter. He weighs in the range of 25 pounds.   He enthusiastically runs to you when called,  sits politely for food, guarding a bone is another matter so no long lasting treats for Vinny.  He goes to his bed/crate when asked,  He opts to hide under a flannel blanket curled up so tight that you don't even know he's inside the blanket so of course he feels a little vulnerable when you wake him. He's a late sleeper and he grumbles when he doesn't want to get up but we all know someone like this! He's a very clean dog too that takes his business outdoors. Vinny likes car rides.   He's is OK with cats and great with other usually bigger dogs. Bottom line if you're a single male in a more suburban or country location, don't have kids; like to hike for long periods of time Vinny could really make a turn around  in his behavior.  I believe the key to his success is sufficient exercise to relieve his tension coupled with a protocol for rehabilitating his unwanted quirks.  To meet Vincent in Blairstown e:mail auntmarysdoghouse@yahoo.com or call 908-362-1333

name: Cappuccino
description: CAPPUCCINO was transferred from Newark AHS. He is a 4 and a half year old friendly boy who likes other dogs and is a handsome boy. He is friendly meeting people and has done well at adoption events. CAPPUCCINO will make an excellent companion. Please come visit the animals at EASEL Animal Rescue League, behind the Ewing Municipal Building at 4 Jake Garzio Drive, Ewing. Adoption hours are every day from 12-3.

name: Sheba
description:
This spunky little lady is Sheba, a 4 year old pretty pittie that came to us from our Newark facility after being given up by an owner that just didn't want her anymore.  When you walk through the kennels and some dogs are barking, trying to get your attention, Sheba is the one sitting quietly, politely looking up at you, hoping you'll ask to meet her.  Politeness is one of Sheba's finest qualities!  Sure, she's a little powerhouse on a leash, but she is perfectly behaved.  She sits when asked and takes treats gently.  She takes a quick zoom around our exercise yard, chases after a few toys, then comes right back to stand beside you and get lots of attention.  She adores people and if she was any sweeter she would be made of sugar.  Sheba doesn't have much experience with other dogs but she is open to meeting them and seeing how it goes.  Come in and meet this little butt-wiggler.....you'll love her!  File#28915  3/5/19

If interested please visit our Forked River Shelter. We are open Mon. - Fri. from 
12:00 P. M. - 6:00 P. M.; and Sat. & Sun. 12:00 P. M. - 5:00 P. M. for directions call 609-693-1900. There is an adoption donation required. The society cannot accept personal checks but we do accept Visa, MC, AE, Discover and cash. As part of our adoption process, we must have proof of residency. Homeowners must show proof of ownership; landlord approval is required for renters before an adoption can be approved.And as always we thank you for your kindness in opening your heart & home to a Society orphan.

name: Tank
description:
Tank is a fun and be-boppy little guy of about 4 years old that would love a great home, and a family that will take him on hikes, adventures, and outings!  He has the energy to do whatever activity you're up for!  Tank came to us from our Newark facility after he was found as a stray one day, roaming around a park.  Tank was taught some manners in his day, and he's such a great boy.  He sits when asked, is easy going with treats and toys, and he's so incredibly friendly.  He loves making new friends and he enjoys meeting other larger dogs too.  He will need a home with no small dogs or cats.  Tank would love a home with nice fenced yard to get his jumpies out in, and he's not the couch-potato type, so he'll need daily exercise too.  He will keep that big smile going and that tail swishing if you just give him a chance!  File#28949  4/6/19

If interested please visit our Forked River Shelter. We are open Mon. - Fri. from 
12:00 P. M. - 6:00 P. M.; and Sat. & Sun. 12:00 P. M. - 5:00 P. M. for directions call 609-693-1900. There is an adoption donation required. The society cannot accept personal checks but we do accept Visa, MC, AE, Discover and cash. As part of our adoption process, we must have proof of residency. Homeowners must show proof of ownership; landlord approval is required for renters before an adoption can be approved.And as always we thank you for your kindness in opening your heart & home to a Society orphan.

name: Abel
description:
Abel is a beautiful shepherd mix of about 2 years old that would just love a great new home.  He came to us in July, 2018 from our Newark facility after he was found in such a sad state.  Abel was found roaming the streets with an old cast on his badly broken leg.  Sadly, the leg could not be saved and was amputated but he has adjusted and made a complete recovery.  Abel was adopted last year but was returned because he kept bugging the other dog in the home until they got into a fight.  Abel has lots of energy and always wants to play so while he needs a home with no cats or small dogs, a larger dog with a similar personality could work out.  He is a barrel of laughs, always wanting to hop around, run, play, and have a great time.  He's sweet and friendly, and loves everyone he meets.  He will bring lots of laughs and happiness to the good family that welcomes him home.  File#28388  1/15/19

If interested please visit our Forked River Shelter. We are open Mon. - Fri. from 
12:00 P. M. - 6:00 P. M.; and Sat. & Sun. 12:00 P. M. - 5:00 P. M. for directions call 609-693-1900. There is an adoption donation required. The society cannot accept personal checks but we do accept Visa, MC, AE, Discover and cash. As part of our adoption process, we must have proof of residency. Homeowners must show proof of ownership; landlord approval is required for renters before an adoption can be approved.And as always we thank you for your kindness in opening your heart & home to a Society orphan.

name: XP Molly - Newark, NJ
description:
Meet Molly - she's a sweet-as-pie Brindle/Blue Nose Pit Bull who needs a new place to live. Molly is 3 years old & she LOVES to cuddle! As you can see in her photos, she loves kids and meeting new people - she loves to play and does well with other dogs, too.

Molly is an amazing dog overall - she's the biggest gentle giant you could ever meet. She's housetrained & quiet - she doesn't bark at all. She's always a happy camper and loves loves loves to be with her family at all times.

Molly is NOT with Eleventh Hour Rescue but we are helping network her so that she may find a new home. If you are interested in meeting Molly, please contact Amber at 862-322-9789. Molly is currently located in Newark, NJ.

name: Labradors
description:
The USDA, National Detector Dog Training Center located in Newnan, GA offers Labrador Retrievers,  beagles and lab and beagle mixes.  These are dogs that are not interested in being working dogs but would make wonderful pets. All adoptable dogs are spayed or neutered,  are current on vaccinations, have been tested negative for heartworms and parasites and have a microchip.  Please call for an adoption application and for more information. 
1-877-797-3899
Thanks

description: The USDA, National Detector Dog Training Center located in Newnan, GA offers Beagles, Labrador Retrievers and beagle and lab mixes.  These are dogs that are not interested in being working dogs but would make wonderful pets. All adoptable dogs are spayed or neutered,  are current on vaccinations, have been tested negative for heartworms and parasites and have a microchip.  Please call 1-877-797-3899 for an adoption application and for more information.

name: Sadie & Jada
description:
A SPECIAL NEEDS BONDED PAIR NEEDS OUR HELP!

Update: Sadie and Jada will soon be seeing a veterinary ophthalmologist for a complete exam.

Five year old Jada and her best buddy, six year old Sadie, are a truly bonded pair - and they're both blind.

Although Sadie, a neutered male, is blind he always knows where Jada is - and she relies on him. When they go for leash walks with their mom, Sadie is the leader and he walks ahead of his mom and Jada follows behind her - it's quite the parade.

Sadie was especially attached to his dad who died a few months ago. He was his loyal companion and stayed right with him throughout his illness. He was also with him when he died.

Jada and Sadie's owner now can't afford to care for them and she's anxious to get them both to a veterinary ophthalmologist for a thorough eye exam and treatment.

Our wonderful volunteer took them both to be groomed and vetted the week of August 7th.

The groomers adored both dogs. \"Jada is a real sweetheart\" and Sadie was fine once he was lifted onto the grooming table (because he is blind he was a bit panicked by being lifted by strangers but he settled down quickly.) Now both dogs are clean and beautiful!

Our vet diagnosed Jada with juvenile cataracts and we hope they're operable and she can regain some sight. Sadie has cataracts and glaucoma, he's now on two eye medications to help reduce the pressure in his eyes.

The immediate need is to find a loving, caring adult only home for these two special cockers. CSRNE will pay for all ophthalmological care and medications. Our vet said both dogs are otherwise in good health.

Both Jada And Sadie were purchased from a Manchester, NH pet store at 12 weeks of age. They started going blind when they were about 4 years old. Their condition, juvenile cataracts, is genetic so the purchased them from an irresponsible puppy  mill that is breeding cocker puppies with the gene  for juvenile cataracts. But quite frankly the puppy mill doesn't care - they've already gotten their money and now it's Jada and Sadie who will pay the real price for the irresponsible breeding practices of mercenary puppy mills and the pet stores who so carelessly purchase their puppies.

We can only help dogs like Jada and Sadie if you, our friends, become their advocates. Do you know a special person who might be willing to give these two dogs the care and attention they so deserve?

We know we're looking for a rare individual who has the time to care for Jada and Sadie but we're hoping their cocker angel is out there somewhere willing and able to help these two devoted cockers.

We ask everyone interested in adopting to please fill out and send in our adoption application and restraint agreement before we invite you to meet any dogs.   Once your application is approved, we can proceed!

Here is a link to our application and more information: http://csrne.org/adoption/apply-to-adopt/

name: Lulu  urgent **Needs a Foster Home***
description:
Please check out Lulu's personal facebook page: I love Lulu

If you are looking for a dog that brings a smile to your face and makes you laugh, Lulu is the dog for you. Lulu has a wonderful attitude about life, she is happy and contented no matter what the situation. 

Lulu knows her basic commands: sit, stay, down, heel, off, look at me and crate. 
Lulu graduated from 2 positive training classes with Wonder Dogs in West Berlin, NJ All the trainers just loved her and she learned so fast. 

She would do best in a home with older children as she jumps when excited.
Lulu is a smart pup and a quick learner. She is even great with agility.  She also has learned how to walk on a tredmill for exercise.

When she is not enjoying a walk or some play time, Lulu wants to snuggle up close to you on the couch and give kisses. She's a real love bug.
While she enjoys an active lifestyle, she is crate trained and is not stressed out by spending time in the crate. Lulu is very housebroken.

Because she hasn't lived with another dog before we feel she would benefit from being the only dog. She can have neighborhood dog friends to Walk with and play dates at home with dogs once she gets to know them well, and if their play style is similar to hers. Lulu enjoys being the center of attention with the people who love her. 

Lulu is in need of a Foster Home, or an Adopter. She is living in one of our partner boarding kennels, since her family returned her because they were having a baby. 
She is taken care of by the staff and our volunteers everyday, but she misses being in a home with someone to cuddle with and a fenced yard to play in. 
We offer to anyone interested in fostering or adopting to start out with weekend sleepovers or day trips, to spend time getting to know each other. 

The adoption fee for Lulu is waived because it is sponsored.

If you are interested in fostering or adopting Lulu please contact us at wjvolunteers@yahoo.com.

name: Buster
description:
Buster is a good boy who just needs a home and family of his own.

\"Hi, I am Buster. I am an adult male bulldog that ended up in the county kill shelter when an animal control picked me up as a stray. Sadly, my owners never came for me. I didn't mean to run away, I was just looking for love since my owners didn't have me neutered. I have not shown any aggression in the shelter but I know how it works in these shelters. Humans over look me for little dogs and tiny cute puppies. But the workers tell me I am cute and they don't understand why I am still here. They say that they would take me if they could, but I wonder why they cant?

Please don't leave him in the shelter. He needs a home.

name: Mylo
description:
Look at those big brown schnauzerly ? eyes of love ? 

Mylo is a special 10 year old Schnauzer looking for someone who appreciates his loyal and fiercely protective personality.  He was adopted 2 years ago but sadly surrendered due to his ownerâs health issues.  He is loving and playful and doesnât look or act like a senior at all, and gets along with most dogs.  Like so many schnauzers he thinks his job is to protect his person and is looking for an adult home with just one or 2 people he can bond to and not many people coming and going, or where he can be put away when guests visit.  
Email njwoof@cs.com for an appointment to meet him.

We do not have a shelter- all our pets are in foster homes and can be seen by appointment only during the week, or at our weekly pet adoptions every Sunday at the Animal Clinic of Morris Plains from 12:30 to 3PM at 3009 Route 10 East, Morris Plains, NJ.  Please email njwoof@cs.com for the fastest response to make sure the dog you are interested in will be there.
To help us better match a pet to your household, we request you fill out an application on our homepage www.secondchance.petfinder.com and copy and paste it into an email, or print it and bring it to our adoption day when you come.   Local inquiries only please- we do not do long distance adoptions.
Can't adopt but still want to help this dog?  Click on the Sponsor Me button at the top of this page to donate toward his/her care!  All donations are tax-deductible and go directly toward the care of our rescue dogs.  Thank you for your support!

name: Tiffany
description:
Meet Tiffany!  This sweet special old lady was abandoned after clearly being neglected and suffering  for a very long time.  
She was emaciated, suffering from untreated chronic dry eye, skin infections, ear infections, and parasites and is blind.  Sheâs feeling much better and looking for a loving home to in which to live out her golden years being spoiled and loved, and her medical care continued.  This gentle girl gets along with other gentle dogs and we think she is at least 12-14 years old.  Email njwoof@cs.com to meet Tiffany!

We have taken in so many local needy seniors recently, and in many cases we are their last and only chance. Thank you for your continued support so we can be there for them!

name: Twix-HOSPICE HOME NEEDED
description:
We are seeking a hospice home/foster for sad sweet little Twix...
This poor guy was given away by his original owner to a home that wasnât equipped to provide for his medical needs.  He has kidney disease, was Lyme positive, blind in one eye and a bit slow getting around and is being treated and doing better... we arenât sure how long he will do well for and are looking for someone to love him be it weeks, months, or years!  He is fine with other gentle dogs and is scared and confused but doesnât seem to have a mean bone in his body.  Please email njwoof@cs.com to meet Twix

Twix is just another of the many local needy seniors who have found their way to us recently- their care is expensive but worth it to give them a chance when they need help the most.  Please share and help us support his care so we can continue to help others like him!

name: Steve
description:
Meet Senior Steve!

This ~10 year old mostly toothless tiny terrier mix was left behind when his elderly owners moved- literally?
They left him in the street instead of bringing him to a shelter.  Luckily a neighbor took them in and reached out to rescues.  Poor Steve hadnât seen a vet in many years and in addition to his rotting teeth, had a very large infected tumor on his hind end (common in older males who were never neutered). Steve is only about 10lbs, very cheerful and spunky for an older guy and good with other dogs.  Email njwoof@cs.com to adopt Steve!

name: Ralphie
description:
Meet Ralphie!!!

These pictures may not look like a big deal, but since he came to us terrified and not letting us touch him when we first pulled him from the pound, these pics show a huge transformation!  Young Ralphie has transformed into a happy playful cuddly guy with his foster mom.  Dogs like him are the most rewarding to foster or adopt- while it is harder to find someone to look past the initial fear, earning their love and trust makes it so much more special.  
It probably wonât be love at first sight and he wonât jump up and give you kisses when you first meet him (or greet your visitors happily), but the love and loyalty he shows his chosen people is worth the extra effort.  He does seem to have a possessive streak over furniture and his chosen people and might be better in a home with just one person and someone who understands when to respect his space.  Ralphie is about 2 years old, maybe younger, neutered, updated on shots and about 15lbs full grown.  We think he is a chiweenie, maybe with some Pom mixed in to give him his curly tail, and and he has been getting along well with other dogs in his foster home. 
Email njwoof@cs.com to meet little Ralphie! This special pup and his adorable whiskers have been through a lot in his first 11 months of life, and he is still learning to trust people.  He was originally a very shy pup rescued from a hoarding case.  He is very timid and fearful at first, especially with men, but is more comfortable around other dogs especially smaller ones and follows their lead.  
We are not quite sure of his mix but his terrier whiskers, curled tail and white speckled feet suggest many breeds mixed together!  Waldo is 28lbs full grown and 11 months old, neutered and updated on shots. Waldo is looking for a calmer adult home with at least one other doggie friend to help show him the world isnât such a scary place.  Email njwoof@cs.com to meet him
