name: Sophia
description:
We are looking for a medical foster for Sophia starting in mid-September, she is currently being fostered in
Brandenton,FL (Manatee County).
Sophia was saved from a North Florida shelter. She was found abandoned with her two full grown puppies at an empty house. When we got her she was very lethargic, her gums were pale, and she could barely stand. We got her into the vet and after getting bloodwork done, she was diagnosed with AIHA, Autoimmune Hemolytic Anemia. Evidently, this condition is prevalent in Spaniel dogs. The treatment is a medication called prednisone and she has responded well to it. We are continuing her weekly frequent blood counts until she is stable, then we will progressively decrease the prednisone. She has since perked up, and is able to get around without issues. She is the sweetest dog who wags her tail all the time. She loves to talk to you, which apparently is a trait of the Clumber Spaniel! She has not been crated but does go in one without issue. She is potty trained, uses a dog door, and gets along great with all the dogs in her current foster home. She loves to get belly rubs and has a big appetite due to the prednisone. Sophia still needs to gain some weight but she's slowly making progress on that end, she weighs about 35-40lbs but should weigh around 50lbs. Her blood count is coming up and although it plateaued last week we are hoping for an increase in the next few days. We are hopeful Miss Sophia will recoup from this. AIHA will always be present but with the appropriate medication dogs with this condition can live a healthy long life span. We are looking for a foster for this sweet girl who will continue to be able to care for her, get her blood work done, and would not be afraid of a challenge. Sweetest dog ever, she will be a project dog. Please contact us if interested in being a medical foster. All medicals are paid by us, and we will oversee her medical treatment plan. Sophia deserves a chance to live. Please look her up!!
We are a foster-based rescue organization with foster homes throughout the state of Florida. We predominantly save dogs from municipal shelters throughout the Southeastern U.S. Our rescue dogs live in foster homes - there is no central facility. If interested in meeting one of our wonderful adoptable dogs, please fill out an application at ewenityfarmsbch.com. Information on adoption donation amounts and our process can also be found at this site.

name: Rick
description:
It's hard to miss Rick when you walk our grounds. He's the handsome St. Bernard/Siberian husky mix sitting expectantly in his kennel for the fun to begin. Rick is originally from Macon County in North Georgia. He has lived in a house, done well in foster care, and would like to settle in a home of his own. At 52 pounds, three-year-old Rick is a fairly big boy. He likes other dogs, knows his commands, and rides in the car so exceedingly well that you almost forget he's there. In fact, as an occasional treat, we drive him around the block. 

Rick needs an adults-only home with dog-experienced people who can take him for walks and continue his training. He'll repay you with loyalty and love and then some. Come meet him.

name: Becky
description:
Becky is a 3 year old 45lb American Bulldog/ Boxer mix who was rescued from a North Jersey shelter after we learned that she at some point had 3 broken legs.  Becky saw a specialist who determined that her legs had already healed and were fused.  Therefore that meant that surgery was not an option.  Although she slightly limps sometimes, she gets around great and loves to run around and play.  Becky needs to go into a home without any children but loves to she loves to cuddle, sleep and get belly rubs from anyone who will spend time with her.  Becky has not had an easy life and we want her to be the only animal in the house so she doesnât has competition for affection as she can be very dog selective.  Becky can be described as a bit of a couch potato.  Give her a couch and some fleece blankets and she is a happy girl!!!  We would love for Becky to go into a home where she can go on walks every day to help make her legs stronger.  The more exercise she has the better it will be as she gets older.  Becky is crate trained, house trained and ready for a loving forever home.

If you are interested in Becky, please go to bfdaaa.com to complete an application.

name: XP Jake - Northern NJ - URGENT!
description:
From his owner: Please help me find a new home for my dog Jake, an 8 year old German Shepherd/Lab mix who is great with kids and adults but no other animals. When he is happy to see you he actually smiles. Jake loves having his belly rubbed and loves to cuddle. He loves to sleep in your room close by and keep you safe.

Jake has been with his family since he was a puppy. He loves to go on walks and hang out in the backyard which needs to be fenced in. He is fully housebroken and has never ruined anything in the house. Jake is very friendly and loves people. He has no medical conditions and is not on any sort of special diet.

Jake needs a good home with no other animals. He is a great companion and friend and this is what he is looking for. Unfortunately Jake got into a scuffle with a neighbors dog and now animal control will only allow him to find a new home outside of Bergen County. We are heartbroken at having to surrender him, but we have no choice in this matter.

Jake is NOT with Eleventh Hour Rescue but we are helping his family to network him for a new home. If you would like to meet him, please contact Janet directly by email at elohrmann@dumontnj.org as soon as possible as his situation is urgent. He is located in Northern NJ.

name: Pixie
description:
Hello from our sweet little Pixie!!  
We rescued Pixie in January from the NYPD 120TH  Precinct in Staten Island, NY. She was in very poor condition...starving, skin and bones, freezing and scared. She was microchipped but the owner claimed she gave her to her ex-husband and did NOT want her back even after learning she was emaciated and living on the streets!! How cruel!!
We were not able to actually take possession of Pixie until our great vet in SI did their due diligence. The Vet staff took great care of her while she had her stay and we are grateful for their assistance in keeping her safe. She otherwise would have most likely wound up in a kill shelter. 
Pixie has already gained 6 lbs but still needs some more healthy weight gain. 
This petite sweetie pie is super lovable, seems unphased by other dogs and just wants to snuggle and give kisses. 
Please consider applying to adopt or foster her by filling out the application at www.nybullycrew.org Thank you!

name: Ginger Bean *URGT* NEEDS IMMED FOSTER*
description:
My name is GINGER BEAN & I'm a sweet and sassy 5 yr F Red/White Amstaff/PitbullX. I'm 50 lbs of  PURE BULLY LOVE. I was saved in the nick of time from a high kill shelter in NY. I am affectionately named \"Bean\" for my love of green beans and I love to pick them off the vine. I have alot of energy and love to run run run, but I was professionally trained on the leash and I walk very well and know all my commands. I am very strong willed and confident and need a STRONG HUMAN PACK LEADER who has had PREVIOUS EXPERIENCE w/ BULLY BREEDS. I do get along with certain dogs preferably bigger male soft breeds that are submissive but I would prefer to be your \"ONE & ONLY\" and I will make a wonderful loyal companion. I am a little interested in cats and am ok with kids but because of my strength would be best with kids ages 10yrs+. Please make me your BFF and come meet/adopt me today!!

For more info/app, pls email: CECE@TAILSOFLOVERESCUE.ORG

name: SANDY
description:
Sandy is a beautiful senior girl who would love to sit on the couch and enjoy TV with you. Sandy is a senior so she does go out to the bathroom often. She loves to be outside in the yard and soak up the sun, she enjoys her walks too. Sandy is looking for someone she can enjoy her golden years with, someone who can just love her, cuddle her, and make her feel like a princess.

Sandy would do best in a home where there are no other dogs or a very submissive dog that is about her size. She would be an ideal match for a couple, maybe even an older couple who understand what it's like to be aging.Sandy is located in New Windsor, NY (not too far from Poughkeepsie). Why not visit her and see if there's a love match? If you have another dog, you will need to bring him/her along.

Sandy is spayed, up-to-date on all vaccinations, and is microchipped. 

Please note: While some of our dogs have lived in a home environment, we cannot guarantee that they are housetrained.

Interested in fostering or adopting? Need more info on this dog? Want to set up a meet and greet? The first step in the process is filling out an application on our website.


	Adoption application: www.nycsecondchancerescue.org/general-application/
	Foster application:https://www.nycsecondchancerescue.org/dog-foster-application/
	Adoption process & fees:www.nycsecondchancerescue.org/process/
	Upcoming events:www.facebook.com/pg/SecondChanceRescueNycDogs/events
	States we adopt to:NY, NJ, CT, DE, PA, MD, NH, ME, VT, RI, MA

name: Giselle
description:
Some dogs leave us scratching our headsâ¦enter GISELLE. This slate grey beauty is just about perfect! She is sweet, calm, well trained and gets along well with just about everyone she meets.

So why has she been waiting so long for a new home? Who knows. 

GISELLE would be a great addition to any home! This is a perfect family dog looking for her family. Currently located in Delaware County, NY.

All of our animals are examined by a veterinarian, given age-appropriate vaccinations, dewormed, microchipped, spayed or neutered, heartworm tested and treated if necessary. Vet references are required and prior to adoption, a home inspection will be conducted.   

Transport options available. Adoption fee applies. 
If interested go to www.pmarinc.org for an application.

name: Sally
description: Sally is looking for a new forever home. She is currently located in Goshen, NY, due to a change in the family and the addition of a small dog.  Sally is totally great with kids and very loving to her family.  But dog selective.  Likes some males her own size but no females, regardless of size.  Meet and greet a must . No cats.  Sally will require a secure, fenced in yard.  Leash walking only.  If interested RER will connect you with her owner.

name: Chloe
description: Meet Chloe! She is a pretty young 2 yr old black chow chow who is in need of a loving home.  She is shy at first  but warms up very quickly. she walk great on a leash and is good with dogs and cats. Currently with foster family located in NYC, till 9/13. Chloe is waiting for her 4ever home. She would do well with a family that understand the breed.   If interest in adopting this sweet girl or would like to help by fostering (need foster home on or around 9/13)  please email Toni at troman0218@hotmail.com for applications

name: Meka
description:
Check out our beautiful girl Meka! She is a young shepherd mix who came to RESCUEDohio from Pike Countywith her brother Ogden. Our special girl Meka is looking for a really special home.Sheis working hard on trusting people and will need a family to give her the time she needs to trust them. She requires a fenced in yard and a quiethome with patient people willing to work with Meka on her social anxiety.

Meka thrives when other dogs are around so we'd love to see her in a home with another confident dog. Her personality shines when she is with other playful dogs...she loves to chase and play with them!She currently lives with two dogs in her foster home and they are helping her confidence tremendously.

Meka is crate trained and almost housebroken. Sheis working on basic commands and learning to walk on leash. She knows down, sit, and touch really well. She is food motivated, so she will learn new commands easily. Meka likes to have fun by playing with balls and squeaky toys. She enjoys her quiet time with a bone to chew on. Meka loves to give kisses to her person and dog siblings.

name: ISABELLA
description:
ISABELLA is a 6 month old, female mini Eskie who loves to PLAY all day long.    
She does hang out with 2 other puppies at her foster home and has a blast.  She likes all dogs. We are not sure about cats. 
She and her Mom joined us from the puppy mills of Ohio.  
She is spayed, micro-chipped, vetted, crate and house trained. 
She is fostered near Cincinnati, OH


Please read the following comments below before applying to adopt one of our dogs. 
 
We do require that anyone wanting to adopt one of your dogs will have to come to Ohio.  We do not transport or fly dogs to any location.  We want to meet the new family and see the interaction between the dog and human(s). If you have a dog it is required that the dog(s) come with the family so we can see the interaction between the dogs.  
 
You will have to fill out an application to adopt one of our dogs. We require a Vet reference and home visit, that is mandatory.  
 
We will not adopt out to owners that have an invisible fence or doggie doors. It does not protect the dog from humans or other animals from harming the dog. 
 
If you do not practice proper care of your past or current dogs you will be denied.  We feel that the dog needs an annual wellness exam with the Vet. It is a state law all dogs must have a rabies shot.

name: Michael
description:
Meet our angel, Michael! 
(Standard male Eskie about 10 yrs old, and 40lbs) 
We took from a high kill shelter, here in Ohio. He joined us back in December in really rough shape. We are not sure, but who ever dumped him totally neglected our boy. He had tumors removed, all benign, a much needed dental ( only lost a few teeth) and a severe ear and skin infection. He has the best foster Mom and Dad that nursed him back to health. He lives with other dogs and enjoys trotting around the yard with them. One of his favorite things is hanging with man of the house. He is a gentle giant. He is house trained, fixed, and fully vetted. He is fostered near Cincinnati, OH

name: JULES
description:
JULES
Our little 2.5 yr old, black female Pom is about 4lbs. She joined us from the puppy mills of Ohio.  She sure does not act like a mill dog. She loves to play,and she just LOVES LIFE.  She is not afraid of humans. 
It is very hard to get a picture of her, she is grease lighting...ROFL  She loves to be on the go and loves her freedom.   She is so cute, when you pick her up, she wraps her front paws around your hands.  What a sweetheart. 

Due to her size of 4lbs, we will not adopt to families with small kids. 

She is a work in progress on potty training. 

It is mandatory to have a fenced yard for our girl. The yard will be check to make sure she can't escape.  She is not a dog to be left outside unattended. 

She is being fostered in Lebanon, OH

name: THOR
description:
Thor is absolutely adorable! This very mild mannered 3 year old Eskie loves to chew on toys and bones, cuddle with his people, and run in the yard! He is house trained, crate trained, learning basic commands, and very dog friendly! He is a happy little guy who loves to curl up and mellow out, preferably beside his people on the couch.

We took him from the Amish mills of Ohio. He is being fostered in Indianapolis.

He needs a fenced yard. 

Please email us at ohioeskierescue@outlook.com for an application.

name: TRISKY
description:
Our TRISKY of Ohio American Eskimo Rescue is doing great.

This 1.5 yr old, 16lb, female, tripod is up for adoption with Ohio American Eskimo Rescue.

She is a puppy mill survivor from the Amish mills of Ohio. She sadly had to have her leg amputated due to lack of medical care.

She is not a typical 1.5 yr old dog, she is learning to be a dog. So she needs a yard to run, not tied up or forced to learn a leash right now. She is working on walking and running on three legs. She is skittish, so we would prefer a family with older kids. She is a work in progress on house training, may have an accident if you are no watching her. .

No apartment life for her, or being left alone at home for 8 plus hours.

Email us at ohioeskierescue@outlook.com for an application.

name: Libby
description: Cinder, Libby and Lance are 12 week old siblings, most likely lab mixes, that we rescued from a rural Ohio shelter. Adoption fee $375, Ohio resident only.

name: Lance
description: Cinder, Libby and Lance are 12 week old siblings, most likely lab mixes, that we rescued from a rural Ohio shelter. Adoption fee $375, Ohio resident only.

name: Cinder
description: Cinder, Libby and Lance are 12 week old siblings, most likely lab mixes, that we rescued from a rural Ohio shelter. Adoption fee $375, Ohio resident only.

name: Xander
description:
Well, let me just say \"I am the greatest little dog you'll ever meet.\"  Della and I were in the Wayne County Dog Shelter.  It seems where we lived  was very filthy.  As a  matter of fact, the place was condemned and has since been demolished.   So we learned to walk on top of the furniture so we wouldn't get dirty.  I can actually fly from one piece to another. Well, my foster mom broke me of that.  But, get this:  I can talk!  When anything exciting comes along, I run and tell my mom.  She thinks it is cute, but little does she know I am actually talking to her and telling her what I saw. I get along with cats and other dogs and am mostly housebroken.
I'm a 4 year old boy who weighs only 19 pounds and my adoption fee is $150 fully vetted.
Save Ohio Strays does not have a shelter. Our animals are cared for in foster homes and the first step in our adoption process is to fill out an adoption application at the link on our website at:  www.saveohiostrays.org.  
Save Ohio Strays does NOT claim or guarantee any breeds given in this description.  These strays come from shelters so there is usually no further knowledge.  These are best guess descriptions for breed. SOS NEVER ships pets and will not adopt out to a driving radius greater than 3 hours from Medina, Ohio.

name: Honey
description:
My name is Honey and I'm just as sweet as my name.....and I have beautiful amber-colored eyes to match!  Iâm a boxer/pittie mix with a brindle pattern and I barely shed at all. I'm just over 1 year old and weigh about 60 lbs.  I have always looked at the bright side of life, even when I was just 10 months old, pregnant and homeless. I was still a very happy pup. I was blessed to be taken in by SOS where I was safely able to give birth to 8 beautiful and healthy puppies.  Now that theyâve all been adopted, I am hoping to find a wonderful forever home of my own.  I am great with kids (Iâve got natural mama instincts) but because of my size I'd do best with older, bigger kids. I'm young and still have a lot of puppy enthusiasm so I play too rough for little ones. I think other dogs are amazing to play with and  I'm a champion at Tug-O-War and fetch.  Iâll even bring my toys to share so that we can all have fun.  I am always up for a good snuggle.  Belly rubs and back scratches are appreciated as well.  I think cats are curious creatures. I love to chase and sniff them, but they never seem to understand I just want to play! Iâll leave them alone if you tell me to though.  I absolutely love, love, love to run (zoomies are the best!), but I could still use some work on leash training.  Iâve got places to go and trees to sniff!  But do you want to know whatâs even better than running?  Eating!  I havenât met a snack I didnât like... fruits, veggies, you name it!  And Iâll tell you a secret... Iâm willing to learn pretty much any trick in the book if youâre willing to share your burger with me!  I can be a bit skittish around loud noises like fireworks, thunder, big trucks, etc--- they can kind of freak me out.  But, during the last storm, my foster mom gave me a treat every time there was thunder and it didnât bother me so much after that.  Basically, if it involves food, Iâm up for anything!  Oh, and I almost forgot to mention I am completely house-trained as well.  I know I could be a perfect dog for your family; I bring a bit of extra sunshine wherever I go and Iâll love you unconditionally if you just give me the chance.  What do you say?  Is there room in your life for me?
My adoption fee is $150  fully vetted. 
Save Ohio Strays does not have a shelter. Our animals are cared for in foster homes and the first step in our adoption process is to fill out an adoption application at the link on our website at:  www.saveohiostrays.org.  
Save Ohio Strays does NOT claim or guarantee any breeds given in this description.  These strays come from shelters so there is usually no further knowledge.  These are best guess descriptions for breed. SOS NEVER ships pets and will not adopt out to a driving radius greater than 3 hours from Medina, Ohio.

name: Bubba
description:
Hi my name is Bubba!!! Iâm 9 yrs old and 12-1/2 lbs. Iâve been living with a foster family until my forever family comes and gets me!!! My foster mama says Iâm a great dog and Iâve been a good boy since Iâve been here. Iâm housetrained and use a doggie door with all my other foster siblings. I get along fine with the cats in the house as long as they get along with me!! Picture of us sleeping side by side shown in photos. I get along with my doggie friends, picture to prove it, shown in photos. Iâm just an all around good guy looking for my next and last home!! Iâve never been around kids ever so Iâd prefer not to start now. Iâd really love a home where my new parent or parents would be home all or most of the time because thatâs how I lived my previous life. Bubba is getting a dental on Aug 27th then heâll be ready to go shortly after. Heâll be all healed by the time you get your application filled out and we do your reference checks!! He can be adopted 2 hours, any direction from Canton Ohio. To speed up the process please fill out an adoption application on our website at 
sophiasgracefoundation.org
Thank you!!!
Bubba

name: Sammy
description:
Meet Sammie! He is a sweet, young boy that is full of energy. He loves going to the park, running, hiking and being outside. Sammie would spend all day playing fetch if he could. His favorite toys are volleyballs and soccer balls. Sammie has done well meeting and playing with other dogs and cats. He is crate trained and housebroken. Sammie is a smart boy and has done well learning simple commands and training. He will benefit from having a new owner that will continue to work with him and keep him active. After a walk, Sammie loves snuggling up on your lap, laying in the sun, or crawling under the covers for a nap. He is about a year old and the perfect size weighing between 35-40 lbs. With his energy level, he  can get rough when he plays and would not be a good match for young children. Sammie is a lovable boy and would be a great addition to an active family!
His adoption fee is $150  fully vetted. 
Save Ohio Strays does not have a shelter. Our animals are cared for in foster homes and the first step in our adoption process is to fill out an adoption application at the link on our website at:  www.saveohiostrays.org.  
Save Ohio Strays does NOT claim or guarantee any breeds given in this description.  These strays come from shelters so there is usually no further knowledge.  These are best guess descriptions for breed. SOS NEVER ships pets and will not adopt out to a driving radius greater than 3 hours from Medina, Ohio.

name: Buster
description:
Buster came to us from a small rural Ohio shelter as an owner surrender.   He appears to be mostly cattle dog with perhaps a little Jack Russell terrier thrown in  .  He is a little on the shorter side and weighs about 28 pounds.   
Buster has been neutered and vaccinated and is a wonderful little guy who just needs a few minutes to warm up before he goes into full play mode.   He is being fostered in Columbus, Ohio.   
If you are interested, let us know and once we get an approved application can move on to a meeting with this cutie!

name: Pebbles
description:
Pebbles is special senior mixed breed gal 8 9 years old and 25 lbs. She has a significant medical journey ahead of her. 

Pebbles came into our care from a rural Ohio shelter positive for Lyme, Ehrlichia, and Heartworm. She has been treated for Lyme and Ehrlichia and is in process of heartworm treatment.
She had her first immiticide injection already and will have the next 2 injection series in about 2&1/2 weeks. She has a slightly enlarged heart that was assessed by Medvet cardiology and requires no medication(just annual echos to monitor).

She also needs a dental, a small mass on her lower right eyelid removed, and an FHO for a right hip injury once she is confirmed heartworm negative so she can enjoy her golden years pain-free.

All of Pebbles previously mentioned veterinary requirements will be covered by Stop The Suffering over the course of her healing journey until she is medically cleared for official adoption.

Pebbles is an absolute sweetheart and loves people and LOVES the outdoors and walks.
She does get along with other dogs, but requires proper introductions and would not be a fit for a home with active and playful dogs. Other dogs would need to be laid back or senior companions. She has been good with kids, hasn't met cats.

Considering all she's been through and will be going through over the next several months, a quiet, stable home where she can rest, recuperate, and relax is ideal.


Her adoption fee is $195

Pebbles will require strict physical activity restriction while she continues heartworm treatment to prevent a pulmonary embolism; minimal exertion and on leash only activity in yard.

Are you the perfect foster-to-adopt family Pebbles is searching for? If so, you can apply for her now at www.stopthesuffering.org

Her adoption fee is $195 and includes spay/neuter, microchip, fecal/deworming, negative heartworm, vaccines and prevention up to date. Ohio residents only.

STS is a foster based, volunteer run, rescue. As such, we do not have a physical location or hours for you meet any foster dog and it does take time to answer each inquiry. All dogs are in homes and once an application is approved and a home visit is complete you are able to schedule meet and greets with available dogs.We encourage interested individuals to get approved prior to searching as it helps expedite the process. A petfinder inquiry is not a substitute for an application. For detailed information about our adoption process including fees please visit our website athttp://www.stopthesuffering.org.

name: Ethel
description:
Ethel is a stunning stunning girl. Rescued last year as what we thought was a hospice from an Ohio shelter; she was completely covered with mammary tumors from a life as a breeder dog. 
Our wonderful rescue vet did several surgeries and all tumors were removed; she also had a tummy tuck, was spayed, and is healthy, happy and patiently waiting now for her forever home.
She loves all humans....just the sweetest and most affectionate girl ever and will give you all the kisses you want. Great on car rides; great on a leash; crate and house trained and has never had an accident. Quiet and doesn't make a peep inside the home. Outdoors, she will bark and growl at neighbors dogs.
She is unpredictable around dogs so she is best suited, and we prefer, she go to an only pet home. She does ignore the lazy sleeping seniors she walks by to go on potty breaks, but does get a bit reactive around younger and the more active pups. Considering her life was a constant breed and motherhood cycle, it's probably why she reacts. 
She is the sweetest,  and most gentile couch potato and companion is that's what you're looking for. 
Ethel is located in Central Ohio. Potential adopters must be within a reasonable driving distance for initial meet and greets, and home checks.
To adopt; completed application,indoor home only, own your home, no other pets, vet and professional reference ; if approved, a meet and greet and home check will then be scheduled.

name: Merlin
description:
We pulled Merlin after being contacted by FCDS he was urgent for fear/bite issues. Merlin was an owner betrayal and as you can imagine, terrified after going from a home to the chaos of a shelter.
Although the shelter had him listed at 11-12 years old, he is estimated to be between 5-7...probably closer to 7. Because of his \"bite\" risk-and he has not bit anyone since rescued, no young children in any potential home...teens and up should be fine.
Merlin needs to be handled carefully only when he's getting his teeth looked at. It's the only time he gets nervous. He does have some age appropriate tartar. This guy is very food and treat motivated. He has two small lipomas on each side of his chest. They were aspirated and are not abnormal and merely fatty tumors. He does not like outfits and will react if you try to put a coat or sweater on him. He LOVES attention and is a great lap pup. Doesn't show well at events as he is loyal to his people which is his breed trait.
He is fully vaccinated, HW negative and neutered. He is cute as the devil, behaves like a perfect gentleman, does well with small to large dogs, listens well, house broken, obedience trained and loves car rides.
Adoption applications can be sent to you emailing us at: gratefulheartsseniordogrescue@gmail.com
Merlin has a small adoption fee.
Merlin is located in the Chillicothe Ohio area; adopters for him need to be a reasonable driving distance from us for initial meet and greets and home checks.

name: Spruce
description:
Breed: Chihuahua / Adoption fee is $150 / Sex: Male / Age: 2 years / Weight: 9 pounds
Spruce is a sweet guy and ready for a new family he came from a rural Oklahoma animal control facility. He is a rather chill guy and is ready to find a new family.
He is rather new to our rescue and we will post more about him as we get to know him.
House Manners: Spruce kept a clean indoor run when we was in the kennel room.
Basic Training: Unknown, will evaluate soon
Other Dogs: Spruce has been in a kennel run and in play yards with similar sized dogs and has done well.
Cats: Unknown, will evaluate soon
Kids: Unknown, will evaluate soon
Fencing: He is a tiny guy so it will be best to check out the yard and check for small gaps in the fence line and to not leave him outside unsupervised.
The adoption fee is $150.This dog has had its age appropriate Vaccinations brought up to date with Rabies shot (4 m & older), heartworm tested (4 m & older) and/or started on prevention, basic dewormer, spayed or neutered and microchipped by 24Petwatch with free registration , and also comes with 30 days of free 24Petwatch Pet Insurance .
Important PLEASE read if interested in adoption:
We have a pretty open adoption policy, apartments, unfenced yards, and young kids are okay, but only if the pet you are interested in is a good fit for that situation!!! Some dogs may require a fence of a certain type and height, due to safety, the breed or known history. We are looking for pet parents that provide vet care such as routine vaccines for their pets and heartworm prevention for dogs. Please understand we do cross check vet references and landowners/landlord policies and cannot process applications with incomplete or incorrect information.
We asked that you take your newly adopted dog for a vet exam in the first 30 days to establish with your vet and obtain their heartworm prevention prescriptions and have a fecal exam administered as some pets may need additional de-womers after leaving our care.
Please submit an Pre-Adoption Application by clicking our logo button below (if visible) or visiting www.petangelsrescue.org to show your interest in adoption (Only submit one app). This questionnaire simply helps inform us if the dog you are interested in might match your families dynamics based on what we have learned about that dog. All of our pets at Pet Angels Rescue are featured on our independent website and can be accessed from our PETS FOR ADOPTION PAGE, take a look as there may be more then one at our facility that you like. We do not have staffed phones for questions, please visit these pages on our main web site, Before You Adopt & Adoption Process & App. if you don't find the information you are needing please submit a E-mail. Ok State Ag License #STL00034

name: BENJI
description: BENJI - M, Shepherd Mix, 1 year old. This blonde boy is single and ready to mingle! His nickname is âBrad Pittâ because just like the movie star, Benji is from Oklahoma, is gorgeously good looking, and loves adventure. This 4 legged good boy will steal your heart with lots of love and affection. Unlike the movie star, he doesnât come with 20 kids, and heâs fixed so no future surprises!! Benji is also pro-vax so heâs up to date on shots and vaccinations. He doesnât know what 420 is, but is still laid back and chill and gets along with most people and dogs. Cats are unknown. No worries about true toilet lid being left up as heâs crate trained and is working on house training. No reality show type drama because he wonât leave you for another woman. Youâll think âA River Runs Through Itâ as you take long walks together or maybe youâll feel like Thelma and Louise as you ride off into the sunset with your own blonde god. If youâd like to be a part of this young studâs celebrity entourage, please text Nikki at 910-238-6676.

name: Blu in OK - Social Butterfly
description:
NYS Registered Rescue # RR102
View full listing, fee and online application at - www.nationalpyr.org/rescue-dogs (sorry, no phone submissions, but if you would like more information you can call 877-739-3582 or email us at renpyrgroup@yahoo.com).

Secure VISIBLE fencing is required; invisible fencing WILL NOT contain this breed.
Oklahoma dogs are not available to adopters who live in an apartment.

Blu came to GPRO from an Oklahoma kill shelter suffering from Parvo and very emaciated. He spent his first week in the ICU, and is now fully recovered - he's healthy, enjoying his carefree puppyhood, and ready to find his fur-ever home! Blu is a Great Pyrenees/Husky and/or Great Dane mix. Beyond his strikingly gorgeous blue eyes and good looks Blu is confident, social, happy-go-lucky, and very smart. He is house trained, crate trained, a great leash walker, a good car rider, knows some basic obedience commands, and is well-mannered for his young age. He loves attention, looooves toys and playing fetch and tug-of-war, chasing the water from the water hose, hunting bugs in the yard, playing with dog buddies, and taking siestas stretched out on his back. This little social butterfly is looking for an active family that will provide him the continued, proper raising, enrichment and training he will need. He would be best in a home with older kids as he's an athletic yet super clumsy pup that is also mouthy. Blu would enjoy a home with a fun-loving dog friend or two.

Blu has received all three rounds of puppy vaccines, and is microchipped, dewormed, utd on prev meds, and neutered. Submit your adoption application at www.nationalpyr.org to adopt this love bug! Blu is fostered in the Tulsa area; all meet & greets at the foster home are scheduled once your application is processed. All GPRO adopted puppies under 6 mo old are required to be enrolled in a puppy level obedience class within 30 days of adoption. This is to insure this giant breed is successfully raised to be a good dog citizen, and is manageable and well-mannered when fully grown. We highly recommend all adopted dogs regardless of age attend an obedience class as it is a great way for adopters to bond with their new dog, continue building the dog's level of manners and skill set, have a local, professional resource, and also offer enrichment and socialization for the dog.

name: LotsaDots (OK)
description:
This dog's fosterhome is located in: SEMINOLE, OK 

LotsaDots was rescued from a shelter in Oklahoma. She had several very large mammary tumors, which have been removed. Dots is 5 to 6 years old, and weighs about 16 pounds - all solid muscle. She isn't really crazy about being outside - except to potty; she would rather hang out with her people in the house, and maybe have a snack or two (or three). Dots is good with other dogs and with cats. We have not seen her around children, but as much as she loves attention we think she would be fine with older kids (7 & up), and maybe even little ones. Dots rides well in the car, and usually walks well on a leash - though she does pull a bit when she sees something interesting. She would be happy as an only dog, or with another canine companion. Dots is crate trained (tho she doesn't really care to be crated), and she appears to be house broken.   

Our minimum suggested adoption fees for 2018 are: Adult Dogs $175, Puppies under 12 months of age $200, and American Hairless Terriers $225.

Please go to our website to find information on the adoption process, to fill out an application, to see other available dogs or to become a volunteer:

www.ratbonerescues.com

name: Mickey
description:
Mickey is a total sweetheart! About 14 months old, he's friendly, playful, and cuddly. He has been really good in the house (uses our dog door to go outside to potty), and sleeps in the human's bed like a champ (we offer this special training at no additional charge! :-) ) 

Mickey was a stray in Tulsa, running scared with an injured leg. We were finally able to catch him and he warmed up immediately. His leg was broken, but we had surgery done to repair things and he's doing great. Mickey can run and jump with the best of them. Once his recovery is 100%, you'll never know he had a problem.

Mickey is handsome, sweet, and happy. Could he be your new best friend? (Oh, and he has most excellent ears!)

Please click \"More about us\" to complete an online application. Adoption fee is $200.

Our rescue is located in Tulsa, Oklahoma. Because we accept responsibility for our foster dogs for the life of the dog, we do not ship dogs and we do not typically do long distance placements unless you are an approved, repeat adopter. We will consider homes within approximately 300 miles of our area (reasonable driving distance).

Placements are preferred in northeastern Oklahoma, but no farther then 300 miles from Tulsa. Interested parties should complete our adoption application online: https://form.jotform.com/81906160839159

name: Wrangler
description:
8/14/19 Ranch dog perfection! Meet \"Wrangler\" and \"Levi,\" the Denim Brothers! They are rescue dogs No. 275 & 276 that have come to us here at The HouseTop Ranch. Word is that they were born around June 10 and come from a ranch out by Burns, Oregon. The mix is supposed to be border collie, kelpie & heeler. One thing's fer sureâthey are all stock dog!

These cuties are currently enjoyin' themselves camping up in the Ochoco Mountains where they are learning about the great, big world out there. They are happily munchin' on horse an' cow turds, grasshoppers, sticks, and alfalfa pellets while explorin' further and further from camp everyday. Not much scares these lil' scampsâ not even big ol' angus cows and calves that wander by.

These boys have had their first shots, have been wormed and are chipped. They have been very-well socialized to two-leggeds and other dogs. Like all ranch-bred dogs they are smart, lively, and active. Stock dogs really do best when they have some sort of job to do EVERY DAYânot just weekends, even if its just horseback riding, supervising chores around the farm, agility sports, or real cow or sheep herding work. These pups will not do well in a small, urban yard where they get walked around the block once a day.

The adoption fee for each boy is $400 which includes a \"goody bag,\" his medical records and a free wellness exam from one of our local vet partners. In addition, there is a REFUNDABLE alter deposit which is returned after proof of neutering before the age of nine months. For more information contact Herd U Needed A Home Canine Rescue at 541-647-4080 or hunahapps@gmail.com. Fill out our application form here: http://herduneededahome.com/hunah-dog-adoption-applicationâ¦/ ~ct

PLEASE PROVIDE A PHONE NUMBER WITH YOUR INQUIRY. Note: preference will be given to working/herding situations, ranches, farms, large acreages, horseback homes, and agility/trial homes.
No apartment or condo living

There is a 200.00 REFUNDABLE spay/neuter deposit 

All stock dogs need lots of mental and physical stimulation to be happy and to stay out of trouble. A short walk around the block is not going to be sufficient. Herding breeds do best when they have a ''job'' to do which occupies most of their day. This can be herding livestock, horseback riding, hiking in the mountains or on the beach, mountain biking, playing extended games of fetch, or agility games. They are incredibly smart and love to learn tricks and solve problems. Be sure that you research this breed carefully before committing to living with a herding dog.
http://www.herduneededahome.com/Adoption_Application.html.

name: Gracie
description: This shining star is Gracie! another sweet fur-baby rescued from a horrible situation in Orrum during Hurricane Florence and made available at RCHS. She was one of the many distressed pups and kitty's observed by myself and the Sheriff's dept surrounded by flood waters and living in filth. Severely malnourished and starved for affection, she was grateful to see us! She appears to be a Chocolate and Red Lab mix estimated at about 1+ years old, weighs approx 45 pounds which is up from her 43 when rescued, Gracie is now up to date on all her vaccines, and spayed. Unfortunately she did test positive for heart-worm, but is currently on Heart Guard but will need to be retested every 6 months to monitor her progress. She would make any family a wonderful loving and faithful companion.. Her adoption fee is $100. Her ID is DF1809013. An application is available by clicking on the following link http://www.robesonhumanesociety.org/images/Adoption_Application_2015.doc You can email it back to us at rchsfriendsforlife@gmail.com, or fax it to 910-738-8685. All animals at RCHS are up to date on vaccinations, tested for Felv/Fiv, heart worm and treated if positive, de-wormed and spayed or neutered if over the age of 6 months. If they are younger than 6 months, the adopter receives a voucher that is good at any vet and covers a portion of the procedure. For more info on how to adopt, please email us at rchsfriendsforlife@gmail.com or call the shelter at 910-738-8282. Robeson county Humane Society is a non-profit no-kill State recognized 501c3 that operates primarily from donations, fundraisers and volunteers, with minimal Government support. If you'd like to donate to our cause, please visit our website at http\://www.robesonhumanesociety.org/donate.html Thank you

name: Little Shiba
description: Little Shiba's comeback - this popular breed has gained momentum in recent years as THE dog to have. Born housebroken, quiet, and cat-like, Shiba Inus are interesting dogs. Originally from Japan, these dogs are polite and well-mannered, and their images have been captured on traditional silkscreens for generations. Prized for their intelligence and extreme cleanliness, our Little Shiba is no exception. And she could be yours! 25 lbs. 3 y/o. Rescued from a rabbit hutch in PA's Dutch Country.

name: Buddy
description:
Buddy is available for foster or adoption. We are a foster-based rescue and always looking for foster families. Buddy is currently located in Palm City, FL (Martin County). Buddy is a laid-back boy of 3 years and 45 lbs looking for a forever home.
Buddy - a low-rider hunk boy is the best way to describe him. Buddy could also stand to lose a few lbs. He's pretty chill and loves to carry around his toys in his mouth. His favorite things are humans and toys (in no particular order). He is fine with other dogs too but humans and toys are TOP OF HIS LIST. He walks well on leash and rides well in the car.
Buddy is housebroken, crate trained, neutered, up-to-date on vaccines and preventives, and microchipped. He was recently cleared by the vet after heartworm treatment.
We are a foster-based rescue organization with foster homes throughout the state of Florida. We predominantly save dogs from municipal shelters throughout the Southeastern U.S. Our rescue dogs live in foster homes - there is no central facility. If interested in meeting one of our wonderful adoptable dogs, please fill out an application at
ewenityfarmsbch.com
. Information on adoption donation amounts and our process can also be found at this site.

name: Jamison
description:
Jamison is a male, 8.2 lb, black one-eyed Chihuahua mix. Jamison's estimated date of birth is July, 2013. He was rescued from the Panama, OK shelter as an unclaimed stray. We don't know why Jamison only has one eye, but he seems to be fine with the one he has! You can meet him at Muddy Paws. Call 918-749-5255 for an appointment. Jamison has a $150.00 adoption fee plus the cost of 6 months of heartworm prevention. 

Note: ARF reserves the right to deny any application that is deemed unsuitable for the animal. Please be aware that our animal adoptions are NOT on a first come- first serve basis. Our sole purpose is to find the best possible home for the animals that fall under our care. We do not ship our animals. All adopters are expected to come to Tulsa if approved
For details on how to adopt please visit http://www.arftulsa.org/adopt

name: Lyle
description:
Lyle is a male, 22 lb, Beagle/Dachshund mix. Lyle's estimated date of birth is July, 2017. He was pulled from the Panama, OK pound as an unclaimed stray. Lyle is a super sweet guy who loves to sit in your lap. He has the classic Beagle whine in him! You can meet Lyle at Bent Arrow Veterinary Hospital. Call 918-459-9100 for an appointment. Lyle has a $150.00 adoption fee plus the cost of 6 months of heartworm prevention. 

Note: ARF reserves the right to deny any application that is deemed unsuitable for the animal. Please be aware that our animal adoptions are NOT on a first come- first serve basis. Our sole purpose is to find the best possible home for the animals that fall under our care. We do not ship our animals. All adopters are expected to come to Tulsa if approved
For details on how to adopt please visit http://www.arftulsa.org/adopt

name: Blu in OK - Social Butterfly
description:
NYS Registered Rescue # RR102
View full listing, fee and online application at - www.nationalpyr.org/rescue-dogs (sorry, no phone submissions, but if you would like more information you can call 877-739-3582 or email us at renpyrgroup@yahoo.com).

Secure VISIBLE fencing is required; invisible fencing WILL NOT contain this breed.
Oklahoma dogs are not available to adopters who live in an apartment.

Blu came to GPRO from an Oklahoma kill shelter suffering from Parvo and very emaciated. He spent his first week in the ICU, and is now fully recovered - he's healthy, enjoying his carefree puppyhood, and ready to find his fur-ever home! Blu is a Great Pyrenees/Husky and/or Great Dane mix. Beyond his strikingly gorgeous blue eyes and good looks Blu is confident, social, happy-go-lucky, and very smart. He is house trained, crate trained, a great leash walker, a good car rider, knows some basic obedience commands, and is well-mannered for his young age. He loves attention, looooves toys and playing fetch and tug-of-war, chasing the water from the water hose, hunting bugs in the yard, playing with dog buddies, and taking siestas stretched out on his back. This little social butterfly is looking for an active family that will provide him the continued, proper raising, enrichment and training he will need. He would be best in a home with older kids as he's an athletic yet super clumsy pup that is also mouthy. Blu would enjoy a home with a fun-loving dog friend or two.

Blu has received all three rounds of puppy vaccines, and is microchipped, dewormed, utd on prev meds, and neutered. Submit your adoption application at www.nationalpyr.org to adopt this love bug! Blu is fostered in the Tulsa area; all meet & greets at the foster home are scheduled once your application is processed. All GPRO adopted puppies under 6 mo old are required to be enrolled in a puppy level obedience class within 30 days of adoption. This is to insure this giant breed is successfully raised to be a good dog citizen, and is manageable and well-mannered when fully grown. We highly recommend all adopted dogs regardless of age attend an obedience class as it is a great way for adopters to bond with their new dog, continue building the dog's level of manners and skill set, have a local, professional resource, and also offer enrichment and socialization for the dog.

name: Jerry Lee
description:
Jerry Lee is a 7-year-old Terrier/Lab/Hound mix who weighs 47 lbs. He was one of 32 dogs rescued from another group in Pasco County. Since being rescued, he has gained 10 lbs and we have seen him slowly come out of his shell and has started to enjoy himself. He has a very special friend who takes him several times a week on walks in the park or on the beach. He even has done a sleep over with her. She describes Jerry Lee as \"loyal, smart, a lap dog and couch potato yet playful, sweet, affectionate, loves walks, gives lots of kisses and can be protective. He is still a little scared when meeting new people.\" Jerry Lee loves car rides. He loves them so much in fact, we have trouble getting him out of the cars after field trips are over. 

Jerry Lee has been neutered, microchipped and he's up-to-date with vaccines. he is nervous around kids and most likely would not do well with cats. He would need to do a meet and greet with other dogs but seems to do fine with other \"polite\" dogs. He wants to play with other dogs but is not sure how. We are continuously working on that. If you are interested in meeting Jerry Lee, well then, \"Great Balls of Fire\

name: Winter Vale
description:
Welcome, Miss Winter Vale. Winter is approximately 2 years old and weighs about 60 lbs. 

BACKGROUND:  This pretty girl ended up in rescue after her person passed away suddenly leaving her with no one to take care of her. Understandably, Winter is a little lost and confused, but we are going to help this girl find her person again. Could that be you? We are not sure of her past life with her previous owner but we suspect that she may have been shaved at one time as her fur is starting to come back in as well.  

LIKES:  She loves to have her ears scratched, chase balls and, yes! Do zoomies when she is excited, even in the living room! She initially is excited on her walks and will pull on the leash. She is learning that pulling makes the walking stop and is making progress. She is decompressing & settling in the new environment. Winter is a great traveler in the car and loves to go where ever you may be headed. 

Winter is looking for someone who can spoil her and give her all the attention she needs. She enjoys attention & will throw paw to ask for it. She prefers to be the only dog in the home. 

If you are interested in adopting or fostering Winter, please contact CHAAMP at CHAAMPapplication@gmail.com for an application. You may also complete an application online thru our web site, www.CHAAMP.org

CHAAMP accepts applications ONLY from Maryland, New Jersey, New York, Pennsylvania, Virginia, West Virginia, and Washington DC. The information on your application will help CHAAMP determine which of our dogs is a good match for you and your family, based upon your lifestyle, other pets, etc. A home visit is required prior to all adoptions. Many of our dogs are fostered in private homes and cannot be visited until you have been approved for adoption. 

ADOPTION FEES
~Adult dogs, the fee is $275.00  
~Older dogs (eight years old or over) the adoption fee is $100.00 
~Puppies between 6 months and 1 year are $350.00 
~Puppies under 6 months old are $375.00 

All dogs are micro chipped, spayed and neutered and up to date on vaccines. These fees help us cover these costs.  The rates are higher for puppies because they require more visits to the vet and shots. 

CHAAMP IS NOT A SHELTER. We are volunteers over a 7-state area dedicated to helping Malamutes in our rescue area. You can read more about Malamutes and about CHAAMP by visiting www.CHAAMP.org

name: Murry Murdoch da Tank!
description:
Murry Murdoch da Tank came to us from a shelter after his \"people\" left him in an overnight run. He was understandably confused but he seems to not be phased at all about his past life. Just a happy pup seeking a new life and home. Murry is ready to work for a treat and bond with his human.  

Murry is strong and all puppy. He seems to be missing basic manners that were never taught in his previous home. He acts more like a 3-month-old pup who likes to frolic and doesn't know his own strength. He is built like a tank & would love to learn how to pull a sled or go on a nice hike. He reminds us of the famous Balto. 

Typical puppy, he has energy to burn, but with regular exercise & mental stimulation, he is a happy good boy. Murry is eager to have a home, continue positive dog training and be loved. He walks nicely on a leash, will roll over for belly rubs and is ready to lean on you for some love. He knows sit makes good things happen & has so much potential. He is food motivated.

CHILDREN:  We are working with Murry to sit when meeting new people, but due to his strength & size, he has the potential to knock over small children. We believe a home with older kids is best. 

CRATES: Murry is not fond of crates; therefore, he will need a gated area for a den for his own space. We recommend a tall toddler gate & a fenced-in yard. He loves toys and will run around and play by himself by throwing them in the air, who doesn't like to play catch? 

OTHER DOGS:  He has done well meeting friendly female dogs so he may be able to live with another female that is around the same age.  

If you are interested in adopting or fostering this dog, please contact CHAAMP at CHAAMPapplication@gmail.com for an application. You may also complete an application online thru our web site, www.CHAAMP.org

CHAAMP accepts applications ONLY from Maryland, New Jersey, New York, Pennsylvania, Virginia, West Virginia, and Washington DC. The information on your application will help CHAAMP determine which of our dogs is a good match for you and your family, based upon your lifestyle, other pets, etc. A home visit is required prior to all adoptions. Many of our dogs are fostered in private homes and cannot be visited until you have been approved for adoption. 

ADOPTION FEES
~Adult dogs, the fee is $275.00  
~Older dogs (eight years old or over) the adoption fee is $100.00 
~Puppies between 6 months and 1 year are $350.00 
~Puppies under 6 months old are $375.00 

All dogs are micro chipped, spayed and neutered and up to date on vaccines. These fees help us cover these costs.  The rates are higher for puppies because they require more visits to the vet and shots. 

CHAAMP IS NOT A SHELTER. We are volunteers over a 7-state area dedicated to helping Malamutes in our rescue area. You can read more about Malamutes and about CHAAMP by visiting www.CHAAMP.org

name: Queen 17
description: The Queen 17 are 16 puppies in age from 12 weeks to 20 weeks (from three litters) and one mother who were rescued from a Pennsylvania puppy mill. Some are hearing impaired and one is vision impaired but most are ok. Please submit a general application and the best match will be made for qualified applicants. The first step is to submit an application at www.findingshelter.org.

name: Whiskey
description: Meet Whiskey! This happy, go lucky guy was saved from a local county shelter along with his sister, Mojito, with the intentions of being adopted in Pennsylvania. When those plans fell through, RMG stepped in to help. Whiskey gets along great with other dogsand pretty much everyone else he crosses paths with. He would make a great addition to almost any family. For more information on adopting, email adrienne@rescuemega.org or fill out an adoption application on our website- www.rmgdogs.org

name: Hondo
description: Meet Hondo! This stunning English Lab is 1 1/2 years of age. He is currently in our prison dog training program where he is learning basic obedience commands, create training and getting lots of socialization. Hondo is the life of the party! He hasnt met a stranger yet and is very confident/outgoing. He would do best in a active home, he loves playing ball or going for swims. If interested in meeting this stunning boy please email muttlover25@yahoo.com adoptions within two hours from Pottsville Pennsylvania home visit/vet references a must.

name: shenzi
description: Meet Shenzi! This girl is stunning, leopard stripes and just the sweetest girl. Sheâs very loving/loyal to her handlers and is extreme intelligent. She loves learning new behaviors and is doing great in our program. She weighs around 35lbs. For additional info on adopting her please email muttlover25@yahoo.com adoptions within two hours from Pottsville Pennsylvania home visit/vet references a must.

name: Lucy
description: Meet Lucy a pure bred Cane Corso puppy. At just 6 months of age this girl will be over 100lbs. Homes with children over the age of 10 as sheâs a giant puppy.  Also her ideal home is with a large dog experienced family that will continue her socialization and training. For additional info on adopting her please email muttlover25@yahoo.com adoptions within two hours from Pottsville Pennsylvania home visit vet references a must.

name: Mason
description:
Forever Love Starts with a Wet Nose and Ends with a Tail...
Mason is a quirky guy. He is a 50 pound husky with a lapdog mentality. He will love you unconditionally and be your best friend. He loves to give kisses and is starting to do pretty well at the sit command. He plays hard and naps even harder. He does great at night, He has slept in both his bed, at the base of the bed, and up in bed with people. It just depends on his mood that night. He loves bones and jerky treats are his favorite. He likes his dinner wet, so we put some wet food on top of his dry food. He is also doing pretty good on a leash. We have been working with him and are seeing improvement. He does get excited when he sees other dogs. He will continue to be trained to be focused while walking, but overall does pretty well on a leash. He will need someone who has time to spend with him during the day or another dog to help keep him company when nobody is home since he does get very anxious being home alone. Fireworks and loud noises don't scare him however. We will send him with his crate, treats, a few toys, his harness, and his leash. His breed is known for high energy and needing a lot of exercise. He is doing great in his foster home. He loves kids and has even met and done well with cats.

All of the dogs/cats listed are located in or near Gettysburg, Pennsylvania. Adoption fees are $195 for dogs ($95 for Seniors 7 years+) and $60 for adult cats, $75 for kittens (under 6 months) and $25 for senior cats (7 years+) to help cover vet bills for spay/neuter of all adoptable pets as well as getting them up-to-date on their basic vaccinations, and for starting heartworm and flea/tick preventatives. No pet will be officially adopted without being spayed/neutered and vaccinated (unless there are health risks in doing so).

We will require an approved on-line application which is available on our website at ForeverLoveRescue.com. If you are looking for a dog, be prepared for a Meet-and-Greet and a basic home check to be done on or before adoption day, to ensure that the dog can be safe in the new home and that everyone involved is comfortable with each other. Please feel free to call 717-900-5525 with any questions, or reach us by email at foreverloverescue@gmail.com. Be sure to check us out on Facebook at Forever Love Rescue and \"LIKE\" our page. SAVING ONE DOG OR CAT MAY NOT CHANGE THE WORLD...BUT FOR THAT ONE DOG OR CAT, THE WORLD CHANGES FOREVER! Please, Don't Shop, ADOPT A BEST FRIEND! <3

name: Diego
description:
Forever Love Starts with a Wet Nose and Ends with a Tail...
HI, I'M DIEGO! DO YOU LOVE TO SNUGGLE AND PLAY? ME TOO!

It seems this sweet boy spent the beginning of his life living outdoors at the end of a chain. Oh, how Diego has blossomed in foster care! He adores people of all ages, including children, and and absolutely craves attention. He may be a little too enthusiastic for small children, so care will need to be taken in that regard. Diego hasn't gotten the memo that he's larger than your average lap dog, as he loves to get as close as possible to snuggle and offer pittie kisses.

This very smart pup will sit, shake, down and rollover on command; we're still working on 'stay' and 'come.' His leash manners could use some polishing, although a proper harness and additional training will be beneficial. Diego has excellent car manners and will often nod off in the passenger seat. Toys rock his world and this silly guy is always ready to romp and play. He'll chase a ball all day long but hasn't gotten the hang of returning it to you just yet. While Diego shares nicely with humans, he's not inclined to share toys, treats or food with other dogs and may act out in an aggressive manner. He's housebroken and crate trained in foster care and may just need a refresher course in his new home, as he gets the hang of a new routine.

Diego does not do well with dogs who make him feel challenged or threatened. He needs to be your one and only. He's also not a fan of kitties and there can be no cats in his home. If you can offer Diego the exercise, playtime and loving care he craves, he's ready to make your acquaintance. A fenced yard is would be ideal. He's had some hard knocks in life, but Diego has shaken off the dust and is ready for his happily-ever-after to begin.

All of the dogs/cats listed are located in or near Gettysburg, Pennsylvania. Adoption fees are $195 for dogs ($95 for Seniors 7 years+) and $60 for adult cats, $75 for kittens (under 6 months) and $25 for senior cats (7 years+) to help cover vet bills for spay/neuter of all adoptable pets as well as getting them up-to-date on their basic vaccinations, and for starting heartworm and flea/tick preventatives. No pet will be officially adopted without being spayed/neutered and vaccinated (unless there are health risks in doing so).

We will require an approved on-line application which is available on our website at ForeverLoveRescue.com. If you are looking for a dog, be prepared for a Meet-and-Greet and a basic home check to be done on or before adoption day, to ensure that the dog can be safe in the new home and that everyone involved is comfortable with each other. Please feel free to call 717-900-5525 with any questions, or reach us by email at foreverloverescue@gmail.com. Be sure to check us out on Facebook at Forever Love Rescue and \"LIKE\" our page. SAVING ONE DOG OR CAT MAY NOT CHANGE THE WORLD...BUT FOR THAT ONE DOG OR CAT, THE WORLD CHANGES FOREVER! Please, Don't Shop, ADOPT A BEST FRIEND! <3

name: Danny
description:
Forever Love Starts with a Wet Nose and Ends with a Tail...

SAY HELLO TO A VERY SWEET BOY!

Our foster dog, Danny, is looking for his Forever home. He is back at rescue (through no fault of his own) after 3 years with a family with 4 kids. (Their living situation changed) He's a great family dog that would love to have kids to play with again. He's a boxer mix with plenty of energy and full of love! Danny is currently in a foster home, but meetings can be arranged.

All of the dogs/cats listed are located in or near Gettysburg, Pennsylvania. Adoption fees are $195 for dogs ($95 for Seniors 7 years+) and $60 for adult cats, $75 for kittens (under 6 months) and $25 for senior cats (7 years+) to help cover vet bills for spay/neuter of all adoptable pets as well as getting them up-to-date on their basic vaccinations, and for starting heartworm and flea/tick preventatives.
