name: Baby Ruth
description:
Baby Ruth is 6 years old, gentle, very socialized, great with children and other dogs, likes to spend time with you and play with toys. Good choice for a family with children.  Baby Ruth came from a shelter in Philadelphia. 

UTD vaccinations, chipped, spayed/neutered, wormed.


Please email rescue@lamanchaanimalrescue.org for an application

***BREED INFO:  We can only go by what breed appears on the dog's paperwork and our \"best\" guess.  We cannot make guarantees that the breeds are correct.***

name: Nena
description:
Nena is 3 years old, gentle, very socialized, great with children and other dogs, likes to spend time with you and play with toys. Good choice for a family with children.  Nena came from a shelter in Philadelphia. 

UTD vaccinations, chipped, spayed/neutered, wormed.


Please email rescue@lamanchaanimalrescue.org for an application

***BREED INFO:  We can only go by what breed appears on the dog's paperwork and our \"best\" guess.  We cannot make guarantees that the breeds are correct.***

name: Cassidy
description:
Cassidy is a male 2.5 year old Pit Bull Mix. He is neutered and up to date on all shots.  He was rescued from the streets of Philadelphia.  He understands basic commands such as sit, stay, down, come.

If you are interested, please contact Linda at 215-801-6398.

name: Otis
description: Otis is the most handsome guy ever!! We rescued him from a high kill shelter in Philadelphia. He has the greatest tail wag and gets so excited when he sees other dogs! He'd good with other dogs and kids, but not cats. We think he's about 4-5 years old which makes him the perfect age! Not crazy puppy energy but still loves to run around! He is neutered, current on vaccines, and microchipped. we think he's an American Bulldog Mix. We are excited to find this sweetheart his forever family! Please email us at enb313@gmail.com

name: Vic
description:
Vic is a stately 8-year-old elder gentleman of the Jack Russell variety.  He was rescued from a Philadelphia shelter where his intake form noted he was neglected for the majority of his life--his skin was irritated and his teeth were not in great shape.  Home At Last fixed him right up and now he prances around showing his beautiful coat and pearly whites.  Vic is untrusting of people at first, but once he gets to know you he will blossom into an affectionate dog who dances for his food- he just needs time and patience to do so.  He enjoys snuggling with people the most but loves to play with the other dogs in the home.  Vic sometimes tries to mark so wears a belly band to control it but we are working on that!  Could Vic be your snuggle buddy and dancing partner?


To submit an adoption application, find out about our adoption process, and adoption fee please visit our website: www.homeatlastdogrescue.com

Home At Last Dog Rescue needs fosters and volunteers! You can make a difference in a homeless dogâs life! If you live in the suburban Philadelphia, PA area and would like to hear about all our volunteer opportunities please email homeatlastdogrescue@yahoo.com.

name: Bunni
description:
Bunni was rescued as a stray from the streets of central Phoenix.  She was treated for tick fever and has recovered.  She is a very alpha personality and needs an experienced dog owner who will be willing to train her. She needs work with house breaking.  Dog intro required if other dogs in the household.  She has grown tremendously while in rescue in her ability to get along with other dogs, but can still be very dominant with other dogs.

She is estimated to be  years old and weighs about 20#

name: Embry
description: Embry is a 4 year old female dog of medium size. She looks to have a couple different breeds in her. Corgi and rottie is what she looks like, but she only weighs 25 pounds, so maybe corgi and a small shepherd? She was rescued from the river bed in south Phoenix last year. She was so scared and so shy at the beginning, we don't think anyone had ever touched her kindly. She was maybe even a wild dog. She adores guys now,Â but has never been able to warm up to a woman. We think she must have been abused by a woman and it does not seem like she will ever get over that. With guys however, she will hang out with them, follow them around, and let them pick herÂ up and hold her after she earns their trust. She is a totally different dog with men. She is sweet and loving and seeks out their affection. She really needs an all male house. She is potty trained and kennel trained. At home in her own environment she is confident and does great, but she is still not interested in walks or car rides. With the right person we are hoping she will work up to that 1 day. This poor little girl seems to have been through a lot in her life and will take some understanding from her new owners. She just wants to hang out at home with her people she trusts. She enjoys being outside and feels like she has a job patrolling the yard. She gets along with other dogs and enjoys their company, but would also be fine by herself. She likes to chase cats, so no cats. She tries for the birds but her legs are too short to jump high enough to catch them. This poor girl is just looking for the right understanding guy to let her be her. If you think you might be the right match for Miss. Embry please call Jen #623-210-6578.

name: Mars
description:
Adorable Mars was rescued from the hot Phoenix streets. Heâs an energetic young man who loves people. Mars is an exceptionally smart boy who already knows several basic commands and has excellent manners. 

Mars was born to be an explorer! Nothing phases this dog; wherever you want to go, he will be right there at your side. Mars will make somebody a wonderful hiking companion.

If you are interested in adopting, download and complete the dog adoption questionnaire from www.animalsbenefitclub.com/adopt/. 

Submit the completed questionnaire via email to info@animalsbenefitclub.com or fax to 602.249.1218.

name: Daisy - Courtesy Post
description:
***THIS IS A COURTESY LISTING.  This dog is not within the ACDR organization. For all information about this dog, you must contact the person listed within the animal description. He/she has been posted as a courtesy to help his/her owner find a new home. You will need to contact them directly. PLEASE do not email ACDR concerning this dog, we do not have further information concerning this dog. ***

Daisy is a 5 year old pure breed Australian Blue Heeler. She is located in Phoenix, AZ. She is good with kids, even those that might tug and pull a little on her. She lives with cats and will chase them but only for fun. She has been living with an elderly couple, one of which, recently passed away. She has gotten a little pudgy due to not getting enough exercise but she loves walks. She needs a new home with lots of room to run and a family that loves her! 

Please contact via text if possible:
Morgan Davis
480-882-8172

name: GiGi
description:
GiGi was rescued in December 2011 from a horrible puppy mill in Pikeville, Ky. As she was being rescued, she went into labor and delivered 5 beautiful, healthy babies. GiGi was a great Mom to her precious babies and were adopted. GiGi was scared to death of everything and has now finally begun to trust humans again. She deserves her own home where she can live the life of the happy girl she is now. She will need a special home that has the time to give her that she will need to settle in and feel safe. She is still scared of loud noises and any fast movement. It takes her a few days to feel safe around new people. There can not be any young children in her home as they would terrify her. GiGi wants to find her forever home and hopes you are looking for her, too. She loves to be around her person and will lay by you as long as you pet her. Please consider this very deserving little girl.  You must be in or very near the Louisville, Ky. area to adopt Gigi. Her perfect home would be with an older woman that is home a lot of the time. You must have puppy mill experience to be considered for this dog.

This dog requires an above ground structural fence for adoption. If you do not have one, do not apply for this dog. Please read her bio, if you do not live in or near Louisville, have no prior puppy mill experience or do not have a fenced yard, do not email me asking if any or all of the requirements are negotiable, they are not.  I will delete your request.

name: SEDRICK
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.MEET SEDRICK!! **Please Note: this is a courtesy post for another rescue; different adoption fees may apply.

My name is Sedrick and I am looking for someone to love me. Someone who needs me as much as I need them. It has been over a year since I have been rescued and I am longing to find
my forever home.

I am a 5 year old mix. Since we don't know my actual birthday my foster gave me a birthday of Valentine's Day because I have so much love to give!!

I am a medium energy boy. I love to go for walks and I play with my toys, but I also love to be inside with you, just lounging by your side.

I love to smile! I am such a happy boy.... I love to give kisses and I really adore children! I
am a big boy, though, so I will do best with older children (10+).

I need a home where I can be the only pet, as I'm not always good with other dogs. At some point, with proper intros, I may be o.k. with a friend, but for now will do best as the only dog
in the home.

I am already neutered, micro-chipped, and up to date on my vaccines. I'm also already
housebroken AND crate trained. I am a VERY well behaved boy!!

If you are interested in making me a part of your family and giving me my
forever home please contact Michele Rose for more information. I will give you companionship and love for the rest of my life!!

*Application, adoption fee, and home visit required. Sedrick is located in Pine, AZ (just outside of Payson) and transport is available.

Michele Rose
Diagirl22@gmail.com
602-770-2116

For more information or to meet Sedrick, please complete an application or send email to info@underdogaz.com

name: Dewey
description:
Sweet little Dewey was found as a stray near Pinon, AZ. He will be ready for adoption around September 20th after he has been neutered and had his second shot! He is working on walking on the leash, housebreaking and is doing great in the crate.

He is still located in Pinon, AZ with potential transport available to surrounding areas. For more info, contact his foster mama: perpetua3629@gmail.com

name: Susie B.
description:
Susie B. was born in October of 2006.  She is a senior rescue from the ASPCA of Pittsylvania County.  Susie B. has been spayed, all vaccines, heartworm checked and chipped.  She is a lovely beagle with a smile from ear to ear.  Bless this little gal - she has so many warts.  Actually warts on top of warts that make her even more endearing.

Susie B. is sponsored by: Mickey Thomas
Photography: Claudia Johnson

name: Spike
description: Meet Spike - He's a senior Fiest Mix that came to us from Pocohantus County. They say he is 19 years old but wow! He sure has a lot of pep for a guy that age and Doc seems to think he is more like 14 to 15. Poor guy is blind and has been for some time I gather. I was told once he lost his sight he started having accidents in the house and he was put outside in a crate in a field of tall grasses :( Well no more of that nonsense for this ole cutie....I mean come on, just look at that face. Spike still has a lot of love to give and trusts quickly and seems to do great with all the dogs here and love attention of people too. He also learned his territory here very quickly with a little help and follows my voice when we need to go outside. He even finds his way into an open crate for a nap on an occasion. Spike is now up to date on his vaccines, heart worm and lymes negative, neutered and micro chipped. We also tested negative for glaucoma. He is ready and that was and looking for his new forever family. Emails us for an application at mmadoptions@gmail.com

name: Abby
description: Abby is a 4 year old american bulldog. She is an absolute love bug and begs for kisses! You canât pet her enough which is obvious by the constant nudging of her nose. She will spend hours in your lap and is as mellow as they come. Sheâs not a fan of kitties but would do well with big dogs. A meet and greet would be needed to make sure sheâs a great fit for your home. Abby is located in Pompano Beach but transport can be arranged. Very sweet and well mannered, knows sit and walks good on leash.

name: Mario
description:
Hi! My Name is Mario. I came to my foster home in Central Ohio all the way from a shelter in Portage County. The shelter thought I would be better suited to be with Speak because they specialize in special need animal rescue. Oh yea, did I mention? I am deaf. But don't worry, that just makes me special, not different because I get to learn sign language. Right now, I know sit and come. I am eager to find my new family who will teach me more signs.

I like to run around too and play with other girl dogs. I am okay with boy dogs if girls aren't around. I am a gentleman and I like tend to be protective of girl dogs. My foster mom says I am what some people might call a \"velcro\" dog. I love to follow my foster mom from room to room and be by her at all times. I mean really, who doesn't like to hang out on the couch with their foster momma and watch TV?

I forgot to mention, I am great with kids too! I am okay with cats...I do like to sneak and get their food though. But I have to say I am super sweet boy and probably the most loyal dog on earth. I also give the best hugs. Hopefully we will have a chance to hang out sometime and I will give you one.

name: SANDY
description:
Sandy is a beautiful senior girl who would love to sit on the couch and enjoy TV with you. Sandy is a senior so she does go out to the bathroom often. She loves to be outside in the yard and soak up the sun, she enjoys her walks too. Sandy is looking for someone she can enjoy her golden years with, someone who can just love her, cuddle her, and make her feel like a princess.

Sandy would do best in a home where there are no other dogs or a very submissive dog that is about her size. She would be an ideal match for a couple, maybe even an older couple who understand what it's like to be aging.Sandy is located in New Windsor, NY (not too far from Poughkeepsie). Why not visit her and see if there's a love match? If you have another dog, you will need to bring him/her along.

Sandy is spayed, up-to-date on all vaccinations, and is microchipped. 

Please note: While some of our dogs have lived in a home environment, we cannot guarantee that they are housetrained.

Interested in fostering or adopting? Need more info on this dog? Want to set up a meet and greet? The first step in the process is filling out an application on our website.


	Adoption application: www.nycsecondchancerescue.org/general-application/
	Foster application:https://www.nycsecondchancerescue.org/dog-foster-application/
	Adoption process & fees:www.nycsecondchancerescue.org/process/
	Upcoming events:www.facebook.com/pg/SecondChanceRescueNycDogs/events
	States we adopt to:NY, NJ, CT, DE, PA, MD, NH, ME, VT, RI, MA

name: Tonka
description:
**Please note - Nugget is currently in foster care. Please call the shelter at (502)875-3436 to make arrangements to meet him.

Tonka is a Chihuahua mix who was born approximately October 2018. He came to us from the Pulaski County area after being relinquished by his owner. Tonka is a sweet little guy who is slowly coming out of his shell since he's been with us, but still needs help with socialization. He gets along with his doggy friends at the shelter, but we always recommend a meet-and-greet to make sure everyone gets along. He would benefit from being with an experienced dog owner who has the time and patience to work with him. His personality is sure to blossom in the right home! Tonka weighs 9 lbs, 3 oz.

If you have questions about this animal, please contact the adoption counselor directly at amyc0405@yahoo.com. Applications to adopt Tonka can be downloaded from our website (www.lifehouse4animals.org) under the 'Adopt' section and emailed directly to the adoption counselor at amyc0405@yahoo.com, or can be filled out in person at the shelter. We are completely staffed by volunteers and are typically unable to complete the adoption process on the same day that applications are submitted. Please understand that it can sometimes take 2-4 days to process an application.

name: Brandy
description:
Brandy is a terrier mix who was born approximately April 2018. She came to us from the Pulaski County shelter with her brother Buck. Brandy is shy and canb be hesitant to make new friends, but if you take your time with her you will be rewarded with lots of kisses and get to see her playful side! She is a very sweet girl and is sure to blossom in the right home. She might do well with an older, more confident dog to show her the ropes, or with an experienced dog owner who can introduce new things to her slowly. She's a diamond in the ruff! Brandy weighs 33 lbs. 

If you would like to visit Brandy, our shelter is open MWF from 1-4 pm and Saturdays from 9-noon. We are located at 14 Fido Ct., Frankfort KY 40601. We can be reached at (502)875-3436.

name: Tate
description:
Tate was  rescued by Dogma from Putnam county animal shelter, after being dumped, heartworm positive and still full of milk from nursing her pups. Dogma had her heartworm treated , so she is heartworm negative, up to date on shots and we are so happy to be giving this sweet girl a chance for a forever home.

Tate is about 8-years old, she weigh 65lbs, and she is housetrained and loves to go on walks.. She can stand to lose a few pounds, and is learning to sit, down and wait.

Tate would be best as an only dog, she is not a dog park dog, but enjoys going on walks, snuggling on the couch and sleeping close to you. She is a perfect girl when company comes over, and she has excellent house manners!  She is strong so she would be best with no young kids, but she is gentle and not a barker like most hound dogs! Tateâs ideal family would be a single adult or couple, she is great with men and women, and like most hounds, she needs to live in a house. She just wants to be the center of attention and loved. For the right family Tate will be your best friend, she doesnât need much, a bowl of food, a walk and a best friend. Is that you?

Tate's adoption donation is $75 and if you would like to apply to adopt this beautiful, sweet girl, visit our website www.DogmaRescue.org or email Info@DogmaRescue.org with questions.

name: BOSS
description: This big boy is Boss! Boss came to us from a shelter in Raleigh County after spending 9 months there! That's a long time for a dog this cute! He is looking forward to getting out of the shelter and into family life. During his time here, Boss has been friendly, enjoys attention from his people, loves to show off his sit command, and to go for zoomies in the play yard! He has met a dog here on leash and done well, but we would recommend a meet and greet here to help make sure he feels comfortable with other canine friends. Come ask us if Boss could be a good fit for you!

name: Pending Copper-Cooper
description:
Please contact Monica R Larner (cowdogrescue@gmail.com), (989) 330-5147 for more information about this pet.8-16-19 Copper-Cooper comes into rescue as an owner surrender due to apartment management taking over the lease which does not allow dogs, is what I was told. His DOB is 9-6-18. He is a nice young man, who likes people and likes other dogs. Please Note: First, we ask that you fill out the adoption application if you are interested in one of our dogs. We can only answer questions about the adoption process, before the application. Then during the phone interview (step two of the application process) we can answer more questions based on what your application has on it. If you email questions without doing an application, we will not be able to give you a good answer. There are too many variables which we look at when matching up dogs. Thank you for helping us to help you, and ultimately help the dogs looking for the right home. Our adoption fee ($250) covers the age appropriate spay / neutering, heart worm testing, rabies, distemper combo, microchipping and any other necessary medical that a dog may need. Please consider a rescue that comes to you with all of the routine medical (and then some) already done.
Need to find the application? Please visit our new website at www.cowdogrescue.comhttp://australian-cattle.dog/?page_id=241

Contact Monica at (989) 330-5147, Director of AuCaDo Rescue, for questions about adoption process. If you are looking for a certain rescue, let me know, as we always have rescues waiting to come here.
Dontate-A-Thundershirt ProgramClick HereDonate-A-Thundershirt Program
PLEASE NOTE: AuCaDo Rescue is not a public shelter. This dog is being fostered in a private home / kennel until adoption. Prospective adopters who have submitted an accepted application and completed a telephone interview are welcome to schedule an appointment to travel to meet the dog. If approved for adoption, a deposit will hold the dog until a meeting or transport is arranged. AuCaDo Rescue does welcome out of state adoptions. We require an approved application, phone interview, photos and willingness to travel to meet the dog. AuCaDo Rescue is located in Remus, Michigan.

name: ACD Missy Red
description:

They have no history, so we are guessing ages at just under a year. While they may be siblings, we do not know this, and is a guess. name: ACD Sr Rebel King HW+
description:
Please contact Monica R Larner (cowdogrescue@gmail.com), (989) 330-5147 for more information about this pet.Rebel will be coming back to rescue (we hope temporarily) to be HW treated. The Canadian adopter had until Christmas to get him back here for HW treatment, and has not returned him, and has had the adoption fee returned, since he is coming back. So the rescue has a breached adoption contract, no adoption fee, no proof / paperwork from the other vet, or Mr Rebel. Who does this, refuses to get his HW treatment done? (IF Rebel is HW positive, he came here that way.)Since he has not been returned to rescue, he is a stolen dog. 12-2-17 Rebel has a meet and greet scheduled. 8-8-17 Rebel King comes into rescue as Senior owner surrender. (Both are seniors) The reason given was that the vet would not put him down, and it was suggested that he give me a call. The only complaint was that the dog would sometimes circle-growl-nip at the owner when he poured his coffee in the morning, until the owner went to his office. We were told that he never did this with anyone else, and they had him since a puppy. No paperwork was given with him. name: ACD Flex
description:
Please contact Monica R Larner (cowdogrescue@gmail.com), (989) 330-5147 for more information about this pet.12-4-16 We received in Flex from someone who considered his release an emergency. Little did they remember that I had been contacted back in August of 2015 about him and did ask for him. However, they decided against it, even though they had already sent him intact to Canada to be a stud dog thru social media. (Poor Flex, he is very scared of his own shadow, so he must have been so very sad.)Fast forward to December 4, 2016 and it was explained that they had tried numerous times to rehome him and Flex would not take to anyone. Well, here we are....Flex is now between 2 and 3 and has been through some pretty horrible stuff. I can't even call it ignorance, since they did have an alternative over a year ago. I so wish I had him then. Flex will require a fenced in yard and quiet household where he can learn to trust again, at his own pace. He is NOT a bad dog, and with time and patience will be a faithful companion. Our adoption fee ($250) covers the age appropriate spay / neutering, heart worm testing, rabies, distemper combo, microchipping and any other necessary medical that a dog may need. name: ACD Mya is Deaf
description:
Please contact Monica R Larner (cowdogrescue@gmail.com), (989) 330-5147 for more information about this pet.
4-1-17 Returned to Rescue11-12-16 Pending Adoption10-29-16 Mya has a pending adoption. (Out of State)8-25-16 Mya is returned to rescue. 6-12-16 Mya has a pending adoption.
7-9-15 Mya comes into rescue as an owner surrender, due to her being deaf and finding out after the fact that she is three legged due to an injury at 3 months old which the breeder did not treat. The owner did not know she was deaf when she got her, supposedly. So then, the rescue only gets part of the story as well. Then the paperwork and x-rays are withheld. It seems that FHO surgery was done at 8 months old. Yet, it did not heal correctly and no rehab was done. So, at 14 months old, the rescue had the FHO Repair surgery done for her. Finding out the morning of the surgery, that she also has a luxating patella, grade 4, which (according to that particular vet) will also need repair after the hip is healed. The rescue had two more opinions, after her FHO surgery, and both of those vets (who we have previously worked with and trust more than the one(s) who did the surgery) agreed that taking off the knee cap and reattaching (because of the previous neglect) could make her unable to use her leg at all and make it worse. Therefore, we are opting to let her be the dog as she is very happy now. Our adoption fee ($250) covers the age appropriate spay / neutering, heart worm testing, rabies, distemper combo, microchipping and any other necessary medical that a dog may need. name: Yeti COURTESY LISTING!
description:
The following dog is not, nor has he ever been, part of our rescue.
We are listing him to help with his rehoming as a courtesy to his current owners.

If you are interested in finding out more about him, please contact the person listed at the end of the following set of notes (provided by his owner, Kenny):

His name is Yeti and his information is below:

1. He is 5 and his birthday is in November. He weighs about 65lbs.
2. He is Neutered. When I brought him back from South Korea, the Korean government required him to be neutered in Order to export him.
3. He is up to date on vaccinations as of May of this year.
4. He is not treated monthly for anything, as none of those are currently in my area and there are no signs of anything.
5. No known issues. Last Vet check was beginning of 2018 when I moved from Vegas to northern Reno.
6. He behaves normally around all. He doesnât like to be âtrapped/blockedâ in. I currently have him around my 2 other dogs whom my ex wife is taking. He is also around other animals from my ex wifeâs mom.
7. Normal routine consists of pretty much outside all day. I live on 40 acres and he runs around it all. He exercises outside all day with the other dogs. He only eats once a day, and it is currently at night around 2000 hours.
8. He is both an inside and outside dog. Does great with both.
9. He knows sit, down, come. He pulls slightly on a leash, but nothing over the top. When he sees other dogs, he is just curious. Wants to smell and normal stuff dogs do.
10. He likes to be pet and loved. The only sensitive part is his tail. When we found him in Korea, he had a rubber band around his tail. The doctors had to cut it to make it healthy. That is the only part about him that is sensitive. You can see it in the photos.
11. He rides in cars fine. Back of trucks too. He hates the vet. Doesnât like to get shots, but it is possible. Can be lifted. Just marks his territory a lot.
12. He has not bitten anybody or any other animals that I am aware of. I just came back from overseas after a year, and my ex wife didnât say anything.
13. No separation anxiety or behavioral issues that I know of. He is kennel trained and dog door trained.
14. I adopted Yeti while I was stationed in Korea. I rescued him from a meat market. He has had all American veterinary care in Korea and well as in the states. Up to date on all shots. The reason Iâm rehoming him is because I got divorced right before my deployment and now that I am back, with the divorce and child support, I can no longer keep a place that can an animal can accompany me. I have to downsize my current lifestyle and living expenses in order to keep my head above water. I have had Yeti since 2014 when he turned 1.
15. I have not contacted any other rescues as of this moment.
16. Best method of contact is 702.823.9275 or kenny032004@gmail.com
17. Address: Reno NV, 89510.

name: THOR
description:
Thor: 
He is a long hair Saint Bernard. Loves people and a car ride. He Does NOT Like Small Dogs. 
Other dogs are ok. He is about 3-4 years old. .  Wants to be a house dog. 


The adoption fee includes all shots, heart worm test, neutering, a Home Again microchip and one night free obedience class in the Reno, Sparks, Carson City and Tahoe areas. We also include an information packet and a large bag of dog food. Our adoption fee is $400.00 and we are located in Reno, NV..  If you are interested in adopting, please fill out an adoption application. Click here to start the adoption application.

name: ZOEY
description:
Hi My name is Zoey; I am a reformed fence jumper and digger. My Rescue mom has convinced me that it's not lady like to do that. I am 4-5 yrs old. I would prefer a home with a doggy door as I like to go inside the house whenever I want.  I like male large dogs only. No cats and No foo-Foo Dogs. ( little ones) I have very good manners I sit for my food, will walk nicely on a leash when I am not excited about something. 

The adoption fee includes all shots, heart worm test, neutering, a Home Again microchip and one night free obedience class in the Reno, Sparks, Carson City and Tahoe areas. We also include an information packet and a large bag of dog food. Our adoption fee is $400.00 and we are located in Reno, NV..  If you are interested in adopting, please fill out an adoption application. www.saintsofthewest.com

name: Connie
description:
You'll fall for Connie's soft expression and puppy-dog eyes! Connie is a one-year-old Mountain Cur mix that originally came from Richland County.  All we know about Connie is what we've seen in the shelter. So far, Connie is a big fan of hot dogs and sits on command for them.  She does not like loud, reactive dogs and would do best with a mild-mannered, sedate canine companion.  Connie is a people-lover and has a lot of potential to be a loving family member!

If you have kids and/or another dog in your family and are interested in adopting a Friendship dog please bring them with you for a meet and greet.  No appointment is necessary.  Stop by anytime during regular business hours. 

All dogs receive one or more vaccinations, a basic veterinary examination, are wormed, heartworm tested, and spayed or neutered.  Dogs 3 months and older are micro-chipped.

name: Shelton
description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Shelton is a gorgeous Yorkie mix who is around two years old and fully grown at 19 pounds.  This beautiful boy came to us from a rural southwestern Virginia shelter after being found as a stray.  He is a very nice dog that likes other dogs and loves people!  We think he would make an excellent addition to most families.

Shelton has been thoroughly examined by our vet and appears to be in great health!  He has received initial vaccines, had blood tests to rule out heart worms and tick borne illnesses, and he will be neutered and microchipped as a part of our adoption process.

CARE Rescue is  foster-base rescue located in Richmond, VA.  We do not have a facility for you to come to meet animals at.  You must visit our weekly adoption stand (calendar on our website) to meet the adoptable dogs.  Out of area adoptions can only be facilitated when we are able to find a volunteer to do a home visit for us and when the potential adopter already has a veterinary reference.

name: Sadie
description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Sadie is a darling little Yorkie who is about 8 years old.  She came to us with another older gal after her owner died, and the extended family was not able to keep them.  Both were in pretty sad shape with horrible skin which we were told was allergies, but good hygiene and nutrition, plus flea eradication, has allowed the skin to completely clear.  Paperwork from the previous veterinarian indicates that most care was declined.

Since coming to our rescue Sadie has been spayed, had a mammary tumor (benign) removed and tested, been given a dental cleaning with extractions, been given all vaccines, had extensive blood testing to make certain there were no underlying conditions and been microchipped.  With good care and her small size, Sadie should live a very long time and enjoy life!  Sadie loves being a lap dog.  We are seeking a quiet and predictable home for her since that is what she is used to.

CARE Rescue is  foster-base rescue located in Richmond, VA.  We do not have a facility for you to come to meet animals at.  You must visit our weekly adoption stand (calendar on our website) to meet the adoptable dogs.  Out of area adoptions can only be facilitated when we are able to find a volunteer to do a home visit for us and when the potential adopter already has a veterinary reference.

name: Guthrie
description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Guthrie is a beautiful pure-bred male pug who appears to be around 2 years old.  He came to us from a rural southwestern Virginia shelter where he had been found as a stray and never reclaimed.  Guthrie's nickname could be Bozo for the happy-go-lucky, goofy guy that he is.  He loves people, loves to play and talk with them, loves to run and play with other dogs and just makes you happy every second you spend with him!

Guthrie appears to be in good health.  He has received his initial vaccines and been examined by our vet.  He tested negative for heartworms but positive for erlichea (a tick-borne illness).  He will be treated with antibiotics, neutered and microchipped as a part of our adoption process.

Gunner is a precious male chihuahua who came to us recently from a local Virginia shelter partner. This little guy was part of a hoarding seizure and is understandably scared of new people and new situations. He is thought to be about a year old and fully grown at seven pounds. He will be best served by a patient and experienced owner who is able to help him learn to trust and love.

Gunner has been examined and appears to be in good health.  That said, he has tested positive for heart worms.  We have begun a slow kill treatment, and he will be neutered as a part of our adoption process.  Gunner has received vaccines and has been microchipped.

This little guy was born sometime around Easter, and he is thought to be a Yorkie mix. He is expected to stay small and be less than 20 pounds fully grown. This little fellow will surely steal your heart!

Kendall is completing his puppy vaccines. Until they are complete it will be very important that he not be exposed to other animals and possible contagions. We will look for a home with a secure yard that can keep him safe. Our puppy policy is on our website and we encourage interested adopters to learn about it. name: Zeb
description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Zeb, and his sibling, Zach, recently came to us from a local shelter under quarantine as they had been exposed to parvo.  They were part of a hoarding situation in a nearby rural county.  Our vet worked hard with anti-viral medications to try to keep the boys safe, and we are excited to report that their immune systems were able to protect them!  They are now looking for homes where they can be the center of attention and beloved pets.  The boys are thought to have been born in late spring and will most likely be 25-30 pounds when fully grown.

As a part of our adoption process, Zeb is receiving his puppy vaccines.  He will be neutered and microchipped, as well.  Because he is a young puppy care must be taken to place him in a secure home able to offer a safe environment as he continues to grow, and especially until his bones and growth plates fuse.

description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Flash is a rare beautiful blue merle male chihuahua who is 1-2 years old.  He came to us from a local shelter partner after being surrendered by his owner.  This little fellow has been passed from owner to owner and has understandably developed some separation anxiety issues that caused the current owner to feel unable to properly care for him.  In his short time with us we see a wonderful dog who would do very well in a home with an experienced dog owner that has a very predictable schedule.  Once Flash has someone he can trust, a routine he can count on and some TLC, he will be a wonderful pet!

Flash is in good health.  As a part of our rescue protocols, Flash will have all vaccinations, blood tests, a microchip implant and neuter surgery.

description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Daphne is a darling female chihuahua who recently came to us from a regional shelter in a nearby rural community.  We have little information about her, but we know she and several other chihuahuas were taken from a hoarding situation.  Daphne appears to be one of the lucky ones who has had some level of human socialization and is not fearful of people.  We believe she is a younger adult, and are still gathering information about her.

Daphne likes adults who are kind and patient.  She is quick with a wag of the tail and to give kisses. We believe that she will thrive in a patient home without larger animals, and she will begin to understand the joy of being a beloved pet.  Delilah appears to be a healthy girl.  She will be given her vaccinations and will be spayed and microchipped as a part of her adoption process.

name: Chyna
description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Chyna is again available for adoption!  This beautiful girl originally came to us in April in medical distress.  She had ingested corn cobs and was unable to pass them.  Her owners were unable to afford to provide her with the life-saving surgery she needed, and they surrendered her to our veterinarian.  We were happy to be able to work with our vet (who we think is just the most awesome vet ever, by the way) to provide for Chyna's immediate surgery on a Saturday afternoon.  We then had Chyna vaccinated, spayed and microchipped, and in May she was adopted.  Sadly her adopted family had a job change and she has returned to our care.

We believe Chyna is getting close to a year old now, and she is a big, beautiful, happy, gentle girl.  She is in great health, and she has been housebroken while with her last family.  We are seeking a home for Chyna with knowledgable and responsible owners able to handle a large dog.  Because she is a young lady, she will need an adopter able to properly exercise her.  We would love an active adopter for her!  Chyna has not been recently weighed.  Our best guess is that she is about 50 pounds now.

CARE Rescue is  foster-base rescue located in Richmond, VA.  We do not have a facility for you to come to meet animals at.  You must visit our weekly adoption stand (calendar on our website) to meet the adoptable dogs.  Out of area adoptions can only be facilitated when we are able to find a volunteer to do a home visit for us and when the potential adopter already has a veterinary reference.

description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Blossom is a two year old chihuahua mix who came to CARE from a local shelter.  She was surrendered by an owner who was no longer able to care for her.  The owner stated that Blossom was housebroken, slept in the bed, loved riding in the car and playing with squeaky toys and was a joy to own.  The only negative mentioned was that Blossom can be an escape artist so will need a secure home.  She is fully grown at about 15 pounds. we believe she may have some Jack Russell terrier in her, as she behaves as one does.

As a part of her adoption process, Blossom has received all her vaccines and has had blood tests to rule out heart worms and tick borne illnesses.  This coming week she will be spayed and microchipped.  We believe she will make an awesome addition to most families, especially those who are active.

description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Introducing Rigby, a cute little mixed breed dog who is about 3 years old and fully grown at 15 pounds.    The first question most people ask is what the breed of the dog is, and the truth is, we haven't a clue!  We see dachshund, Jack Russell terrier, pug and chihuahua, but your guess is as good as any!  Rigby is a happy, healthy dog who would love to have a home of his own!

Rigby is in good health.  He has been neutered and microchipped, given all his vaccines and has had blood tests to rule out heart worms and tick borne illness.  Rigby will do best in a home with experienced pet owners who have a secure environment.  He is good with other dogs his age, but may be better suited to a home without small children.

CARE Rescue is  foster-base rescue located in Richmond, VA.  We do not have a facility for you to come to meet animals at.  You must visit our weekly adoption stand (calendar on our website) to meet the adoptable dogs.  Out of area adoptions can only be facilitated when we are able to find a volunteer to do a home visit for us and when the potential adopter already has a veterinary reference.

name: Rhett
description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Rhett is a beautiful male Redbone hound who our vet believes is 5-6 years old.  This sweet fellow was found in a rural southern VA county as a stray and was totally emaciated, having been on his own for some time, most likely.  Since coming to CARE we have helped him to put on weight and feel loved.  He is a very nice dog who is looking for a family willing to share their home and hearts.

Rhett is in otherwise good health.  He has been given all his vaccines and has had blood tests.  We are very excited to share that he tested negative for heartworms!  He did test positive for erlichia and lyme, both spread by ticks, and we have provided treatment for both.  Rhett will be neutered and microchipped as a part of our adoption process.  He will make a wonderful addition to most any home!

CARE Rescue is  foster-base rescue located in Richmond, VA.  We do not have a facility for you to come to meet animals at.  You must visit our weekly adoption stand (calendar on our website) to meet the adoptable dogs.  Out of area adoptions can only be facilitated when we are able to find a volunteer to do a home visit for us and when the potential adopter already has a veterinary reference.

name: Garrett
description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Garrett is a beautiful male Jack Russell terrier mix that came to us from a rural southwestern Virginia shelter.  He is a three year old fellow who weighs just under 30 pounds.  Garrett is vision impaired, and may be unable to see at all.  He is a smart guy, however, and can walk up and down staircases and get around pretty well on a leash.

Garrett loves people and he loves other dogs.  A home with another kind pet would be such a blessing to him.  He is a quiet and cooperative, and deserves to be someone's cherished pet.  Garrett is in good health.  He is neutered and microchipped, up to date with all vaccines and on heartworm prevention.

CARE Rescue is  foster-base rescue located in Richmond, VA.  We do not have a facility for you to come to meet animals at.  You must visit our weekly adoption stand (calendar on our website) to meet the adoptable dogs.  Out of area adoptions can only be facilitated when we are able to find a volunteer to do a home visit for us and when the potential adopter already has a veterinary reference.

name: Tippy
description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Tippy is a gorgeous Akita/Lab mix that we rescued from a high-kill shelter on the day he was to be euthanized.  He is a favorite with our volunteers.  Tippy walks well on a harness and leash and appears crate trained.  He has not been tested with cats but seems good with other large dogs.  Tippy is heart worm positive and has begun treatment.  He is neutered, microchipped and up to date with vaccines.  Learn how to meet and adopt Tippy at www.carerva.com.

CARE Rescue is  foster-base rescue located in Richmond, VA.  We do not have a facility for you to come to meet animals at.  You must visit our weekly adoption stand (calendar on our website) to meet the adoptable dogs.  Out of area adoptions can only be facilitated when we are able to find a volunteer to do a home visit for us and when the potential adopter already has a veterinary reference.

name: Rico
description:
Rico came to us from an overcrowded shelter in the south to find love here in Rochester. Currently around 6 months old and 40lbs, this adorable brindle boy is all puppy! His foster mom says he is the happiest of fellows (his tail never stops wagging), he is super spunky, and full of cuddles. He's got the brightest sparkly eyes, full of joy and puppy mischief.

Rico is friendly and confident, loves everyone he meets, and loves playing with other dogs of all sizes. He has never met a cat that we know of so he would have to meet any resident kitties before an adoption can be approved. He is full of energy and loves to play and run. Rico would do best in a home with a fenced yard and another dog to play with.

If you would like to meet Rico, please submit the adoption application found at k9orphans.org !!

name: Autumn
description:
My name is Autumn! I was rescued from a bike trail in Roseville when  good samaritan called Pit Crew for help.  I was very scared, but I warmed up to my new foster home very quickly. 

PLEASE DO NOT CONTACT THE RESCUE THROUGH PETFINDER, VISIT PITCREW.ORG AND COMPLETE ADOPTION APPLICATION.

*All of our rescue dogs are spayed/neutered, up-to-date on vaccinations and microchipped*

More information:
pitcrew.org

name: Sabrina
description:
Hello Everyone! It's me Sabrina and I am now available for adoption!!! I am doing terrific in foster care! I am so happy I was rescued from euthanasia in Roswell! They said my time was up... but a very nice lady offered to foster me and she saved my life! She helped to rescue me and even drove down to get me!!! I am so grateful she did!!! I show her everyday how lovable and wonderful I am.

You see I am still just a puppy of 8 months old. I recently went to my new veterinarian and I am healthy, current on all vaccines now, HW neg and chipped! I am so excited that I was saved and I have my entire life ahead of me! I can't wait to meet my FUREVER family and go on new exciting adventures! I like the companionship of other dogs and enjoy playing with them. I am learning basic manners and commands like sit and lay down. I am housebroken already and even know the word potty. I am super duper smart. I am still learning my crate training and getting better at it every day! If you would like to meet me I promise I will put a big smile on your face! I would love to meet you!

name: Gilbert
description:
Gilbert is a Jack Russel Terrier/Chihuahua mix who was born approximately Aug. 2018.  He and his friend Duke came to us from Rowan County, after being rescued from a hoarding/neglect case.  Gilbert is a very sweet little boy who is determined to look on the bright side, make new friends and have as much fun as possible.  Just look at that smile! He also rocks the cutest curly tail you've ever seen. Gilbert weighs 11 lbs., 7 oz.

If you would like to visit Gilbert, our shelter is open MWF from 1-4 pm and Saturdays from 9-noon. We are located at 14 Fido Ct., Frankfort KY 40601. We can be reached at (502)875-3436.

If you have questions about this animal, please contact the adoption counselor directly at amyc0405@yahoo.com. Applications to adopt Gilbert can be downloaded from our website (www.lifehouse4animals.org) under the 'Adopt' section and emailed directly to the adoption counselor at amyc0405@yahoo.com, or can be filled out in person at the shelter. We are completely staffed by volunteers and are typically unable to complete the adoption process on the same day that applications are submitted. Please understand that it can sometimes take 2-4 days to process an application.

name: Duke
description:
Duke is a Jack Russel Terrier/Chihuahua mix who was born approximately Aug. 2018.  He and his friend Gilbert came to us from Rowan County, after being rescued from a hoarding/neglect case.  Duke is a very sweet little boy who is determined to look on the bright side, make new friends and have as much fun as possible.  Just look at that smile! Duke weighs 14 lbs.

If you would like to visit Duke, our shelter is open MWF from 1-4 pm and Saturdays from 9-noon. We are located at 14 Fido Ct., Frankfort KY 40601. We can be reached at (502)875-3436.

If you have questions about this animal, please contact the adoption counselor directly at amyc0405@yahoo.com. Applications to adopt Duke can be downloaded from our website (www.lifehouse4animals.org) under the 'Adopt' section and emailed directly to the adoption counselor at amyc0405@yahoo.com, or can be filled out in person at the shelter. We are completely staffed by volunteers and are typically unable to complete the adoption process on the same day that applications are submitted. Please understand that it can sometimes take 2-4 days to process an application.

name: Dyno
description:
Dyno NEEDS either a Temporary Home or a Forever Home - Can he crash with you?

Dyno is a 3 year old lab mix who weighs approx 54 lbs. We aren't sure about his past as we saved him from Rowan County AC.  He is very sweet and loves to cuddle. He wants to be a lap dog. Dyno is still learning what's allowed and what's not. His foster is helping teach him.  He wants so badly to please his humans. He simply needs obedience and structure to help him succeed. We would love to see him in a home where he is the only dog. He is dog selective. We're not sureHe would also do best in a home without other dogs, or where he can be separated from other dogs. Dyno loves children. His best fit would be with older children as he loves his toys and older kids would know which toys are his. 

He is working on his social skills. He still gets anxious, and scared in public places. 

This sweet baby deserves a chance to learn from someone willing to help him. We will gladly help in this process by offering some training for a foster or adopter. He needs help this week. Please share this post. We know someone reading it will help. We pay for everything. You can start as a foster to adopt.

Foster Application Link:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSf2s67Gs7HN4IYvl42qprtJYyitT7HSUiDTa6N6y_ll-4TXVA/viewform

name: XP Inde - Roxbury, NJ - URGENT!
description:
Inde and Harley were adopted as puppies from the Newark Shelter. Unfortunately their family can no longer care for them & we hope to avoid their being surrendered back to that shelter. Harley has been adopted!!

Inde is housebroken and knows basic commands (sit, down, stay and come). She also loves to swim. Inde gets a little protective over her food so they were fed separately but otherwise get along together great. Inde can be picky about her doggie friends particularly ones that are high energy/aggressive ones but she is otherwise a great family dog. Inde weighs about 60 pounds and is 6 years old. She is spayed and up to date on her vaccinations.

Inde is NOT with Eleventh Hour Rescue. This is a courtesy listing - EHR is helping her owners to network her for a new home. Inde is located in Roxbury, NJ. For more information on Inde please contact Britany at britanylm@gmail.com or 914-776-4962

name: Tovi
description: Tovi was pulled from Russell County on her last day there. She was set to be euthanized. We pulled her and put her in a foster home. She was a littler nervous at first, but warmed up slowly. She gave her foster mom and dad kisses the entire ride home from the shelter. She was grateful.. Tovi is 2.5 years old. She is mixed breed. Not sure what breed she is. We took her to the vet and she is HW POSITIVE. So we are preparing her for the fast kill HW treatment. She is on antibiotics now to prep her body for the treatment. She is currently on Nexgard and Heartgard. She is UTD on all shots, microchipped, rabies. Since we have had her in foster, we have learned that she is not good with cats. She LOVES other dogs, but chases cats. We are looking for a home that is cat free. She will need to be in a home that can keep her calm during her treatments in Sept. Tovi is available for adoption as well. All treatments are being paid for by NHR. Her current foster mom said she's so good in the house. She is so chill and sat in the kitchen while she cooked and was a go with the flo kinda girl. She can play tough and rough with the other dogs in the yard. If your interested in Tovi, please apply here: www.nhrescue.com.

name: Chance
description: If you are interested in adopting this dog, please fill out our dog adoption questionnaire and e-mail it to lauren.baird.htar@gmail.com. PLEASE VISIT THIS WEBSITE TO FIND THE ADOPTION QUESTIONNAIRE: http://www.homewardtrails.org/adopt-a-pet/adoption-forms/ Chance was rescued from Russell County and is currently in a foster home! He is great with other dogs, loves to play a lot and then take a lot of naps, is very food motivated, is crate trained, he's mostly house trained, enjoys long walks and car rides, and he's got the best personality! He is feisty but incredibly sweet, very smart but oh so goofy, and loves everyone he meets! He is very active and would love a family to play with him (fetch and tug-of-war are his favs!) and help him with his training as he grows. He has already learned sit, shake, and down. Can you be his forever home? Please fill out an application to meet him! Adoption Coordinator: Lauren B Location: Foster Home The adoption fee for this dog is $375. This fee DOES NOT INCLUDE spay/neuter but microchip is included. We are proud to partner with the following veterinarians who offer a free first exam for your animal, exclusively for HT adopters: Caring Hands Animal Hospital, Palisades Veterinary Clinic, Sunshine Animal Hospital and Clarendon Animal Care and all VCA Animal Hospitals. Additionally, any VCA hospital will cover illnesses up to $250 at no cost to any Homeward Trails adopter. We also provide a 30-minute phone consult with a professional dog trainer at Fur-Get Me Not within the first 30 days of adopting - just for HT adopters in the Arlington/Alexandria area. Start your new dog out on the right foot with this valuable, expert advice and guidance FREE! COME MEET ADOPTABLE DOGS EVERY SATURDAY AND SUNDAY from 10AM - 4PM at the Homeward Trails Adoption Center- 11116 Fairfax Station Road, Fairfax Station VA 22039! **Note that puppies are in foster homes, not at the Adoption Center.

name: Bugsy
description: If you are interested in adopting this dog, please fill out our dog adoption questionnaire and e-mail it to lauren.baird.htar@gmail.com. PLEASE VISIT THIS WEBSITE TO FIND THE ADOPTION QUESTIONNAIRE: http://www.homewardtrails.org/adopt-a-pet/adoption-forms/ Bugsy is coming to us from Russell County. She is a sweet girl and is good with smaller dogs and cats! She loves to play fetch and snuggle on the couch. She is a sweet dog but will need a quiet home with a dedicated owner. She loves other dogs but isn't a fan of little kids and loud noises so apartments/urban areas aren't a good fit for her. She is a very loyal dog, quiet in her crate, medium energy level, loves to play and settles into a routine well! She can be people selective so a quiet home without a lot of people coming/going will be a better fit for her. Adoption Coordinator: Lauren Baird Breed Estimate: St. Bernard Mix Gender: Female Approximate weight: 50 pounds @ 5 months Approximate age: 6 months on 7/14 Location: Foster Home Cratetrained: Yes Coat Type: medium *Please note puppies are in foster homes- not at our adoption center! The adoption fee for this dog is $375. This fee DOES INCLUDE spay/neuter and microchip. If the animal you are adopting is not already spayed/neutered, you will be required to sign a contract legally obligating you to have the animal altered. Please contact your HT rep to learn about exclusive low-cost spay/neuter options made available only to HT adopters! Every adopted Homeward Trails animal comes with 30 days of free pet health insurance. We are proud to partner with the following veterinarians who offer a free first exam for your animal, exclusively for HT adopters: Caring Hands Animal Hospital, Palisades Veterinary Clinic, Sunshine Animal Hospital and Clarendon Animal Care and all VCA Animal Hospitals. Additionally, any VCA hospital will cover illnesses up to $250 at no cost to any Homeward Trails adopter. Start your new dog out on the right foot with this valuable, expert advice and guidance FREE! You can save animals like this one by becoming a foster! Fosters are like way stations between high kill shelters and forever homes. We need fosters so that we can save dogs before they are euthanized at the shelters. If you are interested in becoming a foster, please check out our information about fostering by visiting http://www.homewardtrails.org/foster-a-pet/dog-and-cat-foster-program/

name: Benji
description:
Benji came to The LAP on June 20, 2019 from Russell County.  He is a senior dog - between 5-9 years old.  Benji is darling sweet, loving, polite - in other words he's a perfect gentleman.    Benji has all his vaccines and is heartworm negative and he has been chipped.

Benji is sponsored by:  Jerry and Pamela Altieri.

name: YoYo
description: Meet YoYo!  This beautiful shepherd mix girl is now available for adoption after giving birth to 9 beautiful babies.  YoYo was a wonderful Mom and now that her puppies have all been adopted, it is her turn to find a wonderful home.  YoYo has been spayed, is up to date on all shots, microchipped and HW negative.  She came into our rescue from a high kill shelter in S. Louisiana where she and her 2 day old babies were hours away from being euthanized.  Thankfully we were able to take her and pups into our program before this happened.  YoYo is a loving girl who would do great as an only dog as she is timid of other dogs initially.  If she is in a home where her people have time and patience to teach her that other dogs are ok and not going to hurt her, she would do fine, but she does need some time to understand it is ok and she does not have to scrap for her food.  Please consider opening your heart and home to this beautiful 2 year old girl.  If interested in adopting you may email us at danteshoperescue@gmail.com

name: Anna
description:
Adorable Anna came to us from the Sanger shelter where she landed as a stray. Petite 45 lbs, she is good with dogs, and is a sensitive gentle soul looking for a person or family to finally call her very own. She has done great with kids and lived with children 9-15 years old in her last foster home. She travels well in the car, and is treat motivated. Moderate activity level, she will benefit from stability and structure, daily walks and lots of love.

$200 adoption donation includes spay, vaccinations, microchip and utd on monthly preventatives + free wellness exam to banfield vet hospital. 

Interested adopters > > > complete adoption form at 
heartsforpawsrescue.com/adopt

1. Complete form at heartsforpawsrescue.com/adopt
2. We will promptly respond to discuss the match/ potential meet & greet
3. Meet the animal in person (heartsforpawsrescue.com/meet-greet-info)

Follow along at 
facebook.com/heartsforpawsrescue and instagram @heartsforpawsrescue to see all our dogs available for adoption

HFPR is a volunteer run 501c3 rescue with foster homes from Sacramento through the Bay Area. All of our dogs are in loving foster homes so we can learn about them and help pair you with the best match. Looking for capable, committed and qualified Homes to love and care for adopted dogs for their lifetimes.
