name: P'nut
description:
Pânut is a scrappy 7-year-old lab/pit mix who needs to be the only dog in the house (no cats, either)! Sheâs a strong-willed, loving, energetic girl who gives everything her all. Her favorite things to do are playing fetch (especially in the water like Tahoe or a pool!), snuggling up to her humans, sunbathing in a backyard or under a window, watching TV very attentively, riding shotgun in the car, and exploring the neighborhood on walks. Sheâs super attuned to her humansâ moods. She loves attention and is very attentive herself.

 Pânut was originally a rescue (I got her 3 years ago) who Iâm guessing wasnât socialized very well and therefore is pretty anxious in certain situations. Sometimes sheâll act nervous and growl/bark at new people (sheâs never bitten a person) until she gets comfortable or, more rarely, goes into timeout to calm down. She has struggled with resource guarding which can be addressed through training that I unfortunately donât have time or energy for. Over the years, she has bitten two dogs (whoâve lived with her and was otherwise friendly with) when they have tried to take her ball or food. She sometimes gets into stuff she shouldnât (mostly food and fun stuff like cardboard) when sheâs left alone too long or when sheâs bored. This can be solved by moving things out of her reach and/or more training.

An ideal home would have someone who can walk her daily and play fetch in the backyard or at a dog park frequently. Ideally they wouldnât be away at work all day, or if they are, there are others who can check in on her or give her attention throughout the day.

 I know in my heart of hearts that Pânut is a good girl who just wasnât taught how to deal with her anxiety. She has made so much progress over the few years Iâve lived with her and Iâm so proud of her! Everyone she meets can tell sheâs so full of love that she just wants to share with everyone - especially through licks and cuddles.

Interested adopters > > > complete adoption form at 
heartsforpawsrescue.com/adopt

1. Complete form at heartsforpawsrescue.com/adopt
2. We will promptly respond to discuss the match/ potential meet & greet
3. Meet the animal in person (heartsforpawsrescue.com/meet-greet-info)

Follow along at 
facebook.com/heartsforpawsrescue and instagram @heartsforpawsrescue to see all our dogs available for adoption

HFPR is a volunteer run 501c3 rescue with foster homes from Sacramento through the Bay Area. All of our dogs are in loving foster homes so we can learn about them and help pair you with the best match. Looking for capable, committed and qualified Homes to love and care for adopted dogs for their lifetimes.

name: MaMaMeeA
description:
COURTESY POST.  PLEASE CONTACT LYNDA AT 530-343-5171 or e-mail wannaberun@gmail.com

Meet MaMaMeeA. She is approximately 10 years old.  Came from a shelter in Sacramento about a year ago and was lactating so had puppies somewhere.  I could tell by her torn ear and few scars on her front legs that she had some run ins with other dogs.  But oh she loves people and loves to play fetch.  She is 19 lbs; housebroken; current on vaccinations to in rabies, heart worm negative and on heart worm prevention; spayed; fecal clear; and on no medications.

name: Frankie  Adoption Pending
description:
Adoption Pending on Frankie

Application to meet Frankie at www.chowsplus.org

Meet sweet boy Frankie!  He is such a handsome mix weighing 52 lbs. Frankie is a sweet playful boy who knows sit, shake, and down. He LOVES playing with other dogs so a home with a playmate for Frankie would be great. 
A home without cats is needed since Frankie is a little too interested in them.
We are not positive on his breed. He may be a mix of husky, akita and chow.
He is very friendly and has been fine with kids ages 11 and up.

Frankie is a smart boy that learns quickly. He is house trained, rides great in the car, loves to be with people and around 2 years old. He is neutered, microchipped and vaccinated and ready for his new forever home.  He is located in Sacramento. If you are interested in meeting him you can submit an application at:
www.chowsplus.org

name: Snoopy
description:
\"Snoopy\" is a 70-lb, 1-yo neutered male GSD mix who is happy, loveable and a little goofy. Snoopy is friendly with everyone he meets but will likely be a good watchdog as well. I KNOW that Snoopy will be great with young children; he met two kids (ages 8 & 10) and was literally melting in their arms. Snoopy is very affectionate and loves to snuggle right next to you in bed.

Snoopy gets along fine with other dogs, but he does have a prey drive and doesn't seem to know what a little dog is; therefore, I am seeking a home with no small dogs. (I'm confident that once he realized that little dogs are indeed dogs, he'd be fine with them.) Snoopy prefers to receive attention from humans much more so than from other dogs, so he'd be fine as an only dog.

I have not seen Snoopy around cats, but since he went after a Chihuahua mix, I can't consider a home with cats for him.

Snoopy is housetrained and never had an accident in the house he's in, but he does occasionally get his paws up on the counter if there is food present. He responds well to the \"sit\" and \"lie down\" commands, so apparently he's received some obedience training in his young life. 

Snoopy walks very well on leash and rides calmly in a vehicle. He apparently enjoys water, as he took to the pond at GSRSV's rescue ranch fairly quickly.

Snoopy gets his name from his long snout and the somewhat comical overbite in his muzzle. I'm not sure if his overbite originates from another canine breed (Collie?) but it does not affect his ability to eat normally. 

GSRSV rescued Snoopy from the Stanislaus County Shelter on 6-23-18. He had been at the shelter since May 12; I imagine that he was a staff favorite at the shelter. Nonetheless, his time had run out and he was going to be euthanized so GSRSV appealed for donations to board Snoopy until he could be transferred to a no-kill shelter out of state. Three women came forward with donations to cover his boarding expense. (Thank you Danielle Blount, Diana Cheung and Alicia Navarro!) When I discovered what a sweet dog Snoopy is, I searched for and was able to find a foster home for him so that he wouldn't have to go back to a shelter. 

Snoopy is located in Sacramento. His adoption fee is $210.

name: Nina
description:
Nina is a female, blonde Terrier mix. Her estimated date of birth is January, 2019.  She was rescued from the Salisaw shelter as an unclaimed stray. She is a super cute girl, previously housed in a foster home. She's wonderfully sweet, healthy, and ready for her forever home! You can meet her at South Memorial Animal Hospital. Call 918-664-8690 for an appointment. Nina has an adoption fee $150 plus the cost of 6 months of heartworm prevention.  

Note: ARF reserves the right to deny any application that is deemed unsuitable for the animal. Please be aware that our animal adoptions are NOT on a first come- first serve basis. Our sole purpose is to find the best possible home for the animals that fall under our care. We do not ship our animals. All adopters are expected to come to Tulsa if approved.

name: Inara
description:
Name: Inara
Primary Breed:Â Samoyed
Gender:Â Female
Entry Date:Â 01/10/19
Birth Date: 2-5 Years
Adoption Fee:Â $150.00

Full Description:Â This dog is from the last group of Samoyeds rescued from Whitefire Kennels, a large-scale breeder in Manly, IA. In the last year, over 300 dogs have been rescued from this facility and a criminal neglect case against the breeder is pending. In the meantime, we have worked tirelessly to find homes for these special rescued friends where they will be treated as beloved family pets and not as livestock. 

If youâd like to adopt a Samoyed from our shelter, we require:
-a completed Adoption Application (found under the âApplication Formsâ tab)
-previous or current Samoyed breed experience
-all pets in home must be spayed/neutered and current on vaccines
-approved adoptions must be completed in person. We do not ship or transport dogs; you must come to our shelter to adopt a Samoyed.
-Adult dogs require another dog(s) in the home to help them adjust and feel more comfortable.

Please call the Humane Society of North Iowa at 641-423-6241 for more information.

Adoption fee covers the following veterinarianÂ services: spay/neuter surgery, age appropriateÂ vaccinations, flea and dewormer treatment, feline leukemia/FIV test in cats, and heartworm test for dogs.

name: Ramps
description: from owner who surrendered him: Rampage we found while visiting my sister in San Antonio. We went to a San Antonio Rampage hockey game, and there he was, under our car at the SBC Center when we went to leave. We just had to take him home. He was very skinny and hungry and very scared. We brought him home October 26, 2013. He looks like a lab, but is not quite as big as most of the labs I have had. and his is brown with a white patch on his tummy. But my guess would be he has some lab in him. When we took him to the vet the following week, he estimated he was probably around 4 months old. So we approximate his birthday July-ish of 2013. Rampage still shows some signs of being abandoned or hurt by whomever left him in the SBC center parking lot. It took him a while to get used to people, and he scarfs down every drop of food when it hits the bowl. After being with us for almost 4 years, he has become very loving and comfortable. He is still scared of new people. He does not show aggression toward them at all, he just runs away and hides. However, he does show affection toward frequent visitors, such as our parents, siblings, and nieces & nephews. So we are confident he will become comfortable is his new home quickly. He does still eat all his food immediately, so we do not free feed him. He eats once a day and eats every drop immediately.  He is great with other dogs- submissive

name: Snickers
description:
Snickers is a 6 year-old Chihuahua cross who is gorgeous.  He is a black and tan pooch with a good coat and body structure.  He was transferred from a local shelter where he was surrendered by his owner due to circumstances unrelated to Snickers.  

Snickers is shy yet friendly.  He likes being held after he's sniffed around and gotten to know you.  He would make a great pet for those who love Chihuahuas or small dogs.   We're not sure how he is with cats or children. 

Our kennels have quite a few visitors/volunteers, and most of our dogs have adjusted to all sorts of people who like to walk them and pet them.  Snickers, no doubt, will adjust to his new surroundings and fall in love with the perfect person. Won't it be YOU?

If you are interested in SNICKERS or any of our other canines, call our office at (831) 634-1191.  We are located in Hollister CA, about 100 miles south of San Francisco.  Sorry, we do not ship our animals.  

See all our animals on our website http://www.petfriends.org.

name: Bianca
description:
Bianca is a beautiful Shepherd mix who is about 14 months old. She is good shape but needs some basic training.  Bianca lacks the human touch that she will get here at Pet Friends before she gets adopted. 

If you are interested in BIANCA or any of our other canines, call our office at (831) 634-1191.  We are located in Hollister, CA, about 100 miles south of San Francisco.  Sorry, we do not ship our animals.  

See all our animals on our website http://www.petfriends.org.

name: Dagwood
description:
Dagwood is a senior (10 years old) Chihuahua who came with his litter mate/sister (Blondie) from a home that had an abundance of dogs.  The owner passed away and the dogs were transferred to a local animal shelter. They are very delightful and sweet.  

If you are interested in Dagwood or any of our other canines, call our office at (831) 634-1191.  We are located in Hollister CA, about 100 miles south of San Francisco.  Sorry, we do not ship our animals.  

See all our animals on our website http://www.petfriends.org.

name: Walton
description: Meet Walton aka Wally! Walton was rescued from the San Jose shelter. He has birth defect on his left back leg, it is shorter than his right leg. This doesn't stop him from getting around! Wally loves to play and he is dog friendly. He is house broken and will make a great companion for someone. His adoption fee is 200.00 and includes neuter, microchip, month of free pet insurance and being up to date on shots up to adoption. If you are interested in Wally please fill out an adoption application and put Walton as the header.

name: Hawkeye
description:
A Big softie in a rough exterior, Hawkeye is a real gem.  Hawkeye came from a severe hoarding case in San Miguel County, but right from the start he wanted to follow and be with people. He is a bit of a goofball, acting silly and playful quite often.  He has shown great manners with dogs and enjoys playing with polite dogs.  Hawkeye is still polishing his house manners.  He has likely had to be resourceful, so he tends to pick up items and carry them around, and is learning what a crate means. He is showing he is a quick study with house training.  Hawkeye really wants to belong to a pack and would like a home where someone is around more often than not.  Hawkeye is about 6 years old and we guess he is mixed breed of Rottweiler, Shar Pei, and other breeds.  He will fill out with good nutrition at about 90 pounds.  

Come meet this big dog with the big heart at adoption events.  Or inquire at julie@hart2heartcanine.com or call 703-254-6582

name: Janet
description:
Janet is as sweet as can be.  She is eager to follow and please.  She needs some confidence but will quickly progress into a nice outgoing, friendly dog.  Janet looks like a Doberman/Rottweiler mix of about 65 pounds.  She is slim and tall in build.  Janet was part of a hoarding case from San Miguel County (NM) and has been waiting a long time in the shelter for the case to be resolved so she can find her home.  She enjoys the company of other dogs and would do well with an outgoing friendly dog.  Janet is about 3-4 years old.  

Please inquire about Janet by emailing Julie at julie@hart2heartcanine.com

name: Blue Moon
description:
Blue Moon is a female, blue Miniature Pinscher/Chihuahua mix, Blue's estimated date of birth is June, 2016. She was rescued from the Sand Springs shelter as an unclaimed stray. Blue Moon has the prettiest blue coloring and intriguing personality to match her unique coat! She starts out a timid gal but warms up quickly because all she really wants is snuggles and attention! Blue will be a good lap friend. She did not get along with the other dog in her previous home, so she may be better as an only dog. She has been okay with cats. Due to her timid nature, she needs to go to a home with older kids only. You can meet Blue Moon at Bent Arrow Veterinary Hospital. Call 918-459-9100 for an appointment. She has a $150.00 adoption fee plus the cost of 6 months of heartworm prevention.  

Note: ARF reserves the right to deny any application that is deemed unsuitable for the animal. Please be aware that our animal adoptions are NOT on a first come- first serve basis. Our sole purpose is to find the best possible home for the animals that fall under our care. We do not ship our animals. All adopters are expected to come to Tulsa if approved

For details on how to adopt please visit http://www.arftulsa.org/adopt

name: Delina
description:
Delina is a female, 18.1 lb, red Dachshund mix. Delina's estimated date of birth is April 2014. She was rescued from the Sapulpa shelter as an unclaimed stray. She is a little shy at first, but is a super sweet girl with a lot of love to give! She would love to share a home with another dog for some four-legged companionship. You can meet Delina atMuddy Paws. Call 918-749-5255 for an appointment. Delina has a $150.00 adoption fee plus the cost of 6 months of heartworm prevention.

Note: ARF reserves the right to deny any application that is deemed unsuitable for the animal. Please be aware that our animal adoptions are NOT on a first come- first serve basis. Our sole purpose is to find the best possible home for the animals that fall under our care. We do not ship our animals. All adopters are expected to come to Tulsa if approved.

For details on how to adopt please visit http://www.arftulsa.org/howtoadopt.html

name: Violet
description: Violet is a bundle of sweet loving and playfulness. She came to us with a broken front leg, that has since been treated, and it never slowed her down, or altered her personality a bit. She is great with children, other dogs, will chase cats (only with the back up of her litter mates, otherwise they scare her).  She is about 9 months old, spayed, vaccinated, on HW prevention, and flea/tick free. She is located in Sapulpa and ready to find her forever home.

name: Max
description: Max is such a handsome fella!! He is about 9 months old, super chill, and such a pleaser. He is desperate to find his forever home. He's been neutered, vaccinated, on HW prevention, flea/tick free, and is microchipped. Max is located in Sapulpa. Adoption fee is $125.

name: Mia
description: Mia is a hound mix of some kind. She is about a year old. Mia loves attention and spending time outside with her fur brothers and sisters. She gets along well with other dogs. She is good with children. Mia has been spayed, vaccinated, on HW prevention, and is flea/tick free. She is also microchipped. Mitzi has been with the rescue since she was about 10 weeks old and would really love a family to call her own. She is located in Sapulpa. Her adoption fee is $125.

name: Johnny
description: If you are interested in adopting this dog, please fill out our dog adoption questionnaire and e-mail it to Mary at mj@mjcrain.com PLEASE VISIT THIS WEBSITE TO FIND THE ADOPTION QUESTIONNAIRE: http://www.homewardtrails.org/adopt-a-pet/adoption-forms/ \"Hello, my name is Johnny. I came to Homeward Trails from Scott County. I have been looking for my furever home for awhile now but for some reason, no one has grabbed me yet. My fosters think it may be because my fur i s little sparse and patchy but they assure me that there are plenty of people that won't judge me for that. I swear, my fur is looking better and growing out every day! I hear there is a saying that goes something like \"don't judge a book by its cover\" that applies well to me. Now, here are some of my favorite things: food, treats, naps, laying outside, sun bathing, butt scratches, chasing balls and playing fetch, and playing with other friendly dogs. Some things that are not my favorite things: Walks with lots of loud noises and baths. My ideal home would be with happy, calm, laid back people. I am fine if my people decided to have a kitty(ies) before me because I only show a mild interest in them and give them plenty of space. I would love to have a doggy brother or sister because they can reassure me when things may get scary. I would do best in a home has a fenced backyard for me to do my business in peace. It is scary to go to the bathroom when something could jump out at you at any moment! I don't jump on the furniture without permission and I love to just rest on my bed inside the house. Oh, I am a super good boy about not going to the bathroom in the house and sleeping in my crate at night! I do not like to get into the car but once I am inside I don't mind car rides. Well, what do you think? Could you be my soulmate?\" This guy is a champ that truly deserves a loving home where he can show what a great dog he is. Older children who are good with dogs would be best because loud noises can still be somewhat disturbing for Johnny. Do you have the patience and love to give Johnny the forever home he deserves? Please complete an adoption questionnaire so that we can arrange for you to meet him and see if he would be a good fit in your home. Adoption Coordinator: MJ Crain Breed Estimate: Shepherd/Golden Mix Gender: Male Approximate weight: 50 lbs Approximate age: 4 years Location: Foster Home in N. Virginia Cratetrained: Yes Housetrained: Yes Coat Type: Medium; red/chestnut/orange Personality: Shy but sweet; good with other dogs and cats The adoption fee for this dog is $375. This fee INCLUDES spay/neuter and microchip. If the animal you are adopting is not already spayed/neutered, you will be required to sign a contract legally obligating you to have the animal altered. Please contact your HT rep to learn about exclusive low-cost spay/neuter options made available only to HT adopters! Every adopted Homeward Trails animal comes with 30 days of free pet health insurance. We are proud to partner with the following veterinarians who offer a free first exam for your animal, exclusively for HT adopters: Caring Hands Animal Hospital, Palisades Veterinary Clinic, Sunshine Animal Hospital and Clarendon Animal Care and all VCA Animal Hospitals. Additionally, any VCA hospital will cover illnesses up to $250 at no cost to any Homeward Trails adopter. We also provide a 30-minute phone consult with a professional dog trainer at Fur-Get Me Not within the first 30 days of adopting - just for HT adopters in the Arlington/Alexandria area. Start your new dog out on the right foot with this valuable, expert advice and guidance FREE! You can save animals like this one by becoming a foster! Fosters are like way stations between high kill shelters and forever homes. We need fosters so that we can save dogs before they are euthanized at the shelters. If you are interested in becoming a foster, please check out our information about fostering by visiting http://www.homewardtrails.org/foster-a-pet/dog-and-cat-foster-program/

name: Penny Cari from Mexico
description: My name is Penny Cari from Mexico and I am a wonderful 4 month old Female Beagle Mix. I am 9 lbs., sweet, loving, fun and playful dog so excited to find my new forever home soon. I am a very happy girl and so excited to find my forever home soon. Mexico is so overloaded with dogs roaming all over the streets with no food, love or care. I am so lucky to get a one way ticket to come to Seattle to find a new forever home! Take me on car rides, walks in the park and I will become your very best friend. I get along well with people of all ages, gentle kids, other dogs but have not been around cats before. I will do best in a home with a loving family that can give me lots of exercise, love and affection! Our pet rescue dog trainer would be happy to come to your home and help train with your new dog for only $75 and this is highly recommended. My adoption fee of $1095. covers Spay/Neuter, DA2PP shots, Rabies, Bordetella, Deworm, Heart Worm Test, Grooming, Microchip, Boarding Fees, Health Certificate, and transport cost from MEXICO to SEATTLE. The adoption fee is firm and helps cover the medical expenses of our other rescue dogs in need of orthopedic surgery, dental and teeth extractions, cherry eye removals and more. Donations are always appreciated to help us pay down our vet bills at Greenwood Vet. Ginger's Pet Rescue is a nonprofit 501 C 3

name: Rascal - ADOPTED
description:
ADOPTED

Animal Profile: Rascal is an adorable 12-18 month old 39 lb male Lab Aussie Shepherd mix who was just rescued from a San Bernadino kill shelter and will be arriving to Dog Gone Seattle Sunday, August 23rd. Our volunteer transporter says \"She is a gentle soul with soft body language, leans into you for support and would benefit from a doggy buddy for confidence.\" We will share more information as we get to know her in foster care.

Seattle Foster Updates: Stay tuned..

Adoption Info: Adoption fee is $475, which includes spay/neuter, current rabies/DAPPV/bordetella vaccinations, microchip, health certificate, and heartworm test. All adoption fees are donations to a Washington non-profit corporation and all donations go to benefit the animals in our rescue.

Apply online at www.DogGoneSeattle.org

Animal History: This dog was rescued from euthanasia at a high-kill shelter in California and will be available for adoption in Seattle, once evaluated in a loving foster home in the greater Seattle area.

About Foster to Adopt Program:
Fosters provide a safe landing spot for dogs transitioning from the shelter environment and help prepare the dogs for adoption. You provide the love and structure, and we take care of everything else! We cover all vet care, and drive the adoption process. Average length of foster is 2-3 weeks. Fosters do get first consideration for adoption, if desired.

Apply to foster online at www.doggoneseattle.org/foster-application

name: Sichen from Iran
description: My name is Sichen from Iran and I am a wonderful 8 month old Male Shih Tzu & Cairn Terrier Mix Puppy. I am only 7 little lbs and I am a very happy and friendly dog who was just saved from the horrible streets of Iran where no one wanted me. Iran is so overloaded with dogs roaming all over the streets with no food, love or care. I am so lucky to get a one way ticket to come to Seattle to find a new forever home! Take me on car rides, walks in the park and I will become your very best friend. I get along well with people of all ages, gentle kids, other dogs but have not been around cats before. I will do best in a home with a loving family that can give me lots of exercise, love and affection! My adoption fee of $1350. covers Spay/Neuter, DA2PP shots, Rabies, Bordatella, Deworm, Heart Worm Test, Grooming, Microchip, Boarding Fees, Health Certificate, and transport cost from IRAN to SEATTLE. The adoption fee is firm and helps cover the medical expenses of our other rescue dogs in need of orthopedic surgery, dental and teeth extractions, cherry eye removals and more. Donations are always appreciated to help us pay down our vet bills at Greenwood Vet. Ginger's Pet Rescue is a non profit 501 C 3 Organization. Please e-mail for an adoption application.

name: Brownie from China
description:
My name is Brownie from China and I am a wonderful 2 year old Male Chocolate Poodle and I am only 7 lbs., super sweet and very friendly and I am so excited to come to America to find my forever home soon. I am super sweet, love people and want to only please you. I am a slaughter house meat trade survivor and so lucky to come to American. I love to go on walks in the park and I will become your best friend. I get along great with people of all ages, older kids, other dogs but have not been around cats before. Gingers Pet Rescue has teamed up with a great Rescue Team in China to help stop the horrid torture of cooking dogs alive in restaurants. We are SO lucky and SO excited to embark on our long journey over to America. Overseas adoption is our ONLY hope to have a great forever life. We are all spayed, neutered, have all our shots, rabies, heart worm tested, microchip, bordetella, dewormed, groomed and ready for adoption. On all overseas adoptions our pet rescue dog trainer will be required to come to your home and help train with your new dog for only $75. My adoption fee is $1250.00 to cover my vet bills and my transport from China to Seattle A part of this adoption fee goes to our 2 acre Sanctuary as we need a new barn for the dogs. Donations are always appreciated to help us pay down our vet bills at Greenwood Vet. Ginger's Pet Rescue is a nonprofit 501 C 3 Organization
.

name: Laly from China
description: My name is Laly from China and I am a wonderful 18 month old Female Cairn Terrier Mix and I am 16 lbs.,super sweet and very friendly and I am so excited to come to America to find my forever home soon. I am super sweet, love people and want to only please you. I am a slaughter house meat trade survivor and so lucky to come to American. I got hit by a car and only have 3 legs but I'm active and happy and doing great. I love to go on walks in the park and I will become your best friend.I get along great with people of all ages, older kids, other dogs but have not been around cats before. Gingers Pet Rescue has teamed up with a great Rescue Team in China to help stop the horrid torture of cooking dogs alive in restaurants. We are SO lucky and SO excited to embark on our long journey over to America. Overseas adoption is our ONLY hope to have a great forever life. We are all spayed, neutered, have all our shots, rabies, heart worm tested, microchip, bordetella, dewormed, groomed and ready for adoption. On all overseas adoptions our pet rescue dog trainer will be required to come to your home and help train with your new dog for only $75. My adoption fee is $895.00 to cover my vet bills and my transport from China to Seattle A part of this adoption fee goes to our 2 acre Sanctuary as we need a new barn for the dogs. Donations are always appreciated to help us pay down our vet bills at Greenwood Vet. Ginger's Pet Rescue is a nonprofit 501 C 3 Organization

name: Kara Cari from Mexico
description:
My name is Kara Cari from Mexico and I am a wonderful 8 month old Female Labrador Mix. I am 11 lbs., sweet, loving, fun and playful dog so excited to find my new forever home soon.
My life has not been easy but I doesn't let it get me down. I was rescued wondering the streets of a small village. It seemed like I had a miner wound on my leg but when the vet examined me it they found out I had gangrene and I would loose one of my legs. After two surgeries and a lot of loving care. I am ready for my forever home.
Mexico is so overloaded with dogs roaming all over the streets with no food, love or care. I am so lucky to get a one way ticket to come to Seattle to find a new forever home! Take me on car rides, walks in the park and I will become your very best friend. I get along well with people of all ages, gentle kids, other dogs and not sure about cats. I will do best in a home with a loving family that can give me lots of exercise, love and affection! Our pet rescue dog trainer would be happy to come to your home and help train with your new dog for only $75 and this is highly recommended. name: Dustin Hoffman from Korea
description: My name is Dustin Hoffman from Korea and I am a wonderful 3 year old Male Pomeranian Mix. I am 8 lbs. and so excited to find my new forever home. I am a very happy, affectionate, and friendly dog who was just saved from the Korean slaughter farms. Korea kills 2.5 million dogs a year to be eaten. I am so lucky to get a one-way ticket to Seattle to find my new family. Take me on car rides, walks in the park, and I will become your best friend. I get along well with people of all ages, gentle kids, and other dogs. I need a home with a fenced-in yard and will do best with a loving family that can give me lots of exercise, love, and affection! On all overseas adoption, we highly recommend our pet rescue dog trainer who will come to your home and help train your new pup for only $75. My adoption fee of $1295. will cover my spay/neuter, DA2PP shots, Rabies, Bordetella, Deworm, Heart Worm Test, Grooming, Microchip, Boarding Fees, Health Certificate and airline transport cost from Korea to Seattle. A part of this adoption fee will also help us build our brand new 2 acre sanctuary. We are in need of building a new indoor barn for the dogs. The adoption fee is firm and helps cover medical expenses for our other rescue dogs in need of orthopedic surgery, urgent vet care, dental and teeth extractions, cherry eye removals, and more. Donations are always appreciated to help pay down our vet bills at Greenwood Vet. Ginger's Pet Rescue is a non-profit 501C-3 organization.

name: Daffodil from Korea
description: My name is Daffodil from Korea and I am a wonderful Female 6 months old Jindo Mix. I am 26 lbs. and so excited to find my new forever home. I am a very happy, affectionate, and friendly dog who was just saved from the Korean slaughter farms. Korea kills 2.5 million dogs a year to be eaten. I am so lucky to get a one-way ticket to Seattle to find my new family. Take me on car rides, walks in the park, and I will become your best friend. I get along well with people of all ages, gentle kids, and other dogs. I need a home with a fenced-in yard and will do best with a loving family that can give me lots of exercise, love, and affection! On all overseas adoption, we highly recommend our pet rescue dog trainer who will come to your home and help train your new pup for only $75. My adoption fee of $1350. will cover my spay/neuter, DA2PP shots, Rabies, Bordetella, Deworm, Heart Worm Test, Grooming, Microchip,Boarding Fees, Health Certificate and airline transport cost from Korea to Seattle. The adoption fee is firm and helps cover medical expenses for our other rescue dogs in need of orthopedic surgery, urgent vet care, dental and teeth extractions, cherry eye removals, and more. Donations are always appreciated to help pay down our vet bills at Greenwood Vet. Ginger's Pet Rescue is a non-profit 501C-3 organization.

name: Leo Cari from Mexico
description: My name is Leo Cari from Mexico and I am a wonderful 4 month old Male Blue Heeler Cattle Dog Mix. I am 7 lbs., sweet, loving, fun and playful dog so excited to find my new forever home soon. I am a happy, playful snuggle bug puppy and excited to find my forever home soon. Mexico is so overloaded with dogs roaming all over the streets with no food, love or care. I am so lucky to get a one way ticket to come to Seattle to find a new forever home! Take me on car rides, walks in the park and I will become your very best friend. I get along well with people of all ages, gentle kids, other dogs but have not been around cats before. I will do best in a home with a loving family that can give me lots of exercise, love and affection! Our pet rescue dog trainer would be happy to come to your home and help train with your new dog for only $75 and this is highly recommended. My adoption fee of $1095. covers Spay/Neuter, DA2PP shots, Rabies, Bordetella, Deworm, Heart Worm Test, Grooming, Microchip, Boarding Fees, Health Certificate, and transport cost from MEXICO to SEATTLE. The adoption fee is firm and helps cover the medical expenses of our other rescue dogs in need of orthopedic surgery, dental and teeth extractions, cherry eye removals and more. Donations are always appreciated to help us pay down our vet bills at Greenwood Vet. Ginger's Pet Rescue is a nonprofit 501 C 3

name: Zac from Korea
description:
My name is Zac from Korea and I am a cute 6 month old Pomeranian mix puppy I weigh 11 lbs I was saved along with my siblings , Patch, Vivian my mom Sheena Easton and 32 other small doggies and puppies from a dog meat farm in South Korea. I would have been killed and made into soup . I was saved I am one of the lucky ones .

Korea kills an estimated 2.5 million dogs a year to be eaten. We are tortured and suffer unimaginable pain .I am so lucky to get a one way ticket to come to Seattle to find a new forever home! Take me on car rides, walks in the park and I will become your very best friend. I get along well with people of all ages, gentle kids and other dogs. I need a home with a fenced in yard and will do best with a loving family that can give me lots of exercise, love and affection! On all overseas adoptions our pet rescue dog trainer will be required to come to your home and help train with your new puppy for only $75. My adoption fee of $1350 Will cover my Neuter DA2PP shots, Rabies, Bordetella, Deworm, Heart Worm Test,Microchip, Boarding Fees, Health Certificate, and AIRLINE TRANSPORT COST from KOREA to SEATTLE. The adoption fee is firm and helps save many more dogs just like me. It helps cover medical expenses of other rescue dogs in need of orthopedic surgery, urgent vet care, dental and teeth extractions, cherry eye removals and more. Donations are always appreciated to help us pay down our vet bills at Greenwood Vet. Ginger's Pet Rescue is a nonprofit 501 C 3.

name: Peter from Korea
description: My name is Peter from Korea and I am an adorable 1 year old Male Poodle boy and I am 10 lbs. and so excited to find my forever home soon. I am a very happy, affectionate and friendly dog who was just saved from the slaughter farms being SOLD to the Dog Meat Dealer to be butchered up for food. I was fed garbage and rotten food and I was supposed to be made into soju elixer. Sadly my mom went to the meat market and it was too late to save her. Korea is so overloaded with dogs roaming all over the streets with no food, love or care and many have been tied up since birth. I am so lucky to get a one way ticket to come to Seattle to find a new forever home! Take me on car rides, walks in the park and I will become your very best friend. description:
HI! I'M JAKE! I'm a handsome and debonair male black & white American Bulldog-pittie mix who was saved from a California shelter after the new year. I am almost 2 years old and weigh about 77 lbs. and am a studly boy! I would love a home where I can hang out with my people, go for walks or hikes, or take naps together. I would probably do best in an adult-only home or one with older kids given my size. I am currently in boarding in a cold kennel and would love a home soon. My adoption fee of $400 covers spay, DA2PP shots, rabies, bordetella, heartworm test, microchip, health certificate, and transport cost from California to Seattle. The adoption fee helps cover the medical expenses of our other rescue dogs in need of orthopedic surgery, dental and teeth extractions, cherry eye removals and more. Donations are always appreciated to help us pay down our veterinary bills. Ginger's Pet Rescue is a nonprofit 501c3 organization.

Please

email for an adoption application.

name: Jersy Meyer
description:
WOOF - I'M JERSY MEYER!
I am a sweet and loving 6-year-old (could be younger) black & white pittie-mix girl who was saved from a California shelter in late December. I've been waiting too long in a kennel! My favorite thing to do is go for walks! I get so excited when I know it's my turn for my walk that I wag my tail and cry! I also have perfect leash manners. I am very shy at first once I know you, I warm up quickly. I love to be cuddled and petted and would be a perfect partner when it's time to watch a movie.

I did well on my dog test with large dogs, with a slow introduction. I'm not a fan of cats, though!

I am spayed, up-to-date on my shots, and weigh 49 lbs. only. Can you foster or adopt me?

My adoption fee of $400 covers spay, DA2PP shots, rabies, bordetella, heartworm test, microchip, health certificate, and transport cost from California to Seattle. The adoption fee helps cover the medical expenses of our other rescue dogs in need of orthopedic surgery, dental and teeth extractions, cherry eye removals and more. email for an adoption application.

name: Loki from Korea
description: My name is Loki from Korea and I am a wonderful 18 month old very Handsome Male Malumute and I am 65 lbs. and so excited to find my forever home soon. I am a very happy, affectionate and friendly dog who was just saved from the slaughter farm being SOLD to the Dog Meat Dealer to be butchered up for food. I was fed garbage and rotten food and I was supposed to be made into soju elixer. Sadly my mom went to the meat market and it was too late to save her. Korea is so overloaded with dogs roaming all over the streets with no food, love or care and many have been tied up since birth. I am so lucky to get a one way ticket to come to Seattle to find a new forever home! Take me on car rides, walks in the park and I will become your very best friend. I get along well with people of all ages, gentle kids and other dogs. I am trained and extremely smart and I need a home with a fenced in yard. I need a home with a loving family that can give me lots of exercise, love and affection! On all overseas adoptions our pet rescue dog trainer will be required to come to your home and help train with your new puppy for only $ 65. My adoption fee of $1495. Will cover my Spay, DA2PP shots, Rabies, Bordetella, Deworm, Heart Worm Test, Grooming, Microchip, Boarding Fees, Health Certificate, and AIRLINE TRANSPORT COST from KOREA to SEATTLE. The adoption fee is firm and helps cover the medical expenses of our other rescue dogs in need of orthopedic surgery, urgent vet care, dental and teeth extractions, cherry eye removals and more. Donations are always appreciated to help us pay down our vet bills at Greenwood Vet. Ginger's Pet Rescue is a non profit 501 C 3 organization

description:
My name is Oreo BB and I am a wonderful 1 year old Female Cairn Terrier Mix at 16 pounds. I was just a few days from being euthanized in a high kill shelter in California and so excited to find my forever home soon. I am a happy dog and have an adorable smile and I and active and I love to play and would like to be with another dog to play with. name: Berlin
description:
Animal Profile: Berlin is a handsome and smart 3-year-old Shepherd mix who joined our rescue from California and is now in a Seattle-area foster home. Berlin knows all his basic obedience like sit, down, shake, come, heel and kennel up, is house trained and crate trained. He is friendly with most dogs he's properly introduced to, but he's not a dog-park dog. He can be nervous when meeting new dogs so he requires a slow introduction with confident handlers. Berlin would be happy as an only dog or with a confident alpha dog companion. He is submissive, eager to please and incredibly snuggly once he is comfortable. He will thrive with a dog-savvy leader with previous dog experience, and preferably someone with Shepherd experience. He'd love to find a home with a yard where he can run and be free as that's where he is happiest. Berlin will make a great partner for hiking, jogging or long walks followed by snuggles on the couch. He's the sweetest boy with the best smile!

Adoption Info: Adoption fee is $475, which includes spay/neuter, current rabies/DAPPV/bordetella vaccinations, microchip, health certificate, and heartworm test. All adoption fees are donations to a Washington non-profit corporation and all donations go to benefit the animals in our rescue.

Apply online at www.DogGoneSeattle.org

Animal History: This dog was rescued from euthanasia at a high-kill shelter in California and will be available for adoption in Seattle, once evaluated in a loving foster home in the greater Seattle area.

name: Helen Meyer
description:
HI - I'M HELEN MEYER! I am the supermodel of pit bull mixes! I am a stunning 5-year-old pit-Greyhound mix, with a beautiful slender body and long legs. It is a gorgeous site to watch me chase a ball as I look almost like a gazelle.

I am energetic in a good way and fun loving.

I want to hug you when you greet me, and I love giving kisses and receiving belly rubs. I have perfect leash manners and would make a great hiking or walking buddy.

If you see me in person, it looks like I'm wearing eyeliner to enhance my beautiful eyes. I do well with most male dogs and prefer males to females. No cats please. I'm spayed, up-to-date on my vaccines and ready for a home to call my own. I weigh about 55 lbs. only! Can you foster or adopt me?

name: Brigid
description:
KID-FRIENDLY SWEETIE.

Animal Profile: Brigid is a 4- to 5-year-old female Boxer/Pit/German Shepherd mix (we had her DNA done) who was rescued in California. She is our rescue's longest resident and we're still looking for the right fur-ever home for her. She loves all people and is amazing with even very young children. She doesn't bat an eye at crazy antics or rough handling by toddlers, and is not mouthy whatsoever. All she wants in life is to be next to her people. Snuggling and following you around are her favorite activities. Brigid is crate trained and can be left crated for 8 hours without issue in a secure crate. She's house trained and knows sit, down and \"kennel up.\" She's not mouthy or food/toy possessive, and she takes treats gently. Brigid is anxious and reactive in the outside world, and needs slow introductions to dogs she doesn't know. She is leash reactive except when managed by an experienced handler, and will never be a dog-park dog. But she loves playing and cuddling with dogs of all genders and sizes in her own pack and will be fine living with other dogs after a slow introduction. (She needs to understand they are part of her pack before she accepts them.) Brigid doesn't need or want to go for walks for exercise but she does need a secure fenced yard to go potty. Bonus skill: She is treadmill trained!

Brigid's Story: Brigid was a stray in San Bernardino and ended up at high-kill shelter. She was put on the euthanasia list when she came down with kennel cough, so we rescued her in September 2016! She was not spayed due to her upper respiratory infection and when she arrived we quickly saw she was very pregnant! After giving birth she ended up with a very serious infection that required separating her from pups so she could get the veterinary care she needed. She had to have her mammary gland removed and was in intensive medical care for some time. This was likely traumatic for her and may explain some of her separation anxiety and excited/reactive behavior around other dogs. Since then, Brigid had an injury which required surgery (TPLO) and has since recovered. She has also had an extensive board and train so she is well trained. We are eager to find Brigid a wonderful home she can call her own. She has been through a lot so she will need a patient, loving and supportive family.

Adoption Info: Brigid's adoption fee of $150 includes her spay, all vaccinations (Rabies, DPPV, Bordetella) deworming, microchipping and transport from California to Seattle. Brigid's adoption will also include a home training session for her new adopters. Brigid's actual rescue costs are close to $10,000 so any donations to her care are greatly appreciated.

About Foster to Adopt Program:
Fosters provide a safe landing spot for dogs transitioning from the shelter environment and help prepare the dogs for adoption. You provide the love and structure, and we take care of everything else! We cover all vet care, and drive the adoption process. Average length of foster is 2-3 weeks. Fosters do get first consideration for adoption, if desired.

Apply to foster online at www.doggoneseattle.org/foster-application

description:
