name: Stella
description:
Stella is a mixed breed who was born approximately September 2018.  She came to us from the Shelby County animal shelter.  Although we don't know her history, we know that Stella is ready for a fresh start!  She is a very friendly girl who seems to have never met a stranger.  Just look at that twinkle in her eye! She is playful, affectionate, and would make a fantastic walking or hiking partner.  She would probably do best in a home with a fenced yard.  Stella weighs 42 lbs.

If you would like to visit Stella, our shelter is open MWF from 1-4 pm and Saturdays from 9-noon. We are located at 14 Fido Ct., Frankfort KY 40601. We can be reached at (502)875-3436.

If you have questions about this animal, please contact the adoption counselor directly at amyc0405@yahoo.com. Applications to adopt Stella can be downloaded from our website (www.lifehouse4animals.org) under the 'Adopt' section and emailed directly to the adoption counselor at amyc0405@yahoo.com, or can be filled out in person at the shelter. We are completely staffed by volunteers and are typically unable to complete the adoption process on the same day that applications are submitted. Please understand that it can sometimes take 2-4 days to process an application.

name: Macy
description:
Macy is an adorable young girl around 9 months of age who is believed to be a Shepherd Cattle dog mix. Macy came from a rural part of Kentucky where she was live-trapped after being born to a pack of Shepherds that were free-roaming on a farm. Macy had zero human contact prior to being trapped and has been very slow to warm up. She is considered semi-feral at this point and is still overcoming her fears. 

Macy prefers to avoid all human contact but has begrudgingly learned how to walk on a leash and tolerate being handled for daily living. Macy is a fear biter and if cornered - such as when she is in her crate and needs to come out - she will lash out in fear. If you move slowly with Macy she settles down and will allow you to handle her but she gets overwhelmed easily when rushed. Macy is going to require extensive ongoing handling, training, and socialization coupled with lots of patience as she continues to grow and bond. 

Macy connects with other dogs much better than she does people as a result of her early life in a pack. She does well meeting new dogs and is quick to follow their lead. She isn't at a place of comfort that she plays often but every now and then she will forget the people are around and start to play with one of the other young dogs. Macy has not been around cats or small dogs although she is relatively small herself. We do not know how she would do as there is not true way to test her given her discomfort on leash. 

Macy has a sweet soul and is trying her best to overcome her fears and bond with the people around her. Macy is searching for a home that can provide her a stable environment and ongoing work as she continues to grow beyond her past. 

If you have a place in your heart and home for Macy please email Tierhavenrescue@gmail.com for an adoption application or visit adoptapet.com/tierhaven for FAQ

name: Cooper
description:
Cooper is a big loveable goofy lab/pit mix. He completed a $1100 training program that comes with lifelong free lessons so you can train him further if you like and even take him to off leash. He is extremely well mannered and loves other dogs and meeting new people. He has great leash manners, knows sit, down and stay while you walk away. He is 1 years old and weighs about 55 lbs. He is house trained. He would love a home where he can play with another dog and a yard to run in. He would also make a great hiking buddy. 
His trained is located in Siler City NC and adopter would need to meet with him at least 2 times to ensure you know his commands.
To meet Cooper please apply at www.ittakesavillagerescue.com be sure you are on the NC site not Delaware

name: Dood
description:
Thank you for your interest in dog who needs a new home. Adoption can be one of the most fulfilling experiences in your life and especially in the life of your new canine companion.

A note to those looking at CPR. We have no perfect dogs - but many of our dogs have proven to be perfect for a certain someone. Our job is to find those someone's. Our most successful adopters come to CPR not because they want a dog. They come to us because they want to give a dog a home. We urge all of our potential adopters not to fall in love with a picture. While we like to know what you like in looks, a dog is more than a pretty face. Our goal is to match you with the best possible pet for you and your home. We want to create furever families.

Our descriptions contain all that we know about this dog today. We'll update as more information is known.

Are you looking to adopt within the next 30 days? If so please visit our webpage at www.carolinapoodlerescue.org and complete the application. You'll find it in the menu on the left hand side. You'll also find a total listing of all our dogs available.

Just browsing but interested in poodles and poodle mixes? Please drop a note to applications@carolinapoodlerescue.org with your name, address and phone # and email. We'll add you to our mailing list.

thanks
the CPR Adoption team

Date into Rescue: 4/5/2019
Reason for being in rescue: VA shelter- allowed to run at large and picked up one too many times
Foster location: Dreamweaver Farms, Pacolet SC
Special Needs? Dood was deemed a dangerous animal in the state of Virginia. His previous owner would not keep him confined and he was allowed to roam at will. He is happy and gregarious and would run up to people and knock them down as a game. He's not shown any aggressive side to us at all but we all know how to tel him \"GET OFF\" and he's respecting that cue. He needs some training and someone with some common sense.
Weight: 99 lbs
Height: 26 in
Spayed/Neutered: Yes

Adoption Fee: $499

Fence needed? Without exception and it needs to be a solid, dependable fence and you need to plan to be in control of your dog. He's been failed by a human once before because of not understanding our dogs needs us to keep them safe and in places they can safely be, not roaming the streets.

What kind of home would be best for me? Dood's perfect owner will be someone with dog experience, who loves to take long, brisk walks and who would enjoy teaching, shaping and training their dog to be the excellent companion this dog has the potential to be. Dood is affectionate and friendly and longs for that companion that will be his partner, his friend and his guide through life instead of letting him run amuck.

What is my personality like? Dood is an even tempered and intelligent dog who has been allowed to run and roam and that got him on serious trouble. He was part of a pack with his sister Dette.

One of our temperament programs is to take our dogs off site for adventures. Dood is a perfect gentleman in the car just as he was in the trip from Virginia to South Carolina. He is attentive, likes to look out the window and enjoys seeing new places and learning new things.

How do I act when I first meet new people? Friendly. He's been known to bark at people but it's in a \"hi come on over and let's get to know each other\" way. But..as big as he is it is a deep bark and that can intimidate people.

Other tips and tidbits: Estimated Birthdate: 4/15/2015. Dood is a lot of dog with a lot of things going for him. He has been given a very bad rap and very nearly lost his life because his previous owner had no common sense. We are going to be extraordinarily picky about his next home to make sure it's his best home and his forever home.

Dood is NOT completely hypoallergenic. He does very lightly shed. We do not know his heritage but I am betting he is first generation so there is some shedding involved.

House trained? Dogs can be house trained if they are in the right environment and are allowed to follow a schedule as long as a physical reason doesn't keep them from being trained. A dog house trained in my home may not be in yours. We will help you teach your new dog this necessary skill and based on your schedule.

Please note - we do not ship dogs. If you are interested in adopting, please take a look at the distance between the foster home location and your location and make sure you are willing to make that trip. Most of our dogs are at our farm in Pacolet, South Carolina.

To apply, please visit our webpage at www.carolinapoodlerescue.org and visit the tab on the left that directions you to the online application.

Please note that when screening applications, we look at the entire home and then make suggestions based on what would be a good fit for your home. You are not being screened for a specific dog although we are looking to see what type of dog interests you - poodles or non poodles, color, age, etc. Others here may be a better fit for you. It is very difficult to get to know a living animal from a picture and a short description. Since we are constantly getting in new dogs, this may be a dog not in our listings yet. We want you to be very happy with your new companion and will make suggestions based on what you tell us about you.

Thank you for considering CPR.

name: Lex
description: Lex is one of 400 German Shepherds saved from deplorable conditions in a puppy mill/hoarder situation in South Ga. Lex is slowly learning to love and trust. He actually walks great on a leash and LOVES people if you go slow and let him trust you. Lex will need a home with at least one other dog that he can learn from by example. No children please, as these dogs have proven to be VERY protective of their people once they bond with someone. Training will be a requirement for his new home, as we want success for all !! A secure fenced yard is needed to ensure his safety. We have lots of assistance available to make his placement an amazing experience for him and his new family.To apply for adoption, go to www.caninepetrescue.com and fill out our online adoption application. You will see answers to many of your questions in the introductory information.

name: Courtesy Post: Princess Moonbeam
description:
Princess Moonbeam aka Moo is on the hunt for her forever home! Moo is estimated to be 6 years old and 65lbs. Best estimate is Lab / Mastiff mix / Pit Mix. Moo is defined by volunteers/ fosters as \"one of the most affectionate animals we have ever encountered\". Moo loves so much and all she asks is that love to be reciprocated. Hobbies include cuddling, hiking and eating peanut butter. 

Moo was adopted from Camden County Animal Shelter and was living life on a rescue farm in South Jersey. Unfortunately, Moo has a very high pray drive and the farm was  overstimulating and not a safe place for her. No other animals or small children (based on her size and playfullness) To foster or adopt, email jessica@badassbk.com.

name: Sharpie
description: Hi my name is Sharpie! I am a little guy looking for love! I wiggle my whole body and am so excited to meet new human friends and also dogs and cats. I was moved from South Louisiana due to incoming storms and I made my way up to Natchitoches to hopefully find my forever home. I've been from shelter to shelter and would love to settle in your home!

name: Scooter
description:
This handsome guy is one of a huge litter DCAWS agreed to take from the shelter in Houston County when they were overloaded with intake.  He was adopted when a young puppy.  In early June we received a call from an animal facility in St. Louis reporting that he was with them.  He had been brought in for observation at the age of 3-1/2 years because he had nipped a child.  When the 10 days were up he was not reclaimed by the family.  
Report from the facility is that this was a play nip and there were no ER or medical or police reports filed as this was a minor and non-vicious incident.  Since his return Scooter has been in a home with several other dogs and is doing well there.  He has shown himself to be affectionate, smart, playful and certainly of good nature, although he does still nip in play occasionally.  He is in need of a new home where he is corrected with training and is never abandoned again.
Born 12/25/12

name: Trish
description:
Meet Trish. Trish came to us in August of 2010 from Sister Pat at St. Anne's church in Carthage, MS. 

Sister Pat had some rescues at the parish and some thugs threatened to kill them if she and an older Sister didnt give them money. Sister Pat called the police on the boys and then called us in a panic. As soon as the young gang boys got out of jail, they were certainly going to come kill the dogs. ARF took in 18 dogs. Some have been adopted, some not. Trish is still a young dog, approximately 2-3 years old and weighs around 35 pounds. She's a bit skittish, and is still learning to walk on a leash. She LOVES to snuggle and just wants to be near you. 

Trish, Labrador Retriever & Terrier Mix has been shared from Shelter Exchange - http://www.shelterexchange.org.

name: Pixie
description:
Hello from our sweet little Pixie!!  
We rescued Pixie in January from the NYPD 120TH  Precinct in Staten Island, NY. She was in very poor condition...starving, skin and bones, freezing and scared. She was microchipped but the owner claimed she gave her to her ex-husband and did NOT want her back even after learning she was emaciated and living on the streets!! How cruel!!
We were not able to actually take possession of Pixie until our great vet in SI did their due diligence. The Vet staff took great care of her while she had her stay and we are grateful for their assistance in keeping her safe. She otherwise would have most likely wound up in a kill shelter. 
Pixie has already gained 6 lbs but still needs some more healthy weight gain. 
This petite sweetie pie is super lovable, seems unphased by other dogs and just wants to snuggle and give kisses. 
Please consider applying to adopt or foster her by filling out the application at www.nybullycrew.org Thank you!

name: Onyx
description:
Onyx is a well behaved friendly dog good with smaller dogs. She is good with dogs her size if they are friendly and not pushy. 

Kellen Rescue is located in California and almost always requires fenced yards and do not adopt out of State with the exception of sometimes to neighboring States. Our dogs are in foster homes and available to meet by appointment.

name: Panda
description: Panda is a senior (born approx 4.1.08) spayed female Akita. She is up to date on vaccines, on flea/heartworm prevention, microchipped, house trained, crate trained, and leash trained. Panda comes to us from the shelter in Suffolk, VA, where she found herself after she didn't get along with the family's new puppy. Panda still has lots of bouncy energy and loves meeting new people and is a wonderful breed ambassador! Panda has gone to daycare with some of the other fosters. She would like a retirement home as an only or with the right mellow male.

name: Waverly
description:
Waverly is a young (born approximately 10.19.17) spayed female Akita. She is up to date on vaccines, microchipped, heartworm negative, on flea/heartworm prevention, house trained, crate trained, and leash trained. MUST GO TO HOME AS ONLY PET.

Waverly comes to us from Suffolk, VA, where she was picked up by animal control, running stray. She is in very good condition and was found with a collar and Seresto flea collar. Clearly someone had been caring for her, but no one came to claim her. She is very people friendly.

name: Lincoln
description:
Lincoln is an adult (born approx 6.29.2013) neutered male Akita. He is up to date on vaccines, microchipped, heartworm negative, on flea/heartworm prevention, neutered, and leash trained. MUST GO TO HOME AS ONLY PET OR WITH FOSTER SISTER, SMUDGE.

Lincoln and Smudge came to us from the shelter in Suffolk, VA. Lincoln is a bit shy but very friendly. He is good friends with Smudge, and could be adopted with her.

name: Brew
description: Brew is in need of a medical foster, she is currently located in Bradenton, FL (Manatee County). Brew is an English Bulldog we saved from a high kill shelter in Tampa. She is 8 years old and in a neglected state. She has a medical history of arthritis spondylosis, she is heartworm positive and required a removal of a blueberry sized mammary node during spay. She is underweight at 35 pounds and will require 3 meals a day. She is quiet,sleeps a lot and the only issue we have seen is some guarding of her xpen area when other dogs nose around. She's fine with other dogs but offers no interactions and turns her head away. Once we have her tuned up she will be available for adoption or long term fostering through heartworm treatment. If you are interested in Brew and have experience with English Bulldogs please contact us. PUPDATE. Brew has been with us for almost a week. She has seen our vet. Her liver values were abnormal and we have had her on supplements and will retest the 2nd week of Sept. She has gotten more energetic,is eating well, and actually is playing with some of the other dogs. She loves people and absolutely loves being pet. She is actually chasing flies! She is becoming a dog again!! Once we do our vet re-check, she will be available for foster to adopt or medical foster. We are a foster-based rescue organization with foster homes throughout the state of Florida. We predominantly save dogs from municipal shelters throughout the Southeastern U.S. Our rescue dogs live in foster homes - there is no central facility. If interested in meeting one of our wonderful adoptable dogs, please fill out an application at ewenityfarmsbch.com. Information on adoption donation amounts and our process can also be found at this site.

name: Owen
description: Owen is a 4 year old boxer mix who was rescued from the euthanasia room at the Pet Resource Center who is looking for a home with adults only. He was a volunteer favorite. Owen is an awesome dog, he's smart, he learns fast, and he will keep you on your toes. Owen does fine with dogs, cats, and parrots as long as there is a slow introduction. We do not recommend horses though, he seems to find them offensive. But, with training he could probably be okay around horses. Owen comes with a six week training class from Bayshore dog training in Tampa. Owen is also heartworm positive and Paw Print Hearts will provide the medication to treat him. We do not know how Owen is with children. He is a powerful, 70 pound dog.Please complete adoption application on pawprinthearts.com website. Adoption fee: $150

name: GALLAGHER- Adult Emotional Support Animal
description:
Go to www. ARKsaves.com to read the complete animal bio
I'm a mellow laid back guy who adores people! ADOPT FEE - FULLY VETTED: $ 75
My Story: Hi my name is Gallagher. I am a 2 1/2 and a red pittie mix. I was pulled from the Tampa kill shelter by Linda Perrigoue and sent to boarding where I am being trained by Emily. I am a good boy who sits for treats and walks well on my leash and knows basic commands.
I am unsure about other dogs and hate cats so it is best if I go to a home where I get all the love and attention. I am heartworm positive but if adopted locally in the Tampa bay area I will get treated for the heartworms for free at the Humane Society of Tampa Bay. The grant will pay $300.00 for treatment any other place. I am fully vetted and neutered and am taking heartworm preventative.
I LOVE people and balls. I put my head in your lap and love to be petted. I could play ball all day long! Because I am a young boy I would be best in a home with no small children. Could I be the special dog for you?
Contact: Linda Perrigoue <winston54@earthlink.net>
Emotional Support Animals (ESA)
Emotional Support Animals are not required to undergo specialized training. They can be dogs, cats, exotics, birds. Their primary role is to provide their owners with emotional comfort. Emotional support animals can benefit a disabled individual psychologically. The basic gift of companionship and unconditional affection can be the therapy needed to counter a condition like debilitating depression or Post Traumatic Stress Disorder.
ESAs are protected under the Fair Housing Amendments Act (FHAA) and the Air Carrier Access Act (ACAA). People meeting the proper criteria are entitled to an ESA to assist them with life. The FHAA protects individuals by allowing ESAs to live with them regardless of breed (even with no pet policies). The ACAA protects individuals by allowing ESAs to fly with them in the cabin of an airplane without having to pay additional fees. ESAs are not required to be professionally trained. An owner can train the pet. A letter of need written by a mental health counselor may be required for those wanting to transport via plane or for landlords. For information regarding the legalities of ESA contact maggihall14@gmail.com.
BARK, BARK - COME AND GET ME PLEASE!

If you can't find what you want at ARK go to the following and TRULY save a life. They still kill though trying to go NO KILL. Help them achieve that goal!
Southeast Volusia Humane Society - 1200 S Glencoe Rd (mile east of I-95), New Smyrna; 386.428.9860; sevhumanesociety@gmail.com; Mon-Sat 10- 5; Sun 10-2
Halifax Humane Society - 2364 LPGA @ I-4, Daytona; 386.274.4703; www.halifaxhumanesociety.org; Mon-Sat 10-6; Sun 10-2
Putnam County Animal Control - 523 Reid St, Palatka; 386.329.0396; putpets.com (don't put www); Mon-Thur 10-4; Fri 10-12; Sat 9-3 9/18/19 12:02 PM

name: Jackson
description: Straight from the streets of Tampa. This guy was saved from a dismal life of chaos and uncertainty and is now looking to be someone's Forever Furbaby. He will be a WONDERFUL, LOYAL and LOVING COMPANION. He is FEARLESS and likes to do things his way, however, he will listen just with Protest. He will require patience and understanding and maybe a TRUE Chihuahua loving person. He TRULY is a sweetheart under his Huge attitude and can be misunderstood if in the wrong hands. He IS dog friendly, crate trained ( possibly tormented in a crate, at one point, making him a little cage aggressive, you can not close the door with our foot.) We do crate also due to his LEG LIFTING habits and he wears a Belly Band. He walks well on a leash and Loves his walks.  He is estimated at 5 yrs old now. Neutered, Microchipped, Rabies shot & yrly vaccine. Please call to schedule a visitation with Jackson or ANY of our adoptable's. Adoption Donation is $250 to approved home. GOD BLESS our Voiceless and Innocent.

name: Moxie - Courtesy Post
description:
***THIS IS A COURTESY LISTING.  This dog is not within the ACDR organization. For all information about this dog, you must contact the person listed within the animal description. He/she has been posted as a courtesy to help his/her owner find a new home. You will need to contact them directly. PLEASE do not email ACDR concerning this dog, we do not have further information concerning this dog. ***

Moxie is a very loving energetic girl.  She is a terrier/cattle dog mix and about 65 lbs and about a year old. She is located in Tempe, AZ.
She is up to date on all of her shots and spayed and micro chipped.  She loves ALL other dogs and does great with even small breeds.  She does need to be in a home without small children but loves adults.  She knows commands like âsitâ and âstayâ and âlay downâ. She is a puppy so she does need more training, especially with jumping. She needs someone willing to take time with her and be patient with her and she will be the best dog. She has so much love to give.
She stays home while we are at work and is confined to the kitchen/dining room and does fine as long as the trash is put up, she is also kennel trained and does not mind spending time inside it and will sometimes put herself in it to calm down when sheâs over excited.  She also loves walks and dog parks. She needs exercise and attention and someone who can provide that for her regularly.
She does have some nervousness that is managed fairly well with regular exercise and CBD oil or treats.

Email: kgray@infinigy.com

name: PUPPY KENZIE-FOSTER NEEDED
description: Sweet Kenzie is 1 of 9 puppies that were rescued from a very rural area in Tennessee where they were dumped and left to survive on their own. This 8-9 month old pup weighs 38 lbs now and will probably top off around 50. Thankfully a Critter Cavalry Rescue foster mom was notified of the NINE, yes NINE, dogs that were running loose and just trying to survive. Kenzie was one of the more socialized puppies that responded to love and kindness. She is really sweet and getting used to wearing a collar. This girl will be ready for walking and enjoying her leadership guidance from a family very soon. She is all puppy and will need just the basic training. She is a little shy but just wants to be part of everything. At the moment of 9/16, but she is not house trained. She is a Hound/Lab mix that just demonstrates the beauty and uniqueness of a MUTT! She will give you everything and expect nothing.

name: Annabelle (Puppy)
description:
Annabelle was rescued from a rural Tennessee animal shelter. 

To schedule a meet n greet please fill out this form https://tinyurl.com/keelysadoptionday

name: FRIENDLY FRANKLIN
description:
Friendly Frank is a handsome 7 year old American Bulldog/Beagle mix that has the most wonderful smile and sweet personality on the planet. This 40 pound boy has been in a family setting with his brother since he was just 4-5 weeks old. He and his brother were adopted together and have lived as a pair for the past 7 years with one major problem.his brother picks on him and beats up him almost weekly. Now with a new baby in the home and training advice that has not really worked. the mom and dad think that Frank needs a new home of his own so the fights don't continue and one day involve their human child. Frank and everyone else will live a much more peaceful life if he finds a great new home. The reason you should consider Friendly Frank is this.he is the BEST and HAPPIEST dog ever. Just look at his smile! He is a great combination of the Beagle joy and warmth and the chunky build and coloring of an American Bulldog with a little stubbornness thrown in for Bulldog good measure. He is perfection when it comes to housebreaking, sleeping all night in his dog bed (which he loves), good with other dogs (unless they jump on him) and he is just a loving soul that will bring good things to your life. It is best that Frank finds a new home where he does not live in fear of getting jumped on by his brother. This love bug deserves to have a family with children or maybe an empty nest couple that will enjoy his fun personality and playful nature and energy. Critter Cavalry Rescue wants to help this special family and special dog find some peace by rehoming Friendly Frank. Frank is fully vetted and neutered and just a happy and loving soul. This boy has many years ahead of him and if you are interested please email at ccrtennessee@gmail.com
PLEASE NOTE: Our dogs are transported from Tennessee to meeting places in the states where we have posted. Further information about us is given on our Adopt-A-Pet site. The adoption fees vary and will be provided as well as noted on the application you receive. Contact us at 615-661-5333 or ccrnewengland@gmail.com Sorry, we cannot adopt to MA residents.

name: PRINCESS NELL-FOSTER NEEDED
description:
Princess Nell is a young, 1 year old, Black and Tan Coonhound that apparently had puppies recently but we are sure about their fate. This girl was starved when we found her in a rural area of Tennessee running loose and very scared and hungry. We worried about where her puppies were and left her for a day or two in hopes she would lead us to her pups. That never happened. Her current weight of 40lbs is very very low for what her breed typically should be which is 65-70lbs. Aside from that, little is known about her previous life and so we will put that in the rearview mirror and go forward with great hopes for a miracle new home for her. She has taken to her foster mom and is good with other dogs and cats. She already has proven to have a desire to be loyal to those that love her and will even try to give a hug with her long thin limbs. She is the most kind and grateful and sweet girl who is desperately longing for her one and only forever family!! Now she is getting the care that she needs. Thankfully she is heartworm negative and otherwise healthy despite her low weight. We have promised her a loving home and a forever future with a committed person or family. Is that you!? She does need a fenced yard for safe exercise time and containment. Please email us at ccrtennessee@gmail.com She is ready to be adopted on September 13th and can transport northward from Tennessee.
ADOPTION FEE REQUIRED. Contact ccrtennessee@gmail.com.

name: Smokey
description:
Meet Smokey. He is a super sweet 6 year old boxer mix. He is an owner surrender from rural Tennessee. He is neutered and will be up to date with shots and heartworm tested before going home. He walks well on a leash and loves kids and other dogs. He currently being kept outside, but should pick up on house training fairly quickly!

To schedule a meet n greet please fill out this form https://tinyurl.com/keelysadoptionday

name: PETEE
description: Meet Petee a super sweet and shy little Chihuahua mix guy that is just 3 years old and weighs 12 lbs. This little guy came from a high-kill shelter in rural Tennessee. He was so lonely and so very scared in the shelter. He did not trust anyone. With some patience from his foster mom, he is starting to come around. He loves to play with other dogs and he is warming up to people. Petee is learning that people are nice and he really loves to be petted. He is still timid around strangers and is not sure about being picked up but he is a loving guy once he knows that you are not going to hurt him. Petee is fully grown. He needs a loving family to come to his aid and give him a the wonderful loving forever home he so deserves, He would be a great and loving little guy in the right home. if you have another dog to help show him the ropes and give him confidence that would be ideal. He would not be a good candidate for a family with small children. Petee would also be best in a home with a fenced in yard. He is smart and knows how to use a doggie door. He is also crate trained. Won't you consider adding the precious boy to your family!! To learn more about Petee please contact Vivienne at viviennejames@comcast.net or 615/943-7311. ADOPTION FEE REQUIRED.

name: HANK
description:
Meet Happy Hank! A truly handsome 8 month old, 33 pound, strong and handsome Border Collie mix boy that needs a good B/C knowledgeable owner. He is smart and eager to learn and needs an alpha person in his life. He was found as a stray in a rural setting in Tennessee after he was seen being tossed from a moving car near a retail store on a highway. This boy is happy and healthy now and loves playing with other dogs. He loves to flip over for his humans to show submission to them and to beg for a good belly rub. He will pull at first on his leash walks but quickly settles down and stops pulling if you do it on a regular basis. He loves to play like most young herding dogs do. This boy needs to be with experienced dog owners or else his smart Border Collie instincts will take over and lead the household. He is food protective with other dogs. He needs to be fed separately as we recommend this for any multiple dog home during feeding time. Happy Hank would be an exceptionally good dog for Fly Ball training, agility or perhaps Dock Diving competition. The sky is the limit with this young and impressionable and moldable boy!
If you are interested please email us at: Ccrtennessee@gmail.com He is located in Tennessee and can transport northward at any time. Local Tennessee adoptions are welcome as well.

name: Ryder
description:
Ryder is a fun little Yorkie / Lab Mix (yes we know interesting mix .. mom was apparently a lab and dad was the Yorkie).  Ryder  was born on April 10, 2019 and is looking for his forever home.  We expect he will be a small / medium when full grown.

Ryder  loves playing with his siblings and toys.  He can be a bit shy at first, but warms up quickly. Ryder is up to date on shots, neutered, on heartworm and flea and tick prevention and is micro chipped as well.

Ryder is not potty trained, that is something that his new family will have to work on him with.  Preference will be given to those with a physically fenced yard, but Ryder we think will stay small enough to be suitable for apartment / townhouse living as well with the right outdoor space.

Ryder is currently located in Tennessee and the adoption fee is $250.  Transportation may be available to out of state adopters for an additional cost depending on the area. The first step in our process is submitting the application.  We are happy to set up a meet and greet once an application has been approved. If you would like to adopt Ryder  please fill out our online adoption application at http://safehaventn.com/ .

name: Raelynn
description:
Raelynn is a fun little Yorkie / Lab Mix (yes we know interesting mix .. mom was apparently a lab and dad was the Yorkie).  Raelynn was born on April 10, 2019 and is looking for her forever home.  We expect she will be a small / medium when full grown.

Raelynn loves playing with her siblings and toys.  She can be a bit shy at first, but warms up quickly.  Raelynn is up to date on shots, spayed, on heartworm and flea and tick prevention and is micro chipped as well.

Raelynn is not potty trained, that is something that her new family will have to work on her with.  Preference will be given to those with a physically fenced yard, but Raelynn we think will stay small enough to be suitable for apartment / townhouse living as well with the right outdoor space.

Raelynn is currently located in Tennessee and the adoption fee is $250.  Transportation may be available to out of state adopters for an additional cost depending on the area. The first step in our process is submitting the application.  We are happy to set up a meet and greet once an application has been approved. If you would like to adopt Raelynn please fill out our online adoption application at http://safehaventn.com/ .

name: Nike
description:
Nike is a sweet mix pup that may have some Catahoula, cur or shepherd in him. Breeds are just a guess, we have no history to know what his parents were. He is about 30 lbs and 6 months old.

Nike was the runt of his litter and it took him a little bit longer to get his grown on!  He is a sweet pup who loves to play and cuddle.  He would love another dog to play with a fenced yard for his new family.  We expect he will be medium sized when full grown.

Nike is up to date on shots, neutered, micro chipped, on flea and tick and heart worm prevention.  Nike is working on potty training and this is something that he will still need help with as he transitions to a new family.

Nike is currently located in Tennessee and the adoption fee is $250.  Transportation may be available to out of state adopters for an additional cost depending on the area. The first step in our process is submitting the application.  We are happy to set up a meet and greet once an application has been approved. If you would like to adopt Nike please fill out our online adoption application at http://safehaventn.com/ .

name: Wendy
description:
Wendy is a sweet girl who we are thinking has some Catahoula or Aussie in her.  She is about 40 lbs, 6 months old and will be large size when full grown. She gets along great with her siblings and is always up for an adventure.

Wendy is up to date on her shots, spayed, micro chipped and on flea/tick and heart worm prevention as well.  We are looking for an active home with a physically fenced yard.  She is going to love being part of a home with activity and play.  She loves snuggling up on the couch with you at night.  She is house trained with a doggy door.

Wendy is currently located in Tennessee and the adoption fee is $250.  Transportation may be available to out of state adopters for an additional cost depending on the area. The first step in our process is submitting the application.  We are happy to set up a meet and greet once an application has been approved. If you would like to adopt Wendy please fill out our online adoption application at http://safehaventn.com/ .

name: Zeke
description:
Zeke is a little lover boy. Loves to give kisses. Enjoys Napping  and sleeping with his humans. Plays well with his other foster pups and dogs. He needs to have a fenced in yard. For he enjoys chasing squirrels, playing ball and chasing leaves.He is Up to date on his shot, neutered, flea and heart worm prevention. Not positive if that is what breed Zeke is that is a guess. We are looking for a physically fenced yard for Zeke and he would love a furry companion to play with!  He will be small/medium sized when full grown.

Zeke currently located in Tennessee and the adoption fee is $250. Transportation may be available to out of state adopters for an additional cost depending on the area. The first step in our process is submitting the application. We are happy to set up a meet and greet once an application has been approved. If you would like to adopt Zeke please fill out our online adoption application at http://safehaventn.com/

name: Willy Wonka
description: Willy Wonka came to us as a stray from the City of Altoona. If his family does not come for him, he will need a new family that will love him forever. Please ask to visit with him to see if hes a good match for you!

name: Bowser
description:
Bowser is an active, friendly guy who has been bounced around far too much. He was origionally adopted from the Jefferson City facility, but ended up homeless in Millersburg. We took him in and found what we thought was a good forever home. Sadly, his new owner returned him to us for an act of very insignificant behavior, she didn't like.

One thing that has made it a little difficult to find Bowser another home is that he definitely does want to be the Alpha male, so there's a good possibility he wouldn't do well in a multi-dog household. He might, however, get along well, with one female, depending on her temperament.

Bowser's adoption fee includes his neuter, regular deworming, heart-worm testing, all vaccinations (Rabies is administered by a licensed veterinarian) and a microchip. For the specific amount of adoption fees or more detailed information, you will need to contact the Shelter directly please at 573 896-4049. Thanks for looking at Bowser.

name: Susie in RI
description:
Check out our website: http://fohari.org

Adoption Application: http://fohari.org/aa

Adoption Donation
$
299

Located: RI (Transportation costs included to the Northeast , plz ask for more details )

Age: approx 7-8 years old

Weight: 10 lbs

Susie is a sweet Chihuahua that found herself in a local shelter through no fault of her own. She loves going for walks and car rides. She is sensitive about being picked up due to an old injury to her shoulder/armpit. She would do best in an adult only household. Another small dog would be great.

If you are interested in adopting me, please fill out an application on our website www.fohari.org and email my foster parent for more information:
bholder1010@gmail.com

Please verify the location and readiness of this dog with us. Because we save lives from various locations through out the United States, some dogs may not be in New England yet, nor ready for immediate adoption.

Please check out our website for how to Adopt, Adoptions events, Fostering and more!

www.fohari.org

Normally we do not process applications unless a specific dog is selected, along with submitting a deposit of $200 using our Paypal Donate link. Please understand we are all volunteers with limited resources - your deposit tells us you are serious.

Click here to complete our online adoption application!

If this link isnt working please go to our website www.fohari.org and click on adoption application.

Once we have your deposit we will hold the dog for you while we process your application. If you are not approved to adopt or we can not provide the dog you are interested in, your deposit is refunded. If you are approved, the deposit is applied toward the total donation of the dog.

If the dog is not a good match, we will work with you to find another dog, but the deposit is NOT refundable. We want you to be certain that this is a decision your have thought through thoroughly & not just a whim so
if YOU change your mind for ANY reason
, your deposit is
NOT REFUNDABLE
!

any of our special rescued dogs by making a donation or
If you would like to place a

name: Snoopy in RI
description:
Check out our website: http://fohari.org

Adoption Application: http://fohari.org/aa

Adoption Donation
$
550

Located: RI

Age: approx 2 years old

Weight: 13 lbs

Meet Snoopy. This sweet boy came to us as an owner surrender because his mom could no longer take care of him. FOHA to the rescue! We brought him into foster care as he awaits his second chance.

And Snoopy is a great little dog! Frisky, friendly, sweet, and absolutely adorable. He has no health issues that we know of, he gets along well with all, he has been around children and his crate trained, leash trained, and a really nice dog! We're going to get him up-to-date on shots, and he's certainly ready to find a family of his own.

If you are interested in adopting me, please fill out an application on our website www.fohari.org and email my foster parent for more information:

name: Lady Bug
description: Lady Bug was one over 150 dogs removed from a hoarding case in TN. Even so, she is friendly, sweet, playful and affectionate. She gets along well with other dogs and has not been tested with cats or very small children. However, she doesn't have a mean bone in her body.

name: Celeste
description:
Celeste and Gideon came to us from a neglect situation involving 10 dogs in Tracy, TN.  I have included their intake pictures so you can appreciate how far they have come.  They went from semi-feral to sweet dogs to run to give me kisses now when they see me.

We don't know their breed or relationship, other then they are for sure a bonded pair and must go and stay together.  We think that Gideon is about 7-10 years old, and Celeste is about 5 years old. Both are fixed, heart worm negative (and on prevention), up to date on shots and micro chipped.  They are newspaper trained and have had dental cleanings done recently.

Celeste and Gideon do very well with each other, and would prefer to be the only dogs.  They are ok with some small dogs similar in size to them, but not bigger dogs.  If you have other dogs, a meet and greet is required.

You MUST have physically fenced that is very secure.  They are diggers and can Houdini their way out at their choosing.  For the most part they have remained inside and just going on newspapers for these reasons.

They travel well in a crate and are very friendly once they get to know you a bit.  They are very food motivated.  Celeste walks well on a leash, Gideon currently needs to be carried, he is not as leash savy.  Both are around the 25-30lbs mark.  Neither have any current health issues that they are being treated for.

Their ideal home would be someone who is home all day who can bond with them and vice versa.  A nice retired person or couple who is looking for some companions would be perfect.  They will need their own room/space as well so that when you go out, they are in a safe space. 

Please contact us if you would like more information about Gideon and Celeste.  Our email address is info@safehaventn.com and you can fill out an application on our website if you are interested in offering these 2 dogs a forever home.  They have been through a lot and have come a long way and are now socialized and ready for a forever family.

description:

name: Vidalia
description: Meet Vidalia! Lots of good things in this little package... she is estimated to be between 1 and 2 years of age. She is tiny, a pocket pittie. She came to us from the streets in Trenton with demodex mange which is non contagious and is now all healed up looking for her forever home. She loves dogs too! Crate trained and housebroken - you cant go wrong adopting this little lady! You must be over 21 to apply and live within 2 hours of the Lehigh Valley, PA area within NJ or PA. Visit our website www.outcastresue.com

name: Tyra
description:
Hello world, my name is Tyra, yes like the super model.  My foster mom says I should be called Sweetie because that is what I am. I am 6 years old, which is a perfect age! I am not a crazy puppy, but I am still an active girl who loves to play! I was due to be euthanized and my two legged guardian angels came to my rescue. I am up to date on all of my vaccines (no cooties here). I am house, crate, and leash trained. My crate is like my own happy place. I like to go there to unwind from all of the playing. I greet everyone that I meet with a big smile and tail wag. I try to sneak a kiss in there every once in a while, but hey I like giving lovingâs. I really like to play with my four and two legged friends all day. I am great with other dogs no matter the size.  I even get along with cats (shocker I know). I am not food or toy aggressive at all. We can all share. I do know how to sit, lay down, and give paw. I do have a tiny spot on my nose that I am seeing my friends at the vet for. I will be getting it removed shortly.

I am currently located in Trenton, OH. If you would like to adopt me please go to www.sophiasgracefoundation.org and fill out the application. I cannot wait to meet my forever family and start the next chapter in my life!

name: Trooper
description:
Trooper is a super super sweet 3 year old Shepherd mix looking for her forever home. She weighs 37.6 pounds and is full grown. Trooper originally came to us from Tuba City and had been found pregnant, skin and bones and covered in ticks. She has since watched all her puppies grow and find their own homes, while she was being treated for tick fever. Now she is tick fever free, has gained weight and is in great shape! This girl is very lovable and adores human touch She is house broken, and rarely barks. Trooper is cautious in new environments until she feels comfortable and trusts the people she is with. She is good on a leash but is still wary when cars pass her. Trooper is happier around smaller dogs compared to larger dogs. She will need a home with a securely fenced backyard and would benefit greatly from having a smaller canine companion to help her build her confidence. Trooper also needs a home with no pet birds, she thinks they are flying popcorn chicken and will try to snack on them!
She is spayed, up to date on vaccines, microchipped, and vet checked. Her adoption fee is $200 and includes a free vet visit and 30 days of free pet insurance. If you are interested in adopting her, please contact her foster mom Marsha at 573-690-9648.

Open TUES-SUN 11am to 6pm / 1102 W. Hatcher Rd, Phoenix AZ 85021 / 602-944-2440

WEEKEND ADOPTION EVENT LOCATIONS - Many animals available for adoption!

Saturdays 10:30am to 3pm at Petco at Tatum & Bell Rd

4727 East Bell

Road, Phoenix, AZ 85032 (Near Walmart)

Saturdays 11am to 3pm at Petco at Tatum & Shea Rd

10825 N Tatum Blvd, Phoenix, AZ 85028

Sundays from 11am to 3pm at Petsmart in Glendale

7290 W Bell Rd, Glendale, AZ 85308 (shopping center, north side of Bell Rd)

***Visit our website or facebook page for special events schedules!***

Website:
www.azsmalldog.org

Facebook:
https://www.facebook.com/arizonasmalldogrescue/

name: Roxy
description: Roxy just turned three years old. She is a very friendly happy well-behaved girl that you canât help but love! She is potty trained, crate trained knows her obedience commands, and is an overall joy to have around. She is not pushy but loves affection. She gets along with other dogs. She listens and I canât really think of anything she has done wrong or annoying since we have had her. She came to us about 2 weeks ago. We rescued her from the Tucson county shelter. She was surrendered there by her owner who decided that living in a 55+ community was more important than her dog. She must be crazy, and Iâm secretly hoping that itâs not everything she imagined it would be. (lol) Anyway, Roxy could be yours, if you promise to love her forever! If you would like to meet her, please fill out our adoption questionnaire located under the forms tab on www.rottenrottie.com we look forward to working with you!

name: Artie
description:
Artie is a very sweet bundle of energy! His owners had taken him from a friend to care for him when he was found as a stray in Tucson over a year ago. When he was found, flyers were posted and attempts were made to find his original owners with no luck. They kept him and took great care for him over the course of a year until he landed here with us.

He is so sweet and likes to try to climb up on you to be pet, and will rest his head in your lap if he thinks he isn't getting enough attention. For the most part he is very curious and affectionate. He does great with other dogs too! He has been to the dog park frequently and loves to run and play. He also loves food and treat, and will get super excitable when you offer him treats! He knows how to sit for them too.

With his excitability, we would recommend no children under the age of 10 for this guy. We also think he would do best in a house that has another dog, and where he isn't left alone for too long, as he is very social and just wants companionship and love.

Please let us know if you are interested in giving Artie a forever home!

Please fill out an application if you want to meet him: http://azhuskyrescue.com/adoption-application/

name: Zulu - Courtesy Post
description:
***THIS IS A COURTESY LISTING.  This dog is not within the ACDR organization. For all information about this dog, you must contact the person listed within the animal description. He/she has been posted as a courtesy to help his/her owner find a new home. You will need to contact them directly. PLEASE do not email ACDR concerning this dog, we do not have further information concerning this dog. ***

Zulu is an older, medium sized cattle dog mix who is affectionate, loyal, hyper-aware and active. She loves to go on walks and hikes with her humans, chew on her Nylabones and rawhide treats, as well as spend time with her fellow dogs and cats. Zulu is very good with children and other animals (she is reluctant to get to know larger dogs, but has so in the past). 

Zulu dislikes loud, sudden noises and busy areas. This tends to lead to excessive barking. She also dislikes being separated from her humans and prefers to hang out with them all the time! 

At the moment, Zulu's current owners live in a very busy neighborhood, on a very busy intersection. The move to this location has taken a toll on Zulu's mental wellbeing and her current humans would love to find a quiet, loving home for her to spend her golden years in! She is spayed and is current on her vaccines. 

Zulu is located in Tucson, Arizona. You may reach her owner at acespino888@gmail.com or (520)440-5575.

name: Sandy - Courtesy Post
description:
THIS IS A COURTESY LISTING.  This dog is not within the ACDR organization. For all information about this dog, you must contact the person listed within the animal description. He/she has been posted as a courtesy to help his/her owner find a new home. You will need to contact them directly. PLEASE do not email ACDR concerning this dog, we do not have further information concerning this dog.

\"Sandy\" is our senior family dog who is about 12 years old. We adopted her from the shelter where she was spayed and labeled as a \"Queensland heeler mix\". She has lived with other dogs, cats and had loves children of all ages. She does not chew or have separation anxiety or any other bad habits. Because of her age she would benefit from a doggy door so she can go potty when she needs. She still loves to play and curl up next to you. Sandy is currently located in Tucson, AZ. Please feel free to contact me with any questions.  Emma Grasham  520-339-8668  emmagrasham2@gmail.com

name: Samantha
description:
Samantha is a sweet girl who had a rough twist of fate last year. The man who had adopted her several years ago passed away and family members were unable to properly care for her. Samantha came to us infested with fleas, coat in terrible condition, large tumor on her shoulder, and very depressed. We treated the fleas, had the tumor removed (benign!), gave her great care so her coat grew back healthy, and helped her get her good spirits back. Happy and healthy now, she'd love to find a new home where she can relax and enjoy life. She's good with other dogs and a total sweetheart. Very calm and easy to have around, but plenty of spunk left too. Seniors are such great, grateful companions. Samantha deserves her happily-ever-after!

Placements are preferred in northeastern Oklahoma, but no farther then 300 miles from Tulsa. Interested parties should complete our adoption application online: https://form.jotform.com/81906160839159

name: Charles
description:
Charles is a male, 9 lb, red and white Chihuahua mix. Charles' estimated date of birth is October, 2015. He was rescued from the Tulsa shelter as an unclaimed stray. Charles is a shy dog right now so no small kids for the minute. He's a little bit of a go slow, but he didn't offer to bite. He walks nicely on a leash and pottied outside so there's a good chance he'll be an easy house train. Charles was quiet on the ride to the vet. We have no doubt he'll warm up quickly with the ladies there. You can meet Charles at Muddy Paws. Call 918-749-5255 for an appointment. Charles has a $150.00 adoption fee plus the cost of 6 months of heartworm prevention. 

Note: ARF reserves the right to deny any application that is deemed unsuitable for the animal. Please be aware that our animal adoptions are NOT on a first come- first serve basis. Our sole purpose is to find the best possible home for the animals that fall under our care. We do not ship our animals. All adopters are expected to come to Tulsa if approved
For details on how to adopt please visit http://www.arftulsa.org/adopt

name: Mickey
description:
Mickey is a total sweetheart! About 14 months old, he's friendly, playful, and cuddly. He has been really good in the house (uses our dog door to go outside to potty), and sleeps in the human's bed like a champ (we offer this special training at no additional charge! :-) ) 

Mickey was a stray in Tulsa, running scared with an injured leg. We were finally able to catch him and he warmed up immediately. His leg was broken, but we had surgery done to repair things and he's doing great. Mickey can run and jump with the best of them. Once his recovery is 100%, you'll never know he had a problem.

Mickey is handsome, sweet, and happy. Could he be your new best friend? (Oh, and he has most excellent ears!)

Please click \"More about us\" to complete an online application. Adoption fee is $200.

Our rescue is located in Tulsa, Oklahoma. Because we accept responsibility for our foster dogs for the life of the dog, we do not ship dogs and we do not typically do long distance placements unless you are an approved, repeat adopter. We will consider homes within approximately 300 miles of our area (reasonable driving distance).

Placements are preferred in northeastern Oklahoma, but no farther then 300 miles from Tulsa. Interested parties should complete our adoption application online: https://form.jotform.com/81906160839159

name: Mickey
description:

name: Norah
description:
Name: Norah
Breed: Labrador retriever
Age: Approx. 3 Years as of April 2019
Sex: Female
Good with Dogs: Yes
Good with Cats: Unknown, but can test for approved applicant upon request. Based on her temperament, we suspect she would be fine with kitties!
Good with Kids:  Yes
Heartworm Status:  Negative

Norah came to us with what we are guessing is her biological family member, Margo in mid-2018 from what was initially described to us as a hoarding case in Twiggs County. As we learned more about their origination, our hearts broke for these poor mama dogs. Because when they came to us, they did indeed have three puppies between them, all three of which were approximately 6 weeks old. Norah and Margo have been through a personal purgatory that if a person had gone through, they would be hailed as superheroes. They and 36 other dogs of similar breed and ages were on a property under what from all reports has been described as a den of horrors. None of them had any sort of medical care, all were living in pens outside with little to no shelter. Many had teeth rotten from a steady diet of white bread. Little to no human contact was given to any of them.

Despite all of this, they were the best moms to their puppies. The puppies grew up and have since found forever homes of their own where they are loved and cared for. Norah and Margo both have spent extra time with us learning about people, socializing with other dogs, and getting plenty of medical care and a steady diet of good food. They have both been so appreciative. Itâs truly been a wonder to see their personalities blossom! 

Norah is a flirt. She likes to give you a big puppy smile and dance away from you just out of reach when you go to tickle that little pointy face of hers. Her zoomies are the best; sheâs like a blonde tornado of glee. She likes treats and to dance with Margo. Sheâs a rough and tumble tomboy that likes laid-back personalities in her canine companions. She gets along great with our small dogs and plays in the yard with them every day. She does fine with other big dogs as long as they arenât overly dominant. Despite her horrific past, she has no problems with things like food or resource guarding. Sheâs a soft, gentle, big bottomed girl that is still learning about how nice it is to be part of a pack that includes people. She is not a fan of the camera shutter sound and pretends to be a walrus with big eyes when itâs around.

Norah is still learning the ropes of walking on a leash completely comfortably, and she is making good progress. Her ideal family would include someone that appreciates her courage and is willing to give her the patience and love she needs to bridge that last gap of going from rescue dog to full fledged, comfortable member of a family. It may take her a couple of meetings with her potential family to really get a good sense of her goofy personality; this will be determined by our manager on a case-by-case basis. Norah tips the scales at approximately 60 pounds. 

----
Peach County Animal Rescue is a rescue located in Fort Valley, GA. Our adoption fees range from $175-350+. On average, our fees are $250. Although our rescue dogs share a common bond with one another, no rescue story is the same (even when similar). Vetting costs vary depending on their health conditions. For us, it is never about the money. We are a non-profit. Thank you for your love and support! All of our dogs are fully vetted: up-to-date on annual shots, spayed/neutered and microchipped with a lifetime registration. We look forward to hearing from you!

If you would like to send in an application for this dog, please use the link below! https://peachcountyanimalrescueandrehabilitation.org/apply-now-2/

name: Betsy
description:
Betsy  was saved from Upson County with her \"sister\" Mindy.  They were left  abandoned after their owner moved away, found in absolutely awful condition, covered in fleas and ticks, with medical issues, and in desperate need of some good love and food.  Our team of  volunteers has been working very hard on getting her ready for adoption.  She is very sweet and loving and ready for her furever home, preferably held in your lap!!  

There is a GoFundMe set up for their treatment and medical costs  https://www.gofundme.com/f/j73a6v?sharetype=teams&member=2514514&pc=fb_tco_campmgmtbnr_w&rcid=r01-15623372613-c485621aed80479c&utm_source=facebook&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=fb_tco_campmgmtbnr_w&fbclid=IwAR1iOOWSk-yxU2TsXj7gAaFR4wVFvmQCPBDSXIsrglwMUF_9YvRWEO_2afk

If you would like to learn more about Cocoâs Cupboard, or to fill out an application please visit cocoscupboardinc.org

To find us on #greatnonprofits and to write a review to support us got to:
https://greatnonprofits.org/org/cocos-cupboard-inc

If you would like to donate directly to help save lives, please visit http://cocoscupboardinc.org/donate.php

To donate food, toys & supplies please visit our Amazon Page http://a.co/7CIFfo1

#rescue #adopt #rescuedismyfavoritebreed #cocoscupboard

name: Yukon
description: Adopt a friendly, playful, snuggly puppy! All Best Friends puppies are already spayed or neutered, microchipped, vaccinated, and infused with extra love and cuddles. They need to be taught all those good things that puppies need to learn in order to grow up to be adult dogs, of course. A puppy is a project! But there's nothing these little ones would love more than to grow right up into your family. This puppy was born in May 2019 and came from an animal rescue group in Utah. If you're in love, please fill out an adoption survey and let's get started!

name: Irene
description: Irene was rescued during Hurricane Harvey and later came to Best Friends from a humane society in Utah. At first, shy and fearful with strangers, but now she warms up quickly and turns into a silly goofball. Her little body wiggles with joy when she sees her human friends. She loves to play with other dogs at Dogtown, and she has been a good role model for her doggie roommate. Irene loves to have weekly play dates with new dogs! She even passed a cat test at the Sanctuary.

name: Kenya
description: When Kenya sees someone she knows, she does a happy dance, wiggling around and folding her body in half. Then she'll sit at your feet and ask to be petted. Born in 2006, Kenya came to the sanctuary from a Utah shelter. Here at the sanctuary, she and her trainers have been working hard on some behavior issues. Although she is calm and friendly when meeting people on a leash, she is protective of barriers and can seem a bit fierce on the other side of a fence or gate. She has bitten before, so she needs a very understanding person who is willing to work with her on her barrier issues. Although she loves to play with toys and with people, she does not get along with other dogs, so she would do best as an only pet. Kenya is looking for a home with a dog-savvy person (or people) who can see her potential and will continue to work with her. She would be thrilled to meet you if you think she might be a good fit! Kenya is part of our Single Pets* program! That means that she is eligible for a free flight home and waived adoption fee! *Single pets do best as the only dog or cat in the home.

name: Hearth (Tyson) - Massada pup 1
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs1066

Hello! My name is Hearth AKA Tyson. I am 7 years old and about 68 pounds. Don't let my age fool you I am an active guy! I LOVE walks on the beach and am learning that car rides can be kinda awesome. They say I'm a lab mix BUT I think there may be a shepherd in my family tree since I have this handsome fur. I was with my first family for a long time but they had to move and couldn't take me with them, so now I am hanging out with my foster Dad and learning lots of new and exciting things!! My foster Dad says I'm a pretty special guy. I am an expert level cuddler and love getting scritches and rubs! My favorite chew is this yak stick thingy. Yum! 

I would probably be best as an only dog or with a single calm, balanced doggie friend who could be my wingman if I get nervous.... but I am still not willing to share my nachos! Some things are sacred! Because I'm a big strong athletic guy (foster Dad says I'm just big boned) I need a human who has some experience and willingness to continue my training to help me be the best boy! 

Great Things about Tyson!
-Crate Trained
-House Trained
- Knows some obedience - sit, stay, down, paw, place, crate, heel
-LOVES people
-Been good with children I have met
- Affectionate
- Active but not high energy
- Loves chew toys
- Learning to like toys, especially this one that looks a little like p-o-o-p ;)


To adopt this dog, or any OPH dog, fill out the simple online application at https://ophrescue.org 
Operation Paws for Homes, Inc. (OPH) rescues dogs of all breeds and ages from high-kill shelters in NC, VA, MD, and SC, reducing the numbers being euthanized. With limited resources, the shelters are forced to put down 50-90% of the animals that come in the front door. OPH provides pet adoption services to families located in VA, DC, MD, PA and neighboring states. OPH is a 501(c)(3) organization and is 100% donor funded. OPH does not operate a shelter or have a physical location. We rely on foster families who open their homes to give love and attention to each dog before finding a forever home.

name: Percy
description:
Hello! I'm new to ODHS! I am a sweet, small 7 year old guy.  I found myself at a local shelter as a stray and no one came for me, so here I am!  While at the shelter they treated me for ear infections and found I don't hear very well (not sure if this is permanent or not), but I am a guy afterall (#selectivehearing).

Adoption donations are $250 for an adult, $350 for puppies (a dog under one year of age), and $125 for a senior dog (based on the age of the dog). All dogs are spay/neutered, have rabies, distemper vaccine, microchip, heartworm test if age appropriate, and are current on heartworm preventative. Adoption donations are accepted via cash or debit/credit card. There is a $5 fee to run a card.

Please remember to bring a collar and leash with you the day of the adoption. 

Fill out an application online prior to arriving to our adoption event. This greatly speeds up the adoption process and will ensure that the animal you are interested in will be at the event. Not all adoptable dogs can make it to all events, because they are cared for in foster homes. Our adoption events are most Wednesdayâs from 5-7pm and each Saturday from Noon until 4 PM on Saturdayâs at 3602 Lafayette Blvd, Suite 102, Fredericksburg, VA 22408. There are circumstances that we will not have an adoption event, so please email or check our Facebook prior to coming to ensure we will be open. 

We do receive HUNDREDS of emails daily. The fastest way to get a response is to fill out an application on our website, NOT by submitting an inquiry. Online applications get priority over applications filled out in person.

Visit our website for an application to adopt.  
https://www.olddominionhumanesociety.org/adoption-application

Please be patient. Old Dominion Humane Society is a volunteer based organization. We are run completely by volunteers, who also have full time jobs and families.

Like us on Facebook
www.facebook.com/OldDominionHumaneSociety and follow this dog's journey in finding a forever family.

Old Dominion Humane Society adopts to Virginia and the immediate surrounding states. There is a $50, out of state fee.

name: Sky
description:
Hello! I'm new to ODHS! I was surrendered by my owner because I was too much of a \"nervous Nelly\" and I paced a lot.  Maybe I need more exercise and mental stimulation, we will see.  I will need some time to relax and feel safe in your home.  Because of my super bionic ears, I do hear quite well and will definitely alert you when someone knocks on the door.  Men are quite tall and big, so they make me more nervous than women do.  I would do best in a home that doesn't have small children, but I seem to like calm dogs to play with.  I am about 30 lbs and between 1-2 years old.

name: Jenny
description:
Jenny is a small female terrier who is estimated to be about two year old.  She is about 8 lbs, and is looking for a forever family who will not abandon her anymore. 

In a very remote part of southeast part of Korea, Jenny was found on the street abandoned by her human family.  We do not know how long she has been living on the street, but she was very thin, and also tested positive for heartworm.  She was relocated to a near by shelter, but we had to rescue her out when it was time for her to be euthanized to a nice foster home who was willing to take her in while she was being treated for HW,  Her personality was really blossoming while she was with the foster family, and we realized she is just another loving pup who likes to be petted, loves going for a walk, and plays with her toys.  She also loves people, and furry friends at the foster home.  We were told she is not much of a barker, which would make her a perfect city dog where she can live in an apartment, and gets to go to a nearby dog park to play with other dogs!  Now, she has to take is the monthly HW meds just like any other dogs, but other than that, she received thumbs up from the vet, and she is ready for his forever home!

We believe people who adopt rescue animals because they are willing to accept a bit of imperfection, and willing to embrace, work/ train and love them no matter what baggage the animal had in the past. It can be challenging, but extremely rewarding. We have seen amazing transformation in our adopted dogs who have been with loving families, and it is our goal to provide all of them with the opportunity. We are at our happiest when we see photos of our adopted animals smile with the new adoptive family, and we hope to find Jenny a loving family who would do the same. 

Please consider adopting Jenny and making her part of your family! If you would like to apply to adopt Jenny, you can download an application here: 

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1u_YTSKWFVkNYLUcJbCVvfyQnguL-gHi8JGG59XOIIog/edit 

You can MEET Jenny upon request or at one of our adoption event in the near future.  We will post the exact date once we finalize the plan.  Please refer to our facebook page for more info:

https://www.facebook.com/Band4Animal/

 *NOTE* We have a 30-mile radius limit from Fairfax, VA for adoption.  We require a completed application & home check to adopt. An adoption fee o$500 applies. All dogs are spay/neutered and have all shots prior to adoption. We will not respond to anyone who has not filled out the application, but request to meet the dogs. Thank you!

name: Tom
description:
Tom is a male Maltese who is estimated to be about two year old.  He is about 11 lbs, and is looking for a forever family who will not abandon him anymore. 

In a very remote part of southeast part of Korea, Tom was abandoned in a crate along with his playmate, a small 7lbs Pomeranian by his previous owner near a high kill shelter.  We do not know why, but incidents like this happen all the time to our furbabies in Korea, where the dogs have been part of the family for some time, and one day, they become disposable.  Tom and his friend were rescued out of the kill shelter when it was time to be euthanized, and now that he feels that he is safe with us, his personality is really blossoming.  He loves people, and loves getting petted.  He does not like it when other dogs try to take the attention away while he is sitting on your lap, and would growl, but he never attacks.  He is relatively very calm, and not hyper.  He plays well with other calm dogs but stays away from dogs that are more jumpy.  When he was rescued, he tested positive for heartworm, but he has been treated for HW since then.  Now, all he has to take is the monthly HW meds just like any other dogs, but other than that, he received thumbs up from the vet, and he is ready for his forever home!

We believe people who adopt rescue animals because they are willing to accept a bit of imperfection, and willing to embrace, work/ train and love them no matter what baggage the animal had in the past. It can be challenging, but extremely rewarding. We have seen amazing transformation in our adopted dogs who have been with loving families, and it is our goal to provide all of them with the opportunity. We are at our happiest when we see photos of our adopted animals smile with the new adoptive family, and we hope to find Tom a loving family who would do the same. 

Please consider adopting Tom and making him part of your family! If you would like to apply to adopt Tom, you can download an application here: 

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1u_YTSKWFVkNYLUcJbCVvfyQnguL-gHi8JGG59XOIIog/edit 

You can MEET Tom upon request or at one of our adoption event in the near future.  We will post the exact date once we finalize the plan.  Please refer to our facebook page for more info:

https://www.facebook.com/Band4Animal/

 *NOTE* We have a 30-mile radius limit from Fairfax, VA for adoption.  We require a completed application & home check to adopt. An adoption fee o$500 applies. All dogs are spay/neutered and have all shots prior to adoption. We will not respond to anyone who has not filled out the application, but request to meet the dogs. Thank you!

name: Remember Me Freckles
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8534

Hello! My name is Remember Me Freckles and I am currently ten weeks old and estimated to be a male lab mix.

I'm searching for...
* someone who won't leave me home alone for more than 4 hrs, at least not until I am older. The older I am the more I can stay home alone. I just don't want you to get mad at me if I have accidents or chew things I'm not supposed to when you leave me for too long. I'm a puppy, so I get bored quick and when I'm bored I could get in trouble.
* I am looking for my forever home, not my for right now home. So as I get bigger I need someone to teach me how to be the best dog I can be. My mommy has taught me a lot, but I am young and still learning. You may want to teach me some new tricks like sit, stay, etc. My foster mom says professional training will help me bond with you. That sounds like fun!
* I saved the most important for last. I am hoping my new mom or dad will snuggle with me, play with me and love me forever and ever!

If you think I may be the dog for you, apply now! I cant wait to find my forever family ! I can go home as soon as 9/22/19 and fostered in St. Stephens Church, VA.
To adopt this dog, or any OPH dog, fill out the simple online application at https://ophrescue.org

name: Doodle Dandy
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8551

2-3 year old Male beagle about 15lbs. Was found in a southern Virginia shelter by a volunteer. 

This dog tested positive for Ehrlichia before arriving to the rescue. Ehrlichia is a very common type of bacteria that infects dogs and other species and is spread by ticks. Ehrlichia is not contagious to humans or other pets. The only way to get this disease is to be bitten by a tick that carries it. The treatment is typically 21-30 days of antibiotics. This dog started treatment upon arriving to the rescue. 

**I will be at the Richmond Dog Festival Event in Richmond, VA on 9/21/19 from 11am to 4pm at Chimborazo Park 3215 E. Broad St. Richmond, VA 23223 . I would love to meet my furever family so come by and meet me this weekend ! 
To adopt this dog, or any OPH dog, fill out the simple online application at https://ophrescue.org

Operation Paws for Homes, Inc. (OPH) rescues dogs of all breeds and ages from high-kill shelters in NC, VA, MD, and SC, reducing the numbers being euthanized. name: Remember Me Lexi
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8530

Hello! My name is Remember Me Lexi and I am currently ten weeks old and estimated to be a lab mix.

I'm searching for...
* someone who won't leave me home alone for more than 4 hrs, at least not until I am older. The older I am the more I can stay home alone. I just don't want you to get mad at me if I have accidents or chew things I'm not supposed to when you leave me for too long. I'm a puppy, so I get bored quick and when I'm bored I could get in trouble.
* I am looking for my forever home, not my for right now home. So as I get bigger I need someone to teach me how to be the best dog I can be. My mommy has taught me a lot, but I am young and still learning. You may want to teach me some new tricks like sit, stay, etc. My foster mom says professional training will help me bond with you. That sounds like fun!
* I saved the most important for last. I am hoping my new mom or dad will snuggle with me, play with me and love me forever and ever!

If you think I may be the dog for you, apply now! I cant wait to find my forever family ! I can go home as soon as 9/22/19 and fostered in St. Stephens Church, VA.

name: Muppet
description:
Hello! I'm new to ODHS! I am between 3-4 years old and I weigh 20lbs.  I got a much needed spa day recently.  Do you like my mohawk?  I love people, pets, other dogs...and Iâm game for just about anything you want to do.  

Adoption donations are $250 for an aduult, $350 for puppies (a dog under one year of age), and $125 for a senior dog (based on the age of the dog). All dogs are spay/neutered, have rabies, distemper vaccine, microchip, heartworm test if age appropriate, and are current on heartworm preventative. Adoption donations are accepted via cash or debit/credit card. There is a $5 fee to run a card.

Please remember to bring a collar and leash with you the day of the adoption. 

Fill out an application online prior to arriving to our adoption event. This greatly speeds up the adoption process and will ensure that the animal you are interested in will be at the event. Not all adoptable dogs can make it to all events, because they are cared for in foster homes. Our adoption events are most Wednesdayâs from 5-7pm and each Saturday from Noon until 4 PM on Saturdayâs at 3602 Lafayette Blvd, Suite 102, Fredericksburg, VA 22408. There are circumstances that we will not have an adoption event, so please email or check our Facebook prior to coming to ensure we will be open. 

We do receive HUNDREDS of emails daily. The fastest way to get a response is to fill out an application on our website, NOT by submitting an inquiry. Online applications get priority over applications filled out in person.

Visit our website for an application to adopt.  
https://www.olddominionhumanesociety.org/adoption-application

Please be patient. Old Dominion Humane Society is a volunteer based organization. We are run completely by volunteers, who also have full time jobs and families.

Old Dominion Humane Society adopts to Virginia and the immediate surrounding states. There is a $50, out of state fee.
