name: Cayde
description: If you are interested in adopting this dog, please fill out our dog adoption questionnaire and e-mail it to AdoptionCenter@homewardtrails.org PLEASE VISIT THIS WEBSITE TO FIND THE ADOPTION QUESTIONNAIRE: http://www.homewardtrails.org/adopt-a-pet/adoption-forms/ Cayde is a beautiful retriever/terrier mix originally from Chatham, VA. He has a beautiful deep red/tan coat and big ears full of personality! Cayde loves to play, but also snuggles up well next to his people. He's happiest when he can exercise and take long walks. He is crate-trained, and goes in happily to lay down or rest. He does great riding in the car and meeting new people. He will need someone to help him a bit while walking on leash as he gets excited and pulls, but with treats and commands he listens well and stops. He's just excited meeting people and dogs -- not aggressive -- so with a little more training, he will do great. He's a big love bug and full of personality. Come meet him this weekend! Adoption Coordinator: Adoption Center Location: Adoption Center The adoption fee for this dog is $375. This fee INCLUDES spay/neuter and microchip. Every adopted Homeward Trails animal comes with 30 days of free pet health insurance. We are proud to partner with the following veterinarians who offer a free first exam for your animal, exclusively for HT adopters: Caring Hands Animal Hospital, Palisades Veterinary Clinic, Sunshine Animal Hospital and Clarendon Animal Care and all VCA Animal Hospitals. Additionally, any VCA hospital will cover illnesses up to $250 at no cost to any Homeward Trails adopter. We also provide a 30-minute phone consult with a professional dog trainer at Fur-Get Me Not within the first 30 days of adopting - just for HT adopters in the Arlington/Alexandria area. Start your new dog out on the right foot with this valuable, expert advice and guidance FREE! You can save animals like this one by becoming a foster! Fosters are like way stations between high kill shelters and forever homes. We need fosters so that we can save dogs before they are euthanized at the shelters. If you are interested in becoming a foster, please check out our information about fostering by visiting http://www.homewardtrails.org/foster-a-pet/dog-and-cat-foster-program/

name: Brioni
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8547

Hello! My name is Brioni and I joined my new foster family, after my trip up with the designer dogs, this weekend. My foster mom calls me a mini St. Bernard (they say St. Bernard/hound mix), she says I look a bit like one but I'm pretty small, around 25 pounds. 

I am still adjusting to all of the changing things around me. I am walking up and down stairs for the first time, I am also learning how to walk on a leash, I take a lot of cues from my foster sister. So far I have liked meeting new dogs and people. Right now, my favorite thing is to nap on the couch. Every day I am learning new things so come back and check on my progress.

I am hoping to find a forever home where I can cuddle and play and learn, is that with you? If so apply today! I wont be available long!

name: Diane von Furstenberg
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8549

 Diane von Furstenberg is a beagle mix girls who is about 5 years old and 27 lbs. Just look at those melting chocolate eyes and smooth long ears - talk about easy on the eyes. 

Diane, who is is fondly called Jolene by her foster family, is a pretty low-key dog. She is timid around new people and will need an adopter who understands that she's going to take some time to warm up. This is all so new to her, and we don't know her background, so perhaps she hasn't had a loving home before. She is very playful with the other dog in her foster home, and this is when we see her fun, quirky side come out. Her foster family is working on slowly socializing her, and helping her to build confidence so her true personality can shine. She is working on her house-training, and does well in a crate - no accidents there, and she is a quiet sleeper. And she walks well on a leash. She is just the sweetest little thing, and we will update her profile as she comes out of her shell more.

This dog tested positive for Ehrlichia and Anaplasmosis before arriving to the rescue. These are very common type of bacteria that infects dogs and other species and is spread by ticks. Neither is contagious to humans or other pets. The only way to get either is to be bitten by a tick that carries it. The treatment is typically 21-30 days of antibiotics. This dog started treatment upon arriving to the rescue. 

To adopt this dog, or any OPH dog, fill out the simple online application at https://ophrescue.org

name: Stella McCartney
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8536

Hi! My name is Stella McCartney and I arrived at OPH on 9/13/19 as part of the Designer Dogs transport. Im guessed to be a plott hound mix, and estimated to be about 1 year old. Im a very sweet girl...a big lap dog actually, who loves to cuddle! I like to bury my head in my foster moms side while shes petting me! AND after I get a bath ...Im a good girl in the bathtub! My beautiful brindle coat just shines when its clean 

I currently weigh close to 50lbs, and Im tall and lanky. I love to eat (), so Ill probably fill out a bit more! Im learning how to walk on a leash better...my foster mom is using a harness because I have a lot of energy, and its going great! Im a fast learner though, Im good at sit and already working on shake! 

Im potty trained (no accidents in the house or my crate since the night I arrived), and Im good at going into my crate during the day when my foster mom is at work. 

Im currently in search of my forever home. Is that with you? If so apply today! I wont be available long!

name: Abbigale and Hoss
description:
Hi there! We are Hoss and Abbigale and we come as a pair of cuties! Together we weigh about 15 pounds, and around 6 years old. We do everything together like sit on your lap and sleep in our kennel. We do fine with other dogs, but we are not really interested in playing with them. We sleep quietly in our kennel and have had no accidents in there. The shelter environment and our foster home is new to us so we are a little timid. It took us a few hours before we warmed up to our foster family. For the most part we do a good job of using puppy pads. I Hoss (white and brown) do a good job on going outside on a leash, Abbigale (brown) prefers not to go outside. We would be best with older children (10+) as we are small and timid. It is also good to know that I (Hoss) have a pin in one of my front legs. It does not prevent me from running/jumping or having fun. We are both sweet and cuddly, we just need a family to call our own. We hope you will come and meet us on Saturday!

Adoption donations are $250 for an adult, $350 for puppies (a dog under one year of age), and $125 for a senior dog (based on the age of the dog). All dogs are spay/neutered, have rabies, distemper vaccine, microchip, heartworm test if age appropriate, and are current on heartworm preventative. Adoption donations are accepted via cash or debit/credit card. There is a $5 fee to run a card.

Please remember to bring a collar and leash with you the day of the adoption. 

Fill out an application online prior to arriving to our adoption event. This greatly speeds up the adoption process and will ensure that the animal you are interested in will be at the event. Not all adoptable dogs can make it to all events, because they are cared for in foster homes. Our adoption events are most Wednesdayâs from 5-7pm and each Saturday from Noon until 4 PM on Saturdayâs at 3602 Lafayette Blvd, Suite 102, Fredericksburg, VA 22408. There are circumstances that we will not have an adoption event, so please email or check our Facebook prior to coming to ensure we will be open. 

We do receive HUNDREDS of emails daily. The fastest way to get a response is to fill out an application on our website, NOT by submitting an inquiry. Online applications get priority over applications filled out in person.

Visit our website for an application to adopt.  
https://www.olddominionhumanesociety.org/adoption-application

Please be patient. Old Dominion Humane Society is a volunteer based organization. We are run completely by volunteers, who also have full time jobs and families.

Like us on Facebook
www.facebook.com/OldDominionHumaneSociety and follow this dog's journey in finding a forever family.

Old Dominion Humane Society adopts to Virginia and the immediate surrounding states. There is a $50, out of state fee.

name: Reagan
description:
Hi! Iâm Reagan. I used to live my life on a chain and could never go in the house. I've had a lot of litters of puppies in my day. I was recently seized from a house by these nice animal control officers. They found out that I was heartworm positive and I also need a dental cleaning. But now I love the air conditioning and don't want to stay outside longer than I have to go to the bathroom. Which I normally do outside! I'm sweet as can be and I love cats and children. I walked a little bow-legged and would really benefit from joint supplements. Belly rubs are my favorite!

Note: I am heartworm positive because I never got the preventative in my prior home.  Iâll be treated and then Iâll just need 30 days of low activity to heal.

name: Baxter
description:
Dear future parents, Hi my name is Baxter and I am such a sweet boy. Iâm loving my life in my foster home right now! I get free range of the house because I seem to be fully house trained and I crate well when told to! I know basic commands like sit, down, and shake with both my paws. My favorite activity is laying in bed with my foster mom cause I love to snuggle so much! I also double as her body guard. I might be 9 y/o but that doesnât slow my long legs down when my foster family goes out to do activities. When you come to meet me ignore how shy I might seem because when you get me home I will be the most bestest doggo ever! 

Note:  In my prior home I didn't like it when people would \"play fight\" because that upset me and made me bite.  If I felt like someone was being hurt, I was going to protect that person.  So if you can work with me on this, I will be pretty easy to get along with otherwise.

name: Vera Wang
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8479

Hi! My name is Vera Wang and Im part of the Designer Dog transport. Im guessed to be a Weimaraner mix (maybe some hound?), around 1 1/2 years old and weigh about 30 lbs. I am still a youngster and have a good amount of typical puppy tendencies in me....

I like to zoom around the yard (as you can see by clicking here). I love exploring all the smells, some play biting and I sometimes jump up to get to the things I want. We can work on correcting these together! My foster Mom says I take correction very well. I am happy girl who likes being on the move and have enjoyed the walks Ive taken.....I would be a great running partner after I am trained to do so.

I just arrived a couple days ago so my foster Mom is just starting to learn about me....so far in my foster home...
*I have loved meeting new people....men and women....I havent met any kids yet
*I love being with my people better than the crate so it sometimes takes me a while to settle
*I have liked all the dogs Ive met.....and Ive had 2 play dates that went great!
*My foster mom is working with me on potty training...too soon to tell what I know...
*Ive had no accidents in the crate and can last through the night.

Do I sound like your match? If so, apply today! I wont be available long!

name: Minnie
description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Minnie is a precious little gal who was born sometime around the first of the year. She came to us with her littermate, Mickey, from a home in southern VA where neither was given any human handling or socialization. Although both are very sweet, they are skittish and each will need a home with a patient owner able to provide a consistent schedule and lots of human interaction. We expect Minnie to be less than 10 pounds when fully grown.

Minnie is in good health. She has had her puppy vaccines and will be spayed and microchipped as a part of our adoption process.

CARE Rescue is  foster-base rescue located in Richmond, VA.  We do not have a facility for you to come to meet animals at.  You must visit our weekly adoption stand (calendar on our website) to meet the adoptable dogs.  Out of area adoptions can only be facilitated when we are able to find a volunteer to do a home visit for us and when the potential adopter already has a veterinary reference.

name: MAC
description: Mac is a well traveled man! Well, he's at least traveled from Florida to VA. Mac came to us from a Florida shelter ahead if Hurricane Dorian. He wasn't so sure about NoVa life at first but now that he's has had a little while to settle in, he can't think of any other place better for his forever home. Mac is a reserved gent at first and thinks the best relationships should never be rushed. If you've got a laid back kind of home and are looking for a laid back kind of guy to go with it, come meet this boy today!

name: Lulu
description:
Lulu, who is a terrier/ Maltese mixed female terrier is about 9 mo puppy. She and her sibling Lucy (who was happily adopted in VA) were both rescue from a temple in the remote southeast part of Korea. Their mother, Star, who is a small Maltese belonging to a man who works at the temple, was raised as an outdoor dog, tied up to a post. In Korea, the winter weather is very harsh, and they get a lot of snow, and we have no idea how a little Maltese survived all those years! The man decided to give up these two pups, since they have no place for growing family, and after much resistance from the man, we were finally able to convince him to also surrender Star to us. Star will also be joining us soon here and hope to be reunited with her babies!

Lulu is such a friendly pup, and plays well with other dogs and people. She is very loving and sweet, and weighs around 9 lbs currently. We believe she will be under 15 lbs even as a full grown. She loves playtime, treat time, kiss time, naptime, and did I mention playtime and kiss time?? She is a perfect small terrier who is fun and friendly, but because she is mixed breed, not designer breed dogs, she has a zero chance to be adopted in Korea. Since she was with our foster's family, we are happy to report Lulu has mastered the potty training, and she is on target 95% currently. We would love to provide a family who already have a small furry friend in their because Lulu likes to play with other dogs. Other than that, she received a clean bill of health from the vet, and she is ready to be adopted! 

We believe people who adopt rescue animals because they are willing to accept a bit of imperfection, and willing to embrace, work/ train and love them no matter what baggage the animal had in the past. It can be challenging, but extremely rewarding. We have seen amazing transformation in our adopted dogs who have been with loving families, and it is our goal to provide all of them with the opportunity. We are at our happiest when we see photos of our adopted animals smile with the new adoptive family, and we hope to find Lulu a loving family who would do the same. 

Please consider adopting Lulu and making her part of your family! If you would like to apply to adopt Lulu, you can download an application here: 

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1u_YTSKWFVkNYLUcJbCVvfyQnguL-gHi8JGG59XOIIog/edit 

You can MEET Lulu upon request or at one of our adoption event in the near future.  We will post the exact date once we finalize the plan.  Please refer to our facebook page for more info:

https://www.facebook.com/Band4Animal/

 *NOTE* We have a 30-mile radius limit from Fairfax, VA for adoption.  We require a completed application & home check to adopt. An adoption fee o$500 applies. All dogs are spay/neutered and have all shots prior to adoption. Thank you!

name: Nellie
description:
Hey, Nellie here! Let me tell you a bit about me... I'm living in a foster home now with three other dogs and no kids or cats. I get along fairly well with the other canines, but they have been correcting me a bit lately (something about etiquette and personal space). I am a young and playful small dog with not too many cares in the world. I'm working on the potty training currently, but  the puppy pads are working great for me. I haven't done a lot of leash walking yet, I'm not super fond of it. I can get a bit persistent and riled up at times, I slept in the crate last night and although it's not my favorite place to be, I settle down after a bit. I have only been here for about a week and I am learning new dog skills every day. Its not that I don't like it here, but am looking for my forever family, a place to call home permanently! Ask about me or fill out the application! I am about a year old and 8lbs.

Adoption donations are $250 for an adult, $350 for puppies (a dog under one year of age), and $125 for a senior dog (based on the age of the dog). All dogs are spay/neutered, have rabies, distemper vaccine, microchip, heartworm test if age appropriate, and are current on heartworm preventative. Adoption donations are accepted via cash or debit/credit card. There is a $5 fee to run a card.

Please remember to bring a collar and leash with you the day of the adoption. 

Fill out an application online prior to arriving to our adoption event. This greatly speeds up the adoption process and will ensure that the animal you are interested in will be at the event. Our adoption events are most Wednesdayâs from 5-7pm and each Saturday from Noon until 4 PM on Saturdayâs at 3602 Lafayette Blvd, Suite 102, Fredericksburg, VA 22408. There are circumstances that we will not have an adoption event, so please email or check our Facebook prior to coming to ensure we will be open. 

We do receive HUNDREDS of emails daily. The fastest way to get a response is to fill out an application on our website, NOT by submitting an inquiry. Online applications get priority over applications filled out in person.

Visit our website for an application to adopt.

name: Dorian's Princess
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8490

I'm Dorian's Princess! OPH helped evacuate me from a partner shelter in Hurricane Dorian's path. I was worried, but now I'm safe with OPH and looking for a home! 

I've been with my foster family a week now and here are some things they think you should know about me:
~ I'm a female pup, about 5 months old and 38 pounds. I am small though, my foster mom was surprised at the vet at my weight.
~My foster family believes that I am a Lab mix pup. I LOVE the water, just like most labs do. 
~I'm a happy girl, my tail is always wagging, and I have loved everyone with 2 and 4 legs that I have met. 
~ I am quiet in my crate.
~ I appear to be house trained (no accidents yet but I may need a day to adjust to your home don't forget)
~ My foster mom believes you should feed me in my crate for a while yet so I can better learn to trust everyone. I may have missed a few meals before in my short life so I gobble my food down. When the door is closed and I feel safe I eat at a much more normal speed.
~ I went to a super fun party in Arlington over the weekend (It was an adoption event my foster mom says) and I did great even with the hussle of the city and lots, and lots of new people.


For now, here are some tidbits about me:
~ I'm super friendly with everyone
~ I'm super quiet in my crate
~ I'm keeping my crate nice and clean. This makes Foster momma very happy.
~ I'm learning to play with toys.
~ I'm doing great with leash walking
~ I'm going to win a contest for the longest tail Foster mom says. It's almost as long as I am tall! She says it's adorable since it's always moving.
~ I'm ready to find my forever family.

Check back for updates as I settle in to my foster home, or apply to adopt me today! A nice pup as cute as I am won't be available for long!
To adopt this dog, or any OPH dog, fill out the simple online application at https://ophrescue.org

name: Dorian's Penny
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8489

A pretty girl like me should have all the petting, don't you think so? Hi, I'm Dorian's Penny. I was evacuated from a shelter in NC that was projected to be in Hurricane Dorian's path. I am about 3 years old and weigh about 45lbs. I could be part collie part hound mix. 

My foster Momma says at her house:
- I'm good in a crate, just need a little more time practicing the going in part.
- So far I haven't had any accidents.
- I am a bit timid, but I am working on learning trust. I now happy prance when foster Momma takes me outside instead of Pancaking myself to the ground. 
- I love my foster brother Dorian's Paxton. He is helping me come out of my she'll more everyday. 

Foster Momma doesn't know what happened to me before I got to the shelter. I can't tell her but she says she doesn't think I've had an easy life. Don't worry she is helping mend my heart with love. I went to the dog park and tried to make some friends today (9.15.19), I sniffed and trotted with some dogs. My favorite part was there were so many new people to pet me! If you are interested in me, please apply today. I am looking for a family to call my own. 

This dog tested positive for Ehrlichia before arriving to the rescue. Ehrlichia is a very common type of bacteria that infects dogs and other species and is spread by ticks. Ehrlichia is not contagious to humans or other pets. The only way to get this disease is to be bitten by a tick that carries it. The treatment is typically 21-30 days of antibiotics. This dog started treatment upon arriving to the rescue.

name: Dorian's Bambi
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8494

I'm Dorian's Bambi! OPH helped evacuate me from a partner shelter in Hurricane Dorian's path. I was worried, but now I'm safe with OPH and looking for a home! 

I'm a female pup, about a year old and 40 pounds. I appear to be a Border Collie/Hound mix. I am a bundle of puppy loving energy!
I love playing with my foster siblings and hiking with my foster family. I even got to go swimming! 
I am an active pup and will need some exercise! I know sit and am house and crate trained! I walk well on a leash with some pulling. I currently wear a harness when we go hiking. I have been exposed to a cat and knew my boundaries when he said he didn't like me!

I will not be around long! I am adorable, young and oh so sweet! 
Apply to receive daily doses of my kisses today!

name: Dorian's Buttercup
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8498

Hi, I'm Dorian's Buttercup! OPH helped evacuate me from a partner shelter in Hurricane Dorian's path and now I'm safe with OPH and looking for a home! 

I'm a female pup, about 6 months old, 38 pounds and appear to be perhaps a Hound/Shepherd mix. My family says I am the PERFECT size since I sit right in the middle of my small and larger siblings.

My three favorite things so far since coming to my foster family have been belly rubs, squeaky toys and the abundance of other dogs to befriend. I am very good with getting to know other dogs and making sure we are on the same page and boy do I love to play if they let me! I have been around large dogs and small and just love them all. If I feel overwhelmed in any way I lay down and let them sniff me but I do not react as I know they are just getting to know me too! 

I have been practicing walking on the leash and with the guidance of some of my foster siblings I am picking it up quickly!! I really enjoy walking and sniffing all around these new place. I would absolutely LOVE to find a forever family that loves walking as much as me. Did I mention I LOVE belly rubs too? My foster family says I am all about the \"people loving\" and the cuddles, which I why I think I get SO many kisses from them!!

I have been given so many gold stars for my potty training skills since coming in to my foster home! I much prefer to do my business outside, which to my surprise I have been given lots of yummy treats for, so I think I will keep that up!! 

I do very well in my crate and understand it is my safe place for me to relax. I sleep well through the night and when my foster family is out of the house I stay in my crate just fine. 

**The only BIG thing missing in my world right now, is a family to call my own. I really would LOVE to find a human family of any size who would let me make them as happy as they would make me!!** 

See me in action here:
https://youtu.be/H59kGdF22oM
https://youtu.be/atYGZQosWEM
https://youtu.be/6qyInoDM5iw
https://youtu.be/E5zAqoVvj3A

I'm spayed, microchipped and up to date on shots and monthly preventatives. If you are looking for a SWEET, affectionate, playful family member, I'm your gal!
To adopt this dog, or any OPH dog, fill out the simple online application at https://ophrescue.org

name: Dorian's Lightning
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8502

I'm Dorian's Lightning! OPH helped evacuate me from a partner shelter in Hurricane Dorian's path. I was worried, but now I'm safe with OPH and looking for a home! 

I'm a male pup, about 5 months old and 30 pounds. I appear to be a Lab mix. 

Lightning is settling well. He is a very active dog and is getting along with the foster's other dogs very well. Overall a very sweet pup, smart and learns fast. He wants a lot of attention, and toys. He loves to give plenty of kisses, and cuddle. His cuddles dont last long because he is always moving. 

He is doing really well with crate training. He will cry for the first 5-10 minutes of being in the crate, but he will calm down. 

We are working on housetraining. He needs to be let out often because he is still young, but we have not had any issues with him peeing or pooping in the house. 

He is very friendly and follows me everywhere. 

He does okay on a leash and we are working on it.

description:

I don't make any noise unless the other dogs start barking a lot and I am doing well going outside and walking on my leash.

name: Milky Desi Dog
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8448

Hi! Im Milky! I am one year old and weigh about 33 lbs. I am a \"Desi Dog\" (a local term for \"street dog\") from India in search of a home of my own. My sister Peppy Desi Dog and I are the only surviving puppies of a litter of five born on the street in New Delhi. I had a hard first year of life. I was hit by a car and had a broken leg, but I was rescued by KAW, a local animal welfare group, who nursed me back to good health. Now I am in search of a forever home!

I made my trip to the USA just in time for my birthday! I'm a year old September 10, 2019. I have adjusted incredibly well already. I'm so happy to be here and I LOVE my new squeaky toys. Guess what??? I like playing with the garden hose, as you can see by clicking here.

I'm working on my house training. My foster mom says it won't take me long because I'm a smart girl. 

Please take me home and show me my new life!

name: Erykah
description:
Hi there, Erykah here! Iâm a spunky little snuggle bug looking for my forever people. I love playing with other dogs but if you donât have another dog for me to play with, thatâs fine too because I just want to be your very best friend! I love being around my people and will follow you wherever you go! Whether thatâs on a walk or just hanging out on the couch, I just want to keep you company! 
I appear house and crate trained and have had ZERO accidents in my foster home! I also sleep quietly in my crate at night. Sometimes I bark for a minute or two when I first go into my crate but I settle down quickly if you just leave me be. 
Iâm very food motivated which means I can learn new things pretty quickly as long as youâre offering a treat! So far Iâve mastered âsitâ and âdownâ! My foster parents say Iâm pretty smart!
If you have room in your life for a fun little adventure buddy, Iâd love to meet you!

Note:  I am heartworm positive, so that means I need to have low activity until my treatment and 30 days of low activity after my treatment.  I can still be adopted though!

name: Trixie
description:
I'm a fun girl. I Iike to run zoomies in the house and jump up and cuddle with you! I like kisses, belly rubs and all the pets! I'm very food motivated. Can you believe I was a stray and no one came looking for me! 

Note: I do have a condition called âcherry eyeâ. Cherry eye is a disorder of the nictitating membrane (NM), also called the third eyelid. Cherry eye is most often seen in young dogs under the age of two. In many species, the third eyelid plays an essential role in vision by supplying oxygen and nutrients to the eye via tear production. If left untreated, tear production may stop. This can be treated with a simple surgery.  She's getting that surgery on 9/17 along with her spay as well.

name: Chloie & her Notes (Mom)
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs6957

Hi there! My name is Chloie and I LOVE to run-run-run at full speed around my fenced-in yard, chase tennis balls, then curl up and be a couch potato. Makes sense since I am three years young. Im a beautiful shepherd mix and 57 pounds. My four puppies were adopted, so I am now looking for my very own forever home. Maybe its with you?

My foster mom says I am a good girl. I love to play with my toys and with my foster mom's personal dog. I love walks. I can be your walking buddy. My foster mom says I prance and jump like a deer. She says she loves everything about me. I may bark when in a new environment or if I know youre making my dinner -- because I'm excited and hungry -- but other than that, Im usually a quiet girl. I do best with slow introductions to other dogs and strangers. I would flourish with an experienced or patient dog owner who can continue to help me learn commands.

I have a guardian angel that thinks I am very special and has sponsored me.

Im just a real sweetheart who wants to love and be loved. Come meet me!
To adopt this dog, or any OPH dog, fill out the simple online application at https://ophrescue.org 
Operation Paws for Homes, Inc. (OPH) rescues dogs of all breeds and ages from high-kill shelters in NC, VA, MD, and SC, reducing the numbers being euthanized. With limited resources, the shelters are forced to put down 50-90% of the animals that come in the front door. OPH provides pet adoption services to families located in VA, DC, MD, PA and neighboring states. OPH is a 501(c)(3) organization and is 100% donor funded. OPH does not operate a shelter or have a physical location. We rely on foster families who open their homes to give love and attention to each dog before finding a forever home.

name: Weston
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8096

Hi! My name is Weston, Im guessed to be a one-year-old yellow lab mix, and Im 100% goof ball! I'm a big boy, currently weighing about 70lbs, but I can still be a lap dog! I dont mind being in my crate, but sometimes I dont want to go inside, but some encouragement helps. I go potty outside most of the time and, so far, Ive only had one accident in my fosters home. Im quiet most of the time, except when I hear other dogs barking. I cant help but answer back just to say hi! I LOVE walks and sometimes I get very excited on my walks and pull ahead of my foster hooman, but Im working on my leash manners. Its just that I like to sniff and explore everything and get excited and forget my foster hooman is behind me.

Im smart and energetic, and sometimes my excited energy takes over and I jump up on people or things, but my foster hooman is helping me work on my manners. She says Im a quick learner, especially if treats are involved! Ive even learned to sit when asked, and Im willing to try and learn anything. So far, Ive been good with most dogs, Ive ignored things called chickens while I was on a leash, but I barked at this big thing my foster hooman called a horse. What was that thing?! Everything is so new to me since Ive been out of the shelter, but Im learning!

Im in search of my furever home. Is that with you? If so apply today! I won't be available for long! I cant wait!!!!!!
To adopt this dog, or any OPH dog, fill out the simple online application at https://ophrescue.org

name: Daisy B
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs7823

You wont find a more devoted heart than Daisy's. She is an affectionate, sweet, loving girl who can be a little on the shy side. Once she knows you, though, you are friends for life. Daisy is looking for someone who wants a best, best, best friend. After a rough start in life, she has come such a long way and is looking for a patient person to give her the life she deserves. 

Daisy is about five years young, with a playful spirit and a happy smile. In her current foster home, she is crate trained and housebroken. She enjoys chew toys but is good about not chewing the things she shouldnt. She loves to go for walks and is learning simple commands like 'sit.' Sometimes when her favorite people come home, she is so happy she has the 'zoomies'! She has deep, thoughtful eyes and weighs about 50 pounds. She does great in a fenced yard and enjoys being outdoors.

Click here and here to see Daisy retrieving treats. 

 Click here and here to see Daisy interacting with others.

name: Chubbers
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8373

Looking for a best four legged friend and faithful companion? Then meet Chubbers, the Corgi/Chihuahua mix! Hes about 6 years old and only 15 pounds so he is very portable and can go most anywhere with you. This shy guy came to OPH on 7/3/19 after some time at an overcrowded shelter in VA, where he was scared, but willing to be handled and enjoyed the attention he received from his OPH rescuer. Chubbers is doing really well in his foster home. He has peacefully coexisted with the dogs he has met so far in his foster home. He likes walks and sure enjoys just hanging with his people. He needs slow introductions to new people to allow him to properly get to know visitors and greet them nicely. His foster says he has nice house manners. Does he sound like the perfect pup for you? If so, please apply to adopt this sweet boy today!

name: Fritos
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs7865

\"Under your scars I pray you're like a shooting star in the rain. You're everything that feels like home to me.\" From the song \"Scars\" by Godsmack

We all have scars, some just can't be seen. While Fritos has some scars of a possible rough life, she lives up to her original name of Sunshine. 

Are you looking for a dog who: 
* Will love you unconditionally until the very end? 
* Loves to be outside playing ball, going for walks, car rides, maybe runs or possibly a frisbee partner? 
* Will keep your yard critter free? 
* Comes pre-loaded with a billion kisses? 
* Is pre-trained for belly rubs? 
* Enjoys learning new tricks? 
* Can be self-entertained with toys and bones? 
* Is already house and crate trained?

If so, then I am the PERFECT girl for you!!! If you want to take me to training, that would be fantastic! After a proper introduction, I'm doing fantastic with the 3 other dogs in my foster home (see pictures and video). I love being loved on, petted and receive ear scratches. I am willing to please in exchange for a loving home. Will that be with you? Come on, let's love life together scars and all!

Click here, here, and here to see me in action with OPH Rescue!

description:

Hi! My name is Bela! I'm a HOUSETRAINED female boxer mix, around 3 years old, and weight about 50lbs. I'm playful, affectionate, and crate trained. I love to cuddle on your lap and play with my toys. I get along great with my home companions including Patch, another foster dog you can find right here on this website! I do need a slow introduction to new dogs and people. I cannot live in a home with cats. While outside I'm usually quiet unless I see the neighbors and want to say hi! I respect my fence and can be left alone, loose in my foster's house with no worries! Meeting new people and other animals makes me get scared so I should be crated (which I go into very nicely) before visitors arrive. name: Voltorb
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs7968

I want to be the very best, like no one ever was. Its you and me, I know its my destiny 
Hi, My name is Voltorb, but you can call me Max! The vets estimate my age to be about 3 years old and I weigh 38lbs! My guessed breed is a Shepherd Inu mix. My foster Mom says that I enjoy a good cuddling and getting my tummy rubbed on the couch! Shes right, its the best! 

This is what my foster Mom has to say about me in my foster home: 
- I appear to be housebroken 
- Does well with respectful kids 
- Likes to explore, a sniffari walk is the greatest! 
- Gets along with most dogs that hes met, but would prefer to be your only pup. 
- Loves to give kisses 
- Gets along with the kitties in the foster home 

I am a happy pup that always has a smile on my face! My foster Momma loves my ears, because one goes up and the other one goes down. My perfect paw-rents would give me yummy treats and play ball with me. I hope you like a bed partner, because even though I am good in my crate, Id love to be in bed with you! I recently had Medical Patellar Luxation (MPL) Surgery! The wonderful vet who did my surgery said I am finally ready to find my forever home! I can do everything a dog can do: take walks, go for power walks and even play fetch now! 
So if you are looking for a great dog, Come with me, the time is right, there will be no better team! 
Apply to adopt me today!

name: Mia Desi Dog
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8261

Say hello to Mia, a nine-month-old, 30-pound female Desi dog (a local term for street dog) from India. Mia has quite a rescue story her mom, Furry, was living on the streets of New Delhi with Mia and her three siblings when they were very young, but their mother was unable to feed them due to illness. Mom and pups were taken into Kannan Animal Welfare, a rescue group in New Delhi, and brought back to health. Furry has already been adopted here in the US, and now Mia is the first of her puppies to come in search of a home! 

Because Mia grew up in a rescue facility, life in a home is very new for her. That being said, theres plenty about it she loves! Walks, couches, grassy open spaces, and toys (even sticks will do!), have all been big hits. When Mia is comfortable she is a funny, happy, and athletic girl whos happy to spend a few minutes wrestling or racing with the other dogs in her foster home, and then a few more minutes snuggling with her foster mom. 

Mia thrives on routine and attaches very deeply to her household members. Although she would benefit from ongoing exposure to new situations and people, she would probably be happiest in a low-key household with one or two people, who can help her develop a sense of security and confidence. Those people will find in Mia a dog who is endlessly entertaining, unbelievably charming, and absolutely devoted! 

Click here to see her in action with OPH Rescue! 
To adopt this dog, or any OPH dog, fill out the simple online application at https://ophrescue.org

name: Aubin
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs5727

Are you looking for a dog who loves the outdoors as much as you do? Someone to walk and hike with, or just to sit on a bench and watch the world go by? If so, beautiful tri-colored Aubin (aka Luna) would like to be your companion! Aubin is a 4 year old lab/beagle mix, about 52 lb, knows basic commands, and is housebroken. 

Aubin is looking for a home without small children, as her play can be too exuberant for them. She is ready to share her life with people who would show her love, and give her structure, to help her to be the best dog possible. Ideally, Aubin would like to be the only dog in the family. Getting to know other dogs could be exhausting and stressful, and Aubin would love to have humans who understand that. 

Aubin is very sweet and affectionate. She will happily let you pet her all day long. She thinks she is a lap dog. She will look up at you when you pet her, as if to say, \"Hey, thanks, that feels good!\" Aubin has been reported great walking on the leash, and an excellent car passenger. 

Does this girl check all of the boxes for you? If so, she would be a great match for you - apply to meet this beauty today!

name: Bowie
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8094

Im Bowie! I am estimated to be a 6-year-old Catahoula Leopard Dog mix. Im a big boy, weighing about 75 lbs and I came to OPH from South Carolina, so Im a southern gentleman. Howdy-do!

My foster mom thinks Im awesome! She says Im crate-trained, I havent had a single accident in my foster home, and I only bark when the other dogs in my foster home bark to welcome someone home. I sometimes talk and sing when my food is being prepared, because I love mealtime! I also get very excited about going out and I spring about 3 feet straight up off the ground when its time to go! I am a strong boy, so I get walked on an easy-walk harness, which works well for me. My foster mom says Im smart to avoid obstacles and not get my leash tangled around them. Yay, me!

I am a people dog, so I love to be with my foster family and getting attention. I can get nervous and anxious around other dogs, so I would probably do best in a home as an only dog, but I think I would do well in almost any environment: apartment, townhouse, single-family home. As long as I can be part of the family and show my devotion, I will be a happy boy.

Come meet me!
To adopt this dog, or any OPH dog, fill out the simple online application at https://ophrescue.org

name: Yoyoma
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs6036

****Yoyoma is a deserving dog that is eligible for an extended trial adoption. We know how special she is and want to give adopters the chance to get to know this wonderful dog that we have come to know and love!****

I'm Yoyoma! Aren't I a beautiful girl? I'm about 4 years old, 50 pounds, and appear to be an American Bulldog mix. My foster family loves my sweet disposition and my tail -- it's always wagging! I love to play and I also love to snuggle up with people. I appear to be house trained and crate trained. I know some basic obedience and thrive on routines, so I can be my best dog self if my new family continues these practices with me. I am ready, willing, and able to be your best friend.

name: Flannery O'Connor
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs7491

Flannery is 2 years old and weighs about 30 lbs with a look and a personality like a min-pin. She is an energetic, busy girl who LOVES to go for lots of walks and would likely even be a nice running buddy. She is smart and curious and will thrive on challenges. She just completed an Intro to Agility class and was a SUPERSTAR! With more training, she could be a serious competitor. She has mastered the tunnel, A-frame, hoop, and can jump anything you put in front of her. She has also been introduced to the teeter and the dog walk. Flannery will fetch anything - balls, frisbees, toys, even rocks!

Her funny personality, keeps us all chuckling. She loves to play with toys and when no one is available to play with, she will just toss toys to herself! Flannery is also a first-class snuggler and a Phillies fan.

Like her namesake, Flannery is a spunky southern girl. She will need an adopter who has some dog experience. That steller brain of hers could easily take over the show. She will do best in a home without children, while she adores children, she has a tendency to nip grabby hands. She gets along fine with other dogs, does fine with cats, has great recall off-leash, and is housebroken and crate-trained. She is smart, willing, intense, athletic, and speedy. While Flannery can be a quirky dog, she is also a sweetheart who will keep you entertained and adored for years to come. Looking for a best, best, best friend? Look no further.

Check out Flannery on video here! 
To adopt this dog, or any OPH dog, fill out the simple online application at https://ophrescue.org

name: Fala Roosevelt
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs7643

Hi! My name is Fala Roosevelt AKA Pepperment or Pepper for short. You can name me anything when I become yours. 

Click here to see me having fun with bubbles in my foster home.

Are you an avid runner? Because I am so young and LOVE to run, I am happy to go with you for long runs! I would be just as happy hiking, walking or playing in the back yard too. Since Im about 1 year young, at that young age, we do have a lot of energy but that will likely taper off as I get older. I am a hound/boxer mix. Im a sweet girl weighing in currently at 51lbs. 

Im house broken and I know basic commands like sit and wait, I also do really well in my crate when no one is home.. I play great with other doggy friends but would probably do best in a home without feline companions or kids under 12 as I can be overwhelming and dont really understand boundaries.

Do you go for lots of trips or want a dog to take everywhere with you? Great news, Im the dog for you! I love car rides!I play great at the dog park and love to get out there and run around. I would prefer to go to a home without small children as I can get overwhelmed by them. Please dont let that deter you though, I really am a sweet, amazing girl! 

Apply to set up a meet and greet!

name: Weston
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8096

Hi! My name is Weston, Im guessed to be a one-year-old yellow lab mix, and Im 100% goof ball! I'm a big boy, currently weighing about 70lbs, but I can still be a lap dog! I dont mind being in my crate, but sometimes I dont want to go inside, but some encouragement helps. I go potty outside most of the time and, so far, Ive only had one accident in my fosters home. Im quiet most of the time, except when I hear other dogs barking. I cant help but answer back just to say hi! I LOVE walks and sometimes I get very excited on my walks and pull ahead of my foster hooman, but Im working on my leash manners. Its just that I like to sniff and explore everything and get excited and forget my foster hooman is behind me.

Im smart and energetic, and sometimes my excited energy takes over and I jump up on people or things, but my foster hooman is helping me work on my manners. She says Im a quick learner, especially if treats are involved! Ive even learned to sit when asked, and Im willing to try and learn anything. So far, Ive been good with most dogs, Ive ignored things called chickens while I was on a leash, but I barked at this big thing my foster hooman called a horse. What was that thing?! Everything is so new to me since Ive been out of the shelter, but Im learning!

Im in search of my furever home. Is that with you? If so apply today! I won't be available for long! I cant wait!!!!!!
To adopt this dog, or any OPH dog, fill out the simple online application at https://ophrescue.org

name: Kalei
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs4588

My name is Kalei! I am a super-social, adorable 3-year old Labrador/Terrier mix and weigh an athletic 45 lbs. 

I have a guardian angel that thinks I am very special and has sponsored me. 

I love to make friends with humans and dogs everywhere I go. Ive been around kids and cats at the dog sitters house and I like them too. I love to go for walks and run, and Im also happy to do yoga with you or coach you through your workout. I know how to snuggle and relax too! If invited, I will curl up with you at night and while watching TV, but I dont usually get on furniture on my own. 

I am a great model! I would love my own Instagram. I happily wear clothes and I love toys. My foster says I have personality for days and I will steal your soul with her eyes! 
I check all the boxes, but need one accommodation. I cannot be crated. I am doing really well in a home with a fenced back yard and doggie door, and am looking for a home with those features so I can let myself out to go potty when youre not home. 

I am spayed and have had my vaccinations and preventatives! Apply to adopt me today!

name: Harry Pawter
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8416

Hi, my name is Harry Pawter! Im part of the Punny Names transport that came to OPH on 7/26/19. I am about 1 or 2 years old and I currently weigh 15 pounds. I am thought to be a Chihuahua mix with possibly some Beagle.

I am a timid dog, but I am very loving. My favorite things to do are snuggle on the couch and play in the yard. I also enjoy playing with other dogs as long as they dont play too rough. Ideally, I would like a home where I will be treated gently with lots of love.

I know some basic manners, but I still have a lot to learn. I am still working on potty training, but Im learning fast. At my foster home, I dont bark or jump often unless I get really excited.

I get scared when I hear loud sounds or see fast movements, but it will just take some time for me to get used to these things in a new home. A little reassurance is something Ill need from my new family members to help me get comfortable. I know the right family will come along and give me the love and patience I need!

I am currently living in a foster home in King William, VA. Please visit me if youre interested in adopting!

name: Gala
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs6024

My name is Gala and I am 3 years old and 50 lbs. You can see me enjoying rescue life in my foster home by clicking here!

I am looking for a caring and compassionate home that will help build my confidence. Once I get to know you, I will want to be by your side. I love that my foster family is home with me a lot. But I do okay when they go to work. I like most people, but not so much other dogs.

At my foster home:
* I am well-mannered and energetic.
* I am housebroken.
* I give kisses and like to cuddle.
* I love to be outdoors; I really need a fenced yard.
* I walk well on a leash and could possibly be a running partner. Click here to see me in action!
* I am crate trained, but I would prefer to sleep with you.
* I like to go for car rides.
* I do best as the only dog.

If you think you have the time and patience for a loving girl like me, please apply now!

name: Titanic
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8424

Hi! My name is Titanic and Im part of the Blockbuster Movie transport that arrived to OPH 8-9-19

My foster mom calls me Ginger, Im guessed to be a Chi-weenie Mix and estimated to be about 2 years old. Im a sweet girl and I currently weigh about 15 lbs.
Im mostly housetrained, but I still have accidents in the house if I dont have a pad to go on. I get scared when it rains or storms and I just cant help myself, but foster mom is working with me to get over my fears and stop having accidents.

I am crate trained! In fact I love my crate! I only bark in the crate after I hear the humans are awake in the morning and Im ready for my breakfast.
I LOVE to snuggle with my humans, nothing is better than a human lap to lay on and get infinite pets.
I also love to play with my foster sibling Zoya. I dont play with other dogs in the dog park yet, just my sister, but she is showing me that other dogs can be fun too. Shes so outgoing and playful with the other dogs, I hope I can be like her one day but right now Im just not so sure about all these other dogs. Im okay with them sniffing me but Im not quite ready to play with dogs I dont know well.

I walk really well on a leash, and Im so good at recall that my foster mom sometimes drops my leash and lets me walk freely and I stay near her all the time and always come running when she calls me.

If you are looking for a cute sweet little dog that will love you more than anything and sit on your lap all day long Im the girl for you!!!

Apply to adopt me today, I wont be around for long!

name: Patch- 101 Dalmatians
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8255

Hi! My name is Patch and I'm a beautiful 10 month old female Lab Mix. I currently weight about 50lbs. My foster mommy believes I may be HOUSETRAINED! I'm very affectionate and playful.
I have a shiny black coat and pretty face. I like playing with my stuffed toys, running around in the yard, or just laying under a tree chewing on a bone. My energy level may be just what you need for a running buddy! I don't jump up on people and try very hard to do what I'm told. I'm well behaved in my yard and house as long as I am supervised. I'm doing very well responding to verbal commands. I've learned how to use my underground electric fence as well as learning to respect the above ground fence. Everyday I'm getting better with house manners and respecting my doggy playmates. I play very well with my fostered buddy Bela, who you can find on this website! At my first adoption event I was very well behaved while meeting new people and dogs. I played very nicely with large dogs and a very small dog while supervised. 
Click here and here to see me in action with OPH Rescue!
I hope to find my forever family soon. Could that be you?

This dog tested positive for Lyme before arriving to the rescue. Lymes is a very common type of bacteria that infects dogs and other species and is spread by ticks. Lymes is not contagious to humans or other pets. The only way to get this disease is to be bitten by a tick that carries it. The treatment is typically 21-30 days of antibiotics. This dog started treatment upon arriving to the rescue. 
To adopt this dog, or any OPH dog, fill out the simple online application at https://ophrescue.org

name: Daisy B
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs7823

You wont find a more devoted heart than Daisy's. She is an affectionate, sweet, loving girl who can be a little on the shy side. Once she knows you, though, you are friends for life. Daisy is looking for someone who wants a best, best, best friend. After a rough start in life, she has come such a long way and is looking for a patient person to give her the life she deserves. 

Daisy is about five years young, with a playful spirit and a happy smile. In her current foster home, she is crate trained and housebroken. She enjoys chew toys but is good about not chewing the things she shouldnt. She loves to go for walks and is learning simple commands like 'sit.' Sometimes when her favorite people come home, she is so happy she has the 'zoomies'! She has deep, thoughtful eyes and weighs about 50 pounds. She does great in a fenced yard and enjoys being outdoors.

Click here and here to see Daisy retrieving treats. 

 Click here and here to see Daisy interacting with others.

I am a strong boy, so I get walked on an easy-walk harness, which works well for me. My foster mom says Im smart to avoid obstacles and not get my leash tangled around them. Yay, me!

I am a people dog, so I love to be with my foster family and getting attention. I can get nervous and anxious around other dogs, so I would probably do best in a home as an only dog, but I think I would do well in almost any environment: apartment, townhouse, single-family home. As long as I can be part of the family and show my devotion, I will be a happy boy.

Come meet me!

name: Incredible Hulk
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8457

Hi!
My name is Incredible Hulk and Im part of the Blockbuster Movie transport coming to OPH 8-23-19.

Im an adorable Chihuahua mix about 2 years old. Im a sweet boy and I currently weigh about 12 lbs. My foster mommy says I am the sweetest and best cuddler shes fostered in a long time and that I am a \"keeper\" whatever that means.

I am a happy go lucky kinda guy, I love hanging out and playing with foster mommy's dogs and exploring her yard.

I am a Southern gentleman and a perfect houseguest! I am crate and house trained and a pretty quiet and mellow guy. Once I get these yucky heartworms taken care of, I'll be free to go to my forever home.

I recently made my way north in search of my new family. Is that with you! If so apply today! I wont be available long!

Watch videos of me here
Schnapps and Hulk
so happy together
catwalk

* potty, house, and crate trained. Perfect dog for 1st time dog owner! Turn key dog!
* energy level: low to medium
* friendly, loves dogs and people
* very affectionate, loves to snuggle and be held
* great with kids who are gentle
* excellent size for apartment or single family home
* neutered and up to date on all vaccines

This dog tested positive for heartworm disease before arriving to the rescue. Heartworm disease is transmitted to a dog through a bite from an infected mosquito producing a positive test in six months. OPH will treat the dog and provide two weeks of recovery time prior to adoption. name: Zekke
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8390

Look into my eyes....you will be hypnotized by my charm!

Hello, my name is Zekke! I am six months old and estimated to be a husky mix. I arrived at my foster familys house after a super fun flight all the way from NC. Have you been on a plane ride? It was sure fun.

I've been hanging out with my foster family for a few weeks now and while its fun here, I would sure like to find my forever family as well. Below are some fun things my family wants you to know about me.

- I am crate trained. Im quiet in my crate and sleep the night away and know to keep it nice and tidy with my toys. Can't ask for more than that can you?
- I have kept my crate clean and dry. (If I bark in my crate its because I have to go out)
- I appear to be housebroken but foster Mom says accidents can happen in a new environment. Don't worry, we will both be learning when I come home with you but we will both quickly know how to talk to each other. 
- Ive just about mastered this whole leash walking thing. It was brand new to me when I arrived but I like to take walks so I'm learning how to walk like a good boy mom says. I still get excited sometimes and get tangled in foster mom's legs but we are working through it.
- Im learning other fun things too. I LOVE treats so teaching me things is pretty easy. Ive mastered sit & lay down and am trying REALLY HARD on stay (that one is tough, I like to be with mom when we are outside (she hides cookies in her pockets for me, how can I resist that)) 
 - I appear to be a roll with the punches type of pup. Ive liked everyone, 2 and 4 legged that Ive met so far. 
- Foster Mom says I am one of the easiest fosters they have had. I am quiet, keep the place clean and follow the rules. I think she likes me. :)
- I would do best in a home with older kids (over 12) until I settle down a bit more. Im pretty mouthy still, just like most teenagers. I am working on keeping this under control and am getting better each day. These foster family people don't take any back talk from me about this, they are tough. Mom says my forever people will have to continue to be tough and remind me about this until I fully outgrow it.
- I would be a great hiking or running partner with a little training. Mom & I are doing a bit of running and I LOVE IT! The foster kids started school so we have been super busy and unable to hike but we have talked about it and I'm pretty sure I would like that as well. I love to be busy.
- TOYS! I have discovered TOYS and love them. I am getting pretty good with fetch (I will bring the ball back most of the time, sometimes I get distracted) and love soft toys that make noise. Foster mom told me not to destroy them and I'm doing really good with it. I really am enjoying the toy box here. I like to take one outside each time we go. Silly foster mom picks them all up and brings back inside at bedtime every night for me to start again in the morning.
- I met cats, chickens, turkeys and pigs and am happy to report that I did not bother any of them or care about them.
- two new things we have discovered this week. I like to swim and I liked being in arlington for an event. 

Do you like my new pictures? I went to an event and there was a nice guy named Drew there who took them. I think I look pretty handsome (even if it was 100 degrees that day...whew!)

Anyway, Ill be hanging out in Nokesville, VA. I am able to go home with you as soon as you are approved to adopt. My foster family says someone is going to be very lucky to have me. 
To adopt this dog, or any OPH dog, fill out the simple online application at https://ophrescue.org

name: Mia Desi Dog
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8261

Say hello to Mia, a nine-month-old, 30-pound female Desi dog (a local term for street dog) from India. Mia has quite a rescue story her mom, Furry, was living on the streets of New Delhi with Mia and her three siblings when they were very young, but their mother was unable to feed them due to illness. Mom and pups were taken into Kannan Animal Welfare, a rescue group in New Delhi, and brought back to health. Furry has already been adopted here in the US, and now Mia is the first of her puppies to come in search of a home! 

Because Mia grew up in a rescue facility, life in a home is very new for her. That being said, theres plenty about it she loves! Walks, couches, grassy open spaces, and toys (even sticks will do!), have all been big hits. When Mia is comfortable she is a funny, happy, and athletic girl whos happy to spend a few minutes wrestling or racing with the other dogs in her foster home, and then a few more minutes snuggling with her foster mom. 

Mia thrives on routine and attaches very deeply to her household members. Although she would benefit from ongoing exposure to new situations and people, she would probably be happiest in a low-key household with one or two people, who can help her develop a sense of security and confidence. Those people will find in Mia a dog who is endlessly entertaining, unbelievably charming, and absolutely devoted! 

Click here to see her in action with OPH Rescue! 
To adopt this dog, or any OPH dog, fill out the simple online application at https://ophrescue.org

name: Will Forte
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8330

Hi! My name is Will Forte. 

Im a Beagle mix and estimated to be about 1 years old. Im a sweet boy and I currently weigh about 32 lbs. I came to OPH from a shelter in South Carolina. I love it here with my foster family and have been hanging out, getting treated for heartworms (they are yucky) and learning new tricks. I've finished my heartworm treatment (yay!) and am ready to find my forever family. 

Some things about me:
* I LOVE treats. What's that mean to you? It means that I am very trainable to tag along with you during your daily travels and can likely learn lots of fun tricks with you.
* I LOVE to play ball. Hopefully you will too. It helps get my energy out as well so we can watch TV later. 
* I LOVE to get my zoomies out outside. My foster family has told me that's where we do this and we play nice inside and try not to run too much. 
* Do you like to explore? Hey, I do too! Let's go on hikes together and explore all that's out there in Virginia and beyond. 
* AHHH...my crate. It's my quiet and calm time and I don't mind it one bit. It's a pretty great place to nap. 
* I like everyone in my foster family so I'm sure I will like you too! They have older kids and I love being around them. 
* I hope you have some toys or that we can get some. I love to play with them. Wanna go to the pet store and pick some out?
* Here's the best part, are you ready? I have not had any accidents in my foster familys house. My mom says I may need a day to adjust to your house but shes assured me that I will quickly know your routine as well and not have any accidents there too.

I'm a super happy boy, my tail is always wagging. Let's find a time for you to meet me and see what a fun little guy I can be. There are some neat video's featuring none other than me below so you can see me in action. (I'm famous you know, I have my own videos and everything)


Click here and here to see me in action with OPH! 

Click here to see me playing with a foster friend. 

I'll be here hanging out with my foster family in Oakton, VA. Ask my foster mom for directions, she will be happy to share them with you. Don't wait! I'll be snatched up soon she says. 

This dog tested positive for heartworm disease before arriving to the rescue. The disease was treated while in foster care. Heartworm disease is transmitted to a dog through a bite from an infected mosquito. With monthly preventatives, the disease is completely preventable. name: Mera
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8444

Hi! My name is Mera and Im part of the Blockbuster Movie transport that arrived to OPH.

Im guessed to be a Terrier mix and estimated to be about 5 - 6 months old and about 30 lbs. I'm very sweet, timid at first but once I know you, super duper lovable and a velcro dog! Where you are is where I want to be. I love attention and affection and I'm very playful with my foster fur brother. I like all dogs, big and small and I''m a pretty gentle playmate. I like an occasional walk , and I enjoy sunning or sniffing around in the back yard. I'm still a little cautious with things I don't know and people I don't know, but I'm a happy pup. I'm VERY quiet (rarely bark) and I have a beautiful sleek, short, coat of fur. My foster Mom says if you are looking for loving little doggie with a personality that is blooming more and more every day, I'm your girl!!


Click here and here to see me in my foster home.

Apply today! I wont be available long.

name: Chubbers
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8373

Looking for a best four legged friend and faithful companion? Then meet Chubbers, the Corgi/Chihuahua mix! Hes about 6 years old and only 15 pounds so he is very portable and can go most anywhere with you. This shy guy came to OPH on 7/3/19 after some time at an overcrowded shelter in VA, where he was scared, but willing to be handled and enjoyed the attention he received from his OPH rescuer. Chubbers is doing really well in his foster home. He has peacefully coexisted with the dogs he has met so far in his foster home. He likes walks and sure enjoys just hanging with his people. He needs slow introductions to new people to allow him to properly get to know visitors and greet them nicely. His foster says he has nice house manners. Does he sound like the perfect pup for you? If so, please apply to adopt this sweet boy today!

description:

****Yoyoma is a deserving dog that is eligible for an extended trial adoption. We know how special she is and want to give adopters the chance to get to know this wonderful dog that we have come to know and love!****

I'm Yoyoma! Aren't I a beautiful girl? I'm about 4 years old, 50 pounds, and appear to be an American Bulldog mix. My foster family loves my sweet disposition and my tail -- it's always wagging! I love to play and I also love to snuggle up with people. I appear to be house trained and crate trained. description:

Hello! My name is Summertime, Im guessed to be a 2 year old and I currently weigh 67 lbs. I am told I'm very sweet and have a beautiful fluffy coat that is typical of Great Pyrenees. 

I would be great as an only dog. I know a few basic commands and am looking for a family who will adore me. I enjoy the country life and would love a big fenced yard to run and play in. Click here to see how much I love the outdoors!

name: Chloie & her Notes (Mom)
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs6957

Hi there! My name is Chloie and I LOVE to run-run-run at full speed around my fenced-in yard, chase tennis balls, then curl up and be a couch potato. Makes sense since I am three years young. Im a beautiful shepherd mix and 57 pounds. My four puppies were adopted, so I am now looking for my very own forever home. Maybe its with you?

My foster mom says I am a good girl. I love to play with my toys and with my foster mom's personal dog. I love walks. I can be your walking buddy. My foster mom says I prance and jump like a deer. She says she loves everything about me. I may bark when in a new environment or if I know youre making my dinner -- because I'm excited and hungry -- but other than that, Im usually a quiet girl. I do best with slow introductions to other dogs and strangers. I would flourish with an experienced or patient dog owner who can continue to help me learn commands.

I have a guardian angel that thinks I am very special and has sponsored me.

Im just a real sweetheart who wants to love and be loved. Come meet me!

name: Zekke
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8390

Look into my eyes....you will be hypnotized by my charm!

Hello, my name is Zekke! I am seven months old and estimated to be a husky/white shepherd mix. I arrived at my foster familys house after a super fun flight all the way from NC. Have you been on a plane ride? It was sure fun.

I've been hanging out with my foster family for a few weeks now and while its fun here, I would sure like to find my forever family as well. Below are some fun things my family wants you to know about me.

- I am crate trained. Im quiet in my crate and sleep the night away and know to keep it nice and tidy with my toys. Can't ask for more than that can you?
- I have kept my crate clean and dry. (If I bark in my crate its because I have to go out)
- I appear to be housebroken but foster Mom says accidents can happen in a new environment. Don't worry, we will both be learning when I come home with you but we will both quickly know how to talk to each other. 
- Ive just about mastered this whole leash walking thing. It was brand new to me when I arrived but I like to take walks so I'm learning how to walk like a good boy mom says. I still get excited sometimes and get tangled in foster mom's legs but we are working through it. *** UPDATE *** Zekke has this down. Has recently been out on a busy street and was perfect on the leash with his foster family and with others.
- Im learning other fun things too. I LOVE treats so teaching me things is pretty easy. Ive mastered sit & lay down and am trying REALLY HARD on stay (that one is tough, I like to be with mom when we are outside (she hides cookies in her pockets for me, how can I resist that)) 
 - I appear to be a roll with the punches type of pup. Ive liked everyone, 2 and 4 legged that Ive met so far. 
- Foster Mom says I am one of the easiest fosters they have had. I am quiet, keep the place clean and follow the rules. I think she likes me. :)
- I would do best in a home with older kids (over 12) until I settle down a bit more. Im pretty mouthy still, just like most teenagers. I am working on keeping this under control and am getting better each day. These foster family people don't take any back talk from me about this, they are tough. Mom says my forever people will have to continue to be tough and remind me about this until I fully outgrow it. *** UPDATE ***: Zekke has really gotten this under control. He has recently met children as young as 1 and did really well with them. He seems to understand they are small and to be gentle with them.
- I would be a great hiking or running partner with a little training. Mom & I are doing a bit of running and I LOVE IT! The foster kids started school so we have been super busy and unable to hike but we have talked about it and I'm pretty sure I would like that as well. I love to be busy.
- TOYS! I have discovered TOYS and love them. I am getting pretty good with fetch (I will bring the ball back most of the time, sometimes I get distracted) and love soft toys that make noise. Foster mom told me not to destroy them and I'm doing really good with it. I really am enjoying the toy box here. I like to take one outside each time we go. Silly foster mom picks them all up and brings back inside at bedtime every night for me to start again in the morning.
- I met cats, chickens, turkeys and pigs and am happy to report that I did not bother any of them or care about them.
- two new things we have discovered this week. I like to swim and I liked being in Arlington for an event. 
- I am super dog friendly. Honestly, I have not met another dog that I have not gotten along with.

Do you like my new pictures? I went to an event and there was a nice guy named Drew there who took them. I think I look pretty handsome (even if it was 100 degrees that day...whew!)

Anyway, Ill be hanging out in Nokesville, VA. I am able to go home with you as soon as you are approved to adopt. My foster family says someone is going to be very lucky to have me.

name: Titanic
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8424

Hi! My name is Titanic and Im part of the Blockbuster Movie transport that arrived to OPH 8-9-19

My foster mom calls me Ginger, Im guessed to be a Chi-weenie Mix and estimated to be about 2 years old. Im a sweet girl and I currently weigh about 15 lbs.
Im housetrained and crate trained! In fact I love my crate! I only bark in the crate after I hear the humans are awake in the morning and Im ready for my breakfast.
I LOVE to snuggle with my humans, nothing is better than a human lap to lay on and get infinite pets.
I also love to play with my foster sibling Zoya. I dont play with other dogs in the dog park yet, just my sister, but she is showing me that other dogs can be fun too.

I walk really well on a leash, and Im so good at recall that my foster mom sometimes drops my leash and lets me walk freely and I stay near her the whole time and always come running when she calls me.

If you are looking for a cute sweet little dog that will love you more than anything and sit on your lap all day long Im the girl for you!!!

Apply to adopt me today, I wont be around for long!

name: Captain Marvel
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8420

Hi! My name is Captain Marvel and Im part of the Blockbuster Movie crew! Im guessed to be a 4 year old, Black and Tan Coonhound mix. Im a sweet girl who LOVES people. I love all of the wonderful people I have met since arriving to OPH. I've never met a stranger! 

My big ears are just a part of my charm. I'm a happy-go-lucky goofy girl. Hounds are just like that! My foster home has three other dogs - and one is a hound so we have lots of fun running in the yard and howling as us hounds do!

I currently weigh about 52 lbs. 

Click here to see me in action with OPH Rescue. 

Apply today to set up a meet and greet! I wont be available long.

This dog tested positive for heartworm disease before arriving to the rescue. Heartworm disease is transmitted to a dog through a bite from an infected mosquito producing a positive test in six months. The dog was treated for the disease prior to transport north. Potential adopters will receive detailed information on the disease and their role in completing the recovery process from OPHs heartworm coordinator. With monthly preventatives, the disease is completely preventable. Read more about heartworm disease here here

name: Kirk Cameron
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8364

Hi! My name is Kirk Cameron but some people call me Tiny. Im guessing I am a Chihuahua/Feist dog mix, but I can only guarantee Im 100 percent dog, harf! Im part of the TV sitcom transport that came to OPH 6-28-19. I cant remember my birthday but I think Im about 1 year old. I still have lots of puppy energy in me and I weigh about 20 pounds. My hooman family had to move and said they couldnt take me to their new place, so they took me to the shelter from which OPH rescued me.

I dont REALLY like going into a crate, because Id rather be playing or cuddling, but once Im in it, Im ok with it. The best part about my crate is the part when Im about to get out of it! I get really really excited to get out of my crate. I have lots of energy to burn!Im practicing walking on a leash with my foster hoomans, and Im getting better, I just need more practice, and more walks HARF!!

My foster hooman has been having me potty outside and Im getting use to that, but I still need more practice. I try really hard to be a good boy, but my foster hooman sometimes puts a diaper on me! With structure and routine I think I can get used to this potty training thing!

Sometimes when I get excited I want to jump up onto or into my hoomans arms, but they keep telling me its not pawlite, so I am trying not to do that! I havent barked much, but if I hear other dogs barking I cant help but join in sometimes. Ive been working on being good and learning basic house manners. I know what to do but I get so \"happy\" it is hard for me to follow this whole manners thing. Im trying!!!! So far, I have made friends with all of the hoomans and dogs I have met, but I really like playing with other younger dogs the best!

Im telling you I am sweet and loveable and want to please my hoomans. I am full of energy and I love to play. When I have my one on one time with a hooman, I can calm right down for some cuddles and love!I have made my way North in search of my new hooman or family. Is that you???! If so, make sure you apply today!! I wont be available long because Im such a sweet pup!

**I will be at the Richmond Dog Festival Event in Richmond, VA on 9/21/19 from 11am to 4pm at Chimborazo Park 3215 E. Broad St. Richmond, VA 23223 . I would love to meet my furever family so come by and meet me this weekend !

name: Harry Pawter
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8416

Hi, my name is Harry Pawter! Im part of the Punny Names transport that came to OPH on 7/26/19. I am about 1 or 2 years old and I currently weigh 15 pounds. I am thought to be a Chihuahua mix with possibly some Beagle.

I am a timid dog, but I am very loving. My favorite things to do are snuggle on the couch and play in the yard. I also enjoy playing with other dogs as long as they dont play too rough. Ideally, I would like a home where I will be treated gently with lots of love.

I know some basic manners, but I still have a lot to learn. I am still working on potty training, but Im learning fast. At my foster home, I dont bark or jump often unless I get really excited.

I get scared when I hear loud sounds or see fast movements, but it will just take some time for me to get used to these things in a new home. A little reassurance is something Ill need from my new family members to help me get comfortable. I know the right family will come along and give me the love and patience I need!

I am currently living in a foster home in King William, VA. Please visit me if youre interested in adopting!

**I will be at the Richmond Dog Festival Event in Richmond, VA on 9/21/19 from 11am to 4pm at Chimborazo Park 3215 E. Broad St. Richmond, VA 23223 . I would love to meet my furever family so come by and meet me this weekend !
