name: Mera
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8444

Hi! My name is Mera and Im part of the Blockbuster Movie transport that arrived to OPH.

Im guessed to be a Terrier mix and estimated to be about 5 - 6 months old and about 30 lbs. I'm very sweet, timid at first but once I know you, super duper lovable and a velcro dog! Where you are is where I want to be. I love attention and affection and I'm very playful with my foster fur brother. I like all dogs, big and small and I''m a pretty gentle playmate. I like an occasional walk , and I enjoy sunning or sniffing around in the back yard. I'm still a little cautious with things I don't know and people I don't know, but I'm a happy pup. I'm VERY quiet (rarely bark) and I have a beautiful sleek, short, coat of fur. My foster Mom says if you are looking for loving little doggie with a personality that is blooming more and more every day, I'm your girl!!


Click here and here to see me in my foster home.

Apply today! I wont be available long.

name: Patch- 101 Dalmatians
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8255

Hi! My name is Patch and I'm a beautiful 10 month old female Lab Mix. I currently weight about 50lbs. My foster mommy believes I may be HOUSETRAINED! I'm very affectionate and playful.
I have a shiny black coat and pretty face. I like playing with my stuffed toys, running around in the yard, or just laying under a tree chewing on a bone. My energy level may be just what you need for a running buddy! I don't jump up on people and try very hard to do what I'm told. I'm well behaved in my yard and house as long as I am supervised. I'm doing very well responding to verbal commands. I've learned how to use my underground electric fence as well as learning to respect the above ground fence. Everyday I'm getting better with house manners and respecting my doggy playmates. I play very well with my fostered buddy Bela, who you can find on this website! At my first adoption event I was very well behaved while meeting new people and dogs. I played very nicely with large dogs and a very small dog while supervised. 
Click here and here to see me in action with OPH Rescue!
I hope to find my forever family soon. Could that be you?

This dog tested positive for Lyme before arriving to the rescue. Lymes is a very common type of bacteria that infects dogs and other species and is spread by ticks. Lymes is not contagious to humans or other pets. The only way to get this disease is to be bitten by a tick that carries it. The treatment is typically 21-30 days of antibiotics. This dog started treatment upon arriving to the rescue.

name: Ribeye (Steak House Pups)
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8469

Are you looking for the perfect, smartest little puppy? STOP right here, you found her! Ribeye is the last of the Steak Pups to find her forever home. Her life started out a bit rough, she was surrendered with her siblings who all were undernourished and scared. She made her way to OPH and has grown so much both physically and mentally. She is amazingly smart, already mastering the \"sit\" command, does well in a crate and housebreaking has been a breeze. She wants to love and please her fosters ALL of the time. Ribeye enjoys the company of both her humans and her foster fur siblings. If she is not sitting with her foster mom, she is tumbling on the floor with one if not several of the other dogs in her foster home. 

Ribeye is 3 months old and about 9 pounds. 

Because she is a baby, she will require an adopter who is not out of the home for more than 4 hours at one time to continue her training - no exceptions! She is up-to-date on age appropriate vaccines and will need to be altered at the appropriate age per the spay/neuter agreement you will be signing at the time of adoption.

Please note that because she is so young, she has only received 2 sets of the required 3 sets puppy vaccinations. This is very IMPORTANT because it means that her immune system will not be fully functioning until about 16 weeks of age. She MUST stay out of public places where she could be exposed to the germs of many other dogs for another 6-8 weeks after she goes home. These no puppy zones include all pet stores, dog parks, and for apartment dwellers, areas used by other dogs. These requirements are strictly for the puppys medical safety and longevity.

I am fostered in Parsonsburg, MD and can be adopted as soon as 8/3/19. Apply to adopt me today !


To adopt this dog, or any OPH dog, fill out the simple online application at https://ophrescue.org

name: Mai Tai (Tropicals)
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs7480

Hi! My name is Mai Tai and also known as Honey. I am happy and ready to live life to the limits! I am a young dog- a year plus young and weigh about 42 lbs. I am very loving and affectionate. Can't get enough pets and give enough kisses. And I sure love to play and be outside exploring everything I see and smell. Walks are on my top 5 things that I love!.

 I am trainable and understand commands like sit and stay. To me, I understand that bed is my crate and night, night is bedtime. Boy do I love car rides. I am ready to go whenever and where you want to take me. I do love having all of your attention so perhaps I may be best as an only dog. I am not sure I like cats as friends so perhaps I may be best in a home without them. I would love to have an adopter who wants to play with me and make sure that I get my daily exercise. 

We could have lots of fun bonding as we do those things together. What do you think? Am I the honey sweet dog for your life? If so I would love to meet you!
To adopt this dog, or any OPH dog, fill out the simple online application at https://ophrescue.org

name: Fritos
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs7865

\"Under your scars I pray you're like a shooting star in the rain. You're everything that feels like home to me.\" From the song \"Scars\" by Godsmack

We all have scars, some just can't be seen. While Fritos has some scars of a possible rough life, she lives up to her original name of Sunshine. 

Are you looking for a dog who: 
* Will love you unconditionally until the very end? 
* Loves to be outside playing ball, going for walks, car rides, maybe runs or possibly a frisbee partner? 
* Will keep your yard critter free? 
* Comes pre-loaded with a billion kisses? 
* Is pre-trained for belly rubs? 
* Enjoys learning new tricks? 
* Can be self-entertained with toys and bones? 
* Is already house and crate trained?

If so, then I am the PERFECT girl for you!!! If you want to take me to training, that would be fantastic! After a proper introduction, I'm doing fantastic with the 3 other dogs in my foster home (see pictures and video). I love being loved on, petted and receive ear scratches. I am willing to please in exchange for a loving home. Will that be with you? Come on, let's love life together scars and all!

Click here, here, and here to see me in action with OPH Rescue! 
To adopt this dog, or any OPH dog, fill out the simple online application at https://ophrescue.org

name: Summertime
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8192

Hello! My name is Summertime, Im guessed to be a 2 year old and I currently weigh 67 lbs. I am told I'm very sweet and have a beautiful fluffy coat that is typical of Great Pyrenees. 

I would be great as an only dog. I know a few basic commands and am looking for a family who will adore me. I enjoy the country life and would love a big fenced yard to run and play in. Click here to see how much I love the outdoors! 

Older kids would be my preference too, because I like a quiet relaxed home. I walk nicely on leash and could be *convinced* to go on walks or hikes. I am housebroken, and crate trained....... And my favorite thing is chew toys!

Stay tuned for more updates as the nice people of OPH learn more about me!

name: Voltorb
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs7968

**Voltorb- Max will be attending WAGS N WHISKERS this weekend in Bethesda, MD, come by and see him! https://ophrescue.org/events/1153

I want to be the very best, like no one ever was. Its you and me, I know its my destiny 
Hi, My name is Voltorb, but you can call me Max! The vets estimate my age to be about 3 years old and I weigh 38lbs! My guessed breed is a Shepherd Inu mix. My foster Mom says that I enjoy a good cuddling and getting my tummy rubbed on the couch! Shes right, its the best! 

This is what my foster Mom has to say about me in my foster home: 
- I appear to be housebroken 
- Does well with respectful kids 
- Likes to explore, a sniffari walk is the greatest! 
- Gets along with most dogs that hes met, but would prefer to be your only pup. 
- Loves to give kisses 
- Gets along with the kitties in the foster home 

I am a happy pup that always has a smile on my face! My foster Momma loves my ears, because one goes up and the other one goes down. My perfect paw-rents would give me yummy treats and play ball with me. I hope you like a bed partner, because even though I am good in my crate, Id love to be in bed with you! I recently had Medical Patellar Luxation (MPL) Surgery! The wonderful vet who did my surgery said I am finally ready to find my forever home! I can do everything a dog can do: take walks, go for power walks and even play fetch now! 
So if you are looking for a great dog, Come with me, the time is right, there will be no better team! 
Apply to adopt me today!


To adopt this dog, or any OPH dog, fill out the simple online application at https://ophrescue.org

description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8420

Hi! My name is Captain Marvel and Im part of the Blockbuster Movie crew! Im guessed to be a 4 year old, Black and Tan Coonhound mix. Im a sweet girl who LOVES people. I love all of the wonderful people I have met since arriving to OPH. I've never met a stranger! 

My big ears are just a part of my charm. I'm a happy-go-lucky goofy girl. Hounds are just like that! My foster home has three other dogs - and one is a hound so we have lots of fun running in the yard and howling as us hounds do!

I currently weigh about 52 lbs. 

Click here to see me in action with OPH Rescue. 

Apply today to set up a meet and greet! I wont be available long.

This dog tested positive for heartworm disease before arriving to the rescue. Heartworm disease is transmitted to a dog through a bite from an infected mosquito producing a positive test in six months. The dog was treated for the disease prior to transport north. Potential adopters will receive detailed information on the disease and their role in completing the recovery process from OPHs heartworm coordinator. With monthly preventatives, the disease is completely preventable. Read more about heartworm disease here here
To adopt this dog, or any OPH dog, fill out the simple online application at https://ophrescue.org 
Operation Paws for Homes, Inc. (OPH) rescues dogs of all breeds and ages from high-kill shelters in NC, VA, MD, and SC, reducing the numbers being euthanized. With limited resources, the shelters are forced to put down 50-90% of the animals that come in the front door. OPH provides pet adoption services to families located in VA, DC, MD, PA and neighboring states. OPH is a 501(c)(3) organization and is 100% donor funded. OPH does not operate a shelter or have a physical location. We rely on foster families who open their homes to give love and attention to each dog before finding a forever home.

name: Vera Fang
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8383

Hello my name is Vera Fang and I am apart of OPH's Punny Names Transport. I made my way north to OPH and I'm searching for a home of my own!

I am a female Chi Mix weighing in at 15 lbs. I'm estimated to be between 2-3 years old. 
I am crate trained and haven't had any accidents in my foster home
I am very affectionate and love to cuddle and snuggle
I love to play fetch and have a few favorite treats.
I love to go for walks and run around in my foster's back yard. I don't mind going out to potty even when its raining.
I get along with some dogs but I would like to live in a house where I can be your one and only
I'm a small gal but don't be fooled, I have a big dog voice when I choose to use it!

I am in search of a family to call my own, could that be you?! Please apply to adopt me today !

**I will be at the Richmond Dog Festival Event in Richmond, VA on 9/21/19 from 11am to 4pm at Chimborazo Park 3215 E. Broad St. Richmond, VA 23223 . I would love to meet my furever family so come by and meet me this weekend ! 
To adopt this dog, or any OPH dog, fill out the simple online application at https://ophrescue.org

name: Bela
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs6911

Hi! My name is Bela! I'm a HOUSETRAINED female boxer mix, around 3 years old, and weight about 50lbs. I'm playful, affectionate, and crate trained. I love to cuddle on your lap and play with my toys. I get along great with my home companions including Patch, another foster dog you can find right here on this website! I do need a slow introduction to new dogs and people. I cannot live in a home with cats. While outside I'm usually quiet unless I see the neighbors and want to say hi! I respect my fence and can be left alone, loose in my foster's house with no worries! Meeting new people and other animals makes me get scared so I should be crated (which I go into very nicely) before visitors arrive. My foster mommy says I'm an easy and great dog to have in the family. If you are looking for a new friend like me please apply to adopt me. I've been looking for my forever family. Could it be you?




**I have a guardian angel that thinks I am very special and has sponsored me. **
To adopt this dog, or any OPH dog, fill out the simple online application at https://ophrescue.org

name: Flannery O'Connor
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs7491

Flannery is 2 years old and weighs about 30 lbs with a look and a personality like a min-pin. She is an energetic, busy girl who LOVES to go for lots of walks and would likely even be a nice running buddy. She is smart and curious and will thrive on challenges. She just completed an Intro to Agility class and was a SUPERSTAR! With more training, she could be a serious competitor. She has mastered the tunnel, A-frame, hoop, and can jump anything you put in front of her. She has also been introduced to the teeter and the dog walk. Flannery will fetch anything - balls, frisbees, toys, even rocks!

Her funny personality, keeps us all chuckling. She loves to play with toys and when no one is available to play with, she will just toss toys to herself! Flannery is also a first-class snuggler and a Phillies fan.

Like her namesake, Flannery is a spunky southern girl. She will need an adopter who has some dog experience. That steller brain of hers could easily take over the show. She will do best in a home without children, while she adores children, she has a tendency to nip grabby hands. She gets along fine with other dogs, does fine with cats, has great recall off-leash, and is housebroken and crate-trained. She is smart, willing, intense, athletic, and speedy. While Flannery can be a quirky dog, she is also a sweetheart who will keep you entertained and adored for years to come. Looking for a best, best, best friend? Look no further.

Check out Flannery on video here! 
To adopt this dog, or any OPH dog, fill out the simple online application at https://ophrescue.org

name: Steel Magnolia
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8478

Hi! My name is Steel Magnolia and my foster family calls me Maggie. I am being fostered in Frederick, MD.

Im guessed to be a Hound mix and estimated to be about 2 years old. Im a sweet and gentle girl and I currently weigh about 34 lbs. My foster family is trying to get me to gain some pounds.

Click here to see me in action in my foster home! 

I am...
* A friendly girl and like people of all ages I have met at adoption events.
* Learning about the crate. I am quiet inside and listen to classical music.
* I only had a few potty accidents when I first arrived.I now tell my foster parents when I need to go outside!
* Calm girl inside and get my wiggles out in the yard or on walks.
* I have been friendly with dogs I have met including my foster dog brother and sister. We take walks together and lounge together in the living room.
* My foster family thinks a home without a cat would be a good home for me.

Check back for more updates about me and apply today to set up a meet and greet!

name: The Hobbit
description:
ADOPT ME ONLINE: https://ophrescue.org/dogs8481

 Meet The Hobbit - known fondly to her foster family as Lady Arwen or Lady for short. She is a 45-50 pound, one year old, beagle/spaniel/lab mix is our best guess. She has gorgeous creamy coloring and luxurious fur - hard to keep your hand out of it. And she doesn't mind the gentle petting and attention at all. She has her nose to the ground all the time - perhaps a nod to her beagle heritage? And she has long silky fur that one might associate with a spaniel. She is so gentle and sweet, and has done beautifully with children, other dogs and car rides. Each day we see more of her exquisite personality shining through. She's very loving and sweet. She's also smart and loves to cuddle. She's been really great with our 2 year old and our 12 year old twins, but our 7 year old is a little too rambunctious for her.

More about this darling girl:
- She is house trained in her foster home, and has visited homes of family members and remembered her house manners there as well.
- She is crate trained, and knows that her crate is her personal den and uses it at time to get some downtime, to relax and unwind. She is a smart girl understanding her personal space.
- She is working on improving her leash skills. She likely never walked on a leash before coming to her foster home, and she likes to pull. With training she is improving and to become really adept and walk on a loose leash, her adoptive family will need to continue the training process.
- She may be shy when meeting new people, but she has impeccable manners - not a jumper
- She is learning her house manners - she likes being on the couch which is fine in her foster home, but she may have to be trained otherwise in her adoptive home. She is very agile and has jumped up to get food from the table. She is learning quickly that is is not acceptable in her foster home. 
- She is generally quiet. She will alert at random times but it's few and far between.
- She is learning to trust humans more thoroughly and quickly, and her fosters are consciously socializing her to help her build confidence. She would rather people kneel down to pet her instead of looming over her. She gets nervous if someone comes up behind her too quickly and can startle if she is bumped into by accident. I think she needs more work on trusting humans in general. She shows no reactivity or aggression, but retreats to her crate if she feels overwhelmed. 
- She loves to run around in the backyard. She loves to play with other dogs. She seems to be a moderate energy dog and she is still trying to figure out how it all works inside a home.
- She loves to play with other dogs.
- She has not been exposed to cats, but her foster thinks she could do well with a confident cat. She's tried to go after squirrels on walks and birds get her attention.
- She will do best with a patient adoptive home where they can continue to show her that humans are a good thing and being apart of a family is where it's at. Possibly someone with another confident dog to help her to continue to gain confidence in a home.

This dog tested positive for Anaplasmosis before arriving to the rescue. Anaplasmosis is a very common type of bacteria that infects dogs and other species and is spread by ticks. Anaplasmosis is not contagious to humans or other pets. The only way to get this disease is to be bitten by a tick that carries it. The treatment is typically 21-30 days of antibiotics. This dog started treatment upon arriving to the rescue. 
To adopt this dog, or any OPH dog, fill out the simple online application at https://ophrescue.org

name: Cardi
description:
Hello, my name is Cardi, although my foster mom usually calls me \"Sweet Girl\" or \"Pretty girl.\" I came to ODHS from a hoarding situation, and when I got to my foster house, I wouldn't even come out of the back of my crate for the first 2 days. Since they had me come out of my crate, they've been working with me a little more every day and they tell me how proud of me they are for making progress every day. I've been with my foster family for about a month now and I've gotten much more comfortable with them. I love to follow my foster mom around the house everywhere she goes. I wag my tail and do my happy dance when I see my foster family now. I went from being scared of them, to loving getting pets and treats from them. I love treats! I hardly ever run into my crate when they are home now, because I enjoy being out in the house with my foster fam. I do great with going potty outside in my little puppy pen. I stay in a crate when my humans leave the house and at bedtime. I have 3 human siblings (ages 7-11) in my foster family and 2 canine siblings that are both close to my size. I have done well with my human siblings because they are very calm and patient with me. I don't think I would like to be with young kids that don't know how to be patient and calm with me and give me my space to build up trust with them. I now love playing with dog toys and chasing balls. I love running around and playing with my 2 year old canine brother.  I'm not a big fan of my older canine foster brother though. I have come a long way during my time in my foster home, so although I'll have a transition period to go through in my new home, I know I would blossom with having a fur-ever family. I would love a family that understands that I will need time and patience to build up trust and know that they are good and love me and help me to understand that the world isn't so scary. Will you be that family?

My first adoption event will be 9/25, which is also my \"go home\" eligible date.

name: Alma
description:
Hi! Im Miss Alma. I'm a tiny lady looking for a place to chill to call my furever home. I came from a hoarding home in SC and so I'm learning to cuddle with my foster mama and explore the home. I get along with other dogs but I get grumpy about my space and prefer to sleep solo. My hobbies include eating and napping on very plush bedding. I am maybe 5lb but I sure do enjoy my canned dinners and my foster mama even warms them up for me because my precious eyes convince her I require that. These hoomans that cater to me make me get up and walk around. I'll do best with a home with older kids that understand to give me space. I haven't been cat tested but by my chill level I don't see it even phasing me. 
And I think Iâm about 7 years old, but Iâm not sure. I will need a dental and to be on canned food only.

description:
Hi there! My name is Zeus and Iâm a special boy, according to my foster mom. I have come a long way in my foster home in learning how to \"dog\".  I started life in a home that hoarded dogs, so I didn't get the best care and the love and attention I needed.  Because of this situation, I was defensive and a bite risk to start.  I like it when you get down on my level and don't tower over me.  You are big and I am very small, so you look like a giant coming at me.  

I have found that I like pillows and they give me security, in that I can hide in them if I want to.  I also am treat motivated (fish based treats are my favorite), so that will be a good way to continue my training. Once Iâm comfortable with you, I love to snuggle close and get belly rubs. I do love to give kisses but I can get a little overboard!

I am working on leash skills and not being so scared with quick movements, loud sounds, and going through doorways.  I like to walk with a harness on and I am learning that I should do my potty business outside. While I am learning, I do understand about potty pads inside. 

I like having a K9 companion, but I would not do well with cats in my forever home.  If you are willing to work with me, I know I could be a great dog for you.

Adoption donations are $250 for an adult, $350 for puppies (a dog under one year of age), and $125 for a senior dog (based on the age of the dog). All dogs are spay/neutered, have rabies, distemper vaccine, microchip, heartworm test if age appropriate, and are current on heartworm preventative. Adoption donations are accepted via cash or debit/credit card. There is a $5 fee to run a card.

Please remember to bring a collar and leash with you the day of the adoption. 

Fill out an application online prior to arriving to our adoption event. This greatly speeds up the adoption process and will ensure that the animal you are interested in will be at the event. Not all adoptable dogs can make it to all events, because they are cared for in foster homes. Our adoption events are most Wednesdayâs from 5-7pm and each Saturday from Noon until 4 PM on Saturdayâs at 3602 Lafayette Blvd, Suite 102, Fredericksburg, VA 22408. There are circumstances that we will not have an adoption event, so please email or check our Facebook prior to coming to ensure we will be open. 

We do receive HUNDREDS of emails daily. The fastest way to get a response is to fill out an application on our website, NOT by submitting an inquiry. Online applications get priority over applications filled out in person.

Visit our website for an application to adopt.  
https://www.olddominionhumanesociety.org/adoption-application

Please be patient. Old Dominion Humane Society is a volunteer based organization. We are run completely by volunteers, who also have full time jobs and families.

Like us on Facebook
www.facebook.com/OldDominionHumaneSociety and follow this dog's journey in finding a forever family.

Old Dominion Humane Society adopts to Virginia and the immediate surrounding states. There is a $50, out of state fee.

name: Toro
description:
Hi Iâm Toro! Iâm a small thing at just 10lbs! 

I was just rescued about a month ago from a hoarding situation so a majority of the world makes me quite nervous but Iâm slowly settling into my foster home. 

I love being outside and just laying out on the porch. Think quick about taking me for a walk cause leashes are scary for now. 

Iâm curious about my foster humans. Iâll go up and sniff and lick them when they arenât noticing but if they try to touch me I scurry off cause Iâm not ready for that much attention just yet. So no small humans for me because if they donât understand the space I need right now I will bite them. 

There are 5 other dogs living with me. The first couple of days I growled when they came near my personal space but we are growing on each other though I would probably do best either as the only dog or just co-habitating with a dog that doesnât want to play.  

Iâm also heartworm positive. Right now Iâm taking my meds before my treatment gets scheduled so Iâll need the low activity life I already prefer until my treatment date and 30 days after.

name: Prince
description: The BEST smile hands down! Look at Prince charming here that is available for adoption! He is a handsome 7 year young shepherd mix (maybe with cattle dog.. lab.. both.?) He is 50 pounds and full grown. He is an owner surrender through no fault of his own. Prince gets along with other dogs and does well with kids, cats are unknown at this time. The adoption events can be quite overwhelming for some dogs and we are certain Prince is puzzled by why is with a rescue! Prince had plenty of spunk and loves to play. He is great in the car and happy to go where good people do. He would love a couch and a home that will enjoy his companionship. Please complete an online application at www.henricohumane.org/adopt-a-dog and feel free to email us at adopt@henricohumane.org for any questions.Our adoption events are every Saturday, excluding holidays, at the Petco next to Trader Joe's in Short Pump from 11:00 to 2:00 (11331 West Broad Street, Glen Allen, VA). *Please note that not all dogs attend our adoption events.

name: Ollie
description:
Hi, I'm Ollie! I'm about 9 years old & weigh approximately 80 lbs. & in good health. I love going on walks with my human. I am potty trained but on occasion will have an accident inside if left alone for too long. I get along fine with other dogs as long as they aren't annoying me by constantly getting in my personal space, so another older guy or gal like me would be ideal. I'd also prefer older kids as I don't care to be climbed on or have my fluffy tail pulled. I like to be in the presence of my humans & sleeping in their room. I like to roam the house during the day & to snooze on the couch. If you're not looking, I'll be sure to steal any food that I'm able to reach (trash included). I'm a great alert dog, making sure my humans know when unauthorized people or animals come near the house. I'm a good boy. I also love being groomed (brushed, bathed, hairdryer, etc.) although I may need to be muzzled when trimming my nails. If you scratch my butt, I'll never leave you alone.

name: Mickey
description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Mickey is a precious little fellow who was born sometime around the first of the year.  He came to us with his littermate, Minnie, from a home in southern VA where neither was given any human handling or socialization.  Although both are very sweet, they are skittish and each will need a home with a patient owner able to provide a consistent schedule and lots of human interaction.  We expect Mickey to be less than 10 pounds when fully grown.

Mickey is in good health.  He has had his puppy vaccines and will be neutered and microchipped as a part of our adoption process.

CARE Rescue is  foster-base rescue located in Richmond, VA.  We do not have a facility for you to come to meet animals at.  You must visit our weekly adoption stand (calendar on our website) to meet the adoptable dogs.  Out of area adoptions can only be facilitated when we are able to find a volunteer to do a home visit for us and when the potential adopter already has a veterinary reference.

name: Roco
description:
Hello! I'm Roco. I traveled all the way from Puerto Rico to find my furever family! I'm what you call a street dog, the product of little to no spay/neuter in my area. I was born in March and I am doing so well with crate training.  I sleep in my crate overnight and don't have any accidents (a whole 8 hours).  As far as potty training in my foster home, that is a work in progress, but I am doing very well. I'm a little slow to trust, but I warm up pretty quick.  I prefer females and am afraid of tall men (they are so big).  I am a super jumper if you want to teach me agility.  I'd also love to be trained so I can get those yummy treats (which are the key to my heart).

name: Mika
description:
Mika is starting to get more comfortable in her foster home, but is still hesitant of people, so no cuddling for this girl. She does great with the other dogs (especially loves bigger dogs) and loves to play with them. Because she is so hesitant of people, taking her out on a leash is an event, but she has no problem using a doggie door or just going outside to a fenced in yard.  She crates well, has had no potty accidents in her foster home, gets along with cats, She has made a lot of progress in her foster home so stay tuned for further updates.

This is a link to a good article about working with shy dogs like Mika. 
https://petcentral.chewy.com/pet-parenting-pet-lovers-7-ways-to-bond-with-a-shy-dog/

name: Frank
description:
Hello! I'm Frank! I'm sweet, very energetic 3 year old boy and I love hikes and swimming! I'm working hard to lose this extra weight so I can be healthy, don't let it fool you, I can easily hike three miles. I also have a pretty good recall when you whistle! 

I would do best in a home with older children, because when I sleep, I'm OUT and I can be snippy if startled. Please feed me alone, because I want all the foods for my self and can get aggressive, but if fed in my crate, I'm good.

name: Laguna
description:
Hi my name is Laguna! For a puppy I'm pretty laid-back. I love to explore with my nine brothers and sisters. But mostly I love to be held and cuddled! I've included a picture of my mama, Maya. She's been a loving Mama to me and weighs 48 lb. In my foster home they're are children, lots of big dogs, cats, and a cockatiel! I'm used to lots of different things!

name: Bay
description:
Introducing Bay! She is a quiet happy little gal who enjoys a good snuggle session. Her favorite place to sleep is right on your lap or in your arms.  This tiny gal does not let her size stop her from anything.  She enjoys exploring her surroundings and is happiest when kids  are close by.  Bay sleeps through the night in her crate as well. name: Wes
description:
Hi guys, I am Wes. I am pretty old and tired, my eyes and ears are not working so well these days. My brother and I ended up with the fine people at the Old Dominion Humane Society after our elderly owner passed way. My brother was a little younger and lucky enough to get adopted, I miss him but I am happy for him. Like most older gentlemen I have some hair loss but with grooming I am looking much better. I spend most of my day sleeping and resting, I sleep quietly in my kennel at night and I have been doing really well about doing my business outside. I do fine with other dogs as long as they do not keep me from napping. I walk on a leash well outside but really struggle with stairs. I think this is because of my poor eyesight. Good news is I only weigh about 10 pounds so I am not heavy to carry. I get along with everyone and enjoy getting pets, oh and kids are great too! I know I might be as cute as some of the young pups and yes I am in the later chapters of my life but I am willing to give you every ounce of love I have left. If you are looking for a sweet quiet older gentlemen to warm your lap in the coming months then I am your guy. Please stop by to see me even if it is just for a short visit.  
 
Thanks,

Wes

name: Rae
description:
Hey everyone, I'm Rae. Well, that's my real name, but my friends call me Ray Ray or little bit around here. I'm new to this household and I've only been here a few days, but I settled right in! They say I'm very well tempered and loveable (what?? people think they can talk about me while I'm in the room and I'm not gonna hear them?). I'm kind of a snuggle bug if I was bigger I'd be a great spooning partner. Especially burried in a fuzzy blanket! The other dogs here are just fine with me too, sometimes they get a bit aggressive with playtime, but I can hold my own. I'm being treated for flea bites currently and I'm hoping my hair fills in as time goes on. Those little bugs really bother me. I'm small, but don't let that fool you, I LOVE to eat! Dinner time is my favorite and I try to show it with excitement and love! I pretty much do my business outside, but I don't like the rain so I have had a couple of accidents in the hallway (hey but at least they're small). Car rides are cool, it's a big world out there to see! I'm ok with the leash, but I'd rather just cruise around freely. The other dogs go a hootin' and hollering about the crate, but I don't mind it, seems like a safe place for me! This place has a few dogs, I haven't seen a kid or a cat yet, but I think from what I've heard I'll do fine with them. I like it here ok, but sure would love a place to call my own and be part of a forever family! Ask about me, I'm hoping to get an application soon!I am about 3 years old and about 15lbs.

Note: My leg has been bothering me and my x-rays have been done.  We are awaiting the results,  I am hoping itâs just arthritis and nothing worse.

name: Christy
description: If you are interested in adopting this dog, please fill out our dog adoption questionnaire and e-mail it to htarmiranda@gmail.com PLEASE VISIT THIS WEBSITE TO FIND THE ADOPTION QUESTIONNAIRE: http://www.homewardtrails.org/adopt-a-pet/adoption-forms/ Meet Christy! She arrived at the Homeward Trails Adoption Center from a high kill shelter in southern, VA almost 3 years ago! She is so very sweet but never had a lot of human contact before so is now learning to trust humans. Christy draws comfort from her furry foster friends. She was at the shelter for over 100 days and set to be euthanized before we rescued her back in 2016. While Christy is afraid of leash walking, she does GREAT if she can have free roam of the yard. Once she is settled in a home, just say the magic word \"potty\" and there she goes! Christy has learned that it's ok to come say hello to her foster humans while they are home and she feels comfortable just hanging out watching tv too. Christy is house trained, great with dogs and cats. She never gets into mischief and is crate trained but not really needed, a nice soft bed on the floor with a bone for her to enjoy is her idea of a good time while she adjust to her new surroundings. Can you give Christy a chance to have a place to call home, a home with a confident friend to help show her the ropes? She's been in loving foster homes but NEVER has she had one to call her own. After 3 years, it's Christy's turn to find a home! Apply to adopt her today! Breed Estimate: Beagle mix Gender: Female Approximate weight: 55 lbs Approximate age: 5 years Location: foster home Cratetrained: yes but not needed Coat Type: silky smooth Personality: Shy The adoption fee for this dog is $25. This fee INCLUDES spay and microchip. If the animal you are adopting is not already spayed/neutered, you will be required to sign a contract legally obligating you to have the animal altered. Please contact your HT rep to learn about exclusive low-cost spay/neuter options made available only to HT adopters! Every adopted Homeward Trails animal comes with 30 days of free pet health insurance. We are proud to partner with the following veterinarians who offer a free first exam for your animal, exclusively for HT adopters: Caring Hands Animal Hospital, Palisades Veterinary Clinic, Sunshine Animal Hospital and Clarendon Animal Care and all VCA Animal Hospitals. Additionally, any VCA hospital will cover illnesses up to $250 at no cost to any Homeward Trails adopter. We also provide a 30-minute phone consult with a professional dog trainer at Fur-Get Me Not within the first 30 days of adopting - just for HT adopters in the Arlington/Alexandria area. Start your new dog out on the right foot with this valuable, expert advice and guidance FREE! You can save animals like this one by becoming a foster! Fosters are like way stations between high kill shelters and forever homes. We need fosters so that we can save dogs before they are euthanized at the shelters. If you are interested in becoming a foster, please check out our information about fostering by visiting http://www.homewardtrails.org/foster-a-pet/dog-and-cat-foster-program/

name: Ajax
description:
Ajax is a silly, funny guy that likes to do zoomies around the house. He loves to play, but he has a hard time picking up social cues from other dogs. He can be too rough with small dogs, so those are a no for him. If you have a very playful dog, Ajax would be a good playmate, but he doesn't know when to stop. Ajax rides well in the car and is crate trained. He is looking for a dog savy family that can help teach him not to be mouthy. No small kids for this guy! Sometimes he can even leave marks! Ouch! He is such a ham, though! Ajax LOVES going hiking and playing in the water. Do you have what it takes to train him?

name: Dutchess
description:
Dutchess is a sweet, small, laid back kinda gal. Sheâs around 10 lbs and 7 years old. Although she only has a few teeth left, it does not stop her from enjoying her meals.  She will gently remind you if you forget.   She rides well in the car and is such a cuddle bug with lots of love to give.  She walks well on leash and enjoys the outdoors, even a fun trip to the park.  Did you say you also need a watchdog? -  then Dutchess has you covered.  She was fostered with a puppy for a time and is working to regain her potty manners.  She is just one cool chic, so if you are looking for a small lap dog, put in an application for Dutchess.

name: Belle (& Taco)
description:
This sweet bonded pair, Taco & Belle, have had unfortunate luck in their very short lives. They lost their original owner suddenly to a stroke and were passed around to different family members for a few months. They ended up with the 80-year-old grandmother who was legally blind and taking care of her disabled son, so she didn't have the time or bandwidth to take on two young dogs. A family member reached out to Worthy Dog for help, and we gladly took them in.

The duo came to N. VA and were adopted in February by a very sweet couple, and we thought they had found their forever home. Sadly, their current mom, Lynn, who is only in her 30's, is going through a significant and unexpected health challenge, and suffering from kidney failure. She had a kidney transplant 18 years ago and was in great health when she adopted the pups. The couple was so very excited to have these dogs, and even started an Instagram account for Taco & Bell to share updates

About two months ago, Lynn's kidney started failing, and she ended up in the hospital for weeks. She is now on the transplant list waiting for a donor and has to do dialysis 3 to 4 days a week. She travels from VA to MD to a military facility for treatment, and the dialysis wipes out her energy when she gets home. Lynn has been the primary caregiver for the pups and had the flexibility to work from home. Her husband is active duty, and travels frequently, so he's not home during the day to help. Her mom and friends have been helping out, and kept Taco & Bell when she was hospitalized, but it's not a long-term solution.

In the interest of the dogs, Lynn has made the difficult decision to rehome them. She feels they aren't getting the time and attention they deserve, and with another transplant surgery in her future, she may be out of commission for an extended period. She wants to find a home for them before transplant surgery, and have peace of mind that they will be well taken care of. She is fostering them until a great family can be found.

TACO & BELLE

Taco & Belle have been together their whole lives and are a bonded pair. Taco is more timid, but loves his buddy Belle, and looks to her for reassurance. Taco needs a little more time to settle in and trust, but once he connects, he's very trusting and affectionate. Both dogs fancy themselves lap dogs once they get to know you.

This adorable duo loves to play and will keep each other entertained during the day. They are crate trained, enjoy their daily walks, and are potty trained, but do need regular potty breaks. Belle lets you know she needs to go out, and Taco will follow her lead once he settles in. Initially, Taco was prone to marking or excited peeing when he was unexpectedly picked up, but that was more about nerves. They used a belly band to settle him in, and both dogs have been trained on pee pads. Lynn will leave them gated in the kitchen when she goes in for treatment, and has a dog walker or her mom come in when she's out of the home for more than 5 or 6 hours.

These two pups are very connected, so we will only adopt them out as a pair. They are buddies who love to play and nap together and keep each other entertained. They are both afraid of loud noises and strangers and need time to acclimate to visitors, but once they know the person, like grandma, they are all excitement and kisses.

We feel a quiet, calm home is the best fit for them - an adult or senior couple, or empty nesters would be ideal. If you are looking for two little pups who will add joy and much entertainment to your life, please apply today. They are long overdue for their forever home.

Breed: Chihuahua
Weight: 12 lbs (needs to lose a pound or two)
Age: ~ 2 to 2.5 years
Gender: Female
Adoption fee: $500 (pair)
Vetting: updated on vaccines, dewormed, spayed microchipped.
Location: Gainesville, VA

FOR MORE INFO OR TO ADOPT: Please go to http://adopt.worthydog.org and complete the application.

You can also help save dogs like this one by becoming a foster, providing a rescue dog with a temporary home and giving them the love and care they need until they are permanently adopted. Every person who fosters is directly responsible for saving the life of a dog, because we can only save as many dogs as we have foster families available to welcome them into their homes. If you think you might be interested in becoming a foster and want to learn more, please go to http://foster.worthydog.org and fill out an application.

Worthy Dog Rescue is an all-volunteer, foster-based rescue that primarily adopts to families in the DC Metro area.

TACO & BELLE

Taco & Belle have been together their whole lives and are a bonded pair. Taco is more timid, but loves his buddy Belle, and looks to her for reassurance. Taco needs a little more time to settle in and trust, but once he connects, he's very trusting and affectionate. Both dogs fancy themselves lap dogs once they get to know you.

This adorable duo loves to play and will keep each other entertained during the day. They are crate trained, enjoy their daily walks, and are potty trained, but do need regular potty breaks. Belle lets you know she needs to go out, and Taco will follow her lead once he settles in. Initially, Taco was prone to marking or excited peeing when he was unexpectedly picked up, but that was more about nerves. They used a belly band to settle him in, and both dogs have been trained on pee pads. Lynn will leave them gated in the kitchen when she goes in for treatment, and has a dog walker or her mom come in when she's out of the home for more than 5 or 6 hours.

These two pups are very connected, so we will only adopt them out as a pair. They are buddies who love to play and nap together and keep each other entertained. They are both afraid of loud noises and strangers and need time to acclimate to visitors, but once they know the person, like grandma, they are all excitement and kisses.

We feel a quiet, calm home is the best fit for them - an adult or senior couple, or empty nesters would be ideal. If you are looking for two little pups who will add joy and much entertainment to your life, please apply today. They are long overdue for their forever home.

Breed: Chihuahua mix
Weight: 13-14 lbs (needs to lose a few pounds)
Age: ~ 1.5 to 2 years old
Gender: Male (Taco)
Adoption fee: $500 (pair)
Vetting: updated on vaccines, dewormed, neutered, microchipped.
Location: Gainesville, VA

FOR MORE INFO OR TO ADOPT: Please go to http://adopt.worthydog.org and complete the application.

You can also help save dogs like this one by becoming a foster, providing a rescue dog with a temporary home and giving them the love and care they need until they are permanently adopted. Every person who fosters is directly responsible for saving the life of a dog, because we can only save as many dogs as we have foster families available to welcome them into their homes. If you think you might be interested in becoming a foster and want to learn more, please go to http://foster.worthydog.org and fill out an application.

Worthy Dog Rescue is an all-volunteer, foster-based rescue that primarily adopts to families in the DC Metro area.

name: Moe
description:
Moe is around 1 year old, 35lb and is eager to please.  He loves nothing more than to cuddle up with you.  Heâs so excited to see his people that his tail goes a mile a minute and he jumps up and down.  He has had no accidents, in human terms, heâs ready for Kindergarten! And he is well on his way to passing the Good Canine Citizen test!  He comes when called, drops whatever he has when you say ânoâ or âleave itâ, and heels well during night time walks.  He does well with dogs small and large.  Heâs laid back and picks up commands really fast.  Moe is an awesome little guy!

name: Todrick
description:
Well hello - Iâm Todrick! 

Iâm a small fellow at just 18lb but Iâm a year old so no growing for me! 

What do I want the most? A big spoon. I want some humans that I can snuggle with all night kinda like I am a teddy bear. Hey if you want to nickname me Teddy I wouldnât even mind! 

Iâd also like some toys. Fluffier the better. Oh and some siblings to play with... 2-legged or 4... doesnât matter! 

And I want breakfast for breakfast lunch and dinner. Yeah eggs... theyâre yummy. I mean bacon is too... but eggs I like. 

Itâs ok if you come with a crate. Iâm good in the crate! Now.... Iâm still working on mastering my potty skills but if I had to guess you were in diapers at 1 too! 

Iâm working on resource guarding, not jumping 6 foot fences, and getting along with dogs smaller than me (little man syndrome).  Iâd be great for an only dog house if thatâs your situation.

So what do you say... we snuggling tonight?

name: Coco
description:
Iâm a spunky, little 11 year old lady!  I don't mind sharing a house with other dogs (as long as they aren't super hyper and in my face), cats, or humans.  Because of my age, I would do best in a home with no kids or older kids who understand to give me my space.  I like for you to call me to where you want me to go vs. picking me up.  

I do have a mammary tumor, so cancer . . .  Due to my age - ODHS is not going to make me go through the surgery to treat. I don't know how much time I have left but . . . Can I spend that time left, with you?

name: Jenelle
description: This beautiful hound is Jenelle who is approximately 3 years in age. She is doing awesome in her foster home with the other dogs and enjoying her fenced yard. She gets pretty excited about squirrels in the yard and feels she should run to greet them. The squirrels are not as excited to see Jenelle as she is about seeing them. Jenelle is housebroken, not a chewer or destructive - just really nice mannered overall. All you hound lovers please come introduce yourself to Jenelle at our next adoption stand! She may even say hello to you with her sweet hound voice (she does seem to say hello at times!) We have learned that cats will not love Jenelle as much as she loves them. Jenelle could be an only pet or she could be a companion to another dog who is about her size. Of course the other dog must enjoy hanging out and then taking afternoon naps! If you want a best friend who is also quite entertaining at times then Jenelle is the girl for you! If you are interested in Jenelle please fill out an application at www.henricohumane.org/adopt/application-for-dogs before coming to our next adoption event. Our adoption events are every Saturday, excluding holidays, at the Petco next to Trader Joe's in Short Pump from 11:00 to 2:00 (11331 West Broad Street, Glen Allen, VA). Please note that not all dogs attend our adoption events so to find out if a particular dog will be coming please email dogs@henricohumane.org

name: Old Man *Adopt*
description:
Foster Homes Needed!

Do you have time and room in your life for a foster dog?

http://www.muttloverescue.org/foster.html

*****************

Old Man came to us from rural VA where a local hunt club dumped him at the shelter for some unknown reason. It's obvious he did not receive the best of care as he is in rough shape, with bad skin, raggedy ears and scars all over his face.. and he is heartworm positive to boot. Despite the neglect, Old Man is the sweetest of sweet. He seems to get along with everyone and he is learning there is a good life for him, even if he had to wait until his golden years to get it. Old Man has started his heartworm treatment which will be finished around the beginning of April. In the meantime, he is spending his days in a loving foster home, being spoiled in the manner he deserves. He is around 37 lbs.

**BECAUSE OF OUR REQUIREMENT FOR A HOME VISIT, WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO ADOPT TO HOMES IN THE NORTHERN VA / MARYLAND / DC METRO AREA**

We have adoption events EVERY SATURDAY from 12-3 p.m. Please note that not all dogs can attend every event, so if you are interested in meeting a particular dog, please complete a no-obligation application on our website at http://www.muttloverescue.org/application.html OR write to adopt@muttloverescue.org.

Upcoming adoption events:

Saturday Sept 21st noon - 3 pm at Weber's Pet Supermarket 11021 Lee Hwy; Fairfax

Saturday Oct 5th noon - 3 pm at Weber's Pet Supermarket 11021 Lee Hwy; Fairfax

Saturday Oct 12th noon - 3 pm at Weber's Pet Supermarket 2599 John Milton Dr; Herndon

For information on sponsoring this dog, please write to adopt@muttloverescue.org.

WE NEED FOSTER HOMES! FOR MORE INFORMATION, PLEASE EMAIL ADOPT@MUTTLOVERESCUE.ORG.

Visit us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/muttloverescue
Follow us on Twitter: @Muttlove_Rescue

name: Wink
description:
VIRGINIA AREA -- Wink is a perfect little sweet companion estimated to be about 9 years old, neutered male who weighs about 10 lbs. Wink is a miniature poodle that went through so much before he came to us.  When Wink was rescued, he was in terrible condition and every square inch of his body was pink and he was itching constantly.  Vet examined Wink and diagnosed him with scabbies, chronic ear infection (which explained why he was snappy when someone try to pet him in the head) and in addition, he was heartworm positive.  It was obvious that such a tiny guy was an outdoor dog in someone's house in the past, and his hair/ skin/ general health condidion was not managed at all.  While he was getting vetted to get the proper medical treatment, he was in the middle of a fight amongst dogs at the shelter, and due to the shock and trauma, one of his eyes popped out which gave him a permanent damage (blinded in one eye).  The ER vet was able to place the eye back in. but not able to save the vision sadly.

But, Wink is a survivor! He completed his heartwarm treatment and fully recovered from scabbies. He still has eczema on his skin, and will need to receive monthly injection of Cytopoint a few more months to be permanently cured of his skin condition, but that is easily obtainable, our foster mom thinks.  Wink was seen by a cardiologist since his arrival in the US, and the symptoms for his heart is also controllable with daily heart meds (Vetmedin, 1.25mg x2 daily).  We were told he does not need to be on Lasix, as long as his breathing is monitored visually.  Wink did however developed symptoms for diabetes since his arrival, and now, he is currently receiving insulin twice a day at his foster home which makes things a bit more complicated.  What a life Wink has..

With so much that Wink went through, we are looking for a family that will shower Wink with love, trust and belief.  Wink is doing his best, but he is afraid of the insulin shots, and he does not know why he is getting poked every day.  His foster mommy is working with a trainer, so that Wink is being less sensitive of his shots currently.  This is a life long commitment, and BFA does not take it lightly.  Wink is still a great companion, and has so much love to give to his family.  Once you get the routine down, giving daily insulin shots won't stop you from loving Wink, because Wink is really that special...(ask his foster moms in the areas, we have a several of them!) We also have to look into whether the adopter is able to afford Wink's medical expanses too since Wink has a several special needs conditions what need routine check up, and will need to be given medicines for life.

If you think you have a small space in your home for a dog that definitely need your help to survive, please consider Wink.  Wink is easy to take care of because he is potty trained, does not exhibit any separation anxiety, and easy to get along with people and other dogs.  We are very sure that Wink will be forever thankful to you and your family, and show you his unconditional love.  

We believe people who adopt rescue animals because they are willing to accept a bit of imperfection, and willing to embrace, work/ train and love them no matter what baggage the animal had in the past. It can be challenging, but extremely rewarding. We have seen amazing transformation in our adopted dogs who have been with loving families, and it is our goal to provide all of them with the opportunity. We are at our happiest when we see photos of our adopted animals smile with the new adoptive family, and we hope to find Wink a loving family who would do the same. 

 Please consider adopting Wink and making him part of your family! If you would like to apply to adopt Wink, you can download an application here: 
 https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1u_YTSKWFVkNYLUcJbCVvfyQnguL-gHi8JGG59XOIIog/edit 


You can MEET Wink upon request at our foster home.  Please refer to our facebook page for more info:

https://www.facebook.com/Band4Animal/

 *NOTE* We have a 30-mile radius limit from Fairfax, VA for adoption.  We require a completed application & home check to adopt. An adoption fee of $500 applies. All dogs are spay/neutered and have all shots prior to adoption. Thank you!

name: Max
description: If you are looking for a great housemate who wants to chill out with you on the couch and you let out for potty breaks mainly - then look no further here he is! Max is definitely the guy for you then. He is an expert at watching tv and lounging. He is a large boy and is 7 years in age. He is currently in a foster home and doing great! This smart fella is housebroken, crate trained (that's where he likes to sleep), loves his toys, and wants to stay close to his human. As you can imagine with his size, he needs an experienced owner. Max has been looking for his forever home for a while now and because of that once he gets there, he would like to be the only one to get your love and attention. While Max prefers to be indoors, he will need a fenced yard to take a stroll and get some sunshine on that handsome face! (A home with no cats is best for Max)If you are interested in Max please fill out an application at www.henricohumane.org/adopt/application-for-dogs before coming to our next adoption event. Our adoption events are every Saturday, excluding holidays, at the Petco next to Trader Joe's in Short Pump from 11:00 to 2:00 (11331 West Broad Street, Glen Allen, VA). name: Buster
description:
Buster is a good boy who just needs a home and family of his own.

\"Hi, I am Buster. I am an adult male bulldog that ended up in the county kill shelter when an animal control picked me up as a stray. Sadly, my owners never came for me. I didn't mean to run away, I was just looking for love since my owners didn't have me neutered. I have not shown any aggression in the shelter but I know how it works in these shelters. Humans over look me for little dogs and tiny cute puppies. But the workers tell me I am cute and they don't understand why I am still here. They say that they would take me if they could, but I wonder why they cant?

Please don't leave him in the shelter. He needs a home.

name: Felix
description:
Felix and his brother Oscar came to us from a rural shelter in central VA.  They were surrendered along with 3 siblings and from what we are told, all 5 of them had been kept in cages outdoors.  We were also told that Felix is 11 years old, although that is hard to believe when we see him playing with the young puppy in his foster home.  Felix is timid, but does not act like a dog who was kept in his cage for his entire life, so at some point he probably had a home where he interacted with his family.  Hopefully he can find a home like that again.  He is sweet and loving with his foster mom and dad.

Unfortunately, Felix does not get along with all of the dogs in his foster home and would probably do best as the only dog in the house, despite his fondness for the pup that he plays with.  He is extremely interested in cats and it would not be a good idea to leave him alone with one.

Oh, and Felix is missing a foot.  He gets around so well that I often forget to mention that!  If you look closely at the last photo, you can see that his right back leg is just a stump.  Sometimes he limps on 3 legs and sometimes he actually walks on the stump.  He doesn't seem to know he has a \"handicap\".

Felix was very matted when he came to us so we shaved his hair.  Now that it has grown out, he looks exactly like a large Yorkie (he weighs about 15 lbs.)

If you think you might be the one to give this sweet little dog a home for the rest of his life, please email cosmozcause@gmail.com

name: Panda
description: Panda is a senior (born approx 4.1.08) spayed female Akita. She is up to date on vaccines, on flea/heartworm prevention, microchipped, house trained, crate trained, and leash trained. Panda comes to us from the shelter in Suffolk, VA, where she found herself after she didn't get along with the family's new puppy. Panda still has lots of bouncy energy and loves meeting new people and is a wonderful breed ambassador! Panda has gone to daycare with some of the other fosters. She would like a retirement home as an only or with the right mellow male.

name: Athena
description:
Athena is an adult (born approx 5.5.15) spayed female Akita. She is up to date on vaccines, microchipped, heartworm negative, on flea/heartworm prevention, house trained, crate trained, and leash trained.

Athena comes to us from the animal shelter in Spotsylvania, VA. From what we can gather, she has already had at least 3 homes before ending up in the shelter. In March 2018, a family acquired her from someone who was giving her away. In May, they surrendered her to the Stafford County Animal Control because they were moving. A few days later, she was adopted by another family. She did well with them for a while, but then she began to guard her pregnant human and show teeth at the other little humans in the house. They surrendered her to the Spotsylvania Animal Shelter on Nov. 1, 2018. 

Athena is SUCH a good girl, the shelter was very persistent about asking the Akita rescues to take her. Finally the stars aligned and we had a space open for her! She is fantastic in the crate in her foster home and regularly goes to doggy daycare! She would be happy in a home with a large male to play with or as an only pet. No children under 10 years of age, please!

name: Waverly
description:
Waverly is a young (born approximately 10.19.17) spayed female Akita. She is up to date on vaccines, microchipped, heartworm negative, on flea/heartworm prevention, house trained, crate trained, and leash trained. MUST GO TO HOME AS ONLY PET.

Waverly comes to us from Suffolk, VA, where she was picked up by animal control, running stray. She is in very good condition and was found with a collar and Seresto flea collar. Clearly someone had been caring for her, but no one came to claim her. She is very people friendly.

name: Yin
description: Yin is an older (born approx 6.20.10) spayed, female Akita. She is heartworm negative, on flea/heartworm prevention, microchipped, up to date on vaccines, house trained, crate trained, and leash trained. Yin came to us from the shelter in Chesapeake, VA, where she was surrendered because her family could no longer care for her. She had a bad skin infection on her back and was reported to have gotten into a tussle over food with the female Rottweiler she previously lived with. In true girl-fight fashion, all she did was hold the Rottie down and pull out her hair. ? Yin is a sweet, older girl looking for her retirement home

name: Lincoln
description:
Lincoln is an adult (born approx 6.29.2013) neutered male Akita. He is up to date on vaccines, microchipped, heartworm negative, on flea/heartworm prevention, neutered, and leash trained. MUST GO TO HOME AS ONLY PET OR WITH FOSTER SISTER, SMUDGE.

Lincoln and Smudge came to us from the shelter in Suffolk, VA. Lincoln is a bit shy but very friendly. He is good friends with Smudge, and could be adopted with her.

name: Opie
description:
Opie is only one year in age.  He came to The LAP from the Friends of Bedford, VA.  Opie has all his vaccines and will be neutered and chipped ASAP.  He is a great little beagle - only 27 pounds and that is all of sweetness.

Opie is sponsored by: Kristin Crowder

name: Shelton
description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Shelton is a gorgeous Yorkie mix who is around two years old and fully grown at 19 pounds.  This beautiful boy came to us from a rural southwestern Virginia shelter after being found as a stray.  He is a very nice dog that likes other dogs and loves people!  We think he would make an excellent addition to most families.

Shelton has been thoroughly examined by our vet and appears to be in great health!  He has received initial vaccines, had blood tests to rule out heart worms and tick borne illnesses, and he will be neutered and microchipped as a part of our adoption process.

CARE Rescue is  foster-base rescue located in Richmond, VA.  We do not have a facility for you to come to meet animals at.  You must visit our weekly adoption stand (calendar on our website) to meet the adoptable dogs.  Out of area adoptions can only be facilitated when we are able to find a volunteer to do a home visit for us and when the potential adopter already has a veterinary reference.

name: Sadie
description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Sadie is a darling little Yorkie who is about 8 years old.  She came to us with another older gal after her owner died, and the extended family was not able to keep them.  Both were in pretty sad shape with horrible skin which we were told was allergies, but good hygiene and nutrition, plus flea eradication, has allowed the skin to completely clear.  Paperwork from the previous veterinarian indicates that most care was declined.

Since coming to our rescue Sadie has been spayed, had a mammary tumor (benign) removed and tested, been given a dental cleaning with extractions, been given all vaccines, had extensive blood testing to make certain there were no underlying conditions and been microchipped.  With good care and her small size, Sadie should live a very long time and enjoy life!  Sadie loves being a lap dog.  We are seeking a quiet and predictable home for her since that is what she is used to.

CARE Rescue is  foster-base rescue located in Richmond, VA.  We do not have a facility for you to come to meet animals at.  You must visit our weekly adoption stand (calendar on our website) to meet the adoptable dogs.  Out of area adoptions can only be facilitated when we are able to find a volunteer to do a home visit for us and when the potential adopter already has a veterinary reference.

name: Guthrie
description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Guthrie is a beautiful pure-bred male pug who appears to be around 2 years old.  He came to us from a rural southwestern Virginia shelter where he had been found as a stray and never reclaimed.  Guthrie's nickname could be Bozo for the happy-go-lucky, goofy guy that he is.  He loves people, loves to play and talk with them, loves to run and play with other dogs and just makes you happy every second you spend with him!

Guthrie appears to be in good health.  He has received his initial vaccines and been examined by our vet.  He tested negative for heartworms but positive for erlichea (a tick-borne illness).  He will be treated with antibiotics, neutered and microchipped as a part of our adoption process.

CARE Rescue is  foster-base rescue located in Richmond, VA.  We do not have a facility for you to come to meet animals at.  You must visit our weekly adoption stand (calendar on our website) to meet the adoptable dogs.  Out of area adoptions can only be facilitated when we are able to find a volunteer to do a home visit for us and when the potential adopter already has a veterinary reference.

name: Perry
description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Perry is a precious mixed breed pup who was born sometime around July 1.  This sweet fellow will most likely be a 25-30 pound dog when fully grown.  He came to us as one of a litter of five from a rural shelter.  Perry is a very sweet puppy who loves people and other dogs.

Perry is still receiving puppy shots.  Until his vaccines are complete and his immunities in place, we are seeking a home for him that can keep him isolated from other animals and safe from disease.  Community living will not be considered until his immunities are in place.  Our complete puppy adoption policy can be found on our website.

description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Minnie is a precious little gal who was born sometime around the first of the year. She came to us with her littermate, Mickey, from a home in southern VA where neither was given any human handling or socialization. Although both are very sweet, they are skittish and each will need a home with a patient owner able to provide a consistent schedule and lots of human interaction. We expect Minnie to be less than 10 pounds when fully grown.

Minnie is in good health. She has had her puppy vaccines and will be spayed and microchipped as a part of our adoption process.

description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Finn is a gorgeous male corgi mix who is believed to be just about a year old, and fully grown at only 27 pounds.  This long, low fellow will steal your heart!  He is a lover of people and does well with other dogs his size.  Finn came to us from one of our southwestern VA shelter partners.  He came to them as a stray.

Finn has been examined and appears to be in good health. He is already neutered and microchipped, given vaccines, and will soon be tested to rule out heart worms.  We believe that Finn would make an excellent addition to most homes!

CARE Rescue is  foster-base rescue located in Richmond, VA.  We do not have a facility for you to come to meet animals at. name: Gunner
description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Gunner is a precious male chihuahua who came to us recently from a local Virginia shelter partner. This little guy was part of a hoarding seizure and is understandably scared of new people and new situations. He is thought to be about a year old and fully grown at seven pounds. He will be best served by a patient and experienced owner who is able to help him learn to trust and love.

Gunner has been examined and appears to be in good health.  That said, he has tested positive for heart worms.  We have begun a slow kill treatment, and he will be neutered as a part of our adoption process.  Gunner has received vaccines and has been microchipped.

CARE Rescue is  foster-base rescue located in Richmond, VA.  We do not have a facility for you to come to meet animals at.  You must visit our weekly adoption stand (calendar on our website) to meet the adoptable dogs. description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Leya is a darling chihuahua/pomeranian mix who is just under a year old and fully grown at just 10 pounds.  She came to us from a rural southwestern Virginia shelter partner where she had been found as a stray.  Leya is a happy, healthy, energetic puppy who loves people and loves other dogs!

Leya has been examined and appears to be in great health.  She has been given vaccinations, been microchipped, has had blood tests to rule out heart worms, and will be spayed as a part of our adoption process.  We believe she would make a great addition to most homes!

name: Kendall
description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Kendall is a precious mixed breed male puppy who was one of four in the litter that came to us recently from a southwest Virginia shelter partner. This little guy was born sometime around Easter, and he is thought to be a Yorkie mix. He is expected to stay small and be less than 20 pounds fully grown. This little fellow will surely steal your heart!

Kendall is completing his puppy vaccines. Until they are complete it will be very important that he not be exposed to other animals and possible contagions. We will look for a home with a secure yard that can keep him safe. Our puppy policy is on our website and we encourage interested adopters to learn about it. This policy helps us choose homes that we are sure our pups can thrive in. Kendall will be neutered and microchipped as a part of our adoption process, also.

description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Mickey is a precious little fellow who was born sometime around the first of the year.  He came to us with his littermate, Minnie, from a home in southern VA where neither was given any human handling or socialization.  Although both are very sweet, they are skittish and each will need a home with a patient owner able to provide a consistent schedule and lots of human interaction.  We expect Mickey to be less than 10 pounds when fully grown.

Mickey is in good health.  He has had his puppy vaccines and will be neutered and microchipped as a part of our adoption process.

name: Zeb
description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Zeb, and his sibling, Zach, recently came to us from a local shelter under quarantine as they had been exposed to parvo.  They were part of a hoarding situation in a nearby rural county.  Our vet worked hard with anti-viral medications to try to keep the boys safe, and we are excited to report that their immune systems were able to protect them!  They are now looking for homes where they can be the center of attention and beloved pets.  The boys are thought to have been born in late spring and will most likely be 25-30 pounds when fully grown.

As a part of our adoption process, Zeb is receiving his puppy vaccines.  He will be neutered and microchipped, as well.  Because he is a young puppy care must be taken to place him in a secure home able to offer a safe environment as he continues to grow, and especially until his bones and growth plates fuse.

CARE Rescue is  foster-base rescue located in Richmond, VA.  We do not have a facility for you to come to meet animals at.  You must visit our weekly adoption stand (calendar on our website) to meet the adoptable dogs.  Out of area adoptions can only be facilitated when we are able to find a volunteer to do a home visit for us and when the potential adopter already has a veterinary reference.

name: Flash
description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Flash is a rare beautiful blue merle male chihuahua who is 1-2 years old.  He came to us from a local shelter partner after being surrendered by his owner.  This little fellow has been passed from owner to owner and has understandably developed some separation anxiety issues that caused the current owner to feel unable to properly care for him.  In his short time with us we see a wonderful dog who would do very well in a home with an experienced dog owner that has a very predictable schedule.  Once Flash has someone he can trust, a routine he can count on and some TLC, he will be a wonderful pet!

Flash is in good health.  As a part of our rescue protocols, Flash will have all vaccinations, blood tests, a microchip implant and neuter surgery.

name: Daphne
description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Daphne is a darling female chihuahua who recently came to us from a regional shelter in a nearby rural community.  We have little information about her, but we know she and several other chihuahuas were taken from a hoarding situation.  Daphne appears to be one of the lucky ones who has had some level of human socialization and is not fearful of people.  We believe she is a younger adult, and are still gathering information about her.

Daphne likes adults who are kind and patient.  She is quick with a wag of the tail and to give kisses. We believe that she will thrive in a patient home without larger animals, and she will begin to understand the joy of being a beloved pet.  Delilah appears to be a healthy girl.  She will be given her vaccinations and will be spayed and microchipped as a part of her adoption process.
