name: Chyna
description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Chyna is again available for adoption!  This beautiful girl originally came to us in April in medical distress.  She had ingested corn cobs and was unable to pass them.  Her owners were unable to afford to provide her with the life-saving surgery she needed, and they surrendered her to our veterinarian.  We were happy to be able to work with our vet (who we think is just the most awesome vet ever, by the way) to provide for Chyna's immediate surgery on a Saturday afternoon.  We then had Chyna vaccinated, spayed and microchipped, and in May she was adopted.  Sadly her adopted family had a job change and she has returned to our care.

We believe Chyna is getting close to a year old now, and she is a big, beautiful, happy, gentle girl.  She is in great health, and she has been housebroken while with her last family.  We are seeking a home for Chyna with knowledgable and responsible owners able to handle a large dog.  Because she is a young lady, she will need an adopter able to properly exercise her.  We would love an active adopter for her!  Chyna has not been recently weighed.  Our best guess is that she is about 50 pounds now.

CARE Rescue is  foster-base rescue located in Richmond, VA.  We do not have a facility for you to come to meet animals at.  You must visit our weekly adoption stand (calendar on our website) to meet the adoptable dogs.  Out of area adoptions can only be facilitated when we are able to find a volunteer to do a home visit for us and when the potential adopter already has a veterinary reference.

name: Blossom
description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Blossom is a two year old chihuahua mix who came to CARE from a local shelter.  She was surrendered by an owner who was no longer able to care for her.  The owner stated that Blossom was housebroken, slept in the bed, loved riding in the car and playing with squeaky toys and was a joy to own.  The only negative mentioned was that Blossom can be an escape artist so will need a secure home.  She is fully grown at about 15 pounds. we believe she may have some Jack Russell terrier in her, as she behaves as one does.

As a part of her adoption process, Blossom has received all her vaccines and has had blood tests to rule out heart worms and tick borne illnesses.  This coming week she will be spayed and microchipped.  We believe she will make an awesome addition to most families, especially those who are active.

name: Rigby
description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Introducing Rigby, a cute little mixed breed dog who is about 3 years old and fully grown at 15 pounds.    The first question most people ask is what the breed of the dog is, and the truth is, we haven't a clue!  We see dachshund, Jack Russell terrier, pug and chihuahua, but your guess is as good as any!  Rigby is a happy, healthy dog who would love to have a home of his own!

Rigby is in good health.  He has been neutered and microchipped, given all his vaccines and has had blood tests to rule out heart worms and tick borne illness.  Rigby will do best in a home with experienced pet owners who have a secure environment.  He is good with other dogs his age, but may be better suited to a home without small children.

name: Rhett
description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Rhett is a beautiful male Redbone hound who our vet believes is 5-6 years old.  This sweet fellow was found in a rural southern VA county as a stray and was totally emaciated, having been on his own for some time, most likely.  Since coming to CARE we have helped him to put on weight and feel loved.  He is a very nice dog who is looking for a family willing to share their home and hearts.

Rhett is in otherwise good health.  He has been given all his vaccines and has had blood tests.  We are very excited to share that he tested negative for heartworms!  He did test positive for erlichia and lyme, both spread by ticks, and we have provided treatment for both.  Rhett will be neutered and microchipped as a part of our adoption process.  He will make a wonderful addition to most any home!

CARE Rescue is  foster-base rescue located in Richmond, VA.  We do not have a facility for you to come to meet animals at. name: Garrett
description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Garrett is a beautiful male Jack Russell terrier mix that came to us from a rural southwestern Virginia shelter.  He is a three year old fellow who weighs just under 30 pounds.  Garrett is vision impaired, and may be unable to see at all.  He is a smart guy, however, and can walk up and down staircases and get around pretty well on a leash.

Garrett loves people and he loves other dogs.  A home with another kind pet would be such a blessing to him.  He is a quiet and cooperative, and deserves to be someone's cherished pet.  Garrett is in good health.  He is neutered and microchipped, up to date with all vaccines and on heartworm prevention.

CARE Rescue is  foster-base rescue located in Richmond, VA.  We do not have a facility for you to come to meet animals at. name: Benji
description:
About Benji AGE-8 years old Energy level- Low to Medium Medical history-Healthy. Current on all shots.   Ideal  home-  Benji ideal home- Benji would do best with a best every 4-6 hours during the day to avoid accidents. Because of his neglectful past, CHR is asking for an all adult household with no frequent visits from young children.      CHR Policies- Please understand that CHR does not adopt out the DC-Metro area or to homes with children under 11 years old.  No exemptions.  Visit our policies page at  http://www.caringheartsrescue.org/policies' ? 



Sweet Benji had a rough start in life but that's all changed now.  This sweetheart loves people and other dogs. Benji is housetrained.  Benji is very relaxed and easy going.  He loves to be petted and snuggles right up to your side. Benji does fine on walks and car rides.  He enjoys food and treats. 

He's on a high end dog food mixed with a little omega oil.  Benji would do great in most home settings.    CHR rescued Benji from the shelter.  He was taken away from his owners and considered a neglect case.  The only real issue Benji has is he doesn't like being groomed.  

We found that having him sedated with medications at the time of his grooming helps.  We have a special groomer located in Springfield, VA who is experienced in grooming dogs who hate being groomed.  Keeping Benji in a shorter cut is ideal to keep things simple and easy going.     


Visit his application link here-  https://fs8.formsite.com/Caringhearts/form10/index.html

name: Tippy
description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Tippy is a gorgeous Akita/Lab mix that we rescued from a high-kill shelter on the day he was to be euthanized.  He is a favorite with our volunteers.  Tippy walks well on a harness and leash and appears crate trained.  He has not been tested with cats but seems good with other large dogs.  Tippy is heart worm positive and has begun treatment.  He is neutered, microchipped and up to date with vaccines.  Learn how to meet and adopt Tippy at www.carerva.com.

name: Charlie
description: Hello, My name is Charlie and I am a sweet young man, looking for a place to call my own! I adore soft things, like blankets, toys and fuzzy socks! I am not a puppy anymore, but if it wasn't for my gray hairs, you would not even know! I am a Corgi-mix and am ready to find a best friend to spend all my days with! I am located in Harrisonburg, VA. My adoption fee is $250 which includes neuter, vaccines and microchip. If you are interested, please fill out an application. Our adoption team will be in touch!

name: Bailey
description: Hello, My name is Bailey and I am a dashing young man, who is in search of my forever home. I love to be where the action is, and am always down for a play session! I am a 5 month German Shepherd mix. I am located in Harrisonburg, VA. My adoption fee is $300 which includes neuter, vaccines and microchip. If you are interested, please fill out an application. Our adoption team will be in touch!

name: Maggie
description: Hello, my name is Maggie, and I am an affectionate snuggle monster who would love to find my new best friend! I love to meet new people and am ready for whatever the day may hold! I am an adorable Cheweenie mix with one cute floppy ear! I am located in Harrisonburg, VA. My adoption fee is $250 which includes spay, vaccines and microchip. If you are interested, please fill out an application. Our adoption team will be in touch!

name: Pamela
description: Hello, my name is Pamela and I would love to be your new best friend! My foster says I enjoy being where the action is, and finding a good sunbeam for a nap! I am a beagle mix, so I do not take up too much room, but be warned, you will not have much since I love to snuggle! I am located in Harrisonburg, VA. My adoption fee is $250 which includes spay, vaccines and microchip. If you are interested, please fill out an application. Our adoption team will be in touch!

name: Nina
description: Nina's foster has informed us that her favorite things to do throw her toys against the wall, meet new dogs and try and kiss her guinea pigs through their cage! She is described as polite, and has already been taught how to sit! This sweet girl is ready to find a home as great as her! Nina is located in Harrisonburg, VA. Her adoption fee is $250 which includes spay, vaccines and micro chip. If you are interested, please fill out an application. Our adoption team will be in touch!

name: Daisy
description: Hello, my name is Daisy and I am a sweet young girl that would love to be a part of your family! I am an easy going kind of gal, that would be perfectly content to hang out with you on the couch, or go for a run in the park! I am located in Harrisonburg, VA. My adoption fee is $250 which includes spay, microchip and vaccines. If you are interested, please fill out an application. Our adoption team will be in touch!

name: Didi
description: Hello my name is Didi and I would love to meet you! I am a young hound/boxer mix who loves to meet new people and enjoys a nice bone! I am located in Harrisonburg, VA. I will be at the Petsmart adoption event this weekend. My adoption fee is $400 which includes spay, vaccines and microchip. If you are interested, please fill out an application. Our adoption team will be in touch!

name: Chucky
description: Hello, my name is Chucky and I am a happy-go-lucky kind of pup that just loves to have fun! I love to go on adventures and be around others! I am a hound/boxer mix with a beautiful blue Merle coat. I am located in Harrisonburg, VA. I will be at the Petsmart Adoption Event this weekend. My adoption fee is $400 which includes neuter, vaccines and microchip. If you are interested, fill out an application. Our adoption team will be in touch!

name: Tommy
description: Hello, my name is Tommy and I am a sweet young man who is looking for a family that I can give all my love to! I am your typical puppy that loves to run, play and just have a great time. I am located in Harrisonburg, VA. I will be at the Petsmart Adoption Event this Saturday. My adoption fee is $400 which includes neuter, vaccines and microchip. If you are interested, fill out an application today!

name: Lil
description: Hello, My name is Lil and I am ready to find my forever home! I am a bouncy, precious puppy who lives each day to its fullest! I am a hound/boxer mix with a beautiful brown brindle coat. I am located in Harrisonburg, VA. I will be at the Petsmart Adoption event this weekend. My adoption fee is $400 which includes spay, vaccines and microchip. If you are interested, fill out an application. Our adoption team will be in touch!

name: Valkyrie
description: Hello my name is Valkyrie, and I am a precious young girl looking for a place to call my own. I have adorable floppy ears, a sleek coat and piercing amber eyes like my sister Roo. I get along with other dogs and love to play and run! I am located in Harrisonburg, VA. My adoption fee is $250 which includes, spay, vaccines and microchip. If you are interested, please fill out an application. Our adoption team will be in touch!

name: Otis
description: Hello, My name is Otis and I am a sweet young fella who is longing for a life-long couch buddy! I am a generally calm dog, but have short zoomies when the moment strikes me! I enjoy a good scratch behind the ears and a nice walk around the park. I am a young hound/beagle mix. I am located in Harrisonburg, VA. My adoption fee is $250 which includes neuter, vaccines and microchip. If you are interested, please fill out an application. Our adoption team will be in touch!

name: Mandy
description: Hello, my name is Mandy and I am a gentle, young lady looking for a family of my own. One of my perks is that I am housebroken! I give gentle kisses and love to be around people. I would prefer to be the only dog in your life, as I need all your attention and love. I have a beautiful brindle coat and chocolate brown eyes. I am located in Harrisonburg, VA. My adoption fee is $250 which includes spay, vaccines and microchip. If you are interested, please fill out an application. Our adoption team will be in touch!

name: Roo
description: Hi, my name is Roo! I'm a sweet girl looking for that perfect person to teach me that life is not so scary! It takes a little patience to win me over, but once you do, I will adore you and become your best friend for life! I love to relax and snuggle on the couch, but I need my playtime too! I love to run around and play with other dogs and giving hugs to humans! I am located in Harrisonburg, VA. My adoption fee is $250 which includes a spay/neuter procedure, microchip, and vaccines. Please complete an application for an animal you are interested in adopting. After completing the application, one of our adoption team members will be in contact with you!

name: Ralph
description:
If there was a show JUST for really goofy hound dogs, Ralph would be a star. 
Ralph is all hound. His best hound buddy, Benny, and he are quite the pair who love to play and romp around our fenced in fields and chase birds together. 

Ralph is about 5 yrs old, 60+ lbs and once his place in the pack is established without a lot of confusion, he is the most loyal, loving, kind dog and will do whatever you ask. He is a protector of his pack. 

Ralph is more laid back but once he decides to get into his zoomies, he creates much laughter for anyone watching...and toys? He can take them or leave them but if he takes them....that too is VERY funny to watch as he just has a blast with himself!

Ralph is very food motivated but knows his \"wait\" commands! 

Please contact Melissa@dogsdeservebetter.org for all the info on this special pup. 
He is located in Smithfield, VA.

name: Bricks
description:
Bricks is one of the most unique little nugget of a dog we know...and we adore him. 
He makes us laugh, smile and appreciate every moment of every day, because he just wants to please!.
This boy is about 3 and a half and...although he may not look it, 50 Lbs. 
He loves his female canine friends and thinks they are a lot of fun.
He only wants to do what will make his person proud. He loves to cuddle but it does take him a sec to realize that is what is wanted, he just gets so excited wanting to be loved or played with. He lives for that!
Bricks deserves a home and really wants you to email melissa@dogsdeservebetter to find out about who he is, what he needs and how much he loves you ....already! 
He is located in Smithfield, VA!

name: Beau
description:
I live in Bernalillo County, New Mexico.

I was rescued from the Valencia County shelter.

My foster mom says I am the sweetest thing ever! I am playful, friendly and love to play outside and explore. I am working on my house training. With the proper introduction, I should be fine with other dogs, cats and respectful children.

I have been microchipped.

At the time of this posting I am 1 year old.

name: Rambo
description:
I live in Bernalillo County, New Mexico.

A home visit is required.

I was rescued from the Valencia County shelter as a stray. 

I am very loving and goofy boy! Scratch my head & Iâll soon be belly up for a belly rub. Iâm great with adults & children. I would love to have acreage to run on but will still need at least a 5-foot secure fence and gate. With the proper introduction I should be fine with another friendly dog. No cats.

I have been microchipped.

At the time of this posting I am 2 years old.

name: Fred
description:
I live in Valencia County, New Mexico.

I was rescued from the jaws of a leg trap in Valencia County. The trap was clamped over my head!

I am getting better, but still very uncomfortable in new situations and new people. Please no tall men or people who move fast. I am done with my house training. With the proper, introduction I should be fine with other small young dogs.

I have been micro-chipped.

At the time of this posting I am 2 years & 8 months old.

name: Minna & Layla
description:
Minna is 5 years old, 12 lbs. and Layla is 3 years old and also 12 lbs.; both are  currently located in Valrico.  

Minna and Layla were turned into rescue after their owner passed away.  Unfortunately they didn't come with any background information as is often the case.  

Both girls are very sweet and playful and are pretty quiet for dachshunds!  They can be a little mischievous when outside and will try and dig under a fence.  Once you call them they will stop and will come to you.   They are avid lizard chasers and catchers so they do enjoy having a fenced in yard to play in.  

They are a bonded pair and love to snuggle together.  They are very easy going and will make a great addition to a family!  

Both have had dentals recently.  

If you are interested in adopting Minna and Layla, please fill out an adoption application on our website at: http://fldr.org/adopt/adoption-application/. The adoption fee is $500 for both dogs.

name: Yeti COURTESY LISTING!
description:
The following dog is not, nor has he ever been, part of our rescue.
We are listing him to help with his rehoming as a courtesy to his current owners.

If you are interested in finding out more about him, please contact the person listed at the end of the following set of notes (provided by his owner, Kenny):

His name is Yeti and his information is below:

1. He is 5 and his birthday is in November. He weighs about 65lbs.
2. He is Neutered. When I brought him back from South Korea, the Korean government required him to be neutered in Order to export him.
3. He is up to date on vaccinations as of May of this year.
4. He is not treated monthly for anything, as none of those are currently in my area and there are no signs of anything.
5. No known issues. Last Vet check was beginning of 2018 when I moved from Vegas to northern Reno.
6. He behaves normally around all. He doesnât like to be âtrapped/blockedâ in. I currently have him around my 2 other dogs whom my ex wife is taking. He is also around other animals from my ex wifeâs mom.
7. Normal routine consists of pretty much outside all day. I live on 40 acres and he runs around it all. He exercises outside all day with the other dogs. He only eats once a day, and it is currently at night around 2000 hours.
8. He is both an inside and outside dog. Does great with both.
9. He knows sit, down, come. He pulls slightly on a leash, but nothing over the top. When he sees other dogs, he is just curious. Wants to smell and normal stuff dogs do.
10. He likes to be pet and loved. The only sensitive part is his tail. When we found him in Korea, he had a rubber band around his tail. The doctors had to cut it to make it healthy. That is the only part about him that is sensitive. You can see it in the photos.
11. He rides in cars fine. Back of trucks too. He hates the vet. Doesnât like to get shots, but it is possible. Can be lifted. Just marks his territory a lot.
12. He has not bitten anybody or any other animals that I am aware of. I just came back from overseas after a year, and my ex wife didnât say anything.
13. No separation anxiety or behavioral issues that I know of. He is kennel trained and dog door trained.
14. I adopted Yeti while I was stationed in Korea. I rescued him from a meat market. He has had all American veterinary care in Korea and well as in the states. Up to date on all shots. The reason Iâm rehoming him is because I got divorced right before my deployment and now that I am back, with the divorce and child support, I can no longer keep a place that can an animal can accompany me. I have to downsize my current lifestyle and living expenses in order to keep my head above water. I have had Yeti since 2014 when he turned 1.
15. I have not contacted any other rescues as of this moment.
16. Best method of contact is 702.823.9275 or kenny032004@gmail.com
17. Address: Reno NV, 89510.

name: Carly
description:
Weight: 45 Lbs.
Female Lab mix
Carly is a llittle timid and she came in with one of her pups from Veguita. She needs love and care. She would be a great campanion for anyone willing to give her time

name: Gaby
description:
\"Gaby\" is an approx 1-yr old, 50-lb handsome neutered male Terrier mix (perhaps Jack Russell/Pit Bull?) who is exceptionally mellow, affectionate and well-behaved. Gaby is friendly with people of all ages and would be appropriate for very young children due to his calm nature. (Yes, he takes treats gently from hand.)

Gaby is great with other dogs and very playful with select dogs. His foster caretaker has four other dogs and Gaby rough houses constantly with the one female dog. However,  Gaby does prefer hanging out w/ his foster caretaker. See a video of Gaby interacting with  a few other dogs at GSRSV's rescue ranch elsewhere on this page.

We have not seen Gaby around cats but my hunch is that he'd be OK with them. We'll consider a home with cats for Gaby.

Gaby is fully housetrained and very well-behaved inside. He's never had an accident indoors even though it's likely he was kept as an outside dog previously. Gaby does not know  even the \"sit\" command, but I was able to get him to sit in just a minute or so with a biscuit as incentive. Oh--Gaby loves treats, so he'll likely be very easy to train. 

Gaby is good on leash and has great recall off-leash. He does not wander far when off-leash. He rides well in a car; in fact, Gaby LOVES to go for car rides!  

Gaby showed up at an RV park/marina along the Sacramento River in June. All efforts to find his owner failed so the man who found him (a friend of GSRSV's) offered to foster him until we could find him a home.

Gaby is located in Verona (small town along the Sacramento River in south Sutter County). His adoption fee is $210.

name: Princess
description:
Princess is an 8-year-old spayed female yellow lab. Princess weighs 32 pounds and is up to date on shots. She is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Princess is a sweet, sweet dog with gentle eyes. She pulls on the leash but only weighs 32 pounds so she is completely manageable.  She was great in the car.  More to follow on this sweet girl.

Princess is from a rural area and have not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. To avoid this, for now we are limiting placement to stand alone single-family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. As we learn more from the dog's time spent in foster, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment and send out an update. 

This dog is available for adoption from Lab Rescue LRCP.   Lab Rescue LRCP rescues and places dogs in Maryland,  Virginia, Washington DC, West Virginia, Pennsylvania, Delaware and North Carolina.  Adopters must travel to Maryland, or Virginia with their family - human and canine - to meet the dog they want to adopt.

Lab Rescue LRCP has between 40 - 80 dogs available for adoption from foster homes across Maryland and Virginia, and at monthly adoption events.  The adoption event dates and locations are listed at www.lab-rescue.org. 

If you are interested in adopting, please visit www.lab-rescue.org and complete an adoption application. After you submit an application, you will hear from an Adoption Coordinator who will guide you through the adoption process. 

An adoption fee is charged to cover the cost of veterinary care and a home visit is required.

description:

Willow #4 is a beautiful young yellow lab who has bounced around a lot in her young life. She is very energetic and has not had formal training so will need a family who will commit to training and regular exercise. She will not do well left alone in a crate for long periods. She is crate trained, housetrained and knows some basic commands. Willow will find ways to amuse herself if left unattended like trash diving and counter surfing â nothing some training wonât fix. This girl is full of energy. She loves people, dogs, playing â she just loves life in general!

Teddy has never had any formal training. He would love an active family who will invest some time in him and give him some much deserved love. Barked at the cats that lived in the farm. He is approved for kids 10 and up.

name: Shelton
description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Shelton is a gorgeous Yorkie mix who is around two years old and fully grown at 19 pounds.  This beautiful boy came to us from a rural southwestern Virginia shelter after being found as a stray.  He is a very nice dog that likes other dogs and loves people!  We think he would make an excellent addition to most families.

Shelton has been thoroughly examined by our vet and appears to be in great health!  He has received initial vaccines, had blood tests to rule out heart worms and tick borne illnesses, and he will be neutered and microchipped as a part of our adoption process.

CARE Rescue is  foster-base rescue located in Richmond, VA.  We do not have a facility for you to come to meet animals at.  You must visit our weekly adoption stand (calendar on our website) to meet the adoptable dogs.  Out of area adoptions can only be facilitated when we are able to find a volunteer to do a home visit for us and when the potential adopter already has a veterinary reference.

name: Honey #3
description:
Honey #3 is a 18-month-old spayed yellow female lab. She weighs 44 pounds 
and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Honey is a real sweetheart and a happy dog although a little confused right now. Honey has had a rough start in life and has bounced from place to place. Honey is looking for a family that can work with her to teach her the greatest way to be a dog and be loved. She does not have a mean bone in her body and loves everyone, except cats. Honey lived in a home with kids 4 and 6 and therefore, approved for kids 4 and up. The owner reports that Honey is very gentle with children. She is good with other dogs, but not cats. She has not had any training and will come with a training addendum. Honey is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. To avoid this, for now we are limiting placement to stand alone single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. Note: Denim is a petite pup who is in heat. Therefore, she will not be spayed until her heat cycle is over. Kids 10 years and up as we have no history. Good with other dogs, but no cat history. More on Denim soon!

Mason is a sweet dog who ended up at the local shelter when his owner died and there was no other family to take him. Mason is very afraid. He must be walked with a harness and double leash to make sure he doesn't bolt if he gets startled while outside. We have no history of Mason having lived with kids, so he is approved for kids 10 and up. He is good with other dogs. Unknown with cats. name: Guthrie
description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Guthrie is a beautiful pure-bred male pug who appears to be around 2 years old.  He came to us from a rural southwestern Virginia shelter where he had been found as a stray and never reclaimed.  Guthrie's nickname could be Bozo for the happy-go-lucky, goofy guy that he is.  He loves people, loves to play and talk with them, loves to run and play with other dogs and just makes you happy every second you spend with him!

Guthrie appears to be in good health.  He has received his initial vaccines and been examined by our vet.  He tested negative for heartworms but positive for erlichea (a tick-borne illness).  He will be treated with antibiotics, neutered and microchipped as a part of our adoption process.

CARE Rescue is  foster-base rescue located in Richmond, VA.  We do not have a facility for you to come to meet animals at.  You must visit our weekly adoption stand (calendar on our website) to meet the adoptable dogs. Buzz is a beautiful black pup with a sweet smile. He likes to play with other dogs and did well meeting other dogs at the shelter. He will need a family that will work on his obedience training and provide adequate exercise for a lab his age. Unknown how Buzz feels about cats.

name: Lachlan
description:
Lachlan is a 2-year-old neutered male black lab. He weighs 58 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children 10 and up.

Lachlan is very friendly and likes to be with you getting petted and attention. He hasn't retrieved yet but goes over and examines toys that you toss then looks at you as if to say what am I supposed to do with this. Not sure he has had any before but we can teach him what they are for. He is a very easy dog and wants to please you. He takes treats very gently. He will be a wonderful addition to a home that has a yard and will give him the attention and exercise he needs. Kids 10 and up as we don't have any history. Good with other dogs, likes playing with the other LR pups at the kennel. No cat history. Knows sit and come, working on down. Lachlan will have a training addendum as he can use some additional training. Pulls on lead as he hasn't been on one much, good with an Easy Walk Harness. Seems to be house and crate trained, keeping his room clean at the kennel. This dog is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. To avoid this, for now we are limiting placement to stand alone single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. name: Dodge
description:
Dodge is a 10-month-old neutered male chocolate lab. Dodge weighs 70 pounds (still growing!) and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 8 and up.

Dodge's Doggerings:
Hi everyone, my name is Dodge. I made it into my foster home after a 2-hour ride. I traveled well even with all my pent-up energy from being at the vet! I'm good with dogs and have met the gang here. I can be a little exuberant in my greeting but I am being given correction; especially by Belle (the lemon beagle). It seems I hadn't had a lot of exposure to other animals so I'm unknown with cats. I'm healthy and up-to-date on everything. I love playing with toys and FM played toss with me today. I would bring it back to her, but I preferred to keep the toy. I know how to \"sit\" when asked, but my butt doesn't always stay there. FM says that I still need to adjust to being here and she knows I will shine!
Love,
Dodge

name: Frazier
description:
Frazier is a 9-month-old neutered black male lab. He weighs 50 pounds 
and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children 10 and up.

Frazier came to us from a rural shelter as a very scared. almost feral pup. He is still leery of new people and situations but is doing much better with his foster/trainer. He is still not ready for full on cuddle fests but he is able to be pet, will even do \"drive by\" lovings and has started to play, giving cute little play bows. His favorite thing of all is playing with all his doggie friends! He will require an adopter who understands his fears and can continue to help him be brave and blossom. He is house and crate trained. He must go with another dog, is unknown but probably OK with cats and approved for kids 10 and up.

Murphy is a gorgeous, very sweet boy with an alert gaze. His foster has been working on hand feeding to gain trust. He is a good boy who will sit and let you handle him all over. He is great in his crate and is house trained. He is good with dogs. Murphy would do best in an adult only, quieter household. He is good with dogs, unknown how he feels about cats. Murphy is looking for a family that is able to provide some training, regular exercise, and lots of love. Chase was given up to the shelter when his owner could no longer care for him. He arrived with an eye infection and skin infection, but is responding well to treatment. His eyes are already looking better and his fur is growing back in. Chase is good with other dogs. Unknown with cats. He is an extremely sweet boy considering all he has had to endure.

name: Gracie #3
description:
Gracie #3 is an almost 2-year-old spayed black female lab. She weighs 44 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Gracie is a happy but shy girl, who loves adorably once she trusts you, but will take a bit of time and some caution to earn that trust. She absolutely loves other dogs, and has never met one she doesn't like. For this girl, the more dogs in her world, the better. If you are giving affection to another dog, her curiosity will get the better of her and she'll almost immediately come up to investigate. She can be a bit hand shy, even once she trusts you, so just needs humans that will go slow and understand to give her time. When she's in her element, she is silly, rolling on the grass, spinning around and zooming as fast as she can to play \"tag\" with the other dogs. And she's REALLY fast. She enjoys napping on the couch, and will allow herself to be a pillow for the other dogs. She also likes to sleep in bed with her humans and is incredibly silly in the mornings as she considers the bed a safe zone - she'll roll on her back and beg for belly rubs and play bitey-face. She especially loves when the other dogs join in the fun. She's excellent in the crate, and foster mom has spied her sleeping in the crate belly up while she's at work. Gracie prefers to eat alone, and will quickly eat her meals in her crate, or in a separate room, but is nervous eating in front of humans, unless it's people food that you are sharing with her (which she loves!). Her leash skills are pretty good, but she would prefer walking on quiet streets and not on a busy road. Gracie is a shy dog, and is always going to be a bit shy. She warms up to new people, but prefers them in small groups and not making a lot of noise, please. She's not the dog for you if you have rambunctious teenagers (or adults), throw parties often, or if you're looking for a dog to take everywhere with you. She started her life sheltered in a pen, and didn't get the socialization with humans she should have at an early age, so they make her a bit nervous. She's incredibly sweet and loving, and will reward you with her sweet, happy, silly self if you give her love, patience and understanding. 

This dog is available for adoption from Lab Rescue LRCP.   Lab Rescue LRCP rescues and places dogs in Maryland,  Virginia, Washington DC, West Virginia, Pennsylvania, Delaware and northeast North Carolina (30 miles east of I-95 and north of the Pamlico Sound.)  Adopters must travel to Maryland, or Virginia with their family - human and canine - to meet the dog they want to adopt.

Lab Rescue LRCP has between 40 - 80 dogs available for adoption from foster homes across Maryland and Virginia, and at monthly adoption events.  The adoption event dates and locations are listed at www.lab-rescue.org.

An adoption fee is charged to cover the cost of veterinary care and a home visit is required.

description:
Old Man River is a 10-year-old unaltered male black lab. Old Man River weighs 46 pounds and is up to date on shots. He is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Old Man River was found as a stray before arriving at Lab Rescue.  He is currently un-altered and needs to gain weight before he can be neutered. He is good with other dogs and unknown with cats. More on this sweet elder gentleman as we get to know him.

Old Man River is from a rural area and have not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. To avoid this, for now we are limiting placement to stand alone single-family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. As we learn more from the dog's time spent in foster, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment and send out an update.

name: Boogie
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.This sweetheart is en route from Texas and will be available Saturday (9/14). This is a perfect sized companion. He is very sweet! He isn't a big fan of the ride from Texas to Virginia, and would so enjoy a loving family to welcoming with their last name!

For more information and to apply, visit http://petrescuealliance.com

name: Steel
description:
Steel is a 1.5-year-old neutered male black lab. Steel weighs 40 pounds and is up to date on shots. He is approved for homes and townhomes with children 10 and up.

Hi! Iâm Steel. I am a sweet âpocket-size labby boyâ at 40lbs. I can be a bit shy initially but once I get comfortable, I will shower you with kisses and follow you everywhere. I am having fun playing with my foster sister and brother in the yard and going for walks by the river. I also enjoy playing fetch with foster Mom and she tells me what a good boy I am for bringing the ball back to her and dropping it at her feet. I am house and crate trained and learning the art of walking on leash. Give me a chance and I will be your best friend!

name: Shadow #2
description:
Shadow #2 is a 5-year-old neutered male black lab. Shadow weighs 50 pounds and is up to date on shots. He is approved for homes with children ages 8 and up.

My name is Shadow. I am 5 years old. I am the best boy according to my foster mom. I love to walk on the leash and I am very receptive to your pace (I slow down when you slow down and speed up if you do!) I am great in the backyard and love to run and play. Toys are my favorite. FM calls me silly boy because I like to get the zoomies when I stumble upon a toy I wasn't expecting. I am not a big fan of getting on the furniture. I love treats and snuggles. I do amazing in my crate. I don't make a sound in my crate and kennel up when told to! I am only a jumper when I get excited but not on people, just jump like a kangroao. I am townhouse approved and approved for children ages 8 and up.

name: Kayla
description:
Kayla is an 8-year-old spayed chocolate female lab. She weighs 81 pounds but needs to lose about 5 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Kayla is a happy chocolate girl who likes belly rubs and running in the yard. She has been a loving and attentive mommy to multiple litters of puppies and now she is ready to take her turn in the spotlight. Sheâs a friendly girl with lots of energy who would do best with a family that will give her plenty of playtime outside, long walks, and lots of love. Kayla is good with dogs, but not cats and approved for kids 10 and up. Kayla is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. To avoid this, for now we are limiting placement to stand alone single-family homes or townhomes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. As we learn more from the dog's time spent in foster, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment and send out an update. 

Foster family reports: Kayla has a vivacious, energetic personality. After spending much of her life outdoors, she is excited to be in her foster home. Her tail has not stopped wagging! She thinks she's a lap dog and would crawl in your lap with the slightest encouragement. She introduced herself to the resident lab with play bows and ran zoomies with him. She is friendly without being either dominant or submissive. Kayla had no problem navigating the hardwood floors. She can zoom up and down stairs. She likes watching TV, especially animal shows and Litter Robot advertisements, which bring her to her feet everytime. (Must be the cat!) She also enjoys watching squirrels outside. This former breeder girl had a litter quite recently and still has enlarged mammaries. She weighs 80 lbs but should weigh ~75. She shows interest in meeting children (approved age 10+). Kayla rode well in the car and walks nicely in an Easy Walk harness. She loved her first walk in the park. Although she came from a rural area, she does not seem bothered by traffic or loud noises. Kayla is food motivated, which should help with refreshing commands. Kayla is settling nicely into her foster home. She was a little over-amped when she first arrived but now she is able to settle in the house. She enjoys playing with the resident lab, and in fact, she is usually the initiator of play! She likes taking walks around the neighborhood, and we discovered that she is a retriever. Kayla did not appear to know her name or any commands, so we are working to teach her basic commands and leash skills. She walks pretty well with an EZ-Walk harness, doesn't pull, but will sniff a lot if you let her. She needs to be tethered in the car until she knows her commands or she will be in the driver's lap. She is not crated when we leave the house and she does not disturb anything. Kayla is super loving and affectionate. She has all the most desirable lab traits! She is a velcro dog to foster mom, but seems to do most of her lab leans on the men she meets. She has met the neighbors and their dogs and impressed them with her friendliness and beauty. Other dogs really like her, so she appears to share good vibes! We don't know yet whether she likes water. Her background continues to mystify us. She was photographed at intake living on a chain, but she also knows her way around a house, is interested in human food and would like to get up on the furniture (although not allowed by her current foster). Kayla is quite energetic for her age and will need regular walks and/or active time in the yard. Since she doesn't bark, navigates stairs easily and can be exercised on leash, Kayla is now approved for townhouses on a case-by-case basis.

name: Roscoe
description:
Roscoe is a sweet, friendly, easygoing beagle. He is 6 years young, 30 pounds, and came from rural Virginia. Roscoe approaches all people, kids, and dogs that he meets with a friendly wag. Roscoe is great with cats. He is completely house trained and sleeps through the night on his dog bed. He is good on a leash and loves to go on walks. Roscoe loves to hang out and cuddle on the couch. He is well behaved and has a calm demeanor. Have you got an open spot on the couch? Come meet Roscoe! He'd love to fill it.Accuracy is not guaranteed; however, information provided is accurate to the best of our knowledge.

For more information on the pet, please send an email to info@aforeverhome.org

name: Arlo
description: NEW â 7 SEPTEMBER 2019: Arlo is a 6-year-old beagle boy who is playful, friendly and good with other dogs. As you can see from his picture, he could put on a little weight. Heâs super sweet, fairly quiet and low key, but he will engage in a playful romp if he has a willing playmate. He was a stray from the Madison County Animal Shelter in Virginia, so his history is unknown. He is available for fostering or adoption.

name: Bella #12
description:
Bella #12 is a 7-year-old spayed female chocolate lab. Bella #12 weighs 103 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Bella #12 is a chunky, curly coated chocolate girl who used to live on a farm with 2 other labs and an indoor cat. Even though leash walking is new, she is starting to grasp the idea. She is a pretty strong gal, so an EasyWalk harness makes all the difference in the world. Bella isnât all that much into toys, but she does love to play and swim in the water. She isnât used to spending long hours alone, but hasnât shown any anxiety when left alone at her foster home. She is quiet and submissive but will bark once or twice at new people or dogs. Bella is not destructive at all and is housebroken. She has not been crated for the last 6 years or so. She does enjoy sleeping on the couch during the day and in the bedroom at night. Bella enjoys her car rides and never has to be asked twice to get in the car. 

UPDATE from Bellaâs foster family:  Bella is adorable. So sweet, completely housebroken, sleeps all night. She LOVES to go on walks. She gets so excited jumping up & down on her front feet! She's very smart & knows commands.. sit, shake, down, stay & wait. She's very good at stay! She will play with a toy for a while and she always meet me at the door with a toy in her mouth when I come home. I do not crate her and she's fine. She has not gotten into anything or torn anything up. She's pretty good on a leash but could use some more leash training because she is strong and used to being off leash on the farm. We are working on her diet and exercise regime! 

This dog is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people.  For now we are limiting placement to standalone, single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area.  As we learn more about the dogâs time spent in foster care, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment.

name: Nina
description:
Nina is a 3.5-year-old spayed female yellow lab. Nina weighs 78 pounds and is up to date on shots. She is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Nina is a sweet girl. Nina has limited vision due to one of her eyes being sunken in. The shelter's vet thought it was either an old injury or a birth defect. Nina is good with dogs smaller than her but isn't quite sure about larger dogs due to her limited vision. So the shelter thinks Nina may be better with larger dogs with slow introductions. Nina is not a good fit for cats.

Nina is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. For now, to avoid this, we are limiting placement to standalone, single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. After Nina has been in a foster home for at least a week or two, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment and will send out an update.

name: Loki #3
description:
Loki #3 is a 4-year-old neutered yellow male lab. He weighs 64 pounds but needs to gain about 3 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Loki is a very friendly boy but is very scared and can be a flight risk. He needs to he walked with a harness and double leashed, so he cannot back out of his collar if he gets scared. Loki was tested on lead with other dogs at the shelter and did great. We don't know how Loki is with cats. There's no kid history for Loki, so he's approved for kids ages 10 and up. Loki is beautiful and a sweet boy. He rides well and takes treats gently. Loki is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. For now, to avoid this, we are limiting placement to standalone, single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. After Loki has been in a foster home for at least a week or two, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment and will send out an update.

name: Louise
description:
Louise is a 5-year-old spayed black female. She weighs 34 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Louise is an adorable, petite, and quiet girl who came from a hoarding situation. She is looking for a family to make her feel special and loved. She rode quietly in a crate in the car. She spent many months in a temporary foster home in WV and she is used to living with other dogs, so she will need to go to a home with another dog. She is good with dogs, unknown with cats, and approved for kids 10 and up. Louise is sweet, docile, and affectionate. She barks very little and she hasnât had any accidents inside the house. She always goes outside to do her business and is very good on a leash. Louise is still a little shy around new people; just a few pets from the right person will capture her heart and she will capture theirs. 

Foster family reports:  Louise (âLuluâ) is slowing coming out of her shell. Watching and helping her learn about the sweetness of life has been amazing. Lulu has been pretty clear about her likes and dislikes. She dislikes noise and unpredictability. She loves food (especially chicken!), chilling in a quiet space, walks on quiet paths, dog toys, and calm human and canine company. She plays with her foster brother and approaches dogs on walks with confidence. Sweet Lulu is house- and crate-trained, very quiet, and as gentle as they come. She asks for nothing but a patient family with a dog that will continue to pamper her and appreciate the joy of seeing this girl blossom.

name: Millie
description:
Millie is a 3.5-year-old spayed yellow female lab. She weighs 66 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Millie is good with other dogs. She was dog tested at the shelter and was fine. No cats for Millie because she will chase cats if they run. There's no kid history for Millie, so she's approved for kids ages 10 and up. Millie is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. For now, to avoid this, we are limiting placement to standalone, single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. After Millie has been in a foster home for at least a week or two, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment and will send out an update. More on Millie soon! 

Foster family reports: Millie was feeling a bit under the weather but is doing much better and is ready to look for her new home! Millie is a wonderful pup. She is very loving and sweet and paid no attention to the caged bunnies in her previous foster. She did well in the crate, and seems to be house trained! She enjoyed playing with other pups but can be a bit bossy. She will likely do well with dogs who don't mind a more assertive lady.

name: Candi
description:
Candi is a 7-month-old spayed female black lab. Candi weighs 31 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Candi is a very sweet and friendly pup. She got pregnant when she was about 7 months old, probably just after her first heat, and was an excellent mother to her puppies Claire & Brianna. Now that the pups have been adopted it is time for Candi to find her forever home. She has nice house manners and has free run of the house. At night she sleeps on a dog bed in the bedroom. Like all young, active dogs, she will need some additional training. Candi gets along fine with the resident dog and visiting dogs too. She enjoys plundering the toy chest. If you are sitting on the couch, she will join you to be close. She likes everyone she meets. 

This dog is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people.  For now we are limiting placement to standalone, single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. name: Lincoln
description: If you are interested in adopting this dog, please fill out our dog adoption questionnaire and e-mail it to MJ at mj@mjcrain.com. PLEASE VISIT THIS WEBSITE TO FIND THE ADOPTION QUESTIONNAIRE: http://www.homewardtrails.org/adopt-a-pet/adoption-forms/ Hi there! My name is Lady (I am also called Lincoln but I have no idea why). I was rescued from a seizure case in rural Virginia and now I need a forever home! I am petite - about 20 inches tall and weigh about 20 lbs. I am about 4 years old and have been spayed. Maybe I am part Shibu Inu, Feist, or Mountain Cur or ????. I am a little shy and can be anxious when around new people and larger crowds. When I am inside and get to know you I relax and love to sit in your lap! People seem to like the fact that I am quiet and seldom feel the need to bark. I was adopted and returned to Homeward Trails, because I escaped first over a five-foot fence, and then another time I slipped out of my harness. I now have an industrial strength harness for walks. I guess I deserve it! I do like car rides, am housetrained, and I am waiting to give you a lot of love if you can help build my confidence and love me in return. My adoption fee is $375 and my adoption coordinator is MJ Crain. Please fill out an adoption questionnaire and email MJ at mj@mjcrain.com if you might be my forever home. Note from MJ: Lincoln needs some help with socialization. She is shy and can be and anxious when she is around new people and larger crowds. When she is inside her home she is very relaxed and loving. Lincoln's ideal home would be with experienced dog owners and maybe even a calm confident dog as well. She is very sweet, has a lot of love to give, and will bond quickly. Adoption Coordinator: MJ Crain Location: Foster home Breed: Maybe Shibu Inu, Feist, ???? Weight: 20lbs. Personality: Shy; very loving when she gets to know you Housetrained: Yes The adoption fee for this dog is $375. This fee INCLUDES spay/neuter and microchip. We are proud to partner with the following veterinarians who offer a free first exam for your animal, exclusively for HT adopters: Caring Hands Animal Hospital, Palisades Veterinary Clinic, Sunshine Animal Hospital and Clarendon Animal Care and all VCA Animal Hospitals. Additionally, any VCA hospital will cover illnesses up to $250 at no cost to any Homeward Trails adopter. We also provide a 30-minute phone consult with a professional dog trainer at Fur-Get Me Not within the first 30 days of adopting - just for HT adopters in the Arlington/Alexandria area. Start your new dog out on the right foot with this valuable, expert advice and guidance FREE! COME MEET ADOPTABLE DOGS EVERY SATURDAY AND SUNDAY from 10AM - 4PM at the Homeward Trails Adoption Center- 11116 Fairfax Station Road, Fairfax Station VA 22039! **Note that puppies are in foster homes, not at the Adoption Center.

name: Rose
description:
Rose is a 10-year-old spayed female yellow lab. Rose weighs 60 pounds and is up to date on shots. She is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Rose is a very sweet and loving girl. She had a rough life and is very happy that lab rescue brought her in and especially to her fosters. She plays very well with the resident lab, sleeps on the couch with foster dad and cuddles on the couch with resident lab when play time is over. She has the best soulful eyes that are just screaming. THANK YOU! 

Rose is great with dogs and people but cats and kids are unknown. Therefore, approved for kids 10 and older. During Rose's exam, the vet noticed a lump in her throat. They asperated the lump and sadly she was diagnosed with thyroid cancer. She is not in any pain and unfortunately it is inoperable. She is not showing symptoms of being sick and continues to go about her day, playing with the other dogs, following foster mom around, snuggling on the couch, and constantly being spoiled. Sadly, Rose is considered to be in hospice right now. 

Rose is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. To avoid this, for now we are limiting placement to stand alone single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. As we learn more from the dog's time spent in foster, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment and send out an update.

name: Gunner
description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Gunner is a precious male chihuahua who came to us recently from a local Virginia shelter partner. This little guy was part of a hoarding seizure and is understandably scared of new people and new situations. He is thought to be about a year old and fully grown at seven pounds. He will be best served by a patient and experienced owner who is able to help him learn to trust and love.

Gunner has been examined and appears to be in good health.  That said, he has tested positive for heart worms.  We have begun a slow kill treatment, and he will be neutered as a part of our adoption process.  Gunner has received vaccines and has been microchipped.

CARE Rescue is  foster-base rescue located in Richmond, VA.  We do not have a facility for you to come to meet animals at.  You must visit our weekly adoption stand (calendar on our website) to meet the adoptable dogs.  Out of area adoptions can only be facilitated when we are able to find a volunteer to do a home visit for us and when the potential adopter already has a veterinary reference.

name: Leya
description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Leya is a darling chihuahua/pomeranian mix who is just under a year old and fully grown at just 10 pounds.  She came to us from a rural southwestern Virginia shelter partner where she had been found as a stray.  Leya is a happy, healthy, energetic puppy who loves people and loves other dogs!

Leya has been examined and appears to be in great health.  She has been given vaccinations, been microchipped, has had blood tests to rule out heart worms, and will be spayed as a part of our adoption process.  We believe she would make a great addition to most homes!

CARE Rescue is  foster-base rescue located in Richmond, VA.  We do not have a facility for you to come to meet animals at.  You must visit our weekly adoption stand (calendar on our website) to meet the adoptable dogs.  Out of area adoptions can only be facilitated when we are able to find a volunteer to do a home visit for us and when the potential adopter already has a veterinary reference.

name: Kendall
description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Kendall is a precious mixed breed male puppy who was one of four in the litter that came to us recently from a southwest Virginia shelter partner. This little guy was born sometime around Easter, and he is thought to be a Yorkie mix. He is expected to stay small and be less than 20 pounds fully grown. This little fellow will surely steal your heart!

Kendall is completing his puppy vaccines. Until they are complete it will be very important that he not be exposed to other animals and possible contagions. We will look for a home with a secure yard that can keep him safe. Our puppy policy is on our website and we encourage interested adopters to learn about it. This policy helps us choose homes that we are sure our pups can thrive in. Kendall will be neutered and microchipped as a part of our adoption process, also.

CARE Rescue is  foster-base rescue located in Richmond, VA.  We do not have a facility for you to come to meet animals at.  You must visit our weekly adoption stand (calendar on our website) to meet the adoptable dogs.  Out of area adoptions can only be facilitated when we are able to find a volunteer to do a home visit for us and when the potential adopter already has a veterinary reference.

name: Rudy #2
description:
RUDY is a 9-year-old neutered male yellow lab. Rudy weighs 57 pounds and is up to date on shots. He is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

This sweet boy loves everyone. He thinks humans are great despite the fact that his past human did not take great care of him. He was allowed to wander around and when he wanrered into the wrong yard he was attacked by the dog that lived there. Once at the shelter his owner was called who never showed up to take him home.  Rudy would love a home that will allow him to give his love and have a soft bed and some ear scratches in return. Maybe a few treats as well. 

Foster update: Rudy is doing great in his foster home! He really warmed up to his fosters and is a sweet, affectionate boy. He has done well in his crate when alone during the day and sleeps in bed with the teenage daughter at night without problem. He gets along well with other dogs he encounters on walks. He does pull a little at squirrels, but he is not bad at all. He is learning to know the difference between his toys and general household items:) He is trying to work on sit, and heâs starting to learn no. Rudy loves to chase and fetch a ball, and his face shows the pure joy he has at sharing the fun!

Rudy is from a rural area and have not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. To avoid this, for now we are limiting placement to stand alone single-family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. As we learn more from the dog's time spent in foster, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment and send out an update. 

This dog is available for adoption from Lab Rescue LRCP.   Lab Rescue LRCP rescues and places dogs in Maryland,  Virginia, Washington DC, West Virginia, Pennsylvania, Delaware and North Carolina.  Adopters must travel to Maryland, or Virginia with their family - human and canine - to meet the dog they want to adopt.

Lab Rescue LRCP has between 40 - 80 dogs available for adoption from foster homes across Maryland and Virginia, and at monthly adoption events.  The adoption event dates and locations are listed at www.lab-rescue.org. 

If you are interested in adopting, please visit www.lab-rescue.org and complete an adoption application. After you submit an application, you will hear from an Adoption Coordinator who will guide you through the adoption process. 

An adoption fee is charged to cover the cost of veterinary care and a home visit is required.

name: Sammy #3
description:
Sammy #3 is an 8-year-old neutered male yellow lab. Sammy weighs 100 pounds and is up to date on shots. He is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Sammy is having a blast at doggie day care. He is described as a huge party animal. He is great with people and good with dogs. He would make a great running/hiking partner. He is huge dog so, he is doing to need someone who can handle his 100lbs. He does have some fence fighting tendency's so a sold fence and/or one where no other dog is on the other side would be more ideal. He is a leash puller so his new home will need to work with him on that. Sammy is a 100lb lap dog with no personal space. He likes to be in the room with you but he is not the type to get up on the couch for a snuggle. He enjoys his humans company but on the floor is his own space. 

This dog is available for adoption from Lab Rescue LRCP.   Lab Rescue LRCP rescues and places dogs in Maryland,  Virginia, Washington DC, West Virginia, Pennsylvania, Delaware and North Carolina.  Adopters must travel to Maryland, or Virginia with their family - human and canine - to meet the dog they want to adopt.

name: Regina
description:
Regina s a 1-year-old spayed female fox red lab. Regina weighs 26 pounds and is up to date on shots. She is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Regina is a very sweet and slightly shy girl. She is a bit slow to warm up to people but once she does she will show you just how sweet she is. She play bows and wiggles her entire body when she sees foster mom. Once she is comfortable with you she will surprise you by stealing kisses when she can. She would benefit most in a somewhat quieter household and a patient one so she can blossom at a more relaxed pace.  Regina gave birth to a rainbow of girls 8 weeks ago. Now that the girls are weaned she is looking for her fur-ever home. All of Regina's puppies have been adopted, and Regina has adjusted very well to life without little ones. She sleeps in a dog bed in the master bedroom. She loves to chase toys and will toss them up into the air with joy. She now tries to engage the resident dogs in play with lots of play bows and quick dashes away. She still LOVES to be outside as much as possible. Currently, she refuses all treats and loses all interest in other activities when strangers are around (this is a change from just a few weeks ago when she settled down nicely with female guests). She continues to change and make progress each week, so it may be a phase that she works through quickly. Her adoptive family will need to be patient while she adjusts to the changes in her life. She still needs to gain a few pounds - she is a picky eater, but will happily munch a dose of Philadelphia cream cheese:). 

Regina is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. For now, to avoid this, we are limiting placement to standalone, single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. After she has been in a foster home for at least a week or two, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment and will send out an update. 

This dog is available for adoption from Lab Rescue LRCP.   Lab Rescue LRCP rescues and places dogs in Maryland,  Virginia, Washington DC, West Virginia, Pennsylvania, Delaware and North Carolina.  Adopters must travel to Maryland, or Virginia with their family - human and canine - to meet the dog they want to adopt.

An adoption fee is charged to cover the cost of veterinary care and a home visit is required.

name: Carla
description:
Carla is a 12-year-old spayed female chocolate lab. Carla weighs 46 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 8 and up.

Carla is a lovely, mature chocolate lady whose family is moving and cannot take her. She loves people and being around them getting cuddled and petted. She knows basic commands and has full run of the house. She is good with other dogs and used to live with a Yorkie, but we were told she doesn't like cats. Carla is looking for a loving family that will spoil her in her golden years. 

This dog is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people.  For now we are limiting placement to standalone, single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area.  As we learn more about the dogâs time spent in foster care, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment.

name: Papi
description: Papi is a sweet 7 year old (think he is older--he was a previous rescue from a shelter) weighing 9.4 lbs. He is neutered, heart worm negative, and had a recent dental. He doesn't see well out of one eye possible cataract). Something approaching on that side can startle him easily. Papi came to us from a veterinarian in southern Virginia. Papi's owner left him with the vet because he was too much trouble and didn't want him any longer. Papi was at the vets for severe skin allergies which had been an issue on a yearly basis.  Initially when he came to me he didn't have much hair but it has all grown back and looking healthy. He has been doing well with medication and prescription skin shampoo.  Papi usually needs a belly band even though he goes outside. He is usually very timid although he gets excited sometimes especially for a treat. He would do best with a family where someone is home most of the time. If you feel you can love this precious boy with his issues, please submit an adoption application to the American Maltese Association Rescue at wwwe.americanmalteserescue.org. He is being fostered in Bristow, VA.

name: Lakota Mato (Bear)
description:
Lakota is a 2-year-old boy born July 2017 who came to us from a shelter where his previous owners dumped him. He was purchased as a puppy and lived most of his life outside. He is still learning all the fun things life has to offer and good manners. He is a little unsure about things and how to behave. He is learning to trust humans again and we are providing consistency and patience so he can blossom. At two he still is mouthy and jumpy but we are working with him and already are seeing improvements. We have started working on Zen and he loves it. He enjoys companionship and is opening up nicely.  We are so glad Lakota is with the CHAAMP family!

Lakota would do best in a home with no young children. He did well when seeing other dogs on walks and we will continue to work with him and see how he does with a female companion. He is super smart and knows how to sit. He had us fooled in the beginning but he will sit now nicely when asked (a treat helps) and he will need continued positive training to be the best pup he can be. 

If you are interested in adopting or fostering this dog, please contact CHAAMP at CHAAMPapplication@gmail.com for an application. You may also complete an application online thru our web site, www.CHAAMP.org

CHAAMP accepts applications ONLY from Maryland, New Jersey, New York, Pennsylvania, Virginia, West Virginia, and Washington DC. The information on your application will help CHAAMP determine which of our dogs is a good match for you and your family, based upon your lifestyle, other pets, etc. A home visit is required prior to all adoptions. Many of our dogs are fostered in private homes and cannot be visited until you have been approved for adoption. 

ADOPTION FEES
~Adult dogs, the fee is $275.00  
~Older dogs (eight years old or over) the adoption fee is $100.00 
~Puppies between 6 months and 1 year are $350.00 
~Puppies under 6 months old are $375.00 

All dogs are micro chipped, spayed and neutered and up to date on vaccines. These fees help us cover these costs.  The rates are higher for puppies because they require more visits to the vet and shots. 

CHAAMP IS NOT A SHELTER. We are volunteers over a 7-state area dedicated to helping Malamutes in our rescue area. You can read more about Malamutes and about CHAAMP by visiting www.CHAAMP.org

name: Stella
description: If you are interested in adopting this dog, please fill out our dog adoption questionnaire and e-mail it to adoptioncenter@homewardtrails.org PLEASE VISIT THIS WEBSITE TO FIND THE ADOPTION QUESTIONNAIRE: http://www.homewardtrails.org/adopt-a-pet/adoption-forms/ Stella was rescued from a hoarding situation in rural Virginia with 12 other hounds. Can you give Stella a forever home? Adoption Coordinator: Homeward Trails Adoption Center Location: Homeward Trails Adoption Center The adoption fee for this dog is $375. This fee INCLUDES spay/neuter and microchip. We are proud to partner with the following veterinarians who offer a free first exam for your animal, exclusively for HT adopters: Caring Hands Animal Hospital, Palisades Veterinary Clinic, Sunshine Animal Hospital and Clarendon Animal Care and all VCA Animal Hospitals. Additionally, any VCA hospital will cover illnesses up to $250 at no cost to any Homeward Trails adopter. We also provide a 30-minute phone consult with a professional dog trainer at Fur-Get Me Not within the first 30 days of adopting - just for HT adopters in the Arlington/Alexandria area. Start your new dog out on the right foot with this valuable, expert advice and guidance FREE! COME MEET ADOPTABLE DOGS EVERY SATURDAY AND SUNDAY from 10AM - 4PM at the Homeward Trails Adoption Center- 11116 Fairfax Station Road, Fairfax Station VA 22039! **Note that puppies are in foster homes, not at the Adoption Center.

name: Monkey
description:
Monkey is a 5-year-old spayed black female lab. She weighs 56 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Monkey is a happy and friendly dog. She enjoys being in the yard, but think she would be just as happy to be a couch potato and hang with you. Hasn't shown any interest in playing with toys yet. She sits nicely for treats and takes them gently. She does fine when she goes out to play in the yard with our other pups. Think she would be happy to be a couch potato and just hang with you. She would like a family that has a yard for her to play in to give her the exercise she needs. Misty is now at a fosters and is living with 3 other dogs without problems. Kids 10 and up as we have no history. Good with other dogs has been out in the yard with other Lab Rescue dogs with no problems. No cat history. Knows sit, down and come. Good on lead. Is house and crate trained as she is keeping her room clean at the kennel and at her fosters. Monkey is a very affectionate and loving pup. She enjoys walking and is calm and easy on leash. She gets a bit excited when she sees a squirrel. She enjoyed her bath. She is food-motivated and will come running anytime she hears a bag being opened. Monkey is from a rural area and have not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. To avoid this, for now we are limiting placement to stand alone single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. As we learn more from the dog's time spent in foster, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment and send out an update. 

Foster family reports: Monkey is sad because summer is almost over and she will not be able to wear her hat and shades anymore - she will have to shop for a scarf! She is a very good sport and is willing to sport attire to entertain her foster family. Her foster dad took her to Petco and she did great. She enjoyed the yummy smells and seeing all the other dogs. Monkey says hello and wants to share that she is a very calm and well behaved pup! She loves to lay around with her foster parents and the resident dogs. She likes to relax and loves rolling on her back and wriggling around so her tummy can be scratched. Monkey is very obedient and knows basic commands, such as sit and stay. She likes taking walks with her foster family and sitting outside on the deck, watching the world go by. She definitely watches for the rabbits to zoom past! Monkey's foster mom took her to Starbucks for a Puppercino and she loved it!


This dog is available for adoption from Lab Rescue LRCP.   Lab Rescue LRCP rescues and places dogs in Maryland,  Virginia, Washington DC, West Virginia, Pennsylvania, Delaware and North Carolina. name: Chops
description:
Chops is a 10-month-old neutered male yellow lab. Chops weighs 55 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Chops came to us as a very scared pup, but his foster has been working very hard to socialize him and let him know that people and the world are not so bad. He has been building his confidence a little at a time. He is good with dogs but is still a puppy at heart, so can be a little annoying to the older, less playful dogs. He has become much more attentive to people and has started to show more affection and enjoy human contact more. His foster has been working with the collar and leash, but he still sometimes \"gator rolls\" when the leash goes on so a fenced yard is a must for him. 

Chopâs perfect adopter would be: 
1) A home with less chaos and a family that is willing to show patience and continue to help him grow and learn. 
2) A home with another dog to help him with confidence. 
3) Someone willing to possibly \"visit\" with him a few times before taking him home

This dog is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people.  For now we are limiting placement to standalone, single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area.  As we learn more about the dogâs time spent in foster care, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment.

name: Buddy #4
description:
Buddy #4 is a 10-month-old neutered male yellow lab. Buddy #4 weighs 45 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Buddy #4 is a very happy boy who loves everyone, two-legged and four-legged. He enjoys his walks and is well mannered when he sees other dogs, both large and small. He does have a few quirks which training should easily correct:  placing his paws on your shoulders while seated on the couch, thinking you want to continue playing after he \"releases\" a toy or bone, barking at strangers at the door until he gets to meet them (he remembers them on subsequent visits so that is pretty handy). He does not have an aggressive bone in his body. Buddy is trustworthy alone at home and is not crated at night. Buddy is a great little guy!

This dog is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people.  For now we are limiting placement to standalone, single family homes or townhomes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area.  As we learn more about the dogâs time spent in foster care, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment.

This dog is available for adoption from Lab Rescue LRCP.   Lab Rescue LRCP rescues and places dogs in Maryland,  Virginia, Washington DC, West Virginia, Pennsylvania, Delaware and North Carolina.
