name: Mojo
description:
Mojo is a 2-year-old neutered black male lab. He weighs 57 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children 10 and up.

Mojo is a happy dog whose tail never stops wagging. He likes to retrieve both balls and toys, will bring them back except if he really likes a particular toy. He has a good nose and found the treats in no time and took them gently. Training will probably come easy as he is motivated to please and loves treats. Mojo enjoys being brushed and petted, and as a reward he will lean into you to show how much he likes it. He would like a family that will give him play time, training and exercise. Kids 10 and up as we have no history. Good with other dogs, has been out with other LR pups at the kennel with no problems. Unknown with cats. Mojo knows sit, come, and down but will have a training addendum. He pulls on lead a little when walking and is better with an Easy Walk Harness. He is crate trained, may be house trained as he is keeping his room clean at the kennel. Mojo is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. To avoid this, for now we are limiting placement to stand alone single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. As we learn more from the dog's time spent in foster, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment and send out an update. 

Foster family reports: Mojo is a super sweet love bug that enjoys the company of his people. He has completed his heartworm rest period and is looking for a family that will help him burn off his puppy energy. He knows sit down and wait (for his meal), but he needs some help with some other basic manners. 


This dog is available for adoption from Lab Rescue LRCP.   Lab Rescue LRCP rescues and places dogs in Maryland,  Virginia, Washington DC, West Virginia, Pennsylvania, Delaware and North Carolina.  Adopters must travel to Maryland, or Virginia with their family - human and canine - to meet the dog they want to adopt.

name: Charlotte
description: This gorgeous girl is Charlotte, a 5 year old, mature, Tree Walker Coonhound.  After retiring from her demanding hunting job in rural West Virginia, Charlotte is happy to kick back and relax in the Virginia Country side.  She has learned to appreciate the finer things in life like a warm fluffy bed, a full belly, and lots of fun walks.  Since her arrival, Charlotte has learned to walk beautifully on a leash.  She enjoys going on walks so much that we would prefer to adopt her to a family that would enjoy taking her for frequent, long walks. Charlotte is still new to indoor life and may need some guidance when she first goes to a new home. However, with time, patience and love we know Charlotte would make a wonderful companion for any family.

name: Jax
description:
Jax is a 1-year-old neutered male yellow lab. Jax weighs 55 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up. Jax is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people, so Jax is approved for placement to stand alone single-family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area for now. 

Jax's teacher was grateful that he was such a good student. Because he grew up in a pen with his siblings and wasn't exposed to a lot of things, he can be a bit timid when you first meet, but he has a lovely disposition and warms up quickly. He enjoys the outdoors and taking hikes. He loves to run around the yard and will need to go to a family with a physical fence. Jax needs a family who will not leave him alone for a long work day. He is used to being with other dogs and loves their company. After he gets the right amount of exercise, he settles down for a nap. He doesn't like to be crated much, so that is a work in progress and he can stay for short periods with a frozen kong, or a favorite durable toy. This young boy has already proven that with the right amount of exercise and continued obedience training, he will be an amazing companion for someone who puts in the time. He comes with a complimentary 7-week Good Manners class at Peaceable Paws in Fairplay, MD. He is excited to find a forever home with a doggy buddy:) 

UPDATE FROM THE FOSTER: This sweet boy is very gentle and loving. He wants to be with companions, both canine and human. Jax has excellent leash manners, loves walks and is learning to go for runs with his foster brother. Jax loves being with other pups (the more the merrier!) and people. Nothing beats a good cuddle session after a full day of play - check out his snuggle with the resident black lab in the photos. If you like exciting outdoor adventures followed by late afternoon naps in the sunny spot, Jax is a perfect match. Jax had fun where he got to run on the trail, wrestle with the other dogs, and play with the humans. He squeezed in a nap in the sunny spot, beating the other pups to it. He loves to meet new people and dogs and play, play, play. This pup is full of joy and energy, and would love a family to share it with him!

This dog is available for adoption from Lab Rescue LRCP.   Lab Rescue LRCP rescues and places dogs in Maryland,  Virginia, Washington DC, West Virginia, Pennsylvania, Delaware and North Carolina.  Adopters must travel to Maryland, or Virginia with their family - human and canine - to meet the dog they want to adopt.

Lab Rescue LRCP has between 40 - 80 dogs available for adoption from foster homes across Maryland and Virginia, and at monthly adoption events.  The adoption event dates and locations are listed at www.lab-rescue.org.

name: Buddy
description: Buddy is a really chill 7-year-old collie male. He was rescued from Missouri along with dogs from a puppy mill, and when he arrived in Virginia, we took him into Collie Rescue, Inc. Buddy is a sweet, well-mannered guy who loves to be around people. He is housebroken. We are currently treating him for heartworm. Buddy is currently shaved, but will grow his hair back long. Check back soon for more information about Buddy as we get to know him. If you are interested in rescuing a collie, please complete this short adoption questionnaire. Our standard adoption fee is $350. This fee helps us to cover the expense of providing each dog with a Health Exam, Rabies/DHPP vaccines, Heartworm Test, Heartworm Preventative, Flea & Tick Protection, Microchip, Neuter/Spay, and a Bath. Thank you for your consideration in adopting a collie in need!!!

name: Drake #4
description:
Drake is a 3-year-old neutered male black lab. Drake weighs 63 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children 10 and up.

Drake is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people, so Drake is approved for placement to stand alone single-family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area for now. 

Drake is a stunning black adorable male. He is doing great and loves his people! Drake thinks that he is the top dog and no one can come close to his looks therefore he is not a fan of other dogs so, he will need a home with no other dogs in the home so he can be the lone supermodel. He is affectionate and sweet but, will need someone to stand firm on the rules of the house. He is house and crate trained and knows all of his basic commands.Â Drake is a sweet and awesomely happy boy! Heâs a big, beautiful, block-headed dog that just wants to be in your lap. Drake knows sit and shake and appears to be crate trained. He slept quietly all night in his crate. Drake likes to retrieve. 

UPDATE FROM THE FOSTER: Drake is play time all day, and he has a full-on body wag! Handsome blockhead black lab, who is toy-obsessed and just wants to have fun. He loves attention and is doing well in training and with doggie day care. He is great with his people. Has a killer lab-lean and is very affectionate once he gets to know you. Drake is fine walking past other dogs on leash, but has no interest in engaging them to play. He is great with people but, not a fan of other dogs so, he needs to be the only dog in the household. Drake is learning his commands and loves human attention. Drake is full of life, and a huge fan of toys and tennis balls - he will even entertain himself. He needs to loose a few pounds, but playing fetch daily in the yard should definitely help him along with his weight-watchers program. He is a big fan of people and lots of fun. You won't regret giving this boy his forever home!  Drake is such an happy camper and so excited about life he rarely stands still - even when trying to get a picture to show the world how gorgeous he is. He's got the classic big blocky head and thick otter tail. He is not the most cuddly until you take him on an 8 mile hike - maybe after that he will snuggle of the couch. Drake thinks there is a lot to life and he is ready to see it all!!

name: Sheba 0725
description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Hi there. I'm Sheba. I was picked up as a stray in Texas in July and brought to my foster home at the end of October. I am spayed and have never been pregnant so I was likely not a stray for very long. I am heartworm positive, but will he treated by SSR

I had an interesting first 24 hours with my new foster dad. He picked me up from the nice ladies who drove me all the way from Texas to Virginia and took me straight to a place where I got a bath. I was very good for my bath and allowed him to do all the things that he had to do to get me \"clean\". I thought I was just fine the way I was but the warm water was nice. I then met the 2 owners of the house, Duke who is a German Shepherd like me and Lily who is a Border Collie mix. They smelled Ok, I guess. I did not pay too much attention to them. I then had a look around the house. While I was doing that my foster dad got some food for me which I ate really quickly. He says I am \"overly enthusiastic\" when I eat and I try to see what is on the kitchen counters a lot, but I am just really hungry and it is hard to get over not knowing when your next meal will be. I slept in a crate all night and was so tired, I did not fuss at all.

I then went for a walk around the block. It was a nice walk and I just followed my foster dad. I don't usually pull on the leash but sometimes when I see a squirrel or fox or deer I want to chase them. I don't try too hard to do that because my leash and collar stop me and I don't want to pull too hard.

In the morning I went to the vet. I was very good for the doctor and let her do all the things she needed to. I did not complain at all.

I sometimes chase my tail and chew on it. I also have a bit of a hotspot on my back but that is clearing up. We are going to ask about my tail, though. I have chewed through much of the hair there.

I always like to be with my foster dad but sometimes he puts me in a crate. That is ok but I don't like it when I hear him but can't be with him. I try and jump around in my crate and make noises so he will come get me out. If he does not then I will stop after 5 minutes or so. I am good with being in my crate at night and when he goes out, though.

I understand a few of the words dad uses to ask me to do things. I know sit, stay (although for these I usually will expect a treat at some point), and come. There are others but he has not figured them out and I am surely not going to tell him what they are. Gotta make him work for it. I have gotten along well with my foster brother and sister so far. I have met dogs when we walk and they have seemed nice. I am not sure how I feel about cats but if they run I will chase them so dad does not think I would be good with them.

A couple of days after I got to Virginia there was something called Halloween. Not sure what that was but dad and I sat outside while a bunch of strange small people came up to the house. Dad said I was very well behaved and I let a lot of them pet me. There were some really small ones, too.

My foster dad tells me I am nice to have around and once I figure out that I will never have to worry about eating so I am not so enthusiastic about my food (and treats) and stop counter surfing, I will be a really awesome family member.

If you want to see more about my day to day progress, click this link https://trello.com/b/ce6g2fmk. It will take you a web page called \"Trello\" where you can read more about me and see pictures.

If you want to contact my foster dad about me, he gave me my own email address. It is sheba@ennoil.comIf you are an approved adopter and are interested in this dog, please let your case worker know. If you are not yet an approved adopter but are interested, please complete an adoption application!
You can review our adoption process, www.shenandoahrescue.org/adoption-process if interested. Donations can be made at shenandoahrescue.org/donate or on PayPal to info@shenandoahrescue.org

name: Rulcho
description:
Rulcho is a 2-year-old neutered male black lab. Rulcho weighs 55 pounds and is up to date on shots. He is approved for homes with children 10 and up.

Foster update:  Rulcho has really blossomed in his foster! He has become much more confident and outgoing. He loves other dogs, especially Blondie :-) He loves toys and really loves food puzzles. He has done great with meeting new people. He is great in the crate and good on leash. He would love a quiet home with a confident owner and a doggie friend would be ideal! 

Rulcho is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. For now, to avoid this, we are limiting placement to standalone, single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. After Rulcho has been in a foster home for at least a week or two, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment and will send out an update.

name: Smokey Joe & Princess Anne
description:
Princess Anne is a 13-year-old spayed female black lab. Smokey Joe is a 13-year old neutered male black lab.  Princess Anne weighs 84 pounds and is up to date on shots. Smokey Joe weighs 105 pounds and is up to date on shots.  These dogs are a bonded pair who must be adopted together.  They are approved for homes and townhomes with children ages 10 and up.

Foster update:  Smokey and Princess are a bonded brother and sister pair, ready to face whatever life sends their way! Life sent this precious pair a curve ball when their owner could no longer care for them. Now theyâre hoping Lab Rescue will send them a family who can appreciate the bounty of benefits that come with adding a senior (or 2) to your family: loving, laid back, house trained, donât need tons of exercise, gentle with kids, off the charts adorable frosted faces! These sweet seniors would be an easy addition to any family. 

Princess and Smokey here! Foster mom went on vacation so we did too! Now we're back and time to unpack our tennis balls. We had a great time at our vacation foster home. We got to go to some neighborhood parties and we even helped supervise a litter of foster puppies that came for a short visit. Our favorite part of the vacation was the teenagers! They would rub our ears and scratch our bellies and throw tennis balls for us in the yard! Sometimes we had to wait until lunchtime for them to wake up, but they were really fun to play with. We're happy to be back with foster mom, but we're still hoping that someone out there has a permanent place in their heart and their home for us. We are an easy pair that just continues to demonstrate how adaptable and easy going we are. From 10 days living in a hotel to 3 weeks with a vacation foster, we make ourselves at home and adapt to new people and places easily. All we need is a yard with some tennis balls and some people to love and snuggle! 

These dogs are available for adoption from Lab Rescue LRCP.   Lab Rescue LRCP rescues and places dogs in Maryland,  Virginia, Washington DC, West Virginia, Pennsylvania, Delaware and North Carolina. name: Toby
description:
Toby is a 10-year-old neutered male black lab. Toby weighs 76 pounds and is up to date on shots. He is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Toby needs to spend his senior years with a family that will love and care for him every day. They will get a truly grateful, loving dog, perfect for taking along on adventures because his loyalty and loving personality will put smiles on any family that calls him theirs. 

Foster update:  Toby is a total sweetheart! He loves hanging out with his humans and is quite willing to be loved on:) He does well with the senior resident lab and enjoys their walks, trotting along side-by-side. He is more energetic than expected for his age and would enjoy long walks or a light run. Toby is not a fan of the crate, but that is okay because he can be trusted to have the run of the house. He does not care to be separated from his people when they are home (what lab does?!). 

Toby is approved for kids 7 and up, he previously lived with a boy and a girl and he loved to be with them. He is good with other dogs but no cats as he will chase them. Toby knows sit, shake, fetch and laydown. He pulls some on lead and would benefit from an Easy Walk harness. He is crate trained and has been keeping his room clean at the kennel.  He is also trained to an invisible fence. 

Toby is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. To avoid this, for now we are limiting placement to stand alone single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. As we learn more from the dog's time spent in foster, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment and send out an update. 

Toby is Heartworm Positive. Heartworm is highly treatable and treatment will be provided, at no cost to the adopter, at one of Lab Rescue's designated vets. Completing Heartworm treatment at the veterinarian designated by the Rescue is a requirement of adoption. Adopters can learn more about Heartworm at www.lab-rescue.org/heartworm.

name: Scout #2
description:
Scout #2 is a 3-year-old neutered male yellow lab. Scout weighs 50 pounds and is up to date on shots. He is approved for homes with children ages 15 and up.

Foster update:  Scout is a shy sweetheart who is getting used to life in the city. He rode like a dream for the long drive from the vet to his foster. He is doing fine in a townhouse and learned to negotiate the stairs. He isnât crazy about being put in his crate, but he will quiet down quickly and is content to sleep there. Scout doesnât pull on his leash unless he spies a squirrel or rabbit and he seems okay with traffic noises. He ignores the cat. 

Scout loves to be near to his people and wants to have his foster in sight at all times, or better yet, snooze beside her on the couch. He needs a calm home and adopters that will be patient as he learns more about the world! Scout needs to gain confidence but he is so eager to please and is a real love bug! Scout takes a few minutes to warm up but, if you get down on the ground and let him come to you - he will warm up and snuggle. He loves treats. He will need an experienced owner who will continue with his training to teach him that life can be fun!

name: Pepe
description:
Pepe is a 3-year-old neutered male black lab. Pepe weighs 35 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for adult-only homes.

Pepe is a fantastic lap dog with a soft shiny coat! He gives the sweetest kisses and loves to snuggle. This little guy is super smart and has learned some new tricks including up, spin, and paw. He loves to show off his skills in exchange for treats and praise, and he is always eager to learn more. 

Foster update: Pepe has only been with us for the last 3 days, but he is a wonderful guest. His favorite thing to do is just cuddle with you on the couch. Second favorite is working on a bone, but he will put it down in a moment if someone comes into the room. Pepe doesnât touch a thing that doesnât belong to him and is housebroken to the max. He is crated for a couple hours a couple times a week to stay in practice, but there is really no reason to keep him crated- he would be a great buddy for someone who does work a full day since he can easily entertain himself. The most he barks is a single âWoofâ to tell the crazy dogs to go play elsewhere. He is a couch potato who insists on sleeping with his babies, which he sometimes carries around. Pepe is gentle with treats and stretches out a meal until the next one. He is great in the car, just occasionally panting. Pepe is also well behaved on leash and is doing fine behind a 4â fence. 

This dog is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people.  For now we are limiting placement to standalone, single family homes or townhomes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area.  As we learn more about the dogâs time spent in foster care, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment.

Lab Rescue LRCP rescues and places dogs in Maryland,  Virginia, Washington DC, West Virginia, Pennsylvania, Delaware and northeast North Carolina (30 miles east of I-95 and north of the Pamlico Sound.)  Adopters must travel to Maryland, or Virginia with their family - human and canine - to meet the dog they want to adopt.

name: Pokie
description:
Pokie is a 9-year-old neutered male chocolate lab. Pokie weighs 61 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Pokie is an exceptionally loving, sweet boy that adores all people and his toys. This silly boy has a toy on him at all times - so much so that we've had to teach him to check his toy at the door before he goes outside. Pokie has exceptional house manners. He is fully house trained and has full run of the house while we're out. He also loves going for rides in the car. Pokie is quiet and only lets out an occasional bark when there's someone at the door. Pokie is partially blind due to complications from diabetes, but he does see shadows and gets around just fine. He loves running around the yard and playing ball (he listens for the bounce and is quite good at locating it). His diabetes is well controlled with two injections a day that are quite easy to do. Pokie's other passion is food and he equates getting his insulin with a biscuit, so he eagerly sits in anticipation of getting his injection and treat. He would do well as an only dog or have a laid back doggy companion. No kitties. Pokie has so much love to give his forever family. He is such a sweet gentleman, LOVES people, toys and catching some rays. Pokie is mostly blind due to diabetes, but runs full speed around the house. He has excellent house manners and is a complete sweetheart. Pokie would do great as an only dog or with another super laid back companion. 

Foster family reports: Pokie is a wonderful companion. He loves to play with people and is getting along with the pack. Pokie adores everyone he meets and is very affectionate. Pokie loves to play ball (he tracks very well with his hearing). He is perfect in the house - he has never had an accident or gotten into anything he shouldnât. His thyroid and diabetes management have remained very stable. He would probably do best with a quiet doggy sibling or on his own. 


This dog is available for adoption from Lab Rescue LRCP.   Lab Rescue LRCP rescues and places dogs in Maryland, Virginia, Washington DC, West Virginia, Pennsylvania, Delaware and North Carolina. name: Reiko
description: NEW - 1 NOVEMBER 2018: Reiko is a 6-year-old neutered male beagle mix who is super sweet, reserved and good with other dogs. He weighs about 32 pounds. He is very loyal and attuned to his person. He thinks heâs a lap dog and loves to give kisses! He was a stray from Green County in Virginia, so his history is unknown.

name: Maui
description:
Updated 1/27/19 - Hey everyone, itâs me, Maui. I know itâs been awhile so I thought Iâd let you know how Iâm doing here in my foster home. Itâs been great. We had a nice Christmas and foster mom was very impressed that I didnât try to potty on the tree. Really mom??? I know better than that. All my business is done outside.
I have been a very good boy. I now have run of the house and only go into my crate when I want to, not because I have to. I like to follow my foster dad. He is my buddy. He calls me his shadow. Guess that is a good thing. I only bark when I see something outside or my foster sisters bark. Iâm a pretty quiet guy. And I still love my belly rubs!
My foster sisters are fun to have around. Buttercup and I play in the yard and I help Violet track rabbits. Thatâs not as much fun as playing. 
As much as I am having fun here, what I really would like is a home of my own. I know my forever home is out there. If you meet me, I know you will just fall in love with me. Iâm that kind of a guy. 





UPDATE - 23 OCTOBER 2018: Hey there, Iâm Maui. And I just have to tell you that I love being in a home!! I have been with my foster family for over a week. I have a real cool Mom and Dad and 2 awesome sisters. I have several warm and comfy beds to choose from. Or on occasion, I may curl up on a chair. I get 2 meals a day and a yard to run around in. Life is good!! Especially when I get belly rubs, which I ask for often. I will roll over on my side or back and Mom will rub my belly. She thinks itâs cute.

My Mom says that I am a good boy. I do all my business outside and I keep my crate clean and dry during the day. I enjoy running in the yard with my sister. And we like to play and rough house. Itâs so much fun.

Now donât get me wrong, I really like it here. But what would really be even better is if I had a forever home of my own. That would make my life perfect.
 So if you are looking for a fun loving, easy going good boy, check me out. I wonât disappoint.


NEW - 8 OCTOBER 2018: Maui is a 6-year-old neutered male beagle/basset mix who is friendly and good with most dogs. He has a heart murmur, but you wouldnât know it by his activity level. The vet says he can still have a long, healthy life. He was a stray from Green County Animal Shelter in Virginia, so his history is unknown. He is available for fostering or adoption.

name: Pasha
description: NEW - 4 OCTOBER 2018: Pasha is a 4 to 5-year-old spayed and fully vetted beagle that weighs a little under 30 pounds. Sheâs a taller beagle. She is friendly and good with other dogs. She was a stray from Amelia County Animal Shelter in Virginia, so her history is unknown. She is available for fostering or adoption.

name: Garrett
description:
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Garrett is a beautiful male Jack Russell terrier mix that came to us from a rural southwestern Virginia shelter.  He is a three year old fellow who weighs just under 30 pounds.  Garrett is vision impaired, and may be unable to see at all.  He is a smart guy, however, and can walk up and down staircases and get around pretty well on a leash.

Garrett loves people and he loves other dogs.  A home with another kind pet would be such a blessing to him.  He is a quiet and cooperative, and deserves to be someone's cherished pet.  Garrett is in good health.  He is neutered and microchipped, up to date with all vaccines and on heartworm prevention.

CARE Rescue is  foster-base rescue located in Richmond, VA.  We do not have a facility for you to come to meet animals at.  You must visit our weekly adoption stand (calendar on our website) to meet the adoptable dogs.  Out of area adoptions can only be facilitated when we are able to find a volunteer to do a home visit for us and when the potential adopter already has a veterinary reference.

name: Zeke
description: NEW - 25 JUNE 2018: Zeke is a 5-year-old beagle who is friendly and good with other dogs. He weighs about 30 pounds. He was a stray from the Louisa County Animal Shelter in Virginia, so his history is unknown. He will be available soon.

name: Fergus & Jamie #2
description:
Fergus and Jamie #2 are 8-year-old neutered black male labs. Fergus weighs 68 pounds and Jamie weighs 80 pounds. Both need to gain a few pounds. Fergus & Jamie are a bonded pair and must be adopted together. 
Both are up to date on shots. These dogs are approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Fergus & Jamie are in pretty rough shape but we can fix that. What we don't need to fix is their wonderful spirit and love they have to give. They like to be with you and get like attention.  Jamie will put his head in your lap while Fergus prefers to put a paw in your lap. They are happy to meet everyone with their tails wagging and like getting their bellies and head rubbed. They are inside dogs that like to go outside. They are bonded and will be adopted together. Fergus & Jamie would like a home with a family that will give them lots of love and has a yard where they can play. Kids 10 and up as we have no history Good with other dogs, have been out with other dogs. No cats history. Knows sit, down come. Pulls some on lead settled down after a couple of minutes. Good with an Easy Walk Harness. Crate trained probably house trained, they are keeping their room clean at the kennel. Fergus & Jamie are from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. To avoid this, for now we are limiting placement to stand alone single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. As we learn more from the dog's time spent in foster, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment and send out an update.

name: Dagwood
description:
Dagwood is a 1-year-old neutered yellow male lab. He weighs 70 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Dagwood is a super sweet boy! When he first came to us he was very scared and timid. He has really come out of his shell and he loves people! He is still leery of other dogs, mostly those that are \"in your face\" type dogs. He does well with dogs that just coexist with him and do not try to initiate too much. He gets a little intimated if shown too much attention by another dog. Dagwood has lots of good points. He is good on leash and loves to go on group walks. He is affectionate and well behaved. He is housebroken. He also presents his challenges. He is terrified of a crate and will try to break out. He is an escape artist with containment, possibly from his formative years of having to live in a pen with MANY other dogs. He would be best placed with someone who is home most of the time or where he could go with them a lot. We do not have any cat history on him and he is approved for kids 10 and up.

name: Honey #2
description:
Honey #2 is a 4-year-old spayed yellow female lab. She weighs 59 pounds 
and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Honey is a smart dog who likes to be with you to keep you company. She likes to be petted and thinks getting her coat brushed is great. She explores everything around and likes to retrieve her Nylabone. She takes treats gently and gives kisses as a reward. She likes to go out and play but thinks she should be an inside dog. Honey would love family that will give her attention and has a yard for her to play in. They will be getting a super dog. Kids 10 and up as we have no history. Good with other dogs, has been out with other Lab Rescue dogs. No cat history Knows sit, down and come. Pulls some on lead, better with an Easy Walk Harness. Reported as Crate & house trained by the shelter and the vet. Honey came into the shelter as a stray, she looks like she has had a couple of litters in the past. Honey is a friendly and active dog, she has manners and likes to play. He will make some family a great addition to their family.

name: Milton #2
description:
Milton #2 is a 3-year-old neutered chocolate male lab. He weighs 64 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Milton is an adorable and mellow boy who was found as a stray walking around a neighborhood. He has big brown eyes, and we can't wait to see him smile. Milton is looking for a family to make him feel special and loved. He rode quietly in the car and waited to go outside to do his business. He is good with dogs, unknown with cats, and approved for kids 10 and up. Milton is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. To avoid this, for now we are limiting placement to stand alone single-family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. As we learn more from the dog's time spent in foster, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment and send out an update. 

Update: Milton #2 is the sweetest chocolate in town. He is waiting patiently at the kennel for a chance to go to a foster home. He knows how to sit for treats and he is very friendly. This boy will make someone very happy.

name: Durkes
description:
Durkes is a 16-month-old neutered chocolate male lab. He weighs 64 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children 10 and up.

Durkes is a very handsome chocolate lab whose family is moving and cannot take him. He was a family dog but has been spending most of his day in his crate and would love a family who will give him regular exercise to burn his typical young lab energy. He has not had any training so he will have a training addendum. He is very affectionate and loves to play. Durkes is good with kids but has not lived with any, so he is approved for kids 10 and up. Heâs good with other dogs. Durkes is unknown with cats. Durkes is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. To avoid this, for now we are limiting placement to stand alone single-family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. As we learn more from the dog's time spent in foster, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment and send out an update.

name: Tanner
description:
Tanner is an 8.5-year-old neutered male yellow lab. Tanner weighs 81 pounds and is up to date on shots. He is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Tanner is a super sweet, charming guy who likes to chase tennis balls and hang out in the yard. He has a friendly smile, big brown eyes, and ears that are longer than your list of things to do! This boy is ready to find a family that will shower him with affection, take him for walks, and toss him tennis balls until their arms are tired. 

Tanner met the resident cats, got over being excited about them and moved on to being curious and a bit mesmerized by them. He does not chase them, or pounce on them to get them to run. He just likes to stand there and sniff them. Tanner knows \"sit\" and loves to give you his paw.  He also loves to sleep on the bed - making it obvious that he's been an inside dog at some point. Tanner listens well, and does as he's asked. He is house-trained and is a terrific boy! 

Tanner is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. To avoid this, for now we are limiting placement to stand alone single-family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. As we learn more from the dog's time spent in foster, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment and send out an update.

name: Scrappy
description:
Scrappy is a 4-year-old neutered male black lab. Scrappy weighs 70 pounds and is up to date on shots. He is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Come Meet Scrappy! This young guy is a sweet, playful, young guy who would fit into almost any home. He loves his toys, his 9 year old human foster brother and playing with the other resident furry friends. Scrappy is house broken, crate trained, walks good on a leash and knows several commands. If you are looking for a younger fella to be your best friend who has average energy and loves to eat, Scrappy is your guy! Scrappy is a good rider. He is good with other dogs but can be a little too rambunctious for very small dogs. Unknown with cats but we don't think cats would be a good idea. Approved for kids 10 and up.

This dog is available for adoption from Lab Rescue LRCP.   Lab Rescue LRCP rescues and places dogs in Maryland,  Virginia, Washington DC, West Virginia, Pennsylvania, Delaware and North Carolina. Lab Rescue LRCP has between 40 - 80 dogs available for adoption from foster homes across Maryland and Virginia, and at monthly adoption events.  The adoption event dates and locations are listed at www.lab-rescue.org.

name: Baby
description:
Baby is a 6 month-old spayed female black lab. Baby weighs 30 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Baby is the most charming, sweetest little pup. She is fearless and loves everyone and everything. She especially adores water! When foster mom was cleaning and refilling the pup pools in the yard, Baby had so much fun chasing the water and carrying the hose. She loves to cuddle and will fall asleep on the couch snuggled up with the other dogs, or next to foster mom. She loves playing with the big dogs and does her very best to keep up with them. She's curious about everything and loves to explore. Baby was born with a neurological condition that affects her movement. She sometimes weaves or stumbles when walking, and needs to be watched near stairs. She is on a low dose of Prednisone and 5mg of Omeprazole once/day to prevent an upset stomach. But this delightful girl still approaches everything full of excitement and joy. She is looking for someone who has a huge heart and maybe a friendly resident dog that will be her buddy. If you have a place in your heart for this sweet, sweet girl, her love will reward you ten-fold.

UPDATE from Babyâs foster family:  Baby's favorite thing to do is play with other dogs and snuggle with them or her humans. She often is found sleeping belly up, as close as she can get to the other dogs or foster mom, and snoring... She loves the new dog bed that she can nuzzle up in as well. Baby is learning to use the ramp to go down the short grouping of stairs outside to the yard, and is getting better at it! She is also learning to go up the big staircase in the house and doing great! She has found her voice and foster mom affectionately refers to her as \"bossy\" when she barks because she wants to do something and hasn't quite figured out how yet. She also likes to bark at the big dogs to get them to play bitey-face with her on the couch. She's a sweet, silly, special girl, who is looking for forever humans that understand her limitations and help her break down the walls when she can. 

This dog is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people.  For now we are limiting placement to standalone, single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area.  As we learn more about the dogâs time spent in foster care, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment.

name: Marley #2
description:
Marley #2 is an 8-year-old spayed yellow female lab. She weighs 95 pounds but needs to lose about 20 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Marley is a very sweet girl. She would love to meet you so she can give you love and attention. She loves to be with you to play and get petted which I don't think she had a lot of until she came to us. She enjoys being outside playing with other dogs but thinks being inside with people is better. She is not interested in running around outside retrieving but will go get treats which she takes very nicely. She likes to go on walks which is good as she has to lose some extra weight. We see a vegetable and fruit diet in her future! Marley would like to meet a family that will give her love and attention. Kids 10 and up as we don't have history. Good with other dogs has been out with other LR pups at the kennel with no problems. No cat history. Knows sit, come and sometimes down. Not bad on lead, better when walking with an Easy Walk Harness. Crate trained, probably house trained as she is keeping her room clean at the kennel. If you are looking for a laid back, gentle soul, consider Marley. This dog is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. To avoid this, for now we are limiting placement to stand alone single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. As we learn more from the dog's time spent in foster, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded. 

Foster family reports: Update We know that Marley is not her real name so we're trying different names. Right now we're calling her Penny, so we'll see. A couple more facts about Marley/Penny. We're not sure how she got to be so large but she's the most food-unmotivated lab! She may or may not eat her breakfast and she's really not into fruits or veggies. Her thyroid has been tested and is fine. We've never had a pup take treats so gently. We're used to the \"you may lose your fingers\" type of lab. Marley/Penny will go to the door if she needs to do her business. She would like a family who's willing to take the time with her to help her feel comfortable and loved. She'd also like a couple walks a day to help her build up her stamina and lose some of those pesky pounds. She recently visited with a friend for a weekend sleepover and met two very dog-savvy cats. She initially appeared to want to play with them but that was more effort than she wanted to expend and she laid back down. Marley/Penny found the toy basket, and although she is not a huge player or retriever, she periodically picks up a tennis ball and brings it to you or gnaws on one of the many bones all over the house. She LOVES her walks she doesn't go far and not too fast but she loves all the smells and all the people and dogs met so far. Marley/Penny is a very easy dog that requires little more than a place to sleep, a few pats on her head, some belly scratches and some food. Do you have room in your heart and home for Penny?

name: Sully
description:
Sully is a 2-year-old neutered male black lab. Sully weighs 46 pounds and is up to date on shots. He is approved for homes with children 10 and up.

Sully is a sweet shy little guy who takes a bit to warm up. He is doing well in doggie day care and learning the ropes with his k-9 friends. He is looking for a family that will help him work on his training and show him the fun side of life. Sully loves to run so if you are an avid runner and or enjoy long hikes, Sully is your man! Also, Sully can be nervous and shy when he is exposed to new situations. His new family needs to go slow with anything that is new for him (situations, environments, people and dog intros) and help him to understand that the world is an okay place. Sully has excellent house manners and enjoys affection from his people. 

Sully is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. For now, to avoid this, we are limiting placement to standalone, single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. After he has been in a foster home for at least a week or two, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment and will send out an update.

name: Blake
description:
Blake is a 5-year-old neutered yellow male lab. He weighs 62 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 10 and up.

Blake is a sweet, happy boy. He is good with other dogs and used to live with two others in his previous home. We don't know how Blake is with cats. He is very curious and is quite interested in all the daily activity of the suburbs. He loves to look out the window at home and in the car. He has been fascinated by joggers and was completely mesmerized by a sprinkler. He has been very interested in everything the family is doing. He likes to lay in the kitchen while we are cooking and eating dinner, but never begs or gets into the garbage. Blake does not bark and does not jump on strangers. He has not had the opportunity to learn basic commands but has demonstrated he can learn quickly and responds when you correct him. He went from crazy dog on a leash to a calmer and responsive walker on the harness. Blake will make a great addition to a family and will quickly bond. He has loads of personality and has perfect house manners.

UPDATE from Blakeâs foster family:  Blake is a sweet, sweet boy and is doing great in his foster townhome. He is housebroken and has free reign over the house when his foster needs to be gone. He has not been crated; he did scratch at the door when left alone initially, but calmed after a couple of days. His foster works-from-home, so he does get a potty break every four hours. Blake is great with the fosterâs teenager. He knows sit, and he quickly learned paw! He is a great eater, is not protective of his food, and sleeps through the night. He gets excited when you first get home and tends to jump, but that is something that can be trained. Blake is a love bug and loves snuggling in your bed or the sofa - he would a family that will let him on the furniture:) 

Blake is a playful guy and walks ~4 miles each day to expend his energy. He is very strong, and his handler needs to be prepared for him to pull hard if he senses something he wants to investigate. He is learning to walk on a leash and doing MUCH better, but ongoing training is needed. He wants to meet people and dogs on his walks and does well; he has not spent time alone with other pups while with his fosters. Blake is a cuddly, fun-loving boy and is the perfect match for a family willing to give him the exercise and ongoing training he needs. 

Blake is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people. If dogs are overwhelmed by their environment, they can exhibit behaviors like excessive barking. For now, to avoid this, we are limiting placement to standalone, single family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area. After Blake has been in a foster home for at least a week or two, we will evaluate if placement can be expanded to include a more urban environment and will send out an update. He has loads of personality and has perfect house manners.

name: Duke #3
description:
Duke is a 4-year-old neutered male fox red lab. Duke weighs 73 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 16 and up. Duke is from a rural area and has not been exposed to traffic, noise, or groups of people, so Duke is approved for placement to stand alone single-family homes in a suburban neighborhood or rural area for now. 

Duke is an adorable boy with a dark honey colored coat, a sweet sugar dipped muzzle, and gorgeous golden eyes. This lovable guy enjoys snuggling with his stuffies, riding in the car, and relaxing with his humans. He does well in his crate and doesn't mind sleeping in there at night. He is very friendly, but can take some time to warm up to new situations. Once he does, he's a happy boy with a tail that won't stop wagging. Duke knows basic commands and is crate/house trained. He does pull on leash so an easy walk harness is recommended. Duke is loving life at doggie day care. He is very loving and is having fun meeting new people and pups. He enjoys getting petted and has a great lab lean. :) He will actively seek attention from his people with a nose nudge. If you are sitting down, he will place his chin on your lap or put his nose under your hand to get affection. 

UPDATE FROM THE FOSTER: Duke is not shy at all. He is an in your face, happy-go-lucky, and go along all the time. He is a jumping bean (except he is BIG). He's full of energy, but happy to do anything for a treat or a toy! Duke loves all stuffiesâ¦ however, he loves to destroy them more. Do you have a lot of stuffies that need destroying? Duke is your guy.

Adopters must travel to Maryland, or Virginia with their family - human and canine - to meet the dog they want to adopt.

name: Ginger #2
description:
Ginger is a 13-year-old spayed female yellow lab. Ginger weighs 72 pounds and is up to date on shots. This dog is approved for homes with children ages 8 and up.

Ginger is a sweet, smart, gentle lady who enjoys snuggling, swimming, and going for walks. This pretty brown-eyed girl has good manners in the house, sleeps all night in a cozy dog bed, knows multiple commands, and walks well on a leash. Sheâs pretty close to perfect! Ginger is a fun, active girl who doesnât need much and is ready to find a family that has room for a laid-back love bug in their lives. Sheâs generally fine to be left alone for about 6 hours, but she needs a home where she won't be alone for a long work day. There are just a few things Ginger canât do in her golden years - like stairs. Sheâs okay on a few, but a whole flight is too much for her. She also needs help getting into a car. Ginger LOVES to sleep in the bedroom. She gets along with all of the resident dogs, and even the resident cat. Sometimes she doesn't like to share her toys, so as long as there are plenty of toys to be had, she will be a happy camper! She has been learning to take treats gently and responds to \"easy.\" She'll be a great addition to someone's home. She's such a nice dog with a great spirit and energy!Â 

UPDATE FROM FOSTER: Beautiful Ginger is checking in with a smile! Her foster family adores her and states that you cannot help but but smile and love her!! Ginger has great house manners, loves to go for walks, enjoys car-rides, is thrilled with lots of attention and will sleep quietly at your feet. All of these good things are wrapped up into a 13-year-old girl who is truly young in heart and spirit! Ginger is a gem of a gal who is always wagging her tail and is always excited to start her day, giving no thought or worry as to what will come her way -- A lesson to learn!! Ginger has so many good qualities and is good with other dogs who will respect her space - AND when she gets to know the kitty's in her life, she respects their space and won't chase or bother them. Ginger is not good on steps, but she has great house manners and knows all the basics. Added to this, she also has great eye-mouth coordination to catch treats, loves car-rides and lots of attention and of course mealtimes! All these good things wrapped up into a beautiful 13-year-old girl who is young in heart and spirit and has so much love to give!!

name: Hopper
description:
We call Hopper a \"gentleman\" because he is such well-mannered, quiet boy. He was rescued from the Walton County shelter where he came in as a stray. He had lots of fleas and hair loss on his back from flea dermatitis, but a good bath and medication fixed that problem. His hair is growing back and he looks great.

Hopper is cratetrained, housetrained and gets along with everyone he meets. He's a mature boy of about 6+ years, 19 lbs. and still has a long life ahead of him. He's very people oriented and loves to sit on the couch with you. Hopper needs a loving home to make his life complete.

His adoption fee is $235. Online application available at http://form.jotform.us/form/43155518418153

name: FLIP FLOP
description: Are you looking for some summer fun that lasts a lifetime? My name is Flip-Flop and I can't wait to find my forever home! There is so much fun that we can have together. We can go for walks and play in the kiddie pool and go for all sorts of adventures! Do you have lots of toys that I can play with? I haven't had the opportunity to play with a whole lot of toys yet but I know that I like kongs! They're super fun to play with, especially when you're busy doing human things and I have to play by myself for a while. I hope we can mostly play together, though. Or if we're not playing, we can snuggle! Doesn't that just sound like the best thing ever? Great! Let's get going then! I am full grown at 48 lbs. *I recently completed treatment for heartworm disease and I'm living in a foster home - please speak with an adoption specialist for details.* ~My adoption fee is $95.00~ Cats? Unknown. Dogs? Okay if they let me be the boss! Children? Unknown. Housetrained? Unknown. Training needs? Unknown. Energy level? Unknown. How did I get here? Transferred from Warren County Animal Ark.

name: Rosa
description:
* Female Chihuahua mix

* Approximately 1 year old

* Approximately 7 pounds

* House trained

* Crate trained

* Okay with other dogs, not sure
about cats

* Dog respectful children 12 and over

* Adoption fee: $285

All dogs with PUP are in private foster homes so we can provide our potential adopters the most current information available.

Health:

Rosa

has been spayed and microchipped. She is current on her DHPP, Bordetella, and Rabies. She has been wormed and flea treated.

She has been tested for heart worm.

She has been diagnosed with recurrent struvite bladder crystals and requires a special diet.

History: Rosa comes from a local Washington shelter. PUP was asked to help and we are happy to help her find her forever home!

Notes from Rosa's Foster Home: If you are a fan of the chihuahua personality and spunk, then Rosa may be the pup for you! She has been delighting us since joining our home and we truly love this girl!

Rosa really enjoys getting out and about. She loves neighborhood walks as well as exploring a wooded trail. She is a 'regular' at Home Depot and has fun with her friends at the local pet food store. She can be shy when meeting people and likes to have an opportunity to meet new folks at her own pace. She would love to be your sidekick!

Rosa's house manners are excellent! She is crate trained, house trained on a schedule, and has mastered many commands. Rosa will alert bark at times but quiets quickly with correction. When not snoozing in a comfy dog bed, she is busy playing with toys, running and retrieving, or playing tug with our 75 lb dog (don't tell her she only weighs 7 lbs!). She can be quite comical when chasing squirrels in the yard, chasing a ball, or running in the yard for the sheer joy of it! Come evening, she looks for a warm and welcoming lap. She is just loaded with personality and this tiny-but-mighty dog makes us laugh every day. And did we mention her cute little zig-zag tail?

Rosa has 'bladder struvite crystals'. Crystals are concentrates of naturally occurring minerals in a dog's urine which can occur due to abnormal urine pH. The good thing about struvite crystals is they can be managed easily by keeping her on an inexpensive prescription food (approx $15/month). She needs to have water available at all times, as well as the opportunity to get outside frequently. Despite this diagnosis, Rosa behaves like all happy and playful young dogs.

Because of her size and shy nature, she will do best in a home with adults and older, dog-respectful children (12+ yrs) She also needs to have opportunities to go 'out' several times during the day. She loves other dogs and would really enjoy having a playful canine buddy in her new home or a playmate nearby. She will require strict adherence to her dietary needs.

This extra-special pup is looking forward to finding her new, extra-special family!

Note: The above description reflects the behavior we have observed in the dog's foster home. Although PUP provides adopters up to the minute information on our dogs, we cannot guarantee they will behave in the same manner in a different environment with new owners.

ADOPTION: If you think you have room in your home and heart for this dog and you reside within Washington State, please go to our Adoption Information page, or copy and paste this link https://www.pupdogrescue.org/adopt.html in your browser. There you will find more information and be able to fill out an adoption application.

EVENTS: To attend our next PUP adoption event, please check out our Facebook page, or copy and paste this link https://www.facebook.com/pg/puprescue/events/?ref=page_internal in your browser.

Can you help save more dogs by Fostering?

Become our fan on Facebook! Or follow us on Twitter!

name: Max
description:
Animal Profile: Max is an 18-month-old, 67 lb male Dutch Shepherd mix who is smart, athletic and loves to play with other dogs. He is very playful and eager to please, a dog that truly enjoys training! Max is crate and house trained and has good basic obedience. He has been respectful of the dog-savvy cat in his foster home, though he may not do well with skiddish cats. We would like to place Max in a home without small children due to his enthusiastic play style. Max is looking for an active family he can explore the PNW with. He loves to play fetch and tug, and would be excited to try things like agility or nose works!

Adoption Info: Adoption fee is $400, which includes spay/neuter, current rabies/DAPPV/bordetella vaccinations, microchip, health certificate, and heartworm test. All adoption fees are donations to a Washington non-profit corporation and all donations go to benefit the animals in our rescue. Apply online at www.DogGoneSeattle.org

Animal History: This dog was transferred from our rescue partner Tacoma Humane Society in Washington.

name: TOMMY
description: Hi, my name is TOMMY and I would love to meet you. I am a Neutered Male Labrador Retriever and Pit Bull Terrier. The shelter staff think I am about 3 years old. I have been at the shelter since Apr 24, 2019. Meet Tommy! This sweet boy was transferred to the shelter from one of our partner shelters in central Washington because they had too many dogs. Tommy was a shelter favorite at his previous shelter - his goofy and affectionate personality won over everyone he met. He is social, active, and always down to play. Tommy has been adopted a returned a few times so he really is looking for a family that can commit to meeting his needs and has the time and patience to do a lot of training. This boy has been through a lot, but he is the forgive and forget type - with his charming nature he makes friends easily. Tommy would do great with training based on positive reinforcement, he is highly motivated by food, attention and toys. Tommy needs to be the only pet in the home. He is ready for an active lifestyle with plenty of exercise, so apartment living is not a good fit and he is best suited for older kids or adults. Tommy is ready to meet his new family today!

name: MAX
description:
EXPERIENCED FOSTER NEEDED AND MAX'S STORY SHARED.  

Desperate to find a experienced foster or home for this sweet American Bulldog Max

Max is a one of a kind dog. His story is a long one but worth the read. So...here it goes.

Max was dumped from a moving vehicle almost 5 years ago in the Enumclaw area of Washington. He wasnât injured and a Good Samaritan caught him and took him to regional animal services in Kent, WA.

Once at the shelter he did what a lot of pet dogs do in the busy shelter environment, he shut down. The shelter Sargent was very dedicated and searched for an rescue or home for him but he was getting worse as time passed and no one stepped up for him. 

The day before Thanksgiving, James Branson agreed to pull Max out of the shelter and do a search for his owners. He was placed in foster while this was done and once an owner wasnât identified he was placed up for adoption. 

But, he had some junk in his trunk, again not uncommon dogs of this breed. After a few months a home was identified and he was placed where he lived for a few years. His family was moving cross country and his âissuesâ had become pressing enough that they felt they could no longer provide a good home for him and so he was surrendered back to Useless Bay.  In the last two months Max has gotten a lot of training on board and become a very good canine citizen. 

Heâs now looking for his soft place to land. 

All about Max

Heâs 6-7 years old, UTD on shots, neuter, microchipped and trainer to work loose leash. He has a very nice level of training on board and is very level headed. 

Maxâs ideal home would have breed experience, be willing to work with some of his quirky behaviors and give him a happy forever after that he deserves.

name: Seymour
description:
Animal Profile: Seymour is an 18-month-old male lanky American Staffordshire Terrier mix weighing in at 75 pounds. He is a quiet, goofy, sweet guy who enjoys snuggling up in his crate, playing fetch and chewing on bones. Seymour is a smart boy and learns new commands and tricks very quickly. He is leash trained, crate trained, place trained and knows many commands including sit, down, shake, no, come and out. Seymour plays really well with other dogs off leash in his foster home and could benefit having a female canine companion or easy going male canine companion to keep him company throughout the day. He does wonderful with his foster fur-siblings and currently lives with dogs of all sizes. He loves to run and LOVES to play in the water but also is the first one to settle in at night. Seymour will make a great companion for a single person or couple that enjoys sticking close to home, hanging out in the back yard or watching netflix. Seymour also needs someone who is dedicated to continuing his training program in and around the home in order to get the very best out of him. Seymour recently accompanied his foster mom on a 7 day trip to Idaho and completed a shadow program with Method K-9 training. If you are looking for a dog with a great training foundation then Seymour is your man!

Adoption Info: Adoption fee is $400, which includes spay/neuter, current rabies/DAPPV/bordetella vaccinations, microchip, health certificate, and heartworm test. All adoption fees are donations to a Washington non-profit corporation and all donations go to benefit the animals in our rescue. Apply online at www.DogGoneSeattle.org

Animal History: This dog was transferred from our rescue partner at PAWS in Washington.

name: Sparky
description:
It's been over 10 years since the water rose up in Waveland, MS. Over 3,500 days since the hurricane cracked the skies open and drove the sea right into town. If you have to ask which hurricane, well, then you probably aren't from around here. Katrina made landfall at Waveland, MS, a small town of 7,000 just an hour east of New Orleans, on August 29, 2005, and you'd be hard-pressed to find any of God's good creatures in Waveland that don't remember. Destin and Sparky remember.



Chaos is too simple of a word to convey what that time was like, but it's the closest thing we've got. Fortunately, there were a few clear minds that day, including Doll Stanley and In Defense of Animals. The organization recognized the doom bearing down on animals in the region, petitioning courts to release captured animals in the pound. Destin was one such animal, languishing in the pound as the storm bore down on the Gulf Coast. At the 11th hour, a judge granted the request, forcing animal control to release the animals to safety. When they reached Destin, the water was already up to her neck. Destin and 34 other animals were rescued that night, but, sadly, thousands more souls lost their lives all along the coast. Destin and Sparky, who was discovered after the storm, were some of the lucky ones.



A number of animal rescue facilities went to work in the aftermath of Katrina, and ARF was one of the organizations born from the rubble. The 35 dogs from Waveland made the trip north to Jackson, and a few more groups soon followed. Destin and Sparky were placed together in their new home, and quickly became inseparable, sharing a bond that few of us can scarcely imagine. Yet over 3,500 days after the storm arrived, these two remain with ARF. Every one of the other 35 dogs has moved on, either adopted to a wonderful home or crossing the rainbow bridge. We've twice attempted to adopt Sparky individually, but both dogs immediately grew depressed and stopped eating. Their bond is unique and irreplaceable, and so even though we know how challenging it is to adopt two older dogs, we know that they need to be together. They are sweet and spunky, despite their advanced age. But the wisdom in their eyes is surely enough reward for providing a forever home.



Katrina had an impact that still reverberates throughout the region. As we think of it, we still mourn for those that have been lost. Yet we also recognize the events that catalyzed the creation of ARF, and are reminded of our mission. If you can't adopt Destin and Sparky today, then please continue joining us in this mission. Stop by sometime to walk these wonderful dogs. The lifeblood of this organization is our supporters, and we're grateful every day that you've helped us make it this far.

Sparky, Hound Mix has been shared from Shelter Exchange - http://www.shelterexchange.org.

name: Carol & Mama (Bonded Pair)
description: Meet MAMA and CAROL, this bonded pair is looking for their forever home together and promise to steal their adopterâs heart. There is no way to tell you about these girls affectionately known as âThe Mamasâ and keep it short, so thank you for reading the entire post. Mama Bear and Carol were rescued from the streets of West Nashville where they had been roaming with a local group of strays. It is estimated that between the two of them they had close to  40 puppies over 18 months. They did the best they could to take care of each other and all the puppies, which were often rescued by locals, but no one could ever catch âThe Mamasâ, they were shy, smart, cautious survivors. We were finally able to catch them in November 2015 and since then they have been in foster learning to be dogs. The have come a long way, but still have a ways to go before they are ânormal dogsâ. They are incredibly smart and have a lot of love to give, but will need an adopter that is willing to build trust with them, be patient, and go slow. They like routine and dependability. They will need a yard with a privacy fence, no other dogs and absolutely no cats or other small prey animals â after living on the streets the prey drive is strong for small furry critters. Carol is the cuddly joker of the pair and enjoys a good snuggle on the sofa. She is often the first to greet you and strangers, and will do anything for a treat. She loves to have her belly rubbed and will flip over in the yard or house and just lay there until provided with a good scratch. Mama Bear is and was the leader of the crew. She commands respect in a calm presence and isnât afraid to let out a big bark if she gets nervous about someone or something. She keeps her distance from new people, but with the help of Carol usually starts to trust a little sooner. She likes to sit on the sofa too, but isnât overly cuddly, although she does love to be calmly brushed and petted. It is estimated that they are roughly 4 to 5 years old. Both Mama Bear and Carol are up to date on shots, have been spayed and are current on flea, tick and heart worm prevention. They sleep well in their crates too and love to lay in the sun. They dislike fireworks or any loud noises. They must be adopted as a pair. If you have additional questions about this special pair or to setup a meet and great please email their foster Becky at carter.m.becky@gmail.com. There is an application here on our page or can be downloaded from our website or email us at rbynsnest@yahoo.com. You can also see more photos and see their evolution on their foster mom's Facebook page Facebook.com/BarneysBackyard.

description:

APPLY today! www.RARErescue.org

Adoption Fee: $185.00



All of our Adoptables are:



-Spayed/neutered

-Up to date on vaccines

-Heartworm tested (and kept on heartworm preventative and treated forÂ 

Â Â heartworms if positive when entering our program)Â 

-Microchipped prior to adoption



*If you are not in the middle Tennessee area, transport can potentially be arranged to approved homes, depending on distance. We normally do not allow adoptions outside of 2 hours driving distance due to limited resources and difficulty ensuring the right match, especially if there are already animals in the home.Â 



**PLEASE NOTE: We are a non-profit organization without municipal or government funding. Veterinary/Medical expenses are constant for an animal rescue. Our adoption fees not only help to provide vetting and care for the animal being adopted, but they also help to cover heartworm treatments and other treatable ailments that many animals, that would otherwise be euthanized, need in order to be made available for adoption.


Please understand that adopting an animal is a LIFETIME COMMITMENT to that animal and there will be veterinary expenses throughout their life that can often cost several hundreds, if not thousands of dollars (without pet insurance), especially without annual checkups and preventative care.Â  As a potential family for this pet you are responsible for their safety and that includes keeping them on your property.

Thank you for choosing to adopt, foster, or aid in the rescue efforts of RARE!

name: Sparky
description: SPARKY is a very sweet and loving dog but is dog aggressive and needs to go to a one dog home. Neutered, UTD on shots, house trained, weighs 37lbs, he is a dachshund mix, 8 years old in March 2019 located in Williamston/Pelzer, SC area. Approved application, vet reference and home visit required

name: Liberty
description: Oh, Liberty! She came to us as a stray from the Williamsburg MO area. She was emaciated, weak, and near death. Liberty has been treated for a bacterial and yeast skin infection at the UMC Veterinary Hospital. She has improved but still has hair loss on her muzzle and tail that may never grow back. Liberty's condition was the worst of the 5 dogs we rescued so her therapy has been more involved, Liberty had a tin can stuck on her muzzle for days while she was homeless. Liberty may need ongoing treatment for her skin conditions. She may not be the most beautiful dog on the outside, but inside she has an endearing spirit and a loving heart. Liberty is a very happpy dog now that she is healing from her horrible skin problems and is not sitting at death's door. Liberty is house trained and knows how to use a doggy door, and she loves kids, dogs, and cats. Leash walking is a challenge for Liberty but she is making progress every day. To be considered for adoption of Liberty you MUST have access to a securely fenced yard. Liberty's adoption fee is $125 and a home visit is required before final approval. If you are interested in adopting Liberty, please fill out an adoption application at www.arffmo.org

name: Cooper
description:
This is Cooper, a 1 year old 22lb. neuterd Aussie mix.  He came from Texas to find his forever home here in Wisconsin. He just knows someone in Wisconsin will adopt him! He loves to run, and play, and chew on nyla bones! He especially loves when his human gives him treats ? He gets along with dogs, and don't mind cats. He is crate and home trained, utd on his shots including microchipped, and neutered! He's being fostered in the Sheboygan County area. His fee is $300.00 Please consider setting up a meet and greet with this guy, you will fall in love ? first go to www.lastpawrescue.org fill out an application and ask for, Cooper! he'll be waiting on you! ?
501 (c)approved Wisconsin Agriculture license # 285589-DS

name: Benny
description:
If your looking for a super, happy, fun filled dog then you've found me!! My name is Benny! I came from Texas, hoping to find my forever home here in Wisconsin. I'm a 1yr old, 40lb. Collie/mix. I love to run, play with stuffed animals, carry a ball in my mouth, run, go for walks, or just lay beside you. I'm crate trained and doing great on home training! I get along with dogs, and children. I'm all up to date on my shots, neutered, and microchipped.  My fee is $300.00. I'm living in the Sheboygan County area with my foster family,  so if you'd love to meet me then please go to www.lastpawrescue.org fill out an application and ask for Benny! I'll be waiting for you ?
501 (c)approved Wisconsin Agriculture license # 285589-DS

name: Griffin
description: Hi my name is Griffin. I am a 9 month old shepherd mix. I am from Arkansas, on my journey to Wisconsin to meet my foster parents I did not know what to expect. When I got here I was extremely scared and did not know what was going to happen to me but when I got here, I knew that my life was going to change forever. My fosters have been super amazing for me and gave me all the time I needed to adjust to life outside the kennel. I am learning my name, learning how to sit, lay down and come when I'm called. I'm kennel trained and I am mostly potty trained. I love to cuddle and to be close to the people that I depend on. I enjoy playing with dogs of all kinds and being around children. Before coming to my foster family I did not know what a bed was and it scared me and now I can't wait for my fosters to get home so I can cuddle with them. I get a little bit nervous around men and and get a little bit nervous when somebody goes into pet me too quickly or turns around too quickly when I am near, but it is just from the abuse that I experienced before coming to Wisconsin. I am learning every day that I am able to trust humans and the people that surround me and that not everybody is out to hurt me. I would love to have a home preferably with a family or a couple with another dog in the home. I am a super lovable, happy and eager to learn puppy. I even like horses and cows. I have a great recall once I am bonded to you. Did I mention I love other dogs and want a home with another dog? Although I can be nervous please know I don't have a mean bone in my body and just need time to learn that you wont hurt me like the one person did.
